I'll go out on a limb and say it's almost compact hi-fi.PROS:>  The fact that it can play MP3s from a microSD card (they call it a TF card) is a bonus.  Up to 32GB capacity card and max. 9999 songs.>  It has a STEREO HEADPHONE output jack (3.5mm) and output even though the unit has mono speaker.>  RICH SOUND.  Don't worry about the "mono" speaker!!!  It's sound output is punchy and wonderously GREAT!!!>  It has a 3.5mm Audio In jack.  Meh... might be useful.>  Many options given to you for selecting channels:  You can do direct keypad entry, or let it auto-search or use a wheel (i.e. old skool) to search for stations.>  It stores stations.>  The charging "guts" are built in.  It uses a cell phone battery.  You can charge it via (USB from computer or USB from Wall plug - which they do not give you) and you can charge spare batteries.What else:  It has Shortwave (2 bands) which I haven't bothered to check out.  That might be nice in an emergency?CONS:*  This radio "comes into it's own" (sound performance-wise) when you turn it up to a level of "5" (where the marker line on the volume wheel is centered.  However, by that time it's so loud that you are not listening to this just for yourself.  You are (at that point) blasting to everyone in 25 - 30 feet.  At lower volumes you won't fully experience the entire bass and punch this radio's amplifier and built-in speaker can put out.  It's not bad at lower volumes, just more "polite"/subdued.  Now, even at low volume levels you always have vocal clarify. The bass comes out when you turn it up.*  They give you a little plastic outrigger "footie" stand that plugs into the back of the unit in case you want to have radio sit on a table "tilt facing" you at a 45 degree angle.  This works, it's a nice idea,  but the little plastic outrigger piece can get easily lost.  Possible solution:  Keep it attached when not in use with a small dot of Velcro?*  You have to hold in the power button for a second or so to turn off the unit.  This is intentional because it also has a sleep timer integrated into the power button.  Once you get used to turning it off properly, this is no big deal.*  It's $40.00 bucks.  Which to some will seem like a lot for a tiny radio.  Wait till you fire it up though.OTHER things:  They give you a 1ft USB adapter.  They give you a short 3.5mm male plug -->  3.5mm male plug cable.  You get a hand strap.UNKNOWNS:I can't tell you about remote gain or distant selectivity / cloud skip / "DXing" etc.  I live in a large modern city and have my choice of 6 well spaced FM stations.  I'm not deprived of good stations where I live.  I  **  can  **  say that I have no cross talk, wavering, static or distortion when I tune in with this unit.  Just warm clear sound.OTHER INFO:*  You get a strap which they leave it to you whether to install it or not.*  This is really a "Kaito" brand (source manufacturer) device.*  There is a very similar version marketed with a model number of "M8" - I suggest not buying it as for the same price this unit has all the same features and includes the 2 ShortWave bands.  By choosing the S8, you are essentially getting the shortwave feature free.SUMMARY:  If you want a quality audio experience in a grab-and-go small package, I know of no other self-contained unit that sounds this good.HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMENDEDADDENDUM 6/29/14:  What I've realized is so cool about this radio/mp3 player is: unlike your big stereo where it "takes over" the room sonically, engulfs you and you almost "have" to listen to it - with the Meloson, it's more of an "inviting choice: It can be a pleasant, steady companion you can appreciate while reading, hanging out, etc. yet it's good enough to dance to if you turn it up. (We found ourselves spontaneously dancing in the kitchen the other day to "The Night Time is the Right Time (Ray Charles).  At first were merely listening to other songs, liked it, turned it up and voila...a micro party of sorts : )  This somehow never happens with the computer feed to our big stereo.  My best analogy is: You are not "told" to listen, you are invited to engage.  It may sound woo-woo but that's how we experience it. While the mp3 songs are not as searchable as an IPOD (just folder numbers and song numbers), I find myself more pleasantly surprised.  I will take this over an iPod anyday.ONE CAVEAT:  Be careful of which SD card you get.  We purchased what we considered to be a legitimate Sandisk brank MicroSD card and the unit does these subtle micro-hiccups every 2 - 3 minutes.  The owner's manual states that not all cars are compatible but does not proceed to tell you which ones ARE.  I'm not going to ding a star for that because I love this unit just the same.

ON PLANE FLIGHTS:  It's common knowledge that the airlines turn off some one or more of the air scrubbers to lower fuel consumption.  On long plane flights (5 hours or more) I can find the stagnancy of the air and close quarters oppressive.  I can get headaches and slight nausea feeling from trapped on a 6 hour flight.  Well, this stuff helps combat that malaise from the stagnant airline air.ON BOATS:  This (in conjunction with Dramamine and "Sea Bands") have keeps me from getting sick on a choppy power catamaran yacht cruise.AT WORK:  It's also good on occasion to use this for stress relief at work.By the way, the little teensy bottle has lasted me a long time.I can recommend this.  5 stars.

I did not pay $23.00 for this so that affects my review rating.  I bought this at a local discount chain for $9.97.  At that price it's a steal.  I use the machete to show roots that I discover who is boss.  Ditto blackberries.  The saw is useful for more "wooden" substantial roots, small limbs, etc.  I also use it for cutting / loosening rootbound roots and for opening planting soil bags when I don't have a box knife handy.  I don't think I would ever pay more for this than I did but at below 1/2 price ($9.97) I will say it's a good deal.P.S.  It comes with a external scabbard made out of something like cordura.  I doubt if I'll ever use it but if you had kids and wanted to store this for a camping trip then - from a safety standpoint - that might be a plus.

I bought this for the heck of it.  The reviews showed that this original was better than the remake done in the 90s (which I have not seen).  I didn't expect much from this film but it held my attention.  My only complaint was the obnoxious character that Ernest Borgnine had to play(Trucker Cobb).  I was not sorry to see the Cobb character's role end.  I came to really like the Heinrich Dorfmann character played by Hardy Krueger.  Kruger is a good actor!  Jimmy Stewart's character (Capt. Frank Towns)was so pigheaded and became so aggravating at the end of the movie that I wanted to throw things at the TV.  I guess that's a mark of good acting and screenwriting.I will probably watch this every few years.  It's a keeper.

I bought the Sesame version of these crackers on a beach trip and was wowed.  When I came home all my local store had was the Chia flavor.  I took a chance, the Chia are also very tasty.  Gluten Free is a plus.  I would eat them regardless. (I don't care how healthy a food is:  if it doesn't taste good then... it's out!)SUMMARY:  THEY TASTE GREAT!  TRY IT!  Highly Recommended.

Where can you get anything that provides this much fun and usability for $12.97 shippped?  Tell me!  I want to know!!I bought this to have something that would play tunes while I was outside digging in the garden.  Little did I know I would fall in love with it.PRO's:  It looks good.  It has clear sound.  Excellent vocal intelligibility.  Amazing volume and throw for it's small size.  It's a marvel of excellent design within a price point.  It's inexpensive enough that you won't cry for the financial loss if it gets stolen.  You will cry however because you will bond with this damn thing!  It's cute!  It's a throwback.SUMMARY:  In a time when everything is supremely over priced and fails to deliver, this thing delivers.  Who thought a plastic device could be beautiful in it's reliable humility?  It's the best cheap, low hassle device you will ever own!CON's:  Of course it has no bass.  So what?  At this price?  What do you expect.IF YOU WANT REAL BASS IN A COMPACT RADIO * and * a STEREO HEADPHONE OUTPUT:  Then ** instead ** go with THIS-->  http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00FEQVENM/ref=oh_details_o01_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc=1The Melosound S8 sounds twice as good as the Sony, but then again it costs THREE times as much.  It's also about a 1/3rd larger in size.  I can say that the Melsound S8 is a absolute wonder.  Music sounds excellent on it.  Scope,function and price point.  Each radio has it's place and yes you do get what you pay for.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!_______________________________________________________MONO OUTPUT VS. YOUR STEREO HEADPHONES.P.S. Mono (1 speaker) sound output is * SO *  long ago for most younger people that they wonder why their stereo ear buds only work on one channel with this unit. They even think this unit's headphone jack is broken/defective/who knows.What you need are "Dual Mono" or "Dual Monoaural" earbuds.  They are not very common anymore but they exist.Here is one example:  http://www.amazon.com/Headset-E-20-Dual-Monaural-Earphone/dp/B000ET2N5M/ref=sr_1_6?ie=UTF8&qid=1401255025&sr=8-6&keywords=dual+mono+headphones+3.5mm+olympusPlan B:  Alternately you could obtain a converter plug.  Specifically a 3.5mm stereo female jack to 3.5mm mono male plug adapter for probably around 3 or 4 dollars.  I don't recommend this as these converter plugs are relatively bulky and, due to their size and the way they stick out, they will put stress on this little radio's earphone jack.______________________________________________________________________________ADDENDUM/TECHNO-CRAP/EXPLANATION:  WHY DID THEY BUILD THIS THIS WAY?WHAT FOLLOWS IS BORING. YOU * HAVE * BEEN WARNED!  : )*  The mono transistor radio is a throwback to the late 60's.  While stereo grew in importance, it was a luxury for portable devices back then.*  To support delivering audio to 2 separate channels, Stereo headphones require a plug with 3 sections: a "TRS" or Tip, Ring, Sleeve plug.  *  The tip of a TRS stereo plug is the Left side speaker(or earbud's) positive signal, the Ring (middle section between the bands on the plug shaft) is the Right side speaker(or earbud's) positive audio signal and the shank (longest metal part closest to the plastic base) is a shared common "ground".---->  In a Mono radio, the female headphone output "jack" has NO third metal conductor/sensor inside it to make contact with the Ring part of a stereo plug.  <----The cool thing would have been if they wired it for dual mono at the factory but that would have added another wire & soldering process, a different jack, driving expense up, yadda yadda.  This thing is what it is: OLD SKOOL shabby chic to the max.  Deal with it.  If you crave dual speaker audio, then find dual mono headphones like referenced above.Over and Out. Meep Meep!

This is one of the few times that an expanded album with outtakes is actually an improvement.  Most of the extra songs (except for "Pedestrian Walkway" which I don't care for) are * very *  good, immediately likeable (especially "Urges").  Why oh why were they not put on the album in the first place??  Maybe record company stinginess at that time or their marketing department? ...who knows... The extra songs raise my respect for Mr. Dolby and confirms that he had a entire extended concept and place of mind... his musical talent was certainly more than a fluke of the original songs.The DVD of a live performance in front of a probably hand picked audience is very good.  The humorous interleaved theme of Ray also being a theater projectionist with all of his boredom, distractions and crisis in projecting the film is amusing.  My only slight complaint is that it messes with the DVD's audio levels for the music for the times when it cuts back to the projectionists room.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!P.S.  While this is an Import, the DVD plays just fine in my made-for-U.S. market Sony BDP S-790 Blu-Ray/DVD player.  The CD of course plays fine because red book audio format (CD Audio) is a region-free world standard.

We bought these for my sweetie.  I did a comparision of the over 50 for Women's vs. Men's in this brand.  Only 2 differences I could find:  a bit more calcium carbonate in the Women's vitamins, a good boost of extra Selenium in the Men's vitamins.  Heck, You'll laugh but I can't see a major reason to not take these myself.Note:  We used to use Phamasomething Nanometer (euphemism, you'll figure it out) vitamins  and they were good vitamins but 6X over priced compared to these vitamins which do the exact same thing.These vitamins are USP certified which is supposed to be a plus.  Reason: I've read that something like 60% of the various vitamin suppliers can put anything or nothing in vitamins.  There's what they "say" is in there and what is REALLY in there.You get (I would like to think)  a bit more assurance with the USP certification.  Nature Made is a name brand that has been around many years.

I bought this back in 2006 on DVD - it looked "OK".  On Blu-Ray its very sharp, good color rendition, no visible grain on my 60" plasma from 11 ft distance from screen.  Sound is Dolby 5.1 or Dolby stereo.  Dolby 5.1 soundtrack had sufficient oomph for the movie.  Dialog is clear.  The big scene at the start when Krypton self-destructs is pretty impressive.  I remember when I first saw this roughly 35 years ago in a giant screen theater in Portland.  I was agog, it was so well done.  I was digesting the impact of this movie for a couple days.  Some aspects of it are a bit dated now but the basic story is still pretty powerful.  Superman would do anything to save his girl and in that moment he becomes very human.

I started with a 2GB a few years ago, then over time bought two other 4GB units.  I just now ordered an 8GB unit because it's only $19.97 with prime shipping - cheaper than the 4GB right now which is still at $39.99 - go figure.MAIN SELLING POINT:  If this drive were to drop out of your pocket or purse, etc. onto the sidewalk (scenarios), or be burglarized from your house, the finder/stealer cannot see your data even though he/she has physical possession of the drive.  They could reformat the drive and use it for other purposes but they would NOT get access to your data.  After 10 failed login attempts the drive is programmed to lock out any access attempts and MUST be reformatted.  (Kingston has a built-in process that forces you to choose a decently complex password so bad guy is never going to guess your password in 10 tries.)These have worked for me on both Windows 7 and the dreaded Windows Vista (I got rid of my one Vista PC about 6 months ago).  I now have Windows 7 on all PCs.I have turned off autorun for security reasons.  Instead, I trudge down through Windows Explorer to find the DTPrivacy launcher file on the drive in the file tree.  It works, it's just some extra effort that's all.I only dock this drive when I need to.  If it's not plugged in, it's less likely to be hacked.  Common sense.Some people ( a few) might run into issues with the E: drive being blocked or in use because Explorer shows the E: drive letter is taken up by the CD/DVD optical drive (which is common).  It is not hard to get around this.  Either try taking the disk out of the Optical drive unit or you could go to Computer, Manager, Disk Management (IF you know what you're doing, be careful here) and reassign the drive letter of the Optical drive to a "higher" letter to remove the conflict.ADDENDUM / OBSERVATIONS:I find that while doing a file save of CHANGES to a 28Megabyte using Microsoft Word to the Kingston drive of a particular .RTF file with a lot of mixed tables, graphics, custom text formatting can be dog slow (like 45 seconds to 1 minute) .  The hourglass for that save process takes over the entire computer.  Fortunately, I don't have to save that file very often.  I'm just used to it.  Yes I have tons of space  remaining (over a Gigabyte or more) on my Kingston drive and hard drives - that's not what's causing this.  I'm not worried about it.  I figure it's encryption processing that is parsing the entire content of the file for changes.  Just a guess.  My Text file and PDF file saves go quickly.Years ago, in the early XP days, I did own an earlier 1GB gray colored predecessor of this drive which - it was eventually discovered - had a security flaw intrinsic to the firmware of that particular earlier series.  Kingston was aware of the flaw and discontinued that series long ago.  Back then these were like (trying to remember) $80 dollars(?) for 1GB.I have deliberately passed on Windows version 8.X up till now so can't speak to usability.  I wasn't up for the aggravation although I'm told it runs faster.  Microsoft has recently announced (April 2014) that they will finally "fix" Windows 8.1 usability issues in two separate passes.  When they will drop the shoe on part 2 of the fix, I don't know.  I just know it's been announced.  In the meantime, I'm happy with Windows 7.While I would be disappointed if my current blue DataTraveler drives didn't work in the revised Windows 8.X (or even future Windows 9), it wouldn't break my heart.  To have simple, reliable, off-line, self-contained security ( I leave one of these at work in case my home had a catastrophe) is a small price to pay for the peace of mind these relatively cheap backups bring.  If worst comes to worst I'll purchase the new iteration and be out max $80 - $100 for 4 drives that work with the latest greatest.  I doubt if it will come to that but if it does, no big deal.

I bought this on a whim, years after reading "Eaters of the Dead".  I read the negative reviews and so, then, dreaded watching it.  Well, it's not that bad.  I don't know what Omar Sharif is so embarrassed about.  Neither is it that great.  It was OK.  I was entertained for it's 102 minutes.  The movie cost $100 million dollars.  They didn't cut corners on the sets and locations.  I actually liked Antonio Banderas in this, normally I don't care for him (except in Mask of Zorro).  They deleted and/or quickly glossed over the most brutal aspects that were in the book regarding the Viking funeral - for that I am grateful.  I liked some of the other 12 (the Viking) actors.  The leader seemed a bit subdued and less fierce than what I pictured from the book.  Oh well.  Call this high budget, high quality cheese with a zippy lack of depth and substance.  It's almost like they were afraid to really develop the characters for being accused of having a movie that drags.  (The fear of action movie directors everywhere!  Gore Verbinski is the opposite of that, he needs to learn how to edit things down.) I bought 13th warrior DVD in used condition for 4 or 5 bucks including shipping.  Probably because Amazon Instant didn't offer it.  I've certainly seen worse movies than this.  I have no burning urge to rewatch it.

I wanted a new PC for my sweeties kids who were still using XP.  I was worried they would get hacked.  This Optiplex arrived in 6 working days, FedEx looking immaculate.  No dings, scratches, dust bunnies or smoke smells.  Mine has a 1GB Hitatchi Ultrastar (a cut above) 1 Terabyte hard drive installed.  This PC was a big deal circa 2007 - 2008.  The E8400 CPU (processor chip) in it is still pretty darn fast if all you are doing is business / office stuff.  6Megabyte on chip cache. The video Intel Video CPU in it is nothing to write home about but yes it will render YouTube 1080p videos just fine.  Comes with 64bit Win7 Pro installed.  I suspect this could be upgraded to 8GB or RAM but for my purposes I don't see the point.  Those who wanted somewhat more gutsy video response at decent price could slap a $70.00 nVidia GTX430 card in here and you'd be good to go.SOFTWARE I INSTALLED:  I put Firefox, Adobe, Flash, CCleaner, the usual suspects then I installed WebRoot Anti-Virus on it (was onsale for $29.00 for 1 year download & disc) and also Kingsoft Office Professional (HIGHLY RECOMMENDED).  If you want 95% of what Office does and you don't care about Outlook and you don't want to pay $350 on up for Microsoft Office, there you go.  Kingsoft. now opens and saves .docx and .xlsx and works better than MS Office in some ways, also looks elegant to me.BASICALLY, once I bought the Anti-Virus and Office clone suite from Kingsoft.....for around $350 total I have a pretty decent PC.  Microsoft will probably support Windows 7 until 2018 or longer (if the past is any precedent).  Heck MS Office alone would have cost as much as this PC.SUMMARY:IF you are looking for a fast workhorse business / school type PC  and... You are NOT doing stuff requiring bleeding edge video and processor core count (like editing movies, doing CAD, hi-res gaming or serious SQL stuff) then...PERFORMANCE IS SOLID, apps open quickly, it surfs well with zippy response.You could run Office and surf quickly on this PC till the cows come home!  I CAN RECOMMEND THIS !!!________________________________________________________________________________ADDENDUM / TIPS/ MINOR CAVEATS:1.  I installed and ran the free "Speccy" program from Piriform.  This program will show you all fo the technical details of your PCs hardware guts and configuration - sort of like Device Manager on steroids.  There is a status "reporting" protocol in the firmware of most modern hard drives called S.M.A.R.T.  Speccy is able to give you a direct view of this data in a Windows session.For my hard drive, it said it had been initially powered up since 1750 days ago, which translates for 4.8 years.  HOWEVER,  another data field showed that the drive had actually been IN USE for 90 hours when I got the PC, and that probably included 24 hours that I put on it myself.  I speculate/guess that a nearly new / refurbished Hitatchi drive was swapped into this PC as part of it's refurbishment.  Which is fine by me.  The Speccy software utility showed no major error correction / remapping of bad sectors.2. One thing to be prepared for.  I turn it on, put in the activation key (which went fine..) then I go to Windows Update:  155 patches to download!  This took 2.5 hours 12MBps bandwidth  So,  I do that download and two other successive passes / reboots and I'm current.  Just letting you know, be prepared to walk away and watch a movie, a lot of catching up to do.  You get past it, it's done.  Just sayin'Don't bother installing the latest Adobe Flash player until AFTER you have downloaded all the security patches.  I found it would not work right until I did so.3.  Since Amazon proper does not sell this, I chose to buy from an Amazon vendor with a 98% rating and a past customer base in the multiple thousands range.  I feel it's not worth it to save a few bucks by taking the low ball bid from someone with a rating score in the low 90's or (egads) 80's.  This is the way I have purchased from Amazon resellers for a decade now and following that procedure I have rarely been burned.  Your mileage may vary but that's my advice.Again, I can recommend this Dell 755 Refurbished PC if you have the technical background to tweak it into shape.

This show was obviously a TV documentary in episodes setup for a lot of commercial breaks.  While I'm fascinated by the story - and it's a heck of a story,  what detracts is the constant "recapping" of things: at the start of each episode, many times after returning to a subsegment, etc.  OK producers:  I got it the first or 2nd time, I was paying attention, you don't have to tell me the 3rd and 4th times!  If you took out the recursive "recapping" this would have made 3 episodes that had no fluff in them.  Nonetheless it's a great story and worth watching.  One of the remaining 4 elderly pilots interviewed when this was made comes off as a real sweetheart of a guy. God bless these pilots and the sheer chutzpah of our armed forces to pull this off.

I bought a couple boxes of this at a local "Grocery Outlet" (discount closeout food store chain) and didn't expect much.  WOW.  Very tasty.  Very few unpopped kernels.  Up till now Act II popcorn has been our staple / point of reference popcorn.  I now totally prefer it to the Act II.  The quality of the actual corn on the Bearitos is quite obviously higher than what I've been buying.  The price they want for the Bearitos here however is staggering.  I got mine for $1.50 a box.  Guess I better go back to G.O. and buy out the rest!  I will not pay $49.99 for 12 boxes of microwave popcorn even it if does the fandango!  : )  Yeah, if you can afford it, the Bearitos probably the healthiest and tastiest microwave popcorn around.P.S.  I have also eaten Pop-Secret which was kind of gross somehow.  The Orville Reddenbacher's did not float my boat.  It wasn't bad but neither was it memorable to me.  Hope this helps.

My first of these "compatible"(supplier) cartridges (i.e. knock off /refill) lasted a LONG time.  I was able to go many pages past the "out of toner" warning and it produced a rich black.  My 2nd cartridge (spare) that I just put in my printer "works" - no spots or smears, however I'm missing those rich blacks / dmax of ink density, whatever you want to call it that I used to get.  Maybe after printing more pages it will get better.  In any event, what I get now is "acceptable" - just not gorgeous.  However at this price I can't complain.  I'm getting almost a year out of each cartridge in my moderate / home use scenario.

I had no idea of how far the sacrifices that were made went to gain an awareness of enemy plans during The Cold War.  The challenges this team took on to come up with and implement near-impossible inventions to stay on the bleeding edge of surveillance boggles the mind.  From 10w-400 oil,  cameras that can resolve license plates at high altitudes, fabricating your own titanium screws, variable intake ramjet engine nacelles, zero radar signature cross-section airframes, and on and on.  We have a SR-71 blackbird in the Evergreen Aviation museum not too far from where I live.  I have walked around it a several times.  It's just mind boggling to be in it's presence.  Hats off to real innovation.  When I read this book, I feel that anything is possible sometimes if you can just conceive of it and persist.  Highly recommended.Favorite story in the book is when the French Mirage plane pulls up alongside the Blackbird and demands their "clearance code" to overfly France.  The SR-71 crew accelerates leaves the Mirage standing still after giving the French pilot his, um... "clearance code".  hahahaAddendum:  If any of you are into project management, this book is a good lesson on what it is possible to achieve when you hire a small sized team of smart people, give them the right resources and keep the bureaucracy out of the way.

It's fairly compact and svelte for an elcheapo $27.00 phone.  Triple minutes, you can find the minutes cards almost anywhere and, if you can't, you can purchase minutes online at the Tracfone website.  Clear, vibrant, sharp display screen.  Quick response to icons.  Exception:  Surfing on this is abysmal due to browser given and performance but that's perfect as I don't want my son wasting minutes surfing.  Has a slot for a MicroSD card.  They give you a 2GB MicroSD card as a freebie but I'd pump it up to at least 32GB if you want to turn this into an MP3 player.  I transferred my son's old T-Mobile phone number to this phone on a Saturday and the process was fairly straightforward.  They (Tracfone) ask a lot of nosy questions - really.  My address I can understand if there was loss or theft of the phone.  My email address - I said "no".  They had the nerve to ask for the last 4 of my SSN.  I said no way.  Things proceeded anyway.  Phone number was transferred within 4 hours.  You just power off and power back on and there ya go.  When they prompt for "activation" it's kind of a misnomer.  What they really meant in my case was "Add Airtime Minutes" which I did.  A $39.95 200 minute card became 600 minutes due to the Triple minutes.  This is what I wanted as, while I liked T-Mobile it is very difficult to get enough "talking" minutes from them under $50.00 a month.  Yeah they (T-Mobile) and Walmart sell a lesser known (semi-hidden!) $30.00 per month service but it didn't meet our needs.  This is my speed.  If you don't use your minutes you have (I think) 90 days before they expire.  On my personal tracfone, I can get through an entire year by buying maybe 3, 120 minute cards ($29.95) that get tripled to 360 minutes.  So...geez...for a years worth of mobile phone, I pay around $90-$100 dollars.  If web surfing is not your focus, then I can recommend this phone.  Can't beat it.

I had previously bought the tube / grease form of SuperLube  http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000XBH9HI/ref=wms_ohs_product?ie=UTF8&psc=1  It worked fine for things like kitchen drawers, it was easy to wipe off the excess, didn't stink to high heaven.  The spray however (which I tried using today) even the tiniest application of it indoors sent us running to open all the doors for ventilation.  I agree with many that WD-40 is an old skool thing and, while it works, there are much better products out there.  My absolute favorite substitute for a spray lubricant/penetrant is "Tri-Flow" but it's pricy for how much you get.  Tri-Flow smells in it's own way too but it has that kind of "mechanics perfume" thing going on that I can tolerate.  I can say that while I would buy the Super Lube --> grease <-- again, I would not buy the Super Lube spray again once I use it up on outdoor projects.

Disclaimer:  My significant other is the Clam Chowder connoisseur in our family.  She eats it often. I am reporting back the feedback she has given me.  I order it for her, she consumes it, I myself don't eat it.  She can't find any decent canned New England Clam Chowder locally (in the Willamette Valley) without driving to Whole Foods, specialty stores, etc.I found a general trend of reviews on the Amazon product review forms that state the Progresso and Snow's brands of New England Clam Chowder are not highly regarded  (that's an understatement).The "gold standard" for my sweetie here in Oregon is to go to a place on the coast that specializes in seafood cuisine.  One in particular is a restaurant chain that has an name that starts with an "M", sounds similar to a guy in 3 Stooges who was always poking his colleagues in the eye and knocking them in the head.  (There's a few of these "M" places up and down the Oregon coast).BACKGROUND:For a couple years we purchased Bar Harbor New England Clam Chowder.  My significant other would add 1/2 a can of milk to that and was very pleased with the taste from that brand.  I get bored with ordering the same thing all the time and saw the good reviews for Chincoteague New England Clam Chowder, thought I'd surprise her with something new, possibly better.  The case arrived today( 2/26/2014), my significant other immediately opens a can, adds a half can of milk to it, cooks it on the stove and sits down to eat it.VERDICT:  She's not that impressed with this stuff, says she finds it bland, lacking in any noticeable volume of larger clam pieces.  Frankly she said that the Bar Harbor tastes * much * better  than this Chincoteague stuff and has more actual clam in it.  Go figure.  I trust her opinion in matters regarding New England Clam Chowder, she eats it probably 3 times a month and loves to find it cooked well in a nice restaurant as a specialty.P.S. We have yet to try the "Atlantic" brand of Clam Chowder but after this experience, we're going to stick to Bar Harbour as the "sure thing".

We have wooden floors in our bedroom and with the cold weather it's kind of a shock to wake up and put your feet on the cold floor. I wanted some runner throws for our bedroom. I did not have time to run all over. I get onto good old Amazon, do some searching, cross-reference and find these. I buy two runner rugs from the same company - this "Chili Pepper" colored (almost)2 X 5 ft rug and another similar to it in a "light charcoal" color. She gets this red one, I get the light charcoal one. They arrive. They look good, the color shade / tinting is good. The grey rug has a cool banded pattern. The chili pepper colored rug is continuous - no banding. How do they feel: "OK". I wouldn't call them cheap (they are NOT hard or harsh on your feet), there's some cush and average comfort but by no means would I call them plush. You do not have the luxurious, "sink into it" pile depth on these rugs. They are "enough" / perfunctory. They have a non-slip rubber backing on them. Overall they are reasonably well made, just not the Ritz. For $36.00 shipped and me solving a problem without me having to run all over heck and gone, it's a fair deal. I would feel better if they came in priced at $28.00 but C'est L'vie. I got it done.  I'm marking these as 3 stars mainly due to quality-for- price.

We have wooden floors in our bedroom and with the cold weather it's kind of a shock to wake up and put your feet on the cold floor.  I wanted some runner throws for our bedroom.  I did not have time to run all over.  I get onto good old Amazon, do some searching, cross-reference and find these.  I buy two runner rugs from the same company - this 2 X 5 ft rug and another similar to it in a "chili pepper" color.  She gets the red one, I get the light charcoal one.  They arrive.  They look good, the color shade / tinting is good.  The grey rug has a cool banded pattern.  The chili pepper colored rug is continuous - no banding.  How do they feel:  "OK".  I wouldn't call them cheap, but by no means would I call them plush.  You do not have the luxurious, "sink into it" pile depth on these rugs.  They are "enough" / perfunctory.  They have a non-slip rubber backing on them.  Overall they are reasonably well made, just not the Ritz.  For $36.00 shipped and me solving a problem without me having to run all over heck and gone, it's a fair deal.  I would feel better if they came in at $28.00 but C'est L'vie.  I'm marking these as 3 stars mainly due to quality for price.

Many movies I have bought to have because "they are a classic", or they are famous, they were a hit, etc.  blah blah.  The truth is they get watched once, maybe twice and then sit there on the shelf - sometimes to be loaned out.  I'm here to say that Concert for George is a joy to watch and holds up to repeated viewings.  Everybody is in top form, playing * together * , no egos, no diva attitudes, just a love and tribute to their friend who they played with over the years.  I find myself playing this video concert at least twice a year.Video and audio quality:I bought this in DVD format back in 2005.  I have long since gotten a Blu-ray (1080p) setup with a Plasma TV.  Normally I have fussed and gone back and rebought some movies that I am really fond of.  The video quality is so high on this particular DVD that I have no motivation to buy it in Blu-ray.  Maybe there's something about it that upscales well on my player(?) don't know - I just know that it looks great and sounds great.Mark Mann (the tall guy wearing the beret cap) and Andy Fairweather-Low are the band's secret weapons.  Amazing tandem slide guitar work.  Gary Brooker does some wonderful piano licks.  Good vocals all around.  The expressions of drummer Henry Spinnetti are amusing and his drumming along with Jim Keltner's is first rate.  It's rare to have 3 or 4 drummers on stage and have them sync up so well.The Indian orchestra part of the movie is well done if you are a fan of that kind of music.  I've watched that a couple times, appreciated it but typically pass over that for the "George's Band" section with Western musicians.  I also pass over the Monty Python stuff much as I liked Life Of Brian and Holy Grail.In closing very cheerful, energetic and heartfelt for a goodbye concert.  Highly recommended.

It's not a speed demon but for the price (64GB under 40 dollars) as of Feb 2014 - it works.I decided to back up years of family photos and videos off site.  Ya never know when disaster might strike.  I have no faith in the "cloud".  I also burned DVD's but  wanted a single point of backup too.  Eventually I'll get a DL blue ray burner but this will do for now.By the way, I bought this particular drive (early Feb 2014) after reading numerous reviews and finding the sweet spot of lowest price AFTER THE CONSIDERATION OF ** reliability **.  All USB flash drives can have problems - even different models within the same brand.  The reviews I found on Amazon seemed to show particular drive one having less than it's share of problems at a reasonable price.  I didn't need to go broke to archive rarely viewed photos.  For my purposes - (rarely updated backups) speed was not a primary concern.If you wanted something faster, and reliable, consider the Kingston, Patriot or Corsair USB 3.0 drives WITH GOOD REVIEWS.... but, right now (Feb 2014) they cost around 2X as much as this.

Good balance, seems solidly built, the bearings sound smooth (compared to the bottom of line Kawasaki drive I returned).Gutsy acceleration, controllable / limitable by the variable speed control which works well.  The drill does not seem to wobble.It's probably equal or slightly better than my Skil cordless 3/8 drill that just died after 5 years of continuous use.The drill is not really made by Kawasaki - it's just Alltrade using their name under license.Main complaint:  No bubble level.  Sigh.  Of well, it's 15 dollars cheaper than a DeWalt.  If you are on a budget, are weekend warrior or want a 2nd (i.e backup) drill  - her ya go.  Eventually I'm going to get a Bosch.  This will get me by until then.  I have my cordless Ryobi drills for screwdriving or light duty jobs.

I wanted to like this drill.  My previous drill was a Skil 3/8" corded drill that served me well for years through LOTS of use.  The gearbox finally broke on my old drill.  I researched drills and thought I'd give this a try.PROS:*  The variable speed governor adjustment wheel works.  I like that.  You can keep this thing from roaring away if you want.  I still would caution you from relying on this feature to use this drill as a screwdriver - it's not ideal for that.*  It's fairly compact for a corded drill so you can get between joists, enclosed spaces.*  It's inexpensive as far as drills go.*  It's lightweight and well balanced.  People who tire of holding a drill for a long period of time might like this.*  It has a bubble level.*  The keyless chuck is a nice idea but.... (see below)CONS:*  The deal breaker:  The unit I received,  I go to put a drill bit in for the first time and the chuck is solidly locked up, I can't get it to dis-engage, unscrew and I have large hands.  First use attempt!  I look at the manual and I'm doing everything right, I look at the "Grip" / "Disengage" markers/arrows on the chuck itself.  No go.  Now...I * could * break out the vice grips and a cloth and risk marring / damaging the chuck and losing the ability to return this.  Why bother?  The thing is brand new!  I shoudn't have to!  Sending this back.*  Yes it has bubble level but it's smallish and since the drill casing is green, and the bubble fluid is yellow or green on that green background, it's difficult to see.*  I can hear the bearings and they sound rough / noisy.*  Lastly:  When you are running the drill motor at medium to high speeds.... you can easily see yellow /blue sparks from the motor brushes via the side vent holes.  And this is a copious amount of sparks with like a 1/4 throw.  Run the motor for 30 - 40 seconds and there's an ozone smell.  And again THIS IS HOW IT BEHAVES NEW.  Imagine what it will deteriorate to as it ages.  I don't recall my Skil drill doing this ever, or if it did, it was mostly visually and physically shielded from me.*  The drill says Kawasaki but it's really made by Alltrade and Kawasaki has allowed Alltrade to license the use of their name to make some dollars.  If this drill is indicative of the general quality of the line, then I feel sorry for Kawasaki as this will besmirch their brand.IN CLOSING:  Maybe mine was made on a monday by a bad robot that didn't have it's WD-40.  I just know I don't have the patience to try again on this model.  I think if you could get it to work and you were a very occasional picture hanger, whatever, then this might work for you.  You'd have to have low standards.ADDENDUM:  Oddly enough, I simulataneously ordered a better model of Kawasaki that has a keyed chuck - BEFORE I NEW BETTER.  It's on it's way.  It's $15.00 more.  Watch for my other review of that.  Hopefully that will go better.The drill of my dreams is a $110.00 Bosch 3/8" drill.  My purpose in ordering this little drill was just to have an extra small job drill.

I unpacked the 4 pack tonight and put one of these in the my Coleman (Johnson Controls) gas furnace.  Examined it briefly, it looks to be as well made.  I used to buy the 3M Filtrete next to top of the line filters.  I remember the Filtrete's costing at least $12.99 apiece.  I did an analysis and looked at comparative reviews of various brands of furnace filters - both on Amazon and Home Depot's websites.  I found that I can get these cheaper off Amazon Prime than purchasing a comparable filtration level filter from my local Home Depot or Lowes.  The True Blue's cost $36.00 for 16 months of clean filtered heating airflow (assuming you follow their change filter every 120 days suggestion).  Another way to look at is:  these cost $27.00 a year, and really - in the Northwest where I come from -- who runs their furnace in July, August and the 1st half of September?  You might even get more mileage if your local climate allows you to write off Summer as a time of usage.  Yet another way you can look at it is, if you have allergies or a lot of cat hair, dust, etc, you can afford to be unusually fastidious.

OK, I unpacked these an hour ago.  Was kind of shocked that the "pack of two" is in one fairly small foil package containing two folded wipes 7 inches by 12 inches.  Now...this product may be stupendous, who knows.  But for $3.75 per each wipe,..it better be God Like!  I know that for $5.30 I can get a bottle of Rain-X ...the appeal these Invisible Glass wipes was just the lazy factor and convenience of having it in the car, ready-to-go.  Will test this in the near future and update this.

I bought these to -  I don't know - try something different/save money.  The first two units out of the pack were dull (mediocre sharpness)on first use and the 3rd one gave an OK but not spectacular shave.  I've yet to use the last one.  I won't be buying these again.  Aside from inconsistency of sharpness, it feels like there's some subtle difference of the angle of the blades that is less effective, more prone to mishaps compared to...PREFERRED ALTERNATIVE:  I like my old standby, the Shick Extreme 3 razors much better.  I find I get cut less with the Shick and it's a closer, hassle free shave.  With Edge (or Barbasol) the Shicks are fearless taking on even 3 day beard stubble.  (I don't have fine hair by the way).To be fair, the Shick razors cost aprox. 47% more money but it's worth it to me not to rip my face to shreds or to discover missed spots later.  Like anything else you get what you pay for.  I just found I had to "drive defensively" way more with these Personna razors.

Overall Rating:  4.5 Rockin’ ★★★★☆Chrome and Steele mixed with grease and a tomboy mechanic that rides a motorcycle…what about that scenario doesn’t get the blood pumping? Once again the amazingly talented Rie Warren creates a world of alpha male deliciousness, humor and sizzling heat with her latest in the Carolina Bad Boys series.  Chrome is the fourth book in this series and it is Jayce and Boomer Steele’s story.  This big, bad alpha male meets his match when he meets a woman that is not afraid to get down and dirty (literally) with Retribution MC’s Prez!Boomer Steel has always been the protector, the one that watches over those he loves and will do anything to keep them safe.  His little sister is now safe with a man that has taken over Steele’s job as her protector and his brother has also found love.  Everything seems perfect, well everything except Boomer is now living alone in a big empty house with just a dang cat for company!  All that changes when he meets a woman that fills all the voids in his life and heart, Rayce.  But Rayce has dark secrets that she hides and refuses to share or allow him to protect her from.He is everything she has ever dreamed of and too good for the likes of her…trailer trash from the other side of the tracks. How could he possibly want her?  Rayce marches to her own beat, riding her motorcycle, racing her motocross bike, working as a mechanic in a male dominated world.  How could she ever fit into Boomer’s world?  He has a successful business, is the Prez of an MC, has a loving family and the man is too beautiful for words.  Rayce has secrets, dark secrets that she keeps hidden from the world and can never be shared.  But Boomer keeps chipping away at the wall she has her heart encased in and she is afraid that he will break through and discover the real Rayce…the hidden girl behind the tough girl exterior!Love is not a respecter of station, position or wealth, but a leveling field for everyone.  In this amazing story about the oldest Steele brother, Ms. Warren envisioned and created a story that will leave the reader totally ensnared.  Her characters are unforgettable and melded in a way that you feel like you know them.  This story also deals with horrific situations that are real world relevant.  As always the pages sizzle and is filled with humor.  I cannot wait to see where this gifted writer will take me next!

Overall Rating:  4.5 Rockin’ ★★★★☆She is his angel that comes to him when he cannot bear the pain and agony inflected.  He is the single purpose for everything she does, her reason for living!  In this hauntingly beautiful love story of abuse, love and redemption we take a journey through hell and heaven.  J. B. Salsbury has woven a web of suspense, drama and true love in Fighting to Forget, book three in her Fighting series.  The storyline alone will keep you trapped within the pages of this remarkable book, but the characters and their realistic struggle will keep you reading!Living in a world that seems at times unfocused, haunted by nightmares that want let him sleep, Rex Carter finds himself using violence as an outlet for his frustrations.  To all appearances he is a successful MMA fighter, musician and great guy.  So what if he is controlled by his hair-triggered temper and reacts without much provocation.  He has it under control, right.  He just wishes he could remember his past and understand his dreams!  When she walks into his life, he wonders if she could be his cure.Her soul purpose is vengeance against those that hurt him.  She needs to redeem herself from the guilt of not saving him.  It is time she faced her past and found a way to be released from it.  He needs to be told the truth about what happened when they were children, but he seems so well adjusted, happy.  Maybe he doesn’t need old wounds to be reopened.  He obviously does not remember her, so she will just watch and wait for the perfect moment to introduce herself to him.  But everything changes when she gets up close and personal with Rex, maybe the past can stay dead.  Maybe they can live in the future and heal each other.This book blew me away with all the twists and turns in the plot.  Just when you think you have it figured out another element is added to the story.  Each character adds an extra depth and layer to the drama taking place.  Love eventually triumphs over evil and that saying ‘true love conquers all’ is proven in this remarkable book. Another great addition to my library and I look forward to reading more by this outstanding author.

Overall Rating:  4.5 Rockin’ ★★★★☆Take one high powered NYC boot scooting lawyer from Texas mixed with her ‘All American’ high school crush then add in a true Southern twist and you will have the first book in Nicole Hite’s The Southern Gentleman series.  Carrington Mason and Colton Wilson two exceptional individuals formed a unique bond in high school that even though neither recognized at the time, survives in Ms. Hite’s novel Justified Love.As soon as graduation was over, Carrington left Avery, Texas behind.  During her formative years those bad girls that we all love to hate made her their target. An overweight geek with a crush on the school’s quarterback gave them plenty of opportunity to inflect damage.  With her own girl posse as backup, Carr survived those years even though the scars on her soul lingered. She is now a successful high powered attorney with a prominent firm in New York.  When her father requests her help with a legal matter, she makes plans to go home and help him.  She is no longer the overweight, insecure girl that left.  Carrington just hopes she does not run into Colton, but a girl has to do what a girl needs to do for her family.Colton had always felt like a big disappointment to his father.  He never felt good enough for his parents.  During high school he was looked at as the golden boy, the guy everyone wanted to be or be with, but he had wanted a geeky shy girl.  Carrington intrigued him and he wanted to know more about her, but she was driven away by others.  Now Carr had returned and he was not letting her get away again.  Colton is painted as a man that loves deeply and is intensely loyal. The care and protection he lavishes on Carrington is beautiful.  He is still all male and dominates while developing his relationship with Carrington. Long hidden secrets begin to unfold and they threaten to destroy the relationship he is building with her.Interaction between the two main characters is sexy and sweet at the same time!  The friendship that the author develops between Carrington and her girl posse is a true high point in this book.  The way they are used as a support system for each other is also a brilliant and remarkable part of the story. The conclusion allowed the reader a glimpse of the couple’s future together. Great read and a must for anyone’s library!

Lesson for Lox by S.M. DonaldsonOverall Rating:  4.5 Rockin’ ★★★★☆Some lessons are harder to learn than others!  In this prequel to Marco’s MMA Boys series by the extremely talented S. M. While out with the twins, Lox finds himself at a strip joint of ill repute and drawn to the woman taking her clothes off on the stage. Pick up a copy and enjoy not only a Lesson for Lox, but also nineteen other sizzling hot reads!

Overall Rating: 4.5 Rockin’ ★★★★☆In the latest KGI novel, the reader finds themselves in a deep undercover black ops mission that is filled with danger, mystery and romance. From the extraordinarily gifted Maya Banks we finally get answers about one of her most notorious bad boys, Hancock. The relentless pursuit of justice and protection of the innocent continues the ongoing theme of The Kelly Group International (KGI):  in this fast paced novel.  As with her other novels in this series, in book ten we are rewarded with the appearance of  beloved characters from previous novels and finally get answers about one of the most notorious bad ass of them all.Honor Cambridge is the youngest daughter in a large, close knit family. However, being the infamous leader of a team that seeks truth and justice no matter the costs, he finds himself in a situation that causes him to question his life choices.  This meeting makes him look at life in a different way, because of her...Honor Cambridge.  Hot on the heels of finding and taking down the elusive Maksimov, Hancock has to protect Honor and do his job at the same time.  But in doing that, Honor may become the ultimate sacrifice. This is a fabulous read, one that will make an excellent addition to your library.

Overall Rating: 4.5 Rockin’ ★★★★☆Whiskey Nights by Fabiola Francisco is a great story with an intricately woven plot. Ms. Francisco has created a beautiful love story with a true southern twist. Beth knows what she wants but is scared that he will break her.  Can she take a chance on this attraction and see what happens?Jake has been flirting with Beth since he met her. Overall Rating:  4.25 Rockin’ ★★★★A family raised by a psychotic mother and a father that does not seem to be part of the world he lives in, then mix together five siblings that are as different as night and day and you will begin to understand the unique situation that Cora Brent, author extraordinary has created in her latest book, Born Savages.  Ms. Brent has woven a web of sensual tension, mystery and true love into an unforgettable tale. This story tracks the rise and fall of the Hollywood royalty, the Savages.When everything your family says or does is instant fodder for the tabloid sharks, you learn early to fade into the background.  I learned early on to avoid my crazy, publicity seeking mother.  When she gave up on me earning her way back into Hollywood’s elite, I could finally breathe.  But all she did was turn her eyes on to my two younger sisters and destroy their lives.  Finally, I have found a sense of peace and anonymity, only to have it once more snatched away. The powers that be want to drag my family into the limelight once again and do a ‘Born Savages’ reality show.  How can I say no, when my family needs the money?  Everything was bearable until he walked back into my life!I should never have agreed to return, but I needed to face her!  I needed to face the woman that had thrown me aside for her psychotic family.  The girl that was now a woman that still haunted my dreams!  It should be easy to face her, but instead of finding release I found need.  Is it possible to move past the betrayal, deceit and lies to find a future?This is Oz and Ren’s story of love lost and a second chance at happiness. In Tess Oliver’s new series, FMX Bros, we are introduced to a new group of hunkalicious males! The pages of this book heat up with their reaction to each other.  Ms. Oliver also includes all the Custom Culture guys and gals in this spin off and they add a depth to overall plot.Cole is the son of a super nova rock star and as such is known and accepted in all the right circles.  He however prefers to work hard and play even harder as his own man!  With his two BFF’s he runs a construction company for his father and does the FMX thing for fun and relaxation.  When he accepts a bet from one of his friends about meeting and dating the heiress next door, Cole bites off more than he can chew!  Kensington pulls at a side of him that he didn’t know existed.  He wants with her what he has noticed his friends have with their significant others.When Kensington meets Cole, she is instantly intrigued. In Storm, book one in her Sex and Bullets series we are submerged into a world that is filled with darkness, greed and evil, but is also filled with light, hope and true love as she tells Raylin and Storm’s story.Nowhere is safe, no one can be trusted! For the first time in her life she had found a place where she felt safe, and that place is in his arms.  But who is Storm?  Is he the handyman that he seems to be or something more? She will become the focal point of his life and he will do anything to protect and keep her safe.  Storm is even willing to go back home and face the life he has been running from to save her!As the story unfolds and the plot thickens Ms. Raven creates a unique love story/thriller that will mesmerize her readers and keep them wanting more. Butler weaves an unforgettable tale around the search of one of these tigers for his true mate.In the shifter world a mate is recognized immediately with just one sniff. He has been dreaming of her and the closer they get to each other the more intense the dreams become for him. What he had not expected was the human female that is his!  Will she be able to accept him and his shifter world?Representing her brother the Vampire Lord at a were-fight, Aubrey did not know what to think when she heard an earth shattering ROAR!  The roar she heard at once pulled her to find the source of it and latch onto it.  When she is introduced to Alaric, she knows he belongs to her and her to him. Overall Rating:  4.5 Rockin’ ★★★★☆A great war occurred and the world was thrown into chaos.  As a result of the damage done to the atmosphere, the female inhabitants’ reproductive system no longer functioned.  Many women were tested and only a few were able to reproduce.  Scientists wanting to save humankind began a program to freeze the willing women to be woken when they were needed.  In Melted by the Dragon, author Amira Rain, delves into time travel and a paranormal world where nothing is the same as Vivian Mason remembers it to be.  She was cryogenically frozen for several hundred years.  Commander Jackson Wallace needs Vivian to produce an heir to take over his leadership.  Their journey is fascinating and adventurous and you do not want to miss it.Jackson is a dragon shifter and Commander of the United Federation of Shifters.  He protects his people from the Gorgolians.  He wakens Vivian and hopes to produce an heir. He finds the beautiful female is exactly what his heart desires. But, Vivian has no memory of her past and bits and pieces of the person she was before she was frozen.  An enemy from long ago surfaces and Vivian is thrown into the new world searching for her place.Amira Rain has created a beautiful romance with her main couple.  The allure, chase, and unknown enable the reader to understand the plight each individual goes through.  Irene and Celeste are secondary characters that I truly adore.  Wonderfully written and welcome addition to my paranormal eBook library!
