Back to point #1, I lugged it through the house folded because it doesn't fit through standard doorways from the bedroom to the laundry room to the door to the garage unfolded.4. We wanted to compare this at the big box store (Buy Buy Baby in Dallas) with the City Mini Double Stroller, but the manager at Buy Buy Baby laughed and told us they don't carry the BOB doubles because they are too bulky and heavy.5. For my wife, this is truly bulky and heavy and doesn't really fold flat unless you remove the front wheel.  Lugging it into the back of her CR-V, it takes up a lot of space, leaving little room for anything else.  I consider it bulky and heavy and awkward to carry, too.6. At the next outdoor event that was on the grass, we had to pause numerous times since it was too bulky to get through the crowds.  We made the mistake of going over a nature bridge and everyone on the other end had to stop so we could get all the way across (we couldn't turn around because a dozen people were behind us).7. For various outdoor walks and jogging, yes, it really shines, but then little things like the canopy design frustrate you.8. The canopy design (when folded back) grazes the top of our 2.5 year old's head.  I've checked it multiple times and that's simply how it is designed.  Our kids are also smaller than average according to the height chart, so not sure how it doesn't bother average or tall kids.  We have to either use the canopy or keep pushing the excess material off their heads.  The Velcro-pull straps don't really help clear the head-clearance.9. The "clear-viewing-flap" doesn't Velcro out of the way as easily on the BOB like it does on the City Mini, which also has 2 different view flaps, whereas the BOB has one.  The City Mini allows for different angles of the canopy so your kid can still see everything, yet still providing the "clear-viewing-flap" at the same time.  The BOB canopy design is a bit annoying.10. Furthermore, the canopy design on the BOB doesn't completely block the sun for a sleeping baby, there are large gaps where the quick-fold handles are.  Both of our City Minis properly shield the sun with no poor design-gaps.11. Reclining a sleeping child requires 2 hands on 2 adjustments for just one seat, hopefully synchronized at the same time.  The City Mini is a simply one-handed recline and it will recline the seat evenly.  (The large gap in the top of the seat back will frustrate you when the bright sun shines straight on baby and wakes them up!)12. We spent ~$80 for a Peg Perego BOB car seat adapter and were never happy with how it "clicked" or didn't click in place.  It's a poor design and the bulkiness of that darn canopy gets in the way.  Also, it then forces the other second seat (our 2.5 year old's) to have a bar going across that functions as a cup holder/tray.  It's all one piece, so you don't really get a choice if she's picky and wants to hold her stuffed animal; the bar will get in the way.  Also, you can only have 1 car seat adapter on the BOB duallie.I think if I put a hook in the garage so that we never have to take the BOB duallie indoors and won't bump our heads into it, I'll be much happier with it.  If you are a hard-core jogger, you'll probably love it.  If you don't take it to the mall (won't fit in aisles and you'll take up half the elevator) or crowded outdoor events, you will also love it.  If you have an SUV and plenty of room for luggage (and a travel-sized bicycle pump) and the BOB duallie, then you'll like it.If you want a practical double-stroller to take everywhere and also jog with it, then this one isn't ideal for our needs.  We want a double stroller that will do it all, not just hard-core jogging.  The City Mini GT double-stroller is the closest fit we've found.  For our needs, this stroller is 2-stars.

Wonderful design and usage overall, almost 5-stars!Even though we really love this oil diffuser, it is not quite 5-stars:1. We love the fact that it can "diffuse" every 10 seconds or continuously2. Diffusing every 10 seconds it seems to last 4-6 hours3. It glows different colors of the rainbow which is pretty cool4. You can use batteries*, plug-in power*, or USB cable from your computer5. I only tried once, but I'm pretty sure it drained the batteries in 2 days.  Since then I used plug-in power by plugging it in with a micro-USB using an old phone charger.  I'm 99.9% confident it would have still worked if I plug it into my laptop's USB cable.6. I deduct the 1-star because of how fast it uses up batteries and I happened to not have any rechargeable batteries to use with it.7. Also, I deduct that star because it doesn't include a power adapter, you have to fishing around for some extra micro-usb phone chargers you might have laying around.8. I do appreciate the fact that any micro-usb adapter or plugged straight into a USB port in a computer would work.9. Lastly, I do wish it had some sort of raised surface or handle to grab to remove the top.  It is smooth plastic.  When the oil/water condensate, it creates this suction and combined with, heh, the oils you are using, makes it difficult to take the top off.  You can turn it upside down, but all of the liquid condensate will leak out, all of this would be fixed if the top were just easier to grab.10. Overall, we really do love this and the size and portability, but a few small improvements and it would be an easy 5-stars.

2 stars is fair here because it states multiple viewing angles.  Well, it would be more accurate to say, Multiple-LANDSCAPE viewing angles.If you want to read your Kindle book in portrait mode (who reads in landscape mode?) well, there's no adjustment!  You prop it up like you would a 2-page menu at a restaurant.  (And who reads completely vertical like that?)Does it fit a new Kindle Fire HD (year 2013-2014) yes it does fit well.  But usability/design is lacking.  We have a different cover that pivots in the holder that gives you true multiple landscape and portrait viewing angles.This one is lacking any portrait-mode viewing angle adjustment.

Great quality all around and the noise-limiter really does work!As parents of 2 little-ones, we didn't want our kids to hurt their hearing when they aren't old enough to truly comprehend why a loud volume would be bad.  This is a blessing and quite a comforting device to own and let our kids use.We have a no-named one for our daughter and this one for our son.  (Actually both work just as well)  Can't say this is any better or worse or less comfortable, I can only state it works as advertised.  (We tested both headphones out ourselves and can fit both headphones on our ears and see that the noise limiters work)

Though I'm no longer single, I used to get the regular Heads and Shoulders and try to hide the bottle or at least turn it around back in my bachelor days, because I like to over-analyze things.Why?  Because, do you really want the person you're dating to think you have dandruff?Now enter the Clear Men Scalp and Anti-dandruff shampoo where you can still have dandruff, but it is not blatantly obvious that you do!So far so good, I'm still married, THANK YOU CLEAR MEN SCALP and ANTI-DANDRUFF SHAMPOO for being subtle about it!

I put 2 (x2) of these batteries in remote-controlled blinds that covers 2 top windows on a wall that is 18 feet high.  I wanted to put the best in there, since they are such a pain to change out when the batteries get drained.Outside of that, I can only trust the product packaging description and see if they last longer than a year, which is what I get with average use of the blinds using regular batteries.If they go for longer (or less) than a year, I'll update my review and stars-given for this product accordingly.

Compared to our other North States gate, this is an easy 5 stars.  Compared side by side, this model is lighter in overall weight and has a few design improvements.The older models were a pain to put together because the metal dowels kept falling out as you go to tighten everything.  This model has improved design with a plastic connector that doesn't fall out.  (The NEW connectors actually fit in the older model, too and everything else seems to match up, just little design improvements in the components here and there)The rest of the install/use is pretty comparable with the older models, except that this one has an arching gate and the feel is a little nicer than the cold-metal of the older model.The color goes well with our white cabinets in the kitchen and walls which are painted a neutral "café-latte" color already.We bought the 60" extension Wide Portico, Linen extension and it is a perfect match and works well.  (And yes just for grins, the extension does fit our older model, too, albeit linen vs white)

4 stars for the clear design, potentially 5-stars with the following changes:1. If this wasn't clear I might give it 4.5 stars.  But the fact that it IS clear means you can see when it gets cloudy inside from condensation/evaporation of the water.  Not visually appealing when that happens; about as visually appealing when that happens to old windows in your house.2. I do wish the soap-caddy part was removable or re-positionable to the front.  I like to keep this flush with the back splash, but the soap-caddy adds too much depth that we have to keep this on the side of the sink.3. Over time you'll get some "green gunk" at the tip of the dispenser.  It's somewhat easy to rinse off, but I don't notice this with other hand soap dispensers through out the house - like ever.Overall: I love the idea, my own foaming soap dispenser for use with any of my liquid soap refills so far, without having to buy the disposable foam soap dispensers at the grocery store.  Some minor product adjustments would make this a 5-star product, but as-is, 4 stars is fair.  "I like it."

I feel 3-stars is fair for this product for several reasons:1. If you cook or wash dishes and absolutely never move your feet whatsoever, then it is true that you don't really "sink to the floor" using this anti-fatigue mat because the gel? innards, etc are cushiony enough to prevent that from happening.  Unlike memory foam type mats that are super-comfortable at first, eventually you "sink to the floor" and are essentially standing on the hard floor.  We actually like our memory foam mats better, because we are still standing in one place, but do move our feet to load the dishwasher or stir a pot, etc. so we always find comfort in the foam mats, too.2. There's some strange and greasy "film" on this mat.  I've washed it with soap and water and a couple coatings of Windex.  If you have squeaky clean floors and step on this mat and step back off, your feet will feel slippery and the floor will too.  (Not a spilled-oil slippery, but like a spilled powder type slippery)3. Most standard size sinks and cooktops are about 30" wide, so this is a good size and the weight is heavy enough it does not slide around.Overall, this isn't our favorite anti-fatigue mat and this strange "greasy film" on it that isn't easy to clean off make it a fair 3-stars product.  "It's just okay."

First, I am very thankful to the Vine program for providing such a "cool" laptop for me to review and I feel bad to only give this an overall score of 3-stars, but that's the fairest thing to do for the Amazon Community.Why 3 stars for an Alienware Laptop?=============================My review is only for the ALW14-5002sLV 14" laptop.Initial Impressions:---------------------------My first impression upon opening is that it is well packaged with a pretty slick Alienware outer box, a 'certificate of authenticity' as if I was now a part of some elite club, but then I had the strange feeling that it may have been a refurb.  The entire laptop is beautiful and feels like high quality, but when I pulled out the power adapter, it says "DELL" and looks similar to some old Dell power-bricks on an old Inspiron laptop I had.  Had someone swapped the power-bricks on me with a cheapie Dell one??A quick Internet search reveals that Dell purchased Alienware some time ago!  Still, looking up the price for this laptop on Amazon and then getting a power brick with "Dell" on it felt a little cheap.  How could such a sharp looking and relatively pricey laptop from "Alienware" be stuck with a plain Dell power brick?  This is like buying a Lexus and popping the hood to see Toyota on the engine (Yes, Toyota owns Lexus, but doesn't make it right!).  I do wish they would've "re-branded" the power brick to say Alienware and look and feel as beautiful as the overall laptop does.Performance:--------------------I then proceeded to download 9 gigs worth of 3DMARK06, Cinebench and PCMARK and spent several hours downloading, installing and running all of the tests.  Unfortunately, it only scored mediocre and well below the "gaming-laptop" benchmarks and only slight better than ultrabooks!?  This is a 2.4ghz i7 laptop on Windows 7 64bit.3DMARK06 - first, it states that the ultimate test, Fire Strike is so strenuous even new adapters have issues keeping up.  And true to that, the Alienware ALW14-5002sLV had a pitiful 5-9 FPS.  In other words, unplayable.SkyDiver from 3DMARK06 was reasonable 50-90 FPS and this is where the Alienware still only benchmarked mid-pack, well under "Gaming Machine" and just barely above "Ultrabooks."CINEBENCH - the Alienware really shined in GPU performance, but still beneath a true Gaming Machine.PCMARK - Mid-pack results, definitely not a stand-out.Usability/Cool Factor:------------------------------Now in terms of usability and cool factor (but not "coolness" - more on that later) - an Alienware laptop is awesome.  You can configure 6 different "lighting zones" to be a different color LED and then make it fade in/out, glow, and blink.  From the Alienware symbol on the back of the screen to the keyboard, touchpad, power buttons, etc all configurable in different shades of LED colors!Keyboard feel is excellent and the touchpad is responsive and accurate.  Overall the feel is very high quality.  I am currently typing on my Work Laptop - an HP EliteBook 8570w.  Sometimes the cursor floats on my HP because I put too much wrist pressure because the laptop plastic near the touch pad flexes!  Not so on the Alienware - really, high quality, sturdy and very rugged feeling.  No floating cursor experience at all because it seems to be better built.What I don't like about the Alienware 14" ALW14-5002sLV---------------------------------------------------------------------------------1. For the price as advertised at this writing, it seems pricey compared to the mid-pack/mediocre gaming performance numbers it generated in 3DMARK06, CineBench and PCMARK.  Now if you don't game, you probably wouldn't spend that much on a "barely better than an ultrabook" non-touch laptop to begin with.2. Related to the above, you again, wouldn't spend this much on a non-touch laptop that weighed this much!  THIS site's product description says 4lbs which has to be wrong.  My wife's 12" touch-laptop is rated at 3.3 lbs and this thing feels twice as heavy.  [Just checked twice on the bathroom scale - when holding this laptop without the power brick, I weigh a little over 6lbs more than when not holding it; admittedly not super-scientific, but I'd say a little more than 6lbs is accurate for this laptop.]3. It's cool, but not cool.  As I type this on my HP Work Laptop, I'm using a CoolerMaster laptop cooler pad with fans because of the heat it generates.  I thought I could use the Alienware without a cooler pad because of the design.  It "seemed" like the Alienware laptop was thicker on the bottom because it self-elevated the internal components so that resting on your lap, you wouldn't block any fans or vents.  Well, this is partly true, it's a much better design than my HP, but you still need a cooler pad AND I measured 126 degrees Fahrenheit on the exposed cooling fins on the back!  That's pretty hot!  (Yes it was running 3DMARK tests at the time...)4. The darn Dell power-brick has this blue LED that is not adjustable in brightness like the laptop LEDs are.  It is super annoying and lights up an entire darkened room by itself.  The wife won't approve of it.OVERALL===========1. For the bulkiness (~6lbs without power brick), thickness and "relatively" small 14" screen, you get an Alienware laptop regardless because of the gaming use and ease of portability over hunking around desktops to gaming LAN parties.  For the mid-pack gaming performance and price point, I personally wouldn't have purchased this.  (Again, this is a Vine review.)2. For ultimate cool-factor, yes, an Alienware laptop is cool.  And if you don't care for gaming, then you have yourself a pretty cool, sturdy, high-quality and well-built laptop.  But if you don't care for gaming, would you spend this much on an i7 non-touch 14"  laptop, or would you get an equally cool, i5-based touch-tablet/convertible laptop that was paper-thin and weighed a couple pounds?3. Overall, I feel this specific model Alienware ALW14-5002sLV laptop that I received doesn't fit into any specific category very well at its current price point (as of this writing) and doesn't stand out with compelling reasons to buy for gaming or performance or couch-surfing and email.

With 12 nieces and nephews, we've had a lot of time to explore various car seat options.  Unfortunately, some systems like this Orbit require you to invest in the entire "ecosystem" to make use of all the convenient functionality.There's no doubting the swivel-base design is unique compared to our "static" Peg-Perego and Britax car seats in 2 different cars.  However, THIS car seat does not include the swivel-base and must be purchased separately.This then makes it the priciest convertible car seat we've seen.  First, the regular price is comparable to a Peg-Perego and Britax, but then the swivel-base and other Orbit components really add up!  [Not related to this review, but we decided to not purchase the Orbit system because we didn't like the stroller design and lack of storage underneath]But back to this car seat, it's heavy and doesn't recline.  This was a deal breaker for us because of the type of cars we drive.  The wife's Honda CR-V has reclining rear seats.  My small sedan does not.  Because of the CR-V rear-seat recline, we can make the seat level the way you are supposed to.  We can also ensure the tether can be fastened over the headrest properly and the bulk of the back of the seat is flush with the vehicle's seat back and feels secure when tugged/jostled etc.  In a small 4-door sedan whose rear seats don't recline (I don't know many?), you lack the adjustment to ensure the seat is level because of the lack of recline. Also, this affects fitment of the seatback as it fits to the contour of the vehicle's seatback.Now to be CLEAR - this is being used WITHOUT the swivel seat base because we chose to NOT invest in the full Orbit system.  Perhaps with the swivel seat base, everything is perfect, but I cannot speak to that.But be it known if you are buying this or gifting this, you're faced with limitations in adjustability in recline and fitment, that we do not face with our Peg-Perego Viaggio and G3 and G4 Britax Boulevard Pavilion car seats.Now, if you are lucky to already have or be invested in the full Orbit system, including swivel seat base, then this may be the best back-saving, convenient car seat you'll find.  (As long as you can get the car seat to the Orbit stroller in short distance, else it is heavy on its own!)

I was a bit disappointed when I received this, the quality of the components (blunt plastic tweezers) and choice of first-aid components were not well thought-out.Here are the exact contents:1 Scissors, 1 Tweezers, 1 First Aid Guide, 1 5"x9" Trauma Pad, 1 Triangular Bandage, 1 First Aid Tape, 32 1"x3" Adhesive Bandages, 1 Fabric Knuckle Bandage, 1 Fabric Fingertip Bandage, 6 Triple Antibiotic Ointment, 10 BZK Antiseptic Wipes, 6 First Aid Burn Cream, 4 Exam Gloves, 1 Cold Pack, 5 3"x3" Gauze Pads, 1 1 ounces Eyewash.---------------------------------------Really, only 1 fabric knuckle bandage and only 1 fingertip bandage ?  I think they could've easily stuffed 32 of each of those in there if they wanted.  The bandaids used thus far were very cheap and don't compare in quality to the namebrand Band-Aids out there.  We have purchased "better-stocked" and more complete first-aid kits before (some with Pepto Bismol tablets and Imodium!) that work better for a household family, that what this offers.2-stars is fair here from the eyes of a household family looking for a practical first-aid kit.

Yes, that's right!  When you lather on the Axe Peace shower gel, you'll feel like you're soaring over ocean waters in a Greenpeace boat saving seals, while getting ready for the Club you're about to go to.But really, no complaints about this; I like the 'Transformers' shaped bottle (well the top-dispensing part looks like 'Decepticon') and the economy size.Bar soap is so 90's and prison-ready.  Shower gel is the only way to go!Except for this review, please don't use "club" and "seals" in the same sentence, let's be nice out there!Carry on!

I love this case.  I've owned other "Otterbox" types and TPU-plastic types that attract lint or are hard to put in your pocket, but this one fits great and has everything I was looking for.I didn't like the "Otterbox" types because although they protect well, they are so dang bulky, that it became distracting in daily use.I didn't like some of the glossy TPU-plastic cases because the glossiness actually affects camera pictures!  Others didn't have a raised front surface to protect the glass.THIS one does it all, no lint, not bulky, good fit, no affect on the camera flash, slides into pocket easily, yet easy to grib, raised front camera surface and none of the connectors are blocked.  Great case that met all of my criteria!

[This is verbatim from my WIFE who READ THIS]I would give this book 3 stars.I really like Rachel Gibson in general. The premise is different. An ex-marine, who is in the security business, is asked to go to Miami to track down the sister of a friend’s fiance. He finds her, and circumstances force them to take a road trip to meet her half-sister in Texas.Although it wasn’t love at first sight, they grew to love each other. This is a bit hard to believe in just a few short days, but it’s a romance, so I’ll overlook the improbability of this. I actually really liked the heroine, Stella. She was funny, sometimes vulnerable, and just likable overall. She was an easy character to root for. The hero, Beau, is a fit, hot ex-marine. What’s there not to like about that?Although I liked the book, there just didn’t seem to be any excitement. There wasn’t an uncontrollable passion between Stella and Beau. There wasn’t any laugh out loud humor. I liked the book, but I would consider it just average.Although I am happy to have read it once, it’s not one I would read over and over.

This is a great 4-in-1 tub that we use for a 2 year old and a 6 month old.  We love the versatility as well as all of the extra accessories that come along with it.It is easy to clean and doesn't have as many 'plastic support ridges' underneath the seat that makes cleaning harder and where mildew likes to build-up in the crevices.  With water and separable pieces, the less small crevices the better for easier clean-up.The primary reason we give 4-stars is because we are unsure about the head-resting-pad-area, since it seems to be some foam pad that is glued on.  Easy fix?  No not really, what type of glue is safe?  What type of glue won't "leech out" ?  We definitely don't want to glue it back on ourselves.  (It hasn't fallen off, but it doesn't seem completely secure and permanent)  We wish the "head-resting-pad-area" were a snap-in type item, etc so it could be removed and cleaned, yet stays in place and NOT glued in place.We love the built-in hook (we use the plastic rings from the baby's play mat to attach it to a towel rack over the tub) - this is great because when the grandparents stay over they don't have some baby tub in the tub-area, it is nicely tucked away and hanging on the towel rack over the back of the tub.Overall, a nice versatile tub that we are happily using for a 2 year old and 6 month old.[Update: 6-18-14 - wanted to add that our 2 year old is a bit smaller than most 2 year olds, in the 10% height/weight range, so if your 1-year old is in the 99 percentile, you may not get the same amount of usage.  At 2.5 years old now, we have moved her out of this tub as we feel she was getting too big for it.  Our now 9-month old still fits this tub fine and will likely fit it for a few more months, so after 1 year it might be time to replace any tub anyways.]

This is our second swing, the first was a hand-me-down that was well-worn and only had a single-direction swing.  This is a nice 4-star swing because it is easy to adjust the swinging motion from side to side to front/back.Here's what we like about it:========================1. AC Adapter!  Our old swing only ran on batteries that we've replaced a few times already.  THIS swing lets you choose to use AC adapter or batteries.2. Adjustable swing motion - side to side or front/back3. Has your standard nature sounds/melodies common on most swings4. Adjustable swing speed5. Rotating mobile with mirror that can be turned off (our old swing had a non-electric mobile that kinda just stayed there)6. It has the ability to fold!  (our old swing is a behemoth monster that is hard to even switch rooms with without carefully articulating and rotating it through the doorway)Here's what we don't like about it and why we have only given 4 stars:======================================================1. Currently, there's some plastic piece in the motor that rattled when I was assembling this.  I can only presume something already broke and is loose inside the motor housing.  The shipping boxes looked fine.  Swing seems to work fine otherwise.2. It says it has 6 speeds, but really only 4 speeds are usable.  Our baby weighs 15.5lbs now.  If I set the speed to 5, the swing will sometimes hit its own stand!  Yes, the swing will swing too much and hit the support stand.  (I've noticed this will happen if you help start the swing motion, but the manual says not to and we are not 'helping' the swing motion, the device is doing this on its own and may be out of adjustment - see potentially related point #1 above)  No fret though, we just set it to speed 4.3. The melodies/nature sounds stop after ~20 minutes.  This doesn't make any sense if it is on AC power.  I think 30, 45, 60 minutes would be more convenient.4. This isn't quiet, though the rhythmic noise might be a soothing factor by accident.  It has a clicking and low rumble-rubberish-squeaky type noise as it swings.5. If your toddler bumps the swing, it will swing out of whack and continue that way, due to the design.  Our old swing had 2 pivot arms so if bumped, it would always correct itself; this has a single pivoting ball motion that is easy to "get off track".Overall, a nice, modern, 4-star swing that has allowed us to cook or eat dinner or get some light household chores done, which is always a nice thing!

We decided to get this because my wife made the mistake of showing an episode of Bubble Guppies to our little toddler when she was home sick one day.  Ever since then, the toddler wants to see "Bubba Gies, Bubba Gies".For our purposes, we think it is great and provides great protection and peace of mind.  Also, the fitment is excellent for our 2013 Kindle Fire HD - never used the older Fire, so have no idea how similar those were.The only reason we give 4 stars is that a perfect 5-star case would have a built-in stand of some sort that was flexible, kid-proof and could be used as needed.  Right now we are just propping this up on small throw pillows on the couch, etc.One observation, that I am not considering in our rating, as I have no proof, is that we have noticed that we have to continually press the Power button to get the Fire to turn on, as if we may have hard reset it or perhaps the case is too tight and instead of Sleep Mode, it is hard-powering-down.  For example, a light press of the power button won't always turn the Fire on.  We have to continually press the Power button in different ways for it to turn on.  (It will still have like 75% battery, so we know that is not the reason)  We didn't observe this until we started using the case and we also have no proof the toddler hasn't thrown this across the room or used it as seat cushion either.  So far the Fire has always (eventually) turned on for us, so not sure if that's related.  We'd love to hear others' experiences in the comments section.  If there's a correlation, then obviously I'll drop some stars.

We are rating this as 5 stars because it is a great, washable, solution for both winter and summer activities.  The summer activities are obvious, but for winter, we've used it for when we've been on the go and there's spit-up on a burp cloth or when there's been the unfortunate blow-out on their clothes.Did I mention it is washable ?The wet side stays there and the dry side stays dry.  Other things in are diaper bag are not affected, so this is a well-designed, tightly-zippered bag.Sometimes we've grabbed this, a couple dental bibs (far cheaper than any made-for-baby changing liners), some diapers and put it on the dry side and go on our quick trip. (Along with our travel-size wipes container stuffed inside)This is a nice 5-star product for us.

We have the First Years Spinning Drying Rack http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000K53UEI (in white, with the older style pegs that do not have a circle at the top of each peg) and a Prince Lionheart Complete Drying Station http://www.amazon.com/Prince-Lionheart-Complete-Drying-Station/dp/B00018XCJC .Here's why I give the Philips Avent Drying Rack 2 stars:Bottle Storage and Surface Area:============================The First Years Spinning Rack holds 16 bottles and is in a more compact, two tier size, with 2 tiers of surface area.  It's really incredible, you can get all of your bottles, nipples, lids, and pump parts - membranes, horns, adapters.  We use Dr. Brown bottles for our colic-y newborn, and those bottles have 6 pieces to separate and wash, so this rack is a blessing.  It's an easy 5 stars.  Also, the drip-tray is separate and can be removed without touching the rack.Prince Lionheart Drying Station holds 8 bottles like the Philips, but it is far more compact and has more nook and crannies and hooks that it holds far more lids and nipples because you can stack sideways.  It's a 4 star and a great efficient design.THIS Philips Avent Drying Rack is 2 stars because it is pretty bulky and only holds 8 bottles and then 8 nipples.  It's surface area is directly below the dripping of the bottles and nipples, which in theory we don't like, even though we just washed them.  The design of the surface area is pretty limited.  Because the surface area is flat (no nooks, crannies, hooks like the Prince Lionheart), you are limited to what you can lay flat...or stack lids, nipples on top of one another, which defeats the purpose of drying them.  Also, the drip-tray is the "base" of this rack, which means you have to delicately hold and balance everything while you remove the base tray underneath to clean.  You can't really see if it is dirty due to the design.  The First Years is just a separate tray on the side that is easy to see when it needs cleaning.Overall=================In our particular household, we use the First Years to dry everything and the compact Prince Lionheart for storage of extra bottles and lids which it is excellent for.With the arrival of our second one, we thought we'd try the Philips Avent Drying Rack, but unfortunately it is no comparison to what we have already - it's bulky, holds less, has a non-ideal drip tray situation, and a very small surface area for the miscellaneous pieces.

I ordered this thinking it was something else, when I realize the product description should just state: "DUAL KITCHEN TIMER" nothing more!I have a Taylor BBQ timer which has a meat probe as a remote unit.  I've used other BBQ timers that also contain temperature probes as a remote unit.This is quite simply, just a DUAL KITCHEN TIMER and I find the BBQ part a bit misleading.  If perhaps, the unit detached and you could put a remote unit at the BBQ and one inside of the kitchen, then yes, I think that would be a fitting description, but this is far from that.My BBQ grill is outside and I may have stuff in the oven or cooking on the stove.  Sometimes I want to time my steaks exactly to the minute while grilling outside, but if I leave this outside (and with no extra remote unit) it will be hard to hear in the kitchen.Actual usage and setting of timers could be a bit improved and the readability is pretty poor if you don't have this on a magnetic surface (of which my stainless-steel refrigerator and grill are not, HAH!).  Furthermore, the unit won't lay on it's side, which is silly.I almost gave this 2 stars, but as a plain-Jane dual kitchen-only timer with magnetic surfaces, I think 3 stars is fair for that usage.

We have 2 kids under 2.  For the first, we only used PolyVi-Sol because that is what the pediatrician recommended.  It smells terrible and tastes terrible (yes, we taste stuff before we give it to our newborn!) and felt pretty sticky.  Luckily, if we added it to her milk, she never complained, whew!Now enter TRI-Vi-SOL which matches up with what the PolyVi-Sol offered, but I noticed it included Vitamin D - which is what a holistic pediatrician recommends everyone should have more of.If I could give 10 stars I would, because this TRI-Vi-SOL has the Vitamin D and it smells sweet and tastes sweet!  When we recently had our newborn son, he was very picky and I don't know anyone that would purposely want to take PolyVi-Sol.  Well, once we tried the TRI-Vi-SOL - no complaints when we add it to his milk.  So this has been quite a vitamin-saver for us and will continue to only purchase TRI-Vi-SOL for our newborn son (we have moved our 2 year old to GummyVites gummy vitamins).

While at the Dallas Quilt Show, a sweet lady told me about these pins and said they were the best she'd ever used.  So I looked everywhere for them and was excited to find them on Amazon.  However, upon receiving them and trying them out, I couldn't be more disappointed.  They're neither  fine enough nor smooth enough, to prevent distorting the seam when sewing small pieces, or keeping points on point.  They almost seem like ball points.I've tried Little House, Dritz and everything in between . . .so far, the absolute best ones I've used, are Clover fine "PATCHWORK" pins (not quilting pins).  Bohin makes the best hand needles on the market . . .and I love their tweezers and machine needle threader . . .but these pins really are like trying to sew with nails.

The rough wood will snag certain fabrics if not careful.  This one wound up in my infrequently used class sewing kit and I ordered a plastic one from Clover that's perfectly smooth, comfortable to hold and because one side is rounded, does a nicer job with points and interior seams.

These are wonderful tweezers, but it's all thanks to Bohin, so I can't subtract stars from the product even though the description is completely wrong.  It says (5pack) but in fact, it is only one in the "pack".Most tweezers are too thick, spring easily or don't have the best angle for pulling threads thru needles, etc.  I keep one at my sewing machine, one at my serger, one at my quilting machine and another in my travel sewing box for class.  I would never want to be without them.***update***March 28, 2015I noticed the description and title have been corrected to reflect this is a listing for ONE and no longer says its a five pack.  Can't recommend these tweezers enough.***UPDATE, Nov 21, 2015***I did enjoy using these tweezers for time I had them, but the metal used is too lightweight to hold up.  The tips no longer meet properly to grip fabric for sewing rounded seams, which was their intended purpose.

These are my favorite pins to use when cutting straight edges of patterns with a rotary cutter and ruler.  The plastic flower heads are flat and enable me to use the ruler on top of the pins without rocking, unlike my glass head pins.  Additionally, the metal is completely smooth, so go thru several layers of fabric smoothly, almost like butter.The length is easier to work with as well, especially good for long fingers.Bohin is a company headquartered in France, however, some of their products are made in Taiwan, to keep the prices in line with other manufacturers.  I've yet to be less than completely satisfied with a Bohin product and typically seek out Bohin notions over all other notion manufacturers, for their quality of workmanship.

I purchased my first set of these in 1998 . . .they included a wall mount that made for handy storage.  However, during a move, the set "disappeared".  I was happy to find a replacement on Amazon, albeit minus the wall mount.  I've had this second set since 2013 with no complaints.The secret to making these work, is to insert the tube to the end, place the wire through the tube and which it reaches the other end, turn it clockwise and when the wire coil is all the way through, gently pull the end back through the tube.  Once through, twist the wire counterclockwise.  Easy Peezy

I bought one of these at the Houston Quilt Festival last fall, for use with my Mid-Arm and liked it so much, checked here for a second to keep with my serger notions.  The instructions are less than intuitive, but this is how I make it work for me.There are two raised dots on opposing sides.  I call the dots North and South.  So, holding it so the dots are North and South, I grab the thread several inches from the end, and place the thread in the groove (don't pull taught, just gently place thread in groove), from East to West.  Then, still holding it so the raised dots are North and South, place the vertical groove gently over the needle and ever so slightly, press into the needle while gliding the needle toward the eye.  A wire will protrode from the tool when it reaches the eye and a loop of thread will form in the back of the needle.  Just pull one side of the loop until the thread is behind the foot.A little practice makes it second nature . . .but calling the dots "North" and "South" made it much easier to remember how to do it each time.

For more than $5, i though I was getting a ball of 87 yards.  However, what arrived was a 27 yard skein, at four times the price I would have paid at a local craft shop.  My bad for not reading the fine print, so buyer beware.
The webbing is not 1" in width, as claimed in the description . . .it is 1.25" and so isn't useable for the needed application.  (See Photo)

This is an extremely robust application which will do everything you need it to do.  However, if, like me, you're a Mac user exclusively (I've been a Mac user since 1989), and have had little to no experience on a Windows machine, you'll find the learning curve even more difficult.It runs just fine on my Mac laptop, but the interface is designed like a Windows interface.  The file structure looks like what one would see on Windows and not on a Mac.  (See photo). Clearly, a Windows programmer simply went in and made the necessary changes to run natively on Mac OS.  The application would be much more Mac user friendly if a Mac programmer went in and made the UI appear more Mac looking in appearance.  (Hopefully this will be done in a future upgrade). I'd gladly pay the full price for an upgrade version in the future, provided it's designed more like Mac.So, if you're a relatively new Mac user, or use both operating systems frequently, you can concentrate on learning the application.  However, Mac only users will want to know, not only must you learn the application, you must also learn Windows simultaneously . . .something a right brained person like me, has more than a little trouble doing.August 6, 2015:Last weekend, I decided to just spend a couple days focusing on the basics . . .and finally, I think I'm at a pont now, where I can continue learning without being hindered by the brain numbing Windows feel.  I've designed a few blocks and am pleased with my progress . . .so am adding a star to my review.

This ham is neither a full size ham and looks nothing like the picture.  (See photo next to a standard size tailor's ham for comparison.)It will work for children size clothing, but if you need it for adult size jackets, etc, you might want to pass this one up.

My sewng machine foot control does remain in place on this "Pedal Stay" but the Pedal Stay slides . . .defeating the purpose.  I have semi-shag carpeting and planned to try this gizmo out before ordering more for my serger, midarm quilting machine and the foot control to my vacuum pressing board . . .but after discovering this abysmal fail, will continue my search for something better.

I have the Reliable C81 pressing board, which has a rack on the right end that accommodates a pressure steam generator.  However, I found the large generator at the work end of the board, a bit too confining, so purchased this cart.  My i400 fits perfectly, and I can wheel it out of the way or across the room where needed.I really don't understand the reviewer who said this cart wasn't worth the price.  It's made of heavy gage steel, is extremely solid and durable and I'm quite sure, it will last decades of use.  This thing is certainly durable for the industrial use it was designed, but works well in my quilt studio.  I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this if you own one of the large, Reliable pressure steam generators.Having said all that, I must point out the description error.  It is not 20" in height . . .it is 30".

I've been an avid seamstress/quilter since childhood and one thing I've learned over the years, is the importance of pressing.  As a matter of fact, one can easily spend an equal amount of time pressing as sitting at the sewing machine.  Sew a seam, press a seam and when we return to the iron, it's auto-shut off has kicked in and we must wait for it to heat back up, and the cycle repeats for an entire eight hour sewing session, only to be repeated yet again the next day.  And when the household iron burns out after a year of on heat/off cool/on heat/off cool, we complain, write bad reviews, and spend another $150 on yet another, made for house hold use iron.  After going thru this cycle more times than I care to remember, I finally wised up and began researching better solutions.I looked into every iron on the market, from gravity feeds to pressure boilers.  While the gravity fed irons appear to be fairly common in the garment making industry, they're really similar to household irons with large water tanks.  After discovering some of the best tailors use Reliable pressure boilers, I took a closer look at this iron.I read every review I could find on both the i500 and i300 (Unfortunately, there doesn't appear to be a single review online yet, of the i400)  Downloaded all three manuals, and researched thoroughly, the irons, their use, etc.  Since this is a new iron, and there aren't reviews, I've tried to include everything I was curious about before making the decision to purchase, and things I discovered after using, so this will be long.Below are the reasons I finally settled on the i400 over the other two models listed above.1.  Tank size - The i400 holds just over 8 cups of water, same as the more expensive i500 model, twice as much as i300.2.  Pressure regulation valve - the ability to control how much, or how little steam is important.  This feature is sorely lacking on the i300.3.  More compact than the i5004.  i300 is rated for use 20 hours or less per week.  My iron is on at least 8 hours per day, 5 days per week.5.  Less expensive than the i500.6.  50 psi just like the i500.  The i300 only has 35 psiI'm extremely pleased with this purchase.  I immediately saw a difference in several quilt blocks I'd already pressed with my household iron and prepared to sew together for a quilt.  I picked one up, and re-pressed using my new i400 and was astonished at the difference!  The seams were flattened completely and the blocks looked so much better.Pros* Dry pressurized steam - typical household irons and gravity feed irons, heat water up to near boiling, which is right around 212F (give or take a degree or two depending on altitude).  However, pressurized boiler irons get much hotter.  The i400's 50 psi means the water is heated to around 282F (as opposed to 259F for the 35psi i300)  So the steam is invisible and dry, until it condenses . . .giving one the ability to use on fabrics that would other wise water stain like silks and satins.* Because the iron just needs heating elements to heat the iron, not create steam, like in a gravity feed or household iron, the i30 iron that comes standard with all three models I've mentioned above, are just under 4lbs.Cons* The manual is truly one of the worst I've ever seen.  Ordinarily, I'd be inclined to deduct a star for that, but I've contacted Reliable's tech support twice and on both occasions, been given all I needed to know plus more . . .and took copious notes. For instance, the "Safety Cap" shown in the line drawing in the manual, is also referred to as "Pressure Cap" and "Fill Cap" in the manual and can be confusing.* It doesn't point this out in the manual, but I was told by Reliable's tech support that I should drain all the water from the unit once a week.* Manual says the unit will take about 10 minutes before it's ready to use . . .but according to my stop watch, it takes nearly 19 minutes.  The unit must bring the water many degrees above boiling temperature, so I plan accordingly.  Once it's on for the day, I leave it on.* Set up  - instructions begin with "make sure all packaging has been removed".  A white zip tie was wrapped around the steam hose and a small spring.  It looked like typical packaging material often found on cords, so I snipped it off.  Only to discover, that zip tie holds the hose to the spring that connects to the hose support wand. . .oops, ordered more zip ties from Amazon.* Hot - the steam is hotter than a household iron.  I use a heat protecting glove I found on Amazon, designed to protect a hand when using a flat iron on hair, works like a charm.  I keep it clipped to a rack on my pressing board.* Expensive . . .but I figure, I can cry once when I buy it, or cry every year when I have to throw out yet another $150 iron and buy another.  Less garbage in the landfill and more money for more fabric, LOL.I highly recommend the Reliable C81 vacuum board to be used with this iron.  It pulls the steam through several layers of the garment and out thru the bottom of the board.  The board is heated, to help dry the board.  You can still use a sturdy non-vacuum board with this iron, but you'll want to keep a supply of board covers on hand, if you use a standard board, because they will be wet.  I definitely would not recommend using a particle board or plywood pressing board with any of the pressure irons as the steam has to go somewhere.Over all, I could't be happier with the i400.  I feel as though I've been using a toy iron all these years.  It's truly stepped up my sewing results and is so much faster and better at ironing laundry.  I'll definitely update this review if there's any trouble in the future, but I don't anticipate anything but many years of happy sewing and no more wasting money on household irons every year.

4.5" square is a useful size for many projects.  I do wish, however, I'd taken a closer look at this particular model . . .it's the older one that's no longer manufactured.  Both full and half measurements on this ruler are white.  If you're used to using Creative Grids, you'll need to pay extra attention because the half sizes are in white circles, not black like current models, and can cause cutting mistakes.  Rather than purchase from this listing, I'd recommend shopping elsewhere for this ruler until the seller gets current stock.

I bought the Gingher Seam Ripper a few years ago, before the replacement blades were available. The handle has a wonderful feel, very ergonomic. However, the blade is awful. The tip is rounded, not pointed, making it difficult to rip seams by catching every third or fourth stitch, as I learned in school 30 years ago, and has served me well thru countless garments and quilts over all these years.I was excited to come across this listing for replacement blades, since it's the blade that causes so many negative reviews on the ripper listing. I was excited when it arrived and the package said "New and Improved". Frankly, it's the same exact, round tipped blade that shipped with it originally. I've attached a side by side comparison of a plain, inexpensive seam ripper, next to this thing, which I even hesitate to call "seam ripper". If you're a garment sewer and use the standard 2.5 stitch length, and rip seams by holding the two seam allowances apart, you might actually like this, but if you're a quilter, using 2.0 stitch length, standard for quilting, you'll find this seam ripper completely useless.It's not often that I find myself in the position of leaving a negative review, because generally, I know what I'm getting when I place the order. But this time, I threw common sense to the wind and took a chance that Gingher might have wised up, but, just as my daddy used to say, "this thing is about as useful as mammaries on a boar hog".

Nice color, and it stays on a long time.  However, when I carry this inside my cosmetic bag, in my purse, the lid easily comes off and there's nothing more annoying than a ruined, expensive lipstick.  I don't have these same issues with my Mac or Chanel lipsticks, so it seems Tom Ford could figure out how to create packaging that's both beautiful and most importantly, protects the product.

There's nothing worse than trying to free motion quilt while the quilt edges are hanging off the table.  The jumbo sized clips work perfectly for keeping a quilt rolled up, making the quilt easier to handle, as I free motion quilt.  I usually use my mid arm machine which has more space but these clips keep my quilts rolled up enough when using my sewing machine as well.  I wouldn't recommend these for binding, however . . .both sizes are indispensable in my quilt studio.

This is the easiest pineapple block ruler I've ever used.  As with all Creative Grids rulers, the markings are easy to read on both light and dark fabrics.  The no skid grippers that are embedded on all Creative Grids rulers, ensure no slipping.An in depth video posted on YouTube can be viewed simply by scanning the QR code printed right on the ruler . . .or typing the ruler name (also printed on the ruler) into YouTube's search bar.

Very useful for pressing open seams in fabric that might otherwise show seam allowances when pressed.  The curved side of the stick, keeps the seam allowance out of the way as it's being pressed and the straight side prevents it from rolling away.  The long length makes it more practical than a seam roll.And while one of these would be easy to make, simply by cutting a straight edge thru a 1" dowel rod and sanding smooth, I'd rather spend my time sewing.  But I must deduct one star, as I feel it's over priced.

This is the easiest Dresden template I've ever used.  All Creative Grids have instructional videos that can be viewed either on Creative Grids website or on YouTube.  Most of their rulers have a QR code that can be scanned with your smart phone or iPad . . .or simply type in the ruler name into the YouTube search to view detailed instructions for its use and to ensure this is the template you're meaning to order.I've replaced all my yellow lined rulers made by another company, with Creative Grids.  I like the clear rough spots on the edges and thru out the rulers that prevent cutting mistakes . . .and the rulers have both white and black markings so can be easily read on both lights and darks.Most of their rulers have the QR code printed right on the ruler . . .however, this template has it printed instead, on the package . . .so keep that packaging.

One of these magnets was the perfect size to use to override my Keurig 2.0 and unclock the menu that enables me to brew a larger cup.  I don't know what I'll do with the rest, but the price was worth it for the use i needed.One reviewer said they were great for kids to play with . . .however, these magnets are extremely strong.  I really wouldn't recommend them for children under 12.

The large fits both my 12.5 lbs  Havanese in full coat.  I have several Pinkaholic harnesses and find the Velcro closure extremely easy to fasten and they hold my two Havanese very well.  However, I wouldn't recommend harnesses with Velcro fasteners for larger breeds or extremely playful dogs.

Have to admit, I was a bit skeptical of ordering a high end cosmetic from a company who misspells the color name, but this eyeshadow is fabulous.  The upper left shadow is a light gold sparkle, not too pigmented, but is gorgeous over the other colors in the pallet.  The top right and lower left shadows are both a satin finish and well pigmented, while the bottom right is a darkly pigmented matte.  This is the sixth Tom Ford shadow quad I've purchased and while it's not my favorite, it will be well worn both day and night.

The majority of my cookware is All Clad Copper Core but I have a few specialty pans in Mauviel.  I'm very pleased with the iron handled m250 cookware as the extra thickness prevents hot spots.  However, the claim in the description that this pan is 2mm thick, is bogus.  It's really only 1.5mm thick.  I made crepes yesterday using both ths pan and my All Clad Copper Core 10" skillet.  There was no comparison . . .the All Clad pan outperformed the Mauviel crepe pan in every area.  A hot spot near the center caused a problem with sticking and the brass handle got far hotter than my iron handled Mauviel pots.So while this pan will look nice hanging in my kitchen . . .it's definitely not a good pan for cooking crepes, or anything else for that matter.  If I had a do over, I would purchase a second Copper Core skillet instead.So three stars for it's beauty, but minus two stars for being virtually worthless as a pan.

I rarely ever buy a product before checking out the Amazon Reviews first, however, when our older model finally went kaput this morning, I didn't bother, just went shoppng.  So it was with shock, when I turned to Amazon for accessories and discovered the massive number of negative reviews regarding k-cups.In fact, so concerned was I that I wouldn't be able to use my old K-Cups, I called the company and this is what they said:  all K-cups made since January, have the special grey ring that's readable by the 2.0.  Since K-Cups only have a shelf life of eight months, this really shouldn't be a problem for anyone.And can I just say, this machine is SOOOOOO much easier to program than the older model it replaces.  There are only ten coffees available for the carafe to date, however, Keurig promises nearly all flavors will be available by the end of quarter, 2015.So as of now, minus one star for my inability to use my own beans, but overall, am extremely pleased with the new model.  Will update my review if that changes.

I've been enjoyably using All Clad pans for over 20 years and they've held up beautifully.  However, it's important to note, All Clad's nonstick pans are limited to approximately three years use before they have to be disposed of and repurchased.  I've switched from the LTD to Copper Core and but still buy the D5 stainless nonstick because it's less expensive and since these are disposable, no reason to spend more than is necessary.All Clad stainless interior will last your lifetime and that of your heirs but anyone expecting the same from nonstick coated interiors is being woefully unrealistic.

I was introduced to this fantastic baking spray at my favorite kitchen store so when I saw it here at a bulk discount, I jumped on it.The spray contains flour and eliminates the need to flour my cake pans.  I have several Nordic Ware cast aluminum bundt and loaf pans which have intricate designs.  A light spray (over the sink, there's overspray) and then add batter and tap lightly on the countertop to get down in all the grooves and crevices and eliminate air bubbles.  After baking, I let cool ten minutes on a rack, then invert pan and the cake/loaf slips right out.Easy to clean, just warm soapy soponge.  It never leaves a sticky residue or build up.  Once you've baked with Bak-Klene, you'll never use the grocery store spray again.  I wouldn't dream of baking without it.

I've owned several reading glasses in recent years as my once 20/20 vision ages.  I like these reading glasses so much, I've returned to this listing several times to reorder additional pairs so I'm never without.  There are no distortion spots like some reading glasses have . . .so full vision no matter where I'm looking.  I can easily see over them when looking across the room . . .and the clear ones virtually disappear on my face.  I love how lightweight they feel on the bridge of my nose and the flexible, over the ear frames return to their original shape so are never bent out of kilter.  The only downside about the last feature would be for people with asymmetric ear placement, as they can't be bent to fit.

I own several pairs of Ugg boots, these aren't the most comfortable.  The shearling lining is cropped short and left unbrushed, so feels like it's lined with low pile carpet.  The strap across the top that buckles at the ankle, is an uncomfortable ridge that digs into my ankle after several hours of wearing.  Lastly, my heels slip around because the heel isn't as fitted as the toe box.  Wearing thick socks helps the heel fit better, but causes my toes to fit too snugly, so a catch 22.  The length, however, is spot on.  They're cute boots, and the fit isn't bad enough to cause me to return, but they won't be the boots I most often reach for this season.On a good note, they are very warm.

Received my calendar today . . .it's lovely.  My only disappointment was the lack of even one chocolate pigmented Havanese, but alas, they're rare so I'll hope to see one next year.  The photos feature REAL Havanese, not just the perfectly coifed.  And there's plenty of room for writing events, etc . . .perfect for my home office.

I absolutely love this bottle! The tapered shape makes it easy to hold on to, and less likely to tip over when jostled. The top is also easy to hold on to, and features an easy to use straw. I've actually been looking for a bottle with a straw, and not found any that really meet my needs. This is easy to use, and easy to clean as well. Plus, I love the color! It's an energetic, and refreshing color.I received this bottle at a discount, to test and review. So far, it's my favorite straw style bottle. It's lightweight, and easily portable. I take it to work every night, and Ive not had any issues with leaking or discoloration yet!

I like these headphones, but I dont love them... They fit well, and are relatively comfortable. However , I find that they don't stay in place so well. I am constantly having to adjust them, or put them back in place. That's really the only issue that I have with them... Unfortunately, that's a deal breaker for me.The overall quality of the headphones is quite nice. They look great, and offer superb sound quality. They're easy to use, and work with just about any device. They're also pretty durable, and built to last.I received a complimentary set to test and review, and if you have small ear canals (like I do), I wouldn't recommend them. For anyone who regularly uses these style of headphones, or ear buds, and like the fit... These would be a great choice!

Thse rings are absolutely gorgeous!Unless you examine them closely, you'd never know that they're not super expensive, jewellery store items. The stones are perfectly placed, and beautifully cut. They're clear, and sparkle like real diamonds. The gold overlay is flawless, and completes the high quality, expensive look of the set.Since this is a bridal set, it includes both, the engagement and wedding band. The engagement ring is a 3 stone ring, flanked by smaller decorative stones. The wedding band matches perfectly, and is an eternity style ring. All of the stones are round cut, and channel set. Except for the 3 larger stones on the engagement ring. Those are in 4 prong settings.The overall look of this set is flawless, and beautiful. It seriously looks like the much more expensive sets that are available in boutiques, and fine jewellery stores. I received this set complimentary, to test and review. My own wedding band is very similar to the wedding band in this set. Except, mine has princess cut diamonds. However, when I pair the engagement ring from this set with my wedding band, it still looks beautiful. And, you can't tell that the engagement ring isn't real diamonds! This is definitely a high quality set, and well worth the small price tag that accompanies it. Plus, it's 18k white gold overlay, so your fingers won't turn green! No one will know it's not a $20,000 set, unless you tell them!

Holy smoke --- this frying pan is AWESOME! It's large enough to fry up just about anything. Plus, it's ridiculously high quality. The materials are exceptional, and allow for even heat distribution. This is great, because you don't have to worry about burnt edges, and cool centers. The heat is evenly distributed, for consistent cooking across the whole pan.It's also non-stick, and not chemically treated. So, you don't have to worry about chemicals leaching into your food! Clean up is super easy, just DONT put it in the dishwasher! That's a HUGE no no for any non-stick pan, as it ruins the finish, and reduces effectiveness of the non-stick components. Hand wash this pan--- it's takes just a few minutes, and ensures it will last a long time!I received a complimentary Green Earth frying pan, to test and review. Im used to using similar pans on a regular basis, but mine are much more expensive. This pan performs just as well, if not better than my Cuisinart pans! It's a great frying pan, and an amazing value!

If You have thick thighs, this may not be the best option. Unfortunately, it's one size from top to bottom. The material does stretch, but it wasn't made with heavy or full figured people in mind. So, the thigh portion tends to roll, and can become uncomfortable.From the knee down, it's awesome! The materialis thin enough to breathe, but still provide support. The copper helps to alleviate aches and pains. Since it is snug, it also helps to move fluid, and reduces swelling.Had this been designed a bit differently, it would certainly deserve all 5 stars! I received a complimentary piece, to test and review. I sincerely wish it were made to accomodate larger thighs, as I could really use it!

Anyone who regularly suffers from a sore, tired, aching, or worn out back, has got to try this! It's fully adjustable, and fits a variety of sizes. Most importantly, it provides comfort, support, and relief.It's easy to use, and really does make a difference! Plus, it includes a removable hot/ cold pack. It's durable and 100% reusable, even the hot/ cold pack. You can use the brace on its own, to provide support. Or, use the pack to help heat or cool sore muscles.My husband has a fused spine, that pains him all of the time. His nerves and muscles are a mess, and we've looked everywhere for relief. This is the only thing (other than surgery) that has made a difference. It's well worth the investment!I received this item as a promotional sample, to test and review. I highly recommend it, and suggest fully taking advantage of the included hot/ cold pack. It won't perform miracles, but it sure does help to ease the aches and pains!

This is a lot of fun!It's curved just right, to offer g-spot stimulation. It also includes clitoral stimulation, through a vibrating prong that protrudes at the base of the vibrator. The combination of these 2 is magnificent!My only complaint is that it requires batteries.... However, that's not much of a complaint now, is it? I received this item complimentary, to test and review. I quite enjoy it, and highly recommend it!

This capo is awesome!  It works well, and doesn't slide at all. It's durable, and well made too. It's simple, and easy to use. Which, is super important to me, because its being used for a child (beginner). Plus, it is a really cool shade of green!I received this capo complimentary, to test and review. It's perfect for beginners and children, and not at all complicated.

Thisnis a great recorder. It's easily portable, and has tons of audio storage. The buttons are large enough to accomodate just about anyone's hands, and its quite easy to use.The sound quality is superb as well. So far, ive had no issues with this recorder, and I use it daily!I received this item complimentary, to test and review. It's worked perfectly for my day to day use, and I highly recommend it.

This is a great portable tens unit. It's slim enough to put in your pocket, but offers as much stimulation as larger units. It comes with 2 sets of pads, and features dual stimulation controls. It also has quite a few settings for strength and pulse. This helps tremendously, as the different variations help to work muscles in different ways.I received this item complimentary, to test and review. It's proven to be quite handy, and I often find myself taking it on my travels. It's helped greatly with my tension headaches as well, as it's loosened the troublesome muscles in my back & shoulders.

This mouse is seriously awesome!  The only thing that would make it better, is if it were wireless! It's comfortable to use, and relatively ergonomic. The buttons are positioned perfectly, even my small hands fit and reach without issue. It's easily customizable, and made for large platform games.The overall visual appeal is also quite nice. It's dark, and features multiple LED lit patches and bands. These are also customizable!  You can choose the color of the LED lighting!I received this item complimentary, to test and review.  So far, it's exceeded my expectations. Infactit's given my Logitech gaming mouse a real run for the money!  I find myself using this more often, as it's faster and more comfortable in my hand. The lighting is an added bonus, but it does add to the overall appeal... It's nice to be able to have a different color without purchasing a new mouse each time!

Ibe been looking for a bright lanyard, to put my work badge on. Lately, I've been misplacing it, and have hoped that a bright color will help me to keep track of it.  These lanyards come in a pack of 10, and feature so many colors!  The colors are bright and vivid, and look great (even with dress clothes)! They also have decent clips attached, and easily open & close to accommodate any pre-punched badge  (or holder). They're slightly shorter than I like, and the overall quality is fair. Theyre definitely worth purchasing if you're looking for a cost effective pack of lanyards.I received this set complimentary, to test and review. I've been using them about 2 weeks now, and had no issues with them. Had they been longer & higher quality, I would have given them 5/5 stars. However, given those circumstances, they would also be much higher priced!

Aside from being junior fit (which is stated on the product listing), these scrub pants are pretty darn awesome... I had high hopes that I could manage a junior fit, but after 2 kids, it's not happening. If you're large or curvy, I suggest finding a women's I plus size scrub set. These will be too small!The material is very nice, and is great quality. It's super soft, and washes easily. So far, these haven't faded or run uncontrollably!  The fit is quite nice, and is very similar to wearing a pair of jeans. This makes them very comfortable, and easy to relax in.I received these complimentary, to test and review. While I was unable to fit them, my step daughter was able to make good use of them. She assures me they are the most comfortable scrub pants shes ever owned!

I LOVE this speaker!  Its Bluetooth ready, and easily pairs with any device. It also features standard audio hookups, so you can use your iPod or portable CD player with it as well. It's super easy to use, and works well for phone or music use. Plus, it looks really nice. The sleek, compact design, is extremely appealing!As for sound, this is definitely on par with other leading brands. It has a wide volume range, and the treble and bass are perfectly set for any genre of music.I received this speaker complimentary, to test and review. I'm a huge fan of portable speakers. My family and I spend a great deal of time outdoors, and are pool/beach bums in the summer. This speaker is killer for beach days, and we have really enjoyed taking it camping as well!

Maybe i received a bunk unit, but this charger doesnt work at all! Its well made, and looks great...  Had it actually worked, I would be thrilled to own it. However, I have so far been unable to successfully use this item.I've followed the directions, and I can get it to recognize my phone battery. I can even get it to light up when my phone on it. However, i have toslide my phone around, and tilt it just so, in order for it to "work". Then, I leave it along for 15 minutes... When I check on the status of the charge, my phone has actually drained a few more % of the original charge. This means that either the charger is NOT charging my phone.... Or, it's draining it while it charges? Either way, it's not the desired effect.I received this item complimentary, to test and review. Unfortunately, my experience is not a good one. I do hope others have an easier time with this device. For me, it's a total loss.Phone: Samsung Galaxy Grand Prime.

The overall quality of this leash is amazing. It's tightly woven, and extremely durable. The collar clip is sturdy, and built to last.  The hand holds are large enough to accommodate all sizes, and are sewn tightly --- to prevent tearing.The leash is quite short, which is is my only complaint. I'm a tall person, so it made walking my dog a little difficult. It is, however, perfect for training. The shortness of the leash for the dog to stay by your side as you walk. The dual hand holds provide better control over the dogs actions as it moves. Unlike single handled  leashes, this prompts the human to be in control, and promotes a health owner (alpha)/ pet relationship.I received this leash as a sample product, to test and review. I was thoroughly impressed with the quality of materials that it made of. I was not a fan of the length, thus my 4/5 star rating. I would live to see this offered in varying lengths. That would be awesome, and definitely appealing to those of us who are above or below average height.

For the price, this is a really nice phone case.  It provides a decent amount of protection against drop/bump/fall damage.  It does include a screen protector, and cleaning cloth ---- as well as a really nice stylus.The case itself is plastic, with rubber detailing. This helps to absorb shock from any type of impact. On the back is a fold out kick stand. This is great for setting your phone up to do Skype or Netflix! It makes it hands free & convenient!I received this case complimentary. It was provided as a sample item, for testing and review purposes.  It's a quite nice case, and I like how well it protects my phone. The extras are always a nice touch; screen protector, cleaning cloth, stylus, & kickstand. For the offered price range, this case provides an amazing amount of value!

If you love to listen to music in the shower, this is the perfect speaker for you... Its durable, and quite water resistant. I don't recommend submerging it, as I've not tried...  But, I don't imagine it would be a good idea!It has good sound quality, and has decent volume for a small speaker. It also has a handle attached, which is nice if you choose to hang it in the shower or on a hook outside of the shower.I received this item complimentary, to test and review. I really like the size and overall durability. The sound is a bonus. I don't listen to music too loud, but my husband does. He insists that this is awesome for loud music while showering...  I'll take his word for it!

Im all for using renewable energy sources. Frostfire has taken the initiative and produced some seriously awesome solar powered products. One being this spot light. It works just as well as any other spot light, but it's not hardwired to the home. You can put it where be you want, and it didn't use electricity.... So, as long as there's sunshine, you'll have a working light!It's easy to install, and all parts are included in the box. The solar panel is quick and efficient. Plus, the light is super bright! I received this item complimentary, to test and review.  Im beyond thrilled with the quality and durability of this light. The fact that it's rechargeable and costs me $0.00 to run---- Thats a blessing on its own!

I really dig the look of this shower head. It's modern, and classy. It also has a bit of personality, that lends to the overall appeal of my bathroom. There's a thick, translucent, pale green plastic ring around the showerhead. It makes showering soothing, and brings some color into the room. It's not at all tacky, or obtuse. In fact, its so light, it's more of a tinted clear than a green!The shower experience itself is nothing short of heavenly. The spray is light and refreshing. It's a true rainfall head, and feels amazing! I received a complimentary shower head, for review purposes. I've grown fond of the color and the overall appeal of this shower head. It's different, but very modern and beautiful.

These bath bombs are massive... But, they're also magnificent! They smell amazing, and really help to relieve stress, aches & pains, and to generally sooth and calm. I love to use them after a long night at work.  Working in an airport, I am constantly moving, and when I get home my whole body aches. I draw a nice hot bath and settle in with a bath bomb for an hour or 2. It's so relaxing, and I feel my aches melt away.I received these bath bombs at a reduced cost, to test and review. Im beyond impressed with them. They're extremely well made, and you can tell the ingredients are high quality. I highly recommend these bath bombs, they really do work. Plus, they would make an excellent gift too!

This is a compression shirt, so it is supposed to fit somewhat small... That being said, this runs a tad smaller than usual, so I do recommend ordering a size larger. Especially if you're a bigger person. It is well made, and worth checking out--- if you do a lot of physical training, endurance running, etc. It works well to increase blood flow, and move fluids. Plus, it is super comfortable, and dries quickly.I received this shirt as a sample product, to test and review. It's been a great addition on my longbike rides. I especially like that it breathes better than other brands, and cools as it dries.

Sometimes you just want to take a refreshing shower...  what better way, than to feel the entire spray? Like standing in a summer rain storm... This shower head is heavenly!  It's large, and produces the ultimate rainfall effect. You can feel the rain on every inch of your skin. It's relaxing!The quality of this shower head is also quite nice. In fact, aside from high end, pricey models, this is one of my absolute favorite. It's simple to install, and the plumbing tape is included in the box. I do recommend an extender arm, as it's size could complicate things...I received this shower head as a sample item to test and review. I absolutely love how well it works, and will be purchasing a second for my other bathroom!

I am a huge fan of selfie sticks. They're a great way to take group photos, especially when no one is around to hold the camera! This particular selfie stick is quite durable, and works as well as expected. It's easy to use, and I love that it has a wrist strap.I received this item as a complimentary product, to test and review. Its been quite useful on my family vacation, and made taking family photos so much easier!

I LOVE this cooling mat!  It's very lightweight, and easily portable. I travel a lot, so the fact that I can easily put it in my laptop bag (with my laptop), is a BIG deal!  It also has some serious "curb appeal". The design is sleek, and I really like the backlit fans.It's also easy to use. Just plug it into your laptop via USB, and you're all set. As for performance, it's comparable to other more expensive name brands. It moves a good deal of air, and works well to quickly and efficiently cool your laptop.I received this item complimentary, to test and review. It's the first cooling mat that I've used that fits multiple sizes of laptops (without looking ridiculous), and still works as well as it should. I definitely reccomend this product, as it's been extremely useful for me on my travels.

These hanging solar lights are re all neat, and the match perfectly with the Frostfire Globeace floor & table solar lights. They're unique, and durable. Plus, they add a very modern look to any atmosphere. I currently have mine hanging from a shepherd's hook, in my poolside garden. The matching floor light is beside my pool steps.These lights are plastic, and are prestrung and ready to hang. They even include a metal hook, so tou wont necessarily need to ourchase anything additional. On top is the solar cell. It charges efficiently, and quickly. Once the sun goes down, the light comes on, and it's bright---- but not so bright it could fully light a room. It's an ambient, white light, and looks great in gardens or on patios.I received mine complimentary, for testing & review purposes. I like it quite well, but I'm not sure the globe shape is quite right for my needs. It's very modern, and I'm aiming for a more classic look. I do recommend these lights, they work well, and look great!

I really enjoy how unique these solar lights look. They're quite durable, and their round shape is very unique. I have them on my patio, beside my pool steps, and they definitely add character to my bland setup.These lights are plastic, and include a base. They also include an attachable cord, to convert them into hanging lights if that's what you like. On top is the solar cell. It charges efficiently, and quickly. Once the sun goes down, the light comes on, and it's bright---- but not so bright it could fully light a room. It's an ambient, white light, and looks great in gardens or on patios.I received mine complimentary, for testing & review purposes. I like it quite well, but I'm not sure the globe shape is quite right for my needs. It's very modern, and I'm aiming for a more classic look. I do recommend these lights, they work well, and look great!

Im not a huge fan of the hanging drop cone lights, but these postcone lights are awesome! They give walkways and flower beds some much needed shape and modern beauty. You can literally put these anywhere, and still achieve a super classy look.They're easy to use, and set up is ridiculously simple. Plus, they're completely wireless. No electricity necessary!
