First - very cute packaging, simple and modern label (little thing but always tend to prefer these since they sit out on our counter :) Bottle top is secure too which is not always the case with oils - some don't screw on tightly and others barely fit and two have even popped off.The scent is a combination of some great ones - (Peppermint, Rosemary, Lemon, Eucalyptus) and as for it's title claim to improve breathing and congestion, well I'm not sure it would actually monumentally change or fix some issues but if you have a cold or a little bit of stuffiness, these kinds of oils DO help to some degree. (Kind of like the idea of a vicks inhaler.) I use this with a nei pot and do feel a lot more clear and refreshed after both so that is combo that may help people too.I do prefer some of the softer and fruitier / floral scents like lavender, orange but this is definitely not bad or too medicinal, just not my favorite - but it's for a specific purpose and not really meant for "decor" as some of the other ones are...Overall a cute bottle/label and helps to some degree - use with a neti pot for maximum effectiveness!Please note: Received at a discount in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are 100% my own.

Very impressed with this padfolio - at only $15 it feels and looks like a much more expensive item!Very nicely made cover and stitching is tight and perfect. Even and feels like it will last even with daily use over a long period of time. Not at all flimsy, it has a nice layer of material on the outside which we LOVE - professional but modern and more fun than something plain or dull. Goes with all outfits too so that is a huge plus ;)This is a perfect size - you can fit a nice amount of stuff inside along with the included pad, but it's not thick or bulky. I would still call it slim but we do have a nice stack of papers in and it isn't bulging or overstuffed at all. The spine is tight and I'm sure once it gets broken in will accomoate more but it really is made so well that you don't have to worry about it wearing out anytime soonReally happy with this purchase, at $15 its a steal and great for both professional and personal use!

The good :  Nice combination between a good amount of prrotection but not being too bulky - it's thinner than Otterboxes for example, but thicker than most average ones that are just a flat layer. Corners have good protection, and the front top is covered left to right which does add to the protection of the screen. Cutouts are accurate and the fit is good - it is not going to move around at all.The bad: The inside is a hard plastic (with the design) and not tpu/softer material like I had expected - little dissapointing as that softness is what helps with drops. I do think for any rugged case there should be a layer of hard and a layer of soft though for maximum shock protection.Also, the screen protector popped out the first few days - you can kind of push it back on and then insert the phone but dissapointing that happened - the glue they use must not be strong enough.Overall not a bad case, but a few flaws that could be fixed pretty easiliy (tpu inner, stronger protector attachment to case)Please note: Received at a discount in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are 100% my own.

LOVE this candle! We try tons of soy candles all the time and were very pleasantly suprised that this made it to the top of the list!All soy is clean burning and just has a more fresh, natural feel - great benefits over regular ones. However, some soy ones can tend to be a bit bland and just not give you that amount of smell you want - noticeable but not overpowering (a bit more than just a hint.) This one (we have the Ocean one) REALLY does - you notice it in all our rooms bordering where it is, and when you're next to it it's strong but not too much or to the point where it hurts your eyes etc. If you prefer a more subtle scent just put it one room away. The ocean is a clean, natural, truly ocean-y scent and does NOT smell at all chemical laden or fake. We love things like clean linen, egyptian cotton and this is right up our alley - both love it.Cute little tin althogh it does get hot so it's not so easy to move if it's been on for a while. We put it on a little plate or use gloves. Burning time is great and it has not tunneled at all! Really a nice punch for a little candle.At just under $15 it is worth it - similar sized soy candles range from around $7 to $20 depending on brand etc and this really is at the upper level of this range. It can get expensive though if you have a larger home or use them a lot.  Would love a sampler pack where you could choose 3 or 4 scents and get a discount the more you get - hopefully the company is reading this and takes that into consideration :)Please note: Received at no cost in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are 100% my own.

This is a weighty, substantial grinder. It looks and feels much more expensive than it is! We were pleasantly suprised when it arrived and we took it out of the box - the gray is a great gunmetal like color with a nice smooth finish and looks great! Parts fit together perfectly and it feels good in your hand with a nice bit of weight but not overly heavy. This is definitely not a cheap unit.Movement/function is smooth and works well without much effort - easy to clean and easy to work with lots of whatever you need to grind. The only down side (and this might be more a personal preference depending on hand size) is that for us, the top is a little thing and smooth with not much of a grip. If it could be made a slight bit thicker and have grippy things on the outside or some kind of indented design, this would help with use and holding this part. Other than that though, zero complaints- really like the look and feel of this and it will definitely last with careful use and cleaning.Price of $15 right now is right on - better than most out there at this price range in our opinion. The company is also very responsive.Please note: Received at no cost in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are 100% my own.

We were really unhappy with this set, unfortunately. Had to buy sight unseen and wish we would have chose something else :(The good: Priced well fora 3 piece kit, and do like the heart shape of the larger piece.The bad: Quality is TERRIBLE, and we got two kits. The smaller ones were totally different from each other! Some were very thin, others 4 times as thick, completely not matching - the weirdest thing ever. The main piece had marks, chips, scuffs, imperfections, didn't look clear / fresh like the photos, just looked almost old/dusty. Both sets were like this. There were 2 actual lines within the glass, not anything done during shipping either.We were able to hide the imperfections with the sand and cleaned them up as best we could, but it just wasn't as nice as I had hoped. Would have paid more if I knew, honestly. I've never seen glass in such bad shape - even buying a few pieces at your local discount store would be better, honestly!The lack of top was ok, we just filled it with about 2-3 inches left at the top and melted wax / poured it in.Hopefully this company will improve the quality of their glass as the shape is nice and price is good.

We both think $49 is a fair price for this hammock - it's a solid product, well made, looks nice and has a good weight capacity.Definitely need multiple people to put it up but that is common with many of these. The biggest plus of this is the 400lb weight capacity - we didn't test the limit really but it did feel EXTREMELY solid and well made, and with the right installation and no abuse we think this will do it's job well up to the max. It feels nicely made, stitching even and solid, and is pretty compact in it's pouch. Perfect for travel, beach, camping, anything really. And we both LOVE the colors :)Another big plus is that due to the lightweight material (but not flimsy) it dries quickly and cleans up well. Will update after a bunch more uses to see how it holds up down the line. So far, so good though!Please note: Received at a discount in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are 100% my own.

While we did not end up keepting this (our magnet mount did not work - case too thick even for 2 magnets) it's a great case for those who don't mind bulk! They do note the weight that this will ad in the listing and their honesty is greatly appreciated - we knew what to expect but wanted to give it a try with some magents anyway, hoping the weight wouldn't be too much - sadly, it was.It's not a snap on easy case - you use the included tool and work with the little screws. However once in, it's not going anywhere. The case is LARGE and does add bulk and weight, but it feels and looks to be very high level / rugged protection - this is along the lines of the other rugged cases like Defender, etc. I would say it even has a bit more bulk and thickness and some metal parts which many of the others do not. Fit is good and with a little bit of work getting it on and off it adds a very good barrier between the elements and drops etc.If you want high level protection and don't mind the weight/size, this is a great alternative to some of the very expensive rugged cases out there.  $15 is a steal for these kinds of "heavy duty" cases and it honestly does feel along the same lines quality wise. Just be advised - it's a beast :)Please note: Received at no cost in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are 100% my own.

Really happy with this case - and we have tried dozens!This one was for a family member who wanted something more than just a layer of tpu/silicone, but hates anything bulky and is pretty careful/not clumsy so didn't need any crazy rugged protection. This is NOT going to protect from water, lots of dirt/dust, or constant hard drops, but it does provide a nice, sturdy layer(s) of protection against minor/medium type drops and marks, scratches, some dust etc. It is a great compromise - not too thin, not too thick, gives a slight bit of heft but really would still be considered a smaller sized case.Nice to have a more matte finish than some of the glossy ones that show tons of marks immediately. Will update after a month or two to see how that is holding up, but I expect it will look a lot better than any shiny ones.The fit is great, accurate cut outs and snug but still easy to pop on and off to clean. It goes give a slight bit of a grip on the sides but I would say it's a little on the slick side, however not at all slippery. And again while it's not total protection from the elements as the openings aren't covered and there's the hole on the back, it protects from the average/everyday things - little bit of dust, water, gunk, light drops etc. Which is what most people need IMO.All in all a great product that gives a bit of protection without being huge or cumbersome. Nice fit and look, and the warranty is solid.Please note: Received at no cost in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are 100% my own.

I received everything intact - I had read some reviews that noted some of the pieces were broken, but I did not have any problems with my set. Of course, inspect all items when you get them to make sure they are sturdy with no damage -if one is loose it would cause problems when trying to put on your bed.BIG TIP: YOU NEED TWO PEOPLE TO INSTALL! One to hold the bed up, one to attach. Without a second person you will be beyond frustrated and give up - trust me :)You do kind of have to eyeball where they each go, as far as how far in/out from the edge, but it's easy to redo if it's not right. Don't put too much material in each clip, but make sure it's enough to hold - again, easy to adjust. The clips seem pretty strong and none have pulled out on us yet. Note - it will not drastically change a horribly fitting sheet to a perfect fit, nor change a type of sheet to a different type - this is best for the general need of preventing slipping or making slightly high sheets a bit more fitted.We have a 14.5 height with our mattress, topper and pad - and our sheets fit up to 18 depth so we have some extra material as well as bit of slipping. For this purpose these work very well - make it a nicer fit, and help things from moving around about 75%. With a little bit of work on install and a helper it really is a good product and design - we are happy with them!Please note: Received at a discount in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are 100% my own.

After a few issues with our tires I decided to start using one of these little gadgets to try and check pressure regularly. This is really very handy and so far has been spot on - very easy to use, led easy to read/lcd, and as accurate as you are going to get with small hand held unit in this price range (which is really not any less than more expensive ones my more than a teeny bit.)BEST feature is that it glows - easy to use at any time and/or in spots where there is limited light. It's also pretty compact and light - easy to throw in the GC or a door or back seat pocket/holder and does not take up much space. Liek the orange so you don't lose it in the sea of black tools and equipment many of us have :)Also appreciate that it does not kill batteries due to the auto off feature - otherwise it could run through them quickly.Please note: Received at no cost in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are 100% my own.

This a cute little compact humidifier/diffuser that really looks like a tiny rice cooker :) It's simple and compact which is just what we wanted. This would be ideal in a kitchen, small bedroom or at a desk. It's a smaller unit so not overly powerful and doesn't hold a huge amount of water but for light use in smaller areas it's great. We use it more with a few drops of scented oil (vs just as a humidifier) as we like just a bit of scent now and then so it's ideal for just that too.Very simple unit with an easy to twist off top and a cord, you can use an adapter if you prefer a wall charge vs a usb charge (easier in some areas.) Cleans up really well and has had no problems working over the past month - steady stream, no clogging or malfunctions and again, really simple to use.Love the blue LED - modern/sleek looking and adds a very slight glow. BONUS: Great rubber bottom - love anything with this, it won't slide around and will grip on to a glass surface well. Nothing is more annoying when things like this and usb hubs etc start sliding all over the place!Priced at the high end of the reasonable range ($18) - however you are paying more for anything compact and with an LED. This isn't a cheap item at all, so worth a few extra bucks over some of the others. We travel with it too and it's light enough to not add weight or bulk to your bagPlease note: I received this at no cost in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are 100% my own :)

As a few other people mentioned, the fit is kind of weird. If you are on the thin / lanky side they will work best (or if you like a straighter fit.) I would NOT call these relaxed - they aren't skinny jeans but the cut is just is more straight than expected.Quality is ok - mid/low level decent brand but nothing we would call "best jeans ever." Slightly on the thin side too.  At around $24 they are fairly priced, and won't fall apart like very cheap ones but they just don't seem very comfy/cozy or like they would wash well years down the line into a great pair of worn in jeans. (The only other Lee jeans we tried didn't) Again though, for $24 it's not a bad deal and you aren't really supposed to get years upon years out of $24 jeans IMO.Fit - again, not what you might expect for relaxed unless you're on the thin/lanky side. Bit too little room in the thigh area.Color and look is nice - the very dark wash is great, and they can be dressed up or down.

This is the 4th scent of oil we have tried (we are picky / sensitive to oils but love them!) We tend to go for the sweeter / more subtle ones like lavender, orange etc - citrus is always a fan as it evokes a "clean" feeling even when you have been lazy and your junk is piling up :) I had wanted to try lemon for a while and glad we got this big bottle!SCENT: It is STRONG - that's for sure. I'm not sure about the 3x, 4x, 5x and beyond but this 5x one is - WOAH. Not in a bad way, but something to be aware of. It kind of reminds me of those little round hard lemon candies....good, but - in your face! A little bit definitely goes a long way - which is good - but keep it away from your eyes as they will likely start to sting if you're too close.PRICE/VALUE: At $13 and change for a 4oz concentrated / glass bottle with dropper -it' fairly priced. Of course there are other factors like concentration and purity and brand, but generally this is right on the mark for this amount of a strong lemon oil. As I mentioned, a tiny bit goes a long way, so this will last anyone a very long time.USES: We mainly use this for our diffuser, and a teeny tiny bit on our dryer balls (so good!) but I will be adding it to some natural homemade cleaning solution soon which people rave about. I have put it in plain ice water with lemon wedges (and in tea with a bit of raw honey) and both were SO GOOD - a really quick and cheap way to make water/tea more interesting lol.  I actually did try baking with it once and it was subtle but good - and the scent was great!, although you can definitely use too much so use a TEENY TEENY BIT for this.  I did some research on the health benefits and came up with an amazing list, so will try to incorporate it into foods going forward...Helps lower cholesterolCleansing and purificationOral health and remedy for halitosis (bad breath)DigestionThirst quencherRemedy for abdominal colic painCough reliefCalms stomach and relieves nauseaPrevents malabsorptionImproves digestionNourishes the skinPromotes Weight lossNow of course, I'm not a Dr but if these things are even a LITTLE bit helped - yay! With all the junk out there I'd much rather use lemon oil in place of something else where possible. I also pulled up some common uses which hopefully can be helpful to someone:Laundry – If  you leave your laundry sitting in the washer too long, add a few drop and your clothes won’t get that nasty smell.Teeth Whitener – Mix lemon essential oil, baking soda and coconut oil and rub on your teeth for 2 minClean Hands – Just add a couple drops of lemon EO with your soap and get your clean hands back!Natural Disinfectant – 40 drops lemon oil and 20 drops tea tree oil to a 16-oz bottle with pure water (and a bit of white vinegar)Face-wash – You can make lemon oil with baking soda and honey for a natural acne free face wash.Wood and Silver Polish – A lemon oil-soaked cloth helps spruce up your tarnished silver and jewelry!  Use for wood cleaning alsoGoo-Be-Gone – Un-stick the sticky goo your kids leave behind with stickers and gum with lemon oil.Promotes Fat-Loss – Putting 2 drops of lemon oil in your water 3x daily can support metabolism and weight lossImproves Mood – Diffusing lemon essential oil in the air can lift mood and fight depressionImmune Support – Can support lymphatic drainage and help your overcome a cold fast, mix it with coconut oil and rub it on your neck.Again, if even a little improvement in these areas is achieved it's a great thing to include! I'm glad I looked into all this as I would have just used it for our diffuser and nothing else :) I will update this review with some results of other uses once I try them...Also: It comes with a plastic seal along the tip which is great as the tops of these glass bottles can come loose easily. Not all oils have this so I appreciate when it when they do.Please note: I received this at no cost in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are 100% my own :)

GREAT socks! Look exactly like the photo - deep gray (great as they don't show much dirt ;) and hit just at the right spot at the ankle - not too low, not too high. Fit a mens size 10.5-11 perfectly and could go up or down a number of sizes. LOVE that they are not cotton, really great combo of poly spandex - holds up well, fits nice without being too tight, and wash great. They are medium/thin, so not ideal for heavy work or sports but for general use, walking, some light activity they are perfect.For washing - we use cold water and turn them inside out (do this with all socks.)Got a 6 pack on sale for around $15 which I feel is a steal - Reebok has consistently put out well made, nice looking socks at a low price point that last a lot longer than most similar brands in this range.

This product is ok - nothing amazing but certainly not terrible. First, I think it's 2.5 retinol + hylauraonic acid, not just 2.5 retinol as that would a LOT.! There are some great ingredients but some others that aren't ideal, and it can be drying - so not great for dry skin.It DID prevent breakouts for the month that I used it, and I think can have some slight benefits in terms of smoothness, pores, lines. BUT this (like most things) is not a miracle, and won't fix your skin issues or remove lines/change pore size (nothing can do that.) I'm surprised people are gushing that in 1-2 days things were noticeably different - aside from something like a peel or dermabrasion - most products are not going to show anything in 1-2 days. Also, most people use multiple items at once, so the results could be from the combination or from something else that is stronger. That being said, a retinol serum can certainly be a good thing to use a night and can help improve the appearance of things like pore size and light lines etc.It is a little on the thick side, but the pump is great and 2oz is a very nice size. Maybe slightly on the high side for price at $16 and change.I will stick with my other products, but if you need/want these particular ingredients and don't have dry skin, it may work for you.Please note: I received this at no cost in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are 100% my own :)

The main benefits of glass over standard protectors (gummy types, wet application or the light plastic ones:No coming up at the edges or near the home buttonNo marks and dents and scratchesCrystal clear view - truly.Very resistant to dirt and general wearThe down side is that the glass does crack and chip somewhat frequently (all, not just this one) if you drop it, even lightly. Not every time, but you will be replacing them somewhat regularly depending on how clumsy you are :)TOUCH: Perfect - zero problems using the screen, buttons, everythingCUTOUTS: Perfect - with a little work you can line it up very accurately and everything fits exactly how it should. Yes, most are cut thinner due to the curved screen - the phone's fault, not the protectorsDURABILITY: Holds up to wear and looks great from day to day - until it cracks or chips which depends on use but does happen more than with other materials. However, while in use it looks great!At this cheap (around $4.50 each) you can afford a few backups - they all come with the standard wipes and stickers so you will have enough to go around. Just go slow when applying, do the top first and once that's lined up and dropped down at the edge, line up the bottom near the home button, then push to adhere. Be gentle with a light hand before you confirm both sides are accurate and DONT pull it up once it's sealed, you will likely mess it up completely.Please note: I received this at no cost in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are 100% my own :)

Wonderful little diffuser! This is our fifth one and I love it for a lot of reasons:1. The wood "look" is not overly fake or tacky like many others - yes, its not a solid hardwood and you won't really fool anyone that it is but it's surprisingly nice nevertheless. I'm someone who HATES "looks" like laminate fake wood floors etc and so to actually not mind this is saying a lot!2. It is nice and compact but not tiny. Fits in your bag to travel easily, perfect for a desk or a corner of a nightstand, but holds enough so that you won't run out every 20 minutes. Really a great size for smaller rooms, travel, desk areas etc.3. Lightweight, but - YAY - has a great gray rubber bottom to keep it's footing on your surface. This is lacking on so many products and ruins things for me - I can't stand stuff sliding everywhere. It seems like a little thing but it really does make a difference for a lot of stuff!4. SIMPLE! One cord, one top that comes off, simple to load, use, clean and store.5. LED's and light touch functions - modern and cool features that many others are lacking. All work great so far (1 month of consistent use)Priced well at just under $20 for the look, rubber bottom and features plus it feels like a more well made unit than some other diffusers at this price range. As always it is worth a few more bucks to get something that wont fail every other time and need to be replaced after a few months. I expect this will work for a good amount of time and will update if anything changes later. But overall - really cute, simple, well made unit!  I definitely recommend the dark wood color but they all look nice to me :)Please note: I received this at no cost in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are 100% my own :)

I was very surprised to read the reviews below regarding these sheets being scratchy - this was not our experience at all and we are picky :)  We have two sets of these, one is new and one a bit broken in, and both have been exceptionally soft and cozy from day one after a wash - so much so that I mentioned to dh how soft they were compared to all the other (equally priced and of equal brand/quality) sets. I wonder if something changed from 2013/2014 when this first came out - I know the material and makeup is the same but who knows, maybe they had been using some sub par stuff and improved it after complaints or something. I think I read something about the Home line being sold - not sure. . No, it's not the highest end set they offer (up to $4000 for one item - eek!) but retail price for the king set is $180 so it's not what I might call cheap either. We are very happy (although we did grab ours for around $70 on sale, so that might make us a little biased - not sure we would pay $200 after tax retail per set.)In any case, the sets we have we LOVE and feel great to both of us - soft, almost delicate feeling but they are not thin or cheap and wash up extremely well. I suggest washing in cold or at most warm/cold and washing only with some delicates or light clothes, and ALWAYS dry in a low heat. This will help keep the dark colors and texture softest.The colors and pattern are great - a nice plum which is a bit feminine but very dark and no flowers or anything girly, so men won't find it off putting :) It's a subtle neutral pattern which is more interesting than a solid but not loud or offensive, and a great compromise between a him/her if that's what you are looking for! I had a hard time finding something we would both like and this really fit the bill.The other pieces to this set are gorgeous - the ovals in warm plum for the shams, coverlet and the assorted pillows are all really nice, well made and luxurious. It's a beautiful set, truly. We don't have the duvet cover/shams as they were a little floral/girly for dh and we both really liked the all dark of the coverlet/sheets/ovals items.I've attached a close up of the sheet next to an ovals / warm plum textured sham. Hope this helps!

This is the last of 4 LAVO products I have tried over the past month. I've really liked them all - with the exception of price per size which I feel is a bit high, the products have all been great to use and have outperformed most drugstore product I've bought in the recent years.PRODUCT: Nice thick consistency - add a bit of water if it's too thick for you - however I like how it goes on :) It does not smell bad at all, and does not end up with a tight cracked mess like many do. It feels and smells like a good quality combination of ingredients - nothing irritated me and I did not have any redness.PRICE: The only con. Like some of the other Lavo products, as great as they are / this is -- I do feel it's a bit high for the size. This is not a top/high end product that can command $50-$150 and I feel the msrp of $70 is high. It's definitely better than most drugstore brands but I feel it's more of a $20 range, $30-$40 msrp at most. Which is good - don't get me wrong, but still not in the $50 and up category in my opinion.  Also, I don't know about saying "this mask costs $80 with a spa treatment." - you can't compare an actual facial to any product, totally different things lol. I know it's silly but I'm a stickler for accuracy lol.That all being said - this is a GOOD mask! My skin responds well, it does help with temporarily shrinking pores and with blackheads and the overall texture is improved. It is more gentle than some masks I have tried, similar to most of the mid range more natural ones, and really does utilize some great ingredients. I use it once a week switching between the Queen Helene which I love too - they are similar actually.Please note: I received this at a discount in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are 100% my own :)

Cute little kit! I've attached a few photos below - hope they help: )CASE: The case is nice and compact, protective with a red velvet-ish lining and a little piece of plastic that covers 1/2 to protect each side from rubbing/scraping against each other. It's a faux leather in white with a black zipper- nice colors. :) Probably room for a a few more thin tools too if you have some you need a pouch for.TOOLS:  The tools themselves are all pretty well made and do not feel chintzy - they are not pro or high end tools by any means but at this price they are pretty good! Sturdy and do not bend with normal pressure. The sizes and shapes vary enough that you will have more than you need (usually people use the lance and the smaller size rounds, but they are all pretty useful for different things!) They have stayed new looking - we wash them well each time of course - as has the case. Hopefully with repeated washing down the line they will stay well.A FEW CONS: The lance could be sharper,  the sewing around the case/inside is uneven and the lining inside is a little low quality - nothing huge if you are keeping it and it's reasonable for a $12 price range but this really is NOT suitable for a gift...Overall a great little kit at $12 - lots of tools, cute case, and everything does a good job.Please note: I received this at a discount in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are 100% my own :)

Advil is our life saver! This is a great deal - we always re buy the 200ct bottle, its not too big or small and the price is better than B&M stores. I find generic brands just don't seem to work as well - whether it's a real thing or placebo, who knows, but to us well worth a slight bit extra :) This bottle is a very secure child proof cap (some are flimsy, so figured it was worth mentioning.)All the expiration dates have been very far in advance - 2 + years - just make SURE you buy from Amazon direct - not a third party seller, which could be new old stock. I always check the dates when they come just to be sure but have never had a problem from Amazon stock - always very fresh new bottles.Liqui-Gels are a lot easier to get down - so perfect for anyone who has trouble swallowing pills or who just hates that chalky taste.

This pad is ALMOST perfect! We have been using it for around 3 months now and will definitely be keeping it for as long as it will let us :) We are on pad number # so that is saying a lot lol. But we both really do like this one. Our setup is a 10 inch firm-ish simple memory foam matress as a base (on thick slats.) with a 3 inch 4lb good quality foam topper, then this pad.FIT: So our setup as described as above is 13 inches before the pad - I believe this one fits up to 18 inches or so, and we knew it would be a little large. It is not bad, but if you are less than around 15 or so inches height you will end up with some extra skirt material and the fit will be less snug. The length and width is pretty accurate (maybe a slight bit big but I'm pretty particular and I think it's still a good fit :) So I would say if you are around 14-17 inches thick that is ideal, but you can still use this for something a bit shorter with a few adjustments. We do have to tuck the skirt in and use some of those mattress sheet clips though. The skirt itself is NOT just like a sheet, but it is not that very snug tight elastic you sometimes see in photos of other ones. It is stretchy with some grip, but a very thin material, and while it does stretch, it is not tight or overly snug by any means. Part of this is the material, part of it is to allow for a higher mattress. I wish it was was tighter as that would help with slipping (see below) but it really is a lot better than many skirts that just droop and barely hold on.FEEL: Very soft, luxurious as much as you can get at this price range :) and it's held it's loft very well after all these months. It is cozy but you do not sink in - it kind of envelops you if that makes sense. We have a 4lb topper underneath and a firm mattress under that which provides support, so if your mattress is very soft obviously that would change things.  Hopefully it will maintain loft for a good amount of time, and age well. If course it is always better in the beginning - but I think even if it flattens a bit we will still like it. I do love the bamboo finish/texture, while it's not all 100% natural it is a nice compromise - some good stuff like bamboo mixed in, but without a $300 price tag. It does not get hot for either of us, which we are both happy about.ONLY CON - for us, is that it does slip around at night. Again, taller mattresses/topper heights will have less of a problem with this, and shorter ones more. We usually have to pull it back into place once daily or every other day - the clips do help somewhat.  We are looking into getting some kind of grippy later or cover to use over our topper and under this pad - kind of like what they use under carpets to keep them from slipping lol :) So - this is really the only con - not sure why all mp makers don't make a very grippy bottom for these...problem would be solved!We paid around $85 for a king and I think it is a great deal at that price. It absolutely feels and looks better than most of the standard/ average ones that are less, and is worth a premium - anything up to $100 or a little over really is a fair price. It is well worth the little extra cost considering it's your bed and your sleep at stake.We had a guest say over one week and her first comment was how comfortable the bed it! I think it was the combo of all the products together but I'm sure the pad had something to do with it!Attached a bunch of photos - I couldn't find a close up of the skit when I was shopping, so included a few and some of the bottom, side, etc.  Hope this helps!

Just about perfect (for us at least!) Needed a quiet, solid unit with a good name for our medium/smallish sized bathroom. Looked at ones from $50 to $200 and ended up somewhere in the middle at this one for a bit over $100. We feel it is very fairly priced - have tried other lesser known brands before and been disappointed. This has been installed in our apt for around 4 months now and it has been working perfectly with zero issues so far.INSTALLATION: Meant to have attic/above ceiling acess but it CAN be done from below, which is how we did it. Depending on your room/space/ceiling and what you have before, it may range from somewhat easy to very difficult. We had nothing there- just a hole - so could assemble it outside and push it back up then secure. Not too bad, but we had just a wide open space to work with - and it did take some fenagling. We did need to cut our ceiling a few inches larger though.LOOK: Looks nice and sleek as the photos show - pretty standard for these, even though its a plastic cover it blends in pretty well. It is a true white, if anyone is wondering (some are a little off.)SOUND: It's quiet - that's for sure. Some people say they can't tell if it's on - maybe it depends on the connection or materials used or something but you can definitely tell ours is on, its just not loud at all. It has kind of grown on us, but I do wonder if it varies from zero to a little bit of sound from person to person. However, I am usually bothered by any noises and this really is so gentle it's nothing that would ever bother anyone (unless you do really need silence.)EFFICIENCY: We have a standard bathroom with tub and a 1 sink vanity, not tiny but not large - and this pulls steam away very well - nothing or only a slight bit on the mirrors if its a very long shower. It works extremely well - nothing more to say on that : )  I'm expecting it to run for many yeras with no problems - fingers crossed!Overall a great deal at $100 - good brand, nice looking and efficient unit that is very soft (or silent for some it seems) I will update this review in a few months and / or if there are any changes.I have attached a few photos of it installed (please excuse the unfinished ceiling lol :) Hope this helps!

We switched from the nasa type thick glossy wet applied protectors to glass protectors about 6 weeks ago. Just tried this Nozza protector recently - most of these are very similar, but the Nozza has a very precise fit and came like most with the appropriate wipes and dust stickers.PRO:  Material does not come up at edges and get gunky. No marks or dents from use. Easier application. Glossy clean look.CON: Most drops face down will crack the glass. Better than it being the phone, but even relatively light drops that wouldn't have harmed the phone do ruin most glass protectors. So it looks GREAT while it's good, but does have to be replaced often.HUGE NOTE: DON'T touch any part of the sticky part or you'll never get it clear again.) Just hold it on the edges, place the top part down first lined correctly, then do the bottom part - its easy to get one side even and the other side slightly off if you try to do them at the same time.I will keep up with the glass ones, even having to replace them often - because they feel great to use, look good, very high gloss but a clear view, and do give another layer of protection that most others don't.ANOTHER TIP: Stock up on a few so you always have a spare!!!!!As long as you are not extremely clumsy or use your phone in high accident prone situations (construction etc.) you should be happy with these.Please note: Received at no cost for testing purposes. All my reviews are 100% honest and unbiased. Thanks :)

These are just what we were looking for - neutral, silver/gray modern looking mats with a nice texture but not annoyingly small holes like our last ones that were IMPOSSIBLE TO CLEAN lol. This is a very cute set of 4 mats, a bit on the smaller side (perfect for us, but check measurements) and have a great modern, chic look -simple with a nice texture and the silver/gray is not too shiny or dull, just right.They have been really easy to clean - just a light wipe with a damp rag and they're like new again. Soft material but does hold up nicely, when you unroll them just roll them up back in the other direction for a minute and they will even out and end up totally flat. They roll up very thin and are really easy to store which is a bonus. I wouldn't put anything extremely hot on them, but we have had a decent amount of hot plates and pyrex dishes (a bit cooled from the oven first) and they have held up well to the moderate heat.They are priced slightly higher than some other sets but I feel they are above average quality and look so worth a few bucks more it in my opinion.Please note: I received a set at no cost in exchange for a fair, unbiased review - all my reviews/thoughts are 100% my own :)

NOTE: YOU MUST TAKE THE PROTECTIVE FILMS off BOTH sides...take your nail and pick along the camera hole at the edge until they come up - sometimes they can really be stuck on there.NOTE #2: The clear and lighter colors WILL DISCOLOR somewhat over time along the edges mostly (yellowing) due to mostly to the oils in your hands. This is the same with all products of this type - nothing to do with this brand. Keep your hands very clean and consistently rub down the case with rubbing alcohol and you will slow it a bit but it's inevitable. I like the smoke / darker colors for this reason but do use a clear one too and to be honest, they are cheap enough to replace 1-2 times a year if the yellowing bothers you...After getting and using these Spigen cases for ourselves we got this one for a friend who has the plus. His experience like ours was GREAT - really enjoying using this case after a number of months and a lot of handling.  For under $13 - Spigen cases by FAR are the best deal you will get, most others are just thin light cheap silicone and do not have this strength, accuracy in cutouts in durability.Even with that - this is a very solid case and as I mentioned the best quality you will get for this price range. There are TONS of flimsy cheap ones that scratch after 3 seconds, others that stretch out and dont offer more than a thin layer of protection. The Spigen cases always seem to go a few steps beyond that for the same or a tiny bit more money. It feels more substantial in your hand without being bulky at all, and that's a huge plus since the iphone 6 and 6 plus are really quite thin and slippery.The company is also very responsive and is good about honoring their warranty. DEFINITELY recommend Spigen cases - we will continue to buy them and give them as gifts etc since we enjoy them so much!

We returned this shirt - the fit was a little strange (didn't hang right for some reasons, the ends of the sleeves kind of went out, and the neck was a little high) The color was nice but it was just not so comfortable and didn't look right. Not a bad shirt if it fits you right and the colors work for you, certainly a great deal at $13 or so but I think there are better henleys around. At the $15-$25 price range.We ended up with the GH Bass short sleeved sueded henley and love that one - softer, hangs nicer, better fit overall at the same price :)

DH loves these flip flops. At first he said they felt a bit stiff and not so comfy on the top of his foot but after they break in a bit (and you can actually sand down any rough spots with a magic eraser lol!) they are now great and the foam squishy foot bed is expecially comfortable. Really versatile - around the house, to the beach, even for a casual lunch -they are not like dollar store or ON ones that are a few bucks. Really nice look - we got the green with orange accents - and they go with everything. Very well made, sturdy rubber/good shape.They fit him a slight bit small, is normally a 10.5-11 and he has the 10, which fits right to the end - if you want a larger fit order a normal size and you should be okay.We got these for a great price - around $13.00 which seems to be on the very low end (now around $15-$30 depending on size and color.) Well worth it at $25 or below in our opinion and the company is good about warranty replacements for the first year if you need one. Definitely recommend these.

We have been buying the Wyoming cargo for years - probably 25 pairs at this point in 5 different colors! DH loves them and wears them almost every day to work. For $22 (sale) to around $28 (full price) these are a STEAL! They have all held up amazingly well in rough and tough environments with dirt, sand, liquid, oil, pulling/pushing/lots of movement and anything else.The black, dark brown, medium blue and camo ones are great neutrals that go with anything, and dark enough that it hides most stains pretty welll! The pockets are large but not overwhelming and placed very well - no weird bulges or anything :)Sizing is very accurate - a nice loose, relaxed fit and will hit a little longer for those under around 5'8 but the length is really ideal - long enough to have full coverage but not too long that it droops on shorter people! Of course this all depends on your height but 5'6-5'11 or so should really find the length to work. We wash these inside out and take them out slightly before they are totally dry and they have held up very well. Only one hole in one pair after a year of tons of use which is great - most brands in this price range would not last that longDefinitely recommend these - we will keep re buying as needed for sure!

We bought a bottle of this for the summer since we're in a really warm climate with really high humidity - not the best weather for your skin! It definitely feels more "treatment" focused than some normal otc soaps - less of a strong scent, is not harsh but it did dry our skin out from time to time when we used a little more product than usual (but not a crazy amount.) Salicylic acid is not for everyone!  It is not organic or 100% pure/natural by any means - it does have a sudsing agent -- but it does include some helpful ingredients and omits some other fillers that don't do anything good.It is a bit thin and the bottle is on the small side for around $5 at 10 ounces, but these ingredients are generally a little more expensive so its still within the range of average pricing for "treatment" soaps. However because it's so thin it's easy to pour out too much when dispensing.  It will not clear up every single thing on all people's bodies but it definitely helps in many cases with any bumps/marks/rashes etc that can be helped by  SA. If that is the ingredient you need this is a good choice, but not strong enough to actually cure/fix anything moderate or severe.

Extremely well made jeans, feels a lot more expensive than the $24.00 we paid! Nice rich dark color, slightly relaxed fit (but definitely not loose) and stitching is very even. The cut is extremely flattering and these can be dressed up or down for most occasions - the dark wash can be for day or night (we got the darkest blue which is ideal as it goes with everything and never looks to casual)I would say these run very slightly small but not enough to size up, unless you are in the middle of two sizes or really like a looser fit. The only note I would make is that we've gotten a number of the same style and for some reason they don't all fit exactly the same - strange but not unheard of with pants. Easy to replace/repurchase but just wanted to mention :) DKNY jeans have consistently been great and have lasted through tons of use and washings, so I expect this ones will do the same. A great tip is to wash darker jeans inside out so the color stays longer (and in cold water!)

We had been looking to try a tea like this for a while after reading some other reviews and product listings.  While we both thought the taste was pleasant, we didn't love this overall and won't be buying going forward.First - it says 14 days, however, the two of us have been drinking it daily for the last 3 days and it's nearly done. It really has about a weeks worth of product maximum. This would be ok if it was listed as a 7 day / 1 week package. I noticed some other people saying the same thing so I know we aren't just using too much. At $25, one week is just not enough. If it was a full 2 weeks that would be priced right.We haven't had any negative affects or anything but this just does ZERO for both of us. Not really much else to say. We would have happily tried this for the second week but there isn't enough product....Of course everyone will react to anything ingested differently and all experiences will be different but this just fell flat for us - would probably not recommend for the reasons above, and might try something from a known brand or at least with a larger amount to allow use for the full 2 weeks.Please note: This product was received at a discount for testing purposes. This review is 100% honest and unbiased. Thanks :)UPDATE on August 18: A few people contacted me to let me know about an apparent "down vote campaign" this morning  - I came on and was amazed to see just overnight ELEVEN more down votes, as well as similar numbers additionally on many other 1 and 2 star reviews. That this happens is quite unfortunate and hopefully sellers will see this actually hurts them too, and is not constructive for anyone. Buyers count on people leaving very honest reviews, good or bad, and look to see how issues are handled as well.First, any criticism is a GREAT opportunity to do two things - first, improve the product - isn't that what we would all ultimately want? If you love and care about what you sell, this is a great thing! Very honest people telling you how to make things better! It's a wonderful chance to improve things and possibly even change some people's minds :)Second, these large numbers of votes makes it painfully obvious to old and potential customers what is going on - it is a huge deterrent. People want to be able to be honest, good or bad and not be fearful of this happening. To reply with a friendly note asking how things can be made better and maybe an email to reach out to is GREAT customer service and shows potential buyers you really stand behind the product- encouraging them to buy. Just tons of down votes and even some harsh comments really gives out the wrong impression, sadly.I know not all people who leave low marks do it nicely, or even are helpful doing it. Certainly 3 words or an angry sentence is absolutely not helpful. But the people who take a lot of time and effort to test and report honestly and clearly/fairly/thoroughly are helpful in lots of ways, and the point of sales/review items/reviews is to bring honesty to not only buyers but the sellers too. I have absolutely updated and improved ratings before when great sellers took the time to listen and work on things. I'm saddened this is not happening here, but hopefully this post will maybe help for others to see it from our end.As always, all sellers are welcome to reach out to me anytime. Thanks!

These are good generic cartridges - they are NOT the same as OEM and not trying to be, but just be aware of this before you think you are getting the same thing. Generics have a high failure rate and you never really know if you're going to get great ones or end up with ink everywhere.We have had pretty good luck with generics over the past 6 years or so  -only had one fail, one leak, and a few issues with streaking etc that required some extra cleaning and reseating etc. There are so many complaints online though that I think we have been pretty lucky considering. These are so cheap though that even if you get a few lemons and some issues arise it really is not that big of a deal to toss them. I'd have a set on hand as extras all the time and be VERY careful when handling them.  Some extra clean cycles can usually help printing issues with colors/lines etc.At a little over $12 these are a good deal - we have had no issues with them and even with some problems as reported in other reviews, the cost is so low you can get some extras as backup.Please note: Product received at a discount for testing purposes. All my reviews are 100% honest and unbiased. Thanks :)

LOVE this scrub! I am a huge scrub person - have tried just about all of them on the market from drugstore brand to $80 luxury ones and everything in between. I do use a scrub approximately every other day, with a gentle "touch" - very important to let the scrub do the work and not rub too hard with your fingers. I prefer using them in the shower since they seem to be more effective on very wet, warm skin.TIP - try these on your elbows/knees, they really do work! Start with a small amount, mix with warm water and don't scrub too hard :)This is a very nice looking jar - looks more luxurious and expensive than it is which is always nice! Great packaging and colors.The grain is very small which I prefer and does not damage your skin - some of the larger grains are just too rough and can irritate or damage skin and possibly make thing worse. This is a soft and gentle scrub but still very effective. The most improvement has been with the texture and pore size appearance and these two things improved even a bit really makes a big difference in how it feels, looks and especially how makeup goes on. I'd suggest at least 3 time a week with this one, but really can use it daily if you are gentle and don't use too much. It also helps your products applied after absorb better so it's great to use at night then with a serum or night cream/treatment afterwards. I'd stay away from using hard medications or ingredients immediately after though.It is priced slightly higher than some similar items in this category, while it is definitely better than most drugstore brands ($8-$20 ish) I think the price point might be more reasonable at the $20 mark give or take. Also, I have to mention that the photo used on Amazon showing the before/after is CLEARLY Photoshopped - you are not going to remove all spots, marks ,wrinkles etc with this - hopefully they will remove this as it's just shady to do - the product is great and doesn't need that kind of bs.Please note: A jar was received at a discount in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All thoughts are my own, always! :)  I would likely buy this product if the price was around $15 or so.All in all a really effective product that looks great on your counter and improves many skin issues with consistent use.

The most adorable dog shirt we have seen in a while! LOVE this one, obviously a great message but the colors and logo are large, solid, of a great quality and seem like they will wash great down the line. For $12 it is a steal, it fit wonderfully and did not shrink much at all the first time we washed it. It's a nice deep full black, good quality material - not cheap or thin like many other dog shirts.Totally recommend this one - be sure to measure and use the size chart though. So cute!

LOVE THESE SOCKS? Hold up amazingly well but have a nice softness to them, I would say they are medium to thick but not overly huge or bulky. They wash up great and hold their shape and quality (washing inside out is ideal.) DH puts them through the ringer and they really have done a great job in keeping him comfortable and cool. Our first set lasted about 2 years which is amazing with the use he puts them through. You may need 1/2 a size larger in your shoes depending on your fit and type of shoe (I do with mine, DH does not.)Price at around $12-$14 a pair is COMPLETELY WORTH IT. You get what you pay for, remember! You will not be replacing these every few months and wont deal with gross cotton anymore - blisters, smell and holes no more! Thorlo's have been consistently great for both of us and we will never buy any other brand!

I have had 3 or 4 smaller/thin portable charges since I prefer not adding weight to my purse - and I like being able to keep it in a little zippered small pocket. However, the power was just not enough for trips or long term frequent use or for when we have both / more than a few devices to charge. In comes this POWERHOUSE of a powerbank - at 15600mah! While we received this one at no cost in exchange for this review, all of our comments are 100% honest and our genuine feelings. :)LOOK:FEEL" This is a BIG unit. It is a little heavy, but not out of control. It is a nice sleek black and white and is as good looking as a powerbank could possibly be :).  It is very well made, you can feel it the minute you open the box. This will not be failing or needing repair any time soon - and that is a great thing since these get used a ton.FUNCTION: This model provides around 6 full charges of an iphone 5s or 6, depending on phone obviously but regardless it's a very good amount of power. Really, 2-3+ full charges is more than enough for most people and even multiple people using it but for longer trips, or in situations where more people are using just one unit, it can really handle it. Using this is smooth and seamless, inputs are solid, no wiggling or delay or anything at all. My generic as well as branded cables all work with this perfectly.QUALITY: Its extremely well made - sturdy/strong and would likely withstand some bumping around / drops etc. It really is rugged and will last - great if you are sick of the smaller or "cute" ones working for a month then breaking .WEIGHT: Only down side is the weight - i'ts definitely not light- but with something of this power this is pretty much what you're going to get . It's a trade off but one that is worth it for many including us. I wouldn't suggest it for your every day purse, but in a duffle or suitcase, or in the car, or similar it's fine. Using this for larger needs and having a mini one in your purse or jacket/bag would be ideal.Overall a VERY powerful, solidly made product that is going to last and hold up to constant use. Responsive company as well - they really stand by their products which is an added bonus.

We've been buying all kinds of insoles and orthotics for a few years now in both male/female versions and both really like most of them - we have different needs (me - soft/cushy/supportive, him - work/pain/stress/arch support) and like to try anything we can! Note - the company provided a complimentary pair for testing purposes - these thoughts are 100% our own :)These Othotics by Vive at first feel VERY hard - we were very hesitant when they came out of the package but I had also read that some types of foot pain and issues actually are helped by a harder surface insole. DH uses these mainly in a work environment and me for walking an hour at a time. While I need a softer and thicker sole for long walking, he really likes them for work - say they are a great combination of supportive and comfortable but not huge or annoying like many orthotics can be. He uses these for the arch support, which if you don't have a great fit you can feel but he managed to get it just right and has no issues with that.The price is within the normal range of orthotics, and much better than the normal ones you will buy in most stores. They company honors a 180 warranty which is great, and shows they stand behind their products.  Overall these are in the top bunches for work purposes that DH has tried over the years and as long as you realize they are not thick/soft/cushy you will enjoy them.

I recently began to try some different glass protectors for the first time with my 5S and now 6 - was happily pleased with the performance (used the wed grippy tacky ones applied ones before and liked them, but they constantly came off around the home button.)With the glass ones this problem is solved! No coming up at the edges or where your fingers are, and no dents. Be careful applying - you really can't rip it off and apply it again once it's been stuck (if you have to, DON'T touch any part of the sticky part or you'll never get it clear again.)The only slight annoyance is that this really does kind of bother me is the overall width - all thin glass protectors for the 6 can't go all the way to the edge because of the curved screen unless it is not fully stuck on and traps some dirt -- It goes JUST up to the end of the viewable area, and can at times cause bit of a rainbow effect. However after a while this has stuck on great, no bubbles or cracks, no dirt or gunk trapped along the edges and no little scratches.I suspect this will stay looking new longer than all of the other kinds including the premium "Nasa" material ones I used to use. Glass protectors are the way to go unless you need complete edge to edge coverage - then you need a totally different type for the 6 - or you need really, really strong protection (like an Otter or LP waterproof) As long as you are not extremely clumsy or use your phone in high accident prone situations (construction etc.) this will work well for you.For most average users that are careful and rarely drop or drop indoors only, this is definitely sufficient to offer a layer of protection. It's clear very glossy/smooth, but does not have any problems registering your touch. Please note that the company provided me with a complimentary item for testing and and honest review, and these thoughts are 100% my own. Hope this helps!

Just what we needed - very sturdy, thick but not huge caribener for tons of keys and some USB sticks. This is a nice looking matte black one, very strong and easy to use, smooth opening and closing and really holds everything securely. Looks a lot nicer IMO with the matte finish but of course that is just preference.Great price too at only $7 ish. Don't go with the dollar store ones - this is 10x better made and nicer looking!

LOVE this shirt! On a constant quest for casual, everyday, lightweight but not flimsy and easily ripped shirts. The shape is great, a bit full but not baggy or too masculine looking for females. Nice deep V but with full coverage still, and nice sleeves a little on the longer side for great coverage. The dark blue (Tri indigo) is a GORGEOUS, deep, saturated blue color with a nice slight vintage finish 'look' to it which makes it a little nicer than just a plain color. It is so soft and comfortable but still a substantial shirt (not one of those light light light fly away ones.)Grabbed this one for about $14 which is a steal, I think normal price is around $25. Will update this review after a few months of washing and wearing. Will be getting more in other colors for sure.

Ok - this is a KICK A - - flashlight! We have a number of LED flashlights both for home and work use and use them all pretty much daily, so have a good amount of long term experience with a number of similar products. This is my daily at home one (but would be great for work purposes as well, it just is a little larger so best for our desk drawer which is huge.)The main deal here is that this is STRONG - do not shine it near anyone's eyes, for sure! It is NOT a weak little lightweight piece, and is much more sturdy and well made even than it looks in the picture. It is a little larger than many of the ones we have tried and seen, and that's totally fine for me it may be an issue if you have limited space or want something very compact. Really though that's the ONLY possible con I can think about this piece. It's really, really powerful and sturdy, and you will not have to replace this anytime soon. As with most items / electronics especially, even though there are tons of these on the market at all price ranges, when you want to keep something a lont time and plan to use it frequently - do not to cheap - those fail, are weak, and don't hold up too much.Yes, the price is slightly higher than some, but you are getting an extremely well made, sturdy, strong product with many features (I won't cut and past here, you can see the list above in the seller description :) If you need something very simple for a few times a year , then you can get by with something lightweight and cheap. But most households will use a flashlight pretty frequently, and this is really a good choice - not tiny so you wont lose it, really powerful so can use it outside too (backyard, camping, trips) and for all the household needs (back of dark closets, when fixing things, power outages etc.) The list is endless and this one will not fail you.Love the attached hand strap and this does come with the rechargeable batteries, charger, nice black box and an extra battery + a little bonus :)The cree LED chip is great -good, solid brand. and the zoom lens is a must - you may not use it all the time but its very handy to have!Overall, this is a really great product. It is worth the price ($60) as it really is a professional level item.  It would be overkill if you just want a little light sometimes here and there inside, but for any needs more than that this would be ideal The company did send a sample unit for testing and this is our completely unbiased, honest review. We took a long time to use and test this to make sure we gave very genuine and accurate comments!A few photos below - hope these help.

Our householf was excited to test a few natural products from Puracy (all of our reviews are 100% honest and unbiased :) Over the past 6 months or so, we've been slowly changing our products over to clean/natural/organic. Definitely important to realize that you do give up some strength with these kinds of products - they won't be as effective for all uses/products due to the lack of harsh chemicals, but this is a good thing overall and the benefits far outweigh most of the things you give up. Of course there are times you just need something STRONG, but for the most part it's not that hard changing over.LOOK/SMELL: Very clean and fresh - like the other products this was pleasing to us all, had no afterscent lingering (other than just clean!) NO gunky buildup or stickiness - felt very natural as opposed to some with lots of chemicals. Again, love the clear, white, green very natural colors used - the packaging is just what you want to make you feel that you're using something safe around your house.EFFICIENCY: Good - for light/medium cleaning it really work nicely, and you do not have to use a ton. BUT -  I'd suggest going over yourself twice if you are really filthy or say were at the beach, work, etc. It is slightly less strong by nature and that's ok, but just be aware that you may need to adjust a little bit if you are facing a lot of grime.PRICE: $12 per 16 ounce bottle. Fair / average for natural products, will seem a bit high when comparing to some other brands. I think $10 might be the sweet spot, but you are defnitely getting a nice quality product for the money.TIP: Always use with a puff to get the most out of body wash :)OVERALL: Really enjoy these products and this brand. They work and are nice to look at and smell. Fairly priced for what you get and the company stands behind everything they sell / are very communicative. While a little bit of tweaking might be necessary here and there, I would definitely recommend these and have really enjoyed using them!

We were excited to test a few natural home products from Puracy (reviews are 100% honest and unbiased, always! :) as we have been slowly changing all our products over to clean/natural/organic over the past half a year. It's important to realize that you do give up some strength with these kinds of products - they won't be as effective for all uses/products due to the lack of harsh chemicals, but this is a good thing overall and the benefits far outweigh most of the things you give up. Of course there are times you just need something STRONG, but for the most part it's not that hard changing over. This detergent has been used in our home for about 4 weeks, a few loads a week - here's our take:LOOK/SMELL: Very clean and fresh - both how it looks and smells in the bottle and how it smells on laundry. No afterscent lingering, just clean, fresh clothes. This is a HUGE plus! Love the clear, white, green very natural colors used - the packaging is just what you want to make you feel that you're using something safe around your house.EFFICIENCY: Everything is definitely clean and smells fresh, but some of the whites and brights weren't QUITE as white or bright as we are used to - again, a lot of this is just the nature of natural products and really not an issue with this product itself. Just be aware you are giving this up along with the chemicals. For very dirty or stained clothes I would go with an oxygen bleach, hydrogen peroxide/vinegar solution, tide pen, and other stronger products but for a finishing wash and your normal dirty things this does do a good job. Minor spots came out but it defnitely isn't a tought stain remover.I do feel you have to use a bit more of any natural product but it IS concentrated so don't feel you have to use amounts from years ago - you will be using too much! Stay within the guildelines of the directions or at most a BIT more, but don't go crazy. I usually put in an extra pump with this one. It may be a placebo thing though - lol. This is a big bottle, and the pump is great but make sure to keep it clean or it can get gunky. I think it was re designed last year and we haven't had any issues with ours.PRICE: $16 for 96 loads really is a fair price for a natural detergent. You are getting a lot safer and cleaner product than the typical ones filled wiht chemicals and fillers.TIP: Use with wool dryer balls for a very soft finish, and an overall very natural process without nasty dryer sheets or an extra bottle of softener.OVERALL: Really enjoy these produts and this brand. They work and are nice to look at and smell. Fairly priced and the company stands behind everything they sell / are very communicative. Definitely recommend this detergent for all households!

The Uncollected David Rakoff by David Rakoff is a highly recommended collection of his writing.This volume includes the entire text of "Love, Dishonor, Marry, Die, Cherish, Perish," early fiction, memoir pieces, travel writing, essays, and reflections on life as a gay man, as well as transcripts of his memorable appearances on public radio's Fresh Air and This American Life. Rakoff was best known for his wit and humor, both of which are captured in this collection.As in most collections not every piece will strike a chord with everyone, but most readers are going to find a genuine connection to more than one of the pieces. For example, in "The Love that Dare Not Squeak Its Name," Rakoff discussion about E.B. White's Stuart Little as a gay icon will likely be a hit for most readers, as will Love, Dishonor, Marry, Die, Cherish, Perish, Rakoff's novel written in verse. Themes of family and friendship are a common thread, along with life as a gay man.Obviously not being a gay man limits some of my emotional connection to all of the stories, but Rakoff's wit is evident and all of the contents are well written and enjoyable. Those who recall interviews with Rakoff on public radio will likely appreciate the transcribed pieces immensely. This is a collection that fans will likely want.Contents include:My Sister of Perpetual Mercy; Sagrada Família; My First New York: Arrived: 1982; An Open Letter to My Sisters; Goodbye to All of You; A Former Smoker Cheers; Diary, 1998; What’s Up, Dike?; The Wizards of Id; [Laura Bush]: The New York Times, Op-Ed; The Love That Dare Not Squeak Its Name; David Rakoff: Essayist, Mountaineer, “Comic Saint,” Fresh Air Interview; Fu Fighters; Evergreen Safari; Northern Composure; A Basket Case in North Carolina; Traveler’s Tale: A New Yorker Is Born; Walk This Way; I Like My Dog. Yours? Not So Much.; King of the Forest; Tweenage Wasteland; Unaccustomed as I Am … How to Give a Wedding Toast; David Rakoff’s Half Empty Worldview Is Full of Wit: Fresh Air Interview; The Craft That Consumed Me; The Waiting; When Bad Things Happen to Do-Good People; Author David Rakoff Calms Himself by Keeping a Full Pantry; Oh! The Places You Will Not Go!: (Co-written with Jonathan Goldstein); Stiff as a Board, Light as a Feather: This American Life; Love, Dishonor, Marry, Die, Cherish, Perish.Disclosure: My Kindle edition was courtesy of Knopf Doubleday for review purposes.

After Alice by Gregory Maguire is a recommended rewrite of Lewis Carroll’s Alice's Adventures in Wonderland from a different point of view.This adventure in Wonderland features Ada, a friend of Alice, and Lydia, Alice's sister. Ada is trying to find Alice when she falls down the rabbit hole herself and, following in Alice's footsteps, she encounters the same inhabitants of Wonderland and a few new ones. While Ada is meeting and conversing with all manner of strange  creatures, Lydia is dealing with her own issues, including Miss Armstrong, the governess looking for Ada, and Siam, a boy visiting her father with Charles Darwin.This tale is decidedly written for adults who remember the classic tale and who can appreciate the word play involved in Wonderland and in the formal 19th century language. The action alternates between the two main characters, Ada and Lydia, and the two settings. Normally I don't need to look up the meaning of any words as I read, but Maguire threw in more than a few surprises for me here with the vocabulary. This might put some readers off when it is combined with the formal language in which After Alice is written.The quality of the writing is quite good, but the actual story is slow to unfold, and, for me, flipping back and forth between the two characters and settings wasn't quite as successful as it could have been. I ended up not really caring very much about what was going on with either character and kept reading simply to see how it would compare to the original and to see when Alice would show up.Disclosure: My Kindle edition was courtesy of Harper Collins for review purposes.

Mendocino Fire by Elizabeth Tallent is a very highly recommended collection of ten short stories.The stories capture relationships and lives during times of transformation with clarity and insight into the complicated emotional landscape of all relationships. Tallent explores relationships between genders, with an emphasis on female relationships, as well as broken marriages. Many of the stories deal with creative people, writers, artists, or ecological/environmental activists. Several are set on university campuses or have a tie in to academia. Almost all of the stories involve exes, severed relationships, struggling relationships. The emotions run high as we hear the inner thoughts of the characters struggling to make sense of their lives, actions, obsessions, and circumstances. Tallent describes lives that are messy, with emotional fallout and struggles.All of these stories are extremely well written with exceptionally descriptive prose and phrasing. There are several passages I marked to take note of in my advanced reading copy. Tallent manages to capture the inner thoughts of her characters and their feelings with a clarity of emotion that is complete and realistic, but with a poetic grace and beauty of wording that often belies the raw emotions being expressed.I don't know if the page numbers will be similar, but the acuity and mental pictures drawn from some of her descriptions is astonishing. For example: "Tamped down love means not only sublimated energy but also a ranting, pointless impatience: before long, she's sick of obsession's two-lane Nebraska highway." (pg 79)Or: "It can't be true that she can't see in. That she can't know the story. This is her life she's been shut out of!"(pg. 97) And on the next page "Divorce is not linear. One morning there is peace of mind, the next there is wrath."Contents include:The Wrong Son - a young man in a working-class California fishing community has a complicated, combative relationship with his fatherTabriza - a man wonders if a valuable rug he dug out of the trash is evil and wreaking havoc on his third marriageMystery Caller - a woman places calls to her first husband but doesn't actually talk to himEros 101 - an female professor is obsessed/in love with her female studentNobody You Know - recently divorced woman travels halfway across the country and meets her ex's new, young wifeThe Wilderness - musings of an English professorNever Come Back - parents have their son's pregnant girlfriend and subsequent grandchild continue to live with them after the girlfriend takes offMendocino Fire - a young eco-activist grows up in an unconventional mannerNarrator -  a young female writer falls for an older famous male writerBriar Switch - a woman's father is dying from lung cancer and she's has to drive through a blizzard to get to himDisclosure: I received an advanced reading copy of this book from Harper Collins and TLC for review purposes.

Kraken Rising by Greig Beck is a very highly recommended action-packed military-adventure-terror-thriller. It kept my total attention from the beginning to the end.We know several things from the opening chapters: a sub has been attacked by some huge, mysterious creature; Alex Hunter, the Arcadian, is still alive and working for the US military; an emergency beacon signal is being picked up by bases on Antarctica; and Chinese operatives have tried to capture Joshua, Alex's son and Aimee, his mother. This should tell all you action/adventure junkies that Kraken Rising will be an adrenaline-packed-thrill-ride of a novel.In 2008 a top secret US prototype submarine goes missing off the coast of Antarctica in the Southern Sandwich trench. The area is also known as the Southern Sea's Devil's Triangle. Thinking it was lost in a deep trench, the USA is surprised when the emergency locator beacon is discovered to now be sending a signal - a signal located deep underneath Antarctica. But the race is on because the Chinese, who have been illegally mining for precious minerals nearby have also heard the emergency beacon and are determined to claim the missing sub. Several different groups of soldiers with some scientists mixed in, are on the hunt and the situation is quickly turning political and the potential for an exchange of military fire is increasing exponentially. Alex Hunter, the Arcadian, is a super soldier. An experimental treatment after he was mortally wounded in a previous assignment has left him with super-human powers/skills, but he also has a dark side. Alex is sent in to find the sub on his own, but at the same time a team of HAWCs is also on the mission. Adding to the tension is the fact that Joshua's mother, petrobiologist Aimee Weir, is also on the mission since she has had previous experience dealing with the terrifying creature they must all now face.You really don't have to read any of the previous books to enjoy this one. I could swear I've read the first book in this series, the book which presents the first assignment in Antarctica, but although I kept remembering facts as I read this book, I couldn't find a review of it. Now it does resemble some other books set in the same geographical area with similar scenarios, so perhaps I was thinking of one of those books. Setting all that aside, I was totally engrossed in the story from beginning to end. Even though I think I read the first book, I know I haven't read any of the adventures in-between the first and this, the sixth, but still I had no trouble following the story.If you like skirmishes between super-human combatants and military novels with an element of sheer terror as both sides face the unknown as well as each other, Kraken Rising should make you happy. It's all about the action. I mean, come on, there's a kraken. This is a perfect stuck-over-night-at-the-airport book.Disclosure: My Kindle edition was courtesy of Pan Macmillian for review purposes.

Homefront by Scott James Magner is a recommended science fiction novel set in the 27th century.The novel will hook you right at the start with the discussion of the Transgenic virus as learned about in a Congressional inquiry.  Then the action jumps to the future after the Transgenic virus has already mutated individuals and we meet Commander Jantine and her infiltration force of soldiers, scientists, and engineers on a suicide mission. They are all exiles from Earth's outer colonies.  Although they know they may not survive their mission, they are  part of a plan to establish a new, secret colony on Earth.
