I'd also caution potential readers that these Highlanders are a brutal, blood lot and the violence might be a bit much for the more squeamish readers.

We peeps in accounting are staple snobs, they need to be neat, clean (no sharp edges for tearing of skin) and preferably effortless. We also do a wide variety of stapling tasks, from 2-4 pages up to 60+ pages (that's what the decades old Swingline heavy duty is for). Most of our larger reports are in the 30-40 page range, and this stapler is a perfect fit. A box of staples came in the box, and they're the shorter staples than what we have in the HD Swingline. Piece of cake to load them up and get stapling, and the only stapling tasks this hasn't been up to are the larger jobs that need a larger staple - and also a larger opening (mouth) to accommodate the stapling task. I.e. the Rapesco has an opening of about 1/2" (if there's a way to adjust the height, I haven't figured it out yet, and can't find it in the instructions) vs. the old Swingline that's about 1 1/2".This stapler also does very nicely on smaller reports (say 5-10 pages) and finishes cleanly without any excess staple sticking out for hurt hands like would happen with the Swingline. We've been test driving this for about a week, with excellent results, the only time it has *failed* is when we've experimented with a staple job too large for this staple and/or the staples that came along with it.Happy camper and happy stapler snob here.

But...it isn't helping with the redness I have as much as I'd hoped for. Oh well. I do get the occasional breakout, and this product seems to be drying them up quite nicely, and I've only tested it on my adult skin - no teenagers around my household to test it on. The product does go on very dry (with a slight odor) and can be used as a topical treatment, or thinly spread as a mask of sorts for about ten minutes and then rinse and have a good moisturizer ready afterwards.I think the packaging could be better designed, I'd prefer a pump so I can control how much comes out at one time - I either don't get enough and then I end up getting too much, and it is a fairly expensive skin product. I was also glad to find the instruction on the Amazon page, because the font color and background on the bottle were impossible for this oldster to read.

Pro's - pictures are WONDERFUL; nice layout, view one week and opposite side is full page photo for each week, ample writing space, good for desk or keep in your work/school bag.Con's - very soft bendable cover (doesn't need to be hard cover but would prefer firmer stock), shiny pages won't work well with pencilThe pro's are very strong and the con's are just picky points.  I'd recommend to get for yourself or as a gift because it is nice quality.

I often buy this at the market for portion control as much as for the variety.  This time around it was just more convenient to order and have delivered because I anticipated the need before I actually needed them.  Just as fresh as the market.

It's a good product and it does get eaten eventually but the cat's don't devour it on sight.  I rotate foods for them and it seems to work out a little better.  Best part is that my dogs don't have any interest in it... which makes it much easier because sometimes the cats and dogs try to swap bowls.  They don't understand their nutritional needs are different but I do!  Sheba is making my job easier so I don't have to separate animals to feed them.

Looks like food, smells like food, even though it's for the dogs!  Feels for me (and I think for them) as though I'm treating them with some human food but of course it's nutritionally what's good for your pet.  If the smell of average dog food makes you nauseous, you will love this food.

Reasonably comfortable and adjustable cord makes it just the right "size" for anyone.  Nice to use with or without the light.  I would recommend for crafting or any detail work if your eyes aren't so good.  I have used it for reading as well... it's not really suited as much for that because it doesn't cover the whole page and it's a slight learning curve to work around that but it can be done.

Beautiful little spacers or to use in delicate project.  The quality is good and the colors are perfect, reminds me of my childhood growing up on the beach!  So long as you realize these are tiny (I knew what I was getting.)

Purchased for my nephew... one size fit for adults and teens.  HIs mom is making the suit to go with it.  A very practical way to go about Halloween costumes for us this year.  Buying the full character costume is too expensive for our budget.  This is the perfect compromise.

I've got a Mario and a Luigi which we are using first for Halloween and then they can wear them after because they are Mario super-fans!  Fit's as expected, precise fit actually.  Very happy with my purchase.

My practical solution to halloween this year!  You can put a pair of sweats or running pants or whatever with them and ta-da, you're Mario!  And since he's a big fan I know that he will wear it long after the holiday... pretty much until he grows out of it.  It fit's spot on to the size as I would expect.  Very satisfied.

What you see is what you get.  Pay attention to the item description to understand the size and quantity of the beads.  They are good for spacers or delicate projects or pattern work.  I like the color blend in the "Spring mix"  I purchased  to make a pair of tear-shaped delicate look earrings with memory wire and these beads and very happy with how they came out.

I like this design, we have a few bird feeders out in our yard and I like this one the best.  Advice, depending on the food mix you choose you need to be careful the holes let a lot of little bits fall through.  I get around that by holding it over the bag and really packing it in.  Interestingly the sunflower seeds wound up mostly sitting at the bottom but that's probably not the feeder's "fault" just gravity or our birds don't like it but the feeder itself they do like and the squirrels here don't bother with it.

It's good while it lasts.  Easy to turn for arthritic hands (as opposed to chunky metal grinders.)  After a while the pegs have started to pop off.  I think I will try my luck with herb scissors instead.  Drier herbs will come out easier.  Any moisture to it and you will be picking contents out with a toothpick or other small pipe tool, etc.

Very compact and comes in a nice protective case.  Can be used with or without the clear tray.  Have measured against similar products and weighs just as accurate.  The style and small size are what I like most about it along with the backlit blue screen.

You really can skip cable for a while if you use netflix.  I like the service (which does cost seperately) and it can be used on a multitude of devices.  If you don't have a netflix account or are not able to set one up... then this is not going to do you any good.
Gave this as gifts filled with little goodies inside.  Great price and better than a little "favor" bag for tweens and older kids alike.  I just wish I kept one for myself.

My dogs will happily eat this but they are somehow aware that it's a replacement from their usual (non-lean variety.)  They still like it and get used to it quickly but if you change back and forth (with picky dogs) they will likely notice the difference too.
My 10 year old cannot get enough of this game.  It's played by other family too but he is a big fan of the movie and loves the game and we are building a Wii U collection.

This was given as a gift for a young boy.  He liked it and it seems like it will hold up to withstand rugged use.  I know things other than money willl wind up stored in here!  Suitable for a small present for young Ninja Turtle fans.

This one is a HIT (ha ha) with my family.  It is played nearly every day & the graphics are nice too.  I don't play it myself but the sports people here are happy and that's what matters.  Definite  recommendation to those looking for a quality baseball game for the Wii

Multiple times I have ordered this paper and it works for my whole family of aspiring artists.  Not only is it good for tracing but I actually like to work on it directly (as in painting or drawing from scratch instead of tracing) just for a different effect.  I certainly recommend to anyone.

Very pretty, just what  I expected it to be.  It's a fine (but not too delicate) gold chain that really shines. I purchased it for a relative and I'm really hoping she will like it just as much as I do... If not I just might have to keep it for myself!

Not sure what specifically caught my eye about this book when I selected it but it wasn't a good choice for me.  Essentially I just couldn't get into it... tried time and time again.  It just didn't hold my interest and a couple times actually put me to sleep.  I don't like to give a negative review.  I can say there there is something worthwhile here for a reader other than myself... for me personally it was just an epic fail.

Very convenient packaging for keeping individual portions fresh.  I have two cats who both are eager to gobble this up in the morning, in fact I have  trouble not having the dog eat it.  Smells better than most cat food in case you're sensitive about that sort of thing.  I feel good offering this food to my cats and seeing them enjoy their meal.

Maddy and Ella are identical twins, on the outside at least.  They have very different personalities though, different set of friends, goals, etc.  Maddy being popular and outgoing, Ella more serious and interested in art and hoped to pursue that in collage.  A tragic accident claims the life of one sister, leaving the other full of guilt and confusion.They say that twins have a certain closeness and "sense" of the other, identical twins are also known to pull pranks or fool people pretending to be one another.  What if it wasn't a joke though?  After the accident, family and friends are mistaken on which sister has survived and she in turn just doesn't bother to correct them and steps into her sister's life and finds out more about her than she knew.  Some things you cannot imagine and would not believe if you didn't see and hear with your own ears and eyes.I thoroughly enjoyed this page turner.  It reads quick and is good for high school and young adult target audience.  I'm 45 and still found it interesting and well worth my time to read.  Great book.

Delicate and lovely, unfortunately this chain necklace had to go back... only because I ordered it for someone and it was the wrong style of chain.  It comes in an attractive gift box.  Certainly a worthwhile purchase for anyone needing a dainty necklace.

Having lived many years in the area south of Boston and I can certainly feel descriptive elements of the area and people quite true to life.  Even so, it did take some effort to read the way people speak.  That could make it tough for some to get through.  his is certainly fiction based solid in reality of drugs and gangs, the unfortunately all to common aspects of life in the area.  I enjoyed it well enough but cannot say I would really recommend for a very large audience.  Certainly appropriate for high school/YA audience and I would expect it to interest others from this area in particular.

The wii u Swap Force Bundle was given as a gift to a nine year old.  Now each version of bundle he ranted and raved about so ultimately the bargain of this system bundle won out in the end.  I'm glad it only cost me the same as the set alone because when the time came around these were no longer as popular.  Interesting fact: he prefers collecting the figures to actually playing the Skylander game.  The Wii U system, the entire family loves.

Not the best product I've had so I guess it just depends on how bad off your feet are.  If they are at a therapeutic level of dryness this may not do the trick but if you just have regular old dry skin that needs moisturizing and a nice cooling soothe, this is a good product.  It does work on tough skin too but it just takes more time and product to get the same effect.
I would say this is quite a nice tea since it didn't last in my house long at all.  Nice comfort beverage and good flavor.
Given as a gift.  Cute little set.  I would recommend this product to TNBC fans.  Nice set featuring Jack and Sally pen and bookmark.

The design is GREAT! The ability to rotate to landscape or portrait and still have the iPad supported is such an insightful feature. I didn't notice any lag or impact on the response to the iPad in any way. The arm which holds the iPad slides easily for quick adjustments and everything is so smooth.The only drawback from the case is that it feels a bit chinsey. I know that helps keep it light weight and portable, but it almost feels hollow and therefore didn't feel as "nice" as I was expecting based on the look.Overall this is a great case and one that I'll be using quite often!(I received this case in exchange for an honest and unbiased review)

HOW IT LOOKS- The gray is a gorgeous, darker neutral color that works with so many decors. The piping around the edges isn't white - it's soft gray, which is awesome because that's subtle and tasteful.- It doesn't look cheap, but it also doesn't look particularly nice either. It's a middle of the road couch as an accent, but definitely not something to base your room around unless you're on a budget.HOW IT FEELS- The fabric is soft, but not plush with ridges like a soft cordoroy.- Firm seat cushions.- Softer back cushions.- Nice deep seating.ASSEMBLY- My husband and I put this together in less than 10 minutes.- There was minimal damage on one of the parts that you can't see, so we didn't worry about it.- Nothing is screwed in, so no tools are needed.OVERALLI am so in love with the color and aesthetic of this couch that I don't care if it looks a little less nice than our other furniture. We included it in our living room as additional seating and due to the neutral design and color, it fits right in! A firmer couch is definitely something I'm excited about as I know they will soften over time.If you're looking for a starter couch or an addition for your space, this is a great option! It doesn't look high end, but the color and design helps it blend well into just about any space.

I used this to clean off our outdoor patio furniture this spring and it did amazing! Easy to use, spray off, no strong odor and it didn't bleach or leave residue on our clothes. This stuff is amazing!

This book has SO MUCH hype attached to it and it absolutely, positively, lived up to every single ounce of it. There's class struggles and magic and coming of age and diversity and minor swoons and just EVERYTHING you want in an epic fantasy!Basically, Kelsier is set to overthrow the oppressive Lord Ruler and he pulls together a rag tag crew of Allomancers (magic using folk) to get it done. Chiefly of those is Vin, a teenage girl who is an incredibly powerful Allomancer and has no idea. So they spend time training and plotting and infiltrating before everything comes to a head and it's wild and crazy and spectacular.What I loved most about Vin was her coming of age. She starts off as a girl who stays in the shadows to stay alive. As a thief, she's easy bait so she tries to blend as much as possible. She trusts no one. Eventually, through the gang and through Kelsier as a father figure, she slowly starts trusting others and believing in herself while still keeping this sense of "I can't possibly be special" which makes her so very endearing.The cast is diverse, multi-faceted, flawed and absolutely relatable. Their conversations draw you in and give you a sense of what it's like to BE in that world and to FEEL their struggle and to WANT them so desperately to win against the very, very unlikely odds.While it does take some time to get going and gain momentum, Mistborn takes all of the elements we love in epic fantasy and centers it around a "job" with a gang of underground criminals that creates one of the most unique and unputdownable plots I've ever read, ever.

I absolutely ADORE Contigo and have dozens of bottles and tumblers from them. I'm always impressed with their ability to wash in the dishwasher and sincerely never leak!The problem I have with this water bottle is that I miss the straw. Squeezing/sucking to get the water out is harder than my kiddo is equipped to handle, so she's not crazy about this. She prefers the Contigo Striker to this one, for sure.This is a quality Contigo bottle we've come to expect, but the squeeze/suck style just isn't working for us.

As a mom to a toddler and fur baby, we have our fair share of instances in which a quick spray of Febreeze is warranted...especially by the diaper pail. We've used Febreeze for years and so when I saw this Unstopables pop up on Vine, I was curious to compare the two Air Freshener sprays.Unstopable Fresh Air Freshener is WAY stronger than the Febreeze Air Freshener. I did one "sweep" of my arm in our living room (large with high ceilings) and it was almost too much. The scent is a crisp, clean smell that obviously smells like air freshener, but not in an unpleasant way.This is the canister I keep in my daughter's room by her changing table now! Stronger scent, longer lasting, and a great smell to cover the diaper pail! I'm sold.

We have a large, oddly shaped house so I was interested in seeing if this would extend our wi-fi signal upstairs to the guest bedrooms (which ar farthest from our outer) - and it does!The Pros:- Easy to install. We used a cell phone even to do the installation process!- Not removing an outlet is a neat little feature.- Negligible decrease in overall wi-fi speed when utilized.The Cons:- The price point is high for what this device does - but unless you're willing to run wires to get the same result, this is your best bet.

A paper trimmer is a must-have for any paper crafter. But not all paper trimmers are created equal. Here's an overview of the latest Portable Trimmer from Cricut!- The handle is a little bigger than other paper trimmers I've used, which makes it easier to hold on to and slide easily.- I tested this trimmer on cardstock and paper of different weights and textures and I was very happy with the clean cuts it provided every time.- The more measuring marks, the better! I don't want to have to mark my paper every time I want to make a cut.- Blade storage within the trimmer is GENIUS.- Swing-out arm makes cutting 12x12 pages (and bigger) so easy.- More lines = easier measuring = more exact cuts. Easy as that.I love the way it looks.I love the way it cuts.I love that it has inches and millimeters for exact measurements.At a $15 price point, it's an absolute must have for your craft room!

This is such a cute idea! I love the whimsical cuteness of it and that it's different from other Birthday Cards out there!I was worried the envelope that came with the card wouldn't fit it - but sure enough it did! The envelope is NOT padded, however.The card is pretty thick (the viewing area of the contents inside need a bit of space) so it would definitely cost extra to mail. At a $7-$8 price point, this is a bit much for a birthday card, in my opinion - even one that is this cute.

This is an absolute dream to use. I've made both a sheet cake (which is the intended purpose, I guess) and used it to cook up chicken fries for my toddler and there is no residue, need for spray, and ridiculously easy to clean.The size is actually perfect because I can out two of them side by side on one rack in my oven at a time.Since this is a bit on the expensive side, it makes for a very thoughtful wedding or housewarming gift. This is definitely a multipurpose and durable pan that will be in your kitchen forever!

I currently have 6 of these Cricut StandardGrip Adhesive Cutting Mats in my rotation and they are my absolute favorite. Let me tell you why!- The border on the edges is just perfect for being able to line up your paper easily on the mat.- The adhesive on the mat easily allows you to re-position your paper and other materials before and after you cut.- I can easily cut vinyl, cardstock, paper, and loads of other materials with the same detail and precision thanks to the grip with this mat.- With repeated use, the mat loses some stickiness. To get that back, all I have to do is scrape off all the residual fibers/dust, wash it with soapy water, and let it air dry and then the adhesive service is back. THAT IS IT. It's amazing!- The mat bends without cracking or breaking, even after repeated use.These are compatible with various Cricut machines and can be used with other electronic cutting machines as well. They are an absolute essential for paper crafting!

It pains me to give this only 2 stars! But trust me, I do have my reasons.First, this is the second book in a trilogy. I read and LOVED the first book (The Winner's Curse) and so I should have been really excited about book 2! I even refreshed my memory by reading recaps of book 1 to remember where we left off.Usually when I start a book in the series beyond the first one, I fall back in step with the characters and writing within 5-10 pages. I remember why I enjoyed the previous book(s) and am swept away into that world all over again! I did not have that experience with The Winner's Crime.I just could not get that spark of excitement I had for the first book! I think a big part of the lack of interest for me was due to the plot being focused so heavily on the star-crossed and distanced lovers of Kestrel and Arin. In The Winner's Curse - we get to KNOW Kestrel and KNOW the struggles and KNOW the politics before the romance blooms, which is great. With The Winner's Crime, we're steeped in longing romance for a very long time and the plot just kind of spins it's wheels, until closer to the end in which things happen to set up for book 3.I'm sure The Winner's Kiss (book 3) will weave together the star-crossed lovers and the plot in a more cohesive way, but I'm not sure that my interest will sustain until then.Bear in mind that I am WAY in the minority here! Most of my book friends LOVED the first and second book in this series and I admit that Kestrel is a smart, strong, brave heroine and I respect that immensely. The whole "I miss him" and "I miss her" thing just dragged me down to the point of total disinterest. But if you're all about Arin and Kestrel, then you'll probably be all about The Winner's Crime!
These are one of my all time favorite pens! I love the way the needle tip writes and never, ever glitches out or blobs or anything. A perfectly smooth and fluid pen!

I purchased this magnet tape so I could make DIY bookmarks and this tape does not stick to itself. Not even a little bit!It will hold a very light weight item to a magnetic surface, such as a wallet sized photo to a refrigerator, but beyond that I am not convinced of the strength it would have.The edge to rip off the magnet tape seems like a good idea, but I found using scissors much easier and caused fewer rips.I'm definitely looking at alternatives for magnet tape and will not be purchasing this again.

Pros:- Very sleek. The brushed aluminum look is aesthetically gorgeous and the dark metal paired with the black keys is quite slick.- Responsive touch screen. I was very impressed with how responsive it is! I have an iPad (2nd generation) and this performs better than my iPad (which I thought was just fine)- 1 TB of storage. Which is a LOT of internal storage! There's also an option to build your own cloud, but I feel like that isn't really necessary with Dropbox and Google Drive and the other services available already.- Screen variability. The screen does NOT detatch, but it does flip backward and tent and remains firmly in place of wherever you leave it.- Processor and Graphics Card are great. The Intel i7 processor is the top of the line. When that's paired with this Intel HD Graphics 5500 card, it creates a tablet/laptop that can easily watch HD movies, and while it won't have the level of graphics more serious gamers are looking for, the rest of us will be happy.Cons:- Weight. It comes in at just under 5 lbs, which isn't too heavy, but definitely not as light as some other convertible laptop/touchscreen combinations out there.- Boot Time. I've had this computer about 2 days. When I timed the cold boot, it took 1:17 to get to the log in screen, and 25 seconds to get to the home screen after I logged in. Shut down took 7 seconds to go blank, but 27 seconds before the fans and computer were totally quiet.- Touch Pad. This is the most common complaint, and for good reason. I didn't notice any significant issues at first, but the longer you use it, the more you notice the sluggishness when scrolling (which is also opposite directionally from my Chromebook, which was weird to me).- Streaks. When my iPad is one, I can't see the streaks from my fingers from swiping. When this is on, I can see the swipes on the edges of the screen from when I used it as a tablet.Overall: This is an incredibly powerful 2 in 1 that I'm happy to have as part of my computer family. The dual functionality of tablet and laptop is ideal for couch computer usage - tablet for scrolling through my Feedly reader and chatting on Twitter, laptop for replying to emails and blogging.

This is the first time I've used a whitening toothpaste, so I wasn't sure what to expect. I've used this product for about a week and after poking around other reviews a bit about other whitening toothpastes, here's what I can say:THE GOOD- No increased tooth sensitivity- It feels like my teeth and mouth are getting as clean as they were with standard toothpaste- The taste isn't terrible, but you can definitely tell the increased hydrogen peroxide with how it foams in your mouth.THE MEH- I've been using the product about a week, and I can't say the notice is that significant. I mean, no one has said anything about it but since I look at my teeth every day, I feel like they are a bit whiter than they were before.- I definitely did NOT notice a chance in 3 days. I've only started to notice a difference in the whiteness of my teeth in the past day or two.I'm intrigued enough to keep it going for the full tube and then will make my decision on whether or not to purchase more. If there isn't a significant change, I'll most likely switch back to the standard toothpaste that has a better flavor and doesn't have extra chemicals and what not.But if you're looking for a gentle whitening toothpaste that doesn't increase tooth sensitivity and won't make you gag - this is your brand!

I received this product in exchange for an honest review - and lucky for me, this product was AMAZING.This is exactly what you're looking for in a selfie stick! Holds phones of all sizes (including my husband's monster Nexus 6) with a good grip, takes fabulous photos, the extendable handle gives you a nice variety in your selfie game.Easy to assemble. Great quality. Excellent price point. I'm VERY happy with this selfie stick!

I was initially interested in this game because I LOVE the movie Mars Attacks! I am also a fan of dice based games as a light filler or casual party game too, so this was sure to be a win-win!The idea of the game is you roll dice, keep what you want to try and get city cards for VPs, and try not to roll too many "nuclear" symbols! There are some slight variations based on cards and certain die rolls, but that's the gist. Very straight forward, easy to learn and quick to play!I'd recommend this game for kids and for those who are looking for a light, fun, dice rolling based game. Nothing too special, but the theme makes it fun to have around!

I just love Glue Dots! They are so easy to use - and this variety are repositionable so if it doesn't line up quite right, or if it's showing over the edge, you can move it without compromising the adhesiveness!These are a must-have for crafters and school projects!

I should start off by saying that we have the Thule Chariot and absolutely LOVE IT and so we were very excited to try out the Glide Sport Stroller by Thule. (You can see my review of the Chariot here: http://www.amazon.com/gp/review/RJXY01PTWSL57/ref=cm_cr_pr_rvw_ttl?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B00FGLRDVC)The Glide Sport Stroller has a fixed front wheel (which means it never ever rotates) which provides increased stability when you're moving quickly jogging or pulling it behind on a bicycle. However, if you're looking for a more casual non-active stroller, you'll probably be better off with the Chariot or other Thule stroller. But if you're looking for a stroller that has all of the features you want with loads of protection, safety, and is very lightweight - this is for you! It folds down for storing and transporting and the seat reclines to a near flat position for napping little ones.A couple other things that really impressed me with the Glide Sport Stroller was the weight of the stroller itself is only 22 lbs (that includes wheels and everything) but it holds up to 75 lbs! Also, my husband was able to put this stroller together in under 10 minutes. For real.The stroller is what you'd expect from Thule - lightweight, high quality, stable, aerodynamic and provides a smooth and comfortable ride for the kiddo. Thule also does crazy amounts of safety testing so their products exceed the safety standards that are set. I love this stroller and I love this brand!

My five-year-old likes to have his hair short and spiky. He also hates scissors and hair trimmers. Giving him a haircut in the past has been a chore and a half, but I love this Panasonic Trimmer. It is relatively light weight and pretty quiet. But the best thing about it is that there is one attachment that you add to the head, and all of the length adjustments take place with a dial.For my little guy, this is a godsend. I can make quick adjustments while I'm cutting, and he doesn't have time to get distracted and pitch a fit. He also can't insist that I use a particular attachment even when I know that it will not give him the look he wants.Because this unit is lightweight, I could remove the hair trimmer attachment and maneuver it easily around his ears and the back of his neck and get a great precision cut. He was still nervous, but not as nervous as he has been with previous trimmers.Another thing I love about this trimmer is that the way the trimmer attachment is shaped, it catches hair as I'm cutting. Sure, there's still some that goes on the floor, but most of it goes into the trimmer attachment. When I'm giving a trim of a few centimeters, I can rinse it all out when I'm done; when I'm cutting longer strands,I can just shake it off into the trash can.Washing the trimmer was quick and easy. There is an area on one side where the directions tell you to flush water through, and an opening on the other side allows the water flow to come out. Cleaning a hair trimmer has never been easier.I love this trimmer, and I love that it lets me give my little guy the look he wants without all the tears.

War of Two is an easily-accessible book, particularly good for those with an interest in Revolution-era American history, but not necessarily a extensive knowledge of all the details. Although the title and subtitle put the emphasis on the infamous duel between Aaron Burr and Alexander Hamilton, it is more a dual biography (pun slightly intended) of the two Founding Fathers with some emphasis on the dispute that claimed the life of one and the political career of the other. John Sedgwick writes in a fluid style, never too dry, and does not favor either Burr or Hamilton over the other. (This seems particularly appropriate since he begins the book with a letter from Hamilton to his own ancestor, onetime Speaker of the House Theodore Sedgwick, whom he says was one of the few people able to maintain friendly ties to both Burr and Hamilton in the final days of their feud.)Though War of Two doesn't seem like it would contain too much new information for serious history buffs, it is a compelling read for those who don't know much about either Hamilton or Burr aside from the duel, but want to know more.

Every once in a while, I get a crazy craving for a Bloody Mary or a Virgin Mary. I usually pick up a bottle of V-8 and one glass about does it for me for a year or so, and I don't generally want the rest of the bottle.This Clamato Preparado Tomato Cocktail far surpasses the V-8. It's good on its own and really good with a few dashes of Louisiana hot sauce. It does have both high fructose corn syrup and MSG in it. While I can do without either, I don't generally go out of my way to avoid them either. If I could get the same flavor without these two ingredients, I might even drink a tomato cocktail more often.

I really wanted to like this book, as the premise is so very promising. Unfortunately, it was difficult to immerse myself in it because the writing is just so heavy-handed. The sentence structure is such that I spent more time parsing sentences than anything else. The characters, too, aren't especially likable. I felt sorry for the narrator, but I couldn't quite empathize with her. She is the youngest child, both spoiled and neglected by her parents, and left out by her three older sisters.In laying out the story, Haydu tries to keep too much under wraps for too long. That attempt to build suspense bothered me more than it intrigued me, especially once I realized that the book would be so depressing.I'm not of the mind that young adult fiction always has to have a happy ending, but the magical aspects of the book led me to expect more fun and less darkness. This book didn't deliver.

I ordered this because my daughter wants to participate in the science fair this year but needs some realistic ideas for her observations and experiments. As I haven't done this before, I wasn't sure where to start. She won't be completing her project non anything in this kit, but it was a good starting point for brainstorming.The kit is pretty cheap, and the lens which attaches to your smartphone isn't especially high quality, but it's at least a starting point for closer observation than she's had a chance to experience before.

David Kirk's second book about Musashi Miyamoto isn't quite as compelling as the first, Child of Vengeance, but it comes close and is still a must-read for aficionados of historical fiction or feudal Japan. Following the Battle of Sekigahara (the final scene of Child of Vengeance), Musashi has become increasingly disillusioned with the samurai code, in particular ritual suicide, sepukku. Embarking on a (foolhardy) crusade of violence and marked for death by the Yoshioka school, he encounters characters (mostly of Kirk's creation) from whom he forms, directly and indirectly, a more developed philosophy of rebellion against "The Way." Of the supporting cast, the foreign-born Yoshioka adept Akiyama, the blind immigrant Ameku, and Goemon, the northerner appointed as the Tokogawa's governor of Kyoto, are the most important and best-developed (and not only because they each have a unique reason to see Kyoto culture as outsiders).Musashi's feud with the Yoshioka takes up most of the book. While altered slightly from most historical accounts of the same events (which don't always cast Musashi in a light modern readers would find sympathetic), it is a plausible series of events. The various successive members of the Yoshioka family to head the school have unique characters and different takes on Musashi, but all are constricted by their devotion to The Way of bushido.The book ends with many questions still unaddressed, but foremost among them is when we can expect another book from Kirk about Musashi, who is still in his early 20s at this point. The real Musashi continued to build his legend for decades, and I hope to get at least one or two more books dramatizing his "future" adventures.

I've always wondered if Bose speakers would live up to the hype, and, simply put, they do. The sound produced by this small, one-piece system far outperforms any stereo equipment I've ever owned. The setup is simple, another advantage over a system involving multiple devices and cords.Although incredibly easy to use, the range of options is extensive, allowing most features to be customized to one's personal preference. As an alarm clock (of sorts), this flexibility gives this another advantage. Also, the built-in radio seems to get FAR better FM reception than any other radio (we live in an area where reception is usually spotty, but haven't heard any static on the Music System IV from stations that otherwise are difficult to listen to).The lack of bluetooth is a minor inconvenience, though easily overshadowed by the sound quality and ease of use. Some might think that the choice of a CD player over bluetooth is a drawback; however, for those who listen to CDs, this isn't an issue.Definitely recommended.

I've only seen a few episodes of Miles from Tomorrowland, but my favorite is one where Miles' parents are considering replacing Merc with a newer model robot. The story is cute and has made Merc my favorite character. The Miles From Tomorrowland Maximum Miles figure can sit atop Merc, or they can be played with separately. Both are larger than typical action figures, making them a good size for small hands.They are also solidly built and durable.

I've only seen a few episodes of Miles from Tomorrowland, but it's a show my son loves. This Maximum Miles figure is a good, solid figure; he's actually a larger figure than I expected, which I think makes him more playable for little kids than some of the toys that are out there. What makes Miles especially fun is that there is a Merc that pairs with him. His helmet comes off, and he can also be taken off of his blastboard. This toy allows for kids to recreate scenes from the show or just create their own imaginative stories.

I live near the end point of Historic Route 66 and, at times, we've decide to go off the well-worn path and travel down some of the remaining portions of this route just tonsee things from a different perspective and enjoy each other's company. My husband and I have talked about taking the kids on a road trip and mainly staying off the beaten path and away from overcrowded tourist spots. Unfortunately, this is not the book to get us there.The information in this book is pretty basic; I'd do as well, maybe even better, with a quick internet search or two. Theres just not enough information about the rstaurants, hotels, and attractions in this book to let me plan a road trip around it.

This is an adorable play mat for little ones. It is incredibly soft but provides baby with textures that will delight. It could honestly serve as just a decoration, it's so cute. I use it on my hardwood floor when my niece comes to visit. We just put a little blanket underneath for extra padding. She likes to grab the fabric and there are a few sections on it where it makes a crinkly noise--like a cat toy--that she finds especially interesting.This arrives neatly folded with a fabric ribbon. One of those little plastic tabs holds the whole thing together until you open it. This would make it easy to give as a gift, as it could be easily placed in a gift bag or added to a gift basket. It's the kind of thing that is so nice, you'll want to keep it long after your baby outgrows it.

I really like this oven mitt and hot pad set, but my husband thinks it's just okay. The mitt is sized well so that it fits on either hand and can accommodate a large or small hand. It's relatively thick--enough to prevent you from getting burnt, even on cast iron, but not so thick as to make it inflexible.The hot pad is much thinner than the oven mitt. It is not as resistant to heat, which is why my husband is not a huge fan of the set. He would prefer two oven mitts to remove hot and heavy items from the oven. I'm fine with just folding the pad in half, as using it opened on hot dutch oven is a little iffy if you have to go further than from oven to stove.In the end, it's a matter of preference. Both of these are good items. If I were to order again, I would prefer two mitts or two hot pads, just because they fit our usage better. Both of these, individually, are great products, though.

I generally dislike AXE products because they are so strong. Middle school boys seem especially fond of it, and they don't understand subtlety, so I've dealt with more than my fair share of AXE products. But, unlike most of the AXE products sold in black packaging, the White Label products are actually nice smelling and strong, but not overwhelming.I ordered this for my husband because he prefers a shampoo/conditioner combo. It smells good when he's showering, but is not so overpowering that I can't get into a car with him later (that has actually been a problem with some other products). My four-year-old likes to use it occasionally, referring to it as "the man shampoo." It definitely has a masculine scent that's clean and crisp.

This is an adorable little musical gym. When my three month old niece visits, we can put this out on the hardwood floor, over a blanket, and she loves it. We position her pretty close to the hanging toys, and she likes to grab them and just hold on while she checks out the other toys.It's really easy to assemble and just about impossible to put together wrong. I like that the toys can be placed on any of the loops. In fact, you can also replace them with other Fisher Price toys that use the same type of loop attachment. This disassembles easily, as well. So it's easy to store away when it's not in use.

I love to cook, and I love to share what I cook. Unfortunately, time and space have often limited what I'm able to bring to church events or work potlucks because there are only so many outlets for crockpots and, I always debate whether I make something in advance and reheat it or whether I wake up at the crack of dawn to make something fresh. In either case, transportation then becomes an issue. And that's what makes this 3 Quart Vacuum Crock Food Jar one of my favorite products in recent history.This is really a simple double insulated jar--a pretty big one, at that. It's only about a half inch thick, but that's quite enough to keep your food hot (or cold) without you feeling it on the outside. And more, without you spilling it. The lid sits flat on top, and there are four locking points that snap on and create a seal. I love my new ability to take large amounts of soups or saucy foods with me on the go, as I can totally trust the seal on this device. That being said, if you put hot liquids/sauces into this, you need to use extreme caution when opening it. Between the heat and the 4-locks, when you close it, you will basically create vacuum pressure, which in turn makes the lid difficult to get off later. This can be dangerous with thinner liquids, and I'm still working on trying to figure out the most effective way to get the lid off hot food without causing splash.I also rather like the simple look. I'm glad that there wasn't an attempt to pretty this up--it's simple and functional, and that's its appeal. It did come with two very large stickers across the circumference. These gave me a bit of pause because I have a Thermos pump pot that I love which came with similar stickers that simply cannot be removed without leaving ugly traces behind. The stickers on this Stanley jar came off easily in two single pieces, with nary a trace of adhesive residue left on the jar.I'm quite looking forward to the next potluck just so I can break this bad boy out and show it to people.

This is one of those games where the players make all the difference. With the right group, it can be tons of fun; with the wrong group--or too small a group--it can be tedious and uninspiring. Unfortunately, it's not a good fit for our family--my daughter is old enough to play, my son is too little (even on a team) to keep our dohdle secret, but he wants to be the sculptor. The game isn't super complicated, but it's not one that you can just break out and start, either. And that's another drawback for me, as in our extended family, we can't always agree on how rules should be interpreted (even when there's an obvious way) because of the depth of competition.As a group game, this can be rather entertaining; in fact, I think the more people who play, the more entertaining the game gets. As other reviewers have stated, it's a bit like pictionary or charades, with sculpting instead of acting or drawing, and those are games that just about anyone can play.

Part toy, part craft, lots of fun. My kids are forever wanting to make crafty things, and while I can sometimes come up with great ideas (ahem...pinterest), more often I'm at a loss between the crafts I see online and the reality of what we have and what the kids can actually do. We've been given a lotnof craft sets that are supposed to allow you to come upnwithbyour own creations. The problem is that they often have a lot of stuff, but not enough of any of it--not to mention few ideas of what to do with what's included.That's what makes this set different. My kids can "create," but they don't have to be especially creative in comingnup with ideas. They can focus on the decorating instead. I like that there is a plastic base that kids (or adults) design from. There are a ton of variations possible, so no two creations will look alike.The set is easy to use, and I like that then decorator tool is simple but allows my kids to feel more creative.about their designs.

This is a great product if you just want to make sure your hair looks healthy and shiny. Honestly, as burnt out as my hair is right now, this product helps keep it looking decent. But as far as styling, this hasn't done much for me. It seems to be designed more to simply keep away the frizzies than to provide styling; and it works for that.

I don't know that I'd go so far as to say this is weightless hair cream, but it is lighter than many other products I've tried. It's good at keeping away the frizzies. While I didn't notice a particular scent to it, both my husband and daughter asked me if I was wearing perfume when I was using this product.

I like the Probelle line of nail polishes, but white isn't a color I would typically choose for my whole nail. Instead, I use it to create designs, mostly on my daughter's fingers and toes. It's perfect because it goes well with any color.If you do choose to use this as a polish, it spreads easily and fairly evenly. You will definitely need more than one coat. The chalk white is a little weird for me to consider for the whole nail, but it also works if you want to give yourself a French manicure.

I love watching my 4-year-old little guy get involved with his cars and trucks. He creates his own little world that is just fun to be in. This mat is great for giving him a defined space to play in as well as giving him things to explore, especially when his older sister is feeling too old for floor play. He's got a train table, which is close in size to this, but it limits him to just the table, whereas he can still take his adventures off the mat with this if he chooses to.It rolls up nicely so it can be put away if you want to do that, but I prefer leaving it out so that he can see it and park his cars on it.

In ordering this showerhead, my biggest concern was that in getting a wide spray, we'd lose water pressure in the shower. Fortunately, that hasn't been a problem at all, and everyone just loves this showerhead. My kids say it looks and feels like a waterfall, and they've taken to using my bathroom just so they can shower under this spray.The showerhead was easy to install. It did not come with instructions, but I'm not sure whether that's because we received a complimentary one or whether that would be standard. It did come with a roll of plumbers tape that we wrapped around the threads of the shower pipe before threading the shower head over it. The head stays in place, but it also pivots so that you can adjust the direction of the spray as necessary.The two settings for the spray are as pictured and then a more narrow stream. Unfortunately, there isn't a setting to allow you to get both at once, but I don't t think the water pressure would hold up to that. It is worth noting that the pressure or your water is going to remain consistent with whatever it currently is; you will not get extra pressure from the design of this spray. I wish you could, but I think that's just not feasible.

This Youthful Vitality conditioner is just what my hair needs after a series of bleaching and dying experiments. The conditioner spreads evenly and my hair soaks it up. It rinses cleanly, but gives my hair the conditioning that it needs, as all of its natural moisture has been stripped away.
This is a great product for when I want to blow out my hair. It is easy to work through my hair, and I can get good results with it. It lasts through the day, even if humid weather.

Babies have a natural curiosity and want to expore the work around them. Hard to do when you can't even roll over or sit up yet, but this little sit-me-up seat is a great solution.My niece is two months old. She can support her own head, but she can't sitnup on her own. She loves this seat where she can watch all the goings-on around her. The seat is fun and colorful looking.It has two toys that attach to the front with included blast if rings. One is a soft plastic flower like thing that will be perfect for when she starts teething and needsnsomething to chew on. The other is a bitterly. The body is a sof plastic, while the wings are fabric which makes a crinkly sound when squeezed. The size is just right for her to be able to hold a wing in each hand. The length of the attachments is just enough for her to reach them (with some help), but not long enough to pose any hazards.The seat is easy to assemble and folds flat when not in use. This makes it easy to store or take with you. The fabric seat cover can be removed to be washed, and then attached toys are interchangeable as the plastic rings are like the ones found on similar baby seats, playmats, etc.The back of the seat comes about halfway up baby's head, providing complete support of her neck. By the time her head will come up higher, she will not need the additional neck support. The seat is designed so that her back and legs are fully supported by fabric. She won't ever feel like she's dangling.This needs to sit directly on the ground, not non a table or other chair. But it will still make for a good seat when baby begins eating.

I use this in the mornings when I simply don't have time for anything other than a quick comb through my short but curly hair. I can finger comb this product through my hair, put a part down the side, and comb it back. If I don't want to do anything else, it'll keepnmy hair manageable, if not stylish, for the rest of the day.If I wait about an hour, I can run my fingers through my now-dry locks and let my hair show off some of its natural body and curl. This product keeps the frizzies away without making my hair fell stiff or sticky.

I love the Tresemme Perfectly (un)Done line of styling products. Like the other products in the line, this gelee spreads easily through my hair and requires minimum fuss when styling. I can put it in my hair and just let my natural curls take over. A quick few minutes with a diffuser sets my hair without making it crunchy.The one thing I don't care for with this product is that it's a bit stickier feeling than the (un)Done spray. It still doesn't make my hair crunchy like lots of other gels, so I'd definitely use it again. I'd just pick up the (un)Done sea salt spray first.

We seem to have an endless number of cords behind the t.v.--for the set itself, for the cable, the blu-ray player, the soundbar, three gaming systems,  a computer tower, a router. In order to get all the cords powered up, we use two heavy duty power strips that also have their own cords which connect to the electrical outlet. It's a bit of a mess, but we thought this power outlet would help tidy it up.Unfortunately, this surge protector actually takes up both outlets, limiting its usefulness. Yes, we go from two outlets to six, but we lose the ability to use another surge protector in the second outlet. This just makes it a no go for our intended purposes.I was sorely disappointed.

This is a rather small magnetized dry-erase surface attached to a very strong magnet. The LED lights are more decorative than functional simply because the size of this doesn't really allow you to use it in a way that would really require lighting. Because the board is thick, protruding from the surface you attach it to, you'll have to be careful about where you place it. If this were maybe double the size, it would be rather useful. But as it is, there is hardly enough surface space to write on. You're almost better off with a post-it note.

While sold as "Candy" labels, these are really a rather versatile product. They work great to decorate kisses, as seen in the product picture. Likewise, they can be added to the ends of rolled candies like Lifesavers or Rolos.Personally, I like to use them on the bottom of my acrylic paint bottles. I can add just a dab of paint to the label so that the color of the paint is visible when I store them upside down in plastic containers. This allows me to see what the actual color of the paint inside the bottle is. Given the hundreds of variations of the rainbow that I seem to have accumulated, it doesn't get any easier.

This is a wonderful way of colorful dry-erase markers. The colors--even the yellow and light green--show up bright against my whiteboard, so I know that students can see what I've written, even from across the room. The tips are on par with the Expo markers that I usually use.These are described as low-odor, but they are virtually scentless. I can't smell them when I'm using them, and had to sniff to determine whether they gave off any odor at all. Two black markers are included with a color array varied enough to allow you to do just about anything you want with these.While I took these to my classroom, my kids have indicated that they would love a set of these markers for their whiteboard at home. I told them no, but Santa just might deliver.

I really love these oval Kraft labels. In keeping with the homemade look and feel, I don't use them in my printer. I like to write on them with a Sharpie and use them to label mason jars. They are simple, but classic.They don't initially peel off easily, but the surface you adhere these to will clean up easily under water.

This tooth whitening product isn't difficult to use. You use one tube of paste to brush, spitnwithout rinsing, then use the second tube to polish your teeth. It's a pretty simple routine.I was worried about tooth sensitivity using this product, but it turns out that wasn't an issue at all. What is an issue is gum sensitivity and whitening. While brushing with the first tube of paste, it felt like my gums were getting polished as much as my teeth. Now, maybe it was me brushing too hard, even though it felt like I was brushing normally. I guess I could have been brushing harder and just not realized it.I would have given this product a second chance, but when I looked in then mirror after just one use, I didn't see any change in the color of my teeth. No problem....except that I saw a huge difference in my gums--the edges were all white. In fact, it looked like  I had just eaten a loafnof white bread and hadnit stuck to my teeth. Rinsing with water didn't clear this up. In fact, a full 24 hours later, my gums were still white and they were sensitive too.This product might be great for some people, but I'm going to have to spare my gums. Something in it is much too strong for me. Even three days later, my gums still feel raw.

I'm not big on sweets that don't include chocolate, and when in ordered these, it was with my husband and kids in mind. They've got sweet tooth's that don't quit. Bit when the huge tin arrived, I had to at least give them a try.These caramels are amazing. Unlike the Brach's caramel which are pretty much the only mass produced ones I'm familiar with, these were not dense and chewy. Instead, they are soft and very creamy. There is a subtle difference in the tastes of the caramel, caramel and vanilla, and caramel and butterscotch. They were all sweet, but not overly so. And they didn't stick in my teeth.The 2.25 pound the is a very generous size. The tin itself is simply designed, which makes it perfect for gifting or just putting out for guests any time of year.

I'm not sure what it is about kids, but they love mechanical pencils. I think that goes double for my fourth-grader, who wasn't allowed to use them in her classroom last year. We purchased this set because her school suggested that pencils and erasers might be more useful and long-lasting (as well as healthier) than bringing in cupcakes for birthdays.I love the Cadoozle mechanical pencils because they feel almost like a standard pencil in your hand. They have a nice white eraser that erases cleanly and that fits the look of the pencil. I like that they don't have a clip on the side and they don't unscrew at the bottom. These things often present too much distraction to kids as they play with them in class.The awards pencils are primarily white, with the printed phrases  "Good Job,!" "Great Work!," "A+," and "#1." Each of the pencils is identical, so that every one has the same positive message and you don't have to filter which ones would fit which kids.

We are in the process of changing all of the switch plates in our house because the homebuilders cheaped out and we've read online that some of the electrical issues we're experiencing may be the fault of poorly installed or cheap switches and plates. We'd already purchased several Leviton 5621-2W 20-Amp 120/277-Volt Decora Plus Rocker Single-Pole AC Quiet Switch, Whites as we move from room to room, so when this antimicrobial switch was offered to me, I thought it would be the perfect replacement for the garbage disposal switch.Installing this switch is as simple as installing any other electrical switch. As with anything electrical, read the directions and shut off the power supply to the house before beginning. I can't attest to just how effective the antimicrobial additive in these switches is, as I don't have a kit to run comparative tests. But I figure any additional protection is better than nothing.What I love most about this switch probably isn't the antimicrobial properties, but the look. The little box which usually frames the switches is gone, and I think it gives the switch a cleaner look at the same time as it gives little germs fewer crevices to hide between.

My 9 year-old currently fits clothes sized between an 8 and a 10, but these pants were way too big for her to currently wear, even after adjusting the elastic in the waistband. The material is of decent quality and is and sewn well, but it's hard to get a proper gauge on the fit when both the waist and the length are so much larger than we expected. I usually buy a size up so that she can grow into her clothes and they'll get us through the school year. These might have to wait until next semester, if not next year.Part of the problem with the fit on these is probably because of the front pleat. It causes the pants to gather at her hips and waist and creates poofs of bunched fabric that are difficult to work around. It's just not very flattering. When she grows into them, I will reevaluate the fit and adjust this review accordingly.

I'd read some work by Kerrigan Byrne when she was mostly publishing directly to e-book format. They were pretty decent, not great, but good enough to make me remember her name. So when I had the opportunity to check out this "debut historical," I jumped at the chance. And I was not at all disappointed.***POSSIBLE SPOILER***(There is a potential plot spoiler in the next paragraph. Though I think that most readers will make this discovery almost immediately, or at least within the first few chapters, actual confirmation doesn't come until later in the book, so I include the alert as a precaution.)The story starts with two orphans--Farrah and Dougan. Theirs is an innocent friendship born of cruel circumstances, and they are torn apart while both are still too young to really have a romantic attachment to each other. It's years later when Farrah encounters the infamous Dorian Blackwell. Most readers will immediately recognize that Dorian is a reborn Dougan, though it takes Farrah a bit longer.****END SPOILER****Dorian is the ultimate troubled hero. He thinks of himself as soulless and unredeemable. But Farrah immediately starts to care for him. And, though she is innocent, she recognizes the strength of the sexual tension that runs between them. This tension and the ultimate fulfillment of their desires makes for some delicious reading. For all that he is not the typical hero, Dorian is a wonderfully attractive and likable one.Farrah is maybe slightly too good to be true, but I liked her nonetheless, especially because she is such a loyal character without being a doormat.In addition to the romance, there is some action and suspense written into the story as well. The secondary characters are well written, and I look forward to the next book in the series.

I ordered these Kraft Brown Square Labels for their rustic appeal, and for that reason, I used a Sharpie rather than my printer to write on them. I wrote different flavors on them and stuck these to mason jars. They definitely help enhance the handmade appeal. They are also super sticky, so I didn't have to worry about them coming off.They don't peal off easily when dry. In fact, they don't stay in one piece, so if you try to take them off dry, it leaves a big mess. However, the simple solution is to wet the labels. After just a couple of seconds, the adhesive will loosen up and the paper and adhesive can be removed without leaving a trace.

These are a good quality, fairly lightweight pair of shorts. Although they sell as uniform shorts, they are good for any occasion. They can be dressed up with a nice polo or button down shirt, but they also work with a simple t-shirt. They are well-made and fit well. They have the adjustable elastic hidden inside the waistband which I find absolutely necessary for my little one.

The talking Joy doll speaks five phrases--"Come on, group hug!" "Another perfect day!" "Think positive." "I've got a great idea!" "Ha, ha! We made it!"She has a slightly oversized, but soft head that looks much better in person than in the product picture. Her arms and legs are soft, but the mechanism for sound is located in her torso, which is hard. Because that part of the doll is so slender, though, it actually gives Joy a solidity that she needs.This is a doll that's easy to hold onto. She is the perfect size to be held when my little guy curls up in bed. She can tuck in right next to him, and he can wrap just his hand or his whole arm around her. Since the sound on the plush is activated through her hand, it's not an issue with her talking in his sleep (at least, not unless he's making her do it).

This is a clear gel pomade that has a consistency thicker than any I've experienced before--it's like sticking your fingers in a tub of shortening--only it's denser. My husband uses it on his hair just to tame it a little. It's perfect for that. I've tried it on my 4-year-old to try to give him spikes, and it's okay for that. In the morning, the spikes look great, have a great shine, and are adorable. By the end of the day, his hair is still shiny, but flat. Now I've got a sweaty little guy, and his hair gets soaked when he's playing, so that might have something to do with it, but this gel pomade is definitely not a max hold for him.My husband generally prefers to use the Got2b Playful Texturizing Crème Pomade, 2-Ounce (Pack of 3), but they are no longer as inexpensive or as easily available as they once were. He says that this pomade is probably the next best thing. It has a slightly citrusy scent, but it's not especially noticeable. For his uses, it's great. For spikes and sculpting, we're still on the look out for something a little stronger and more sweat resistant.

Whennit first arrived, I was disappointed in this case. It looks like really cheap plastics. Okay, honestly, it IS really cheap plastic. But when I put it on my phone, it looks quite good.The plastic has some sort of coating on it that gives it a rubberized feel. It's still just cheap plastic. But it's also effective enough at protecting my phone. I've dropped it a few times without any issues.I purchased this case in red. Its a good red--not orange, not pink.

I love some of the Tresemme styling products that I've tried lately, especially the ones that are supposed to help manage my curls. So I had high expectations for this Making Waves Shaping Gel Cream. Unfortunately, it reminds me too much of the gels that were around in the 80s when I was still in school. This gel cream is thick, sticky, and very definitely there in my hair. Unlike the TRESemme,TRESemme Expert Selection Gelee, Perfectly (un)Done Wave Perfecting 3.3 oz that I've fallen in love with, this cream doesn't disappear into my hair. In fact, it makes my hair just a bit crunchy, and I can feel it all day long.

When I opened my first bag of Annie Chun's Seaweed Crisps, my plan was just to try them out before dinner. But my da9-year-old and I finished the bag in a matter of minutes. They are that good.If you've ever had http://www.amazon.com/JFC-Nori-Arare-Crackers-Ounce/dp/B004OQKPDS/ref=sr_1_12?s=grocery&ie=UTF8&qid=1442104439&sr=1-12&keywords=nori+maki or rice crackers like them, you will recognize the flavor of these. The seaweed is very light, the rice cracker very subtle. But it's the Gochujang flavoring that put this snack over the top. Unlike the Japanese rice crackers that I'm more familiar with, these are flat. That means a better seaweed to cracker ratio. And it also means that the seasoning is evenly distributed on every cracker.I'm not going to lie, if you don't like nori (dried seaweed), this will have no appeal. But if you do like it, you're in for a treat. These crackers are sweet with just a touch of spice,and they make a great snack. The bag says there are two servings inside. I'd say it's more like one very hefty serving because I can't imagine anyone stopping at half a bag while the rest of it still beckons.

I really like the Cadoozles mechanical pencils that have the look and feel of a regular wooden pencil. In fact, we just ordered a rather large set of them for my daughter to pass out to the class for her birthday, and they were a hit with the kids. I figured she'd like these colored pencils well enough. But I wasn't prepared to love them myself.These are my new favorite colored pencils. I was planning to give them to my daughter, but I think she's going to have to wait until I order another set. Like Crayola Crayola Twistable Colored Pencils, 12 count (68-7408), these colored pencils have lead that  can be released or retracted to the length that you prefer when coloring or drawing. But I find the lead in these to feel smoother, and I think the colors are bolder. The triangular shape is also easier to grip. I guess I'm a "hard" colorer because I'm always breaking crayons, but the shape of these pencils allows me to color without putting a lot of pressure on them. And if I do push a bit too much with my fingers, it's okay becaue the plastic barrel doesn't break.I love the fact that the pencil barrels are the same color as the lead inside. it makes them easy and fun to use. For students, the traingular barrels also mean that they're easier to use and keep track of on sometimes overcrowded desks. I like these well enough to sneak in some coloring in my kids' books while they're not looking. And I may even order some mandalas for myself because there really is something relaxing about coloring.

This book started off with great potential, but by the end it devolved into something worthy of Jerry Springer. Jessie is the most beautiful woman in London (as the narrator frequently reminds us), but she had a difficult past which is hinted at for the first half of the novel before a revelation of the obvious is made. Daniel is a doctor and a vicar and a saint.They fall in lust at first sight. Then, with a bit of sloppy plot development, they are married. From there, the story is more about Jessie being freed from her past than it is about any romance between the two characters. In fact, while I enjoyed the chemistry and tension between the two when they were resisting each other (which was in about the blink of an eye), once they decide to marry, the story became a bit dull and rather predictable.I've enjoyed many books by Mary Jo Putney in the past, including several in the Lost Lords series. Unfortunately, if this had been the first book of hers I'd read, it would have also been the last.

The product picture, at least on my computer screen, makes this look like a soft, muted peach color. But pay attention to the name--peach side babe--as a true indicator. This polish is actually a bright pinkish orange that reminds me of my childhood in the 80s. My 9-year-old loves the color, and I guess it is kind of rad on her. But the skin on my hands isn't quite as supple and firm as in my younger days, and I've got a medium skin tone, and this nail polish is sort of glaring on top of it.The polish glides on easily, but unevenly. You need to use two coats, but I wouldn't recommend more. The first coat I put on was clearly darker on some areas than others. I wasn't sure that just one more coat could smooth it out, but it eventually did. And the polish dries super fast, so that by the time I was done with my second hand, I was able to put another coat on the first. But the polish looks thicker than I'd like, and I think mistakes show up pretty easily.

My husband hates to use dishcloths because he seems to think they take up too much space, and if you leave them sitting, they stink. I hate sponges because I think they're bacteria magnets and they stink. Paper towels would be a solution, except for the sheer numbers we'd have to use to get anything cleaned. They make those disposable Clorox Handi Wipes Multi-Use Reusable Cloths, 72 Cloths wipes, but they aren't very durable, and they are way too big. They also present a lot of waste.Washable and reusable, but also biodegradable over time, these Now Designs Swedith Dishcloths are a great solution. They are about the size of a standard washcloth, but they look like a stiff, thick paper until you dampen them. Then they have a more towel-like texture and can be used for wiping down tables and countertops, cleaning dishes, or other light work. They aren't good for scrubbing, but they are definitely sturdy enough to be used again and again before being washed and used again and again. After use, you can lay them flat or drape them over something and allow them to air dry. They will dry out and stiffen up until you rewet them.I really like these dishcloths for dishes, but I would prefer them slightly larger for table top cleaning.

We received two of these Stay-N-Play Balance Balls--one in lime, another in pink. Though all indications on the box would make you think they'd be exactly the same except for color, the pink ball is markedly smaller than the green one. This wasn't a big deal to us, as my youngest child wanted the green one anyway, but I don't know if it's a quality control issue or something that represents an inconsistency across all balls. Regardless, I make note of it, but it wasn't a big issue for us.My kids love these balls. They were a bit perplexed by the nubs that fall onto one side of the ball because, unlike what we expected from the product picture, those nubs cannot support the ball. My son calls the nubs cow butts, which tells you something about the look (he doesn't know what udders are). Still, the kids like these things. They use them to balance the ball (not quite successfully) on top of their heads, to swing the ball around (even though they're not supposed to), and to hold onto as they balance their bellies on the ball. And when they don't want to deal with the udders, they just put them on the underside and sit.As much as my kids like sitting and rolling on these balls, I think they enjoy the sound they make just as much. The material is a heavy rubber, much like the bouncy balls that are in big racks in toy stores. When you slap them, they make a sort of hollow sound that is fun for kids, if not a bit annoying to adults. We encourage them to drum these things in the hall closest to their room--it makes a good echo and isn't too close.These balanceballs are providing lots of play opportunities for the kids, and if they're promoting good posture at the same time, I'm going to continue to encourage their use.

While this bubble bath is not overly bubbly it did feel good on my skin which has been drying out lately due to the weather. I also have sensitive skin and react to perfumes and some chemicals to the point where my breathing can be effected.  This feels great on my skin and does not cause any reactions on my skin or effect my breathing in any way. I also use this as a shower gel because it feels so nice on my body.This is great for a nice calming bubble bath. At my age bubbles are not a big thing. Relaxing in a hit tub of water which feels nice on my skin is all I want. It is also great as a shower gel.  If you are getting this for a child or adult who likes lots of bubbles they may want more bubbles.

I have been trying new razors and shaving creams for years.  This is very good shaving cream. A little goes a long way. Since it is not a foamy shave cream I can see my face better and shave better.I look for three things in a shaving cream. I want it to feel good on my face and this does. I want to help me get a close shave and this does. I want it to last and this does. Once I am done shaving my face feels great. This is a very good foam-free shaving cream.

The idea of putting coconut oil in individual packets works.  The coconut oil is in sold form allowing it to be used on the skin as well as using it for cooking. If you use it for cooking the packet allows exact measurements. Once heated the solid oil melts and can be used for cooking.I have never thought of coconut oil as anything other than something in which to cook food. I have used this on my dry hands and it does act as a moisturizer. I have put some on my lips when I went out in the sun and it moistened them and tasted great.I have used this mostly for cooking.  Each packet is  tablespoon. I like to use this when I am cooking eggs or vegetables or some items that does not need a lot of cooking oil. Rather than pour some liquid in a measuring cup this allows me to open the packet and get exactly ½ tablespoon of coconut oil.If you plan on cooking with a lot of coconut oil there are better options but if you use a little each time this is a great alternative. Also, while I am not an expert on coconut oil this seems like a high quality product.

This is a nice gift idea for someone with a baby. I could also see someone with a baby buying this because of the quality of Burt’s Bees products.  The package looks nice with a bow on top and the option to put a picture on the inside of the packaging makes this a great gift idea. In addition this comes with four practical items for anyone with a baby.This comes with eight ounces of tear free baby shampoo and wash, six ounces of lotion, three ounces of zinc oxide for diaper rash and a nice small bar of soap. My only negative is that while the bar of soap is cute it is really small.These products are free from synthetic fragrances. Burt’s Bees are quality products.

I am not a fan of these bars because of the taste and fat content. This is the first time I have tried a hemp bar.Taste is subjective. Some people commenting on these bars say that they like the taste.  I taste a slightly nutty flavor combined with a slightly bitter flavor. I don’t taste any apple or cinnamon.  These are more bland to me than anything else. I have not tried a hemp bar before so maybe I am not accustomed to the flavors. Others could taste something different I suppose.I am also concerned about the fat content.  The box says each bar contains 15 grams of fat of which 1.5 grams is saturated fat, 0 is trans fat, 10 grams is polyunsaturated fat and 2 grams is monounsaturated fat.  Of the 230 calories 140 are from fat. I know there are good and bad fats but for me this is a lot of fat.  I like low fat products so these are not bars I would get again.I give these three stars because of the taste and fat content. I could see other people liking these though.

This is fascinating book where Christians from all denominations each share there understanding of a different question asked by Jesus in one of the four gospels. It was fascinating and thought provoking to read what many of the different Christians had to say. My only quibble is that I do think this book has a broad interpretation of the term “Christian leader.” I wish the title had called the Christians in this book notable Christians rather than “Christian leaders.”When I  think of Christian leaders I think of Christians who lead churches or nuns or priests who lead orders or Christian theologians whose works influence Christian thought or Christian academics at seminaries or theology schools.  The Christian leaders listed in this book include authors, actors, singers, clergy and academics. Roma Downey, Lecrae, Mark Burnett and Amy Grant are examples of artists who I would not consider Christian leaders. There are modern Christian authors listed who I would not consider Christian leaders because I don’t believe writing about Christian subjects makes a person a Christian leader.I did enjoy reading much of  what was in this book.  Roma Downey, Lecrae, Mark Burnett and Amy Grant all had interesting things to say.  Some people focused on personal stories to explain what Jesus had to say while other had a broader theological explanation. I found something interesting in what everyone had to say.The first question explored is “If you love those who love you, what reward will you get?” (Matthew 5:46-47.) The question is explored by Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby. Archbishop Welby is my idea of a Christian leader. I found what he had to say thought provoking. Others like Gene Robinson a retired Episcopal Bishop, Cardinal Timothy Dolan the Roman Catholic Archbishop of New York and Charles Chaput the Roman Catholic Archbishop of Philadelphia fall into what I would consider Christian leaders.Most of meditations in this book are three to four pages. All are worth reading. Some are insightful and thought provoking while others are just interesting and worthy of thinking about.I like the diversity of people in this book. Christian denominations seem to be well represented. As a Catholic I found it interesting reading what other Christians had to say knowing that Catholics were included in this book.I really like this  book. I like the diversity of those included in this book. I would not consider all of them Christian leaders but rather notable Christians.

The Sherpa lining along with the cotton material  makes this feel great when I put it on. The denim look makes this a great shirt when you are looking to go casual. It is important you read the size chart to make sure it fits.
