I usually get XL shirts but this was a bit small because I did not read the size chart.I have never tried a Sherpa lining before and I love it. It feels really soft. I will look to by other shirts with this lining.The denim is soft and looks as it does on the picture on the page. The buttons are simple but nice looking. This a great shirt to wear when you want a casual look.  Because of the lining and the look this is something I would wear in the cooler months.It held up well when I washed it. It is supposed to be washed in cold water and dried in the low cycle.It is important to check the size chart on this before ordering it. I usually wear XL casual shirts and sweat shirts.  The size chart for XL for this shirt lists the chest at 44.75 inches and the waist at 37 inches. I have not been a 37 inch waist for years and I usually assume XL will cover a much larger waist. Wrangler has a size chart listed so it is important to check it out before ordering. I ordered before reading it so while the shirt fits I can’t button it. It gives me a good reason to lose weight.I really like this shirt. I can’t wait to lose some weight so it fits perfectly.

I work outside a lot and the skin on my hands tends to get rough. This makes my hands feel and look better.This comes out on the thick side but quickly absorbs into my skin.  It feels nice. After a few uses I have noticed the hardness and roughness of some of the skin on my hands has gone away. Over all my hands feel and look better. I also have used this on rough patches of skin on my elbows and knees and that has improved.The mild and pretty much nonexistent smell of this cream is important to me. I don’t like perfume like smells on me.This is a great men’s hand cream. It really works for me.

These are nice strong plastic cups that are perfect for parties and when watching Michigan football.  The colors are bright and are the Michigan colors.The cups hold 18 ounces of liquid which is a good amount. The cups are made of a quality plastic and will last the whole party and or  game.  These are prefect for any Michigan fans.

This  feels nice on my skin and has a mild scent. It is a spray but looks foamy on my skin once I spray it on me. I then rub the lotion over my skin.I like the idea of spraying on body lotion. This is easier spread on the skin than regular lotion. This feels very nice on my skin. It feels cool at first and soft and silky on my skin.  I like the way my skin looks after using it.I have some dry spots on my knees and elbows and this works great on those spots.  I have also used this after working out in the sun and it made my skin feel nice and cool and soft.This is a great way of making my skin feel nice and cool and soft. It is easy to use and has a mild smell.

It is nice to read works of faith by those who views would be deemed unconventional by some. How can you get any more unconventional then a pastor who is described on the back of her own book as a former stand-up comic who is tattooed, angry and profane. Interestingly, I found most of what she had to say to be in line with  mainstream Christian thought and found her humility to be saint like.One of reasons I picked up this book was because of the quote by  Fr. Richard Rohr, on this Amazon page, in which he says Pastor Nadia thinks like he does only she says what she is thinking so much better and with more humor, living examples, “and a conviction that will convict you!” I have read a few books by Fr. Rohr and I do see a similarity in that he and Pastor Nadia book seek and find holiness in people and incidents that are often overlooked and ignored by many clergy and many people.This book is broken into 19 chapters most of which are focused on incidents and people who are part of her congregation the “House For All Saints And Sinners.”  She discusses the Blessed Virgin Mary, Good Friday, the Easter Vigil and the Church Year. All these are almost Orthodox and while she puts her own unique spin on each story I found her views to be very much in line with main stream Christian thinking.She takes on serious subjects like the  killings at Sandy Hook Elementary School and how “church was never meant to be a place for escapism.” Church needs to be a place where the evil in this world is discussed. I can’t agree more.Pastor Nadia  admits how early in her tenure at her church she was taken aback by how many “socially awkward people”showed up at her church and how the church would never have a chance if these were the people who showed up. She eventually realized how important these people are and how we are all socially awkward and imperfect.I have been so frustrated at times at my parish (I am Catholic) while listening yet again to one more homily at Church about how we are all brothers and sisters in Christ while  there are people sitting alone and  hurting in the pews all around me. I want a priest to acknowledge that life is hard and people struggle and loneliness and pain are part of this world and there is a good chance there is someone in the pew near me who can use my help and maybe I should tell one of these people we are brothers and sisters in Christ and I want to help. I  have a funny feeling people at pastor Nadia’s church are more comfortable doing this than at my church.Pastor Nadia reminds us that we are all flawed, including her, yet we all can become accidental saints. I am glad I read this book.

This comes with a nice case that offers protection for the Galaxy S6 as well as three frames that allow you to change the look of your case without buying a new one. This is a great idea.The case offers nice protection. The inside of it seems like a soft plastic that should protect your phone if it is dropped. Instead of being flat inside the case has a special pattern which is supposed to hold the phone in place if dropped. It fits the phone well.The bumper frames look good. They are easy to remove and put on the case.  This is a great way of changing the look of you case without buying a new one.This is a great way to protect your phone and make it look nice as well with the three bumper frames.

These are scented markers that are easy to wash off if you get them on your hands. The smell varies from marker to marker but for the most part they smell nice and all are good markers.In my pack of four markers I got red (cherry), yellow (banana), green (mint) and blue (blueberry). The green has moderate spearmint like smell. It has a nice green color. The blue has a strong sweet, candy like, blueberry scent and has a nice blue color. The red has a mild cherry scent and a nice red color. The yellow has a strong, candy like, banana scent and a nice yellow color.  I notice the smells even after the markers are on paper. The colors are what I would expect in markers and look very much like the colors of the markers.This is supposed to wash of any washable materials. It washed of my hands without a problem. I have not tried washing it off clothes. The box has a warning that it should be kept away from wallpaper or painted walls, finished or unfinished wood, vinyl carpeting and other materials that cannot be laundered.These are good markers that have scents that match with the colors.  The scents last even when they are on paper. Theese did wash off my hands without a problem. These are very good, washable, scented markers.

Even though this is listed as an AmazonBasics cable this is as good a quality as any name brand. It is well made and the picture quality on my monitor is excellent using this cable.I used this to connect my computer to a monitor. The cable connected perfectly to both my computer tower and my monitor.  The connection is strong at both ends.The ends of the VGA connectors are gold plated.  The cable is well made and looks like it will last a long time.The graphics and picture quality on my monitor are excellent using this cable. It is as good as  any name brand cable.

This is a well made game that is easy to play and at the same time harder than it looks. It is addicting.  My only issue is that you need an overhang or ceiling near the hook  to play the game so it is hard to find a spot to play outside and you need to be willing to screw an eye hook into a ceiling or overhang.The product itself is well made. The board and ring it is on are quality products. They look nice on a wall. This could stand alone as a hook on which a person could hang his or her keys or even a light jacket.  This comes with tape to attach the back board to a wall if you don’t want to use screws.The game itself is simple but addicting. It should be easy to get the ring on the hook but it is not. It is frustrating when someone else does and I can’t. When I play with friends the loser always wants to play one more game because it should be easy getting the ring on the hook.  Having a string attached to the ring makes sure you don’t lose the ring and can affect the direction of the ring based on how the ring is tossed.My one criticism of this is that in order to play an eye hook needs to be screwed into a ceiling or overhang near the back board and hook to play the game. A string is attached to the eye hook and the ring so when the ring is thrown at the hook the string is attached to it.The product description currently on this web page says this can be played indoors as well as outdoors. If the game is played outdoors you need to be near some sort of overhang or ceiling to screw in the eye hook. If the game is played indoors you need to be willing to screw the eye hook into a ceiling or overhang.I have plaster and tile ceilings in most of my house and I did not like the idea of screwing an eye hook into either. I wound up using this in my basement where I have wood beams. I think this game would also work if the string was attached to a person’s wrist so a ceiling or overhang was not necessary.This is a simple fun game. The back board and hook are well made and look nice. My one issue is having to screw an eye hook into a ceiling or overhang.

This is a sturdy box spring that will support a mattress well. It is a nice color.When this was delivered the delivery man carried this all by himself. I on the other hand needed a friend to help me move the box spring to my bedroom. It is not overly heavy and in some cases one person can move it and in other cases it may take two people.I currently have an old Serta mattress and by replacing the old existing box spring with this new one the mattress seems  more firm. I eventually plan to get a new Serta mattress to go with this. I would think it should work even better with a new mattress.This is nine inches high. It easily fit onto the frame that my old box spring used.  I like the blue color of this box spring. It is a nice color for a bedroom.This is a well made box spring that is firm and gives excellent support to a mattress.

These dish towels are so soft and nice looking they seem more like fancy cloth napkins to me. I am not complaining since I enjoy having very nice looking soft dishtowels.These are made in India and are 100 percent cotton. I don’t know what type of cotton was used but it is a very soft cotton. I love the design. The Fleur De Lis design is framed nicely at the bottom of the towel, in part, by white thread as the picture on this page shows. I did not see any lose threads and the sewing looks very well done. There is also a strip of material at the top corner of the towels that allow the towels to be hung on a hook.I followed the care directions and washed these in cold water and the put them in my dryer on the gentle low cycle.  They came out fine and had few wrinkles. The can be ironed but considering they are towels I did not bother.These are fancy looking dishtowels that are soft. They wash well. They look great in my kitchen but I have also used them in my bathroom as hand towels.

This is surprisingly light but it works well. It is strong and looks like it will last and most importantly is well designed.When I first saw this I was impressed with the design. It works well as a wheel chock or tongue dock. Once in place a wheel or trailer tongue will not move.Because it is light it is easy to move and can be stored anywhere. The orange color stands out. It is also easy to clean with soap and water but a hose will work fine at times.This is a simple product that works well. It will ensure that your trailer does not move.

This offers some of the best protection for a smart phone I have yet to see. It is a little bulky but it is worth it to protect what has become an essential part of many people’s lives.The OtterBox case is strong and offers a number of types of protection for your phone. . According to the description this is due to a  polycarbonate shell, a silicone slipcover and a built-in screen protector. You cane feel how strong the case is when holding it. The screen protector does a good job protecting the screen.The case fits well on my phone while allowing for easy access to it.  It also has a belt clip holster which is okay.This is a little bulky but it is worth it for the protection. It offers excellent protection for an HTC phone.

Despite having read a number of books about the Civil War this book introduced me to an aspect of Civil War diplomacy/spying of which I knew little about. It is an interesting read that should appeal to and Civil War or history buffs.The book explores the activities of Robert Bunch who was British Consul in Charleston, South Carolina beginning in 1853. While personally against slavery, as was the British government, Mr. Bunch let those around him believe he favored it allowing him access to key figures in the South leading up to and during the Civil War. Interestingly Bunch was viewed as friendly toward the South by the North when in fact he was against British involvement in the war.The book looks at the Southern leaders from the perspective of Bunch as well as British diplomatic relations with the United States during this time. The book suggests that the one of the key reasons Britain kept out of the war was its unwillingness to support slavery in the South in any form.While I have read about American and British diplomacy during the civil war I never knew about Mr. Bunch. I also never realized how strong a role Britain’s hatred of slavery played  in its refusal to help the South.This book is in part a history of the Civil War from a British perspective and in part a spy novel of sorts where a British Consul pretends to favor slavery and the South when he supports neither. History and Civil War Buffs should really enjoy this as well as anyone with an interest in the Civil War.

This is a simple toy that worked well for me for the most part. It reminded me of toys I had as a child.There are two factors that seem to influence how this works.  The first factor is how hard you pull the string. Pulling the string affects how high the disc will go and how long it will spin.  The other factor is how you hold the base.  The angle of the base will determine the direction of the disc and how well it climbs walls or fly.This comes with six flying modes. The first five were easy to do.  The three indoor modes Twister, WalllRiser and Rock’N Roof worked fine for me as long as I pulled the sting hard enough. As long as there is enough spin the disc will twirl on the ceiling, wall or floor.Two of the three outdoor modes were simple as well. All I needed to do to make Shocking Fight work was pull the sting hard and angle the base slightly. For Shuttle Flight all I needed to do was pull the string hard and hold the base straight.How hard the string is pulled will determine how far and how high the disc will travel. I can see younger children not having the strength to make the disc go as far as adults.I had a bit of trouble with Boomerang. It took a few tries to hold the base at the right angle for the disc to come back and while it came back it never came straight.  This might just take more practice.The disc is made of a soft plastic so it will not easily break.  The base is made of a hard plastic. This overall construction is okay.This reminds me of tops with strings that I had as a child as well as a plastic toy gun which had discs that came with it which when I pulled the trigger of the  gun would fly in the air. This seems to have combined the best of both of these items. It is an entertaining toy to use at home or bring to a park.

This reads like a well crafted spy novel only it is true. Considering the ending I wish it was not.The book looks at how hard it was for the United States to develop spies in Russia in part because of doubts about their authenticity and the real threat of the KGB.  A Russian then offers intelligence to  the United States only to be doubted at first. He would then become one of the CIA’s biggest assets.The book looks at how Adolf Tolkachev approached the United States and why he wanted to spy on his own country. It looks at how he was vetted and how he passed information to the Americans. The book also looks at how this information helped the United States.This is a well documented book. It reads like a spy novel but it is written with an eye to detail and offers detailed support for what is written. This is fact that reads like fiction, which makes it an extremely enjoyable read.I am glad I got to read about  Adolf Tolkachev and all he did.  As the description about this book on Amazon explains, Mr. Tolkachev was eventually betrayed. I won’t go into details about how and what happened but it was the only thing about the book I wish were not true.This is a fascinating read. David Hoffman is an excellent writer.

This looks like someone used a tire design when making this case. I have seen better looking cases but this offers very good protection.The case/stand is made of a silicone skin which does a good job protecting a Nexus 9.  The information on the Amazon page seems to focus on the ruggedness of this product and the overall protection it offers. I agree that it offers above average protection.This goes on a Nexus 9 easily. The stand feature works fine. There is a screen protector that looks good as well. It does not limit the use of a Nexus 9 in any way.I have mixed feeling about the look of this. I would have no problem using this outside or if I had a job that required a lot of physical activity. I am not sure if I would be comfortable using something with such a rugged look in a formal office setting. Still it offers above average protection.

This is a professional looking weekly planner. It has good writing space for a weekly planner and comes with two satin bookmarks.This looks nice. It has hardback textured paper bookbound back and front covers. The covers do not bend and will protect this planner.  When you open the front cover there are tabs for each month  making it easy to access each month. Two satin bookmarks also make it easy to mark pages with important dates. Each month starts with a calendar on two pages with1.65 x 1.65 blocks that allow for brief notes to be made. The next two pages have the first seven days of the week listed and a block for notes.  Each day is a  4 x 2.75 inch ruled block with ten lines.  Considering this is a weekly calendar there is good space to makes notes regarding meetings and deadlines.  I have a daily planner with a page devoted to each day which offers more space for each day  but it is bulkier and does not give me a sense of the week like this weekly planner does.There are 12 ruled pages at the end of the planner that can be used for notes and contacts. This also has holidays for the next four years and a list of time zones at the end of the planner.This is a very nice looking and a very functional weekly planner. It has a hard cover.  It is something that would look good at work or at home.

This is an easy to install case/phone protector that is light but strong. If I drop my phone I am confident it will offer good protection.This case does not look as strong as it is. It is less bulky than I imagined and lighter than I imagined but it seems to be made of a very strong material. The description talks about this meeting a military standard that certifies the product as against abuse from drop and shock. I believe it. I am confident that this will protect my phone.The case allows easy access to my S6 and all its features. It easily fits in my inside jacket pocket.This comes with a screen protector that was easy to put on my phone.  It is clear and will protect my screen.This is very good case/phone protector that is light and not bulky at all and offers good protection for an S6.

These dishtowels absorb water well.  They dry reasonably well.  They hold up well when washed. This is a good simple dishtowel that works.I have a number of dishtowels because I am tired of spending money on paper towels. Dishtowels can be reused and absorb better than paper towels. Dishtowels can also brighten a kitchen.These are plain looking dishtowels that work.  They come in white, red, a darker blue and a lighter blue.  They have no designs on them.They are well made. I did not see any lose threads when I took then out of the package and I still do not see any after I put them in a washing machine and dryer. They are made in China and are well made.The care instructions say wash in cold water, tumble dry low and iron on low.  They did not shrink after I washed them or put them in my dryer. They were a little wrinkled but these are dishtowels so I don’t care.I use these when I am drying glasses and dishes and when I dry my hands afterward.  I have used these to clean up water that has spilled on my counter.  These absorb water well and dry in a reasonable time afterwards.  These would work well when drying a counter after cleaning it or cleaning up most any spill.These are perfect for everyday use.  They brighten my kitchen.

I am very pleased with this phone.  It is large, has a good amount of memory, has a very good sound and a good camera.I measure the actually screen size at approximately 3 x 5 inches.  This is the largest screen I have ever had on a smart phone.The video quality is excellent. I have watched movies and television shows on the phone and been able to enjoy them thanks to the screen size and video quality. I have watched replays of parts of baseball games and horse races and found the picture quality excellent.The phone comes with an FM radio. I also listen to music from other sources.  The phone comes with an ear piece that I use when listening to the radio.  I have listened to music on the phone  without the earpiece and the sound quality is excellent considering it is coming from a phone.The sound quality when I am talking to people on the phone is good as well. I have no trouble hearing someone or being heard.The camera on this phone is good. It has many features including a flash. It has a main camera and a front camera. It has some nice features like a face beauty mode, normal mode, live photo mode and panorama mode. It has a video camera as well.Because of the listed 4 GB of internal memory and 512 RAM  I have been able to download a good number of apps. I have also been able to store a lot of photos.I enjoy using all the Google features.  Google has become very interactive. If I want to know the weather forecast, the score of a baseball game or the location of the nearest gas station all I do is verbally ask Google and get the answer. Google maps is great on this phone. I once was low on gas and asked the phone where the nearest gas station was and it mapped the route for me.The voice recognition feature makes it rare that I have to manually type anything on this phone but when I do I am able to do so with my large fingers with ease because of the size of the phone. I have used other smart phones where I often press the wrong letter because they as so small on the screen.The battery life for this phone is good.  The phone comes with a USB cable and charger that can be plugged into and wall outlet.When I am home or at places that have WIFI I use the WIFI feature. It works fine.Th phone does come with a screen protector that I have yet to be able to make bubble free. When I called BLU phone support I got no help and was told to go a phone store to see if they could help. I will see about buying a better screen protector when I have the chance.This is a great phone. It is like a small tablet.

These are well made brightly colored cotton napkins that are made in India.  They hold up well when washed.These will brighten any table.  The sewing around the edge of these is well done. I have not seen any lose threads.Since these are napkins they have to be washed after each use. The instructions say to wash in cold water, tumble dry low and iron at a low temperature.The colors hold up well when washing. I have not seen any fading.The come out  of my dryer  much less wrinkled than I would expect based on my experience with other cloth napkins. I do have to iron them but it only takes a few minutes.These are well made napkins that brighten any table.

This is an inexpensive way to brighten a window and at the same time offer a level of privacy from prying eyes as well as a level of protection from the sun. This is fairly easy to put on a window and looks really great.This comes with a very good set of instructions.  The instructions start of with what you will need when applying the widow film.  This includes a spray bottle, liquid soap, paper towels, window cleaner, measuring tape, a utility knife, a straight edge and a squeegee which is included.Installation is fairly easy. You need to cut the window film to fit the window you choose. You then  need to clean the window and apply soapy water. After putting the window film on the window you then apply soapy water again. Finally, you use the squeegee which is included to remove any air bubbles.I used this on the top part of a window facing west in my living room. I have blinds over the window but even with the blinds the sun can get pretty strong especially when it is setting.I did remove about a quarter of the window film in order for it to fit on the window.  That was the hardest part since I do not have a paper cutter and I wanted to make sure I cut the film evenly.The window film stuck to my window nicely. The squeegee removed the few air bubbles that were present.  The fact that this can be applied to a window without leaving any air bubbles amazes me.The design looks great. I always like stained glass windows and this has a stained glass look to it. It allows light in but takes away the harshness of the sun.I pull up blinds during the day so I can enjoy the window film. It offers a good level of privacy. It looks even better when  the sun sets.I plan on getting some other styles for other rooms. I have bathroom window and after calling Artscape I will be looking at an etched glass and an etched lace style of window film that should offer privacy and allow light into the bathroom.I like this Melange design. It was easy to install and looks great.  I really changes the look of a room for the better.

This is an honest book about the struggles of an Orthodox Jewish boy whose growing obsession with sex and eventually having a girlfriend does not mesh with his religious upbringing. This is a coming of age story that most men should be able to identify with in some form.There is a certain point where sex becomes an obsession for most teenage boys.  In the case of Eytan Bayme sex becomes a major obsession. I am not sure whether his obsession was furthered by his strict religious upbringing or whether it was just his nature but in either case that obsession is the focus of the book.There are funny parts of this book and sometimes sad parts of this book. It is embarrassingly honest at times. I think most men will identify with being Eytan’s age and being awkward and wanting to lose their virginity and become a man. I found the book interesting. It works as a coming of age story with an Orthodox Jewish twist.

This is a great product that works, is easy to use and very safe. I will use it again.I have used this on my lawn and my lawn looks good. I did one feeding and I plan to do a another in a couple of months.This is easy to use. All you do is attach this to a hose and start spraying.I like the fact that children and animals can walk on the lawn after spraying this.  There are no harsh chemicals in this. There are warnings on the label against getting this in a person’s eye but most products have that.This is a safe, easy to use product that works. I will use it again.

This is a nice book of bible meditations. It is well formatted for the most part. My big issue is that I would not consider it a journal because there is not much space to write or journal.There are forty days of meditations in this book.  There are three or four readings from scripture followed by a meditation.The readings don’t seem to follow a set pattern. Some meditations  have and Old Testament reading followed by a reading from Psalms and two readings from the New Testament.  Other meditations start with a reading from Psalms, then have and Old Testament reading followed by a New Testament reading. Other meditations have two readings from Psalms and one from the Old Testament.  There are other patterns as well. This is okay but I like books of meditations that follow a set pattern.My big issue is that on the bottom of the book is written “A Scriptural Journal.” I think of a journal as a book where a person writes down his or her thoughts. For me a scriptural journal would have a blank page or two to write down a person’s thoughts about scripture. In many cases in this book there is approximately three inches of space after the meditation and this book is approximately the size of a paperback book.The book itself looks great.  The colors on the cover look great. The typeface is easy to read. Each page has a nice border.I had a hard time deciding how many stars to give this book. It is well designed and easy to read.  I would have liked the reading to follow more a of set pattern like an Old Testament reading followed by part of a Psalm and a New Testament reading. Yet that is a matter of personal taste. The meditations are fine. If it was called a devotional I would given it four stars.Yet for me a journal includes a good amount of space to write and this does not. I think others can see journal in the title and assume the same thing. As a result I give this three stars.

This is a high quality grill cover. It is very well made and will protect a grill from all sorts of weather.The cover is made of nice looking black fabric on top. The back  of the cover has what looks like a rubbery substance that I assume keeps the rain off a grill. It has a bit of a rubbery smell at first but it gets better over time.The stitching and workmanship on this grill cover is superb.  I did not expect to find such quality work on a grill cover.The grill cover has handles on both ends. The handles are stitched in a way that will last.There are two plastic buckles on the inside of the cover that help secure this cover as well as a hem cord which helps keep the cover snug.  It fits really well.This comes with instructions on use and care. If dirty soap or detergent should not be used to clean this.  Warm water and a soft brush are recommended. If wet it should be air dried. This comes with a four-year warranty.This will protect your grill from bad weather as well as the sun. It is extremely well made

I live in a river valley and have sandy soil.  The weather lately has been full of extremes. It can be 60 one day and 85 the next.  Lately we have been in a period of drought.  My lawn has suffered. I figured I would try this.I planted this two weeks ago in my front yard and have seen growth.  I raked the area first, used a grass seed spreader and went over the area with a rake to make sure the seeds were covered with soil. I watered the lawn every day.  The grass is still young so a lot can happen but so far a good portion of the seeds have worked. Hopefully the grass will continue to grow.

This is a fascinating story about how music became digital and became a source for pirating.  The author is someone who was in college when digital music became available to those in the know. He admits to an obsession when it came to downloading bootlegged songs and wound up with almost 15,000 albums worth of music which took him an hour to queue up.  He was the perfect person to write this bookThe book looks at the history of digital music piracy. He starts with the development of MP3 technology and ends with a music industry which is still trying to define itself in the digital age.In a certain way I was at a disadvantage when I read this book. While I am aware of sites like Amazon and iTunes where you can purchase and download digital music and I do have an MP3 player I am still happy to listen to compact discs. I remember records and 8-track tapes and cassettes and compact discs. I like my compact discs.  I am not yet ready to embrace yet another revolution in music.  Someone who lives by digital music will understand parts of this book better than I do.Still, this is a fascinating story about the biggest change to the music industry has ever faced. The question becomes how can people be stopped from  illegally downloading music rather than buying it.The author writes well. He knows his stuff. This is an in-depth look at a fascinating subject.

This is a nice bible that should appeal to children and young adults.  It has a set of characters which appear throughout the bible giving insights along the way and icons which highlight certain topics or ideas. There is also a bible dictionary at the end as well as maps from National Geographic.The bible contains four icons which include a sailboat, umbrella, lighthouse and life preserver which bring attention to certain text. The sailboat icon brings attention to text that should help children grow stronger with God, the umbrella brings attention to text that should help children in difficult times, the lighthouse brings attention to text that develops  faith and the life preserver highlights text that  answers tough questions.In addition there are God’s Thoughts/ My Thoughts sections which relate scripture to a child’s life and asks questions for children to think about.  There is a Did You Know Section which explains aspects of the different books of the bible.  There is also a also Memory Points section which marks key passages to memorize.There are three children that appear throughout the bible and help the reader.  They are Asia, Kat and Edgar. There is a nice bible dictionary at the end as well as eight maps from National Geographic.The text a nice font size.  The layout is open and not crowded as some bibles can be making it easy to leaf through the bible. The bible does not include the Apocrypha / Deuterocanonical books of the Old Testament found in Catholic Christian and Orthodox Christian bibles and some Protestant Christian bibles as well.This is a very nice looking bible that should attract the attention of children, young adults and even adults. It is well designed and should interest younger readers.

This is a memoir of Fox News personality Gretchen Carlson.  It is an easy read that is interesting as is explores Carlson’s life path which brought her to Fox.As someone who has watched Carlson on Fox I liked the book. It paints her as a hardworking, talented woman who has managed to be a success not only as a Miss America Pageant winner but as an award winning reporter and television personality.Carlson worked hard to get to Fox. The book talks about her starting out at local television stations and working  her way up the ladder. She talks about covering a number of stories including 9/11. She is married and has two children so she talks about being a working woman and mother.It is easy to assume a Miss America Pageant winner would be handed a television job based on her looks.  This is far from the case. Carlson combined hard work and talent to get where she is.This is a light, enjoyable book.  It is a fun read.

This is a quality grill cover with Velcro straps that is very well made. It will protect your grill from both bad and good weatherThe front of the cover  is made of a nice looking black fabric.  The back has a water resistant material that has a  bit of a rubbery smell at first but it goes away over time.The grill cover has three Velcro straps that will secure it to the grill during windy weather.  The bottom of the grill has an elastic at the bottom that also helps secure the cover in place.  The cover has vents that will reduce condensation and wind lofting.The stitching and workmanship on this grill cover is better than I expected.  I did not expect to find such quality work on a grill cover.This can be air dried if it gets wet. You can’t use soap or detergent if you want to clean this. Water works fine. It has a one year warranty.This will protect your grill from bad weather. It is extremely well made.

These are refreshing wipes that are great not only for children but for adults with sensitive skin. I use these  myself because I have been having skin reactions to chemicals of any sort and have been trying to go chemical free for a bit. These make my skin feel great.The ingredients in this product include Aqua(Water), Glycerin ,Sorbitan Caprylate, Decyl Glucoside,Propanediol, Benzoic Acid,Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Chamomilla Recutita (Matricaria)Flower Extract, Citric Acid, Sodium Benzoate, Potassium Sorbate and Sodium Citrate. The wipes feels cool on my skin. They have been especially nice in the hot weather.I have been using as many chemical free products as I can lately because of recent chemical sensitivity.  These have not caused any reaction in or on me and make my skin feel better.While these are eco friendly they should not be thrown in the toilet. The label says these need to be kept out of the reach of children. Also these should not come in contact with a person’s eyes. So while this is an eco friendly product there are precautions that need to be followed.These come in small containers that keep the wipes moist. I have had an opened pack for 10 days and the wipes are still moist.I really like these. They have been perfect for me in a time of need. I have other friends with bad chemical sensitivities and I have recommended they try these wipes.

I have a few rose bushes that have been around since I was a kid so I could not wait to try this. It seems to be keeping beetles, as well as other insects, away from them.This can be used on house plants and flowers as well. While it comes with warnings about what to do if it gets on skin or clothing, is inhaled, gets in someone’s eyes or is swallowed it can be used indoors so it seems a bit safer than some other insecticides.  The active ingredient listed on the Ortho website is 0.006% Acetamiprid which is an insecticide.This is keeping beetles and other insects off my roses. The labels lists the insects controlled and it is a very big list which is too big to list here but looks too include between 150 to 200 types insects.  This is not something that only kills eight or nine types of insects.This comes in a spray bottle. I used gloves when using this. If using outside the instructions say to stand  “up wind” while spraying. The spray comes out fine. This seems to work fine.

This is both a travel book and a book about how certain Christians practice their faith in other countries.  Amanda Hudson who grew up in Alabama where her church was one of “five congregations within a 500-yard radius” comments both on the culture and faith practice of those she met on her journey’s to China, Honduras, Brazil, Wales and Tanzania.When I first saw the title of the book I was expecting an examination of the practices of different Christian denominations in different countries. The cover of the book includes “one woman’s journey to experience Christianity around the globe.” I assumed the  book would be looking at how Eastern Orthodox Christians practice their faith, how Roman Catholic Christians practice their faith and how the different Protestant Christian denominations practice their faith.  It is hard to get "to experience Christianity around the globe" when you limit yourself to five countries and exclude Eastern Europe or the Balkans or the Middle East where the Eastern Orthodox Christian Church has had such a strong influence or Western Europe (aside from Wales) where Christians fought each other during the Reformation.This is more of a travel book where the author visits and speaks to Christians whose faith is similar to hers  in five countries and compares that faith to other Christians like herself in the United States. The book seems to look at faith in the context of Evangelical Protestant Christianity.  This books works as such a book but I think the cover suggests a more global and comprehensive look at Christianity.During Amanda’s  travels she visits other Christians like herself and examines how their  practice of faith differs based on cultural influences. She also looks at the countries themselves which helps in understanding the differences between how Evangelical Christianity is practiced in Alabama in the United States as opposed to Tanzania.Amanda offers some  nice insights about the faith of the people she visits and the countries in which they live.  She comes across as very interested in her faith and the faith of those she meets.  As long as your not expecting a detailed look at different Christian denominations this books works okay.

This is a great blade which cuts well. It is made to fit 98 percent of multi-tools/oscillating tools.Whether a product like this works and whether it lasts are the two things that matter to me. It is made in the United States and seems made to last. I have used it a number of times and it looks fine. Time will tell if it lasts long but everything I have seen so far indicates it will last.I have and old house that is in constant need of repair. I used this to cut screws and nails while making repairs on sections of a deck. It works fine. I have other plans for this when I start some other projects.

Rinker Buck and his brother got to live the dream of many a history buff and in doing so wrote a history/travel book that is very enjoyable to read.  In doing so he got the chance to learn about life, think back to times with his family and make the history and experiences of the Oregon Trail come alive.This could have been two books.  It could have been a history of the Oregon Trail.  I learned a lot about what the settlers who traveled on the Oregon Trail faced daily.  It could also been a travel  book talking about how two brothers learned a lot about the world and themselves while traveling the Oregon Trail  The author does an remarkable job of merging these two books into one and in doing so creating a work that I read in three sittings. I literally did not want to put this down.This book is a rare example of excellent writing combined with a fascinating story about a recreated journey from the past.  There have been a number of books written by people who have recreated journeys made by explorers in the past.  There are television shows where people live like people did in the past. Most of these fail because they get caught up in the “gimmick” of modern people living in the past.While the premise of this book is that two modern men take and old wagon and three mules on the Oregon Trail, the end result is so much more.  What makes this book different is the author is an exceptionally good writer who knows how to write about history as well his journey and I wound up caring both about the history and the journey.

This is a hard book to put down despite the suffering involved. The reason for this is Joseph Kim tells his tale in a simple straight forward manner which made me care about what happened to him. This is not a book with a political agenda but one where the only agenda seem to be telling what happened to him and his family.When Joseph was about 13 years old he was homeless because his father died in the great famine and his mother, after selling his sister as a “bride slave” in China, abandoned him because she was a “burden.” Homeless, Joseph went from begging to stealing to survive.He explains, “I became a different person when I became homeless. For one thing I was shocked to learn I was a better thief than I was a beggar.” He then explains how this happened naturally as if his body knew what to do when hunger reached a certain point. He says, “I don’t remember any moral debate about whether stealing was wrong.”Joseph is a good man driven to steal to survive in a world where death was all to common. He is much kinder to his mother than I would have been. I was happy when he found his way to freedom.I recently read and reviewed on Amazon another book called “A Thousand Miles To Freedom” written by  Eunsun Kim who escaped North Korea with her mother and sister. While both books have some similarities and both are recommended I found Joseph Kim’s book more informative about what life was like for the average North Korean before, during and after the great famine. His time homeless and stealing to survive and his time in a forced labor camp tells a lot about Joseph and the conditions people faced.This is an important book considering the lack of information about life in North Korea.  It is also an important record of what Joseph Kim, a good man, had to do to survive.

This is an enjoyable read focusing on a section of New York City, the Upper East Side, and the people who live and work there.  I think it is even more enjoyable for people with a familiarity of the City and the people. I live near New York City and have walked along Park Avenue and  other part of the Upper East Side and have seen the wealthy one percent walking the same streets as me.  I even have eaten at a few a restaurants where the one percent eat as well. The 22 essays in this book bring that area and those people to life. It is a world I will never know but one that fascinates me.The author, Richard Kirshenbaum, is a major player in New York advertising.  He is also a writer and this book is a collection of essays written for the New Yorker and some new essays as well.The author shares the world of the one percent for those interested. Because of his success he is part of their world. The essays cover everything from grooming habits, to social climbing, to divorce, to dating for the one percent. Often times the one percent don’t look so good.One of my favorite essays titled “Never Mind The Nannies, Drivers Are The New Dads.”  It looks at how those who drive the wealthy are often required to spy on their employers children and perform parental roles, something nannies formerly did.The author explains how the New York Post ran a story explaining that the wealthy were passing off their classroom volunteer duties to nannies much to the dismay of their children’s schools and the other less wealthy moms who did not want to have to do their volunteer duties with nannies.  The author writes “ The story ricocheted around the Upper East Side, a neighborhood whose privileged parents stand accused of outsourcing every child-rearing task, from cooking to etiquette training.  He then states, “As someone who lives and raises kids there, I here to tell you the stories are pretty much true.”Richard Kirshenbaum is a part of the world of the wealthy one percent. He has no problem sharing his insights about that world with the rest of us. I really wonder what the wealthy people he writes about think about his essays.The essays are well written. I think they will appeal more to those who are familiar with New York City and the Upper East Side and who have at least seen the wealthy one percent out in their environment. I found them fun to read.

This is a part of American history I know little about.  The book focuses on five Cubans who allegedly committed espionage and murder and were convicted of these crimes. The author looks at the Cuban exile community in the United States as well as relations between Cuba and the United States.  This book is especially relevant with the recent move by President Obama  toward normalizing relations with Cuba and the opposition it has created.I was expecting a spy thriller type of historical fiction but found the book hard to follow at times.  The author did a lot of research and at times I got lost in all the names and places mentioned. The author does seem to have a bias in favor of Cuba and the Cuban five.I feel the book suffers from the fact that it was translated into English by two people. I found the flow of the book off at times and do think the fact that it was translated into English played a part in this.Despite all this the author does a great job in exploring a period of American history and politics with which I was not familiar. I have read about the rise of Castro, the Bay of Pigs and the Cuban Missile Crisis. I have read about Cubans fleeing their country on rafts in an attempt to come to the United States. I am aware of a Cuban exile in community in Florida but I knew little about it until I read this book. This book has taught me much about this community which has a real voice in American politics.I am glad I read this book.  I learned about aspects of American History and current American politics about which I knew and know little. This book is especially relevant with the recent move toward normalizing relations with Cuba and the opposition it has created.

Rather than viewing nursing homes as places where old people go before they die the author has turned nursing homes into a place where elders  share their knowledge of life. He has taken the time to listen to people in a nursing home and let people know that there is a wealth of knowledge in those who reside in them.Like most self-help books the author stars with a premise and uses the insights and actions of people, in this case those in a nursing home, to prove his point. In the 28 chapters of the book the author looks at subjects like suffering, loss, acting in a crisis, religion, sexuality and the importance of acting in the present. The author concludes the book with 28 lessons learned.There is a lot in here to think about. Each chapter stands on its own.  Resilience, hope and refusing to be defined by your circumstances are themes that seemed to be present in many chapters but each chapter is different.The author includes a lot in each chapter.  This is not one of those self-help books which has a few simple themes repeated over and over. The author is willing to address a lot of different issues.The author puts a lot of thought into each chapter using relevant examples from people with whom he has worked in the West Caldwell Care Center. Even though he is a clinical psychologist the author has allowed himself to learn from his patients which gave me an even greater appreciation of the book and the author.This is one of the better self-help books I have read. It offers advice from our elders on a host of subjects written by a psychologist who took the time to listen and learn.

Any book which gives a first person account of what it is like to live in North Korea would be interesting.  A book written by a woman who escapes from North Korea to China and eventually makes it to South Korea is a book that I could not put down and read in two days.The author comes across as someone who, with her mother and sister, only wanted a chance to have a life where malnutrition and hopelessness was not the norm. She did not leave North Korea because of political beliefs but because the country was suffering from famine and her father and grandparents had died because of the harsh conditions.I admire Eunsun Kim’s courage and the courage shown by her family. I admire the others she met who also did not give up and fled North Korea.  I admire the endless hope that lead Eunsun to make it so South Korea despite being sent to a North Korean labor camp, being treated badly in China  and fleeing into a Mongolian desert.The author explains what happens in a simple and genuine way. It almost seemed like she was sitting across from her while she told me her story. The writing makes an interesting tale that much more meaningful. I like the author and feel for all that she and her mother and sister endured.

I enjoy military history and reading books about soldiers whose acts of bravery seem like things no humans should be able to do. There are a lot of books like these available and this is one that is well worth reading.The Vietnam War has gotten some recent attention with the anniversary of the fall of Saigon. While I was not even a teenager when the war ended I have always wanted to understand it better because it was a topic that was talked and at times argued about by everyone I knew.Legend is a true account of a team of 12 special forces soldiers who were inserted into neutral Cambodia to monitor North Vietnamese activity in 1968.  The team did not know that there was a nearby North Vietnamese base and the men were quickly surrounded.  Special Forces Staff Sergeant Roy Benavidez volunteered to help rescue the men only to be seriously wounded and belatedly awarded the Congressional Medal of Honor for his actions.While this book does place the battle in a historical context a good portion of the book is recreating what happened during the battle. The author does a good job recreating the battle and at the same time allowing the reader to get to know the Americans involved.Sergeant Benavidez is the hero of the book.  His recovery and the awards he received are covered in the book.  He finally received the Congressional Medal of Honor in 1981, in part because American troops were not supposed to have been in Cambodia in 1968. Interestingly the citation for valor for his Congressional Medal of Honor does not mention Cambodia, only that the men were inserted in a dense jungle area west of Loc Ninh, Vietnam.I smiled when I read  the citation for valor listing all that Sergeant Benavidez did to be awarded the Congressional Medal of Honor. It was read by President Ronald Reagan which the book said was an honor since Presidents don't normally read them during the award ceremony.The book is well written and is an easy read. I read it in two nights. I am glad I read it. It is a must read for me.

I am impressed with the power of this small wet/dry vacuum.  When I first saw it I was not expecting much because all I was getting was the top part of small wet/dry vac but after using it I like its power and size.I have used this to clean and dry carpet in my basement and the blower to help blow dust and pollen off screens around my air conditioner.  The suction for a unit of this size is impressive.  I was expecting much less considering the size but this wet/dry vac did a good job of sucking up water from my carpet as well as cleaning the dirt off my carpet.I also used  the blower feature to blow dust and pollen away from screens that are around my air conditioner. The dust had not been cleaned since I last used my air conditioner last fall.  This motor is strong and the blower did a good job dislodging the dust and pollen.I like the size of this as well. This is easy to carry around. I have a bad back so I need to be careful about carrying things.  I carried this wet/dry vac down a flight of stairs to my basement with ease. I then took this outside to clean my air conditioner screens without a problem. The size listed on this page of 13 x 10.5 x 14 inches seems about right.You do need to but a bucket for this.  The instructions tell you which ones to use with this. I bought one for a little over four dollars. The bucket is light and easy to carry as well.This is a powerful wet/dry vacuum considering its size. It works very well and is easy to carry around.

This is a very nice looking cup that keeps cold drinks cold. It is easy to clean.I like this way this cup looks. I like the red color on the outside and the stainless steel inside and on the bottom. I am happy using this at parties because it is a good looking cup.  One day I may get more for guests to use when I have barbeques at my house.I use this around my house as well. It keeps water, soda, ice tea and beer cooler longer compared to a glass or mug.  I have not tested it for eight hours but I have nursed a beer for a couple of hours and it stayed fairly cool.This is easy to clean since it is big.  I use hot water and  dishwashing detergent and a towel.  I have used this with soda, beer and ice tea and cleaning this afterward was easy.This a good looking cup that keeps cold drinks cold and is easy to clean. I like using it.

This has a spearmint like taste. It leaves my breath feeling and smelling clean and fresh. This comes with cup that allows a person to measure the exact amount to use each time.I like the taste of this. It has a spearmint like taste and no aftertaste. It feels good in my mouth as opposed to some brands of mouthwash which are bitter and harsh and leave a bad aftertaste.My breath feels clean and fresh after each use. My girlfriend says my breath smells nice after I use this.This comes with a measuring cup so a person uses just the right amount.  The label instructions recommend both rising and then gargling with this during each use and recommend using this twice a day. This comes in a 16 ounce bottle so this will get used up quickly if you use more than you need.The label instruction are written in a large enough typeface that I can read them without my glasses or a magnifying glass.  This is a plus for me since it seems like many products have use instructions which are so tiny I need my glasses and even a magnifying glass.This is nice tasting oral rinse that works.

This is a very thorough look at the the life of Silvio Berlusconi as well as the politics and history that allowed him to become prime minister. I read it because my ancestors came from Italy and I try to learn about Italy when I can.This book is very detailed. The author clearly knows his stuff. The book is 288 pages and includes end notes and a bibliography.If you want a thorough look examination of Berlusconi and Italian and European politics this is a good choice. An understanding of the existing system would likely add to your appreciation of this book.While my grandparents were from Italy, I am American and grew up on American politics. As a casual observer Italian politics and even less so of European politics I found myself getting a bit lost in a political system and way of thinking that I am not all that familiar. I don’t think this book was necessarily written with an American audience in mind.  This is not a criticism because the author should assume readers will have a certain knowledge base.The author’s background seems to be European. He is a London-born journalist who has lived in Italy and been a correspondent for The Independent, a British newspaper, for the past six years. He has written articles about Italy for The Wall Street Journal and  Variety.  He is uniquely qualified to write about Berlusconi.  I just think this may not translate so well for an American audience.I give this four stars because it is through, well written and has a good set of end notes and a bibliography. I do think being an American who is not very knowledgeable about Italian and European politics limited my enjoyment of this book.

This is a double-sided turkey decoy that is easy to carry and easy to put in the ground.  I used it in some woods where wild turkeys are common and after about an hour a male turkey started approaching. Unfortunately I made some noise and scared away the turkey and and other turkeys in the area.This is fairly large. It seems the size of a ready-to-breed hen.This is something that is appropriate for either hunting or turkey watching. It is made of a cloth like material and is double-sided.  People can use it in their yards for decoration purposes but I am not sure how it will last. These seems to be made for short term uses rather than sticking it in a yard for the summer.

This is the classic head & shoulders dandruff shampoo with a conditioner. It smells like the classic shampoo and is supposed to be gentler on my hair.I am happy so far. This is keeping my dandruff under control. I suffer from dry scalp and this seems to help my scalp feel less dry and itchy.  My hair looks good after I use this.Like with most head & shoulders a little of this product goes a long way. A 23.7 ounce bottle will last.As with most head & Shoulders this  uses Pyrithione Zinc (1.0%) to treat the dandruff. I am not sure which of the other ingredients is the conditioner.The directions on the bottle say that this product should be used twice a week but I use it daily.  I am pleased with it.

I like a lot of things about this case. It is well made, a good size and stores GoPro items well.The case is made of a hard material that does not move much when I press on it. If I drop the case with my camera and other accessories in it I am comfortable nothing would break.The case looks nice. It has a handle. There is also carabiner which is a D shaped metal hook inside. The zipper works fine. On the back of the case there is a label with two lines.There is precut hard foam inside the case that feels strong and adds additional protection to a GoPro camera and accessories.  The foam cannot be moved.  There is a “elastic web” which is a square with elastic strips on it that allow for small items like memory cards to be stored safely.  The square can be removed if something else need to be stored in that spot.  The “elastic web” is the only removable part of the case.The top part of the case that opens out when the case is unzipped and has a mesh pocket on it.  Items can be stored inside the mesh.This can easily fit a GoPro camera, telescopic pole, charger and memory card as well as any plugs or wires.  Most importantly it does a good job protecting these items. I have had a number of camera cases over the years and this one is very well made and looks good.

This is a big pillow that is much firmer than my regular pillows.  It does conform to my head and neck but I personally find it a bit firm.This pillow is listed as queen size but it is a big queen size. After getting this pillow I purchased a pillow protector that is queen size and a pillowcase that is full/queen size. The pillow protector fits but it is very snug and the pillowcase is very snug as well. I had to flatten the pillow to get the pillowcase over the pillow. I tried putting an old full/queen size pillowcase over the pillow and it did not fit.My head and neck do sink into the pillow but only to a certain point. Once my head and neck stop sinking the material in this memory foam pillow seems a bit firm. My regular pillows are much softer. This pillow offers much better support for my head and neck because of this firmness. I can see people really liking the pillow or wanting something softer.The pillow has a smell when you first get it. It is described in the care and use information sheet that came with the pillow as a “new car smell.”  I would not call it a “new car smell” because I like that smell.  For me the smell is like the smell of a new carpet. It is not a bad smell but it is not a good one either. I have had the pillow for a few days and I don't notice the smell anymore.Overall this is a good pillow for a memory foam pillow. I have tried other such pillows at stores that were much firmer.  The pillow cover on this is nice. It seems like it is made to last. The key to liking this for me is whether a person likes memory foam pillows of any type which all seem to be on the firm side or whether he or she likes softer pillows.

I live in a river valley and have sandy soil.  There are marshes near me as well and I am not far from the coast.  Some grass just won’t grow. I figured I would try this.I planted this two weeks ago in an area in my back yard and have seen growth.  I raked the area first, used a grass seed spreader and went over the area with a rake to make sure the seeds were covered with soil. I watered the lawn every day.  The grass is still young so a lot can happen but so far a good portion of the seeds have worked. Hopefully the grass will continue to grow.

This is a well designed cookbook full of nice photographs of mouth watering food.  The recipes are at the moderate level of complexity.  I tried a few of the easier ones and the food was great.This broadened my concept of Mediterranean cooking.  I had previously associated Mediterranean cooking with Greece, Italy, Spain and Lebanon. These are the Mediterranean restaurants that I have tried where I live. This book broadened my view of Mediterranean cooking to include the Middle East, North Africa, Persia, and Turkey.The pictures in this book are nice. These are not as glossy as I have seen in some cookbooks. The type is easy to read.  There is no nutritional information such as calories or carbohydrates listed for the recipes.The book is 8.2 x 0.8 x 10.3 inches and 224 pages. I have bigger cookbooks but this is a good size since it does not take up too much counter space.The recipes vary in size and complexity. I cook a bit but I don’t have a lot of exotic foods or spices in my kitchen.  There were are some spices and foods in this cookbook that I don’t usually uses such as maldon salt, sheep casings, sumac, blood orange juice and fiddle head ferns but for the most part the ingredients are things I would associate with Mediterranean cooking. The more a person cooks this type of food the more common the spices will become.I tried a few simple recipes. I love the Sweet Potatoes with Tamarind and Tahini, Middle Eastern Sausage with Lemon & Pomegranate Molasses and the Smokey Egg Plant Dip with Charmoula.  These took some work but they tasted great. There are other recipes with many ingredients that seem like a challenge but I will try someday.This is a nice looking cookbook that made me aware of Mediterranean flavors that were new to me.  The recipes vary in complexity.  The few I have tried came out great.

These are a great way to let a person know if bed bugs or other crawling insects are hanging around a bed.  I like this because these can be placed around my bed and since they are nontoxic I don’t have to worry about pesticides by my bed.These can be placed under a bed, between a mattress or on the side of a mattress. They can be placed anywhere bed bugs might be. Some of the sprays are toxic so if you are unsure if you have bed bugs this is a safe way to find out.So far I have not seen any bedbugs. It is good knowing I have something to warn me if bed bugs show up.

This is my first time trying this product and I think it's great. Previously, I tried the usual water flavorings you find at the store -- you know the brands, I won't name them here. There are many good ones and I like them but this has a distinctly fresher, more natural, less chemical taste. It just tastes better.

Looks just like the photo. Fairly realistic in appearance. On someone 6 feet tall the fabric ends about 1 foot above the floor. Could be a hair longer but OK. What you don't see is a "V" neck with two cords in the back that you can tie to close the "V". It helps to have someone else tie it, or tie it loosely first and slip it over your head. As all Halloween costumes in this price range, not the most rugged fabric so be gentle with it.
It drags. Not bad. I kind of wanted to bail about 2/3 of the way through, though. Very dark visually -- kind of hard to see.
Liked the original, like this too. Good acting, except for Tony Danza's usual overacting.
An important inventor and industrialist who doesn't get the recognition he should. I learned many things about him.
Very watchable. Bare boobs in a couple of spots seemed out of place and didn't add anything, except boobs. The May December romance angle with the Newman character seemed highly improbable.

I don't watch much video or TV but I love this series. I'm glad it's back for another season. I loved the Route 66 episode -- I want to drive it now! I don't have cable, don't get the Travel Channel, so I am glad to be able to purchase these episodes on Amazon.

You basic protein bar. One of the ones with the highest amount of protein (21 grams) for the lowest number of calories (180) I have found. 15% of governments calcium requirement in each bar also -- not bad. Taste, well, others taste better, in particular the new bars by Robert Irvine -- FitCrunch  -- taste pretty good but but they are much less efficient in terms of calories you take in for protein (380 calories for 30 grams, for the peanut bar).

A good protein powder. So many aren't. Dissolves completely -- no lumps. I'll buy this again. I guess if I'd change something I'd have some more calcium per serving, and then maybe more of other nutrients, but as a low-calorie source of protein that doesn't taste bad this is fine.

Does the job. Have used this in travel and it works fine. The suctions cups have a way of sliding into place that you'll see -- the fit is a little tight on one, but not too tight -- I just have to work it a little. It is very handy to be able to travel with my EZPass.
Looks good. Haven't needed to open one up yet but seems as described.
Very handy. I was concerned about how well they'd hold up in travel but they're fairly rugged.
Looks good. My seller was Park Lane Super Mart. Expiration date is 4/2018, which is nearly 1000 days -- I take one a day, 1000 tablets.
A well crafted, good looking movie. Good acting overall, but Pacino overacted his role in my view. Didn't like the ending. What a warped sense of ethics and morals. Glad I didn't go to that school.
This was good. Some preposterous action and plot twists, but very clever overall. I read a couple of reviews but did not see many things coming. Entertaining.
Had seen the TV series a couple of times and am glad I finally saw the movie. Never saw the Broadway show but you can see this on the stage.
Nice seeing these great actors, but didn't get the story. Technically, a well made movie, but not sure what to make of it. Gratuitous sex and bare breasts didn't add to the movie.
Worth a look. Fun. Some tedious predictable sight gags. I like the cast in the original TV series better.
It's OK. Good production values. Too much overacting. Too many depictions of animal cruelty for me, even though they were supposedly simulated.
Well done. Good acting, cinematography, production. Some great shots of old Washington DC.
Glad I took the time to finally watch this movie. A bit slow.
Well, kind of boring and unbelievable to me. Not bad, but wish I had my two hours back.
This was a delight. I loved the characters and writing. I get the low-starred reviews from those who didn't "get it." But, you don't have to. Go with the flow, and enjoy this love letter from Japan.
I don't know. "You have to go." You can't go." You have to go." "You can't go." Over and over and over again. Acting was good but writing was a little far fetched.
It is a pretty good guide. Deducting a star for it arriving damaged.

I like how the show deals in the owners' personal relationships, expecially when the owners are married couples. If a couple repairs and commits to their personal relationship, restaurant success can follow.

Dr. Day took care of our animals when we lived in Watseka. ("Bob Dobbs" is not my real name.) I didn't get to know him well then but I am very happy to learn more about him from this book.Soon into the book you're into the field on cases with him. It started out more graphic than I expected, but soon I felt comfortable, as if a teacher was next to you telling you what's happening step-by-step. I had no idea there could be so many issues with livestock giving birth.Thank you Dr. Day for sharing your expertise and your life stories. Whenever I see an animal now, I'm assessing its health.

I remember when this came out years ago but since I don't have cable I didn't see it then. I'm glad it's here. More engaging than I expected. Informative also. I hadn't read the book this is based on and didn't know that much about John Adams before seeing this.

Just bought an iPhone 5s. That phone works fine with the original cable from Apple. I bought this for use at another location, but the phone won't recognize it most of the time. Returning.Hate is such a strong word. I am not a hateful person, so I won't give it one star, otherwise I would.

I saw the great reviews but was still a little skeptical. It works. I cut my iPhone 4 Micro SIM down to Nano SIM size. A little rough around the edges, but I used the included sandpaper to quickly smooth it out. The downward pressure needed to punch it was greater than I expected, but not a problem.A piece of advice -- avoid touching the metal contacts of the SIM when you are manipulating it. This will reduce the chance of it picking up contaminants that might affect operation on down the line.

I feel misled. The product description says (today anyway) "6 x 5 x 4 inches" for the dimensions. They are really about the size of a credit card. They are so small. They work, but I need more than one sheet. I think I paid too much, but it's not worth the hassle to return. I will shop around for a better value next time.

A quite thin cotton material that does not feel as smooth as thicker material, but it's thick enough. This would be just for use as an undershirt, not a t-shirt to wear alone -- it's too thin. A little on the small size compared to other large tees, but big enough for me.
More cheaply made than I expected, magnification field distorted. Would return but not worth the hassle.

This is a very attractive jacket. The black looks more like a dark blue to me. I ordered a large, which is my normal size for items such as this, and couldn't get it to reach enough to button comfortably in front. The sleeve length is fine. An extra large might fit better around the middle but I expect the sleeves will be too long. So, regrettably, I returned it for a refund. If you are a quite trim man, this could be a nice jacket for you.

Need to pour a measured amount of oil into a furnace water pump once a year. Didn't know how far off I was on the amount until I bought this bottle. I pour the oil in from the can, then use this to dispense into the pump. Works great.

I like this kit. It seems a good value. The blister-pack it is packaged in arrived with the plastic separated from the cardboard over a length, which let some parts fall out, but they are all accounted for and some tape repaired the package.
Not a great fan of Pure Protein bars, but this is the best flavor to me of the ones I have tried. Also, about 10 fewer calories compared to other flavors but same protein content.

Works fine. I see the price has gone up considerably since I bought it, but probably still a good value. Make sure you use it right -- I found I wasn't after looking at some instructional videos on YouTube.

Kit comes with a variety of adapters that would seem to cover any installation type. I had some trouble with the hose twisting, but not kinking, while I made the last few tightening turns on the hardware --- trying to hold the hose still while tightening helped. I like the metal braid on the hose, which the hose it replaced didn't have.

When a valve failed in my old Maytag dishwasher, this replacement fixed it. Simple electrical connections. I found a universal dishwasher water connection kit on Amazon that I used to replace an old water line at the same time. Runs fine now. You should know how to make plumbing connections using teflon tape, which you will want to use at the brass-colored water connection you see in the photo.

These had the potential to be great earrings. The charms were large with two-sided detail. I expected them to be heavy, but they were light. The earrings were constructed on a standard fishhook with a jump ring followed by the feather charm, making the feathers mobile and flirty.My problems are these. First, the charms face to the side because of the jump ring, not to the front to frame my face. From the front, they appear as thin swinging lines. Next, the feathers have an obvious curve to them, so it is easy to see that one of them faces forward, while the other faces backward. This gives my earrings an uneven appearance.I am a jewelry designer for local stores in our mountain town, so I like to purchase inexpensive accessories to get new ideas and to see what is fashionable - Call it "research". This pair of earrings are just not up to my standards, but my POV could be out-of-date and you might prefer this look. That's why there are so many different styles!

This review contains discussion regarding black lingerie/undergarments of an adult nature. Please do not continue reading if you stumbled upon this review in error.The package of this black bedtime lingerie contains:* 1 black teddy* 2 adjustable black garters* 1 self-correcting thong/crotchless panties* Fabric handcuffsFeatures of the black teddy:* Formed of stretchy black lace* Covers mainly to waist with triangles angling to the sides for the garters on the upper thighs and rear* Four places for garters to attach at the bottom (Fabric fits best with garters to stretch it)* Adjustable shoulder straps will fit even shorter women* Built-in 3-hook bra catch in back (Size best for 38/40 C/D)* Crossing straps over stomach give a peek-a-boo effectThe thong likes to wind itself up into spirals when it is taken off, but it "usually" unwinds correctly when I put it back on. The sliding back strap allows the thong to self-correct for motion and not get overly-tight. The front triangle of black mesh is a sassy touch. This is my first experience with 100% crotchless panties, and I'm not displeased.The handcuffs are a beginner novelty item. The wrist pieces are made of stretchy black mesh (same as in the thong) and are held together by elastic (same as the garters). They slip on and off easy but are cute to complete the outfit.Not included in the package:* Thigh-highsSizing: I am 5'0" and 145 lb. I usually wear a size 10P in pants, medium top, and 36-C or 36-D bra. The size ran a bit large, but not too large that I couldn't make it work. I'm seriously considering getting it in both the white and red options.

This is my favorite Glade scent. I like it even better than the peach. It brings summertime into my home no matter the weather outside. Low humidity shortens the expected life of the solid air fresheners from 20 - 30 days to 15 - 20 days, but the valuable bulk buys here on Amazon make that less inconvenient. I can even afford to spread them around the house more or put multiple honeysuckle solid air fresheners in the same large room!

RFID is an under-appreciated method of identity theft. A person with a small device in hand or pocket can wander around a shopping mall or festival and gather the credit card information of hundreds of people passing within a small radius of him or her. This "information" can be sold on the international market, assuming the thief isn't after a quick dollar on-the-spot. Most credit card companies offer protection from unauthorized charges, but clearing up such problems takes time, causes stress, and cannot always be resolved to our satisfaction. In addition, criminals look for other electronic cards to hack for entry into secure buildings or secure areas of public buildings - schools, labs, government facilities, military compounds, etc. Some states even use electronic chips in their driver's license and state ID cards.
