Cloning a electronic identity card can be as easy as the write equipment and opportunity.I'm a rather-be-safe-than-sorry person, so I jumped at the chance to review this assortment of RFID-blocking card sleeves, even though I already had a wallet performing the same task. My cards are not always inside my RFID-blocking wallet after all; sometimes, they're in my iPhone wallet case or loose in my pocket (a bad habit when I'm in a hurry after the check-out line). The sleeves allow me to protect my cards wherever I put them...or forget I've put them. The designs are stylish, and the fit is snug without being difficult to withdraw my cards by aid of the small fingerprint-shaped cutouts. I'm even thinking about a way to turn one into a necklace with a lanyard. I don't have a passport, but my brother, a frequent visitor to Nicaragua, is pleased with the passport holder.My only concern with this product stems from the disclaimer that it does not protect "older prox cards". I attempted research on different types of prox cards, but I got lost in the tech-speak. It remains to be seen if my credit cards do or do not qualify as "old".

I am excited about this compact sewing kit! There is a true myriad packed inside the small square nylon zip case (less than 5" x 5" x 1"). Each item is tucked away behind its own elastic strap to keep the kit physically and visually organized (except the bonus items).Kit Inventory:* 3.5" stainless steel scissors* long measuring tape* white and black thread spools (26 ft. ea.)* 10 color spools of thread (13 ft. ea.)* spinning needle holder with 24 needles of various lengths* 3 black & 3 white buttons* 2 needle threaders* 5 color safety pins* seam ripper* thimbleBonus Items:* 50 straight pins* 50 safety pinsI can't tell you how I wish I'd had something like this at college, at camp, or many-a-time in my purse. I've seen similar kits, but they never organize their inventory so easy to access and provide such quantities for such a small kit! This product has impressed me, and I thought I was beyond truly being "impressed" by another sewing kit.I received this item from the manufacturer in exchange for my honest opinion, and my words are my own.

I'm trying to think of how to word this review politely, and not coming up with much. I'd expect this quality at a Dollar Store or discount bin. The sizing fit is for girls, sort of. They pinch fiercely behind my ears and are too big over and around my crown. The width is 1/2 inch at most. The plastic is rigid, so there will never be any "give" or bending to loosen to fit over time. The colors aren't just "mainly black" as in the "About" section of the product page, but they are "all black". These are thin, plain, untextured, shiny, hard plastic head bands. I purchased this hair accessory at a discount in exchange for my opinion, and I sincerely regret the few dollars I spent.

After consistently applying InstaNatural's 2.5% Retinol Cream for three weeks, my skin on my face and neck is more: soft, hydrated, plumped, acme-free, evenly-toned, and free of fine lines. I've been smothering my skin with a power-packed punch of anti-oxidants and anti-aging vitamins every day straight from InstaNatural's convenient and generously-sized airless pump bottle. For lines, the skin on my neck has seen the most results, especially that crease at the base of my neck right at my collarbone. I love that the cream doesn't flake. It smooths right in each application. I've even received good results testing it on the dry skin on the backs of my upper arms and other areas. The cream has a light fragrance that does not detract from my perfumeHere is the amazing, admireable, easy-to-understand ingredient list for InstaNatural's 2.5% Retinol Cream. "Aloe" is the first ingredient, not a variation of water! The 2.5% retinol is industry high, and will help replenish skin.INGREDIENT LIST: Organic Aloe Vera, Organic Sunflower Oil, Retinol, Palm Oil, Glyceryl Stearate, Cetyl Alcohol, Stearic Acid, Vitamin C (Sodium Ascorbyl Phosphate), Botanical Hyaluronic Acid, Organic Jojoba Oil, Kosher Vegetable Glycerin, Shea Butter, Wildcrafted Green Tea, Wildcrafted Propolis, Vitamin E (d-Alpha Tocopheryl Acetate), Vitamin B5 (Panthenol), Phenoxyethanol, Ethylhexyl Glycerin, Xanthan Gum, Citric Acid.I received this retinol cream from InstaNaturals in exchange for my honest opinion, and my words are my own.

I've been smothering my skin with a power-packed punch of anti-oxidants and vitamins every night straight from InstaNatural's convenient and generously-sized airless pump bottle. For lines, the skin on my neck has seen the most results, especially that crease at the base of my neck right at my collarbone. I love that the cream doesn't flake. It smooths right in each night. Here is the amazing, admireable, easy-to-understand ingredient list.INGREDIENT LIST: Deionized Water, Organic Aloe, Glyceryl Stearate, Cetearyl Alcohol, Safflower Seed Oil, Niacinamide, Vitamin C, Stearic Acid, Sunflower Seed Oil, Kosher Vegetable Glycerin, Matrixyl 3000, Organic Rosehip Seed Oil, Organic Argan Oil, Avocado Oil, Evening Primrose Oil, Palm Oil, Decyl Glucoside, Glyceryl Caprylate, Sodium Carbomer, Sodium Hydroxide, Tocopherol, Organic Gotu Kola, Wildcrafted Horsetail, Wildcrafted Dandelion, Wild Geranium, Ethylhexylglycerin, Honeysuckle Flower Extract, Honeysuckle ExtractI received this InstaNatural Night Cream in exchange for my honest opinion, and my words are my own.

I'm not that impressed. Each charm is the size of a penny, and that's being generous. They are 3D by making the back deeply hollow and ugly where the charms were punched out to make the pumpkin shape form on the front side. There is no variety. The charms took six weeks to arrive.

These 325 nail polish remover pads are like the ones used by my salon stylist. They are thin sheets of cotton two inches square. They make it easy to take off my polish, whether it is traditional polish or fancy gel polish. The 325 sheets come in an organized box that is easy to open and use. I received this product in exchange for my honest opinion, and my words are my own.

Let me tell you an interesting story about a headlamp from both the his and her perspectives.Chapter #1: I accepted this lamp in exchange for my honest review. My man is often under cars or driving nails in hard-to-light spots, so I thought he'd like to try this lamp. He loved it: the adjustable elastic head band, the three light settings (bright white, cooler red, and flashing red), its light weight, and the fact that it came with batteries included. But I tried it too.Chapter #2: Now, you might ask, "What does a blind person need with a headlamp?" There are degrees of blind. I still see shadows, light/dark, and blobs of color. Imagine my surprise when the brightest setting of this headlamp turned our dark house into a place I could navigate visually! Walls glowed white, bracketing dim doorways. Obsticles jumped out at me, if they were light-colored. It reminded me of the effect black lights had on my vision back when I could see well. But I'm passing along the existance of this headlamp to my visually-impaired friends, because some of them will do more than find this headlamp quaint and fun to play with; they'll find it useful for everyday activities, such as lighting a book while they read.Epilogue: So, from the him and the her, this headlamp is comfortable, useful, and a good product.

This survival kit comes in a metal box with the removeable lid held on by two latches on either short end of the box. I'm not 100% sure the box is "water-proof", but it might be; the lid fits very snug. The box's measurements are 5.75" x 3.75" x 1.15" inches. Along with a booklet on how to use the tools and in what situations, the box includes:* Whistle* Candle* Pliers* Screwdrivers* Fire starter* Waterproof paper* LED light* Water Purification Pills* Single Edge Blade* Pencil* Nylon Cord* Wire* Salt Packets* Compass* Sewing Kit* Signal Mirror* And more, even condomsThis is a covers-all-the-bases kit. It will fit in a glove box, backpack, or large purse. It will be great for a bug-out bag or emergency kit (with accompanying water and food). The Box can't possibly contain anymore.The only drawback to this kit is that, if you go rooting around in it for something, you probably won't be able to get everything back in the box afterwards!I accepted this kit from the manufacturer in exchange for my honest opinion, and my words are my own.

This is a 60-day supply of turmeric caps. Turmeric is an herb known for its anti-inflammatory, anti-oxidant, heart-healthy, and circulatory properties. I have arthritis, scoliosis, blood pressure problems, strokes, and fibromyalgia, so I gladly accepted a sample bottle of this product from the manufacturer in exchange for my honest review. I can report thus far a decrease in the swelling in my knees and the pain in my back, which has made it easier for me to exercise. I appreciate that this bottle is a 60-day supply (120 caps), rather than the usual 30-day supplements elsewhere on Amazon. I won't pretend to understand the science of which brand's product is more pure than the other's, but I do know that this one is at least proving its anti-inflammatory properties for me.

This is a traditional can opener in that it removes the inner circle of the can lid. I appreciate that the manufacturer took the time to coat both the handles and the turning nob with a plastic material. The handles obliquely angle away from the can, which assists in the ease of opening larger-volume containers. The handles are also not too big for my smaller, feminine hands. The action of the can opener is smooth. The bottle opener is utilitarian. Overall, I am very pleased with this necessary kitchen tool and plan to make it my primary can opener.I received this item in exchange for my honest opinion, and my words are my own.

I love the mix of coral and black in this not-quite striped top. The fabric is thin, but it is a summer top. The sleeves are very fluttery and feminine, even though they are short. As others have commented, the arm holes are large and will show a bit of the bra, but they are not quite big enough to be classified as "dolman". Wear a nude/skintone bra and no one will notice. The sizing is more juniors or Asian, so buy one size up (or be prepared to have a blouse to attract male attention). I'm pleased with this new top, and I'm especially excited about the less-than $5.00 price with Amazon's Add-On program!

This is a very useful brush. The long 16.5" handle detaches from the brush head with a firm tug, but it won't come off on its own. The bristles are soft enough not to scratch the skin but strong enough to clean. There is a loop of cord on the end of the handle away from the brush head to hang the brush up. The brush head has a strap on its back to go around a person's hand when he's using it alone without the long handle. A cotton drawstring travel pouch is included which will hold the brush head (not the handle). This brush has come in particularly useful in our small shower (the kind one person can hardly fit in) to reach one's back and one's feet. I know the product description says, "dry," but keeping the wood from molding is easy. This also makes a good back scratcher. I accepted this brush from the manufacturer in exchange for my honest opinion, because I saw it would be useful in my home. My words are my own.

This is a 30-day supply of resveratrol, a compound known for its heart-healthy and anti-aging properties. I accepted this product from the manufacturer in exchange for my honest opinion, because I have blood pressure problems which promote my mini-strokes. According to the manufacturer, this brand's resveratrol caps contain differing amounts of grapeseed and Japanese knotweed to reach the recommended 1500mg daily dose of resveratrol (3x 500mg), depending on the growing season. PubMed has this to say about the resveratrol compound and heart health:"Resveratrol, initially used for cancer therapy, has shown beneficial effects against most degenerative and cardiovascular diseases from atherosclerosis,hypertension, ischemia/reperfusion, and heart failure to diabetes, obesity, and aging. The cardioprotective effects of resveratrol are associated withits preconditioning-like action potentiated by its adaptive response. During preconditioning, small doses of resveratrol can exert an adaptive stress response,forcing the expression of cardioprotective genes and proteins such as heat shock and antioxidant proteins. Similarly, resveratrol can induce autophagy,another form of stress adaptation for degrading damaged or long-lived proteins, as a first line of protection against oxidative stress. Resveratrol's interactionwith multiple molecular targets of diverse intracellular pathways (e.g., action on sirtuins and FoxOs through multiple transcription factors and proteintargets) intertwines with those of the autophagic pathway to give support in the modified redox environment after stem cell therapy, which leads to prolongedsurvival of cells. The successful application of resveratrol in therapy is based upon its hormetic action similar to any toxin: exerting beneficial effectsat lower doses and cytotoxic effects at higher doses. 2011 New York Academy of Sciences."I am very glad to have a natural way to stabilize my blood pressure. I hope this supplement will allow me to wean myself off of my heart-health prescription medication (under my doctor's supervision). I am already able to be more active without my heart feeling like it's about to pound out of my chest.Note: other brands sell lower doses of this supplement and are highly rated for their results. Therefore, I'd recommend taking the first bottle of this brand's resveratrol 3x day as it says on the bottle to infuse the compound into your body, then decreasing to 1x day for heart maintenance (and to save money).

I love leggings and have them in various colors, patterns, and fabrics. I pair them with tunics and skirts. Amazon makes it easy for me to find leggings for my petite/short height (5'0").These are my first "jeggings". They differ from jeans in that the front zipper flap, metal button, and front pockets are just for show. Only the back pockets are usable. The stretchy material hugs my skin - "form-fitting" is what Mom would say. But these jeggings make me look thinner, not like I'm trying to wear clothes too small for me, like some leggings can do. these are a thick, warm legging with the look of a jean (seams and belt loops included). The style is amazing, and the quality is exactly what I expect from a name brand jean company. My favorite part is that they come on/off so easy!The Lee jeggings are sized like jeans are sized, in numbers, not in catagories. I Usually wear a size 10P or 12 regular in women, so I purchased the 10P (for the hip room and shorter length). When I took them out of their package, I thought the length was much too long, but the inseam sort of shortened/conformed to me when I put them on to be the perfect length (without ruching). The only problem was that I should have purchased the 8P; the waist and butt were too loose in the 10P (I've not had this problem with any other 10P before). I'll just consider that my weight has a bit of room to flux and/or the rear will be covered by a tunic most of the time. The stretchy fabric makes me look skinnier, which is why it's important that you know the sizing in petite runs large (even for the most curvy of us). Also note that the dark color in the photo on Amazon is more dark than the jeggings seem in-person.Update: The more I wear these jeggings, the more loose they become, getting very baggy in the rear and the waist sliding down. Other leggings don't have this problem. I will definitely go for a size down next time and be prepared to wear a belt.

War Angel is an IR thriller (Black/Latino) with a plot worthy of Shakespeare for the modern era (if not poetic prose). Watch the background as three weird sisters (in the paranormal sense) try to orchestrate the lives of the rest of the cast of characters and exactly how and when skeletons will fall out of whose closet.Jahaira knows her father wouldn’t approve, but she loves Lenox anyway, but she never takes him home to meet her parents. Two years later, no one even believes Jahaira  has a boyfriend, and they’re fine with her fiction (except the other man who wants her). Meanwhile Jahaira believes she has the complete and correct picture of her family: who’s cheating on whom, why, and the extent of where the money comes from. Oh, how wrong she is!Lenox will do anything for his Jahaira, but he never thought he’d have to prove it. He never thought he’d see the things he’d see or do the things he’d do. Lucky for Lenox, he grew up on the streets. He knows one end of a gun from the other. But sometimes, you’re darned if you do, and you’re darned if you don’t.Plot holes in this story relating to Lenox’s blackmail left me taken aback. I wanted to knock him in the head and yell at him, “You idiot! Fingerprints!” But then I caught on. Forensics was a “possibility” of how this was going to blow up in his face, while the author developed other avenues as well. It made the end predictable, yet the journey worth the trip.Elements of War Angel were unlike other books I have read recently. I identified with that the female protagonist was curvy and large-busted (not a skinny-mini). I approved of the sex being real, not always perfect, not hearts and flowers for the romance novel crowd. The emotions in the relationship ran deep, yet so did the doubts, just as in true life. The lesson of things never being as they appear was driven home well by the plot (and that of telling the truth up-front).This is only the beginning: War Angel is the first in a series. It did not end in a cliffhanger, but the weird sisters, quite displeased, are left plotting in the final scene of this contemporary thriller with paranormal overtones.I met Keith Kareem Williams in a Facebook literature group and have been following his witty repartee and sharing his thought-provoking book excerpts for some time now – and all before I picked up a book of his to read. That may sound odd, but he presented his Facebook profile professionally, and I “collect” writer friends who aren’t advertising every day for me to buy their books. KKW’s posts have been always grammatically-correct and intelligent. Because I have a high ranking on Amazon as a reviewer, I messaged him politely if he needed any reviews of his books, and he offered me War Angel at no cost in exchange for my honest opinion. I appreciate this opportunity, and I hope my honesty about this book will help you.

Call it a “snowflake” or call it a “flower.” Either way, this well-plated pendant and chain combination is full of sparkle and class. The pendant is a hair over an inch in diameter with fine detail and accented with both Marquise and round cubic zirconia. The sixteen-inch chain has a two-inch extender and an easy-open lobster clasp (even if the clasp is tiny). I am of the opinion that I can’t own enough chains, and this sturdy chain is of a short length I’ve been needing (That almost-choker length). My only issue is that the title and product description says "platnum" for the plating, while the options to click on for the coloring mention colors,which is confusing, and the resulting necklace/pendant is an odd color to match. However, the quality "looks" and "wears" so well that I don't mind if the pendant and chain are plated in whatever, either one. The manufacturer of this piece also makes a matching ring and earrings. As a jewelry designer myself, I love to see what other designers are up to. I am glad to have this in my jewelry collection, because it is elegant, well-made, sturdy, and can be applied to both winter (“snowflake”) and spring (flower”). Though I was provided this product for review, my words are my own. I hope this review has helped you with your purchasing decision.

My significant other is a nerd. Yeah, he looks like a lumber jack with the beard and the body, but he loves his Star Wars, Lord of the Rings, and Harry Potter. Don't let the tradesman's uniform he puts on every morning fool you!The t-shirt says:"I didn't get my acceptance letter to Hogwarts, so I'm leaving the Shire to become a Jedi."The takes-a-nerd-to-understand words are largely and boldly written on a black shirt. It is very easy to read, unlike other cross-platform/cross-franchise tshirts.The XXL is made of thick, quality cotton, not the cheap mass-retailer fabrics. The fit is as I hoped for his 6'4" and 230-240 lb.He laughed when he read it, and I got a huge hug and kiss for finding and purchasing such a shirt for him.Shipping from the U.K. to North Carolina took from the Wednesday I ordered the shirt to the following Friday (9 days).Now, why didn't I get one for me too?

This wall charger is "intelligent." While it is busy juggling six USB ports and the requirements of my devices, I'm off living life. No overcharging. No overheating. No accidentally breaking it, because the full outer case of the hub is rubberized. Just plug the unit into the wall and access the row of six USB ports on its side. And, the hub even comes with a carry bag for portability (Its power cord even detaches).I received this USB charging hub in exchange for my honest opinion, and my words are my own. But had I purchased the hub for under $20.00, I'd have considered myself with a bargain. I wish I had known such a wall-charger hub existed before, instead of depending on my computer's hubs or multiple single-USB wall chargers to power my devices.Since I've known about this type of product, I have researched them a bit. Not all feature their USB ports the same as this hub does. This unit is just a bit wider than a deck of cards, and the USB's are grouped together in a row along one of the sides, not along the larger flat top (where there appears to be a heat vent). Six cables grouped so close together could become an issue to detangle at times, but there are a lot of differently-colored cables on the market now to make that easier, and most charging cables are short anyway. I hope knowing how the USB's are arranged helps.

I was provided this 6 ft. NetSun Apple-certified lightning cable in exchange for my honest opinion, and I accepted it because I have been sick and tired of short cables never allowing me to roam far from my wall charger or computer's USB port. It has consistently performed better than non-lightning cables I own. From what I can tell, this cable performs comparably to the cable my iPhone 5S came with in both its capacities of charging and syncing. My iPhone does not overheat while charging, nor does the cable connection become hot to the touch. The thin end is easy to find and works with the two iPhone cases I alternate (a leather wallet case and a sparkle gel case). I cannot emphesize enough what a difference the extra length in this cable means to my sanity at times! I am very pleased with this cable.Pros:* Apple-certified lightning cable* Freedom of 6 ft. over the usual 3 ft. length cables* Thin connection fits through most cases* Lifetime warranty and polite customer service

I have had this 3.3 ft. Mengo Apple-certified lightning cable for ten weeks. It has consistently performed better than non-lightning cables I own. From what I can tell, this cable performs comparably to the cable my iPhone 5S came with in both its capacities of charging and syncing. My iPhone does not overheat while charging, nor does the cable connection become hot to the touch. The thin light-up end is easy to find and works with the two iPhone cases I alternate (a leather wallet case and a sparkle gel case). I am very pleased with this cable.Pros:* Apple-certified lightning cable* 3.3 ft. over the usual 3 ft. or smaller lengths* Light-up end is easy to see* Thin connection fits through most cases* Warranty and polite customer serviceDisclaimer: I was provided this cable in exchange for my honest opinion, and my words are my own. Because I accidentally checked off that I had already written a review for this item when I had not, my review period for this item spans ten weeks and is that much more reliable for the extra time.

Why I wanted it:I accepted this bandeau in exchange for my honest opinion, because I wanted to try it as breast support with spaghetti-string tank tops and sun dresses with crisscross straps or straps that tie behind my neck. I own traditional strapless bras in black and in white with underwires and rubber around the bottom to keep them from sliding due to movement or the weight of my breasts. I needed something in “nude,” because it seems like everything I purchase is made of thinner and thinner fabric or have arm holes which would show ordinary bras.Buy one size down:My bust size is in-between a 36C and 36D, depending on the bra. Going by the size chart, I chose the XL. That was a mistake. The nylon construction of this bandeau is very giving/loose. I was expecting something supportive, like the controlling fabric of a swimming suit, but this product is designed more for “comfort” than “support.” Pick a size down.Cup size for A/B, not C/D:The firm cup pads are breast-shaped, but the ones in the XL appear to be made for a B-cup. I took one out and put it in one of my C-cup bras and couldn’t stop laughing. No, Hoveox, that wasn’t going to work. Wearing it, I didn’t just have under-boobage (and aroundage?), but I looked like I had stuffed something down my shirt to be funny. And there was no support. My breasts were still angled down and wiggled when I moved. Give me “lift” people! I need lift!Overall construction:I should add here that there are side seams. The top and bottom bands of nylon and elastic weave are thicker, but no less comfortable than the rest of the bandeau. It looks well-made of quality fabric for the right-size person who needs coverage without support. For this review, I kept wearing the bandeau for the afternoon, and the fabric and alignment of the pads stayed in place and never shifted. I regret that I can’t use this bandeau, after admiring its texture and practical applications. If you wash this on cold and don’t put it in the dryer, it will keep its shape longer (I needed to be told things like that when I was young).Rating:I’m subtracting stars from this product because the size chart did not get in the ballpark of my size – not even close. The XL bandeau can’t support and lift the breasts of larger-busted women (and women of larger measurements have heavier boobs). I am not knocking the bandeau all the way down, because their fabric and workmanship on the bandeau appear to be better than similar products I’ve seen in local stores. Plus, had this fit, the bandeau would have been the most comfortably-textured bra ever!

I have tested this solar light to the best of my ability in order to write this review, but I am not a professional in the fields of electronics or patio/outdoors.Pros:* Sturdy construction* Stable mounting onto a flat surface* Fulfills the estimates given in the product description of hours of illumination (when properly positioned for charging during the day)* A light I can see from the inside of my house and illuminates a good area of yard for its size* Film is moderately easy to remove from charging panel and the rest of the set-up is a no-brainer* iHome is a brand I'm familiar with and can go to their website for assistance with their products (My fav is their color-changing iPod dock speaker I purchased a few years ago before I ever started reviewing on Amazon)I am rating this four stars (and not five) for two reasons. First, the product description suggests mounting the solar light to "trees," which is impossible with the hardware provided. Other verticle surfaces don't give the light a full charge, because the charging panel isn't directly in the sun enough during the day (Thoughtful placement of any solar light is very important). Under a tree would certainly not provide a full charge. Then, there is the size of the unit. At around 7"x5" inches, I'm confounded at why the unit must be so big (after using and reviewing other solar lights).I was provided this solar light in exchange for my honest opinion, and my words are my own.

These 3.38 oz. (100 ml.) spray bottles are transparent and a TSA-compliant size. They spray a fine mist of any thin liquid they’re filled with (not shampoos/conditioners). I prefer to fill mine with a mix of carrier oil, essential oil, and other ingredients to make my own perfumes. The bottles only take one or two pumps to prime them and are good to the bottom. They are easy to label and even come with a clear plastic cap over the spray nozzle (a bonus touch). I dropped one down the wooden basement stairs to land on the concrete floor to test its durability, and it didn’t have a scratch on it! The only way this product could be better is for the four bottles each to be of a different color. These four bottles were received in exchange for my honest opinion, and my words are my own.

First, KNOW WHAT YOU'RE GETTING! That's key. These are NOT "clip-ons." They're LEAVERBACKS. I wear all types,, because I'm a jewelry designer myself, so it didn't bother me. But try to use them as clip-ons, and the snowflake/flower ornimentation angles down, not facing directly forward.The just-over-one-inch charm of the earring is a snowflake or flower, depending on your point-of-view or the time of year. It's quite detaild and features a variety of Marquise and round cubic zirconia. The charm is sturdy and is well-attached to the earring; it doesn't dangle loosely.If I had to choose my favorite style of earring, I'd say it is the sturdy leaverback. Leaverbacks mean no fitting on or losing tiny rubber earring backs. They are the closest thing to toddler-proof I've met. They just seem to fit more naturally in my ear so that I don't notice that they are there. So I'm glad these turned out not to be clip-ons, even though I was prepared for clip-ons.The "rose gold" plating looks a bit too coppery, but I like the tone well enough, and it doesn't turn my sensitive skin.I received this item in exchange for my honest opinion. My words are my own, and I'm honest, no matter how good or bad the item is. I hope my experience as a jewelry designer for our local mountain stores is of help to you in this purchasing decision.

Thank you God, they worked, and I don't need to know why they did. Something about bacteria and all that, but there comes a point at which the medicine working is more important than the ingredients and the science. Two pills 3x a day. I can do that. It doesn't hurt to go to the bathroom anymore (or even have my undergarments rub there, you know?). Never letting my medicine cabinet be without this again. Enough said.

I have tried Forskolin and Garcinia Cambogia. They seemed to work, but, when I stress-ate, it didn't seem like they were helping much at all. I even drink lots of water and eat my fruits and veges. I needed something that would help me not eat so much and would approach the other weightloss qualities of the products I have tried. I blame my fibromyalgia and my strokes, but really, it's a lot of depression and apathy about life.What is a raspberry ketone? It is the compound that makes red raspberries smell so good. It is the major ingredient inside these 60 hyper-strength pills. Just open the bottle and smell the fruitiness!But the manufacturer went further, which is why each pill contains 1200mg of goodness, unlike 500mg or less in other brands. There's mango and acai and green tea and resveritrol too! What a bouquet of tummy-tucking, fat-melting ingredients!Why should you take this supplement? It curbs appetite, energizes the body, is a detoxer, moves waste more quickly through the body, supports the immune system, and keeps fat from being absorbed.Did it work for me? Yes. I was very impressed by how much appetite I lost. The amount of stress-eating I have done recently is way down. I have more get-up-and-go in the morning, and it lasts far into the day without making me too jittery (I am relieved that I use a quality sleep aid at night.). Thankfully, the odor and taste of the pills are pleasing, not hard-to-stomach like many of their weightloss competitors. I can take raspberry ketones with confidence, because I know I'm doing something chemically safe and helpful for my health.Now that I have actual results from this product, I'm even more encouraged to use it (and to try to get off my butt and exercise)!I was provided this product in exchange for my honest opinion, and my words are always my own, no matter how great or how bad the product is.

It’s been 4 long years since Leah Carson’s husband tried to kill her.  Four years of surgeries, rehabilitation and trying to learn to live without fear.  Today, Leah is a practicing veterinarian finding pleasure and closeness with the animals she treats, yet these last couple of months have her on edge.  Missing keys, flat tires, mysterious flowers - annoying but they held more terrifying memories of how her dead husband used to taunt her.Deidre, Leah’s one close friend has been murdered and a detective agent, Alex Morgan from the Tennessee Bureau of Investigation is hot on the case.  The fact that Deidre had been stabbed twenty-three times, the same as what had happened to Leah was just too coincidental leading to wonder whether or not Leah’s husband was really dead.As usual Mary Burton who is a master of suspense and terror keeps that tradition going with  I’LL NEVER LET YOU GO.  Blending her masterful suspense with the Morgan’s of Nashville series also added in a lovely romantic bent as well.  Because of previous books on the Morgans, one is able to understand what has shaped Alex into the brilliant detective he is.  Just as Alex was fleshed out, Ms. Burton did a remarkable job of fleshing out Leah as well, making one understand her fears and a little bit of her OCD.However, what Ms. Burton does best is change the rules and totally twist around everything one thinks is going on!  I’LL NEVER LET YOU GO is one highly recommended read! Most importantly, be prepared to be surprised at the end.Marilyn Rondeau

4-1/2*  Lady Sara Emerson has come to London for help. Several years ago her cousin Meredith had been brutally murdered, now Sara is receiving letters from the killer who seems to be targeting her.  Sara has come to beg assistance from the man who was once Meredith’s fiancé, the Duke of Rossmoyne, Gabriel Ferguson.  After the death of Meredith, he had promised that her family could always come to him for assistance.  And that is exactly why Lady Sara to appealed to him.Rossmoyne (Ross) had never paid much attention to Meredith’s shy, retiring, blushing cousin before.  Having just returned from India, his once wild ways, had changed where he had grown and was at once  drawn to Lady Sara’s lovely intelligent eyes and very calm demeanor.  However, he had no intention of staying in London and wished to return to India as soon as he could, but the guilt he had felt over Meredith’s still unsolved murder, required him to do his best to find the murderer.There were many things that I enjoyed in THE RELUCTANT DUCHESS.  One of course was the lovely characterization of Lady Sara, and the bonhomie she was able to bring out of the dour Duke of Rossmoyne.  I loved the relationship that evolved from friendship to love between these two.  Both of these protagonists were so very well fleshed out that one couldn’t help but feel compassion and love for them both.  The pace itself was also a boon and the  pages just flew by filled with a small amount of lovely secondary characters to add depth and interest to the story.  Personally I loved the little urchin Thomas who played a small pivotal role that led to the ultimate revelation of the villain in this plot.Also the angst of Sara’s unwillingness to believe she was worthy of becoming a duchess was well done as Ross attempted to profess his love and assurance that he was not the same person he was years back.  All in all, I can highly recommend THE RELUCTANT DUCHESS as one very enjoyable read most will find highly entertaining.Marilyn Rondeau
Love this so handy to have around my neck instead of searching all over the place for a pair of scissors.  Works great!
Very good item. Helps immensely with my crocheting and small enough to bring to class.

I have read an awful lot of Grace Burrowes books and each and every one of them has left me feeling good, DANIEL’S TRUE DESIRE, was something else entirely.  I simply didn’t want to see it end!  Daniel and Kirsten were absolutely the most special couple ever, and Daniel - there are no words for a hero like him!  No, he didn’t have a title, he had very little money, nothing at all to recommend him for an Earl’s daughter like Kirsten, but oh, he had heart, he had honor, a sense of humor, and an abundance of love and understanding.  Be still my heart!The story starts off with Daniel, a vicar, bereft and on his way to Kent and his new assignment as the vicar of the family seat of earls of Bellefonte in Haddondale.  His life has hit a new low.  His wife had run off to God knew where, and the child he had raised for the last five years, had been reunited with Daniel’s sister Lottie.  Missing young Danny, the child most thought was his son, was excruciating.Resigned to spinsterhood, Lady Kirsten Haddonfield welcomed the new vicar and urged him to stay at her family’s home while the vicarage went under some much needed repairs.  In a very short time, the handsome vicar had Kirsten rethinking her ideas about love and marriage, but secrets thought dead and buried, were about to overcome any happiness Daniel and Kirsten thought they had found.What really made this story resonate so deeply in my heart?  It wasn’t just the wonderful romance and love that evolved with Daniel and Kirsten, it had even more to do with their interactions with their ‘rotten boys’.  As a vicar, it often fell upon them to tutor the young boys in Latin, maths, history and so on.  The supposedly rotten boys was a nickname they used for the youngsters who had driven parents and sisters to the brink, and needed just a tad of training.However, with Ms. Burrowes wielding the pen, these boys received much more than just lessons in studies, they learned and grasped the principles of becoming loving young men with the steady and loving care from both Daniel and Kirsten.There is just so much more emotion, that DANIEL’S TRUE DESIRE encompassed in this story that I could go on and on.  However, I don’t want to take away the enjoyment you will experience as I did on reading it.  Highly, highly, recommended.Marilyn Rondeau

Years ago, Lord Owen Renderwell, gained a title for a highly publicized rescue of a kidnapped duchess, but only few knew that Scotland Yard’s famous detective worked alongside London’s most infamous thief and his criminally brilliant daughter, Charlotte Walker.  Lottie was like no other woman Owen had ever met.  She mesmerized and challenged him on every belief he’d ever had and yet he wanted her, but at the end he’d lost her.Now a private detective tracking down a murdered, Owen has sought Lottie out.  No matter how they may deal with issues of the past, he will always be a man of law, and she a criminal.  Yet whenever Owen is near, and while Lottie tells herself it could never be – they both long for a future that could never be theirs.To me, this had a bit of a slow start, but I persevered and found that after a while, I understood where they were coming from and began trying to figure out who and why the murders were taking place.  Naturally, the reveal took time as to discovering just why Lottie detested Owen as much as she did and them both trying to uncover the mystery of  the clues left behind.  Of course there were a plethora of other little twists and turns in trying to discover who had been committing murders and leaving a trail of crumbs that led to Lottie’s door, but the bigger surprises came in at the end and they were surprising.The romance was slow to evolve, as the protagonists (especially Lottie) was quite stubborn and as it turned out, miss-guided in her opinions.  However, A TALENT FOR TRICKERY was a good read and well worth your time.Marilyn Rondeau

I love starting new series and when they are written by a favorite author it makes them even more delectable.  Lorraine Heath just happens to be one of my favorite auto-buy authors and FALLING INTO BED WITH A DUKE, the first book of her new series Hellions of Havisham, was a total delight!Miss Minerva Dodger was one very smart cookie and knew enough to choose spinsterhood over the many fortune-hungry suitors she’d encountered over her six unsuccessful seasons.  Lord, she had even written a book on how to spot and what to do when one with a sizable dowery was targeted by fortune-hungry suitors!  However, as much as Minerva was set to enjoy her spinsterhood, she wanted to experience one night of pleasure.  Minerva had heard of the very secret Nightingale Club, a notorious place where ladies could don a mask before choosing a lover.  If she could just screw up the courage to take that step, and actually she did!Masked and quite nervous Minerva recognized at once the sinfully handsome Duke of Ashebury and although rules stated the lady should be the one to approach the man, the Duke took one look at the long-legged vision in white and made a beeline to Minerva.  He was more than willing to satisfy the secretive ladies desires and escorted her to his room.  However, Minerva lost her bravado after sharing an intimate conversation and a more than heart stirring kiss.  Ashebury, ever the gentleman let her go, but reserved his expectations and desire to discover who she truly was.  Naturally, Ashebury discovered within days who the masked temptress was, and totally intrigued set out to capture her, but was it she who had captured him?Such a wonderful premise, and fabulous characters.  I loved the fact that Minerva was so very capable, a highly intelligent young woman who while not a beauty, had much more to offer Ashebury.  Ashebury, didn't realize at the time that her wit and intelligence was exactly what he needed most in a wife and partner, to help him put the ghosts of his past away.Bottom line:  An absolutely endearing and enjoyable story with wonderful characterizations and folks you want to come back to and discover how they get on.  Loved this story and looking for more in this new series.Marilyn Rondeau

The very lovely Lorelei Sundun had never here of the mysterious Wherlock clan and their other worldly abilities.  However after a surprisingly handsome man appeared in her garden, quite nude asking her for help, then that same nude man disappear a moment later in front of her eyes she thought she was insane.  Quite possibly what she witnessed was impossible, but the fact remained that she was totally intrigued that she just might be falling in love with a ghost!  She must do something, but what?Caught by a madman intent on stealing Argus Wherlocke’s gift /talent to be used as weapons, Argus needed to alert and seek help from his family.  He didn’t plan to involve a duke’s lovely daughter in the struggle, but now the lovely Lorelei is his only hope for salvation.I have long been a follower of Ms. Howell’s Wherelocke series  and believe me it just gets better and better and the characters, she creates are immensely endearing and lovable.  I particularly loved Lorelei, her father the duke, his brood of children, and his butler!  What an incredibly loving family, including siblings, and cousins.  But that is not all, because Lorelei did get the word out to Argus’ family and they all came to rally round to help capture the madmen who thought to steal the Wherelocke’s gifts.  Naturally, each and every one of the Wherelocke’s had their own individual gifts and talents. Discovering some all over again, some new and some I’ve seen before in earlier volumes just added to the enjoyment of reading this series.The villain’s in IF HE’S DANGEROUS were particularly vile, which made for a lot of juicy adventures, thrills and chills, excitement, and ever lasting suspense.  Much of it ‘edge-of-the-seat’ suspense.  This is just simply one of my favorite series with fast paced adventures, quite sensual romances and just one of the best series of exciting adventures.Ashford MacNab, Narrator, takes the impeccable writing of Hannah Howell and makes it into a visible theater of images for the listener.  Great job for both author and narrator.  LOVE this series.Marilyn Rondeau

Ms. Gracie’s heroine Abby was enormously lovable right from the get-go.  Abigail Chantry was a governess and had a good working relationship with her employers and her charges but when she heard her younger sister was in desperate straits, Abby would do anything to save her and two of her sister’s dearest friends from a fate worse than death, including death itself.  Hiding from being discovered by folks who would do them harm,  funds were at a perilous or nonexistent state.  Needing medication for her sister Abigail decided to break into an empty mansion in the hope of finding something to sell.  What Abby did find was Lady Beatrice Davenham, bedridden and neglected. Horrified at how Lady Beatrice’s servants were robbing their mistress blind, with Lady Beatrice’s affirmation Abby then fired them all - with Lady Beatrice’s blessing.  After that Lady Beatrice had these four young ladies become her “nieces” .Life was good until Lady Beatrice’s dashingly handsome and arrogant nephew, Max, Lord Davenham return from the Orient and discovers an impostor running his household.I have to say that I have always been a fan of Anne Gracie but what originally prompted me to pick up this audio was two things, one the gorgeous artwork of the cover, and second because I have always liked Ms. Gracie’s writing.  So WOW - I got DOUBLE the pleasure!!!  Add to that the superb narration by Allison Larkin and this Audible version was the best!Not only do you have a wonderful sensual romance going on between Max and Abby (once they figured it out) but Lady Beatrice was a darling; her other “nieces” were sweethearts; and Abby’s friends who had always looked out for her became their butler and footman!  It was a purely spectacular mix of great characters who interacted with each other in a wonderful tableau of danger, adventure and humorous antics.Naturally, there was also the danger of the fiends who were trying to find Abby’s sister and reel her back into the dangerous brothel she had escaped from.  Add to that the mystery of how and why her sister ended up there in the first place and you have one fully fleshed out tale, that will keep you listening to the very wee hours.This Audible version is highly recommended.Marilyn Rondeau

As a massive talent in the paranormal romance genre, Kresley Cole is a must-buy for me and a mission to acquire every one of her Immortal After Dark books which just get better and better!  Sometimes we revisit characters from the past – especially some very cool and fun ones, as well as the bad guys.  Old characters are brought up to date to what’s going on in the present and some come in to aid the the perplexed!  And then we have Nix the all-knowing, inexplicable, scatter-brained sooth-sayer who is never wrong and an absolute hoot!The plot of UNTOUCHABLE features the fourth Wroth (vampire) brother who finds love, in an almost impossible situation for any man - human or vampire.  Murdoch is totally besotted with Daniela the Ice Maiden.  Unfortunately, to touch her will bring her unbearable pain and vice-a-versa.  So how to overcome this?  First of all is the element of trust which takes awhile for Murdoch to forge with Daniela and to keep her safe from those that were trying to kill her!Both stubborn - neither Murdoch or Daniela are able to accept their undeniable attraction to one another, nor that they are destined as mates.  They have the the all the adventures and excitement of Murdoch trying to keep her alive while they meet half-way - then clash and back off.  But then an amazing thing happens when Daniela accidentally bloods him and Murdoch will never be the same again, but then Daniela disappears and the  biggest adventure begins again.No spoilers here – but it will be up to you to see how north and south can come together to meet at the equator!Bottom line:  Just simply another fabulous entry in one of the more original paranormal genre’s out there.  Highly recommended both as a stand-alone book or my preference of being read to by the amazing narration of Robert Petkoff.Marilyn Rondeau

Lord almighty, even though I hope Ms. Ward doesn't ignore my favorite Blackdagger Brotherhood I am more than excited to follow along with THE BOURBON KINGS after this initial introduction of Book #1 which has whetted my appetite for more.What could be better than a filthy rich family – pillars of society and dysfunctional as all hell  – who are finding out that their own father has practically bankrupted the Easterly Estate and left most of them without their silver spoons!  Book one centers around Tulane “Lane” the prodigal son of the bourbon dynasty who seems to be left holding the ruin of his family’s legacy; a cheating and poisonous soon to be ex-wife; a totally dysfunctional sister whom he is trying to save from herself; and his oldest brother who was physically and mentally abused and almost killed by their father.The stage was set with one bright beam of light in Lizzie King, Easterly’s head gardener, who had made the mistake of falling in love with Lane, and just might be the one person who can save Lane in order to pull Easterly back from the precipice of total ruin.Alexander Cendese who performed this audible narration did a good job and loved his southern drawl, however, I would have liked a better interpretation of the female voices.BOTTOM LINE:  This was one extremely powerful and ensnaring beginning of what looks to be another phenomenal series from the talented pen of one of my favorite authors.  Ward has set the stage for another intoxicating series and I can’t wait to see who manages to stay alive and prospers once the dust settles and Book 2 comes out.  Highly recommended to all fans of Ms. Ward to get in on her next big series!Marilyn Rondeau

At the suggestion of a friend of mine, I decided to give the critically acclaimed author Linda Fairstein atry and was extremely pleased to be able to find her very first debut novel in my preferred format - audio!The heroine, Alexandra Cooper is Manhattan’s top sex crimes prosecutor who wakes up one morning to learn some shocking news - the newspapers and news channels were discussing her brutal murder! Naturally, she was far from dead, but knew at once from the reports that the body found was not her but her friend Isabella Lascar, a Hollywood star whom Alex had allowed to stay at her Martha’s Vineyard home.  The question facing Alex now was Isabella targeted by a stalker; or was someone out to kill Alex and mistook Isabella for her?The characterization of Alex and her colleagues were wonderful as well as the background one is exposed to concerning the legal workings of a top ADA prosecutor.  I loved the dialogs between Alex and her wisecracking colleague Mike Chapman who is a hoot in some ways to disguise a brilliant investigative mind.  There are a plethora of twists and turns to keep the pace rapid and a good amount of interesting secondary characters which add a lot of depth to the mystery.Bottom line:  A terrific thriller and a most enjoyable way to discover a new author whose I hope to read a lot more from.Marilyn Rondeau

Introduced in Ms. Galen’s EARLS JUST WANT TO HAVE FUN, Gideon Harrow had spent his life in the dark alley’s of the London rookery known as St. Giles.  Thieving and cons were a way of life he wanted to rid himself of so he had planned one last heist to win his freedom and leave London far behind.  All was going rather well barely escaping his cronies out to kill him for his double cross, when he fell prey to an even bigger threat – into the hands of one of Society’s most untouchable cherished daughters – Lady Susanna Derring.Having been suffocated under the thumb of her domineering mother; and protective older brothers, Susanna wants out – she wants an adventure; and she wants to experience Vauxhall Gardens at any cost.  Blackmailing Gideon, she hides from him the velvet pouch that holds his ticket out of London. In order to get his property back he must take her to Vauxhall Gardens.  But as her adventure turns into a series of mis-adventures and a whole lot of danger would she have to pay such a high price and bank on the love of a reformed thief?*** In this second book of the  Covent Garden Cubs,  which by the way is completely stand-alone even if you hadn’t read the first book in this series, you will still experience the excitement, adventure and danger of life lived in London’s underbelly.  Gideon who played a part in the first book is fully fleshed out in this second book where we see his motivations and learn more of his background.Susannah who just happens to be the sister of  the Earl of Dane (who captured his wife in the first book of the series) has led a much more stringent upbringing which is fully exposed as to the how and why in the rather twisty surprise ending.  Naturally, it was a wonderful experience to watch Ms. Galen take the once very obedient young woman and turn her loose with Gideon as her guide and watch her grow in a woman of strength, purpose, and self esteem.Bottom line:  This was a wonderfully fast-paced adventure with witty humorous dialogs, outrageous double entendres; and a beautifully evolved sensual romance.  What could possibly be better than that?  Highly recommended.Marilyn Rondeau
When you have bad feet it's a pleasure to find comfort and these Reiker's were like walking on  a cloud.

This was a total delight to read.  Actually, it was two novella’s turned into one complete beginning to the Windham Family series.  It sets the stage for a plethora of stories regarding the prolific progeny that Percival and Esther Windham’s marriage produced.  But what THE DUKE AND HIS DUCHESS did for me was to show two people who were not perfect but whose love and respect for one another through thick and thin; gossip; betrayals; family sickness was so strong and so enduring that it is a love story for the ages.Back from the Canadian and American wilderness, Percival (Percy) and his brother Anthony met Esther Himmelfarb at a house party where if gossips were correct their mother the Duchess of Windham had ordered her two younger sons to find themselves suitable brides.  With Percy, known as  something of a rake, he had noticed the girl without a title or dowry and was intrigued by her down to earth attitude and absence of the usual arsenal of feminine wiles of trapping a nobleman. Easy to talk to and lovely to boot Percy moved fast and their romance was brief and a whirlwind marriage followed.Part two was the marriage five years later with Esther and Percy producing four children in the nursery and the reality of living along with others in the ducal estate with an aging duke on the verge of senility and the heir apparent (Percy’s brother Peter) not well.  It was interesting that all was not sugar plums and fairy tales but Ms. Burrowes showed real life where the issues of not enough help would plague a mother (Esther) who was overloaded with the responsibility of four quick births, the exhaustion of nursing (they couldn’t afford a wet nurse), and keeping track of four rambunctious young boys.Ms. Burrowes not only writes the most wonderful love stories but she does this with reality as well as great emotion.  She shows where Esther is still in love with her handsome dashing soul mate, but truthfully is just plain exhausted.  She also portrays Percy as loving and caring to the point where he visits an ex-mistress to question her about his wife’s health.  Strange yes, but a proud man and very much in love with Esther that he would go to a source he knew Esther, should she find out, would be very upset.Bottom line:  Again Ms. Burrowes writes real and beautifully described romances with more than fluff and sex scenes.  Every Burrowes book I’ve read is a keeper and resonates in my heart and mind long after the last page is turned.  Simply a marvelous beginning to a fabulous series and family dynasty.Marilyn Rondeau

Another new author for me and if this is an example of how she writes and plots Ms. Maeve Greyson just may become a favorite.  What was not to love about MY HIGHLAND BRIDE?  First, not necessarily your run-of-the mill time traveler - Ms. Greyson’s heroines were time-runners  !  Quite unique where they not only could go back and forth but this group of time-runners also had some unique gifts - trust me as I will let you discover what they are for yourselves.Kenna Sinclair was presently quite happy in 2015 running the family’s boutique of herbs and perfumes, until she received a message from her grandmother [who is presently in Medieval Scotland in the 13th century]  telling Kenna it is time for her to join both her and her elder sister Jolie who is about to give birth to her 2nd child.  Kenna is really not ready to do this but duty calls and she would love to see her new niece or nephew.  The surprise in store for Kenna is that Mother Sinclair (Granny) has found Kenna’s fated husband.  Kenna is not thrilled until she touches his arm and electricity runs up her entire body.  Now that never happened before!Suffice it to say that there are many humorous moments, as Kenna (modern Miss) squares off with Colum Garrison (Medieval warrior).  In fact, Colum is frustrated that Kenna is the first lass who seems completely immune to his charms.  Kenna, who reads minds, saw at once that he had probably slept with every lass in the clan and decided she was not about to become another notch on his sword.  Actually it was quite tough seeming uninterested and frustrating because deep in her heart Kenna knows that she has met the only man she will ever love.  However, this romance was never going to be an easy accomplishment!Not all was coming up roses, and danger came in the form of one very mysterious and handsome Clan chief who decided that Kenna was the Lass HE intended to have.  This aspect was cleverly written and evoked humor, danger and an emotional pull that had me tearing up.Bottom line:  Excellent read and a series I plan to continue for this is right up my alley, with great romance and immense intrigue.  Loved it!Marilyn Rondeau

WHAT TO DO WITH A DUKE is a delightfully charming book and one which to my mind was totally enchanting.  The fact that this is the first book in a new series – Spinster House Series – makes it even more delectable for me when I can start a great series right from the start.Daughter of the town cleric in the village of Loves Bridge, Miss Isabelle Catherine “Cat” Hutting was thrilled when she heard that the spinster who had occupied the Spinster House had eloped and the house was empty.  Notification went out to the Duke of Hart aka the Cursed Duke  who must come and formally endorse the next spinster to occupy the house.  Cat who needed peace and quiet to write her novel - away from the interruptions of a busy house and numerous siblings - knew that at the advanced age of 25 she was on the shelf; didn’t want to get married; and wanted to be the next spinster to occupy that wonderful quiet house.After being notified of the vacancy at the Spinster House, Marcus, the Duke of Hart hightailed it to Loves Bridge following the rules all Dukes of Hart must follow which were dictated 200 years before in order to select the next spinster to occupy the house.One problem Cat encountered was that the Cursed Duke was the most handsome man she had ever seen, and very impressive.  The same problem Marcus faced as he was just as attracted to Cat as she to him.  The bigger problem was the actual curse which stated that any Duke of Hart who married would never see his heir born and be dead within the next nine months of a valid pregnancy.With wit and writing that moved this story right along at a great pace, plus characters that leapt into your heart (especially the four year old twin brothers of Cat) this is one of those splendid reads that one doesn’t like to lay down until finished!  Excellent and highly recommended.Marilyn Rondeau

Daniel Herbert had buried his grief in medical studies after the death of his childhood sweetheart whom he’d intended to marry.  Basically, he’d closed off his heart and was passionate only for his medical studies which of course made him an exceptional doctor whom most who knew him viewed as a saint.Unfortunately, when he learned that he’d inherited a title and estate from a distant relative, Daniel was less than overjoyed as the burden of wealth would interfere with his medical calling.  Reluctantly, he accepted his sister and brother-in-law’s guidance on how to get on in society. Daniel also thought it was time to find a wife.  A wife who was sensible, intelligent and could look after the estates so he could pursue his medical calling.  What he didn’t expect was to be overcome with passion by a woman described as the Black Widow.*** As usual, Ms. Putney engages you from the very first pages and with NOT ALWAYS A SAINT, she continues in kind.  Her hero Daniel is an amazing young man and one can see where most all would consider him a saint.  I fell in love – not only with Daniel but with Jessie aka the Black Widow and Ms. Putney’s wonderful dialogs and elegant prose. With glimpses into the lives of some of her past heroes and heroines it was like being invited to a wonderful family reunion.Daniel was wonderful, kind, caring, loving with no mysteries. Jessie on the other hand came with secrets galore, which made the story move at a rapid pace and made this reader continue reading into the wee hours to finish.  The passion and sensual scenes, all tastefully done, were beautifully rendered. When discoveries were made as investigations into Jessie’s past ghosts were unearthed and not all was joy, but Ms. Putney was able to give closure to many of the mysteries and nightmares Jessie had carried with her all her life.  Some joyful - some not and with a cliff-hanger in the offing would they finally have a happy ending?  You will have to read to discover!All in all, this was a most excellent read by one of the long-standing stars of this genre!  Brava Ms. Putney - you continue to entrance and entertain.Marilyn Rondeau

Again a new author for me, and a story and writing that I thoroughly enjoyed.Miss Margaret Mayfield was an obedient child and daughter, never given her parents a moments worry as they molded her into a perfectly compliant young woman.  Timid, shy, with no real spunk or an original thought in her head.  Brainwashed as well by her parents who saw the world as black and white, right and wrong.  About to have their annual dinner party, Margaret was warned by her mother that Sir Justin Keighley had been invited as a manner of course, but for Margaret to steer clear of him at all costs as his opinions, and arrogance were rude beyond comprehension.  Forewarned, Margaret was on her guard.Sir Justin Keighley found Margaret to be everything he detested in a woman.  Shy, retiring, obedient to her parents (whom Justin detested) and ignorant of the real world around her!  When the party decided to go for a walk, Margaret planned to duck out of sight but unfortunately, Justin saw her and decided to tag along.  Before Margaret  realized it she imagined all kinds of horrors at the hands of such a rake and went into hysterics, falling, ripping her gown and that is how the rest of the guests found her with Justin attempting to help her to her feet.  Naturally, the parents insisted Justin marry the twit - he refused!And so it began…. and the story evolved into a delicious adventure where both Margaret and Justin had the chance to grow.  Margaret was still of the opinion that Justin was rude and beastly; Justin still thought Margaret a brainless twit but hearing she had run away, he felt honor bound to follow and bring her home.  Unfortunately, mishaps happen and the comedy of errors began but rather than give any more details, I will simply say - this is a must read and my opinion is that you will enjoy every morsel of this story as much as I did.  Reading A RADICAL ARRANGEMENT was a most enjoyable pleasure and I highly recommend this book!!!Marilyn Rondeau

One thing you will find whenever you pick up a book by Grace Burrowes - you are in for a rare treat! Not only is Ms. Burrowes one of the most refreshing and prolific authors to have arrived on the scene since her debut book THE HEIR in December of 2010, but she has amassed a legion of dedicated fans. Fans, like myself, who are ready and willing to devour anything she puts her name to be it historical, or contemporary genres!  Ms. Burrowes is just that good - grabbing you in the first chapter, or first page, and never letting you go until the end.Just as in TREMAINE’S TRUE LOVE, Ms. Burrowes gives us a very wealthy wool magnate, who truly loves his sheep prowling the world in search of new strains and improving the bloodlines of the sheep he loves, all while making more and more profits.  When he meets the somewhat reserved Lady Nita Haddonfield, he recognizes that she is more than just an attractive face.  But Nita, is to all intents and purposes content with her lot in life - not looking or expecting to marry and have to answer to a husband.  She has purpose, commitment, and a dedication far beyond that of most women - she is a healer and caters to the needy in spite of her family’s objections.  She could never expect a man to allow her the freedom and the chances she takes with herself to tend to her patients.However, Ms. Burrowes never gives you a one dimensional character, and Tremaine St. Michael, for all his wealth is cut from a different cloth.  Maybe brusque at times, but with a heart and feelings that rush across the pages straight into your heart - yes I adore this hero she created!  Not only do you have the most wonderful hero in Tremaine, but Nita is also one of the more giving and loving heroines I’ve come across lately and will hold a special place in my heart long after I turned the last page.Bottom line:  Kudo’s and blessings to Ms. Burrowes who continues to enrapture her legions of fans with every word she writes.  TREMAINE’S TRUE LOVE is not to be missed!!!Marilyn Rondeau

After police rescued Jenna Thompson a five year old from a closet she’d been held captive in for nine days, and with her family murdered by the same madman, her aunt whisked her away to live in Baltimore.  Twenty-five years later, Jenna, now a forensic artist, has returned to Nashville on a quest to find peace with herself after a particularly brutal case in Baltimore brought back memories of her own childhood ordeal which she would rather remain buried.Detective Rick Morgan, is on a new case where a child’s skeletal remains are found.  He learns of Jenna’s forensic artistic ability to recreate a face based upon a skull and enlists her help.  Jenna agrees realizing that though she lived through her horror another child hadn’t.  But worse than that, other women are dying, and the links between these new murders and Jenna’s past are coming to light and Rick is beginning to realize that Jenna may still be in more danger from a madman who appears to be looking to tie up loose ends.Mary Burton’s latest novel, BE AFRAID is one more reason that proves that if you are looking for complex, twisted, action-packed thrills and chills – rest assured - Ms. Burton should be your “go-to author”.  I have read several of her novels now and they just get better and better.  Burton has a knack for playing her cards close to the vest and I haven’t been able to guess her villains until she is ready to reveal them!  The complexity of Burton’s plotting is top-notch and her writing style is clean and fresh with no wasted words.Burton’s characters are all superbly drawn and fleshed out by the end of the novel. Any questions the reader might have about what one person has to do with another and what connections link them will be revealed.  All in all, BE AFRAID is just one more novel on an impressive list of like genres that place Ms. Burton at the top of her game!  Highly recommended!!Marilyn Rondeau

Awesome, awesome, awesome - the GRAY MAN series gives the BOURNE series a run for its money and if the producers in Hollywood haven’t picked up on what would be a fantastic series set to the big screen than they are simply not paying attention!In Book 4 of The Gray Man series, ex-CIA master assassin Court Gentry is still trying to stay out of light and into the shadows.  With so many entities out to kill him including the US Government, Court is having more and more difficulty remaining in the shadows.  On his last assignment of taking revenge on a former employer who betrayed him, a killer very much like Court has now set his sights on him.Russell Whitlock, code-named Dead Eye, is a graduate of the same secret Autonomous Asset Program that trained and controlled Court.  However, Dead Eye is going rogue in order to frame and terminate his ultimate target - Court Gentry and earn the distinction of being the one man who could take Court down.In another of Greaney’s fabulous additions to his Gray Man series, I can say one might need oxygen handy as the suspense is so tense I find myself holding my breath through this authors amazing detailed descriptions of the blow-by-blow action.  Greaney’s writing is astounding bringing you right along with the Gray Man’s adventures and heart-stopping suspense which he masterfully generates.Bottom line:  Mark Greaney’s Gray Man books are top notch and DEAD EYE  is just one more example of the best you may find in CIA black OPs thrillers!  AWESOME!Marilyn Rondeau

Some time ago, the widow Ursula Kern took control of her life and began the Kern Secretarial Agency providing reliable professional services to its wealthy clientele.  Anne Clifton, both friend and one of her finest employees has met an untimely end – and Ursula is unconvinced it was NOT from natural causes.Ursula’s latest employer Slater Roxton, archaeologist and adventurer, is not only upset that she is going to quit her position with him to start investigating Ms. Cliftons demise; but feels it is too dangerous if Ursula’s intuition of foul play is correct.  Instead, Slater intends to stay very close and volunteers to help Ursula with her investigation.  In the interim big sparks of attraction occur between Ursula and Slater, but Ursula’s independent nature and intent to go it alone put her life in danger.  In the end, would Slater be able to save Ursula for a future he now feels could be theirs?As usual, Ms. Quick has struck gold in this latest novel of intrigue in Victorian London.  Her plotting is superb, characterizations are impeccable and pacing of the action is fast and exciting.  Her heroine, Ursula Kern is a very admirable character - ahead of her time as an early entrepreneur who has not only helped herself to financial security but had also given many women the opportunity to gain their own independence as professionals.Likewise, I was fully intrigued with Slater Roxton.  The preface gives a wonderful look at Slater’s background and his adventures on a mystical island that if he weren’t a survivor could have entombed him;  but otherwise shaped him into the very interesting man he’d become.  Outside he presented what one would consider a mild scholarly individual, but underneath he was anything but!  With Ursula and Slater both stubborn and independent individuals who had been burnt by others, levels of trust were hard for each to accept or accommodate.Finally, the intrigue of following a minute amount of clues which ended up as one very big and deadly conspiracy was, as usual for Ms. Quick, amazingly complex and action packed.  GARDEN OF LIES was another brilliantly staged drama full of action, and surprises.  Bottom line: Most readers should be gratified with the thrills, chills, sensuality, and total excitement Ms. Quick brings to each and every novel.Marilyn Rondeau

It really thrills me when I get to start a series that starts out as wonderfully as this one.  I picked this up via Audible and spent a lot of my time just riding around to hear more.  Had I been reading this, I’m sure I would have never put POTENT PLEASURES down - except to heed natures call - and to get something to eat or drink!  Naturally as a fan of Eloisa James, this seems to happen each time I pick up one of her books - they’re just that good!About to make her debut to society, Charlotte Calverstill the youngest daughter  of a duke, was given leave to visit Julia, a school chum.  Her mama was busy completing arrangements for Charlotte’s come-out ball.  Charlottes friend Julia was a bit foolish and always falling in love and Charlotte was talked into attending a masquerade ball to keep Julia out of trouble.  Innocents that they were, neither realized it was a courtesans ball and the lemonade was spiked. Julia didn’t drink her tainted lemonade, Charlotte did.  So when a darkly handsome young man swept her into his arms Charlotte went willingly and after he relieved her - not against her wishes - of her virginity Charlotte realized she was ruined.Years later, when Charlotte and the rouge (Alex Foakes) meet again, the still devastatingly handsome Earl does not remember her, yet he is totally smitten and vows to wed her.  Charlotte finally knows who he is, and that he is primarily looking to find a mother for his young daughter so Charlotte  planned to lead him a merry chase.  However Charlotte couldn’t resist the same sizzle that affected him also affected her.However, while this sets the stage for the beginning of the tale it is by no means the end of the story.  I simply can’t give anymore away.  The marriage does take place, and the emotional upheavals, the joys, betrayals, and trust issues are all there, making for both joyous and heartbreaking scenes.  I found POTENT PLEASURES to be an emotional roller-coaster ride.  Charlotte was so precious, so very innocent even after she had been ruined.  Her mother the duchess was so very loving, and at times the dialogs between them were actually hilarious!  Just remember the term “floppy poppy” and you’ll understand what I mean.Alex Foakes, the Earl of Sheffield & Foakes, was a superb hero – a wonderful papa, to his orphaned year old daughter; a consummate lover; and a bit of jerk all at the same time!  Ms. James portrayal of the Charlotte and Alex was wonderfully complex and beautifully done.  Lessons learned here were how damaging gossip, twisted and turned could ruin lives and cost unnecessary damage.Bottom line:  Eloisa James continues to be tops on my list of authors for remarkable storytelling, her exuberant humor, sensual love making and emotions.  At times I would have liked to hit Alex over the head, for his stupidity; and his daughter Pippa will make your heart sing!  Excellent read!Marilyn Rondeau

Once again, Ms. Burrowes has created another perfectly enjoyable and brilliantly written tome of THE DUKE’S DISASTER set in Regency England.  She has created Noah Winters,  a wonderful hero I simply fell in love with whose droll sense of humor was a refreshing change of pace for me.When Noah’s, choice of bride whom he’d been pursuing cried off and betrothed herself to another Noah had to revise his plans.  Not wanting to waste any more time, Noah decided that his chosen bride’s companion, Lady Thea Collins, who had been in attendance during his pursuit would be his next best choice as his duchess.  After all, Lady Thea seemed sensible and even attractive. Once her former employer married Thea would no longer be needed as a paid companion.  After all, rather than have to look for new employment, wouldn’t she be more than grateful to become his duchess and bear him an heir and a spare.Lady Thea, knew enough not to expect any kind of romantic gestures from the Duke and that he expected she would jump at the chance to become his duchess.  She certainly knew he was no romantic. It was his duty after all to continue his line with a proper heir.  Naturally, he expected she would be grateful for the offer, yet Thea didn't jump at his offer.  Thea had a confession to make but in Noah’s rush to have the marriage completed, she hadn’t the opportunity to bare her soul.As it turned out both the duke and his newly married duchess, never came clean with one another.  Lady Thea didn’t have the opportunity to tell Noah that she was no longer a virgin; and Noah had neglected to discuss with Thea the existence of two young daughters that resided in another wing of his massive home.With her usual intelligent and delectable prose, Ms. Burrowes has given her fans another example of why her writing has attracted such a legion of fans.  Not only is Burrowes writing impeccable but her characterizations and plotting is always brilliant.  I loved the story - both Noah and Lady Thea were perfect together and I loved their dialogs, especially during their morning breakfast’s in bed.  Their shared tea; and his ever present touchy-feely tendencies.  Noah’s two adorable young daughters were also a delight.Bottom Line:  Love, love, loved this story and especially the very surprise ending.  Burrowes books just get better and better every time!Marilyn Rondeau

My first experience with this author.  Her heroine, Cassandra Burton - a duchess and human - was totally unique when first introduced driving a cart through the cemetery to steal a fresh corpse!  But Cassandra’s interest was purely scientific.  Cassandra had a brilliant mind and wanted to be a doctor, but because of her sex, she would never be admitted to study with others.  So for the last ten years she studied on her own every medical text she could get her hands on. Now she needed human cadavers in order to further her studies so that she could heal people.However, this particular night she was caught – not by the police but by the Lord Vampire of London, a man she actually knew from society Don Rafael Villar and he was none too happy thinking she was a vampire hunter.  Why else would she be in the cemetery in the middle of the night?  Unfortunately, she saw his fangs and because he could not wipe her mind he brought her to his home.  As the story progressed Rafael had two options, kill Cassandra to keep her silent or change her into a vampire. But falling in love was not among them.What is very interesting in this authors take on the vampire paranormal genre. She presented Rafael as a damaged immortal; one whose face had been disfigured, and a left arm which had been damaged so badly that it was a useless appendage.  Naturally, as Cassandra was his prisoner and was falling in love she wanted to heal him.  But would she have the time and the skill because behind the scenes, a betrayal and revolution was brewing by another vampire who wanted to topple Rafael’s authority and take over as Lord of London.BITE AT FIRST SIGHT was an easy read, and flowed along at a good pace. I liked the way the author let some of the vampires have frailties, such as an addiction to drugs, and Rafael’s injuries. The plot was creative and original and the secondary characters added depth and interest to the story.  Overall a very good read.Marilyn Rondeau
