I couldn't put it down.The only reason why I am giving this a five star is because it is confusing in spots, where I didn't feel like the tale was fleshed out more. It also left me with more questions than answers, which as a reader, find it frustrating. I am hoping that there will be a second book that will explain more of the myths in this novel as well as explore the relationships between the characters.This is a fast-paced novel and definitely a good read.

I needed a third bed shaker for our apartment since we had to get up early before my husband got off work. I didn't want to spend a lot of money on what we normally buy. This is a fantastic tool.I will say that the flashing light is not that bright. I didn't buy it for the light and to our disappointment, there is no socket in the back to plug in a lamp to wake us up. That is a major flaw in our book as we rely on our flashing lamps to wake us up as well as the bed shaker.However, the bed shaker is loud. My boys said that the volume of the buzzing is loud too but when you don't have your hearing aids on, it is rather muffled. What we do is put the bed shaker beneath our mattress and when the alarm goes off, it will wake you up and believe me, I have been woken up with a big start every single time the alarm goes off. It is rather nerve-wracking to wake up to. (That is the effect we're aiming for.)I would definitely buy this again. It is worth the price and the red glow at night does not keep us awake like the green glow does. It is actually soothing to fall asleep by.

I just absolutely adore this pinking shears. I had packed my other set already earlier this year while waiting to sell this house. I had to buy this one since someone wanted one of my bunny creations and I wish I had found this one sooner.It is so much easier to cut through material with this shears than with my older pair. It doesn't hurt my hand when I am finished. It curves perfectly with my hand and provides a solid grip as well as cushioning my hand. It cuts like butter going through fabric, even when I double the material to make two or three cuts. It is smaller than a lot of other pinking shears.This is my favorite tool in my sewing closet right now. I would definitely recommend this to everyone.

I JUST got this today and it's going right into the boys' bathroom in the new house. It matches the color of the bathroom there and perfect for tween boys who really don't care about the style of the bathroom shower curtains, as long as no one can see them, that's all they need. I, on the other hand, like to decorate and keep the bathroom looking nice.The shower curtain is not plastic, which I really like. It is machine washable, which is another plus in my book. The shower curtain hooks may be plastic but they're of a stronger sort than what you'd find at the local grocery store, so another plus.I plan to fill the lotion dispenser with foaming soap since my boys don't care about lotion. It is a masculine enough color not to deter them from using soap. I do like the mosaic tile look. The soap dispenser is handy as well and the cup is great. However, there is one flaw that I am seeing in this whole setup, which is the lack of a toothbrush holder to match the cup, soap dish and lotion dispenser. If I could trade anything, it would be to get rid of the soap dish (we don't use bar soaps in our house) and replace it with the toothbrush holder. And yes, I would pay a little bit more to have the toothbrush holder in a matching pattern with this set.As it is, the price of $18.99 is a great bargain for this set. Some will say you get what you paid for, and while it is cheaper than buying each piece individually (and maybe not have the guarantee of having all the matched pieces available in one store), it is still a good bargain. I find this a great house-warming gift for those high school graduates soon moving out of their homes into a dorm room, or even into their first apartment.I wish someone had bought me a set like this years ago when I first started out. So, this is one of my favorite products to review from Vine.

Such a captivating story. I really enjoyed reading this memoir as it is well-written, informative and filled with great insight on how to describe living with a hole in your head. She writes without self-pity, which I absolutely adore. And she writes in such a way that her diagnosis makes sense, though honestly, I cannot imagine not knowing the difference between 10 minutes and an hour, or my left from my right side. She navigates her life with grace and humor, though physically she may not be so graceful but emotionally, she is.This is a fast read. It is one of my favorite stories. I found it to be fascinating as she describes the few years after she had her diagnosis made. All of her life, Cole thought she was just different and odd. Her relationships with her family members were strained as she always had to have a lot of attention or someone had to be with her to go places otherwise she would be lost. Once the diagnosis was made, it just all made sense to her and her family. It wasn't an easy thing to accept but she made it work.In spite of her navigational issues (among others), Cole has managed to carve out a life of her own, and has managed to carve out a career as well. This book is well-written and captivating. I enjoyed it and hope she will write more books in the future.

I truly wish I enjoyed this book, like so many reviewers here.I did manage to finish the book but learned absolutely nothing from it, other than people with money are so disconnected from the rest of the people struggling with cancer. I had a close friend who died from brain cancer and my father died from a brain-related dementia and I picked this book, hoping to feel that someone else shared insights to what it is like to watch someone die from a horrible disease.Memoirs are really my favorite category to read. I love them. This one, however, is poorly edited and poorly written. I don't know if she was just trying to make light of her situation but I ended up feeling that she and I have nothing in common. Well, honestly, I don't have a summer home and a five bedroom house, nor the money to buy my daughter a house or to hire two people to help me take care of my dad like she did. Or have friends with Black American Express cards to throw at a doctor that have been under investigation for ignoring the federal government guidelines in treating cancer. Throughout this book, I never really got the feeling that the author has come through to become a real person who is grieving her husband. She says the right things but the feelings never really shined through. Half of the book was written about her current husband and their subsequent reunion. She tries to put a positive spin on everything, even taking her daughters to Europe to recover from their dad's illness and death, only to have them mope all through Europe. I sure wish I was able to take my mom to Europe after my dad died but modern medicine is not cheap and all of her savings were spent on medical bills.I truly wish I like this book. I had high hopes for it. Then again, not everyone is alike when they come to a book and read it to apply to their lives, to find a common ground with someone who lost a loved one to cancer. This book can be appealing to a lot of people, but I just couldn't relate to the author. I wish I did.

I got this to try out through Vine. I picked this out for my husband who has been struggling with spinal pain and deep back aches. I thought after reading the reviews that it might work.I was wrong. This was too hard on his back, too awkward to roll around on and too small.He is not a big man, so the length of it should not have been a problem, but it is. It is the same size as my dog's chewy toy and that is not big at all. The pictures on this site is misleading.It is too hard and too awkward to use. It doesn't stay in place when you use it. The only way we could use it is if one of us is rolling it on his back for him. That does defeat the purpose of working out the kinks in your back yourself when no one is around.Fortunately, the price isn't too expensive so it'll be a good addition to the tools my husband already has. It is disappointing especially since we were hoping that it would work.

I love lipsticks and I am always on the look out for the perfect lip stick. I will admit that I often forget to reapply it throughout the day so having something that will keep the color on my lips all day is very appealing.This one fits the bill. I do have to reapply the gloss part throughout the day but that's because I really don't like dry lips. The color does not stay fresh for 24 hours like it says BUT I did have a tint left on my lips the next morning after I woke up. It needed reapplying then but it lasted through everything. What I like is that it does not leave a stain on your glassware after drinking a cup of water/wine/juice. It stays on your lips, not on the glass. It does stay on while you're eating and it does stay on when your husband kisses you.As far as I am concerned, this is my favorite lipstick. It is a bit pricier than what I normally pay for but I'll take it any day. I just love it. And even better, it does not have that weird scent like a lot of lipsticks or gloss have. It has a faint but very pleasant scent to it. It won't drive you crazy all day trying to hide that unpleasant scents that some lipsticks have. That is a bonus for me.

!!This is by far, the MOST COMFORTABLE Memory Foam Mattress I've EVER had!  I absolutely LOVE it!  I sleep AWESOMELY WELL, no back aches or headaches in the a.m. I really love the fact that I don't have to have a box spring under it!  I bought an inexpensive metal fram here on Amazon for it & after at least a month, it's STILL GOING STRONG!  Will post an update if I have any problems, but if you don't see any updates, you can rest assured, that I'm surely resting well

I Absolutely LOVE this!  SO GLAD  I bought the 2 pack!  They are illuminated blue, which makes using them at night really nice.  I have a Traverse which also has another port for a second one inside the console. EVERYTHING I've charged with this has charged quickly & efficiently. (an iPhone, Kindle Fire HD, Nintendo 3DS & 3DS XL & also the portable battery I bought here on Amazon(Ravpower Delux) 15000mAh external battery pack whhich I also LOVE,  since it comes in really handy when spending time with Amish friends!)  They really are "High Output", IF you have the correct "HIGH OUTPUT" USB cable (likea 3.0)  Wouldn't be caught without them & don't know how I got along without them before this!  Just spent a week with an Amish friend of mine visiting her Mom in NY State, these were life savers for me!  Kept my iPhone & Kindle FIre HD (which I used every night to watch streamong videos) charged all week on one charge of my Ravpower external battery!
Nice sturdy case. only problem is it screws together & not all ports available. threw mine away.

I've been thru 2 USB toMicro USB charger cords for my Kindle Fire HD in the past 6 months because of the way the Micro USB charger end sticks straight out from my Kindle, (they get bent easily) so I was looking for an adapter like this that had a right angle (or left, didn't matter) that would keep it from being bentso easliy.  This fit the bill & was like a dream come true! The only problem is the charging time!  Before getting this adapter, I could plug in my Kindle to charge when I went to bed & it was ALWAYS done charging before morning. (I'm a chronic insomniac). With this adapter,  by the a.m. it was only 38% charged!  I was sure I must've not had it connected properly, so tried again, 3 nights in a row with the VERY SAME RESULTS!  It takes on the average about one full night & at least half the next day!  This is NOT ACCEPTABLE!

I've been wearing Hanes or FOL bikini panties for years.  I absolutely LOVE the waistband on these.  I also LOVE the fact that they are a solid color, instead of having to pick between REALLY BAD patterns!  I would like it even better if these were available in all white or all grey, but the solid colors are certainly an upgrade from the stupid, ugly patterns we used to have to pick from!  Think about it, I'm over 50 years old & DON'T LIKE WEARING UNDERWEAR MADE WITH UGLY PATTERNS FOR JUNIOR HIGH GIRLS!!  it's time that someone started making these a little more respectable for us 'mature' women who can still wear these, but HATE UGLY UNDERWEAR!!Since I just got these, I will update everyone on how the waistband wears!  It looks like it will be an imporvement over the other waistbands that used to unravel quite easily!  other than that, they look & feel just like the FOL underwear I've always worn!  LOVE THEM!

Great electric blanket at a great price!  My elderly Dad LOVES IT!  My only gripe is that i wish you could use these with just one control for the whole blanket, instead of having to use one for each side.  My Dad is a widower & doesn't need two  controlers, other than that, it's perfect!
save your money.  this just plain stinks!

I absolutely LOVE this bag for carrying my Kindle Fire 8.9 HD!  There is a very well padded pocket for the kindle, and extra pocket beside that, (when zipped open from the top), it also has a velcro flap on one side to carry charging cables, etc & a zippered pocket on the other side.  My ONLY complaint is that I wish it had more room in the main zippered pocket for the plug in end of the charger (it's too flat to carry the actual wall plug inside) & that there was a little more room for a couple extra things.  i guess you would say I would like it to be a little thicker, (not side-ways, but thickness way)  Otherwise, it's an ABSOLUTELY AWESOME bag for my Kindle!  The pocket for the Kindle is very well padded & I feel my Kindle is very secure & protected in it.  I've tried 4 or 5 different kinds of bags like this for my kindle, but NONE offer the protection like this one does!  I also like the fact that the shoulder strap can be removed (it has clips) & can be carried by the handles that are also on it!  VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR EVERYONE WITH A KINDLE FIRE!

This is such a cute game!  Many adults I know really get into it, including me!  It's a very involved game, has a lot o things to do, quests to carry out, clothes to make for quests & just wearing. Pooh also has a garden that you can grow items in to use to make food for your cafe, & for other things.  Really AWESOME GAME, coming from someone who is 50+ yrs old!!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED for EVERYONE!

I've bought many of these universal battery chargers for cell phone batteries.  Most of them stunk, BADLY & went in the trash!  This one does an EXCELLENT JOB.  VERY EASY to use & does a GREAT JOB!  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS ONE ABOVE MOST OTHERS!
Bought these for my elderly Dad who had prostate surgery.  They are AWESOME & a GREAT PRICE!!
Won't work on Kindle Fires!
YUCK, I HATE IT!

I absolutely LOVE it!  Very easy to apply.  They cost more than other 'cheap' screen protectors, but WELL WORTH EVERY PENNY!!  Can be taken off to adjust it's position.  Reusable.  NO BUBBLES!!  I've never had ANY luck applying screen protectors, but this one was SUPER EASY to apply!  I took it off to try an Otter Box I got for my Kindle Fire.  Like a dummy, I laid it on the table & it fell off onto the floor.  So I'm ordering myself a new one, because I was NOT impressed with the Otterbox for Kindle Fires.  The bulkiness isn't so bad, but I prefer a case that has a lid I can shut, without having to take the cover off the back of the Otterbox & put it on the front....Going to send that back.  Which is why I'm getting another Moshi screen protector!  LOVE THEM!!  Picture is clear, easy to keep wiped off & just an AWESOME screen protector!  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND those to all Kindle Fire Folks!

These pine nuts are WONDERFUL!  Taste is great!  They were a little smaller that I had hoped, but hey, they worked just fine anyway.  I've purchased these from that seller twice now & plan to buy more in the future!

This product is ok if you're strapped for money, but it's cheaply made, had a short sprayer tube, no shoulder strap & doesn't even come with a clip on it to attach the sprayer tube when not in use.  We ended up paying a little more, but got another one that was a little more expensive, but worth every penny; "Smith 190216 2-Gallon Max Contractor Sprayer With Heavy Duty 18-Inch Wand and Shoulder Strap"  We like it much better!

I've been grooming dogs for 35+ years & would never, ever be caught without Kool Lube!!  Great product, easy to use & is VERY HELPFUL!  It not only cools hot blades off, but removes hair quickly when you're in the middle of grooming a dog & don't want to take the blade off, take it apart to clean it!  Just spray Kool Lube along the top of the blade & thru the side, wipe off the excess & you're good to go!!  I love ALL Oster Products!

My Doc recommended that I use Liquid Gels, versus caplets or tablets.  They work GREAT!  Get into your system FAST & start working right away.  Not to mention the WONDERFULLY AWESOME Arthritis Cap!  I LOVE THAT CAP!!  Having Rheumatoid Arthritis, it makes it unbearably hard to open those child proof bottles!  Sometimes I can't get them open AT ALL, not to mention how much it hurts to try to open those Child/Senior Proof caps!!  This is an answer to a HUGE question & problem!  I highly recommend this product to EVERYONE who has problems with Senior Proof Caps & who would like an over-the-counter pain med that works REALLY QUICKLY!!

This is a wonderful little tool that is great for keeping in the car, your purse, or anywhere else you may use it often.  Small, light weight, very portable with 4 different tips that all fit inside the handle, making it just one piece to carry around with you!!
Not worth the money at all.  Spending this much on a collar for just Bark Control is really not worth it.  An electronic training collar is a much better investment.

This was a hit with my little sheltie terrier mix, and perfect for the size of my backyard. It's not a launcher that will give you great distances, but I liked that I could with a minimal amount of practice control fairly well how far it went, keeping it from sailing out of the yard. My dog loves stick-shaped toys much more than balls so this was perfect for her. It's not particularly obvious how to use the launcher and I smacked myself pretty hard before checking the instructions, so be careful particularly with kids to make sure they know how to do it correctly. Replacement darts not very cheap, but at least they are available if you do break it, and be sure not to leave it around for your dog to chew on as the notch for launching it is exactly the type of thing most dogs would chew off first.

I've been a fan of Canon printers, and still use the MG6220 which I got a couple of years ago, the printer Amazon sent me to review was actually the white version of this printer, I guess to match Apple computers. It did work fine with my iMac, running the latest version of Mavericks, and I eventually did get AirPrint to work (the ipad and the printer have to be on the same wifi network, which I forgot to check, if you use multiple networks, be aware that the printer will most likely only be able to use the slower one). But I'm not impressed enough with this printer to replace my other one. I really dislike the paper drawer, which also cannot handle more than one paper size at a time, so be prepared to swap printer paper with photo paper if you use both. The printer cartridges are very hard to load if you are not in a well lit room, and the print quality just so-so. It does include double sided printing which is also a must for me, but just not one of Canon's better offerings.

Scharffen Berger is one of my favorite chocolates but I've generally only used it for my baking, when I want a really quality chocolate, I've used it in my chocolate chip cookies, chocolate cheesecakes, and making homemade chocolate truffles. This is my first experience with their chocolate bars intended for eating and I was not disappointed. The gift box is beautifully packaged with two bars of each flavor, arranged from low cacao content to high. I do prefer milk chocolates for eating myself, and the coconut and macadamia bar was indeed my favorite. I did still find the darker chocolate bars still very wonderful as well though, some of the best I've ever had in fact, the amount of fruit flavor and salt in these is perfectly balanced to complement the chocolate. I particularly liked the raspberry and almond bar. The bars are considerably thinner than their baking chocolates, making them very easy to break apart and eat. The price is comparable to most fine chocolate once you figure out the price per bar for 8 bars of this quality. I would caution about ordering this during warmer months as Amazon does not typically provide any temperature protection for chocolates in my experience.

Very short, with very little here that would really help someone learn to knit, you can just go to wikipedia and get more information on knitting for free than you'll get from this ebook. If you want to learn to knit, you'll do better finding some intro videos on YouTube or even better, signing up for a beginner course at Craftsy, than to get this ebook. Not sure it's really even worth getting for free, but definitely not worth paying any money for.

This mat is similar to Silpats, which I use a lot for baking, they are a bit cheaper and the company touts them as being BPA-free, but be warned, there is relatively little safety testing of any kinds of plastics and if any harmful chemicals leech into the food, so BPA-free doesn't mean there isn't something else that might be harmful. So do take that into consideration, you may want to still use these sparingly just out of caution. I found these to be thinner than the Silpats and after one time through the oven, have a bit of warping to them, they flattened back down again after I ran my hand back over the sheet, but I've never seen this with my Silpats due to their thickness, so not sure how well these will hold up over time. They are unlikely to have as much insulation as well being thinner, which can be good or bad depending on what you are cooking. Also be aware that not all baked goods due well on silicon baking sheets, I do still bring out the parchment for some items that I cook that seem to need more "grip" to the surface to cook properly. Meringues for instance I don't ever do on silicon baking sheets. Overall, a good value for the price but not quite as good as my Silpats.

I really like this new CEB translation particularly for YA readers, it puts the Bible into language more in line with how people today speak without any real significant change to meaning as you get with some more radical translations like The Message. More staunchly conservative types and Bible literalists may disagree, but I'm definitely a fan. This bible is geared towards YA teenage readers and so includes articles and discussions particularly geared for that age group. It does a good job of encouraging without being condescending. I think most adults would enjoy much of what is in here as well, particularly the callout boxes that help explain some of the more difficult sections of the text as well as the maps.

We usually start kids off at a young age with something like the Children's Picture Bible or the Action Bible (manga) but when they want to move to a "big kid's" real Bible with written text, this is a perfect choice, the translation is done in easy to read modern English, without any significant change to the meaning such as you get with translations like The Message. This makes it much more approachable for kids, but this also includes Study Bible elements geared particularly to kids of grammar school age. There are 3 cartoon kids that lead the reader through the text and ask them questions to think about, etc. The text size is a tad small for the target audience, but then you don't want a really big heavy Bible, or thin easy to tear pages for kids either, so it's probably a good compromise. Overall, one of the best study Bibles I've seen for school age readers.

This book was more a memoir of the author's struggles through losing her mom to cancer at 12, living with an alcoholic father, as well as the marital struggles that raising a disabled child brings. The relationship between the brothers is almost *too" perfect, there's not a whole lot of nuances with that part of the story, it almost becomes overkill how much we hear about how much Connor loves Cayden and shows it in everything he does, but having a similar relationship between two brothers, one normal, the other autistic, in my own family, it's certainly something that I relate to and see very much the same kind of protectiveness and love between them. I think in children raised properly, it's the kind of natural response that an older, normal brother would have, so in the end I found Jenny's story the more interesting and compelling one here.

As other reviewers have mentioned, the item you will receive is not the one pictured. The white ReaderRest I got is the one with the glasses image on them, not the much more discreet original design shown here. The only option Amazon could give me was to return the whole thing and get a replacement but that seems pointless when other reviewers are all getting the same item. Very disappointed.

This is a nice book for YAs that are dealing with bullying, I like that it's written by someone that experienced bullying themselves, as it's very affirming to hear from someone that came through it and came out the other side. While I never experienced the kind of bullying today's kids did, I did deal with some of it myself in school and not having anyone want to be friends, etc. so a lot of the messages ring very true. While the author does try to offer some practical advice to try and end the bullying I think most kids know it's not always that easy, that adults often powerless or unwilling to stop it, so it's definitely not going to be a solution for every kid being bullied, but it's a good start and hopefully some of the messages about being special and important will get through.

This is an okay fryer, but be aware, it's very small, so really only suitable for one, maybe two people at most, and probably just best as a secondary fryer to something like Fry Daddy that can handle larger amounts and more types of foods, in the same amount of counter space, due to it not having a heating element on the bottom or needing a basket. Battered items do not work well in this style of fryer I found, they sink to the bottom so get stuck to the basket, and lose that area of the batter. This style of fryer works fine for things like french fries or chicken wings, cheese sticks, etc. that don't use a real wet batter. I also like that it has a temperature setting, something the Fry Daddy does not include. So this was ideal to do my french fries in, which I use different temp settings for par-frying and finishing, while doing my batter-fried strips in the Fry Daddy. I just wish I could find one perfect fryer that could do everything.

Very cheaply made apron, I have some similar "flirty" aprons which are much better designed, although kind of a pain to wash with all the ruffles and fabric that generally needs ironing. This very simple design would be a quick ironing job, if even needed, but the fabric is so thin, it's not going to protect well against much more than flour dust. I do like this kind of tieable neck strap but the upper bodice part of the apron is poorly design and doesn't taper so is very unattractive. The biggest issue is that it does NOT have pockets as described, which is an essential feature for my kitchen. So if you want a very cheap apron that is a bit more "cute" than the average one, this might be okay. But for a functional apron for every day use, look elsewhere.

I've used similar bands in the past when I have a flareup of the elbow tendinitis that has bothered me for years, and this type of "support" definitiely helps relieve the pain although you do want to be careful not to use them for too long as they can cause the tendon to shorten over time and you become reliant on having the support there. For short term use they can be very helpful. However I really didn't like this design at all. It may be fine if you are a thin, normal sized person, but I have a bit of extra weight and in order to get the band tight enough to do anything, I had to tighten it to a point that the velcro strap was digging into my arm. Velcro is very scratchy and bothers me to begin with so I wish I knew before I bought this that it was used for the strap, but for a brace that requires being very tight to work, it's even more of an issue. I definitely prefer the designs that include an air pillow to give you the pressure against the tendon with less requirement for having the band super-tight as well. Having used about 3 or 4 styles of this kind of support, this was by far my least favorite I've tried.

A year ago, Amazon offered me a copy of Office 365 for Mac, this year, I got the standalone Home and Student version to try. While usually I prefer paying once for software, it's hard to look at the pricing and not see the value in considering the cloud version. You not only get 1 TB of cloud storage, you get the full suite of products, at a price that gives you two years of access for less than the standalone software costs. Of course, Mac users still don't get ALL the software that PC users get, and until they do, I will not give ANY Office version more than 4 stars at best. While I wouldn't tend to use Access as much these days, Publisher is software that absolutely should be included in the Mac version when PC users get it. However, this review is for Home and Student which only includes Word, Excel, PowerPoint and OneNote. Note that Outlook is not included, something to be aware of if you are looking at purchasing this version, over the 365 Personal license which DOES include it. Of these, OneNote is the application I haven't used a whole lot, simply because I have so much in Evernote and haven't really had a need to look at migrating to OneNote. You can get OneNote as a standalone on the Mac Store for free, so it's worth looking at if you don't already use Evernote, but if you do want to use it, you almost certainly would want the 365 version so you have cloud storage for easy sharing of your notes across your desktop and mobile devices. Likewise a lot of the newer features in the other applications require cloud storage, such as sharing features. While you don't have to have a 365 license to use these, the only cloud services available are MS's OneDrive cloud service and Sharepoint. It's very annoying that they don't offer such popular cloud services like Dropbox but clearly they want to push users to get the 365 licenses instead which include the full 1TB of storage. If you don't need to keep a lot of docs on OneDrive though, the free account may work fine for you.Now if you are a current Office for Mac user, the question is whether there are suitable updates here to look at upgrading. If you are more than 1 or two versions behind, it's pretty much a given that you would want to update, the new ribbon (toolbar) is much more elegant and user friendly, proper keyboard shortcuts are available, the various Mac touch gestures are supported, etc. And there's tons of improvements in the  applications themselves. I particularly loved the new theme designer feature in Powerpoint which gives you not only many more slide designs, but makes it really easy to switch them to different color schemes. Slide transitions are now better supported across PC and Mac versions and there is an improved presenter view, and dedicated animations panel. The formula designer in Excel has been updated, and there is better support for the full range of functions that the PC version had. More chart designs are now available, and comments in Word can now be fully threaded conversations. Print to PDF is better in all the apps, as well. Overall, the features definitely are worth a look, but the lack of Outlook and high cost for just the 3 main programs (OneNote being free to download anyway) does make it a bit hard to recommend this version over a 365 license. If you don't need Outlook, don't have a need to upgrade your apps very often, don't plan to use cloud sharing much, and mainly just want copies of the applications for cross-platform support with PC users that send you files, this might be worth considering versus the 365 version, but you'll need to use it for more than 2 years before you see any savings. So I rather the upgrade as a solid 4 stars, but I'd give this specific version only 3 stars for the value that you are getting for the price.

These premium chocolate arrive in a tastefully wrapped box, it oddly doesn't have a normal lid once you unwrap them, the outer sleeve from the packaging appearing to be the only thing you can use if you don't want to eat them all at one sitting, but I would be concerned about it keeping them fresh for very long. Not that they are likely to hang around for very long once opened! No temperature control packaging (ice packs) used in shipping them so do NOT order these any time of year that they are likely to encounter heat. They arrived safe and sound for me, and I dove right in. They include a small guide to some of the chocolates but not all, and they are definitely made from premium ingredients. The price is very similar to Godiva chocolates, and personally I do prefer Godiva over these. The chocolate itself is perhaps *slightly* better, but I prefer the variety of flavors you get with a typical Godiva ballotin box, which are more typical of American chocolates. This is definitely a matter of taste though, there are certainly plenty of people that would find these chocolate superior as they are definitely very good quality with some excellent hazelnut and smooth caramels in particular, a very European style of chocolates. I do also like the smaller pieces compared to Godiva chocolates, it lets you enjoy one or two pieces of chocolate and feel that you didn't consume very much in the way of calories! Not to mention being able to share them more easily.

Great way to save money on multiple lip shades, particularly if you generally use a brush to apply them anyway. As with most free brushes, the one included will work, but it's not great. It takes a fair number of applications to get good color on my lips and the staying power is pretty minimal, but it's a nice palette that lets me try out different colors before buying the ones I really like and will use a lot in a version that will last longer when I need it. There's no price on this currently but based on typical prices for Maybelline cosmetics I wouldn't expect it to be very expensive. Based on the quality and quantity included, I wouldn't expect to pay more than 10-15 for it.

This is a decent steam iron, with digital temperature readings, it generates copious amounts of steam and had nice weight to it, so performs well for the most part. Most of my dislikes didn't really deal with how well it ironeed, but just little nits about features. Personally I prefer dials and being able to "tweak " my temperature setting versus the digital setting but it works well enough. I also like my iron with a retractable cord, versus this very heavy and thick cord that doesn't wrap particularly well for storage. My biggest complaint would be the water compartment which is very hard to read, being dark blue and needing to be read horizontal versus in a more typical vertical position. Most irons I have bought come with a little cup for easy filling of the compartment as well, which was not provided here. So overall, not my favorite iron, but a fairly good one for the price.

We played this a couple times with a local board gaming group and we enjoyed the game mechanics for the most part. It is sort of a rock-paper-scissors card game but with strategic elements built into it, and the tag team game was a particular hit. We like that any one can win if they manage to score a pin at the right time, we were playing a tag team game and our team was totally getting thrashed but managed to score a pin and win just as we were almost unable to even play enough cards to get through a turn. That was kind of cool, but not everyone will like that element of luck. But paying attention to which cards the other players has the most of, what they've lost to you so far, etc. can allow you to better strategize your moves to have more chance to win. You definitely don't need to have any interest or knowledge of wrestling to enjoy this game although I expect fans will enjoy knowing the wrestlers and their associated moves. The numerous variations in how to play the game also gives this an excellent level of replayability. Overall, not sure it will be a favorite game but definitely one that we enjoyed.

I've been building up my home tool set and was lacking some good crescent wrenches, so was pleased to get a set of these to review. Overall I find them good, but a tad heavy and bulky, particularly the two larger wrenches. They are definitely very solidly made, and in spite of the concerns about being made in China, the quality seems decent enough. But the heavier weight usually means compensating for somewhat lesser quality of steel with more bulk, and that seems to be the case here. So I would say these are adequate, but if you, like me, prefer tools that aren't super heavy, these might not be your best choice.

I was fairly pleased with these towels, they are a nice size and soft and absorbent, a good value for the price. I liked the packaging they arrived in, with a ribbon around the set and plastic wrap to arrive snowy white still. Good for anyone that does a lot of work in the kitchen.

I'm a long term PS user, primarily for photography and digital scrapbooking, but I also like to make digital art from my photographs as well, and this program looked to be well suited in particular for that purpose. I'm also not particularly fond of Adobe's move to cloud-based hosting of their software, preferring a program like this one that you just pay once for and own as long as you want. The main challenge in using software like Painter is that it's not particularly intuitive, particularly if you aren't already used to PS, but even PS users will be frustrated at the differences and trying to learn something new. With PS, you have massive amounts of online tutorials and help, as well as books, local and online classes, etc. Here, you're kind of own your own to learn it, and you don't even get a printed manual, having to deal with searching and scrolling through PDF manuals. The few online lessons I watched already have differences in where to find things in some cases, such as the brushes being organized a bit differently. It's definitely not a good choice for anyone that is not already well versed in using this kind of software or that doesn't like learning things mostly on their own, without books or other educational materials to help.Having said all that, if digital art is your medium, it's hard to ignore how powerful and well designed this software is for that task. Even if you just like to dabble in things like making photographs into art, you'll not be disappointed... if you can get past the learning curve. I particularly enjoyed using some of the auto painting features, which really show how well thought out Painter is. The attached photo took me only about 5 mins to do using their auto paint feature and appropriate tweaking. With PS you often have to pay for or design your own custom brushes, where you will find so much here already included. There's a bunch of addon brushes you can purchase for $30 a pop as well for things like hair, smoke, fire, etc.I still don't see this software being a replacement for me, there are just too many things I do in PS that are not well handled here, particularly all my photographic and scrapbook work. If you are a digital artist, and looking for a powerful and somewhat cheaper alternative to PS though, this may very well be worth a look.

I'm a long time agility trainer and instructor and I've gone through my share of flimsy at-home practice equipment but this set really takes the cake for being next to useless. The tunnel is so short as to be almost useless for training, it's barely as long as my little sheltie mix, and can't be curved into other shapes. Just search on Amazon for "play tunnel" to find a whole bunch of kid's play tunnels that are much longer and more flexible in terms of how they can be used, and cheaper as well. As for the other obstacles, they are made with very thin plastic tubing and are the most flimsy design I've ever seen. No way I would train a dog on these, besides the fact that they don't visually look like real agility equipment (something that is important if you do want to teach your dog the sport) they come apart far too easily making it a real possibility that the dog will not learn to avoid hitting the jump, or even hurting themselves by getting caught in it. Do yourself a favor and just make some obstacles out of PVC, it will cost no more than this kit and you'll have a far more appropriate set of obstacles to work on. Just go to the Instructables website and search on 'agility' to find all kind of do-it-yourself instructions for agility obstacles.
Because obviously if your dog bites, you want to make them look "cute and funny" so kids try to approach them, right? Not to mention prevent the dog from being able to drink water.

I've only used this dehydrator a few times but so far, fairly pleased with it. I have used one of the cheaper dehydrators with the stacking trays and always hated the noise, the difficulty in cleaning the trays (fruit leather is one of my favorite things to make and it always seems to spill on the trays, which do not fit in the sink or dishwasher), and lack of time controls so that I can let it run during the night and not over-dry my items. This dehydrator deals with all those issues, it came completely assembled, with all the metal trays/shelves already in place, along with a replacement shelf and filter. I didn't see any of the bowing issues other reviews have mentioned but will see if that occurs with use. I've tried doing some banana chips as well as some peaches I had canned in light syrup and loved the results, the banana chips turned out pretty much the way the ones in my other dehydrator did, and the peaches were nice and chewy, a great sweet treat alternative to something like candy. I wish I could do fruit leather in this model without having to buy a bunch of additional trays since it only comes with one and the usable space for each tray is much smaller than typical stacking models so you really need a bunch of them to do leather. So not sure this is the best choice if that is a common dry task you are looking to use it for. Also, the manual that comes with this model is absolutely TERRIBLE, it clearly was just translated (badly) from another language to English is is pretty incomprehensible. The controls are not particularly intuitive so trying to figure out how to use them is a bit frustrating and takes some trial and error. The times given in the recipe book for drying fruit seemed to be really off, I needed almost double the time for my banana chips... but given the poor instructions it's possible I was using a different drying setting. For such an expensive appliance, they could at least provide users with a decent manual on how to use it.

Like most Invicta watches, this one is quite large and heavy, this is not for guys that want a fairly unobtrusive watch on their wrist, there are few watches you will find as big and obvious as this one. The design is very striking with an attractive color scheme, although marketed as an "aviator" watch it has more of an aquatic look to it. However, that's where most of the positives stopped for us. First the nylon band is VERY stiff and not very comfortable, compared to pretty much any other Invicta watch I've reviewed or bought. It's also fairly difficult to get into the metal strap holders. If you are always in a rush to get your watch on and out the door, this one is going to annoy you. I expect it might loosen up over time with use but who wants a watch that's uncomfortable when they first get it?? The "Speed" thing around the bezel seems to serve little purpose other than to make the watch unnecessarily bigger, I believe you are supposed to watch the second hand go around it while something is happening (like a car driving by) and use that to determine the speed it is going, but it's not particularly well explained or useful. I'd guess there are apps for smartphones that do the same thing much easier and better. Worst of all, the chronometer doesn't include the 1/10th second dial. I guess if you are an aviator you might not need this, but if I'm getting a watch with a chronometer, I want it to include all 3 dials. I also have always hated how Invicta gives you a guide to the watch that isn't specific to YOUR watch, you have to page through the manual trying to figure out which are the features your watch has and which are not. It's really annoying. I couldn't even find specific instructions for this type of chronograph, only for the 3-dial ones. Overall, not a watch I would particularly recommend over many of the other nice watches that Invicta offers, particularly at this price point.

I'm very impressed with the quality of this cookbook, everything is well laid out, beautifully illustrated with photos, and contains a wide variety of recipes from very simple to ones I probably will never try (like octopus stews). I was concerned about trying a cookbook for a foreign cuisine since they often need a variety of exotic and hard-to-find ingredients but I was impressed with the selection of recipes here that don't use anything that I wouldn't already have at home, with maybe 1 or 2 extra things from the store. Sure, there are still recipes with some ingredients I might have trouble finding (like the aforementioned octopus, or some cakes that use a specific brand of international brand cookie) but overall the recipes are reasonably easy to make and use fairly standard pantry items. Just make sure you have white wine around, that seems to be a popular ingredient for a lot of these dishes! I also liked the pages with additional, more detailed information on preparation steps, again lavishly illustrated with photos for the steps, and having all the ingredients both with US measures as well as metric. If you like to weigh your dry ingredients like me, you always love to see a cookbook with the weights for everything included. The paper used for the book is nice and heavy weight with a glossy finish that should help make cleaning up any splatter in the kitchen fairly easy. The recipes vary in serving sizes with some feeding a large group, other suited for just two. I wish more were in the range of 4 or less, since more than that and I have to consider halving the portions, but anyone looking to cook for an entire family will be just fine. Since I was not familiar with Portuguese cooking prior to this, I can't comment on the authenticity of the recipes but the couple that I have tried so far turned out successful and fairly tasty as well. Overall, a really wonderful, quality cookbook that I know I will enjoy for years while getting to appreciate the flavors of Portugal as well.

I've been trying to switch to drinking more water and so was happy to get this pitcher to review. I've used Brita products in the past, but this is the first pitcher I've had in awhile. It's pretty large, so make sure you have fridge space for it. The size is a bit problematic for me in terms of getting it under my faucet, I have to tilt it so it's not getting filled as well as a smaller one would. If you don't have a very deep sink keep that in mind while shopping for a filter pitcher size. The filter design does seem to be improved, without the flecks in the water that I've had before. The lid has a design such that it won't go on unless you have the filter properly seated fully. I haven't had any issues with the lid falling off as many reviewers in the past have mentioned, so am thinking Brita may have addressed this. The lid is still very thin plastic and fairly flimsy, so will have to see how it holds up over time. The electronic display is not every intuitive in how it works, if it's somehow keeping track of usage, I wouldn't be putting a lot of faith in it in terms of when to change filters. Easier for me is to just put a reminder on the fridge when I change it to know when to swap it out. Brita does make an app as well but seems just as easy to add a reminder on your smart phone when you change filters.

Wow, Masterbuilt really needs to improve their quality control. I just got this smoker and had issues assembling it due to some parts not being properly aligned. One of the wheels in particular just simply would not align up properly to allow all the screws to be put in, I tried to bend it to the proper shape but the metal is far too think for me to manage without having a vise. Also, the lower right corner was damaged, even though it's well packed with styrofoam and an additional plastic protector on the corners... so was clearly damaged that way BEFORE packing. This does not bode well for the quality of their products. I hope it performs better once it stops raining here in NC so I can actually try it out.

I've used a couple similar water fountains but always find them annoying hard to fill and to clean. This one is designed much more like the refillable water bowl I use currently so I thought I'd give it a try. Out of the box it's a breeze to set up, just fill the reservoir and plug it in. The water comes out in a small fountain in the center and circulates throughout. It's reasonably quiet and my cat definitely was intrigued and attracted to it immediately. Other circulating water dishes don't have an actual fountain in them, which is a definite plus of this design that many cats will love. Whether this will really result in an increase in drinking frequency I don't know, but he does seem to like it. I also have dogs and they were a bit taken aback by the fountain at first but got used to it quickly enough. The bowl is large enough to allow them to drink either from the side, or one of my dogs liked to drink right from the fountain. I do wish that the fountain could achieve a bit more height, it's very low, adjustable height would be even better, but you only have an on and off switch. The reservoir is also much smaller than I like having multiple pets. The advantage of this design is to keep the water fresh without having to refill it all the time but if it doesn't hold that much water to begin with, I'm not that much better off. I'll probably for that reason still keep my much larger refillable water bowl that has enough water for a couple days for the dogs, but the challenge of course is that if they like this bowl too I'll still end up having to refill it pretty frequently. I was also very annoyed to find that the box says it comes with 2 charcoal filters, but I could not find these in the packaging at all. It has the plain white filter which was already inserted for me, but no charcoal filters, so I dropped an extra star from this review for that omission. I'll have to see how hard it is to get those sent out and will update this review accordingly.

I've played and reviewed numerous traditional racing car toys, and all of them ultimately tend to disappoint. They take up a lot of space, are tedious to set up and often almost impossible to take apart. The game play is fun for about an hour at best and then they get tossed aside for more interesting racing games on the game console.This Anki racing game is a HUGE improvement, by combining a smartphone racing game with a live action racing toy. There's a lot of stuff to like here, particularly how easy the track is to take out and set up and then pack away again when you are done. It uses a magnet system to connect the tracks that works great, they just click right together, and it's very easy to change the configuration around. My iPhone had no trouble after downloading the app connecting to the cars and going through the racing tutorial. It's really cool how the cars just follow the track, and the ability to "battle" the other cars with weapons is a cool twist on normal race car games.A few caveats, It's definitely a pretty expensive game, particularly when you look at the prices of cars and additional track pieces. It's always fun to build additional track designs and expand a game but you can easily spend a few hundred dollars here to do that, so be sure to consider that as part of an initial purchase. There's still a lot you can do with just the basic starter set, though. Also the app definitely has the feel of a first run, there's no tournament play currently for instance, which would make the basic set far more playable with a group of people. Also you have to go through a scanning phase before EVERY game even if the track hasn't been changed. It's kind of annoying and seems like it should be able to remember that and just prompt you if the track was modified. Hopefully we will see them expand the capabilities and play options in time.Overall, this is a really awesome game, with some more improvements it could be even better. But it's certainly still worth a purchase for anyone that loves car racing.

Absolutely fantastic book about Animals, tons of photos, and a very comprehensive guide to all the animals of the world, from mammals to birds, insects, lower invertebrates, as well as other information related to the animal kingdom such as habitat, reproduction, and more. A great coffee-table book for any home and perfect gift for any animal lover or zoologist in the making.

This product was provided for me through the Amazon Vine system for free, but I try to take into consideration how I would feel about it were I a paying customer. And my overall impression is that yes, it's got some very nice features and vacuum packs like a champ. But is it THAT much better to pay so much more than the others cost? My first impression is that no, I would probably not be willing to pay so much more for it. First, the size is just massive. There's not going to be many people that have a place to put this on their counter and even finding storage elsewhere in a kitchen would be problematic. Compared to my current FoodSaver, it is a full 10 inches wider, and 5 inches deeper. But all that size only provides a paltry 4" more of sealing space (from 11" to 15"). Including something like storage for the accessory port cord inside the device is nice, but is it worth how much more room had to be added to the sealer? It's almost like they built this so big so it looks more impressive than it really is. I do however really like the stainless steel look of the thing. Too bad it has to spend most of the time hidden away in the garage, where that SS exterior pretty much goes to waste. I did really like the locking mechanism for the lid, as well as the handles, which considering the size and weight of this appliance, make it much easier to carry it in and out of the kitchen for use.One of the big features this sealer touts is being able to continue sealing for 100 times, but as other reviewers have mentioned, if you want to use the double seal, (and who wouldn't?!) it gives out pretty quickly and requires a very LONG 20 minute wait to seal again. It's pretty disappointing as this double sealing feature is really the best new feature on this. I personally have never had a major problem with my last FoodSaver not keeping up with the amount of meat I have to seal, while I am not a hunter, I do often buy large amounts of meat on sale, including large cuts like ribs, or whole chickens, etc. to fill up my chest freezer. At most I might have to wait once or twice for a short time for it to get back to work. So a 20 minute wait really isn't appreciated just to use the one really killer feature on this FoodSaver.The other thing I didn't care for is the way it seals and how much bag it wastes. It seems like every FoodSaver I buy, this becomes more of a problem, from the earlier ones that would seal very close of the edge of the bag, and then they wasted a couple inches, my last one about 3 inches, and this one which is more like 4 inches. I have to wonder if this is on purpose, after all the more bag wasted, the more money FoodSaver makes on bags, and particularly the less you can reuse them. The way you have to lock the lid onto the bag tends to not only make it take a longer time to activate the device (versus my current FoodSaver which you just insert the bag into and it begins sealing) but it means more bag wasted, and sometimes issues with the bag coming out as you close the lid, particularly if it is very full. You also will find you will need to put some kind of prop like a book under your bags to seal them due to how high the sealing surface is, to lessen the chance that closing the lid will move the bag out of position. I did feel that the vacuum is REALLY strong on this FoodSaver in comparison to my last one, and having a removable drain channel for cleaning is something every FoodSaver really should have.Overall, I really couldn't see paying so much for this FoodSaver over my much less expensive and more compact 11" model, unless money really wasn't a concern. Reliability as well might make me see it more favorably, I would hope for the price that this would last many times what the cheaper models do, but only time will tell if that is the case. If the price makes you balk as well, along with the release of this new product, there are some additional styles of FoodSaver bags, including an 11" roll that is pleated, allowing you to much more easily vacuum pack large cuts using 11" bags. If you already have an 11" model, you may want to check out these Foodsaver Expandable Vacuum Bag Rolls. It certainly is a much cheaper approach to sealing large cuts of meat than this very expensive, and very large FoodSaver.

This is my first Mega Bloks kit, but I have assembled a lot of Lego and K'Nex kits. What a cool vehicle this is! Certainly any serious Halo fan, or kids (or adults) that enjoy brick building will like this. The spring suspension in particular is a nice touch. I would say this kit is harder than a normal Lego kit for the same age group, due to the large numbers of different piece types. The figures in particular took me awhile to figure out as they didn't include step-by-step directions, so even though they are first in the directions, for inexperienced builders you may want to leave them for last. Otherwise, it's a great kit and an awesome 'Hog model.

Many of us remember these Thermos bottles from childhood, as other reviewers have mentioned, this is not quite the same quality, but I find it only to be slightly less well made. The handle in particular is kind of clunky and tends to get stuck on one end when I try to pull it out or push it in. I use similar stainless steel sports bottles to keep my drinks in the car cool, particularly this time of year when it is so hot, but those are much smaller and don't even have enough room for a bottle of my favorite Sobe water with ice. This is ideal to bring along a whole day's worth of drinks to keep cool and refill my smaller sports bottle with. It doesn't quite make it 24 hours in a hot car, but definitely did the job for a 12 hour full day away from home test.

There is absolutely NO useful training information in this book at all. At best, it covers some different training methods and the importance of finding a good trainer, but that is information you can easily glean for yourself from many sources. In fact, go to the Wiki page on Dog Training and you will find almost the exact same run-down of types of training methods. It includes the Koeler method as a "potential" training method, which is very old-school punishment-based training and much of the text is written in a way that the average reader would have trouble understanding it. It also shows a photo of a collar that is a type that I would not use on 99% of puppies, and many other photos have little to do with the associated text. I could go on, but what it comes down to is that there's actually nothing that gives you information on HOW to actually train your dog to do anything. You can read this entire book in 5 minutes, and come out with pretty much nothing you wouldn't have known already and many things that would be best forgotten.Take a look at all those 5-star reviews on this e-book. Every one of them is the ONLY review that the person has posted, and many of them are so poorly written as to be incomprehensible (they read like something written in another language and put through Google Translate). This is typical for someone that pays for 5-star reviews to be posted on their book to try and get people to buy it (just look how many of them refer to 'puppy preparing', a term I've never heard used before for training). Please please don't waste your money on this. If you want some good information on how to train your dog, go grab yourself a copy of Pat Miller's Power of Positive Dog Training instead.

I've been consistently impressed with the products I've gotten from Five Star to review for Amazon Vine. This is no exception. It's a fairly straightforward expanding file, but well designed to stand up to the abuse of being carried everywhere, and includes soft edges so you don't hurt yourself putting papers in and out, as well as tags with slide-in labels, so you can easily change the labels on the tabs. The design is colorful and fun. Really not much to improve on here.

I wasn't as impressed with this book as other reviewers. Now, as a young girl, I read ANYTHING that had to do with horses, particularly the entire Black Stallion series, Misty of Chincoteague, and other such classics. While this is written for an even earlier reader than those, it still came off as very stilted and simplistic in its writing. It has some nice information on what kinds of things you might have to do at a horse ranch to care for the animals, and certainly young girls will love it regardless because of the ponies and dogs that the story is about as well as the lavish illustrations, but the story just really lacked much creativity and charm, IMO. I compare it for instance with another book I reviewed recently for the same age group, Battle Bugs, which even an adult could read and be charmed with the imagination and inventiveness of the story, while still managing to educate along the way. While that book was more geared towards boys, it was the kind of story I particularly loved as a young reader myself, why is it that books for girls are so often far less interesting, domestic even, while boys are off having grand adventures? Perhaps it was because I reviewed these two books so close together that I could not help but feel let down as a girl that this story had so little of that. Ultimately the story seemed to be mostly about the girls misbehaving and fighting a lot and then in the end getting their way. The protagonist is repeatedly not following instructions and putting herself in very real danger (not to mention the animals which keep getting loose, which in the real world often leads to severe consequences), and then the adults actually just give in and let her have her way at the end. We see a pony that is actually rearing up when being brushed (something that could cause a child very serious harm) and just a short time later in the story, she is actually being allowed to ride the pony. Not only is it unbelievably unrealistic, I think it sends a very bad message to young readers about the importance of following the rules, particularly around animals like horses and ponies that can seriously injure them, and that if they just keep nagging about what they want, the adults will just give in. Not the kind of lesson I would want for a young girl. I hope that future books in the series will take a bit of a different approach and teach some better lessons.

There's not a whole lot of difference with Chromebooks in terms of the programs you get installed, it's kind of a relief in fact to not book up a computer and find it full of crap I need to remove! Chromebooks are particularly good for kids as a first laptop and will serve them well even through college. It does rely on having internet, don't expect to be able to do much with one of these away from a wifi signal. But that does mean as well being able to work on the cloud a lot which is how it gets away with a fairly minimal amount of onboard storage. It includes a 100gig Google Cloud account (free for the first 2 years), so you will have plenty of online storage for photos and documents. Don't expect to be able to do really serious MS Office work on it, unless you plan to subscribe to the MS Office Cloud as well though, Google's versions are fine for very basic docs but definitely will not work with more complicated Office needs.I was pleasantly surprised by the performance of the laptop, it's very fast, since it's running off Flash storage only. Display is decent, if not excellent, for the price. Instead of a row of F-function keys the keyboard has action keys for back, forward, mute, full screen, etc. The keyboard was reasonably spacious and the touchpad worked well. Really the only thing I noticed that I would have changed is some kind of small cutout on the front edge to make opening it a bit easier. Overall, an excellent device for the price, as long as you keep in mind its limitations.

I really like the design of this notebook but as other reviewers have mentioned it is NOT 8.5x11 letter sized paper, but the smaller 9.5x 6 size. Ironically though the price is less on what is supposed to be the larger size that the listings I found for the smaller size (almost the same but has a corner tab feature this one does not include): http://www.amazon.com/Five-Star-2-Subject-College-Ruled-72851/dp/B005QAV6YISize issues aside though, I really like this notebook. Very ingenious covering up the spine which also allows you to label it easily as well. It includes tabs with pockets that are designed so you can move them and the pages are all perforated for easy removal. A really nicely designed notebook although not sure I'd pay the price with shipping if you can't get it directly from Amazon.

I have a different Hoover carpet cleaner that is no longer working after a couple years of light use, so I will be curious to see if this works better. But first impressions, I'm not thrilled. First, the "clip" to hold the power cord is so thin, I could not get the cord into it no matter how hard I tried. I don't think even a hammer would get that cord in there. As for the "commercial" designation, it doesn't seem any more heavy-duty than my other cleaner, and the cleaning compartments in particular lightweight plastic with seams that look prone to easily break apart with use. Even though it costs quite a bit compared to similar cleaners, it is missing a lot of features my other Hoover had including a hose attachment for doing stairs and upholstery. And more annoying, this is one of those cleaners that doesn't mix the cleaning fluid itself, so you have to do a rinse by throwing out any remaining cleaning fluid so you can refill it with clean water. Although, that seems to be where my last machine broke down, so perhaps I should be glad it doesn't do that! But that was just so much more convenient and less wasteful... when it did work. Given all that, it did clean my floors pretty well, I just am not sure the price is worth what you get.

I received a bag of this to review for Amazon, and it looked like a good choice, I prefer grain free foods for my cat. And he seemed to really like the taste of it, he's definitely finicky enough to turn his nose up at lesser foods, and the high protein content of this was definitely to his liking.However, I don't know that I would continue to feed this food, given how many people have had cats come up with UTIs after feeding it. Yes, dry food is often a contributing factor, but there definitely seems to be a lot more people complaining with this food and particularly recent changes to the formula. Having a male neutered cat myself, and one that so far has not had a health problem, I'm not really willing to risk his health feeding a food known to cause these issues too frequently.

These biscuits are okay, but not great. The ingredients are not my favorite, including wheat flour as a primary ingredient and garlic powder too, which is never good to feed your dogs regularly. My dogs seemed to like them well enough, but the mini size is bigger than what I like to use for my small dogs, I like biscuits that I can push into treat holding toys like the small Everlasting Ball, and while these will fit, I have to break them up for them to be small enough to come out. At least they do break easily. The 3 lb bag I got is a pretty good value, and doesn't expire until Nov. 2016, so it should last me a long time. I would not trust the bag to keep out bugs or moths, so you may want to make sure you have a well sealed container for them depending on where you plan to store them.

Very nice polyester tablecloth. The cream color I received was a bit darker ivory than I expected, but it still is a nice neutral color that goes well with my good dishes. The material goes through the washer and dryer without a problem and needs minimal ironing afterwards.

My family are avid recreation table tennis players, and often use STIGA paddles. My old one was wearing out so I was happy to get this one to review for Amazon. The paddle is very light, which is the type of paddle I prefer to play with so I was pleased with the performance of it, my Dad also tried it but found it too light for his liking, making it harder to control the spin he likes to put on the ball. The racket was very similar to cheaper STIGA models I've used so not sure I can recommend paying this much for this particular model. Also be prepared when you first use it, it comes with a protective covering, that when removed leaves a fairly sticky residue behind, so the paddle was covered in dirt in no time.

This is an ingenious and addictive little game, it definitely could benefit from some better instructions, but that's hardly unusual! Takes a little tweaking to get the string hung at the right height but once it's up, you have a fun game, perfect for outdoor parties, we hung it on the basement level of the family lakehouse under the deck, where we also play corn hole, and it was a perfect additional game to keep everyone occupied. The price does seem a bit high for something that is just a piece of wood and some cheap hardware, after all you could pretty easily make this yourself. I would have liked to see it more in the $20-25 range (it's considerably more with shipping charges as I write this review). But for a game with virtually no setup and that anyone can play, it's definitely a hit.

I was fairly disappointed in this book, while I am a Christian, I really was looking for a book with more help on starting friendships and cultivating them than just a lot of Biblical stories and lessons, much of which is just very general about relationships, do's and don't, things like forgiveness and being a good friend. Much of this is pretty common sense stuff, and it didn't have a whole lot for people like me that might find it difficult to start up friendships particularly with other women (who I personally often don't have a whole lot in common with). There are a fair number of topics as well which have no interest to me, being single and having no children, likewise topics about "at the office" had relatively little I could glean from them. Overall, this might make a nice choice for a women's study group, but for just casual reading on making women friends, it definitely was much too heavy handed, with too little real "meat" for me.

This is not the easiest to read or most accessible book on this topic by any means, personally I enjoyed Matthew Vine's "God and the Gay Christian" more for a book fairly similar to this, but a lot easier to read. Still, I greatly appreciated the depth of scientific information in particular here, and the in depth discussion of the associated Scripture passages. It's not for the faint-of-heart or those looking for a quick read on this topic, which is primarily on how we can reconcile scripture with what we have learned about same-sex people and relationships from a scientific bend.I do shake my head at comments that this book "won't convince anyone" that has already taken up an opposing position. That's nothing unexpected, we know from confirmation bias that we are all very hard-wired not to accept arguments that go against our own strongly held positions, and IMO this is a perfect example of confirmation bias in action, where there is not a really obvious "perfect truth" on one side or the other. Rather than get into a long discussion of this and my own journey to what I believe, for me, ultimately I look at where the evil and harm that Jesus tells us we will see come from false prophets is, and there is no question in my heart where the truth lies, and that is with love.

I was a bit disappointed in this book. Maybe I was expecting something other than what the intent was, but if you aren't a big surfing fan and already know who Clay is, but are looking for more of an exploration of growing up with Asperger's, this is probably not the best book to go to for that. I think for instance, of Temple Grandin's amazing books on living with Autism like "Thinking in Pictures". This book doesn't come close to that level of excellence, insight and widespread appeal. Describing this as "co-authored" by Clay as well seems a bit of a stretch as it was more based on interviews with him and family and friends, with a much more journalistic approach to the material than the personal insights and reflection you usually get in an autobiographical tone. Having felt for many years that I have Aspergers myself and still exploring what that means for me, and reconciling that with the social difficulties I had growing up, there was much I could relate to, but only very superficially, as there were equally as many things that were foreign to me and my experience. Ultimately, this really is just a biography of a surfing phenom who happens to be an Aspie, with some interesting insights in how those two interacted to make him who he was. And as a biography, I found it only somewhat interesting as surfing just isn't a sport I am particularly interested in. But as a book on what Aspergers is, what it's like to live with, and how differently it can manifest, it just wasn't as compelling or interesting as I had hoped for.

Uggh, this book just tries to be a bit too cute and funny for its own good. From the tone I felt like it was focused on teenage boys, and their level of juvenile humor. It's a topic that has been covered before, and better by others, although I did enjoy the closing chapter, talking about being an active participant in what we watch and ways to discuss it. Most of the rest I just tended to get a bit annoyed by, from the writing and over-the-top attempts at humor to the often lack of real depth of knowledge on the movies discussed, particularly those based on other media like books and comics. It's a bit silly for instance, to talk about being able to find Christian messages in the Lord of the Rings, written by well known Christian JRR Tolkien. If you aren't into zombie movies, you may find the amount of time spent on this genre a bit tiresome as well. Overall, just not the best book on this topic particularly for more mature readers

I've read most of the other Quilts of Love series, what I liked about this one was that it was a very different book than most of the others, being a whodunit mystery rather than a romance. I loved it revolving around a quilt show, for quilt lovers, it's always fun to read books that have a quilt or something related to quilting as part of the central story and having a crime mystery at a quilt show was a hoot for me. What I didn't like is that it simply isn't a particularly well written one, the characters have no dimension, the dialog is contrived and trite and ultimately the story pretty predictable.

I depend on solar lights for lighting the outside of the house but I also love them when the electricity goes out (which seems to happen far too often), and I use them to light up the entire inside of the house when this happens. They come in so handy and since I'm a recycler, I love recycling the light from our Great Central Sun. This particular design is great and allows one to hang it on the house/fence or to situate it snugly into the earth. At the moment I've got it just sitting on the ground and this works well also. It isn't a heavy unit but the winds don't blow it around and it seems happy among the shrubs.It's made well enough and has two brightness settings, high or low. I generally use the low as I don't want to blast the neighbors with unwanted light. We actually have rules in our neighborhood where lights are frowned upon because folks who moved here came here specifically to watch the night sky.Installation is a snap and you're up and ready to roll within minutes. This light stays on longer than any other solar light I have in the yard and it charges nicely everyday in the sun.... Perfect in every way.Product received for review purposes.

I'm listening to music as I write this with these fabulous headphones. I love my BASS and I can assure you that these buds have that and more.I like to use the term, *surround sound stereo* for really good earbuds and that is certainly true of these. I always test headphones to Warren Zevon's music, especially his songs, Mohammed's Radio and Carmelita. Both these songs go through every chord and note and they'll come through one or both earbuds with perfect pitch. I'm extremely thrilled with both the sound and the comfort of these headphones. I could listen for days on end, and maybe I will. The audio quality is superb.The earbuds fit gently in the ear canal and stay put. I've been running around the neighborhood with these and haven't had any problems with them staying in place. I don't hear any echo from the cord, the color blue is lovely and they pair easily. A 80 mAh battery keeps them charged and it takes about 2 hours to fully charge. Music or talk time is about 7 hours and standby time is about 175 hours.They come nicely boxed with a USB charging cable, 4 silicone ear buds, 4 earhooks, a buckle and a user manual. If you haven't used bluetooth earbuds before, I think you'll easily understand the set up through the manual. As everyone knows, I'm a real fuss pot when it comes to my bluetooth headphones and I only want the best BASS there is. This is it folks, don't hesitate to purchase these for you or your friends.Product received for review purposes.

This little gadget is terrific....I know that some of us prefer this type of bluetooth device because there are no cords or attachments and if you're one of those folks, you'll really like this too.
