Her performance is both charming and terrifying, the perfect character study for a film like this.The Blu-ray transfer of EVIL EYE looks great, however there are a couple of transitions that cause the picture to ‘wobble’ every now and then.  This is not overly distracting, but it is noticeable.  The picture clarity is excellent, however, and there’s practically no graininess anywhere.  Likewise, the sound is top notch as well.EVIL EYE is a big win for me, and I recommend it to anyone not experienced with Bava’s work.  This is a great film to start your journey with, and it’s a title every horror fan owes it to themselves to own.  The Blu-ray offers two versions:  the U.S. release, which was titled EVIL EYE, and the European version, which was released as THE GIRL WHO KNEW TOO MUCH.  Regardless of which one you watch, you’re sure to appreciate the impact this film had on our much beloved modern horror genre.  This Blu-ray hits store shelves next week, so make a note.

* I received a review copy of this book in exchange for an honest reviewThe minute I laid eyes on the title, I knew I had to read this book.  I didn’t know what a ‘heaven maker’ was or why it might be gruesome, but the mystery of these questions drew me in.  I’m very glad I gave this one a shot, too…author Craig Herbertson has a vivid imagination rife with brutal originality and terrifying concepts.  If you’re a fan of short horror fiction, put this book on your Must Own list.I cheated a bit by not reading this book in order.  I don’t suppose it really matters where you begin an anthology, but this time I jumped straight to “The Heaven Maker”, which is toward the middle of the book, and started there.  This story set the whole tone for the book and is a perfect example of the horror found within it.Each story in THE HEAVEN MAKER AND OTHER GRUESOME TALES is written well and flows at a nice, even pace.  I commend on Herbertson for his pacing…some short story writers tend to rush sometimes and try to reach the punchline faster than they should.  Not so here; Herbertson pulls the reader into each story from the beginning and then delivers a sucker punch when it is least expected.One of my favorite stories in this collection is “Gifts”, a rather short tale measuring only a page and half in length.  This one is told from Santa’s perspective one Christmas Eve, however something is different this year…and it might be a very bad kind of different.  The imagery in this story is very vivid, and the twist ending is unnerving to say the least.My sole complaint about THE HEAVEN MAKER AND OTHER GRUESOME TALES is from an editing standpoint.  I ran across numerous typos and errors throughout the book, more so than I think any edited publication should contain, in my opinion.  Granted, this did not detract from my enjoyment of the book, however I feel it worth mentioning.Otherwise, THE HEAVEN MAKER AND OTHER GRUESOME TALES is a big win for me.  This is a solid anthology with some interesting concepts and horrifying realities.  The book is available now in a variety of formats.

*I received a review copy of this film in exchange for an honest reviewDirector Jess Franco’s VAMPYROS LESBOS has been dubbed by some as “the Holy Grail of cult cinema.”  I had heard of the film several times over the years, but I never found a copy to give a look.  When I heard Severin Films was remastering the film and releasing it on Blu-ray, I immediately put it on my To Find list.  Thankfully, the fine folks at Severin saw fit to grace me with a review copy, and I’m so glad they did.  This film epitomizes Franco’s legacy of exploitation and Eurotrash flicks.  If you are a fan of these genres, then this film is a must-have for your collection.Before I continue, I have to confirm the title:  yes, it is translated as ‘Lesbian Vampires’.  Not very controversial by today’s standards, but look at the time period in which the film was made.  Homosexuality was not as accepted back then as it is today, therefore the title alone was enough to send people into a fury about this film.VAMPYROS LESBOS is shot fairly well, however you almost have to be an existing fan of Franco’s work to enjoy much of it.  I say this because the film is Franco’s first venture into his own style of cinematography.  There are many odd shots of abstract things which (if you look closely) do fit with the film.  There’s even some symbolism in regard to what he shows onscreen.With that being said, this is not really a horror flick.  It’s meant to be (I think), but there’s no scares and, if I’m being honest, the blood looks horrible, like someone popped a ketchup packet somewhere.  Still, the film is very entertaining and held my attention the entire time.The acting in VAMPYROS LESBOS is so-so, but people don’t generally watch exploitation flicks like this for the performances.  The beautiful and sensuous Soledad Miranda is always welcome onscreen, and she revels in this portrayal of Dracula’s lover.  Ewa Stromberg and the rest of the cast do ok for the most part, however their cardboard characters are part of what makes the film so fun.VAMPYROS LESBOS is a win for me, and I recommend it…however it won’t be a film for everyone.  Connoisseurs of Franco’s work will definitely want to snatch this version up; the HD transfer for the Blu-ray looks amazing, and the sound quality is great as well.  In addition to the high quality picture and sound, this two-disc Special Limited Collector’s Edition includes a variety of Special Features. This film hits store shelves next Tuesday, so make a note.

*I received a review copy of this film in exchange for an honest reviewI love horror films that introduce unique villains, especially those who are original enough to become genre icons in their own right (for example, Jason, Michael Myers, Freddy, Jigsaw, etc.)  The films that birth these characters are usually labors of love and not just someone’s attempt to make a quick buck.  THE DROWNSMAN is one such title, an impressive attempt at adding to the prestigious list of iconic horror figures.  And although it has a few flaws, the film is a lot of fun and I recommend giving it a look.I love the concept of the killer and his unique way of dispatching victims; drowning has to be one of the worst ways to die, and using it as the primary way of a killer dispatching his victims is very clever.  This is especially true when combined with the supernatural elements the killer invokes.THE DROWNSMAN is shot very well and looks great onscreen.  The film was shot using a RED camera, so the picture quality is excellent.  Likewise, the ambient sounds are crystal clear in surround-sound, and lend a huge hand in building suspense for the film.The acting in THE DROWNSMAN is pretty good, although a couple of the actresses are a bit lackluster in their deliveries.  Michelle Mylett, who plays the lead, Madison, does a great job and exhibits a wide range of emotional diversity in the film.  Ry Barrett, who portrays The Drownsman himself, is a solid and foreboding figure.  His silent but menacing performance injects a nice shot of terror into the film.But there are a couple of negatives about the THE DROWNSMAN as well.  For one, we are never told how he pulls his disappearing act in the opening scenes, nor are we ever told why or how he has supernatural powers.  There’s not even any speculation as to how this happened.  Another example is how Sebastian is supposedly defeated: with fire.  Really?  I thought water doused fire, therefore how could a supernatural entity like The Drownsman be terrified of it?  And if it pertains to his backstory, shouldn’t we be told about that?Still, with these minor issues aside, THE DROWNSMAN is a heck of a film, and it highlights the talent of director Chad Archibald.  Given the way the movie ends, I sure hope there is a sequel in the works, and I hope it answers the questions above.  If that is the case, THE DROWNSMAN will move up several notches in my book.  I recommend giving this one a look, if anything to check out a new and original horror figure.  The film is available next week in a variety of formats, so make a note.

*I received a review copy of this book in exchange for an honest reviewThey say fiction has nothing on real life, and I believe that statement wholeheartedly.  The news has been chocked full of atrocious and horrifying headlines for years, making it an interesting place of source material for horror books and movies.  One of the most terrifying concepts to me is cults.  When someone is charismatic enough to convince others to carry out the most heinous of acts in the name of some religion, that is truly scary.  This premise is the basis behind WITHIN THESE WALLS, a chilling new book by authoress Ania Ahlborn.  And although the book is not perfect, it’s very close to being so, and it’s one every horror fan should own.I remember hearing about Jonestown when I was a kid, and how everybody “drank the Kool-aid” to commit suicide.  I was stunned that someone could have so much power over a group of people.  This was my first wake-up call to the real world, and it was a harsh one.WITHIN THESE WALLS is written very well and flows smoothly for the most part.  Ahlborn does a skillful job of telling two stories in one: the primary tale is set in modern day Washington state and details Lucas’ plight; the secondary story is set in the 80s and relates what happened to Audra Snow (aka Avis) and how she is connected to Jeffrey Halcomb.  I had no problem switching back and forth, and I enjoyed the pace of each as well.Speaking of the characters, each is fleshed out well and written with a grand dose of realism.  In this book, everybody is damaged and these personal demons help accent the physical ones.  I like how Ahlborn brings both modern day and past-day people into the mix, sharing with the us the generational nuances that are easily recognizable.  This is just one example of her extraordinary talent as a writer.My sole complaint about the book is that it sometimes becomes bogged down with exposition about what every character is thinking.  In most cases, some insight into the thoughts of the characters is fine…however, in this book we get a bit too much of a look inside their heads.  Thankfully, this isn’t a huge detractor, and the plot is enthralling enough to keep the story moving.WITHIN THESE WALLS is a major win for me, and I recommend it to anyone looking for a spine-chilling story that will haunt you after it’s over.  The book is available now in a variety of formats.

* I received a review copy of this film in exchange for an honest reviewI have to state right up front that this film is one you will either love or hate, and I will wager many people will hate it.  I will explain why later.  For me, though, I liked it for the most part.  I never get tired of seeing Debbie Rochon onscreen, even in low-budget indies like this one.  And although the storyline is simplistic, it’s still a lot of fun (if you look past the flaws).  Granted, there are many things about the film that could have been better…but everything about it overall works for me on a base level.I should probably also state this is one of those films that is so bad, it’s good.  This statement alone will explain a lot about why I like it so much.AXE TO GRIND looks like it was shot on home video cameras for the most part, and therefore does not have a lot of cinematic value.  The lighting is decent for the most part, although there are a couple of darkened shots that could have been lit better.  The sound, thankfully, is good, so we don’t have any problems hearing the dialogue.The acting is about what you would expect from a B-movie.  I love Debbie Rochon, so she always entertains me, regardless of her role.  Another noteworthy performance is given by Michelle Tomlinson, who plays fellow scream-queen Cheryl.  I first saw Tomlinson back in 2011, in a lesser-known film I reviewed for Hayes Hudson’s House of Horror titled BRAIN DEAD.  She impressed me then, and continues to impress me now.  The rest of the cast, however, is a take-them-or-leave-them group.  Nobody really gives a horrible performance…yet, I don’t think anyone in the cast will win any awards for their acting anytime soon, either.The special effects are ok, however I absolutely hate CG blood-splatters.  The several we see in AXE TO GRIND are poorly done, and therefore come across as cartoonish.  I understand CG is a cost-saving tool, however gore cannot be a secondary aspect in a horror film and should always be given its due.Yet, even with all of its flaws, there’s something satisfactory about seeing Rochon dole out her vengeance on a group of clueless scream-queens who have slept with her husband.  She even takes out the director and his cohorts (although I never quite caught on as to why…maybe her character is just that demented!).  My sole (major) complaint about the film is that I didn’t understand the ending.  I don’t really know what her big ‘performance’ was or even who the creepy caretaker was supposed to be.I can’t honestly recommend AXE TO GRIND, unless you’re a big fan of B-movies or Debbie Rochon.  And even then, you have to give this one a lot of leeway.  If you can do that, however, you’ll be in for a minor treat.

* I received a review copy of this show in exchange for an honest reviewI have to confess up front I’ve been collecting Yu-Gi-Oh! cards for several years now.  I don’t play the game, but I am drawn to the cards because of the imaginative characters and creatures, as well as the impressive artwork.  I’ve never watched any of the Yu-Gi-Oh! TV series before either, but I’ve been meaning to; for some reason, I’ve always had something else to watch instead.  So when the fine folks at Cinedigm sent the press release for a recent Yu-Gi-Oh! series titled Zexal, I jumped at the chance to watch it.  I’m glad I did, too.  YU-GI-OH!: ZEXAL is a fun anime series that will appeal to both young and old.After watching Zexal, I think I might have to try my hand at actually playing the game.  From what I’ve been told, I’ve amassed some pretty powerful cards, so I might be a formidable opponent someday.  And if the game is half as fun as this show, then I’m in for a real treat!YU-GI-OH!: ZEXAL is both vivid and intense, a cartoon series that is just as serious as it is campy.  The characters are larger than life, particularly Yuma, who can’t decide if he’s a man in a boy’s body or a just a wannabe duelist who is trying to tread water in a sea of talented card-slingers.  Yuma’s over-the-top antics are half of what make this show fun, although some of his inner dialogue can be painful at times.The show itself looks great, with well drawn monsters straight from the game cards.  I like the diversity of the cards/creatures used, as it really opens the eyes to those not initiated with the actual game.  Likewise, the newer monsters are powerful and cool, welcome additions to an already impressive canon of beasties.YU-GI-OH!: ZEXAL is a win for me, and fans of Saturday morning anime cartoons should love it.  The 3-disc set of season one is packaged in a nice, albeit plain, box case, so it should look nice on any collector’s shelf.  The series hits stores tomorrow, so make a note.

* I received a review copy of this film in exchange for an honest reviewAs a self-proclaimed H. P. Lovecraft devotee, I try to snatch up every film adaptation I can of his works.  I have not personally read everything he has written, however I can state with a smug smile I have read much of it.  Therefore, every time a filmmaker tries to adapt his work, I have to check it out to see how well it follows the actual story, and also to see if the filmmaker does the story justice.  I’m very happy to report director Tom Gliserman’s adaptation of THE THING ON THE DOORSTEP is a fairly accurate and engaging film that horror fans should enjoy.This is a low-budget film, so don’t expect a Michael Bay-sized production, but the filmmakers do a great job utilizing the money they have.  The film is a true testament to what heart and determination can bring forth when funds are low.THE THING ON THE DOORSTEP looks decent onscreen, although the cinematography is lacking a bit and the picture quality looks cheap.  The scene gets very grainy when light levels are low, which sometimes becomes too much for the story to overcome.  If better lighting had been used or even a better lens, the results would have been drastically better.  Still, the sound quality is solid, so that makes up for a lot.The acting is pretty good, too, especially for a low-budget film.  The cast is pretty solid overall, particularly David Bunce, who plays Daniel.  Bunce has several credits on his IMDB page, however I am not familiar with any of them.  Regardless, he does a good job here, and I hope to see him in future projects.The special effects are average, but they don’t play too much of a role here.  THE THING ON THE DOORSTEP prides itself on suspense and intrigue over splatter-shock or gore.  And it works.  The mystery of what Edward is going through carries the story, and the result is an enthralling thriller that you won’t want to miss.I have to hand it to director Gliserman:  he does a good job with this adaptation.  Sure, there are little differences, such as the movie-Daniel naming his son William, after Edward’s father, whereas in the actual story, he’s named Edward…but these are minor nuances that don’t affect the end result.  My sole complaint about the story is that it is set in modern times, when it would have been so much more effective to set it in its proper time period (back in the early 1900s).  This is nothing that detracts from the film itself, but more of a personal preference.THE THING ON THE DOORSTEP is a big win for me, and I suggest horror fans check it out.  If you are not familiar with Lovecraft’s work, you should read the short story before seeing the film; it might help shape your perception for what you are about to watch.  THE THING ON THE DOORSTEP is available now in a variety of formats.

* I received a review copy of this book in exchange for an honest reviewA couple of years ago, I had the distinct pleasure of reviewing a book by Kristopher Rufty titled THE LURKERS.  I am a HUGE fan of creature-features in both books and movies, so this was obviously a must-read for me.  I loved that book, and I’m excited to report the story continues on in THE LURKING SEASON, the followup that was recently published by Samhain Horror.Samhain just keeps getting it right when it comes to horror.  I have yet to read one of their books that I did not enjoy.  I hope this trend continues, as they are a powerhouse in horror in my book (pardon the pun).THE LURKING SEASON picks up a short while after the end of the first book but forges forward with a new storyline. Like its predecessor, this book is written very well and flows at a nice, even pace.  Rufty once again weaves a thrilling tale of terror rife with intensity and scares.  I am very impressed with his ability to keep his creatures scary; though the characters and story might change, his Haunchies are still vicious and bloodthirsty.And speaking of characters, there are several new ones we get to meet right from the start.  Each is fleshed out well, with individual backstories and unique characteristics.  But we also get a couple of familiar faces as well.  I will not divulge too much information and tell you who they are, because some of these reveals are integral to the story.In regard to the story, this book brings a new aspect of the Haunchies to light.  Again, I won’t say too much, but I can tell you there’s a bigger plan brewing than what was previously brought to light in the first book.  I really enjoy where Rufty goes with THE LURKING SEASON, and I hope this series turns out to be a trilogy.  I can’t seem to get enough of the Haunchies and their bloodthirsty ways!THE LURKING SEASON is another feather in the cap of author Kristopher Rufty, and I highly recommend giving it a read.  Chocked full of good ol’ gory horror, this is one book that every fan of the genre should own.  It is available now in a variety of formats.

* I received a review copy of this film in exchange for an honest reviewIn my opinion, THE RAID is one of the greatest action films ever.  There’s a lot to like about it, including the writing and the action.  So when I heard the producers of THE RAID were making another film, I put it on my Must Watch list before I even knew what it was about.  Surprisingly, the film turned out to be KILLERS, a thriller about two men in different parts of the world who share an urge to kill.  And just as I had hoped, the film delivers on every level.I love the premise of KILLERS.  It’s about time we got a movie about “dueling psychopaths.”  But the movie is much more than just two murderers comparing notes.  It’s a look into the existence of two very different individuals who are damaged and trying to make their way in the world.KILLERS is shot well and looks great from a production standpoint.  I love the drastic difference in tone between the two locations.  The Japanese locales are full of vibrancy and life, while the Jakarta locations are more industrial and grim.  This contrast is reversed when looking at the characters.  Nomura is a dark individual, a loner who exists almost in the shadows; Bayu, on the other hand, is a family man and has brightness in his life because of them.The acting in the film is very good.  I am particularly impressed with both of the leads; they do an phenomenal job of bringing their characters to life.  I would even go so far as to say the acting is a big part of what makes the movie so effective.The special effects are great as well.  Gore-hounds will be happy to hear there are several scenes of some nice carnage.  My particular favorite is when Nomura stabs a pimp in the chin during an altercation in a club bathroom.  It takes the guy a while to die, but the crimson fountain that erupts is truly impressive.I give KILLERS a major thumbs up, and I recommend it to anyone looking for a slick thriller.  My sole complaint about the film is its running time.  It clocks in at 2 hours 17 minutes; in my opinion, they could have wrapped it up in just under 2 hours.  But this isn’t a big detraction, just more of a personal preference.KILLERS is available now in a variety of formats.

* I received a review copy of this film in exchange for an honest reviewOver the years, I’ve grown almost bored with horror movies about asylums and hospitals.  This is primarily because there are SO MANY of them on the market now.  Granted, these are great locations in which to set a horror film…but there’s an over-saturation point that should not be passed, and this one was reached a long time ago.  So when the fine folks at After Dark sent the press release for BEDLAM, I was very skeptical.  Could they actually find a way to make an asylum scary again?  I decided to give it a shot, just in case.As the credits rolled, I sat for a few moments and pondered on what I had just seen.  Was the movie scary?  Not really.  But was it entertaining?  Yes, I have to say so for the most part.  It’s not what I was expecting, but I did enjoy it overall nonetheless.I love the cover art from the DVD.  The image doesn’t have much to do with the film itself, but it definitely does its job and sparks interest.  Thankfully, it’s not too far from events in the movie, so it’s not terribly misleading.  I can’t stand it when a movie poster or media cover art has nothing to do with the film its promoting.BEDLAM is shot well and looks good from a production standpoint.  The location chosen for the asylum is perfect, a building filled with tight corridors, dark recesses, and cramped quarters.  Likewise, the setting feels very aged, which fits perfectly with the theme of the story.The acting is very good, with Guy Edmonds heading up a great cast.  Edmonds gives a believable performance as George, the man who inherited madness from his mother.  Supporting him are John Boxer and Greg Hatton, who portray the two orderlies who torments George behind closed doors, as well as Gary Boulter and Cassandra Swaby, who play George’s fellow inmates.  The whole cast does a great job with their roles.The storyline in BEDLAM is interesting and riveting, however it pretty much as no horror value at all.  I would classify this more as a drama (maybe a thriller) but not a horror film.  I’m not saying this is a bad thing at all; but if you watch this movie, you need to know what to expect.BEDLAM is a win for me, and I do recommend it.  The film is a gripping trek into a madness-filled mind, and it will take you on a journey you won’t forget.  The film is available now, so give it a look.

ECHOES is one of those curious films that I have a hard time defining.  It’s part horror, part thriller, part mystery, and even part informative semi-documentary.  And yes, it’s entertaining for the most part to boot.  But with that being said, it’s not as enthralling as I wanted it to be.  From the hype I had heard about it, I was honestly expecting more.  Still, I do recommend it, although it’s less horror and more of a thriller.I have to commend director Nils Timm for what has been accomplished with this debut.  From a production standpoint, the film looks great.  The cinematography is tight, the acting is top notch, and the film overall is well made.  The only lagging piece is the story.  Granted, it’s written well, but there’s just something missing from it.As I mentioned, ECHOES is shot well and is visually beautiful onscreen.  The desert scenery is amazing, and it really captures the desolate and lonely atmosphere the film is trying to portray.Also, the acting is great, too, with Kate French and Steven Brand in the lead roles.  I’ve watched both actors in prior works, and I have been impressed with everything I’ve seen.  The supporting cast (as small as it is) does a fine job as well.The story in ECHOES, however, just didn’t excite me that much.  It had a couple of interesting portions, but I found it predictable and saw the ‘big reveal’ coming from far off.  Don’t get me wrong:  it is well paced and fleshed out for the most part…but it’s just lacking something, a specific spark of major interest.Although I have reservations about the storyline, I still recommend ECHOES.  It is a slow-burn thriller that does keep you entertained, even if you can see what’s coming from the start.  And I do hope to see more from director Nils Timm in the future.  ECHOES is available now in a variety of formats.

Like all other edible mushrooms, reishi mushrooms prevent cancer, prevent cardiovascular problems, and boost our immune health.  However, reishi mushrooms are unique among edible mushrooms in that they contain steroid-like substances which boost our muscle strength and bone health.  Don't doubt the wisdom of the Chinese people in selecting this mushroom above all other mushrooms more than 2,000 years ago.Worldwide, dozens of varieties of reishi mushrooms exist.  The healthiest one is the red reishi and the more bitter it tastes, the more likely that it contains the beneficial compounds most abundantly.  The red reishi mushroom powder in this product has a noticeably bitter/metallic taste, which indicates to me that it is genuine and quite healthy for us.  I add boiling hot water to this product and after it cools off, I drink it as is about half the time and sweeten it about half the time with delicious aspartame (with no acesulfame potassium added to it).  This product is only about half as bitter as olive leaf powder and only about one-fourth as bitter as globe artichoke powder, both of which are extremely healthy for us to consume too.

In order to enjoy the extremely powerful health benefits of consuming the phytochemicals from olive trees, we need to choose one of the following strategies:(1)Immediately throw away all vegetable oils in our homes and buy only extra virgin olive oil from now on and consume it regularly together with our favorite foods.(2)Buy whole dried olive leaves, throw away the bad ones, and eat just the good ones.[Unfortunately, whole dried olive leaves are somewhat tough and don't taste that good].(3)Buy chopped dried olive leaves and pour boiling hot water over them to make olive leaf tea.[Unfortunately, olive leaf tea doesn't taste that good and needs to be sweetened].(4)Buy this product, olive leaf powder, and pour boiling hot water over it.[I sweeten my olive leaf powder drink with aspartame that doesn't have any acesulfame potassium added to it].(5)Buy raw unbrined/unsalted olive fruits regularly and eat them.[Unfortunately, raw olive fruits taste somewhat bitter].Conclusion:  Don't worry about the warning from the State of California about this product containing too much lead.  Lord Jesus prayed to Lord God under the olive trees on the Mount of Olives, partly because He knew that olive trees had extremely powerful health benefits.  Also, many experts believe that the "Tree of Life" in the Bible was an olive tree.

The healthiest way to eat salmon is to purchase the frozen wild sockeye salmon filets at Costco or Sam's Club and then boil them for at least 15 minutes without adding any salt.  Eat them together with raw onions, raw green onions, raw garlic, raw radish sprouts, crushed raw turnips (daikon), boiled nori (laver), salsa, tomato paste, tomato puree, tomato sauce, catsup (ketchup), French's yellow mustard, wasabi, turmeric powder, astragalus powder, extra virgin olive oil, and/or your favorite steak sauce.Unfortunately, I can't recommend the use of black pepper or red pepper because scientific studies say that they tend to cause stomach cancer and liver cancer.Because this product is without the extremely healthy, fatty, omega-3 skin, it is not as healthy for us to eat as salmon that comes with the skin.  The salmon skin was removed from this product and used for making omega-3 softgels.

I've decided not to buy this product again because my liver is in excellent health.  However, people who have developed a damaged liver (because of alcoholism, eating pork regularly, hepatitis, syphilis, prescription drugs [for example, Rezulin/troglitazone], cancer surgery, or cancer chemotherapy) should buy this product.  The healthiest sweetener to use is Equal (aspartame) without any acesulfame potassium added to it.  That's the sweetener that I will be using to help me consume this product.  This product (artichoke leaf powder) is twice as bitter as olive leaf powder, which is also extremely healthy for us to consume, and four times as bitter as reishi mushroom powder, which is also extremely healthy for us to consume.

Together with genuine aspartame, this product also contains large quantities of acesulfame potassium, a potassium salt which gives this product a substantially salty aftertaste.  100% pure aspartame would taste sweeter and much more delicious.  The original Equal, which was available in the 1980s, the 1990s, and the 2000s, contained 100% pure aspartame plus dextrose plus maltodextrin with absolutely no acesulfame potassium added to it.Warning:  This product tastes salty because, unlike the original Equal (aspartame) sold by G.D. Searle (from 1981 to 2000) and Merisant (from 2000 to 2009), this product has large quantities of acesulfame potassium added to it.  If you would rather buy the much more delicious pure aspartame at a good price, look for it at Costco (Kirkland Signature), Sam's Club (Member's Mark), or Amazon (N'JOY brand aspartame).

Emperor Montezuma II ruled the Aztec Empire in Mexico from 1502 to 1520.  According to Spanish conquistador Hernando Cortes, Montezuma II told him in 1519 that "[unsweetened] cocoa is a divine drink that builds up resistance and fights fatigue.  Drinking just one cup of this precious drink will allow a man to walk for a whole day without eating any food."In Montezuma's days, the cacao bean, which is really a seed and not a legume, grew only in Latin America.  Today, more than 70% of the world's cacao beans are grown in western Africa.In Montezuma's days, the cacao bean was separated into cocoa powder, which was very highly prized, and cocoa butter, which was the waste product.  Today, cocoa butter is very highly prized and in short supply because it is needed by the chocolate industry to feed the world's addiction to chocolate.  Today, cocoa powder is in oversupply and in need of more buyers.Even before Montezuma's days, the Incas in Peru considered cocoa to be "the drink of the Gods," which explains why "Theobroma cacao," the modern scientific name for this plant, means "God" "drink" "cacao" in the Greek language.  However, radiocarbon dating indicates that the Aztecs drank liquid unsweetened cocoa before the Incas.  In Honduras, archaeologists uncovered elaborately designed bowls used by the Aztecs around 1600 BC to drink liquid unsweetened cocoa.Disadvantages of cocoa powder:  Cancer-causing mycotoxins, inflammation-causing bacterial endotoxins, the toxic heavy metal, cadmium, and acrylamide, which is the slightly cancer-causing chemical produced when starch is baked or fried (but not produced when starch is boiled or steamed).Advantages of cocoa powder:  Cocoa powder, even when unsweetened, tastes much better than all other health-promoting powders, including turmeric powder, olive leaf powder, matcha green tea powder, ginger powder, garlic powder, Korean red ginseng powder, astragalus powder, amalaki powder, globe artichoke powder, milk thistle seed powder, reishi mushroom powder, Agaricus blazei powder, fenugreek seed powder, etc.

There is nothing wrong with the quality of this kombu, which is a product of South Korea.  Meanwhile, Emerald Cove's wakame is a product of China (because it is farmed near the Shandong Peninsula of China).  Emerald Cove also sells an expensive seaweed medley product from Japan, which must be ordered directly from their website.  Yes, wakame and nori are more popular than kombu because they are easier to use and somewhat more deliicious than kombu.  However, the seaweed soup from both kombu and wakame are extremely delicious.  Simply add boiling hot water to strips of dried kombu in a 16-ounce cup.  Next, discard the seaweed soup, which is too salty.  Next, add boiling hot water again to the rehydrated kombu.  Finally, enjoy the delicious seaweed soup.  Unfortunately, sea salt is not good for our health because it causes high blood pressure, stroke, kidney disease, stomach cancer, esophageal cancer, and osteoporosis.  However, the biological nutrients in the kombu are extremely good for our health.

The manufacturer of this product guarantees this product to be rust-proof.  However, the lower half of this product will cling to any magnet.  The reason is that the black-painted, 4-legged base and the inner core of the lower half of this quad can is made of stainless steel, not aluminum.As for the wide, 4-legged base, it is stable only on 3 sides.  The side of the wide, 4-legged base that should face the person who is walking is not as stable as the other 3 sides.  There is a need for a quad cane with a wide base that is equally stable on all 4 sides but nobody seems to want to manufacture it.

This product is a very bad choice because it keeps moving around.  Even after fastened extremely tightly to try to prevent it from moving around, it will still move around severely and become like a thigh pad used by a person playing tackle football.  I've even tried using this product upside down and, believe it or not, that helped slightly but it still moved around way too much.This product is definitely not usable for people who need to crawl forward or backward while staying on their knees.However, for people who never walk forward or backward while staying on their knees - people who go down on their knees and then stand up and then go back down on their knees and then stand up - this product can just barely be used but with great difficulty.  The only advantage of this product is the luxurious cushion.  However, the small initial pleasure from the excessive cushioning is more than offset by the powerful displeasure of constantly worrying that it will move around by itself and transform into a thigh pad or shin pad.Conclusion:  This product is borderline fraudulent.  It should be discontinued.  Avoid all Troxell products.  Their claim, "So Comfortable You'll Forget You're Wearing Them!" is an outright lie.  At $22.06 (with free shipping), this product is priced way too high compared to cheaper, better knee pads such as Fiskars Ultra Light Knee Pads, which are priced at $9.95 (with free shipping).  The Fiskars Ultra Light Knee Pads won't move around while the person is crawling forward or backward while staying on their knees but the cushioning is less luxurious and less comfortable than this Troxell product.

Ingredients:  Small Red Beans, Pinto Beans, Lentils, Red Lentils, Whole Oat Groats, Brown Rice, Triticale Berries (Wheat), Rye Berries, Hard Red Wheat, Pearl Barley, Kamut Khorasan Wheat, Buckwheat Groats, and Sesame Seeds.Disadvantages:  The 2 large legumes in this product (the pink-colored pinto beans and the red-colored kidney? beans) take much, much longer to get soft than all of the other ingredients in this product.  Therefore, if these 2 large legumes were removed from this product, then simply pouring boiling hot water over this product and eating it 3 minutes later would be an excellent way of doing things.  Because of these 2 large legumes, however, this product needs to be boiled for at least 10 minutes before serving.Advantages:  After adequately softened, this product is delicious enough for us to eat, even if no salt or soup base is added to it.

This product is slightly less delicious than yellow corn but these yellow peas are quite delicious - delicious enough.  Both yellow corn and yellow peas are high in the carotenoids, lutein and zeaxanthin, which have been shown to greatly benefit eye health in humans.  By contrast, green peas are high in several forms of lutein but do not contain any zeaxanthin.  Both green peas and yellow peas are much healthier for us to eat than yellow corn, which is slightly healthier for us to eat than white corn because yellow corn is much higher in carotenoids than white corn.  The main reason that peas are much healthier for us to eat than corn is that both green peas and yellow peas are legumes.  Real populations of real people who eat any species of legumes have been shown to be much, much healthier than people who don't eat any legumes.  The 2nd reason is that peas are much less likely to contain cancer-causing mycotoxins (such as aflatoxins, fumonisins, ochratoxins, zearalenone, patulin, citrinin, ergot alkaloids, and tricothecenes) from pathogenic molds (such as Aspergillus and Fusarium) than corn.  When compared against green peas, yellow peas taste quite different - yellow peas have a more fruity, ripened taste than green peas.  Also, green peas tend to always be infected by fungi called, white mildew (white spots), but yellow peas tend not to have this problem.

The fact that this product is organic is a disadvantage, in my opinion, because the scientific evidence appears to indicate that the "natural" chemicals used by organic farmers (such as rotenone, pyrethroids, copper sulfate, and cow manure) are worse for human health than the man-made chemicals used by conventional farmers (such as organophosphates, glyphosate, and 10-20-20).  Also, organically farmed plant-source foods have been shown to carry a higher risk of contamination by pathogenic E. coli, pathogenic Salmonella, pathogenic Shigella, and cancer-causing mycotoxins than conventionally farmed plant-source foods.  [Organic farmers tend to tolerate greater insect damage to their crops and this directly causes higher levels of mycotoxins from pathogenic molds].  Organic farmers regularly and intentionally make their farm soils permanently toxic (with copper, a pro-oxidant and toxic poison) and cause toxic environmental runoff (with copper).  Organic farming has also been shown to cause deforestation of virgin forests, excessive depletion of water reserves, lower fruit and vegetable consumption among poor families, and increased instances of fraudulent food marketing.Conclusion:  Eating this product regularly will help us to live much, much longer despite the fact that it is organic.  After adding boiling hot water to this product and stirring well, this product should taste somewhat like creamy, liquid peanut butter.  However, Bob's Red Mill Lowfat Soy Flour, which is toasted, tastes even more like creamy, liquid peanut butter than this product.

Toasting definitely makes this product does taste a little more delicious than - and a little more like genuine, creamy, liquid peanut butter than - Bob's Red Mill Organic Soy Flour after boiling hot water is added.  Unfortunately, toasting also reduces the health benefits by creating harmful byproducts of high-temperature combustion, including trans fatty acids, dietary advanced glycation endproducts, dietary advanced lipoxidation endproducts, and possibly also some nitrosamines, heterocyclic amines, polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons, alkanals, and alkenals.  Toasting temperatures (175 to 230 degrees Celsius) are very similar to frying temperatures (180 to 250 degrees Celsius) and are much higher than canning temperatures (130 degrees Celsius), which are somewhat higher than the extremely healthful practice of cooking foods at the boiling temperature of water (exactly 100 degrees Celsius).The fact that this product is not organic is an advantage, in my opinion, because the scientific evidence appears to indicate that the "natural" chemicals used by organic farmers (such as rotenone, pyrethroids, copper sulfate, and cow manure) are worse for human health than the man-made chemicals used by conventional farmers (such as organophosphates, glyphosate, and 10-20-20).  Also, organically farmed plant-source foods have been shown to carry a higher risk of contamination by pathogenic E. coli, pathogenic Salmonella, pathogenic Shigella, and cancer-causing mycotoxins than conventionally farmed plant-source foods.  [Organic farmers tend to tolerate greater insect damage to their crops and this directly causes higher levels of mycotoxins from pathogenic molds].  Organic farmers regularly and intentionally make their farm soils permanently toxic (with copper, a pro-oxidant and toxic poison) and cause toxic environmental runoff (with copper).  Organic farming has also been shown to cause deforestation of virgin forests, excessive depletion of water reserves, lower fruit and vegetable consumption among poor families, and increased instances of fraudulent food marketing.The fact that this product contains slightly less than half of the total fat of full-fat soy flour is a big advantage for people trying to lose weight, especially since this product tastes better than untoasted, full-fat soy flour.  The soybeans used during the manufacture of this product are cold pressed to squeeze away slightly more than half of the soybean oil.  No hexane or other toxic solvents are used to separate the soybean oil from this product.  By contrast, the neurotoxin, hexane, is used during the separation of the the soybean oil away from Bob's Red Mill TVP (textured vegetable protein).Conclusion:  Eating this product regularly will help us to live much, much longer.  Enjoy the better taste but at the expense of a slightly reduced health benefit.

There's nothing wrong with the quality of these Mushroom House brand dried shiitakes.  Just pour boiling hot water on to them and in a few minutes, they can be eaten deliciously.  The vast majority of these Mushroom House brand shiitake stems do not have a black-colored bottom, which would indicate rotting (decomposition) if they did.Keep in mind that although all mushrooms contain vitamin D1, vitamin D2, and vitamin D4, shiitake mushrooms are an especially reliable source of vitamin D4.  Vitamin D4 has health benefits that vitamin D1, vitamin D2, and vitamin D3 (plentiful in wild ocean fish and in sheep's skin) lack.  For example, some medical doctors prescribe vitamin D4 pills to increase the blood levels of calcium in their patients.  Thus, people who suffer from osteoporosis might benefit greatly from consuming shiitake mushrooms (and also the delicious, fermented, Japanese soybean food called, natto, which is a rich source of vitamin K2/MK-7, vitamin K2/MK-8, vitamin PQQ, vitamin C, nattokinase [subtilisin], scyllo-inositol, soy isoflavones, and the extremely beneficial probiotic bacterium, Bacillus subtilis natto).Also, both shiitakes mushrooms and natto are very beneficial against pathogenic fungi (mycotoxin-producing molds) which very frequently get into our bodies from plant-source foods.

They sent me a 6-cell, rechargeable, Li-Ion battery that didn't slide in properly into the empty battery compartment of my Dell Vostro 1520 laptop because it was just slightly too large than it normally should be.  The Li-Ion battery that they sent me had, "Inspiron," printed on it.  Apparently, Dell Inspiron laptops require slightly larger Li-Ion batteries than Dell Vostro laptops.
These envelopes can be easily reopened by anybody.  Only the first time that the 2 lips are allowed meet will result in an adequate (semi-strong) closure.

Scientific studies say that SelenoExcell (Selenium as High Selenium Yeast) works just as well - no better and no worse - as sodium selenite capsules at slightly improving our overall health.  Therefore, shop around for the better price.Zinc, selenium, and iodine are the 3 beneficial antioxidant minerals.  Iron, copper, manganese, and aluminum are the 4 pro-oxidants (very dangerous if consumed in excess).  Arsenic, lead, cadmium, mercury, and barium are the 5 toxic heavy metals.  Beryllium (toxic lightweight metal) and radioactive isotopes would also be detrimental to our health if consumed in excess (for example, Brazil nuts contain a very small amount of radioactive radium).In addition, plant-source foods very frequently contain the following mycotoxins, which are even more dangerous to our health than any of the above-mentioned toxic metals:aflatoxins, fumonisins, ochratoxins, zearalenone, patulin, citrinin, viomellein, sterigmatocystin, A. fumigatus gliotoxin, cyclochlorotine, luteoskyrin and rugulosin, P. jirovecii, C. immitis and C. posadasii, B. dermatitidis, C. gattii VGIIc, phomopsins, tremorgens (penitrems and roquefortines), ergot alkaloids (clavines, ergopeptines, and lysergic acid amides), type A trichothecenes (T-2 toxin, HT-2 toxin, Stachybotrys satratoxins, and diacetoxyscirpenol), and type B trichothecenes (nivalenol, deoxynivalenol, 3-acetyldeoxynivalenol, and 15-acetyldeoxynivalenol).Many other mycotoxins, including slaframine, moniliformin, sporidesmin [facial eczema], and Neotyphodium fungal endosymbiont toxins, will only afflict plant-eating farm animals.Scientific studies also say that the healthiest selenium compounds are manufactured by plants such as garlic, onions, green onions, cabbage, broccoli, cauliflower, kale, red radishes, giant white turnips (daikon), soybeans, and mushrooms.  These plant-source organic selenium compounds are much more complex and very different from SelenoExcell's yeast-bound selenium.  Unfortunately, farmers usually do not enrich their soils with added selenium because it just wastes their money and doesn't make their crops grow any better.Brazil nuts (highest), skipjack tuna [Chunk Light Tuna](2nd highest), other wild ocean fish (3rd highest), wheat germ, and shiitake mushrooms are the 5 foods that contain the most selenium.  Of the 3 beneficial antioxidant minerals (zinc, selenium, and iodine), only selenium can bind to mercury and remove it from our bodies.Don't forget:  Radioactive radon gas, which sneaks into our homes from underground, kills millions of people every year by shooting deadly alpha particles at our lungs and causing lung cancer.
As far as I can tell, the turmeric inside is of high quality.  Also, the clear plastic container is very useful.  The smaller holes at the top are more useful than the big hole.

Organic versus non-organic:(1)Organic ground flaxseeds should not have herbicide residues, assuming that the product is really organic.  The weeds are manually or mechanically removed or smothered before the organic flaxseeds are planted.  Herbicide residues tend to be potentially more damaging to our health than pesticide residues or fungicide residues.(2)Non-organic ground flaxseeds have fungicide residues, which means that the farmer has probably done a better job of minimizing the cancer-causing mycotoxins that grow on flaxseeds.  I consider this an advantage of the non-organic ground flaxseeds.  The organic farmer is prohibited from using fungicides.(3)Non-organic ground flaxseeds are slightly cheaper than an equal amount of organic ground flaxseeds.CONCLUSION:  Organic is better on herbicide residues but non-organic is better on mycotoxins and on price.  These 2 products are competitive.Golden versus brown:(1)Golden ground flaxseeds taste slightly more delicious than brown ground flaxseeds.(2)Brown ground flaxseeds contain slightly more lignans than an equal amount of golden ground flaxseeds.(3)Brown ground flaxseeds have a slightly better (higher) omega-3 to omega-6 fatty acid ratio than golden ground flaxseeds, probably because they tend to be grown farther up north in colder temperatures.(4)Brown ground flaxseeds are slightly cheaper than an equal amount of golden ground flaxseeds.CONCLUSION:  Golden is slightly better on taste but brown is slightly better on lignan content and on price.  Because ground flaxseeds contain much, much more lignans than humans need to derive the full health benefit from eating lignans, lignan content isn't really an important issue between these 2 varieties of flaxseeds.  Also, because the human body can convert only about 5% of the alpha-linolenic acid (LNA) into eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA) and only about 0.1% of the alpha-linolenic acid (LNA) into docosahexaenoic acid (DHA), the omega-3 to omega-6 ratio is only a minor issue for me, especially since I swallow plenty of Double Strength Fish Oil softgels every day and also because virgin omega-6 oils have been shown in scientific studies to cause and worsen cancers in animals but not in humans.  Therefore, I lean slightly in favor of buying the golden flaxseeds despite their slightly higher cost.Note:  The vast majority of all brown flaxseeds are grown by our neighbors up in Canada (mostly Alberta, Saskatchewan, and Manitoba) but the vast majority of all golden flaxseeds are grown in North Dakota with much smaller amounts grown in South Dakota, Minnesota, and Montana.THE BIG PICTURE:  Ground flaxseeds are probably the healthiest seeds that we can eat.  Only chia seeds, mustard seeds (stings the mouth like raw garlic), and fenugreek seeds (a legume; all legumes cause flatulence) can match or exceed the health benefits of eating flaxseeds.  All other seeds and all nuts are less healthy for us to eat than ground flaxseeds.  Only allium vegetables (onions, green onions, or garlic), cruciferous vegetables (cabbage, broccoli, cauliflower, kale, Brussels sprouts, red radishes, giant white turnips, turnip greens, collard greens, mustard greens, watercress, or Chinese cabbages), legumes (especially foods made from soybeans), mushrooms (especially shiitake mushrooms), seafoods (especially salt-free boiled fish, oysters, and seaweeds), soluble fiber foods (especially shirataki noodles or psyllium husk powder), probiotic foods (especially fat-free yogurt, probiotic capsules, or natto), and healthy teas (green tea, white tea, rooibos tea, honeybush tea, or olive leaf tea) can match or exceed the health benefits of eating ground flaxseeds.Update:  I downgraded this Bob's Red Mill product from 5 stars to only 4 stars because Amazon has suddenly more than doubled its price.

Common Problem Number 1:  The holes in these foam earbud covers are much smaller than expected.SOLUTION:  Don't worry.  This is the way these foam earbud covers are supposed to be.  If the holes were larger, these foam earbud covers would fall off too easily.  Slowly and gently stretch the hole to make it larger, then slowly and gently fit it over the earbud by stretching it on.Common Problem Number 2:  Specks of dust are on the foam.SOLUTION:  Use a weakened-stick tape to get them off.Common Problem Number 3:  The foam disintegrates into dust after several months of storage in a sealed, airtight plastic bag.SOLUTION:  You'll need to buy more if the foam disintegrates into dust.  The cause could be a chemical reaction with the air that only happens if there is no ventilation.  The chemicals from the human skin are not the cause.Please keep in mind:  Scientific studies say that people who use cell phones for more than ten years will double to quadruple their risk of developing brain cancer on the side of their head that they always use their cell phone.  Even the side of their head that is always farthest from their cell phone will have a 20% to 50% higher risk of developing brain cancer compared to people who never use cell phones.  People who use an earbud and always keep their cell phone at least 12 inches away from their brain will not have a higher risk of developing brain cancer compared to people who never use cell phones.

This product contains only 666mg of glucomannan soluble fiber per capsule, not 2,000mg per capsule as some of us might be misled by Pure Naturals into expecting.  However, the quality of the glucomannan contained in each capsule is excellent.Other ingredients:  cellulose, silicon dioxide, vegetable stearate.It's unfortunate that when glucomannan is purchased in capsule form, it must contain these fillers.  When glucomannan is purchased as a food (shirataki noodles or konnyaku blocks), it does not contain these fillers and tastes much better.  Psyllium husk capsules don't contain any fillers.Of the 2 extremely healthy types of soluble fiber, namely, psyllium and glucomannan, which is healthier for us to swallow?Psyllium capsules are slightly safer to swallow than glucomannan capsules because psyllium capsules are less likely to solidify into an obstruction somewhere in our digestive tract.Psyllium is also slightly better than glucomannan for treating constipation because mucilage soluble fiber (psyllium) has a lower viscosity (is thinner) than glucomannan soluble fiber and therefore can melt away those hardened stools faster.However, for losing weight, glucomannan is slightly better than psyllium becuase glucomannan can be made into a very filling, delicious noodle dish which will quench our appetite.Also, glucomannan capsules are slightly better than psyllium capsules for weight loss because glucomannan soluble fiber has a higher viscosity (is thicker) than mucilage soluble fiber (psyllium) and therefore glucomannan is less likely to cause diarrhea than psyllium.  Diarrhea always washes away the weight loss-causing good bacteria and strengthens the weight gain-causing, cancer-causing bad bacteria.Although glucomannan capsules can cause intestinal blockages if swallowed with insufficient water, there is absolutely zero risk of intestinal obstructions if glucomannan soluble fiber is consumed the way the Japanese in Japan consume it every day, namely, as shirataki noodles (zero calories), konnyaku blocks (zero calories), or sukiyaki (extremely delicious).The big picture is that both psyllium and glucomannan will prevent constipation, heart disease, cancer, obesity, and a dozen other killer diseases.Both psyllium and glucomannan will feed the good bacteria and dramatically increase their numbers.Both psyllium and glucomannan will partly block the absorption of calories from fats and sugars because they are both forms of soluble fiber.[Also, foods that are high in phytate such as wheat bran, ground flaxseeds, chia seeds, fenugreek seeds, natto, edamame, green peas, green beans, and almonds will partly block the absorption of calories from starch and protein.  Phytate will also slightly reduce the severity of flatulence.  Phytate will also partly block the absorption of toxic heavy metals including arsenic, lead, mercury, cadmium, and barium.  Phytate will also partly block the absorption of iron, which like copper, manganese, and aluminum, is a pro-oxidant which, if consumed in excess, will damage every cell in our bodies.  On the downside, phytate will partly block the absorption of zinc, which like selenium and iodine, is a beneficial antioxidant].

Biologists place both ginger and turmeric under Order Zingiberales, Family Zingiberaceae.  These 2 plants manufacture very similar phytochemicals.  The scientific studies involving turmeric (Curcuma longa) outnumber the scientific studies involving ginger (Zingiber officinale) by better than tenfold.  The purported medicinal uses of turmeric greatly outnumber the purported medicinal uses of ginger.  The supermarkets only sell ginger because ginger roots are somewhat more delicious and somewhat more attractive than turmeric roots.Ginger works much better than turmeric for reducing the severity of flatulence.Try this test:  Eat a certain large quantity of legumes such as whole soybeans, whole green peas, whole chickpeas (garbanzo beans), whole black beans, whole navy beans, whole kidney beans, whole pinto beans, whole lima beans, whole great northern beans, whole lentils, or any other whole starchy legume.  Measure the amount of flatulence caused when ginger was not consumed together with the beans.  Then retry the same experiment with plenty of ginger, say, at least 10 capsules.  The severity of flatulence should be substantially less when lots of ginger was added to the beans.Turmeric works slightly better than ginger for (1)preventing and treating metabolic syndrome (causing weight loss, preventing and treating diabetes and insulin resistance, improving cholesterol and triglyceride numbers, lowering high blood pressure, and reducing markers of inflammation),(2)protecting the inner lining of the entire human digestive tract from free radicals, and (3)partly blocking the formation of cancer-causing nitrosamines in the human mouth, throat, esophagus, and stomach.  Turmeric has been shown to be effective at partly blocking nitrosation - the formation of reactive nitrogen species (RNS) such as nitrosamines.Turmeric capsules are easier to chew in our mouth than ginger capsules.  In fact, many brands of turmeric capsules are moderately delicious.  All turmeric products come from India.  This product, Nature's Way Ginger Root, is of such high quality that if chewed in our mouth, the sting from the beneficial phytochemicals in the ginger may be too potent for most people to tolerate and may cause most of us to cough.It's perfectly OK to swallow both ginger capsules and turmeric capsules at the same time.  In humans, turmeric is absorbed very poorly so it's unlikely that turmeric can protect where our blood goes.  Experiments with animals, however, show turmeric being absorbed very well and delivering spectacular health benefits.DISADVANTAGE OF GINGER:  Ginger is always higher in the cancer-causing mycotoxin, ochratoxin A, than any other plant.  Strangely enough, eating Equal (aspartame) at the same time as eating ginger will almost completely block the cancer-causing effect of ochratoxin A in ginger and coffee.  People trying to lose weight and people trying to reduce flatulence should add 2 packets of Equal (aspartame) to their "ginger tea," which can be made by pouring boiling hot water over 2 capsules of ginger to make 1 pint (2 cups) of ginger tea.  Splenda (sucralose) is completely harmless but will not block ochratoxin A.  Equal (aspartame) will block ochratoxin A extremely well but will not block any other mycotoxin.Other mycotoxins that have greatly harmed humans include:aflatoxins, fumonisins, other ochratoxins, zearalenone, patulin, citrinin, viomellein, sterigmatocystin, A. fumigatus gliotoxin, cyclochlorotine, luteoskyrin and rugulosin, P. jirovecii, C. immitis and C. posadasii, B. dermatitidis, C. gattii VGIIc, phomopsins, tremorgens (penitrems and roquefortines), ergot alkaloids (clavines, ergopeptines, and lysergic acid amides), type A trichothecenes (T-2 toxin, HT-2 toxin, Stachybotrys satratoxins, and diacetoxyscirpenol), and type B trichothecenes (nivalenol, deoxynivalenol, 3-acetyldeoxynivalenol, and 15-acetyldeoxynivalenol).Many other mycotoxins, including slaframine, moniliformin, sporidesmin [facial eczema], and Neotyphodium fungal endosymbiont toxins, will only afflict plant-eating farm animals.

For both dried shiitake mushrooms and dried chanterelle mushrooms:Shiitakes and chanterelles never have white worms, which are a major problem with porcini mushrooms.Shiitakes and chanterelles never have horse manure, which is a major problem with white button mushrooms.For dried shiitake mushrooms:Shiitakes are the most delicious of all mushrooms.  Many people have described shiitakes as having a "rich, earthy" taste.Shiitakes have extremely strong health benefits, especially in the area of cancer prevention in humans.Shiitakes are one of the best-selling mushrooms.Shiitakes are one of the most economical mushrooms:The lowest grade (standard grade) of dried shiitakes costs about $50 for 5 pounds, or $10 per pound.[For comparison, maitakes, the other delicious-tasting medicinal mushroom with a Japanese name, costs about $20 per pound.Therefore, the only dried mushrooms that are priced cheaper than dried shiitakes are the extremely horrible-tasting woodear black fungus mushrooms from China, which costs only $7 per pound].For dried chanterelle mushrooms:Chanterelles are moderately delicious but not quite as delicious as shiitakes.Unlike porcini mushrooms, which taste like beef gravy, chanterelles have been described as having a mildly peppery taste and a fruity smell like apricots.This dried chanterelle product does indeed have a fruity smell before rehydration but after rehydration, the peppery taste is completely missing.Like all other mushrooms, chanterelles taste substantially more delicious after rehydration than before rehydration.  However, if mushrooms had to be eaten without rehydration, then chanterelles would be the best choice of all mushrooms for that purpose.Like all edible mushrooms, chanterelles offer substantial health benefits.Chanterelles are not one of the best-selling mushrooms.  Very few dealers sell chanterelles at Amazon.Chanterelles are much more expensive than shiitakes:Dried chanterelles can be purchased for about $50 per pound.[I purchased 1 ounce of this product for $4.57 plus shipping from Amazon.  Although they lacked the mildly peppery taste which is very common with chanterelles, there was nothing wrong with the quality of the chanterelles that I received].Conclusion:Chanterelles are an excellent choice for wealthy people who want to experience eating a wide variety of mushrooms, all of which have different, extremely beneficial mycochemicals.However, shiitakes are a much better choice for the vast majority of people because of their low cost, extremely delicious taste, and powerful health benefits.

Disadvantages of eating prunes:(1)Prunes and other dried fruits, if eaten in excess, will cause flatulence.(2)Prunes are extremely high in fructose and other sugars.  Scientific studies say that consuming too much fructose will increase our risk developing diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, non-alcoholic liver disease, hypertriglyceridemia, and all cancers but especially pancreatic cancer.(3)Prunes are extremely high in calories.(4)Prunes are higher in pesticide residues than most other fruits and vegetables.(5)Prunes contain substantial quantities of the neurotoxin, acrylamide, which forms in all dried fruits (especially in prunes and in pears) during the drying process with hot air.(6)Prunes contain substantial quantities of the cancer-causing growth hormone, IGF-1.Advantages of eating prunes:(1)According to scientific studies, prunes will slightly increase bone density and slightly increase muscle mass in humans.  The growth hormone, IGF-1, may very likely be the cause.(2)Prunes will prevent and treat constipation very effectively because prunes contain several phytochemicals that exert a laxative effect.  These beneficial phytochemicals include soluble fiber, sorbitol (a sugar alcohol), and.......................................................(3)Prunes are extremely delicious.(4)Prunes never contain cancer-causing nitrosamines, which are frequently a problem with dried meats, dried fish, dried spices, and dried vegetables.(5)Prunes almost never contain cancer-causing mycotoxins (such as aflatoxin B1, fuminosin B1, ochratoxin A, zearalenone, tremorgens, patulin, ergot, and others), which are frequently a problem with dried whole grains, various seeds, peanuts, pistachios, Brazil nuts, and to a lesser degree, all other nuts.(6)Prunes are rich in the purple-colored antioxidants called, anthocyanins, which give prunes a relatively high ORAC antioxidant score.(7)Despite being high in sugars and calories, prunes will cause substantially less weight gain than the calories that they contain would predict.  The reasons:  (1)Soluble fiber partly blocks the absorption of calories from sugars and fats, (2)Insoluble fiber increases stool size and speeds up bowel transit time, (3)Phytate partly blocks the absorption of calories from starch and protein, (4)Polyphenols (mostly neochlorogenic acids, chlorogenic acids, and anthocyanins) protect the weight loss-causing good bacteria from the free radicals manufactured by the weight gain-causing bad bacteria, (5)Psychological:  I've eaten way too many calories already so I can't eat anything else today.I gave this product 5 stars because these prunes were of high quality.

Immediately above the rootlike structures of wakame that cling to the ocean bottom, mekabu is just the thickened trunk area of wakame.  Mekabu is frequently sold in the fresh seafood department of supermarkets as "ocean salad" or "seaweed salad," which contains a substantial amount of added vegetable oil, salt, and sometimes, red pepper flakes and/or sesame seeds.  The price of mekabu has gone up in recent years because of the publicity over the marine polysaccharide, fucoidan, which is substantially more plentiful in mekabu than regular wakame.  The big picture is that both mekabu and wakame offer us the same, enormous health benefits from containing large amounts of the marine polysaccharide, fucoidan, the marine carotenoid, fucoxanthin, the marine fiber, alginate, and the marine long-chain omega-3 fatty acid, eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA).This product is not the thick, cordlike mekabu found in "ocean salad" or "seafood salad" but stringlike and therefore very similar to hijiki.  However, hijiki is always black in color while this product is clear green in color as mekabu should be.  Judging by the taste, about 85% to 90% of the salt was washed away from this product before it was dried.  Most people will choose not to throw away the healthful soup created when this product is rehydrated because it isn't that salty and because they know that it contains lots of fucoidan.The biggest noticeable difference when rehydrating dried mekabu versus rehydrating dried wakame is that the wastewater soup resulting from the rehydration of dried mekabu is much, much more mucous than the wasrewater soup resulting from the rehydration of dried wakame.  This mucous substance in all "brown" seaweeds is especially rich in fucoidan.  Also, the wakame wastewater soup will be much too salty for health-conscious people to drink while the mekabu wastewater, which is much more mucous, will not be too salty to drink.I would have given this product 5 stars if the price was more competitive compared to other seaweed products offered by Amazon.Product of South Korea.

Both products would receive 5 stars from me if they did not come from polluted waters.The Chinese appear to be losing their battle against industrial pollution.  Chinese coastal waters have become much more polluted than, say, the beautiful waters of the South Pacific.  Seaweeds tend to soak up the toxic heavy metals and PCBs much more severely than fish or shellfish.Both products are extremely delicious to eat.It's shocking to me that so many biologists from meat-loving cultures describe wakame as "an invasive species."For example, the California government has invested huge sums of money to eradicate wakame from California's coastal waters.According to Wikipedia, "The sea plant [wakame] has been found in several harbors in southern California. In May 2009, it was discovered in San Francisco Bay and aggressive efforts are underway to remove it before it spreads.[16][17][18]"Also according to Wikipedia, "In New Zealand, wakame is declared as an unwanted organism. It was first discovered in Wellington Harbor in 1987 and probably arrived accidentally in the late 1980s via shipping from Asia contained in ballast water.  Wakame is now found around much of southeastern New Zealand, and as far north as Auckland. It spreads in two ways: naturally, through the millions of microscopic spores released by each fertile organism, and through attachment to vessel hulls and marine farming equipment. It is a highly successful and fertile species, which makes it a serious invader. However, its impacts are not well understood and are likely to vary, depending on the location.  Even though it is an invasive species, in 2012, the [New Zealand] government allowed for the farming of wakame in Wellington, Marlborough, and Banks Peninsula.[15]"This product, Wel-Pac Fueru Wakame 2oz, sells for $6.29 (with FREE Super Saver Shipping).That's $3.15 per ounce of dried wakame.The other product, Emerald Cove Silver Grade Pacific Wakame, sells for $29.75 (if we Subscribe & Save at Amazon).That's $0.85 per ounce of dried wakame.This product, Wel-Pac Fueru Wakame 2oz, comes with plenty of ocean salt.The other product, Emerald Cove Silver Grade Pacific Wakame, also comes with plenty of ocean salt but, judging with my taste buds, contains slightly less salt than the Wel-Pac Fueru Wakame 2oz.By contrast, nori (laver) always comes with all of the ocean salt washed away (completely removed) and if nori contains any salt, it was added by the manufacturer just before packaging the nori for sale.Caution:  Salt always contains cancer-causing nitrosamines.  Therefore, soak the dried wakame in water for at least 5 minutes to wash away 99% of the salt.  It's a good idea to do this at least twice before eating the wakame.  Unfortunately, most people can't resist the temptation to eat seaweeds deliciously - with plenty of the salt still remaining.Both products are rich sources of (1)the marine carotenoid, fucoxanthin, (2)the marine polysaccharide, fucoidan, (3)the marine fiber, alginate, and (4)the marine long-chain omega-3 fatty acid, eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA).  Scientific studies say that all 4 of these marine phyconutrients cause weight loss in humans and that all 4 of these marine phyconutrients prevent cancer in humans.Wakame and other "brown" seaweeds might contain many other beneficial phyconutrients in addition to these "big 4" (most highly praised) phyconutrients.Wakame is very beneficial to fish and other marine life.  After eating wakame, fish convert the eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA) into docosapentaenoic acid (DPA) and docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) inside their bodies.Because phytate binds to toxic heavy metals (such as arsenic, lead, mercury, cadmium, and barium) and therefore partly blocks their absorption into our bodies, it might be a good idea to eat foods that are extremely rich in phytate (such as wheat bran, green peas, natto, edamame, TVP, fenugreek seeds, chia seeds, ground flaxseeds, or almonds) together with salt-free wakame in order to optimize the enormous health benefits.  Also, although they only contain a moderate amount of phytate, raw cruciferous vegetables (such as cabbage, Chinese cabbages, broccoli, broccoli sprouts, cauliflower, kale, Brussels sprouts, collard greens, watercress, mustard greens, red radishes, radish sprouts, or giant white turnips) will greatly increase the human liver's ability to detoxify our bodies of bad chemicals.

Scientific studies have shown that wheat bran has greater health benefits than oat bran, corn bran, and all other brans except rice bran, which contains the healthiest combination of phytonutrients.  However, because rice bran always contains a small amount of arsenic, most people prefer to eat wheat bran regularly instead of rice bran.As for wheat germ versus wheat bran, they are both extremely healthy for us to eat but overall, wheat bran is substantially healthier for us to eat than wheat germ.  However, wheat germ is substantially more delicious than wheat bran.  Also, 1 ounce of wheat germ is richer in minerals and phytosterols than 1 ounce of wheat bran.  However, 100 calories of wheat bran contains just as much if not more minerals and phytosterols as 100 calories of wheat germ.Eating wheat bran regularly will substantially lower our risk of developing all cancers, heart disease, and a dozen other killer diseases.  Wheat bran is definitely superior to wheat germ for people who want to lose weight because (1)wheat bran is much, much lower in calories than wheat germ, which is very high in fat, and (2)wheat bran provides more food for the weight loss-causing good bacteria in our intestines than wheat germ.Fiber constitutes 66.3% of the carbohydrates in wheat bran.  That's higher than almost any other commonly eaten food.  Insoluble fiber comprises about eleven-twelfths of the total fiber in wheat bran.  A very beneficial group of soluble fibers known as, fructooligosaccharides (FOS), constitutes the remaining one-twelfth.  Fiber constitutes about 35% to 60% of the carbohydrates in legumes, which are even more beneficial to our health than wheat bran.  However, all legumes tend to cause way too much flatulence because they contain way too much fermentable starches (such as raffinose) in addition to flatulence-reducing phytate.  Because wheat bran is high in flatulence-reducing phytate and low in flatulence-causing fermentable starches (such as raffinose), wheat bran tends to minimize flatulence in the vast majority of people.Bob's Red Mill does an excellent job of preserving the health benefits of wheat bran in this product by tampering with nature as little as possible.  However, because mycotoxin-producing fungi love to eat whole grains, seeds, and nuts, I strongly recommend that wheat bran be kept in an airtight container, preferably with a dessicant inside to keep the humidity as low as possible.  It's not necessary to do this before the clear, plastic bags that come with this product are cut open.

The only time clasp envelopes might be a better choice than these convenient self-adhesive manila envelopes might be for documents that somebody might very likely want to steal such as something being sent by Registered Mail with Return Receipt Service.
I thought I could use this to extend my ceiling fan pull chain but the beads of this chain are larger than normal beaded chain so the connector is the wrong size.

I have very low vision and this phone is easier for me to use than the standard issue phone from Safelink. I have speech on for both menu options and character input. Also invert colors and large fonts enabled. The speech feature is not like ios Voiceover. With Voiceover I can slide my finger around the screen then lift my finger when Voiceover lets me know I'm on what I want thereby activating the option. With this phone the voice speaks and launches or types what I touch so there is no way to first determine that you are on what you want before launching or typing. Still it is useful and as I learn the location of the items on the screen it will get easier to land on what I want on the first try. The voice speaks most things but not everything. Entering my wifi password for instance was difficult because first off no qwerty keyboard option was available so I had to enter the password with the phone-like keyboard where you quickly tap each key however many times necessary to get the desired letter typed.  And the voice is silent so no help there. I managed to accomplish it using a magnifier. I also need a magnifier to type a message. Even though speech reads the character I tap, it also types it so unless I've been lucky enough to land on the right character there is a lot of deleting and trying again. Still though I am happy to have this phone for ten bucks. I can't believe how easy it was to transfer my Safelink service over to this phone. Thanks to many helpful reviews I had my serial number at the ready when I called Safelink and choose the transfer to new phone option. Took only minutes and did not have to speak to a person. About 15 minutes after ending that call my old phone had no service so, as directed, I powered off my 306G then turned it back on. First attempt to make a call failed but then the phone seemed to reset itself and second attempt to make a call worked. Be sure to call Safelink using your old phone because the automated system gathers the data it needs from it. Amazing!

Oh my gosh this nut butter is so good!!  Perfect consistancy with no pool of oil on top requiring stirring. But yikes the cost!!  I wish it was more on par with almond butter as far as price. I get the taller jar of Barney Butter for around $9 and paid $16 for this short jar of walnut butter. I'm sure its worth it but keeps me from having it as a staple. Its only doable as an occasional treat or a gift. The jar and lid with foil seals is quite presentable as a gift.

I have two pairs of these Vivobarefoot Stealth in teal size 39. I typically wear 8.5 in athletic shoes and the 39 fit but only with thin socks. So in order to wear slightly thicker socks this winter I ordered this pair in raspberry size 40. They feel really good. I was surprised that they do not have removable insoles like my first two pairs have. Its not like the insoles are missing, the inside footbed is finished with smooth fabric printed with the brand, but there is nothing to take out. Doesn't matter to me - by ordering up a size I can put the insoles from the  Altra's that did not work for me because they are not flexible like the Stealth into the Stealth. Now I know we are supposed to be embracing the barefoot-ness of these shoes, and I am always barefoot in and around my home, but for long walks on concrete, and at my age, I need a little bit of cush. No support, just a tiny bit of softness. The zero-drop highly flexible Stealth is the shoe for me and my persnickity toes who much prefer to go shoeless.

I wanted something to hold stuff on the handle of my Playmarket Go Up Shopping Trolley. I did not want or need a full blown stroller organizer, just something for a phone and lighted magnifier while shopping. So I was happy to find this item. I had planned to put it on the handle of my cart, between where my hands rest. I was disappointed to find that the attaching strap is sewn to the cup holder at an angle so I had to put it on the tube that travels up and turns into the handle. The cup holder is not designed to go on a horizontol part, only on a part that is angled vertical.  Otherwise I am pleased with this item. As others have said, it must be installed over foam.. It has no non-slippage components of its own.
