I'm surprised that some reviewers felt that these shirts were too thick to wear as undershirts. To me a Hanes Beefy T is thick and compared to them these shirts are thin. The fabric is very soft too.

I normally wear size 8.5 in walking shoes but bought these in size 9 because of several reviews. The fit is good. The look of the shoe is that of a little kid's sneaker. I love little kid sneakers but its not all that cute in adult size 9. But who cares about looks if the shoe delivers comfort. I like how it feels on my 2 - 4 mile walks but they don't feel quite as good as Earth Glides. Unfortunately Earth doesn't offer the Glide anymore so I am glad to be able to buy this brand in no-leather styles.  Update - I had to give up on these shoes. My big toes were killing me and I finally figured out why. The Earth Glides and the other shoes I walk in, the Vivobarefoot Stealth, are extremely flexible. This Altra is too stiff for my feet. I loved the cushioning but I have way less discomfort in the Stealth which has zero cushioning than in the Altra. The Earth Glides were both flexible and cushioned so they were perfect. What I've done is buy a new pair of Stealths in a half size larger to allow room for the insole from these Altras. The insoles add enough cush to the Stealth to make them almost perfect.

I usually wear small in tops but ordered medium in this vest because of the reviews. I think maybe a small would have fit but the medium fits good enough. I bought it for casual wear over t-shirts this fall so that I can carry stuff without needing a purse. Its okay. I don't love it though. Because there are no pockets on the back all the weight of my stuff is on the front which causes the vest to hang unattractively forward. I've never owned a cargo vest so it didn't occur to me when I chose this one that that might happen. I'm pretty much flat chested so maybe this droop would not happen for bustier women. The fabric is woven like regular cloth and looks nice. There is a mesh liner for whatever reason. I would think maybe the texture of the mesh would prevent the vest from sliding forward but it doesn't. And the construction seems good.

I bought this item in my local supermarket to use occasionally in my Hamilton Beach Flex Brew. They are so short that two coffee measures of ground coffee, typically what is needed for a 12 oz mug of brewed coffee, fills the filter to the top edge. Not only is it tricky to fill the filter with zero tolerence for error but with the filter so full the brewing process invariably washes some of the ground coffee out of the filter and into the basket. Since easy clean up is the main reason I want to use paper filters this product fails to perform. If for any reason, small cup size, weaker brew preference, you use only one scoop-ful of coffee then these will probably work for you.
I put one of these on both sides of my Gomarket Go Up Shopping Trolley so that when I buy too much I can hang bags on the hooks. They are large and strong and look great. Love them.

I was thinking this was something to wrap around several cables or cords but actually it is for holding the opposite ends of two electric cords together. But its attractive and anything Velcro turns out to be handy so I am happy to have it and confident I will find a use for it eventually.

I am very small busted and many swim tops have way too much infrastructure than I want or need and too much space to fill. This top fits great.  The pads are thin and triangular fitting right to all three edges of each cup. But they are not cups really, they are only slightly rounded. The bottom edge of each is about 6" and the other two edges are about 7". The pads can be removed through small slits in the lining but I left them in because they are not the kind that soak up water and stay soggy. Oddly I find that if I tie the strings in a double knot they come undone but if I tie in a bow they stay secure.  no annoying tag, the label is printed on the fabric .. I am 28" around below my boobs and 32" around boobs and ordered the small.

This starter kit is the same version that I bought at Target about a year ago. Except this one comes with four individually packaged wet cloths in addition to a pack of dry cloths and the mop itself. I like the contoured grip on the mop much better than the original model. I turn the brush roller off on my vac and go over my laminate and tile areas. Then I use a dry cloth on the Swiffer to finalize the laminate especially along the baseboards. Usually I mop tile with a big microfiber cloth and hot water. But sometimes I use a wet Swiffer on the tile.
This runner is so cute I can't wait to use it around Halloween. Its very well made and weighty so it lies flat and the ends drape nicely.

I think these bars are delicious and healthy. That said, I would not keep my pantry stocked with them. They are way too good to easily stop at one and considering their price tag and calorie content I would be busting my budget and the seat of my pants in no time. They are a very handy and easy to eat version of a handful of nuts. And because the bar is slightly chewy the eating of it takes longer than tossing same amount of nuts in your mouth. So they would be preferrable  for travel or any one-handed eating when too busy to sit activity.

Several times a week I walk two miles each way to my daughter's house to babysit my grandson. Often I need to take a cloth tote bag to transport things and often even if I go over without one I return home with one because my daughter has given me something good to eat for my dinner.  The problem with cloth totes is twofold - the shoulder straps don't stay together and one or both constantly slip off my shoulder as I walk. This ingenious item solves my problems. The straps stay together and on my shoulder. The straps on the tote I've been using this pad on are actually about 1.25" wide but because they are of soft fabric both fit into the pad by being folded. I have another tote with slightly stiffer straps that are 1.5" wide and amazingly I can get this pad around them and snapped. But I'm here on Amazon hoping to find the same pad in a wider size to use on that tote. Now, I have not yet hauled a heavy load using this pad. There is no cushioning so possibly with a heavy load this pad would not feel too good on a two mile walk. One last thing - there is as much gripping power inside this pad as there is on the outer underside. So not only does it hold good on your shoulder, the strap stays where you want it inside the pad.

Got this for my mother. She had a brown leather one years ago and wore it out. She has missed it ever since. I set out to find another brown one, synthetic and leather-like because I refuse to buy leather and a nylon one would not fit her persona. I was delighted to see this in faux brown leather so I bought it. Its pretty perfect. Had to adjust the strap to its shortest length and thankfully it fits well. Another inch longer and it would be too big. The strap has no loose part that hangs down which is wonderful. Its made like a purse with a silky fabric lining. Mom slides a pair of reading glasses (the slender style) into the outer pocket. In the main compartment she keeps a large adhesive bandage, keys, and debit card. There is room for a few more items but thats all she needs in a store. The only reason I didn't rate this fanny pack five stars is because there is no credit card slot. I feel that keeping cards and I'd separate and secure is important. The zipper for the main area faces up and is easy to use. Mom wears the pack on her front. The waist belt buckle is the kind where one piece slides into another and clicks. Then you have to pinch to release. It seems secure and not overly difficult to release. Unlike, say, my grandson's high chair seat belt buckle. Sometimes I get scared that I won't be able to get him out!!

The description of this cable is confusing. The item title says it is 6" but the details say its four feet. The one I received is 6" and thats fine because I already own a long one. I plugged the usb end into an Apple AC cube then plugged the other end into an iPad Mini with retina display. It worked perfectly, there were no dire warnings.  Its a nice looking little cable that has a fabric outer layer and beautifully finished ends.

Just got this today.  I unboxed and unfolded it and headed to my nearby shopping center on foot. It handled well, about like a $50 stroller. Same for the build quality, not cheap but not fabulous. I am 5' - 4" and with the handle in the middle position it feels comfortable. I did not kick the rear wheel axle but itt's close and if you have a long stride you may have to shorten it a little while pushing this cart. Unfold and fold-up is easy and I'm glad for that because I have to fold it for it to fit in my closet. I was worried about capacity so I bought stroller hooks from which I can hang bags and put one on each tube leading up to the handle. I did not need them today but sometimes I will. I easily put four plastic store bags in the cart today. Three were very full.  The cart handled well both empty and full. It is quiet except for a squeak in one of the wheels that annoyed me throughout the supermarket. I have since sprayed WD-40 on all the wheels and hope very much it eliminates the squeak. The insulated compartment on the front is almost the full height of the main bag. Today I used it to put smaller items in as I shopped so they didn't end up under heavier larger items in the main bag. Then after checkout I put the frozen items in the insulated compartment for the walk home. Having two separate sections was very nice. All descriptions that I've read online about this cart say there is a small zippered compartment on the back.  I have not been able to find it if it's there. I've emailed the seller, maybe I'm just not seeing it. My previous cart was designed to be pulled instead of pushed. I felt better today, pushing instead of pulling a cart through a store. I chose the orange (mandarin) color because I wanted something sporty and not looking like luggage. It does look just as I thought.  The big flap that covers both the main and insulated areas will flip to the back and hang down completely out of the way so you are not having to deal with it as you put in and remove things. When closed the flap has a buckle that clicks into the receiving piece that slides up and down on a strap attached to the front of the bag. So its really easy to snap together then slide to cinch.  Still though, if the bag is loaded rain can get in on the sides. I don't care if my groceries get wet but if I was toting something like wrapped gifts I'd put them in plastic bags then into the cart. It's very clever how the rear wheels pivot to where they almost touch the front wheels in case you need to pull rather than push.  Like if it were raining I could pull this cart and hold and umbrella. I would not be able to steer while pushing with one hand.  Or if the elevator is not working and I have to use the stairs. You tip the cart forward lifting the rear wheels off the ground, then the rear wheels can be pivoted towards the front wheels, set the cart back down on the rear wheels and go.  So for now, after one trial run, I am pleased with this cart. I will update this review if anything  more occurs to me or if something goes wrong. Sure hope that squeak isn't recurring and that the small compartment is there somewhere. Update - I've made a second excursion to the supermarket with my cart.  It was even better than my first because the wheel squeak is gone. Also this time I did use the hook I put on for a bag with a loaf of bread and big bag of cherries and it worked perfectly. The cart handled just as it does without the added weight dangling from the handle strut. Instead of using the insulated compartment for small items as I shopped I used it for frozen vegetables. I learned that it would be better to do this after the main bag was filled because the frozen items caved in the main bag making it a little difficult to put things down in there. The cart bag is not squared like the picture, its a soft bag, which is necessary for folding. So next time I will buy frozen foods last.  The only dissappointment so far is the missing small zippered pocket as mentioned in the description. It is not there. I like to have a lighted magnifier with me when I shop and was looking forward to having a handy place to stow it.  Another update - Inside a store and on other smooth surfaces I can easily maneuver this cart with one hand. It's only on the uneven terrain that is my route between home and shopping center that I need to use both hands to push and steer. I am loving the cart.
I love my Envy 110 and how easy it is to install these cartridges. I'm not a heavy user so the cartridges last a year at least.
I grind these and add to steamed veggies and salads. They have a good fresh flavor. Its my main source of omega 3.

What a relief!  These fit my AC air handler perfectly.  I don't drive and the supermarket I can walk to does not carry 12" x 24" filters so having a bunch stashed away feels very good.  the filter frame is stiff enough to allow easy insertion into the slot where it goes and without a millimeter of wiggle room.
I am a female adult. These are too large to fit into my ears therefore they leak.

Cute water pistol. My  2.5 year old grandson can not, of course, pull the trigger but he enjoyed being chased around his back yard by his armed grandmother today. Its also fun for target practice. The bright colors of this toy makes it easy to find in the grass. The fill hole is larger than the ones I remember from water pistols of long ago.  Easier to fill.

I took this attractive and well made toy to my grandson's house and handed it over. He is 28 months old. He played with it for several minutes, using the switch on the front to access the three levels. At each level there is a variety of reactions from each key press so a child will not become bored quickly. I left it at my grandsons house and his Mom has told me that he has revisited the toy many times and it seems to hold his interest.  Today I tried to determine exactly what you get from each level but  All i can say is that each level is different and each key press results in multiple ways. My grandson has his own iPad Mini and uses it for games, videos, and Youtube clips of things he loves like ceiling fans, helicopters, surprise eggs, and he is 100% adept at using it. I say this because I feel that if he still finds this toy tablet interesting then Fisher Price has done a good job.  I like the choice of volume levels and the flashing lighted edges too.

I am 5' 4" and weigh 113 pounds. On top I am extremely small, not completely flat but I could easily find a bra that fits in the girls training bra department. All my shorts are 4 or 6 so I ordered the medium size in this suit. It fits me well. The waist comes up a little higher in the front than in the back but it still looks okay I think. I took the round pads out of the top because I don't care for soggy bra pads after swimming. Without the pads the bra dries quickly just like the rest of the suit. Its very hard to find an adult swim suit that fits me right up top. Usually there is more fabric and/or support infrastructure than I can use or fill. I'm not a mesh person but the bras on the styles that don't have mesh are not the same as what I have so probably would not fit me. I'm worried that maybe the fabric won't last long during a summer of frequent use in chlorinated pools so I'm going to buy a couple more. Its an amazing deal considering the price of the very few other waist high swim bottoms for sale. Also how strange that a waist high two piece swim suit is so difficult to find.  Meant to mention above that with this style (Black) the bra pads could be slid out through a slit. And the fabric is double so even with pads out there is no show through. There is a vertical stay on both sides that keep the top in place and in shape. The bottoms are double fabric too.

This is part one of my two part review. Right now my mouth is in perfect condition so I am unable to evaluate the healing effects of this rinse. It is very subtle and pleasant to taste and my teeth, gums, and tongue feel great after use. I'm writing this review now because as a tester I have a deadline for submitting my opinions. At the end of June I'm scheduled for dental work. Preparing two molars, farthest back and next one forward, for crowns. And I know from experience that my mouth will be ravaged and painful for at least a week afterwards.  I am going to be able to give an excellent evaluation of how well this product aids in easing oral discomfort  at that time. So I'll be back to complete this review.

I love nutritional yeast flakes and these are as good as any I've tried. And are a Subscribe and Save item!  I use it on steamed vegetables with olive oil, salt, pepper, and onion powder. I have tried to skip or use less oil but its not so delicious that way.
Keep this in the fridge and sip a dose every day. Taste is mild and pleasant and hopefully its doing me some good. I read it was good for skin taken orally.

When I first tried this floss I hated it because it was extremely difficult to stick the stiff end between the teeth of my temporary bridge. Then I got my permanent bridge and now the floss threads through easily. It must have been the design of the temporary or the material it was made of (the permanent bridge is made of much smoother stuff) or both that was my initial problem. Now if only I could buy it from my Walgreens or at least from Amazon instead of a seller in the UK. Nothing against the UK, just that it seems like a long way around and takes a long time.  I did see Super Floss in a Target but it was made with Glide floss and I do not like Glide.

I was certain, because these gloves are large, that I would have trouble keeping them on but I don't. They slide on easily and stay in place even though my hands and fingers are very thin (ring finger ring size is 3 on left and 4 on right) .  So thats good.  They are way more than a disposable and nearly as thick as Playtex dishwashing gloves. Having a big box full of them under the kitchen sink is a great convenience.

I take this and several other supplements in and effort to prolong my RP ravaged retinas. I am better off then some and worse off than others with RP so who knows if supplementation helps or not. This one does not cause any obvious I'll effects so thats good.

I have tried many vacuum cleaners and so far I like this one best. Its light but not so light it doesn't clean well. And as for noise it is noticeably less loud than my Eureka 166DX stick vac and 4700D upright, both of which are now headed to the Salvation Army store. Right off I was happy to find that not only is the electric cord for this vac nice and long, we get two roomy cleats spaced a decent distance apart for easy wrapping. Most of my previous vacs had undersized cleats and it was a challenge to fit all of the cord on. I am happy with the placement of all controls. There is no handle release lever to be sought with a foot.  Instead you simply place a foot gently on the base/brush roll housing and tilt the handle.  Removing and emptying the dirt cup was easy although I did have to reach in to pull out a wad of carpet fuzz that was trapped.  I didn't mind. I started on my carpet which is deep but very thick and dense. For this I did not have to open the air intake.  Then I proceeded on to ceramic tile and the strong suction immediately made itself known. I had to open the air intake to lessen the suction for both ceramic tile and for laminate.  This air intake adjuster is right under the handle and very easy to access and adjust. The handle, by the way, is large and comfortable.  Its the kind that abuts the lower palm of your hand so when pushing its not all up to your fingers.  In the past i have used vacs with swivel joints and have not liked how much effort was required to maintain control.  This one does swivel but there is enough resistance so that it doesn't cause a power struggle between me and it. So far I have not triggered the brush roll shut off but its only a matter of time before I go over something that causes a jam. The auto shutoff seems like an excellent idea to me. And maybe because of this feature I do not see any mention of belt replacement in the user guide. Fine by me.  As already mentioned in other reviews, if you want to easily see through the clear walled dirt cup have some Goo Gone handy. The large garish stick-on labels leave a sticky residue that is highly annoying if left there.  I've studied closely the diagrams in the PDF version of the user guide and the disconnecting and removal of the portable portion of the vac looks easy. But I am not feeling adventurous so I'm not attempting it. I do wish there was more instruction in the form of words instead of mostly just drawings. My vision is bad so deciphering what is being illustrated is often impossible. Written direction as reinforcement would be helpful. Finally, when I first used the vac I had not discovered the notch on the back side of the handle to hold the electric cord up.  The low dangling cord was a nuisance and I was delighted to finally see the notch. It holds the cord and is super easy  to get the cord out if you need just a foot more to reach that farthest corner. *** Update - More to love - That when I'm running the brush roller, the brush roller stops when I click the handle in upright position. And both small front and large back wheels have rubber tread. This makes for good traction and quiet rolling on hard floors. And the big hand hold - its for both removing and toting the dirt collector and for lifting the entire vac.  Its smooth, comfortable, and located where it is easy to grasp and where the weight of the vac is well distributed.

Well this one was a surprising success. My 27 month old grandson is decidedly not artistic, is not interested in crayons or finger painting.  This stacking toy is an artsy item in that the pieces go together to create pleasing visual designs.  I was sure he would not be interested in this toy but lo and behold he was!  He played at stacking the shapes for about 15 minutes then came back later for more!  I'm impressed?

My 27 month old grandson has a ton of toys. Cars, trains, balls, every imaginable electronic toy, animals, and robots but nothing replicating a human. I thought, since he drinks from sippy cups and is approaching potty training, that he might be interested in this very cute doll.  I showed him how she could drink from her cup and even put her on his little potty to wee wee.  He was mildly interested for about five minutes and no more.  But the doll is truly cute and her accessories are made well.  I'm sure my grandson's female playmates will appreciate this toy.

I see these single serve cereals in the grocery store and am tempted but can't justify paying a buck each. Here on Amazon they are about the same price, even though they come in bulk. So I was happy to have some to review.  Its great - just peel off the easy to remove lid and add milk. The cups are pretty full to begin with so after adding milk its tricky to eat at first so young kids might make a mess.  I like the original recipe best because its not very sweet.  The strawberry is sweet but natural tasting.  The strawberries are real and freeze dried.  If you like sweetened cereal but don't care for the all out blast of sugar you may enjoy this one. The strawberries bring a nice tang to the mix. Cost aside, and if your community recycles plastic, these are a very convenient way to have a bowl of tasty cereal.

I mean its not breathtakingly beutiful but the design is attractive. Its simple and given the choice of inexpensive simple or inexpensive flashy I'll take plain any day. I'm glad to have a pump bottle that, unlike the pump bottles that come filled from the store, this one is nice and wide all the way down so it does not tip over easily when not full and weighty. I mainly use liquid body wash but do like a bar of glycerin for my face so I put the soap dish on my shower caddy shelf. And the curtain rings that so many are bashing as cheap happen to be my favorite type. I had some like this years ago but last time I bought new rings I was disappointed that the store I was in did not have them. They are great!  Like a tallish letter C with the ends touching. You just slide the curtain in then flex the ring to snap it on the rod. When working at something where I have to reach up the faster and less complicated the better.  I am very pleased with this set. It is basic and functional, not elaborate and gift-y.

These diapers are wonderful. Today I put one on my 26 month old grandson who weighs 32 pounds and the diaper fit good. I am stoutly opposed to any and all tight garments on him and I was very happy with not only the fit but the stretchiness of the wide side panels. I felt all around the leg holes and they are snug but in no way tight or binding. The diapers look cool and stay nice and neat unlike his regular diapers that after an hour on him are sagging and all dilapidated.  Just to check out the side tape I used them when a dry diaper was needed and they work great.  We plan to put these on my grandson for a car trip next week. Not only will he not require changing (the trip is one and a half hour) but I think he will be more comfortable in these.

This is exactly what I wanted. I have very poor vision and trying to see who is at my door through a typical peephole is impossible. I was afraid, because of my sub standard vision, that this item would not help much but its actually quite awesome. The installation was easy except that the hole in my door for my old peephole was too small.  My largest drill bit is 1/4" which is not big enough but I was able to enlarge the hole by pressing it against the hole perimeter and sort of filing away the edges. My door has metal skins.  I did not bother enlarging the exterior skin, just the interior so that the barrel would go in. Then the lens went in from the exterior and into the barrel. Also I was unable to utilize the set screw because it has to go in from the bottom of the viewing screen and there is a doorbell housing on my door preventing use of a screwdriver from below.  Anyway I am very pleased with this gadget. Believe me, if I am able to see who is at my door anyone can. I should add that I am in a condo with outside corridors so there is good daylight during the day. An hey if someone knocks at night I'm not answering it no matter what I can or can not see on the screen,

I have the same cup and another color and it's great. Personally I like the grown-up colors. They are easy to assemble easy to clean and they do not leak. The only thing I can think of that could go wrong is that the silicon disc would end up in the disposal. It has not happened to me but it. Could easily happen.
Intelligent, meaningful, and hilarious.

I bought these to use in my Hamilton Beach Flex Brew because the Flex is unreliable when using K-cups.  Columbian is my fave so thats what I ordered.  With the Flex and K-cups my coffee was stronger than I like even with the maximum amount of water.  With these soft pods I have the reverse - I can use one pod and be content with a small six ounce cup of coffee or use two pods and have a ten ounce mug.  I am going with the mug.  Cost-wise by using two pods per serving I'm not saving by using soft pods instead of K-cups. But at least I'm putting less plastic in the trash and I'm not missing the hit or miss scenario of using K-cups in my Flex Brew at all.

I really like this rice and quinoa side dish.  Its sort of a convenience food but healthier than, say, boxed mac and cheese. The brown rice was parboiled prior to drying so that it cooks in the same time as the quinoa.  But at least its still in the whole grain catagory instead of the flour that macaroni is made from.  Plus theres no cheese and for me thats good because dairy causes my joint pain to flare.  All the seasonings are figured out and the flavor is wonderful.  I was thinking I'd cook it in my rice cooker until I saw the directions were for microwaving. Its great to have something in the pantry that requires little time or effort yet is still somewhat healthy.  I only wish it had less sodium.  Or none at all and I could add how much of my own sea salt as I wanted.  I cook this in a Corningware casserole with glass lid.  Put in the rice/quinoa and contents of seasoning packet with 1-3/4 cups of water.  Cover and nuke on high for seven minutes.  Stir and cook (again with lid on) at half power for 20 minutes. I add the olive oil after cooking.  I appreciate that Near East doesn't skew their nutrition stats by claiming more servings per box than there are.  They say two and thats realistic although to be honest I could eat the entire box if thats all I'm eating.  But i pair it with steamed broccoli.

I tried this supplement because I have joint pain, not in my knees but feet and left hip.  I took one daily for three weeks and experienced no reduction of joint pain.  I take other antioxidants and walk about 25 miles a week.  I stopped taking this product when I realized that the lingering headache I had began around the time I started taking it.  I stopped and it was 36 hours later that the headache went away.  This happened to me years ago when I tried blue green algae supplementation.  It too gave me a continuous nagging headache that cleared away after discontinuing the product.  I notice that this stuff is made from micro-algae.  Don't know if thats a coincidence or not.
I have no complaints about these cups.  They look cool, do not leak, are easy to put together, and my two year old grandson really likes them.

After reading other reviews while I waited for my bars to arrive I was pleasantly surprised, after trying my first one, to find that they are not sweet at all. I had one this morning as my breakfast and it did not negatively imppact my blood sugar levels like sweet versions of protein bars do.  No way would these bars tempt me to snack on them.  I like the ingredients list and love that they are vegan.  I just wish they had more protein.  But other than that they are great.

It does a good job of moisturizing and I love that it is fragrance free.  It isn't the type of lotion that absorbs completely and then is undetectable.  There is a little bit of residual film that stays on my skin.  But it isn't heavy or sticky like some.

I did not hate this vacuum as much as I thought I would when I first saw it. Mainly I wanted it to clean about 700 square feet of tile and laminate.  My method has beeen to go over the floor with an Eureka stick vac then go back over everything with a dry Swifter.  I was thinking since this vac has a hard floor attachment with a duster attached I could vac and dust at the same time.  And that was true, it did an admirable job on my hard floors.  It is not as loud as  my stick vac and the cord of this one is much longer than the stick vac cord so two plusses there.  By rotating the floor attachment I was able to place the intake edge (normally facing forward) up against the baseboards and so get the very edge of the floor clean.  So that was good.  In order to empty the dirt cup as designed I would have to remove the long extension tool that I attached the floor tool to.  It would be nice to be able to leave the extension installed since that is how I will be using the vac.  I suppose I could bring a small trash can to the vac and try to hold it under the dirt cup drop down door but will probably either remove the extension or the entire dirt cup.  Another negative is that the hot exhaust is blowing out near my arm, hand, and body.  Might feel nice on a cold day but not in sunny Florida.  When attached to the extention the  upholstery/stair tool gets no power to turn the brush roller.  I was thinking that was okay because I could do my small thin area rugs without the edges being lifted by a spinning roller.  And my one large braided rug isn't supposed to be cleaned with a vac with spinning brush roller.  But it did not work out because the pivoting upholstery/stair attachment will not stay straight during use.  The cord in reality can not be conveniently wrapped around the machine so storage is sloppy.  I am 61 and in excellent condition but still, at my age supporting the entire weight of a vacuum cleaner with one arm is uncomfortable.  I have some work gloves with grippy palms and fingers and next time i use this vac I'm going to wear the gloves.  I can see that a person could easily develop calloused hands if using this vac frequently.  One more thing - it of course does not stand up but it does stay in the position I lay it down in, it does not flop over to one side, so its not so bad to pick back up.  In conclusion, I don't hate it but I don't love it.  I think as a corded hand vac it would be very useful.

I like this toothpaste a lot.  The peppermint tastes natural and is subtle compared to other brands.  It does contain fluoride and that is a matter I struggle with.  One camp declares it poisnous and another claims its safe and good for teeth.  My brother in law believes it is poison and I was convinced for years that he is right.  I have had some molars crack in the last few years and can't help but wonder if using a fluoride toothpaste would have made a difference there.  The dentist who is repairing my molars obviously believes in fluoride because she includes fluoride application after cleanings.  But can simply brushing with it then rinsing actually help?  Who knows.  Anyway, I do like this toothpaste.

This oven, which by the way is model TO1216B (there is no TP1216B) was sent to me as a replacement for another oven I was dissatisfied with by the company that manufactures them. I've been using it for a few months and it works well.  I do not use it to make toast and so far have not baked anything from batter state.  I use it to cook frozen things like fries and vegetarian meat alternative items.  I will update my review when I try other things in it.  The control knobs are easy to grasp and turn and although I wish the markings were bigger I am able to see these with a lighted magnifier.  The oven this replaced had such tiny markings I could'nt read them even with magnifier.  But at least the glass door has not shattered.  I found reviews for this oven on other sites where its being sold and have not seen any complaints of breaking glass doors.  The reviews on the other sites are generally favorable.  The only frequent complaint is about baking cakes and such.

As you can imagine the head of this razor is larger than most in order to house six blades but I quickly got used to that.  It shaves very nicely and the handle feels comfortable to hold.  I was happy to discover that the razor came with a suction cup holder because I've been meaning to buy one but I've found that it will not stay attached to my tile wall.  I have a shower caddy that is stabilized by suction cups and they stay fast to the tile for weeks before coming loose so I don't think my tile is the problem.  Anyway, the razor itself is very effective.

Its very thick and makes way more lather with my scrubby glove than any other body wash I've used.  Also renders the floor of my tub, where I shower, very slippery so there's something in the formula that is different from others.  It smells nice, the cap is easy to flip up with wet hands, and my skin feels clean.  I don't see how a body wash, which cleans you and then is rinsed off, can possibly moisturize so I was not expecting it to.  And it doesn't, I still have to use lotion if I don't want to go out looking like a scaly reptile.

This is a very cute item and would be a nice gift because of the way it is folded and secured with ribbon.  As others have already mentioned, the fabric is lightweight.  But maybe thats an asset for a towel that a toddler wears suspended from her head and runs around the house in,

It works but mine would not stay put together so I had to wrap tape around it.  The pen comes apart in the middle to access the batteries and uses friction to stay back together.  Don't know why but no matter how forcefully I pushed the two ends together I would invariably find it had come apart when I went to retrieve it from my purse.  The sellers advice was to ask someone to help me.  Oh well the tape is working out.  I like that although I have very little vision I can change the batteries myself. But needing to be taped together renders it a three star item.

This works perfectly - water is actually at a rolling boil  in a eight ounce coffee mug within a few minutes.  I was heating tap water so that it reached boiling made me feel better about consuming city water.  I am very grateful to the reviewers who offered the heads up about not removing the heater from the water before unplugging.  Its such a simple device and how to use it is so obvious I may not have bothered to read the instructions.

My two year old grandson watches several programs via Amazon Prime and Blues Clues is one of them so I bought this notebook set for his Christmas gift.  I wasn't actually in attendance for the opening but got a video of it in an email.  It is the most adorable scene, his Mommy helps him open the box and he appears to be awestruck!!!  The set has been used a lot and two months later, although not as exciting as when it was brand new,  he will still now and then retrieve the box containing the set when Blues Clues is playing.  You get the notebook which has in it several laminated pages and several high quality paper pages.  Plus a set of large crayons and extra paper pages.  Its not easy to wipe crayon from the laminated pages and I keep meaning to bring a dry erase marker when I go to babysit to see if it would work better on those pages.  Can't turn the kid loose with a pen of course but often I'm the one drawing the clues.  I was 100% happy with this item and so is my grandson.

I have several over door hooks that I bought because they look good but this one is my favorite.  First off it looks good too because the part that the hooks are attached to and that goes up and over the door is clear so all that is really obvious are the hooks themselves.  And I love that the hooks have fat rubbery tips so things hung on them don't slide off.  Then there is the method of how it is kept in place - the springy part puts a little pressure on the door so the whole assembly is less likely to lift up when removing an item from a hook.  If your door has a very small space between it and the door frame at the top you will still have the problem of not being able to completely close the door but this one does have a thinner over-door part than my other ones which are of all metal construction.

Its a beautifully made toy.  I bought it for my two year old grandson and I think its not challenging enough for him.  That or he has so many electronic toys at home he isn't interested in simple activities like fitting shapes.  This would have been perfect for him a year ago.

Its a great little toy.  The one I received is well made, attractive, and the resistence between pegs and holes is perfect.  My two year old grandson isn't interested in it .  Don't know why, I think its pretty cool myself, but whatever the reason its not the toy's fault.

The best thing about this toy is that I can select a lower volume level for the sounds it plays.  So many of my grandson's toys are way too loud so I really appreciate a quieter option.  I like that each page is printed with a nursury rhyme and not all are of the over-used titles.  And that a matching song is played each time a page is turned,. But other than being bright flashing lights the buttons along the right side are kind of a joke.  Wit each press there is a short burst of sound, like "A-B-C !!" And that is it. Not very interesting or useful.

I have always used steel grid sink protectors because I like being able to set a hot pot on it and also because it serves as a drying rack when I've washed just a few items.  This silicone mat also allows me to put hot pots on it and it has indentions that support the bottom edge of washed plates etc so that they can lean against the sink side for air drying.  The small feet seem to raise the mat enough for some air circulation but not as much as a steel grid type.  This mat looks nicer than my metal one and I like the quiet cushioning effect.  I suppose it could be cleaned in the dishwasher since my silicone spatulas can.  The only important drawback about this mat, as compared to a rigid metal type, is that it, being flexible, will not provide an even and level surface in the sink.  This mat will conform to the slant of the sink floor.  All in all I am enjoying this mat and might be a permanent convert from metal to silicone.

This hair product did not work out for me.  I don't hate it but I don't love it.  I think it's a youthful look and I am not young.  My hair is short, thick, fine, dark brown, and beginning to gray.  I get the concept, I spent the first 44 years of my life on the east coast of south Florida  and am fond of the day at the beach look.  And this product does an excellent job of replicating it.  But at 61 the look doesn't fit.  And I much prefer to run my fingers through silky smooth hair than matte hair.

To all the brave users who complained about the rod not staying up, let me congratulate you for getting that far with it.  The instructions say to twist to unlock then twist to lock at the desired length.  I twist and it unlocks but no amount of force will cause the rod to extend.  I have another rod like this one - a royal pain to get in place but once up it has stayed.  After twisting to unlock the smaller diameter tube should slide within the larger diameter tube thus adjusting the length.  My tubes are unlocked, I can turn them, but with all my might can not slide  to lengthen.

9 grams of protein, 4 grams of fiber, no dairy or wheat.  And I like the list of ingredients, most are barely processed and very apparent and identifiable as I savor the bar. There are 12 grams of sugars and I don't know if that amount is considered high but the bar does not taste very sweet which is great. There is no chocolate coating, something I find preferrable.  I'm kind of over the chocolate covered bars. These have the flavors evenly distributed throughout the bar. I am very pleased with this product.

I'm not even trying to remove makeup and my skin is not very oily these days but I'm  disappointed in this cleanser. I hoped it would replace the premoistened facial clensing towlettes that I've been using but it won't. My face feels cleaner and better after swiping with a baby wipe than after using this product.  I went over my face twice, using two cotton balls and my skin felt like I had just used plain water. There is an odor too. Not that bad but not good (like witch hazel) either.

My hair is short, thick, fine, graying, and dry. It didn't used to be dry but is now that I'm in my 60's.  I have been using very thick conditioners, the kind that comes in a tube rather than a bottle. I did not think this conditioner, or any bottled conditioner, would be as good as the thick stuff. But  in fact I like my hair even better with this product.  My hair is smooth and silky.  There is an underlying unpleasant odor though. Not unlike the sulpher smell of perming solutions. I don't notice it after my hair (I always let it air dry) is fully dry. Another gripe is that the product is thick, possibly as thick as the kind in a tube, but its in a bottle and has to get out through a small hole. Not easy to accomplish. But still I like what it does to my hair.

I like everything about these wipes except that they are small. I am using them for myself and am glad I'm not having to clean up a poopy baby butt with them. They are soft, have no fragrance, come out of the package (soft packs with peel back closures) easily, and there is plenty of moisture throughout. I also use these on my face with no Ill effects.

TruSoft By STAINMASTER Luxurious Bath Rug, 17-By-24 Inch, Fresh Cream - It's a nice rug. The color is very light, almost white. I have owned thicker bathroom rugs but this one is soft and feels nice under bare feet. I prefer to stand on cotton when I'm wet from showering so I always lay a hand towel over the rug at first then hang up the towel once I'm dry. My bathroom is the hall bathroom so its used by visitors. For this reason I do not leave the rug down. I keep it draped over the tub side then put it down when I bathe. Not only does the rug stay clean looking but I don't have to wonder what has been tracked in on someone's shoes when I'm standing on it with my clean feet.

I put two of these up on a laminated plastic (Formica) cupboard door. I swabbed the surface with isopropal alcolhal before pressing the hooks in place. They don't have the unattached duel-backing tapes like Command  hooks. The tape (adhesive) is already affixed to the hook. You just have to peel away the backing and stick the hook where you want it. As others have mentioned, the tab for some day removing the hook is perfectly visible. The hooks I put up seem sturdy. I would say if you used these in a place where looks don't matter, and especially if applied to a white surface so that the white pull tab isn't so obvious, these could be a less expensive way to get hooks up. Less expensive than Command brand. I can't figure out what benefit the hinge feature offers. Other than making it easier to do the 30 second press in place maneuver by being able to swing the hook up so that my fingers could press evenly on the backplate, the ability to swing up and down seems useless.  Update - I have used all of the hooks now and they work perfectly.  And I finally figured out one good thing about the hinged hook.  It can be used from above like a cup hook.  Stick the back plate on the underside of a shelf and the hook part swings down.  A while ago I was looking for peel and stick cup hooks and could not find any.  So these would fit that description.

I like the cooling effects of the alcohal, the textured side of the cloth, the scent, and the silky powdery feel of my skin after use. But the long list of unrecognized elements sends up a red flag. Finally, I wish the cloths were bigger. If you were seriously sweaty, like if you walked to work on a hot day, you would probably have to use four of these to feel refreshed. One for each underarm, one for back of neck and shoulders, and one for chest.

The mittens are very cute and the string (which is removeable) is nice. I live in Florida but before you laugh let me say in my defense that it can get chilly in my area and I don't drive so have to walk everywhere. Today it was in the low 40's and windy. The mittens did not keep my hands warm because the wind goes through the fabric. My hands would have been colder without the mittens so they help but still my hands were not even close to warm. The keeper string was useful when I had to get out my hanky and blow my nose. I could free my hands and the mittens were right there ready to go back on. I would say if you don't have to be out for long stretches, like if you need only walk from your car to your office, etc., these will do. But if you're out there for a substantial amount of time, walking the dog or such then these will help but will not keep wind from your hands.

I used the included suction cup to hang this down low on a sliding glass door. It looks good. My 23 month old grandson for reasons unknown will not toss the balls onto the board. He throws them everywhere BUT at the board. Oh well, some day maybe.
Nice small top. It looks nice and sounds cool when spinning. My grandson is 23 months and still not able to get it going fast. He knows what to do but lacks the coordination to set it to spinning.

These sneakers are adorable. I can't remember what size fit my 23 month old grandson but I can say that when we put shoes on to go outside he has a very strong preference for these shoes. He has chubby feet and after seeing this brand recommended for his foot type on an online mothers forum I ordered him some. Now this is the go-to brand when he needs new shoes. His mommy has him out exploring their neighborhood nearly every day and after several months the shoes show no wear. They have been completely soaked from spigot play and dried right back to original form.

These fit my Eureka LightSpeed Upright Vacuum, Bagless, 4700D.  The vac had gotten more noisy so I thought a new belt would help. When I opened my vac the belt seemed fine. There were no noticible cuts or other damage. I almost changed my mind about replacing it but decided to go ahead. After removing the old belt I held it up next to a new belt and the old one was way longer, it had stretched out. Installed the new belt, a little challenging because it was hard to stretch it, and am happy to say it did help reduce the vac noise back down to original level.

I bought this to wedge under my floor chair, to tip it back against the side of my bed while watching movies. Its very comfortable to sit tilted back like that and I can rest my head on my bed top. I also have a bed wedge (InteVision Foam Wedge Bed Pillow (25" x 24" x 12") with High Quality, Removable Cover)) and it is made of a better foam than this small wedge. It works well in my situation but I think a heavy person could be disappointed with the lack of firmness when they rest their legs on it.

I use diaper pins to attach my keys to me when I go walking and have no pockets. And usually if what I'm wearing has pockets they are pathetically shallow so I will use a pin to help keep the pocket contents secured. For years my pins have been either plain steel or little pink ducks or other baby motif.  Now with these cool looking pins I feel like I am looking a little snazzier when accessorizing with diaper pins. The pins seem to be made sturdily.

I bought this broom for my 22 month old grandson. He likes to toss little fistfuls of dirt on to his patio and when he does I use a big broom to sweep the dirt back into the planter area. I thought he might enjoy doing the sweep-off himself so I chose this push broom.  He does push it around, sometimes upsidedown, but I don't see him seeking it out to use. But its a nice broom and he will probably use it mindfully eventually.

I bought this for my bathroom vanity but ended up getting a over-the-toilet etegere to store things on. So now I have this two-tier unit down in the cabinet where it is doing a pretty good job of storing supplies. The shelf was easy to assemble. It looks okay but not as attractive in real life as I expected it to.

I like everything about these. The oval shape of the spoon bowls, how they feel when I hold them, and that they are black with visible graphics. I've run them through the dishwasher with no issues. I did remove the spoons from the holder because I have never become accustomed to using a measuring spoon while it was attached to others. Also in some instances I like to leave a measuring spoon in a container of, say, soy milk powder so that it is already at hand when I need some.

Purchased 11/15; Used about 35 hours a week. I had to replace the battery in my mouse once (no bfd). Little to no delay in typing/mouse clicking. Works fabulously...when it works. For about the last three weeks, the little usb receptor thing isn't being recognized by my computer--I have to tap it and wait, tap it an wait, tap it and wait. Every morning. Every time the computer goes into standby. Sometimes for no reason at all. I tried re-installing the driver, but same results. Aye-Yey-Yey! It works great...when it works. I tried it on my work computer and my home computer just to be sure that it is the keyboard/mouse/usb. It is weird. It isn't annoying enough to purchase a replacement, but it is enough to make me write a bad review. I recommend forgoing this set-it is definitely on the cheaper side, but if you have to replace it every 5 months, it is a horrible value.Update: Well, it finally died. Microsoft support to replace the usb receiver is non-existent. To be clear, this was in my office, unmoved, for 5 months before it gave out. That is really unacceptable.

My husband has developed the strange ability to have weird kitchen gadgets follow him home from the store. Most of the time I can tell right away if something is going to be a dust collector or actually useful. This Progressive Onion Chopper was immediately dismissed as a general 'bad idea'--I mean, it looks like it is ready to fall apart, or get clogged, or completely un-cleanable. I could not have been more wrong. I first used this little guy to chop onions for some delicious delicious chili that i was making. It tore thru those onions and peppers so easily, so uniformly, it was amazing. It is really great to be pleasantly surprised. Clean up was a breeze because of this tiny included rake that gets into the squares. I highly recommend this tool, it is definitely worthwhile.04/21/2014 Update: Guess What? This thing is still awesome. Here are the top 5 things I have learned thus far:Carrots: Cut baby carrots in half & chop. If they are too big, you will need the strength of a marvel superhero to press the door down & complete the process. I've found it helps to yell "HULK SMASH!" whilst you are fighting an overly-pushy veggie.Lettuce: Don't be lazy & try to chop lettuce in here; It just turns to water & your taco will be less than pleased.Tomato: If you use cherry tomatoes, you can totally chop them in this, but be sure to grab a tarp & cover yourself. There were little seeds exploding everywhere. Some interesting places I found seeds: My Dress. My Upper Cabinet Doors. The Window. My Hair. It's cool though, because I've never been to a Gallagher show and I think that this is pretty much the jist of it.Onions: No more crying for you. Pop some sliced onions in this bad boy & your eyeliner will still be flawless. This convenience does have one downside--with the ease of cutting onions, you will be more inclined to include them in your cooking adventures & onions smell terrible after you have eaten them. Seriously, use with caution.Veggie Dogs: "Veggie Wah?" Yep- veggie dogs. Chop em up, throw them in a fry pan with some veg bacon,(don't judge me) mix them up with beans and you, my friend, are in for a treat. These fantastic little morsels are the best & you will be the life of the party--Biggie Smalls Style.Update: 01/12/2015-Amazing Vegetarian Chili:what you need:Like a Tablespoon of Olive Oil.Pack of Veggie Dogs- Chop them suckers up!Pack of Veggie Bacon-Chop them up too! go crazy! no one is safe.1 small onion- Sweep the Leg Johnny! CHHOOOOPPPPPP ITTTT!!!!!2 Cans of Beans: the weirder, the better. I usually go for like a big fat red bean & a speckled white bean. I am a legume fan. Pick whatever.1 big asscan of diced tomatoes- drainied. You could totally dice them yourself, but they are like super cheap.1 packet of Ranch powder1 packet of Taco PowderWhatever Spices/peppers you got lying around. Have some smoked paprika? throw that in. got any peppers? throw that in too. sky's the limit dude.Directions: Throw in all yr chopped up goodness into a pot with a little bit of olive oil & cook it until it's little crusty. Veggie dogs blow up like balloons sometimes. Then throw in everything else. cookl over low heat for 15 minutes to whenever. What now? Baby, you got a stew (chili) going.

these are super comfy, super cute and super affordable. Next time I try to purchase non-New Balance shoes, I want someone to bonk me in the head to try & knock some sense into me. These will help you run faster then Walt Flanagan's dog.

Maybe I'm spoiled my my paraban-sulfate chocked shampoos, but I hate hate HATED this shampoo. It was a weird consistancy, did not suds up at all, and it made my shower look like I had a visit from Dexter. I purchased at Sally's on sale & I was stuck with a vat of gross "shampoo" bleh! really turned me off to the whole Quantum brand.
Wait-This is a thing!?! Disclaimer-I have neither a cow nor a calf, but this device just seems mean spirited. Totally weird.

Like really good. The best part about the entire show is the cast-I initally looked for Jon Daly, because he is ridiculously funny on Kroll Show. You haven't watched Kroll Show? Go watch it now. I will wait. OK- funny, right? I know. So, JD is pretty funny in this show too, which is one of the reasons you should watch betas.Next, Charlie Saxton. I love Charlie Saxton. So good in Hung. Pretty good guest spots on Workaholics too.Wait...is that....Ed Begley? Awesome. It turns out he isnt a weird-hippy-strange bird that I thought he was. He is really good.The rest of them fit pretty well into the rest of the ensemble. Oh and there are also rando people that pop up (Im looking at you Jonesy)Re-reading this review, I have just realized I might watch too much tv. Luckily, this is on the computer, so it doesn't count, right?

So My Mom put me in charge of potato peeling for thanksgiving dinner & I was looking for a way to get it done as easily as possible. I considered the Rotato, but ultimately picked up this little gadget because it looked more sturdy & has a double duty purpose of potatoes & apples. Let me tell you- this thing peels apples like a champ. We did a test run on Wednesday with an apple & both of us were amazed at how fun & quick it was (we are easily amused, dont judge) But on Thanksgiving morning, we tried to peel potatoes & it was a miserable failure. The potatoes are way too bumpy for this to work. Too bad, but it totally rocks the party on apple peeling, so it is worth keeping.

I originally purchased this keyboard sticker set at Burlington. It is easy to apply & lasted for years. What I love about this pattern in particular is it is not super-hey-look-at-me-noticeable, but rather a "hey, whats on your keyboard?" type of response. The set has several different sizes of the same keys, so you are likely to have everything you need for full coverage. I never had a problem with them lifting up, or peeling off. When I left my last position I found that I missed the fancy keyboard, so I picked these up on amazon & was not disappointed. installation takes about 15 minutes and everyone that has noticed them thinks it is awesome--a really good way to meet people at the new job. :D I would be confident in purchasing other patterns from this brand based on my experience.

So I started a new position with a suuuuper awesome company with two downfalls: 1- I moved back into a [shudder] cubicle and 2-they move at a snail's pace to get new equipment. One thing that years in an office has caused is my impatience for talking into a handset, so I immediately ordered a headset from corporate. It was taking forever. (I did mention I am impatient) So, I began looking for cheap alternatives when I found this headset buddy. I was weary of the mixed reviews, so I went onto their website to verify this product was compatible with my desk phone. The chart listed my phone & I watched the video on how to install just to be sure. Side Note: The video is really REALLY unintentionally hilarious. Basically it is a plug & go product, but the really good looking dude that is demonstrating the 'installation' never breaks eye contact with the camera. It is sexy, funny & slightly creepy all at the same time, which is how i like my men.  Im pretty sure it hypnotized me, because I bought the product within 5 minutes. Got it two days later & I was super excited to use with my regular IPhone headphone. Nope- the female jack was too small. (2.5mm) Apparently there are different sized of headphone plugs. After some research, I learned that most headphones are 3.5mm which is way too fat for this adapter. The internets did say that some old headphones are 2.5mm, so I found an old XBOX360 headset. I tested it by talking a little smack on COD and took the Frankenstein headset into work the next day. I plugged it in, but alas-- a No Go--didn't even get a dial tone. What a bummer. Good news is return process was super easy. Good to go. Overall, this might work for you, or you might need a newer headset, but its kinda worthwhile to give it a try because you can just send it back if it doesn't work. Either way- go watch the video & let me know if you think it is as funny as I do. Also, this story has a happy ending- my wireless headset came in a couple of days later.

Case took 10 days to deliver, but was well worth the wait! So SO cute! Tiffany blue case fits my 4s like a glove, but comes out easily. I also appreciated the screen cover & adorable (but sorta unusable) button over. I really love this case & it is an awesome addition to my case wardrobe.

I hated my trash can. I hated my recycling bins even more. They sit in the front of my house and just looked horribly mismatched & ugly. Once, I tried to purchase a trash bin similar to this at Lowes (for almost double the price) but when we took it out to the car, it wouldnt fit in the back seat. Hubbs refused to tie it to the roof, so I had to immediately return them. I thought all was lost until I saw this for sale. I jumped at the chance to make my front stoop look more tidy & neat. This toooootally did the trick. They are large enough to hold the week's rubbish and easy enough to cart out to the sidewalk on trash day. No complaints thus far. They are both awesome. I picked up the Duro Decal Permanent Adhesive Vinyl Letters & Numbers: 3" Gothic White to put my address on the side too. Looks great-seriously.

I hated my trash can. I hated my recycling bins even more. They sit in the front of my house and just looked horribly mismatched & ugly. Once, I tried to purchase a trash bin similar to this at Lowes (for almost double the price) but when we took it out to the car, it wouldnt fit in the back seat. I hated my trash can. I hated my recycling bins even more. They sit in the front of my house and just looked horribly mismatched & ugly. Once, I tried to purchase a recycle bin/trash bin similar to this at Lowes (for almost double the price) but when we took it out to the car, it wouldnt fit in the back seat. I initally saw this shirt on Pinterest, and was like "Oh that is so cute!" After I pinned it, I totally forgot about it until I came across it for sale on Amazon. I had a gift card, so I decided that it was totally worth it to buy. Shipping was uber fast despite the fact that it isnt Prime (Ordered it on a Friday & got it the next Thursday) What is most impressive is the quality. It is so soft. Love that! I was sure that it would be a hit with everyone I know, so I showed my hubby right away. He surprisingly didnt think it was as rad as I thought it was. In fact, no one really thought it was as funny/cute as I thought it was. Whatever-I still love it & I give it an A+++. BTW, Im a chubster (size 16) and I ordered the Medium; fit well, but probably could have gotten away with the small.Update 8/6: I figured out why no one but me finds this shirt as funy as me. the "just kidding" part is too small & people dont automatically read it, so they assume that it is just a harvard law shirt. AH HA! I wore this to bed on a girls trip and my friends didnt even notice it said Just Kidding until the next morning over the continental breakfast. So it is funny! Yay! Disclaimer: when I put it on, we were a little tipsy.

I purchased these little gems to wear while I volunteer at Comic Con Philadelphia. I get to meet a ton of people, so I thought these would be cute conversation starters. Well, they will definitely serve their purpose, but I expected them to be bigger.The book is about the size of my hand, but each tattoo is about 2-2.5 inches each. Good enough.Update 6/25/2013: I totally wore one for Comic Con & no one noticed. It could be that I passed it off as real, or that It was totally obviously fake & lame. Im going to settle on somewhere in between. I also increased my rating from 3 to 4 stars. I really like the smaller tats, because the larger ones just seem to mess up during application. Im now sure there is a method to the madness.I say grab em up.

I will admit it-I have been hard on my coffee machines in the past. I've used tap water & ignored the signs of a descaling. So when I recieved this YouBrew 24 weeks ago for my birthday, I decided to change my ways & take extra special care of my little darling.Oh, it is a gorgeous machine. From the top to the bottom, it screams "Im really sexy" (I know a coffee machine cant be sexy, but believe me-this one is." I filled it with nothing but filtered water. I descaled every month. I cleaned out the hopper, and the grinder (not a fun job, btw) And what does all of this care get me?BROKE beginning of this month. Yep-it worked for a whopping 5 months. This is a new low in my coffee maker experiences. The water will no longer move from the tank thru the heating element.I contacted the company, but because Im ridiculously stupid & didnt register the machine when I received it, I have low hopes of replacement. If there is any customer service, I will update.Seriously--when I was growing up, we always had a machine that worked. Me & my sister would even run coffee thru twice without any breakdown. Where is the craftsmanship in today's machines?!? I just dont get it. Im stuck with french pressing for the time being. Ugh.

OK. So I recently found this awesome lip plumper made by Bite Cosmetics. It has cinnamon oil in it and I really like it...but I want to LOVE it. Im crafty-I can make it better! I scoured my local Vitamin Shoppe & GNC, but I couldn't find cinnamon oil anywhere. Luckily, good old Amazon came thru for me & the Cinnamon Bark Essential Oil came in record time. I was so excited when it came in, I popped the lid off straight away, and put some of the deliciously smelling essential oil directly on my lips. At first, I was disappointed--I mean I only felt a little tiny tingle--bummer.After a couple of seconds, I'd realized I should be a Bluth, because I'd made a huge mistake. Holy moley, did it burn. Like burnnnning burn. You're probably thinking "Oh, It must have been like eating hot wings or something". You would be wrong madam. It was like a tiny Satan was breakdancing on my lips. This must be what it's like if Krampus came & got you.I looked in the mirror thru my teary eyes to find it did in fact plump my lips, but with mascara running down my cheeks, the whole look was ruined. Luckily, the pain subsided after about 20 seconds, at which point I acknowledged I am truly an idiot.I still love this stuff. Im going to find some lip gloss base to dilute it for the perfect plumper. Five Stars!Update: 08/30/2013 I did add this to a lip gloss, and the homemade plumper is awesome.Update to the Update: 10/24/2013 My friend told me the smell of cinnamon subliminally attracts the male of the species. "hrm..." i thought "i totally have some cinnamon oil sitting on my jewelry stand." So I threw on the Young Guns soundtrack & Yes, I did--threw this all over my pulse points. Yes, it shockingly had the same reaction. Instead of the hubbs coming home to a delicious smelling wife, he walked in on me feverishly trying to tend to the bright red welt on my neck & wrists with a wet washcloth. I still think it worked, because dudes love funny chicks and the situation was nothing if not comical.

Last Summer, I finally found rain boots that fit my chunky calves. I loved them. They betrayed me and totally ripped at the heel seam. I thought all was lost, but I googled how to fix it & this product came up. I figured it was worth a shot & ordered the shoe goo. It fixed them right up & I haven't had any problems thus far. I also fixed a purse that was beginning to come apart. This stuff should be a staple in every closet.

I was looking into buying curlers to alleviate some of the time spent curling with a traditional curling iron. I have long(ish-about 18 inches) thinner hair, so the traditional multiple sized curlers wouldnt cut it for me. I would likely need to buy 2 sets & set the smaller curlers out to pasture. When I saw this set, I couldnt believe my eyes--all jumbo curlers, and cheaper than the regular set? Oh....wait...it has Twilight written on it. Oh no. Whatever, I dont have to follow R Pats & K Stew to enjoy curly hair, so I bought them and hoped no one would see the package delivered to my door. Luckily, it was in a brown box and I opened it in the privacy of my own bathroom. I do love these curlers with one exception: the clips. God almighty, these U shaped clips are completely useless. I went & purchased some traditional curler clips from Sally's (reason why I deducted 2 stars) & haven't looked back since. This really is a great set, but I strongly suggest using distilled water, or at the very least, filtered water. I can definitely see how the mechanism can get clogged with just regular tap.On a side note, Id also like to comment on the resiliency of the plastic. My bulldog got ahold of the water chamber & there was minimal damage. Way to go Pro Beauty!

Hands down, this is the best black polish I have ever used. You know when you get into one of those moods, and yr like "Im totally getting this [insert drug store name] black polish, and im totally gonna rock it" then you get it home & you put on the first coat (streaky) and the second coat (still streaky) and so on an so on, until you have a thick goopy mess on yr hands? Yeah, this polish doesnt do that. One Coat (maybe two in some spots) will get you done in no time. Maybe yr thinking to yrself "I would never NEVER wear just black polish-ew." Well guess what? you still need a black polish in yr arsenal to do adorable accents like stripes or chevrons or whatever, so you might as well get the best, right? Right.

I have had a Droid X for 2 years. Over the last 6 months, I have hated this little sucker. HATED! Battery would go from 100 to 0 in 20 minutes, the downloads would take forever & It began to develop dark spots on the screen. What a piece of junk, right? WRONG! it was the dumb battery! After my little robot took a crap at a fairly inopportune time, I decided I wanted out & called up my mobile provider and expressed my intentions on upgrading. Guess what? If I upgrade, I lose my unlimited data. I saw red. My options were as follows: Keep my crumby phone & just keep it plugged in, buy a new phone with no subsidy, or cancel and move to another provider & eat the cancellation fee. Grrrr. I decided to get a new phone (can't take away my unlimited suckers!) But while searching, I found this little package. I figured "what harm can it do?" Well, I am ELATED that I took the chance. After charging the new battery, I popped it into the bane of my existence, and *POOF* it was like a brand new phone! Fast. No more spots (later found out they were caused by a bloated old battery. Who knew a battery can get fat like that. too many tacos, i suppose) My battery lasts All day long w/o a charge. The best part?!? THERE IS ANOTHER ONE WAITING IN THE WINGS! If you are having a difficult time with your phone, I would definitely recommend getting this package. It is a life saver & renewed my relationship with my Droid X.

I bought this leash to match my 8 month old buldog's new harness. It definitely does the job it is intended for. I deducted a star because the clip sticks a little & Im not sure that it will hold up well. I will update after we use it a bit more. I love the fact that it is 3/8 of an inch, so it isnt too fat and weighs the pup/me down. Nice leash for a fraction of the price you would pay at a major pet store.

I have a 8 month old english bulldog weighing in at 38 lbs. She fit the medium with room to grow. All the buckles look like they will hold up well. The best part about this isnt in any of the descriptions though...along the chest strap, there is a tag that reads "SassyDogWear.Com" OMG. this was totally perfect for Savannah, because she is, in fact, a Sassypants. Icing on the cake. Overall, great harness and much cheaper than you will find at the major pet stores.One request to Sassy Dog Wear: can you make clips to accessorize the harness? ie flowers/ribbons/bows? I know this might not be a priority for some doggie parents, but I would absolutely love to add these to her collection. Oh & also, if you can make a Tiffany Blue harness, I will pay double (make it triple).

I was in love with TooFaced Lip Injection extreme for years; but then, they repackaged & revamped the product. Much to my disappointment, it just didnt pack a poweful punch afterwards. I tried to find a viable replacement (Soap & Glory, Dior, Stilla, A multitude of Drug Store Brands, etc)which had some good qualities, but not what I was looking for. Good things must come to those who wait, because let me tell you, my world was seriously rocked when I tried the Bite Beauty Cinnamon Plumping Lip Oil today.Here is why I love it & gave it 5 stars:1-Super cute packaging. I love the logo, Matte gray handle, and the tube shape. All a lovely touch & make me feel like it is a luxury item.2-Color. No, there isnt really a color transference onto your lips, but I love that it is pretty in the bottle.3-Smell-So cinnamony & delicious.4-Natural- it is 99.9% natural. Now, Im not one of those ladies that is constantly on the lookout for organic natural makeup, but this is just an added bonus.5-The dealbreaker: It works. It works like gangbusters. My Lips feel tingly & plum immediately after application. I love love love this product. It did wear off after I ate lunch, so reapplication is a non-negotiable.I love it. seriously-get it.PS-picked it up @Sephora for 22w/.15 off for Chic WeekUpdate 05/16/2013I thought I would share the review for the Cinnamon Bark Oil I recently procured because it ties into this (awesome) lip plumper:OK. So I recently found this awesome lip plumper made by Bite Cosmetics. It has cinnamon oil in it and I really REALLY like it...but I want to LOVE it. Im crafty-I can make it better! I scoured my local Vitamin Shoppe & GNC, but I couldn't find cinnamon oil anywhere. Luckily, good old Amazon came thru for me & the Cinnamon Bark Essential Oil came in record time. I was so excited when it came in, I popped the lid off straight away, and put some of the deliciously smelling essential oil directly on my lips. At first, I was disappointed--I mean I only felt a little tiny tingle--bummer.After a couple of seconds, I'd realized I should be a Bluth, because I'd made a huge mistake. Holy moly, did it burn. Like burnnnning burn. I looked in the mirror thru my teary eyes to find it did in fact plump my lips, but with mascara running down my cheeks, it ruined the whole look. Luckily, the pain subsided after about 20 seconds, at which point I acknowledged I am truly an idiot.I still love this stuff. Im going to find some lip gloss base to dilute it for the perfect plumper. Five Stars!

I love the whole 'stick it and forget it' aspect these types of nail products bring to the table, so I have a slightly unhealthy obsession with purchasing them whenever I see the product on sale. The Nail Bliss Bling Ombre Flair was no exception. I picked these up at a cool 1.99 at a local beauty supply store and they sat in my nail polish dungeon for a few months before I decided to use it. First and foremost-these are different from your regular-run-of-the-mill polish strips because they are not polish at all. Some ways this is way better & way worse.First, the good:They dont dry out. My application of patterned strips is to apply one (or two if im feeling particularly zany) as an accent nail. That means that I have to go to extraordinary lengths to preserve the remaining strips in the package, or else they will dry out faster than a puddle in the mojave . These do not have these problems, because they are actual adhesive on the back of plastic sheets. That is awesome.Studded Nails? Count me in. If you were going to try to replicate look with any other polish/product, it would be like a glitter? OMG, can you imagine trying to get the specs just so? No way. Cute, unique look-This isnt going to be on everyone's fingers.Now, the bad/slightly annoying:They are thick & you can peel them off unintentionally. Did I mention they are stickers? yeah, these are not going to last you longer than a couple of days before the edges start to peel up. No bigs in my opinion.Even with their short lifespan, I still recommend adding these into rotation.

I bought this to hook up my droix x to an existing ipod alarm clock in my bathroom. It works wonderfully-better than I could have imagined. Since it is in a humid environment, I will update to verify it can stand up to the test.One nice thing about the product was the packaging--it came with little plastic caps on the input stem things and in a nice box. Quality product, no doubt.

So good. Im a little at a loss for words, because I just finished The Redhead Revealed and there isnt a third book out yet. Im definitely going to get totally depressed now. Dare I say this book is totally life changing. Thank You Thank You THANK YOU ALICE CLAYTON!

I wasnt super interested in this film until the husband mentioned wanting to see it. I thought it was awesome. Great concept & exceptional acting on Joseph Gordon Levitt's part. I could take or leave Bruce Willis, but I havent enjoyed much of what he's done since the 5th Element (MULTIPASS). Thumbs Up.

I know it is weird to write a product review about a deodorant, but I feel like I must. I grabbed this on a whim in the drug store because I like dove products & needed something strong to hold up to my new-found gym membership. Here are some of the reasons I will never buy another brand ever again:-Smells fantastic.-Glides on like a dream.-Works better than any other deodorant I have ever used.-Lightened my armpits.Wait-"lightened my armpits"?!? yes, Im not sure it was supposed to, but after a month of using it, I caught a glimpse of my armpits in the mirror & honey--they looked goooood. Totally weird side effect, but awesome none the less.My only gripe was that the tube konked out after about a month & I was caught totally off guard. I had to use the husband's Degree & it was gross. So be sure to have a couple on hand just in case.

Got this as a part of my Kindle Lending Library. I like the series. The characters are likeable, the plot is fun to follow, and overall a fun series to follow. I find myself running thru them pretty quickly, and cant get enough. Luckily there are like 8 (or something like that) so you will have a lot to go thru. It is kinda like when you watch all of My Name is Earl on netflix Streaming, because: [1] It is there; [2] There are a lot of them' [3] They are pretty entertaining. My only qualm is that by book 3, some religious undertones are starting to peak thru, which is a serious no-no in my opinion. If I wanted to read a book that involved Christianity, I certainly wouldnt be looking in Paranormal Romance. I wouldnt pay for them, but I will rent from the library.

I find myself running thru them pretty quickly, and cant get enough. Luckily there are like 8 (or something like that) so you will have a lot to go thru. It is kinda like when you watch all of My Name is Earl on netflix Streaming, because: [1] It is there; [2] There are a lot of them' [3] They are pretty entertaining.
