So, I decided to read this book in a fairly unconventional way. I stumbled on this really awesome blog (One Good Book Deserves Another) and she really disliked this book, but loved the next book in the series. So, I decided to get this on the basis of  'how horrible can it be?' Well, to answer that question: Pretty effing horrible.The storyline is completely disjointed. It is transparent the (pretty terrible) 'love' scenes were written first and then a (really terrible) storyline was just added to attempt to create some sort of flow. The outcome is a really bad book, that really should be re-worked or never sold again. Im not sure that I feel comfortable getting the next in the series if the book is going to carry on the same flaws/writing style of the first. Bleh!*spoilers* (aka things that annoyed me)-So friggan trite to play the "oh, i dont think im pretty" angle. Give me a break.-I swear, if he called her kitten one more g-d'ing time i was going to lose it. Just. No.-Soooo....a dude stalks you, drags you to meet his family, marries you while yr under the influence, plugs you up....PLUGS YOU UUUUP all within the span of a couple days and yr...happy? really?!?-double dog dare you? grow up.

Wednesday:In all honesty, I am only 6% into this book...but Im completely, unabashedly, totally hooked. It made me laugh out loud twice already...on public transportation. It is really REALLY well written. OK, I might be slightly biased, as i am a curvy 33 year old redhead in the process of getting her groove back. I really hope this storyline doesnt go down the s'ter. Will update once fully read.Thursday:32% and I am utterly obsessed. I love everything about this book, it is a little unhealthy. I love the banter between the characters, and it reminds me of when I first met my husband. :D  I even started a spotify playlist based on Grace's musical taste (I really REALLY appreciate the music that is described in the book. Everytime a song is mentioned I pull it up & give it a listen) I am pretty sure Im a huge dork--and not a 'omg, im such a nerd, hehe' type of dork, but a true bonifide 'well that is awkward' type of dork. Im almost tempted to write the author and to thank her for writing the book. I will hold off on that.Friday:67% and reading every free moment I have. Might get fired for devoting so much time perfecting my pinboard featuring Christina Hendricks & Jensen Ackles. Worked out to the Prodigy last night--burned like a gazillion calories. Love this author. Tweeted the author, and she responded. She might be the coolest lady on the planet.Sunday:Finished book on Friday, but have been...ahem...busy. What a fantastic book. Couldnt wait to pick up the second, so ran to Starbucks to jack their wifi to download it before I even finished this book. Definitely an A+!

Last Summer, I finally found rain boots that fit my chunky calves. I loved them. They betrayed me and totally ripped at the heel seam. I thought all was lost, but I googled how to fix it & this product came up. I figured it was worth a shot & ordered the shoe goo. It fixed them right up & I haven't had any problems thus far. I also fixed a purse that was beginning to come apart. This stuff should be a staple in every closet.

This stuff is seriously good. You probably think, "Oh, it's just peanut butter" or "Meh, it's just a gimmick." Well, my friend, I am here to tell you this stuff effin rules. It is so delicious.  I primarily use it to turn whipped cream into peanut butter whipped cream, but I can see myself using this in other baking capacities, adding it to smoothies, snorting it like a Motley Crue member...well...maybe not that.  But really, it is good. You owe it to yourself to try it out. It is unlike anything you have ever had before.Update: 3/11/13. Soooo. I packed up some powder for the day with the intentions of mixing it with some flax seeds and boiling water for a mid-afternoon pick me up. Well, 2pm rolls around, and Im too engrossed in work to get up & fulfill my goal. Yes, I did stick my finger into the glad sandwich baggie that held my powdered peanut butter and try to eat it as it; Yes, it did get all over my black pants;  and YES it was a horrible idea. Now I look like I've been hanging out with Lindsey Lohan. Still tasted pretty good. (disclaimer, Im starving)

I have very light & clear Irish skin. Im 33, so I have to use some sort of a primer/bb cream to get that flawless look to compete with the natural glowing skin of the countless 20-somethings running around the streets of Philadelphia (enjoy it while it lasts Bs!!) I have tried several different higher end BB creams including Boscia (my absolute fave), Too Faced & Smashbox. All are VERY nice... but I'm not thrilled with the price at almost $40 a pop; After the very last drop out of my Boscia tube was squeezed out, I neglected to replace it, and instead decided to venture into uncharted territory-a drugstore! (gasp!). Well, I never really got around to it until one lazy Sunday afternoon when I was strolling around my local grocery store, I came upon the L'Oreal Youth Code BB Cream. I thought to myself "Hey, I need some youthfulness AND BB cream! This is totally cheap at 15 bucks--Im going to try this out. I'm so smart & frugal. Look out younger generation--I've got yr code now!!! YOLO!"(I sort of wish I had made up that last statement for the purposes of this review, but unfortunately, that is my actual thought process/what I possibly said out loud.)The next morning, in a sleepy haze I started to put on my daiy makeup. When I remembered I had the product, I fished it out of the grocery bag, ripped open the box, squeezed out a pea size amount & rubbed it into my face in an upwards motion. It applied easily enough & had a bit of slip to it (plus?), but overall it just kind of sat there and didn't really absorb into my pores. Eh, no bigs, I wasn't expecting the same quality as the products I've used in the past. I felt younger already-sort of like when you buy your first bottle of foundation and you look like a quasi-nutball until you find a shade that makes you look like you're not wearing nutella. Other than that, makeup went on fine, didn't really see a difference during the day either-kinda just felt a little thicker.Fast forward to the end of the week after wearing the BB Cream about 4x. This was when I truly found out what L'Oreal means by Youth Code...hint-It's pimples. Seriously, broke out on my chin, on my cheek, and just for laughs, the tip of my nose. Do you have any idea how ridiculous a pimple on the TIP OF YOUR NOSE looks? ugh.Needless to say, I immediately discontinued using & slam dunked it into the trashcan. Im half-convinced this product was secretly made by Proactive to get you to buy their stuff.BTW, isn't it totally ironic that I had to spend extra money on buying pimple cream/face wash because I didn't want to shell out the cash for a quality product in the first place? Goes to show you, just do it right the first time.  Not all is lost, I do feel a lot younger having to purchase Oxy products while fighting the strange urge to find some Electric Youth perfume & watch Weird Science.

Got this as a part of my Kindle Lending Library. I like the series. The characters are likeable, the plot is fun to follow, and overall a fun series to follow. I find myself running thru them pretty quickly, and cant get enough. Luckily there are like 8 (or something like that) so you will have a lot to go thru.

All of these colors were fan-tab-ulous! I am never ever dissapointed with the quality of China Glaze nail polish, and the colors in this collection are perfect for any fall wardrobe. There are only two weird things about the collection as a whole: #1 Do they represent Hunger Games? Um....not really. I never read the books, but I did watch the movie (surprisinly good, btw) and I did not see any coorelation. No bigs. #2 The collection was released at the beginning of 2012 summer--they are clearly fall colors. I picked them up anyway & kept them for later. Favorite polishes: Fast Track, Smoke & Ashes & Mahogony. Dress Me Up came a close second. HINT! these colors also go super well with the Safari Collection (released shortly after HG collection) So much so, in fact, that I have a sneaking suspicion that these were all apart of the same collection. Smooth Move China Glaze.

I purchased these exclusively for nail art, but now that they are here, there are so many uses for them, I dont even know where to start! I used the zig zag scissor to complete a chevron accent nail, and I could not be happier with the results. These are a must have accessory for any crafty lady (or dude)

OK, full disclosure: I have wide calves. This means I have a limited amount of options when it comes to adorable rain boots. When I found these on sale at a store that was going out of business, I was ELATED that they fit and looked great. It was the beginning of the summer 2012 when I bought them, so I only wore them about 2Xs, and maybe 6Xs in the Fall and 4xs this Winter. Well, I was just about to order some cute monogram decals from Etsy to add to them, when Whomp! the heel sole pulled away from the rest of the boot! NOOOOOOO! I can hardly believe that they broke after less than a season. I was bummed, but since they were so cute, I figured that I would come onto Amazon & pick up another pair, but I am flabergasted at the price! I want to say I picked them up for about twelve bucks, and that is really all they are worth in my eyes--Im totally debating if I should spend thirty. They are adorable though. If you do decide to get them, just be sure to handle them with kid gloves, and maybe you will get more use out of them. For now, Im going to try to glue them back together--it is a clean rip, so all hope might not be lost.Update 7/24: I used the shoe goo to fix them good as new! I also followed thru with the monogram & they are adorable! now that the price is down to under a Hamilton, I might have to get another pair.

I purchased this because Ive been supplementing my dog's diet with coconut oil & thought this might be a good way to change it up. The stuff smells horrible. Like horrible horrible. But the worst part was when my poor dog woke up with hives and a super swollen face. She had a terrible allergic reaction to the Salmon Oil which required an emergency trip to the vet. The poor pooch looked like Mike Tyson. She got a couple of shots and is now sleeping it off, but wow--I would never have guessed something so innocuous could have lead to such a reaction. Goes to show you-stick with what works.

Just got a 10 week old English Bulldog that has a crazy strong unrelenting bite. After she got ahold of my big toe, I decided it was time to put a stop to the behavior. I ran out and bought this on sale at my local pet store (on sale for a Lincoln)and sprayed it all over me-my arms my hands & most importantly, my toes. The pup got one taste of it and was completely turned off by it. No more biting. I also followed her around and deterred her from chewing other things like wires, the couch, the stairs, the credenza, the puppy gate, teh pillows, a blanket and an ottoman. She likes to chew, but she is still pretty awesome.On the other hand, my mom has three weiner dogs. One of them decided a corner of the wall tasted delicious, so she went out & bought bitter apple. The chewer was thoroughly deterred from chewing, but in a wacky twist of fate, another weiner dog loved the taste--he would sit and lick the walls like a tootsie pop. He is a weird dog though. Adorable, but a weirdo.

I have a 3 year old english/american bulldog mix that loves chewing on nylabones/dingos. I bought this product selfishly, because I like dinosaurs. Unfortunately, the littel nubs tore into her gums like nobody's business and left sharp shards sticking out. She only had it for a short time under (sort of laxed) supervison, but when i looked down the thing's entire tail was covered in blood. Into the trash it went. Moving forward, I will stick to the non-nubby nylabones.

ok, ok, that was the worst joke ever, but seriously, these types of nail products are fabulous to have in your repertoire. Why? Because you can totally add some pizzazz to your nails by adding one of these little babies as an accent nail. It is awesome. believe me. Re-reading this review, I know I sound like Blanche from Golden Girls, but whatever-it is a super fun product. Buy as many of em as you can afford.Update 01/29/2013: I decided to deduct a star from my original review because the boxes I have been opening are all dried out. There is no 'use by' date listed on them, but be careful to get a fresh pack, or else they are just crumbly & hard to work with. I still love them though.

Not like any horror movie I have ever seen, so kudos to the production/director. Definitely weird. Definitely worth watching. Only issue I had was trying not to sing 'Boats n' Hoes' in my head everytime the dad from Step Brothers was on stage. Also seems a little low budget for Thor, but hey, everyone's gotta eat sometime, right?

Nothing Special-I did have to clean it becasue it got musty smelling, but other than that, it is just yr run of the mill coffee maker. I long for the days of my K Cup sometimes, but whatever, this will do.Update: 11/29/2012The carafe broke last month. I have never had a carafe shatter, but I guess there is a first time for everything & I cant blame it on the shoddy craftsmanship of Hamilton Beach. It's no big loss though, because the tank was smelling a little off anyway. Since then, I have been using the single brewing side, but Im over it. It is pretty messy to clean the single side filter and the steam even smells. Clean it? oh-great idea-I do. All the time. And it takes forever clean. Spending an hour continuously running water after a vinegar bath thru the machine is no picnic. Ive got episodes of Duck Dynasty to watch. And even after the water is clear, it still tastes a little off within a couple of days. What do I mean by off? Sorta like a sponge that is past its prime. Lame.Getting this coffee maker was a pretty bad decision overall. The quality and width are really not suitable for me.  I only have about 14 inches on my counter for my coffee station, so this has been sitting wonky for the entire time. I suppose if you have a baller kitchen and have enough room it wouldnt be the worst machine for you, but it might look weird to have a cheap machine sitting next to yr viking range across from the subzero fridge. It would probably be better to have this outside of your home theater in that case.In closing,  I was spoiled from a series of Keurigs, and I should have just bought another expensive machine in the first place and not cheaped out on this one. Im getting the new Breville YouBrew, so if anyone is interested in this machine, it will be on the sidewalk shortly. If the YouBrew is bad, im just going to go back to french pressing. Or maybe get one of those fancy vacuum coffee makers--that would totally up my steampunk cred.

I hate gloppy, sticky, icky lip gloss (im looking at you mac lipglass) This product has none of those traits, so Im a happy camper. It doesnt really stay on all that long, but it is a gloss, so im not expecting it to. I read once that is a diet tip-put on lip gloss & yll not want to eat because you dont want to mess it up. Maybe that works on some girls, but not me-i just keep reapplying.

It really Urks me when Im looking for reviews to help me decide if I want to buy something and I see 3 reviews all posted posted on the same day by 'users' who have only one review under their belt. Who are you trying to kid? I was looking at buying this product from a groupon, but based on the unscrupulous business practices displayed here, i think i'll pass.

I found this pattern in my local dollar store, and I cannot tell you how pleased I am with the pattern. I initally purchased to cover a copy paper box that I keep in my office, but the roll keeps going and going! I have covered my light switch, an outlet switch, a pop tarts box and a cereal box, and guess what? i still have a bunch left over! If you are looking for an easy, inexpensive way to bring together small accessories, this is definitely the way to go. Even though I purchased my roll for a dollar, I would have gladly paid the asking price on amazon--it is that versitile.
I liked this book a lot. Easy to read & some new spins on the age old zombie story. If you liked Rise of the Governer, you will like this as well.

Hi There! I wanted to have a huge (5ftx3ft) "Keep Calm and Carry On" Logo for my office wall. What I did not want was the hundred dollar price tag that Etsy wanted for the Decal. So I ordered this contact paper, an xacto knife & printed out the image 1000%. It took some legwork, but I was able to easily cut it out of the contact paper & put it on the wall. Thus far, it has stuck very well & I get compliments on it daily.The contact paper is a bit thin, but with careful placement, you will not be sorry you purchased this.

This is the third Keurig that Ive bought. None of them had broken--i just kept upgrading. Ive had this Cusinart Keirig since October of 2010, so it has been about a year & a half until it started acting up. It is almost unusable at this point. It needs to be de-scaled every other day, I set the cup to 12 oz, and only 3-4 come out, and the grinds seem to get everywhere. If I do decide to replace this one, I will be only us distilled water, de-scale it every month, and generally pay better attention to the filter. It doesnt seem that the life of the machine should be less than 2 years.

I agree with the previous reviews in that this is kind of a slow moving volume in which nothing really happens. Best to wait for 16 & read them back to back. Luckily you can pick up Rise of the Governor that packs a punch. Thanks Kirkman for being awesome.

The sheets arent as soft as I would have hoped....but im also used to 500 count. I do think they are hot as all get out, and I love them to death. Also, the topsheet is only printed on one side, which is something to be expected, but still kind of annoying.

I got this as a surprise birthday gift from my husband. I love the look of the firkin (faux birkin) It seems sturdy, but Im sure not to overload it as I know the handles will show wear if I dont take care of it, as I know this by experience with other purses.My one and only complaint, and the reason for the one star deduction is this: Stinky. It has been unseasonably raining in Philly lately, and my bag has gotten wet (not soaked, but rained on) a couple of times, and it has gotten this funk about it. I took out all the contents of the bag & febreezed the bejesus out of the lining and wiped down the outside with some leather wipes. It is still stinky, so I sprayed some Stella Nude into it & put it into a oversized ziplock bag overnight. It is definitely less stinky, but not 100% gone. Weird, I know--but unavoidable unless you treat yr firkin like a quasi-gremlin and avoid getting it wet at all costs. (I havent given it food after midnight, so i dont know if that will affect it at all)Update 01/29/2013 I used this bag maybe 1x a month, and the other day I noticed the handles are ripping, the bottom leather has scuffed off and the lock has lost its luster. I am not overly tough on my bags, but I think this one just has mediocre quality. Not sure if it is worth the price at this point. oh, it is also still a smidge stinky.Update 04/18/2013: Guess what? Used some Shoe Goo to fix the handle! Good as new....well, the lock lost it's luster, but Sorta good as new.
Works great with the konad brand stamper & scraper. Make sure you use special polish or else you will have limited success with the plate
Easy to use & a must have for your konad system. Be sure to get the special polish- ive tried to stamp with other nail polish with mixed results, but nothing is as good as the special polish.

I got this because of the color (Tiffany Blue) which is the only thing good about this scarf. IMO, it isnt as soft as it appears, it got 2 runs in the fabric after one wear, and I was shopping @ acmoore and saw other pashminas (softer than this) there for a lincoln. Just goes to show you buy locally for better quality control.

lots of options, but the quality is just not there. But come on--did you really think that there would be quality pigment in such a low cost product? This is best used for the beginner, or a teenager. I still break mine out sometimes, but you should be prepared to layer it on thick to get any color transfer.
This is a great polish. It is super thick, is tough to dry out, and is a staple in your konad system.

Our home was built in 1960, and much to our dismay, one day, the copper pipe in the basement that carries all waste water out, started leaking along the bottom. Called the plumber, $700 later, he replaced half of the pipe. 6 months later, the next section started leaking. I bought this tape, being skeptical it would actually work. WOW. It WORKS. Wrapped the leaky part with tape and no leaks, and it's been over a week now. Yep, I'll get the plumber in to fix the whole thing, but so great to know this works terrifically as a DIY repair. EXCELLENT product.

This speaker has some weight to it so it's not good for back packing but it would be awesome for car camping and it's perfect for the patio.You have to charge it via an outlet with usb charger or with a computer unless you buy the solar charger that gets attached to the top of the unit.There are lights that show the amount of charge left. The unit makes a noise when it's turned on  and off.The speaker quality is fine for background music while eating outside. It might not be loud enough to help out for a super loud pool party.It looks really cool. Like the Subaru of speakers.

This towel set looks awesome in the kitchen. Very fancy. They go with any color scheme kitchen. They are fine for drying hands and if you dry dishes with them they will not leave lint behind, they look and feel like a proper dish towel but they not very absorbent for drying dishes. Eventually the water soaks into the towel but you have to take some extra time.

I have have my echo for a few months.I am listening to more music than ever because it is so easy to ask Alexa to play songs or playlists. I pay spotify and I can play spotify through the echo but more often I am accessing Amazon prime music and music from my Amazon cloud which has every song I've ever bought from Amazon on cd or a record album ( they automatically give you an electronic copy of all that)The whole family uses Alexa to add items to the store list. Even family members who are worried about the rise of the machines like the store list feature. I keep the hand held remote control at the other end of the house so I can items when I'm out of her range. Then at the grocery store you open the echo app and check off the items. Or you can order them through Amazon through the app. ( it's definitely an Amazon shopping portal but that's ok by me )I love the news briefing feature which can be customized.The weather forecast is perfect. Accurate and just the information you need.Alexa is easier to talk to than Siri but Alexa only knows Wikipedia and you have to ask questions in a certain way to get the information you want. We find she is getting better at this data retrieval task.I ask her to read my book to me and my audible book starts off where I left off ( in the audible voice ). Then my phone knows that she read some and takes over at that spot.In the winter I used the traffic feature.I recently found that she could not pronounce the name of a nearby town and so I emailed Amazon through the echo app and they emailed back that they are teaching her that word. ( this showed me the need for the slow roll out process )I'd like to have another echo at work. I'm not sure when we can start buying additional units.I talk really fast but Alexa can usually understand what I'm saying except when happy hour gets carried away then forget about it. She can't understand me at all after a couple drinks.It's fun to talk to her about random things to see what she has learned. We just discovered that she knows the Game of Thrones. She'll quote Star Trek lines to you if you say "live long and prosper". She knows some famous movie one liners. She can tell jokes.She can reorder stuff for you from Amazon if you've already ordered it once before. You can buy songs through her.The quality of the speaker itself is very nice. You just ask her to turn herself up or down for volume control.Basically I'm over the moon with this thing.one night I was on my way to bed saying the usual good nights to the family and the dogs and on a lark I said "Alexa, good night" she said " don't let the bed bugs bite". Cracked me up.We changed our wifi router and she knew she wasn't connected any more and told me what to do to fix her. ( this stuff all freaks my wife out but I think it's great )Bottom line, if you have an Amazon prime account you will cetainly get your money's worth out of this just with the music selection.
Clean scent, not too perfumy or flowery but also not too old spice either. Shampoo lathers up very well. Rinses off your hair and body easily. Not lotion like, more liquid like.

This is a really big bar of soap. Seems like the heft of two regular size bars I'd say. It lathers quick. It makes your skin soft but you really really have to rinse off well in the shower, a quick rinse leaves soap residue. The aroma of the soap is great in the shower, fine for man or woman, and afterwards your skin does not retain the scent of the soap.

My wife is a home brewer. I am a daily craft brew drinker. (You only have 3 seconds to make a first impression so I'm trying to establish why I think I am so wise in the ways of beer and qualified to review things dealing with beer and wenches)My wife follows this author's web postings. I'd never heard of her before this book. The writing is very funny. The book is easy to understand and I think it is put together in a useful manner.This book does not have recipes for making beer. It has recipes for cocktails that have beer as an ingredient. It has recipes for food cooked with beer as an ingredient and it discusses beer and food pairings. As I read the book I found myself dog earring many pages containing recipes.This is one book where I'm inclined to recommend considering the kindle version. So when you're out at a brew pub you have the information at your finger tips and when cooking recipes you can set up your electronic device to view the book. Also the author should consider putting together an app that has all this data.I think this is a great gift for anyone new to craft beer, or anyone who already loves craft beer. Very nice photos. Nice balance of information and very approachable.

Took an hour to assemble. You are supposed to let the battery charge for 18 hours before using it the first time. I charged it for 16 and it seemed to work fine. You can't let the battery on the charger for longer than 30 hours at a time.There are no seatbelts. It only goes either 2.5 or 5 miles an hour and this is one toy that needs supervision all the time. When the accelerator is disengaged, the wheels can still roll but there is some resistance. There is no brake petal. It stops when you take your foot off the gas.After it's together it is very easy to pick up and move. It's not that heavy just bulky.It ships in a large cardboard box. We didn't have to sign for it.It comes with a wrench but you'll still need a Phillips screw driver and an adjustable wrench for assembly. The instructions are easy to follow.The wheels are plastic with 'treads' that make it drive fine on rough ground. We tried the yard and a very rough parking lot. Fine on both.The metal parts are the side bars and the frame. All else is plastic.The seat does not adjust.There is a little storage room up under the hood. The battery goes into a door in the back of the car.

We recently started to grill steaks and elk burgers (after years of only grilling fish and turkey burgers and beer can chickens) so i wanted to be able to grill rare but safely. I don't like the idea of letting juices escape but this thermometer reads very quickly so the probe is not in there long (but it still obviously leaves a hole)It comes with a sleeve so that when you are not using it the probe part doesn't get dirty. It also keeps the pointy end protected.

Orbit is the only gum I buy. I was just about out when I was offered this variety box to review. (sometimes I think Amazon knows me a little too well. Its scary).Orbit is individually wrapped. It's the smaller size like dentine, not the bigger stick like juicy fruit. It's sugar free. The only bad thing is that it has aspartame. I chew this gum often and I am sensitive to aspartame and this does not bother me so I think it must not be too much in there.I like to keep a pack in desk drawer. My bosses desk drawer. My car. My kitchen. My kid is always wanting some. My backpack. So the variety pack is nice. This gum keeps a long time too so I'm not worried about it going stale. The packs are wrapped in plastic too.

We buy many a super soaker because it is our method of dog training. Which is to say that our dogs are not trained, don't listen, and have no manners, but they stop barking if you threaten to squirt them with the super soaker.So we need a super soaker that makes noise when you shake it. This one does not. We also have regular women sized hands and this squirt gun requires hands bigger than ours to function easily. (My wife lifts weights every day and this squirt gun is still big enough to be clumsy in her hands)You can use the gun with or without the hose.We tested this against the Nerf Super Soaker Scatterblast Blaster (which is half the price) they both squirt exactly the same distance and that one is easier to use. This new bigger one would be better for older teens I think, especially if they connect the hose ( but the right hose nozzle would still squirt further )

I work all day and night with Dell PCs and laptops and a few chromebooks. This is the first Lenovo product I have used. If you put these same specs into a Dell you'd pay much more so this is a good value. The materials on this Lenovo are similar to Dell's Inspirion line. The unit feels solid.The display handles true 1920 x 1080. The wireless is a/c. Back lit keyboard. Speakers are on the bottom of the base and the sound is good even when folded upon itself.The cursor continues to freeze. The touch pad becomes unresponsive until I hit the alt key. This could possibly be a windows 8 issue but the touchpad looks a little indented at the top to me so i'm not really sure if it's hardware or software but it's a pain in the neck. Also when i'm in tablet or touch mode and the focus is in a data entry field I have to ask the keyboard to come up and display. On an ipad, for example, this happens automatically. Also in table mode the virtual keyboard does not have a windows key which is also a problem.The real keyboard has a number pad. The spacing and feel of the keys is fine for typing at length.No dvd/cd drive.The touch screen is responsive. I was playing Hearthstone for an hour and I kept switching back and forth from laptop and touchpad to tablet and touch screen and it was seamless. The game switched from laptop to tablet during the game with no lag or glitching. The Lenovo never got hot even after an hour of playing.With the display on bright and a game going the battery ran down a fast clip. You have to sit near an outlet.Windows 8 is what it is. Once you get used to it .... well I wouldn't really know because even after all this time I'm still not used to it but i've learned to tolerate it. This comes with a bunch of Lenovo apps installed.When i'm at home I generally use my ipad for everything. However I find myself picking up this touchscreen laptop more and more. I really like the display for games and videos. It is very thin and light weight even though it's 15.6". I like typing on it.  It's is versatile. I need to get the cursor issue fixed and then I would probably give it 5 stars.

I asked my teenage son for his opinion of this necklace after I put it on. Without skipping a beat he said, "it makes you look like your Mom".  To all the men shopping for a gift reading this, NEVER say those to words to any woman. You think you raise a kid right ...Anyway, this necklace is very fancy, not the kind of thing that goes good with a casual night at all. The pearls on mine all appear to be the same size and color. If you are giving it as a gift you need to also buy a fancy bag to store it in. The box they come in is okay, not great but either way the pearls have to be stored in a cloth bag.

This diaper bag with built in changing pad is a great idea well executed.The coloring and style of the bag is perfect because it is grown ups who carry the supplies so it makes sense to style the equipment in a more mature way instead of in all baby colors and designs.The bag has pockets and fits more than you might think based on the messenger bag like shape.Also, when you dont need it for baby any longer you can use it for your laptop or tablet. It's perfect.

The dimensions of the pot inside where the food goes is 3.75" high, and the bottom is 10" by 10" (it's a little wider at the top)This is very very heavy.The lid is all made of the same material so pot holders always.I have a traditional kitchen aid 6 quart round dutch oven and it tucks nicely into this one for storage purposes.You can use this in the kitchen or on the grill or in a camp fire.

The bad news, imo, is that there is no mention of Serial or Invisibilia. As amazing as Serial was, Invisibilia is even better. Talk about story telling and driveway moments. I assume that's because a graphic novel takes long to put together. This one says since February 2012. Also I assume there is no mention of these shows because "editing". Anyway, if you love story telling look into the podcasts for Invisibilia. And you're welcome!Anyways, the good news is that there is lots of red meat in this weird book. It's about 200 pages and of course it's hand drawn pictures and speech bubbles. It takes a good amount of time to digest all the information.This is the sort of book that's tough to pass on even though I really enjoyed it. "I just read this really interesting book." "What's it about?" "Behind the scenes at public radio." "Pass." "There's pictures?" ...When you are an NPR junkie, all week you keep boring your friends by trying to retell them the stories you heard. This book explains why you are boring, while the original radio broadcast was not. This book explains about all minutiae that goes into the months of work before the story is aired.If you love NPR you will appreciate this book. If you love story telling and you don't listen to NPR I think this book will make you want to start.

Well heck. We were offered this through Amazon's Vine program, and having three schnauzers that we have to spell the word "s-n-a-c-k" around, thought we'd try it. Good news! They loved them. Bad news! I read the other reviews and then Googled the product. I was concerned because I saw the phrase "Made in China" on the pack. We love our dogs and aren't going to give them snacks that could potentially put them at risk. Sorry, Wagon Train...can I get a similar product made in the USA, please?

I have over a dozen bird feeders and I have tried every style of Niger feeder. Stainless steel with small holes, all kinds of bags and plastic feeders. The squirrels love the bag type. The birds hated the metal type. And the plastic ones never last but I've decided they are the best option because at some point I always end up with clumped Niger seed and the feeder is dirty and gross and just needs to be replaced. So I get this basic style every time now. This looks nice. I think the yellow attracts the goldfinches (just my opinion) and they are very affordable so I don't mind if I just get one or two seasons out it. It's worth the investment because the birds like this style best.

This is an applicator only. No concealer comes with. It works great. It's so soft and effective at blending. It's imporqnt to be careful around the eyes because of bruising with too much pressure so this tool is perfect for applying with a light hand.

We were using a few Archer products combined with the mid grade wifi selection from our cable provider. All of which are very afforadable and easy to set up but the number of wireless devices in our home keeps growing and while things were fine, every so often there was an update to download or a movie that was glitchy.So when I got this linksys router I also upgraded to the fastest internet speed run offers us($10 more dollars a month) and I upgraded the internal wifi card on our oldest dell laptop. All other devices were adequate as was. And holy moly things are really zipping along now. On the new laptop, ac, I'm getting around 110, which is what I'm a paying for, but I'm getting it on the wifi, not when I'm plugged into the modem so that is awesome.I have an external hard drive set up as a laymans nas and that is fast also. No rev up noise or delay.

I love all things pumpkin come fall, into winter. This pudding is ok, I'd say it's a bit cinnamon heavy for my taste, but easy enough to make. I am grateful to be able to buy it on Amazon, when my local store had sold out.

I groom dogs and have a couple of very sensitive clients, and this is one great shampoo for them. No scent, no color, very gentle, rinses out easily and leaves those tender doggies clean. Their owners are grateful and happy. A++ from Bio-Groom on this truly hypo allergenic shampoo.

Nice shirt! This one is Jerzees, 90% cotton, 10% poly, and fits true to size, The arm "holes" are big, so big that if you are a woman, maybe a bra and tank underneath is a good choice. But very comfy, easy to wear and and work out in. I love it, very good old fashioned t shirt, the material is almost "old school" heavy.

Very witty - combines my two favorite things into one t shirt. 50% poly, 25% cotton, 25% rayon, this shirt has a thin but super soft feel to it. The size is accurate, and I'd say if you wanted to show off your muscles, you could buy 1 size smaller and it would probably be perfect. If you buy your true size, it will still cling to everything you want to show off.  It's very comfortable. Recommended.

If you love movies you MUST watch the Babadook. Even if you think you do not care for horror movies you MUST watch this movie. It's as much psychological thriller as it is horror. Just watch it early in the day with all the lights on if you are hesitant but WATCH it.We watch LOTS of movies. Most movies. US and international. Subtitles. We see multiple new movies every week.This was our favorite movie of the year for sure. We watched this movie three times in one weekend. While we watch lots of movies there are not many that we re-watch like that.We just couldn't stop talking about it and pointing things out to each other and simultaneously knew we had to re-watch. The second viewing we asked our 18 year old son to join us. He noticed things we hadn't. Later that same weekend after more discussion and reading about the director/writer (she's new) we watched it one more time.Thanks to Amazon for having the movie available. We were upset that our local art house theaters had not shown this Australian film yet. I assume it will eventually show itself. Hope so.This is one of those movies that will turn you into a missionary for the movie.

At Ikea I saw an idea I stole for my living room because we don't really have room for a Christmas tree. I hung a branch from the ceiling and hung ornaments from the branch. These 3 bird ornaments, 3 bird house ornaments and 3 owl ornaments. It looked great.My wife is Scandinavian and I PA Dutch and I like the designs on these birds because you see flavors of each on the painting.

Angelina Jolie is the bomb in this movie. Just perfection.I loved what this movie did with the story.I think this movie is a great companion film to watch with Frozen. Strong females with no need to be saved by a man. What a great year for movies.

OMG this makes my life so much easier. I don't know why I didn't buy one sooner. Saves so much time.If you have more than one device you want to type on you can quickly finagle things to reset the connection but these are so affordable I just bought two spares. One for the office and one for my wife's ipad.

Love it. Got one for me and one for my mother as a Christmas present. (had her open it in the other room away from guests but still....)Works so well that it saves me five minutes in the morning.The 7" works well with our standard toilet.

So popular at the ugly Christmas sweater contest this year that I gave it to a co-worker and made their day.Nicely paired with the Christmas Story ugly Christmas Sweater that has a picture of a gun and "you'll shoot your eye out"The hat fits better on a big head.
Awesome illustrations. The story is classic and classic Gaiman.I love any book with girls kissing no matter what the context.

My teenage son continues to read Darren Shan even though technically he is probably too old for this series. These are great books for any young person who likes horror and thinks they don't like to read. All Shan's series were devoured by my son through his middle school and high school years.

My teenage son continues to read Darren Shan even though technically he is probably too old for this series. These are great books for any young person who likes horror and thinks they don't like to read. All Shan's series were devoured by my son through his middle school and high school years.

My teenage son continues to read Darren Shan even though technically he is probably too old for this series. These are great books for any young person who likes horror and thinks they don't like to read. All Shan's series were devoured by my son through his middle school and high school years.

My teenage son continues to read Darren Shan even though technically he is probably too old for this series. These are great books for any young person who likes horror and thinks they don't like to read. All Shan's series were devoured by my son through his middle school and high school years.
We buy one every year for my Mother in Laws Christmas present. She loves them.Nice photos. Good quality calendar.

This shirt runs small. So small that I wore it for ugly Christmas sweater competition (paired with a red and white santa cowboy hat also purchased on amazon) but then I changed t-shirts because this one really did not fit me. But people at work loved the shirt so I gave it away and made the receptionist's day.

The main character's real name is Hild. Hild was a real young woman who we know a little bit about. I recently read an almost 600 page book by Nicola Griffith who basically took what is written about this historical figure (very little) and fleshed out a story around that. That book was challenging to read but very engrossing. "Half the World" took the character of Hild and let her be much more of a tom boy and this story was not challenging to read. It was a page turner. I did not read the first book in this trilogy and I still loved this story. I never felt lost but I can't wait to get caught up by reading the first book now.I love most things Viking and everything with strong female characters and this book is all of that with a good sense of humor and adventure inside a very entertaining story.There was a strong Karate Kid vibe, but with female characters and it's very groovy. BTW there is nothing here that should turn off male readers but hooray for all the chicks who kick butt in this story.There is a relationship between the young female lead character and a male character. It is sexual but not graphic at all. There is some mild cursing. Appropriate Viking curses, again nothing extreme.I am recommending this book to the same people I recommended the Hunger Games when I found it. Also my 18 year old son loves GOT and Patrick Rothfuss so I ordered him the first book (Half a King).As I read I could see and hear the characters easily. Basically it was a joy to read and I highly recommend it. I laughed often while reading. This is a smartly written story that is accessable to all readers.

What I like best is that I can name each band so I know which of my devices is picking up the 2.4 and which are picking up the 5.We have many wired and wireless devices and there is big range in the age of these devices so this device is perfect for us. Everything works. The speed is awesome. The range is so good that I disconnected by Wi-Fi extender. This definitely has a stronger signal than my Neatgear dual band. I get stronger signal further from the router.Setup is not much different than any other router I've used. Having the usb port for an external hard drive is nice.The footprint of the device is actually pretty small, the antennas are adjustable.

Very sturdy and well made. It holds two strips of staples. The staples are more sturdy then usual office staples. This design makes it easy on your hands.The best use for me for this is stapling shut bags and other items other than papers. However another plus for this type of design is that I store the stapler on a magnetic bar on my fridge which is nicer for me than a standard desktop stapler.

I currently have this on my refrigerator. It is basically a metal frame with super strong magnets inserted into the frame, the magnets are held in the slide by the yellow tape that you can see in the photo. Very basic design.The magnets are so strong that if you put something on there with a lot of metal it is actually hard to pull it off the bar. For example, I have a sturdy plyers/stapler on the magnetic tool bar and I have to use two hand to pull it off the bar because the magnetics hold it so strongly. But if I grab a screw driver off the bar, it just pulls off easily because there is less metal actually touching the bar.I have pens, scissors, stapler, screw driver stuck to it on the side of my fridge. I love it.

I have used the 3M version of these and this brand sticks and more importantly, unsticks, as well as the 3M hooks.I use these in all the rooms in our house and I have never had one fail.But this year, I found the ultimate use - Christmas decorations! Works great and after the season, pull them off. Great.

We have limited counter space so we like multitasking appliances. We drink lots of tea so we have a hot shot hot water heater and a coffee pot. Combining the two saves us on foot print size. So that's a big plus for us.The coffee maker works fine. The water reservoirs fill easy enough. The hot shot part works fine. Water temperatures are good. Features are typical.My only complaint is that it feels flimsy.

Noric noir. Good winter storm book.You can read this book without reading the authors previous books.This is a great Nordic noir story that you devoir asap and the best setting is a winter storm. Snowed in, with a good book, juicy and enticing without being too heavy.

I have what I think are normal size female hands and I find these pruners to be a smidge challenging to get a good grip on. So I choke up on them and I think due to physics that means I have to exert more pressure when pruning but I can usually get through the branch in one squeeze.The pruners do cut cleanly. They cut nicer on an angle. The blade wipes clean easily.I really like the lock being on the bottom of the unit.

I loved this case on my old Ipad and I love it on my new Ipad also.It's super durable. It holds up to the dog walking on it. It stands up to dropping as long as the case it closed when the Ipad falls.It has auto shut down. It has the correct holes for camera and mics.I like the slant options in landscape mode.As always, this case works better in landscape but it more than fine for portrait also. I used my old one for 3 years.

I always wash my car by driving through the local laser wash. I have a Subaru. My understanding is that if you have a very expensive car you would never use a laser wash. I have no qualms using one on my car. I'm generally just interested in getting off winter salt and such things.I used this 303 spray on my car AFTER going through the car wash and I got LOTS of dirt off my car. It was very easy to use. It smells awesome. It worked great on the plastic parts on the front and back of the car.It did not take off the license plate dirt. It did nothing for rust.I would reach for this over armour all for example. It seems to clean better and smell better but it is the product of choice for normal vehicle drab and dirt. Nothing extreme.

To my way of thinking the only reason someone would consider a review of Far Cry 4 is if they have not played previous Far Cry game. This bogus debate of Far Cry 3.5 is nonsense because if you played Far Cry 3 then you loved Far Cry 3 and why would you not want more of the same but amped up.If you have never played Far Cry and you are considering it for your new PS4 console then the answer is YES. Other people in the house will be walking by the display and stopping to watch your game play as if it was the movie of the week.If you've never played Far Cry this is a really nice mix of story and mission and activity. Did you like Red Dead and Uncharted? Of course you did so you will like this blend of tower structures, camping, hunting, shooting, family drama engaging story line.The co-op play with option for 10 friends is awesome. Depending you play with you can be creative or just basic shoot em up. This option increases the value of the game which was pretty awesome to start with.

We had a nice winter dog coat but it was too big for our current dog. Using this fabric Velcro we were easily able to make an alteration to the garment. The coat fits fine now.The Velcro is not fuzzy and bushy, so it lays flatter. It sticks very well.This is the sort of item to keep on hand in the junk drawer. It should come in handy a lot.

Works as advertised. I did not experience any rash and I have sensative skin. The container has a clever applicator system. You need nothing additional other than a damp wash cloth. I am very happy to know this product exists and works so well.

My desktop PC connects to our secure network via a wired ethernet connection. I can only access our open network if I use a wireless device, typically my phone or ipad. By installing the TP-LINK usb adapter I can now switch my PC back and forth from wired to wireless. I have to go through control panel and disable the one to enable the other but it only takes a second. The problem is remembering to have all network programs shut before I make the switch from one part of the VLAN to the other.I also tested the device on my laptop. It slowed down my speed significantly.

Let me start this review by stating that Focusrite has top-notch customer service...and that's pretty hard to find in this day and age.I had an issue with the connectivity between the iTrack Pocket and the Impact for Focusrite App. Specifically, I wasn't seeing an icon on the app that I should have been seeing, when I plugged in an electric instrument. I emailed Chris (whose email address is on the enclosed documentation) and he responded within an hour-and-a-half. He said he believed I had a defective cable and said he would send one immediately via Priority Mail. That was on a Friday. By Tuesday, my new cable arrived (from California to Pennsylvania). Kudos to a company who cares about the consumer and not just the number of units they sell. That is a huge plus!Now on to my review. I'll begin with the Cons, which are minimal and are nothing that would discourage me from purchasing this product. They do not affect the performance of the device. They could be considered by Focusrite as opportunities for improvement.•First, I am using an iPhone 5S and I have a protective cover on it. This cover does not add much thickness to my phone, but in order to place it in the device slot on the iTrack Pocket I had to remove the cover which was quite difficult. In designing this device it would have been nice if the slot was a little deeper to accommodate phone covers.•I had to register the device and open an account in order to access the user guide. Based on the simplicity of the device, an enclosed user booklet would have been nice.Now for the Pros: I have to say, without reserve, that the iTrack Pocket is the coolest little device on the market for people who like to record videos without going through the trouble of setting up web cams or cameras and microphones. It is very portable and can travel virtually anywhere. It is also very affordable.•In essence, the iPhone is the video camera and the iTrack Pocket is the microphone. It is a hands-down better microphone than the one built into the iPhone.•The video quality is very good. Of course, this has to do with the superior camera in the iPhone 5 and iPhone 6 lines. I emailed a clip to myself and noticed the video quality had degraded somewhat from the original clip, although the sound quality was still there, which I credit to the function of the iTrack Pocket. I haven't tried posting to Youtube and probably never will as I plan to use this device as a self-monitoring tool (to make sure I'm not making funny faces when I play). Therefore, I don't know if there will be degrading of the video if it's uploaded to Youtube.•I tested the sound using electric and acoustic mandolins and I have to admit I was pretty impressed in both scenarios. The microphone was surprisingly good at capturing sound. The sound from eight feet away sounded as good as it did at 2 feet. I also did a clip of just me talking and I was also pretty impressed with the quality of the sound. The microphone is really sensitive so you have to pay attention to gain, which you can control via the levels dial on the side of the iTrack Pocket. A red light will come on if levels are not properly adjusted. I tested this by recording while the red light was on and during playback I noticed the sound of the TV from two rooms away as well as a static-sounding distortion to the instrument sound. So don't forget to verify your levels before starting to record.•The input jack for electric guitar (or in my case, an electric Mandolin) is pretty awesome. I was very surprised at the quality of the recording. After you plug you electric instrument into the iTrack Pocket and launch the Impact App, you will see a guitar icon. Pressing on this will bring up the option to record in the following modes: Stereo Mic, Guitar & Mic and Guitar. You can also choose to use or not use headphones. Finally, there are three "Amplifier" options (in addition to recording "clean"): Twin (with sliders for Drive and Reverb), Brit (with sliders for Drive and Delay) and V-AC (with sliders for Drive and Reverb). Not being an expert in sound engineering, I played around with these setting and managed to come up with some pretty off-the-wall sounds on an electric mandolin. I was happy with recording using my acoustic and electric mandolins, but I have to admit I will stick primarily to acoustic recording. I am getting an electric UBass for Christmas, so I'll be looking forward to trying that out using the input jack.•The editing controls, while minimal, are pretty cool. The Impact app allows you scroll through the editing options based on what you're doing. Editing consists of "Enhance" and "Compress"  sliders and the "Fx" which adjusts sound based on what you're editing. There are editing options for Acoustic Guitar (or other acoustic instrument): Fx controls are Small Room, Big Room, Chorus, Echo and None;  Guitar and Vocal: Fx controls are Small Room, Medium Room, Big Room and None; Electric Guitar (or other input device): Fx controls are Small Room, Echo, Large Room, Large Echo and None; Female Vocal and Male Vocal: Fx controls are Doubler, Huge Chorus, Big Room and None.The effects are pretty cool and I can see kids going wild over adding effects. For what I was doing, I adjusted the "Enhance" slider and kept the "Fx" at None which, in my opinion resulting in a sound with a little more bass.•The Impact for Focusrite app is user friendly. The bar graphmeter and the red light on the front of the iTrack Pocket let you know if you're getting into trouble with sound gain. As I stated before, you can then make adjustments with the gain control dial on the side of the iTrack Pocket. After making sound adjustments you can hit the "clip editor" icon in the lower right of the screen and video frames appear along the top of the screen and you simply use the sliders to clip off the beginning and end of you video where you're reaching to start and stop the recording. I have found that it's more effective to clip the recording using the sound line at the bottom instead of the clip line at the top.There's one other thing that's neither a pro nor a con and that has to do with the start / stop button. It's a little small, so I found myself getting very close to the screen to see if the timer has started. I finally noticed that when the device starts recording, the little white circle in the red button turns into a white square. There's a tip that will make starting and stopping your recording a little easier.The iTrack Pocket can also function in another capacity. From a psychological perspective, recording oneself and getting comfortable with seeing oneself on recordings can be a true confidence booster and can go a long way in overcoming performance anxiety. I just had to add that because there are many musicians dealing with confidence and/or performance anxiety issues.All-in-all, I must say this is this year's must-have device. It is  a really cool, handy device for the money. I would highly recommend this device for people who are just beginning to dabble in sound and video recording, for people who put lots of music video out on Youtube and want a quick and easy way to do it or for people like me who just want to monitor their playing and presence. Hurry! Buy one now...you won't be sorry!
The USB end does not look like a typical USB connector but it fits into the USB port on the PC. The tiny device charges well. I had to take my phone case off for the cable to seat tightly.

This is a pretty neat shop vac. Besides being a traditional shop vac, the whole top part detaches and you can carry it around and use it as a leaf blower. It comes with all the usual hoses and attachments. Yes, it does work as a wet and dry vacuum. I've used it in my dog grooming area in my basement and it sucks up fur really well. It is a little bulky on top for debris removal compared to a regular shop vac, but I do love being able to carry the blower around.

I think Wolf Winter is a perfect winter blizzard book. For Summer beach reading I grab light easy reading because the book has to go well with the weather and the abundance of summer cocktails. Winter has the advantage of pairing with dark roast Swedish coffee, and a caffeinated brain can handle more meaty reading.Wolf Winter hits me in all my sweet spots. Strong female characters, suspense, fantasy (of the magic variety), survival skills, and lots of snow. I read many nordic noir stories and also historical fiction and this is a nice balanced blend of the two.So basically this is a murder mystery with very nice turns and twists. The setting is as important as the plot. The characters, some are alive and some are not, are drawn in what I think is a typical Scandinavian style in that you get to know these people in small bits and pieces over time.The year is 1717 and the politics of the time and place are important to the story but the writer leaves the boring details out altogether. That was ok with me. There is plenty of revelations and clues and secrets and hauntings to fill out the story. Lots of characters considering the setting but it was never too complicated to keep them all straight.There is a scene in the book with a snow blizzard and an explanation to clear off the porch every time the snow on the window sill reaches an inch. Otherwise they'd be snowed in and wouldn't be able to open the front door. This is the same week in New York state the lake effect snow dumped 6 feet and the news showed photos of a dog who wanted to go out but couldn't because there was a wall of snow behind the front door.It isn't good when we forget the old ways and this is one of the main morals of this book.For readers who care, there is no swearing and no sex on screen. It's a murder mystery with ghosts but it's not a gory horror book.

I had one of these years ago but it was shaped in a rectangle. This book is a small sqaure and it actually fits in the back pocket of my jeans.My eyes are 50 years old and I wear glasses and prefer large print but I can read the book text fine. Some of the text on the subway map is very small but still readable.I live In a suburb of Philly and going to New York is a big deal for us. We usually take the bus. This guide will be very helpful. I like the day trip ideas very much. There are some photos.The entries include the website, phone number, address, cost, public transportation data, hours etc for each location.There is a lot of information but it's organized in an easy to access way. The map can stay attached to the book if you want.
Bought for canon rebel camera. Works great. Fast. I have purchased many sandisk cards over the years and have found them very reliable.

I have a bridge camera with a 60x zoom which is great for birding photos. I I also have an iPhone that takes fantastic photos when I'm not out birding.But when I want a good snapshot of a face, human or dog, I reach for this camera.  It's perfect for faces. And for vistas, landscapes. It takes perfect videos. It focuses very fast. It feels good in my hand. It is very light weight. It takes great photos very fast and very easy.I used to have a manual film canon and I took a ton of photos and developed my own slides for a time. Learning what all the buttons and menus do on the digital canon takes some trial and error and rereading of the manual. The camera takes great photos on all auto but learning the manual opens up many more options for good photos that are in challenging lighting or have other issues.Next stop a 70-300mm lens.This kit comes with everything you need to get started except for a memory card. I bought a 32gb sandisk sdhc for about $20 on amazon. The lithium battery needs to charge before using. It takes about 2 hours to charge.This camera has no wifi ability so you have to use the included cable or remove the memory card to get the photos to your computer.

In my opinion this is an odd little book. Heartbreaking and warming. Mystical and historical. Spiritual but in a Native American flavor. Haunting almost like all the characters were ghosts.I wanted to read this book because the idea of an old lady hiking across Canada seriously floats my boat. But that's not really what the book is about. It's about war and then the end of the war and how it doesn't really end. And it's about growing old. And it's about the interconnectedness of everything. It's a blurry story but it's told really well and I enjoyed it.

My son has been reading this series since he was in elementary school. He is officially too old for the series probably but reading is reading. He liked this entity as much as the previous. He commented specifically about the vocabulary words in this book being challenging for very young readers. It would be a fun book for a parent to read with their child though. Great series!

This rubber rejuvenator does an excellent job of renewing windsheild wiper blades -- just apply with clean paper towel, and rub it into the rubber part of the wiper blade. It helps to prevent the rubber from being attacked by the ozone in the air. My wipers were skipping and streaking before applying the Rubber Renue, but just one application made the wipers like new again. I wish I had found this stuff many years ago !!

Highly-polished Stainless Steel -- looks and shines like chrome, but will not peel, chip, flake, or rust.Comes with four (4) stainless steel screws and polished, snap-on caps. NO sharp edges !!Quick and easy install with #2 Phillips screwdriver.

They're every bit as good as the Manufacturer (Made in USA) claims -- well-made, strong, weather-proof, and good-looking (in a rugged sort of way).The out-of-box fit was puzzling, as the Driver's side mat was marked (Right), and the Passenger's side was marked (Left), but when I reversed 'em, the fit was absolutely perfect for our resto '95 Mercury Grand Marquis. I almost passed these by, 'cause the Amazon  Product Description says this item (W2TN) fits the 2005-2007 Malibu, but the W2TN fits 30 PAGES of car years and models from many manufacturers!! Check to see if these mats (W2TN) fit YOUR vehicle, 'cause you won't find any better quality from some other manufacturer. WeatherTech is THE BOMB for quality floor mats !!

When they say "MAX CONTROL", they're not kidding !! The old strainers in the double sink finally wore out after several years of no-rust service, and the 3-pack deal made this Sink Strainer the perfect choice to replace the ones that worked so well for so long. Fits perfectly in standard kitchen sink drains. I've had other strainers that were supposed to be "stainless steel", but they rusted out. These are the real deal !

This is a high-quality air filter, made in USA -- and when compared to the auto parts store brand, the number of pleats and the quality of the filter media was immediately visible , as in 65 pleats for the Brand X vs. 88 pleats for the Motorcraft, and no pinholes in the Motorcraft, either. Keeps the MAF Sensor Wire and Throttle Body cleaner than, and without the hassle of cleaning and re-oiling of the K&N that I've used for years.

This card gives excellent signal reception and connection speeds over a variety of conditons -- right out of the box -- but if you demand that extra bit of performance, it's easy to convert the antenna to three 9db antenna rods (available at Amazon). Easy install, and an excellent performance increase for your PC.

These work perfectly to view NVIDIA 3-D applications, and can be worn over eyeglasses, if necessary. They're comfortable, stylish, and provide excellent 3-D photo viewing and gaming. And ya can't beat the price !!

The Energy Suspension Urethane bushings # 9.8107R (Red) and 9.8107G (Black) are practically indestructable, and will last for many miles/years. I have used them off-road on 2 different Land Cruisers, and for highway use on large Ford, Lincoln, and Mercury sedans -- they also fit Camaro and Firebird ('82-'02), as well as many other applications. The bushings will out-last the shocks, and can be re-used when the shocks are replaced. Urethane shock bushings are far superior to the rubber type, and help to keep your shocks attached firmly and your car, truck, or off-road vehicle's suspension tight and under control. When installing new shocks, remove the original rubber bushings and install these. No problems, no worries -- ever !

This thermostat (Motorad 2065-195) comes with a rubber "seal" -- but the seal is NOT USED in the Ford-Lincoln-Mercury 4.6 liter V-8 engines !!The enclosed "seal" MUST BE REMOVED before installing the thermostat in the thermostat housing.After draining the cooling sysytem, follow this proceedure for installing this thermostat in the FOMOCO 4.6 liter engine:1. Remove thermostat housing.2. Remove old thermostat and gasket.3. Clean all surfaces thoroughly.4. Remove rubber "seal" from edge of thermostat and discard.5. Insert new thermostat with springs on the BOTTOM side.6. Install new O-ring gasket (not supplied) on TOP of thermostat.7. Clean and replace 2 water housing hold-down bolts; torque to 20 ft./lbs.8. Re-fill cooling system with 50-50 mixture of Ethylene Glycol (Anti-Freeze) and Distilled Water.9. Run engine for 10 miles and let the engine cool down overnight -- re-check coolant level, and add fluid to the "cold fill" line.Good Luck !!

These 3-D glasses are the real deal -- with the Nvidia Logo and "3D VISION - Discover" printed on the right-side earpiece. These are the entry-level glasses for your Nvidia 3D Vision preferences setup that accompnaies your Nvidia 3D-capable Sound Cards. Comfortable fit, no side glare, they look OK, and the price was, like, cheap-ola !! My wife wears hers over her regular glasses, and she loves the view -- and the comfort, too.

Each of these antenna rods gives 8dBi performance, and 3 of these fitted to a TP-LINK TL-WDN4800 Dual Band Wireless N900 PCI Adapter  bring in a solid signal and a connection speed of 130 Mbps. , which delivered speedtest dot net results of 93.21 Mbps (down) and 12.08 Mbps (up) behind a NETGEAR WNR3500L 2.4GHz Router -- through a cinder-block wall and a lot of machines, motors, and steel cabinets and furniture. Easy install -- 3 of these spread out in a "fan" pattern give a strong signal over a broad range. These TP-LINK 8dBi antenna rods give the best all-around performance of any antenna rods or devices that I have ever used in my 20 years of wireless computing. Get 'em before they're gone !!

This peppercorn blend is a great value -- not the very best peppercorns, but a very good choice for the low-budget gourmet. It's a nice upgrade from an E7500 or below -- Takes just a few minutes to change over and there's a noticable difference in performance. I recommend the new Arctic MX-4 thermal paste -- better than the popular Arctic 5.

The perfect replacement for those snail-slow, 5,400 rpm spinner hard drives -- Faster boot times, lightning response times, cooler case temps, no need to de-frag, and beautiful silence are just a few of the features that make the Crucial MX200 the perfect choice for upgrading your PC.

Perfect replacement for our Dodge Ram pickup with 318 cu.in. engine. Well made, easy install, low cost -- a perfect combination to get the truck up and running on the hottest days or the coldest nights.

This 18-inch hose gives a plenty of flexibility to get at the hard-to-reach fittings on your car, truck, or farm equipment. It's a perfect attachment for your hand or air-operated grease gun. Easy to load, easy to use, and makes greasing your car, truck, or farm equipment faster and easier. Snap it in, plug in your LAN Cable, and you're good to go -- with connection speeds of 1 GB/s. It's a must-have to get maximum connection speeds with the new DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modems. Easy to install, easy to use, and it makes my Dremel 8100 even more versatile. Holds tools firmly, with no wobbling.
