This is the perfect tool for installing all types of door locks that require the standard size and type of holes in wooden doors. The hole saw works perfectly to make the proper size hole to accomodate regular door knobs and dead-bolt locks. 7/8ths-inch. wood bit is included to make the side holes for the lock, dead-bolt, and strikes. Instructions are included for a quick and easy lock installation.

Just follow the easy-to-understand directions, and this deadbolt lock is a breeze to install and operate. The fit and finish is excellent, the completed installation is attractive and functional. 2 codes are supplied with the lock, and up to 17 additional codes can be added. 2 keys are supplied for over-ride purposes. Comes with 9-volt alkaline battery, and the manual recommends that lithium batteries are NOT to be used !! If you have an existing hole in the door for a dead-bolt-type lock with 2 3/8ths back-spacing, this lock should fit right in with no need for adjustment of any kind. For 2 3/4ths inch back-spacing, the adjustment is made with a simple turning over of the dead-bolt. If you need to drill a hole to mount your dead-bolt lock, it can be done quickly and easily with the "Door Knobs 2 1/8" Hole Saw Diameter Wood Bit" by Amico -- which I purchased here at Amazon. The lock looks great, works perfectly, and is sure to keep the banditos from your goodies !!

Bought as a gift to my Brother-In-Law -- and he was very pleased with the results. He has Type 1 diabetes, and has been plagued with Neuropathy for several years. This oil will certainly not CURE the neuropathy, but he tells me that his pain is drastically reduced when the oil is massaged into his feet.

This is an excellent Gasket-maker / Sealant that is easy to apply and seals all types of gear oils, but is especially good for use with gear oils that have the friction modifiers included in the formula -- as well as gear oils that require customer-added friction modifiers, such as those for Limited-Slip  applications. Can be easily applied by inserting cartridge into a standard (manual) caulking gun. Screw-on tip is a nice feature that allows full control of the bead as it is applied.

Loaded with convenient features. Cuts smoothly through metal, plastics, wood. Blade storage; 5.0 amps; 6 ft. cord; 0-3000 RPM. 2 year warranty. I like it much better than the old Craftsman jigsaw that it replaced.

The perfect fix for your "switchless" popcorn popper !! My new Presto PopLite popcorn machine didn't have an "ON-OFF" switch, so I drilled a hole in the base and mounted this well-made, 15-Amp switch. The Popper eats 1440 Watts, so a 15-Amp switch can safely handle the load. Works great, and the popped corn is perfect !!

This Presto PopLite is excellent in all respects -- fairly quiet, quick-heating, and makes delicious popped corn with no fuss & no muss !! Some reviewers complained about the lack of an "ON-OFF" switch -- so I got a good toggle switch and mounted it on the side of the popper. Ya gotta drill a hole in the side of the base -- and do some careful wiring to get it right, but it was worth it. I keep mine right next to the La-Z-Boy, ready to go at all times.

Quality is value, and the JBtek PWM Fan Splitter Cable is the perfect choice for hooking up two fans to the same power source. It's a 1-to-2 cable, with 1 female end, and 2 female ends. Plugs right in, and there's 2 fans cooling your rig in a matter of seconds !! Brought my case temps down about 6 - 8 C. on average, measured with infra-red gun. I should have gotten this thing years ago !!

Order arrived promptly, in perfect condition, and was exactly as described. Easy-peasy upgrade for the old Dell Vostro -- swapped out the E7500 for this E8600 -- the swap took just a few minutes. Windows Performance Index now up to 6.7 (overall score). I tried the new ARCTIC MX-4 Thermal Compound -- easy application, non-hardening, 8-year warranty. It's WELL worth the money !!

The ARCTIC F9 (Rev.2) was an easy install, and the new-type fluid bearing is quieter than the ball-bearing model it replaces.The 9-blade fan moves a plenty of air (43 CFM) through the case, and it keeps the case temps a lot cooler than the OEM 7-blade fan. 4-pin connector on 16-inch wire allows connection to either 3 or 4-pin headers. Great upgrade for an older computer -- highly recommended.

The Dorman pop-rivet tool is well-made of quality materials -- steel handles with comfortable plastic grips and 5 rivet dies that accept rivets up to 1/4th inch in diameter. Smooth, strong action and a rivet "collector cup" make for easy operation and excellent results. Overall length = 17 1/2 inches. Comes with 5 packs of assorted-size rivets. Small wrench for changing dies is included. Best danged rivet tool I've ever seen or heard of -- shoulda bought one years ago !!

Stainless steel  bowl is easy-to-clean, doesn't tip over, and the rubberized edge keeps it from sliding around. Dishwasher safe -- and the smooth, stainless surface doesn't hold germs like the plastic dogbowls do.

They lured me away from TURBO-TAX -- to my regret.The H&R Block software was completely useless to me. Ignored the H&R Block disaster, ordered the Turbo-Tax, and completed my Federal and State returns quickly and easily. No more H&R Block for me !!

The Cooler Master with copper-core heat-sink is a great upgrade for your OEM CPU cooling fan, because the fan housing has a built-in shroud that directs air down over the alluminum fins, increasing the efficiency of the fan and the heat-sink.If you're upgrading your CPU, it's the perfect time to upgrade to a copper-core and shrouded fan -- all in one unit.I'm very pleased with the cooler-running CPU, and will add another Cooler Master unit to our other PC.

Just what I needed to replace my leaking temp/pressure valve -- and it's lead-free, too !! Fits perfectly to replace a bad valve in 40-gallon gas water heater with heavy insulation, such as the Sears 12-Year Warranty model.
Wasted my money on H&R Block's stuff, which turned out to be a bad joke !! Totally useless !! Switched back to the TurboTax, and knocked out my Fed & State taxes easily, and in plenty of time.

After more than 2 years of daily use and abuse, the Logitech K800 has proven itself to be perfect in every way -- form, function, and an excellent design and workmanship combine to make this the absolutely finest keyboard on the market !! The many excellent features of this keyboard make it almost fun to navigate -- regardless of your ISP, your OS, or your lack of computer/typing  skills. Of all the computer peripherals I've purchased over the years, the K800 Keyboard is the best investment -- all-ways excellent, and I'm all-ways satisfied. Highly recommended !

The Valterra Hi-Flo Stainless Steel Regulator was installed into the inlet side of our 40-gallon gas water heater - to prevent pressure fluctuation inside the glass tank that can cause the tank to crack and fail. Water Heaters have become VERY expensive to replace, and the Valterra Regulator is cheap insurance against tank failure. The lower water pressure saves money, too -- because it takes LESS energy to heat water that is under less pressure.

This gas cap was the solution to a recurring PO442-PO455 code problem with a Dodge RAM 1500 -- It turns out that the Dodge is VERY sensitive to gas-caps not being installed properly and/or leaking internally. The Gates gas cap is of top quality, and includes the notice to "Tighten Past 3 Clicks" to insure a proper sealing of the Evap System. In my case, New Cap = No Codes !! Good Luck !!

The DSTE NB-4L with Lithium-Ion high-capacity battery with charger brought my old CANON camera back to life, and the extra capacity lets me go much longer without charging the battery. The Wall Charger and the Car Charger are nice extras that work perfectly, and the 3-piece combo was an inexpensive choice that solved my battery problems quickly and without fuss.

Installed on a Dodge RAM 1500 Club Cab Long-Bed with 5.2 Liter (318 ci) engine, 4-speed Auto Trans, and Trailer-Tow Package, the Gabriel 77662 (Rear) shocks cured a severe problem with the vehicle "porpoising" -- even with vehicle empty or fully loaded. Both ride and handling are greatly improved, and the rig feels much more stable when towing the trailer with horses aboard. The premium-quality Gabriel shocks really do give the driver "maximum control" of the vehicle under all conditions, and the Amazon price beats the competition by a mile !! The 77662 is for the rear -- the 77661 is the front shock for the Ram 1500 -- check before ordering. While installing the Gabriel Max-Control shocks both front and rear, an Energy Suspension # 5.5124R (red) Sway Bar Set (Front) was also installed in order to bring more stability to the suspension and improve handling under all conditions. The effect of cross-winds is minimized, and the trailer follows much better on mountain roads.

Simply the best heating pad we've ever owned -- the perfect size; soft, smooth texture; easy-to-use control module, and settings for every need. Unit heats up quickly, and then gives a steady warmth, according to your selected setting. Controls allow for Automatic Shut-Off or Manual Over-Ride,  which lets the heat stay on until it's turned off manually. We've used it for a few weeks, and it has helped a lot with my wife's chronic back pain. She sleeps much better at night since she began using the Sunbeam Xpress, and she says she has more energy during the day -- and she takes less medicine, too !!Makes an excellent gift for aging or elderly relatives and friends.

I didn't think these Baking Mats would perform as expected, but the proof is in the pudding (or Italian Bread, in our case).The bread dough was placed directly on the Mats, with no oil or corn-meal used to prevent sticking/burning. Baked loaves slid right off the Mats, and the loaf bottoms were well-crusted without any burning or hot spots.The Kitchen Goddess remarked that there was no messy oil or corn-meal to clean up afterwards, and the Mats can be wiped clean for quick re-use.These Baking Mats are very well-made, and appear to be of high-qualkity materials and excellent workmanship. These are great for the experienced baker or the novice -- they save time and work, and they're easy to clean and store.

The Oxo Good Grips Flour Sifter helped us make Italian Bread with no fuss, no muss, and no flour all over the place !! Simple, side-to-side shaking action of the comfortable handle makes sifting quick and easy, even for those with arthritis and/or dexterity problems.The OXO shaker-type-sifter gives a new meaning to "Shake & Bake" . So easy a cave-man could do it !! Bottom "Lid" keeps the ingredients in the sifter until YOU ARE READY for them to be sifted -- no spilling or wasting of your ingredients. Recipes remain accurate, and all dough types are blended more uniformly. Top "Lid" keeps the flour from wafting out of the sifter, and clean-up time is reduced. Sifter is well-made of stainless steel, with rubber handle that gives comfort and ease of use. After use, a simple rinsing with hot water will make it look good-as-new. Tip: For recipe accuracy, MEASURE the ingredients BEFORE sifting.

Baked some Italian Bread on these -- worked perfectly. Farberware Pans are of high-quality steel, and coated with a durable non-stick surface. The 3-Piece Set  of pans ensures the perfect size for every baking need. They'd make a nice gift for the "Baker" in your family !!
Birkenstocks are the gold standard of comfortable footwear -- and have been for decades !!

We got sick & tired of paying $4 to $5 per loaf for edible bread, so the Kitchen Goddess and I decided to make our own. After consulting with our Italian breadmaking friends and a few recipe sources, including Cuisinarts, we started our list of necessary ingredients. I guess we should call our bread "Amazon Italian", since many of the ingredients and utensils used were bought here at Amazon.  Yeast - Fleischmann's Active Dry Yeast -- the same great stuff that our mothers and grandmothers used.  Flour - King Arthur Bread Flour -- unbleached. Premium high-protein flour. Made in USA since 1790.  Agave Nectar -- used in place of cane sugar.  Water -- Double-Charcoal-Filtered.  Salt -- Himalayan Grinder salt.  Oil -- Garlic-Infused Avocado oil used in place of extra-virgin olive oil. The above ingredients were purchased at Amazon. Flour, salt, and yeast were sifted together with an OXO Good Grips "Shaker" sifter. Bread was baked on Farberware "No-Stick" Baking Pan. Silicone Baking Sheet from Artisan Metal Works kept the bread from sticking, without the need for a corn-meal "dusting". The above utensils were purchased at Amazon. Using Amazon-purchased ingredients and utensils and a combination of recipes, we made 2 beautiful loaves of Crusty Italian Bread -- with excellent color, texture, and flavor. The Fleischmann's Yeast worked perfectly -- easy to measure, easy to store, and completely worry-free. Refrigerate after opening. The 4-oz. jar = 16 envelopes. Product of Canada.

ALL Energy Suspension Products have a color-coded part number -- the letter at the end of the part number designates the color. A "G" at the end indicates a BLACK Urethane; while an "R" at the end means the Urethane is RED. Check carefully before ordering so as not to recieve the wrong color. This Low-Profile Bump-Stop is well made of the super-tough Urethane formula that has been leading the high-performance suspension industry for decades. Comes with a plated bolt (embedded into the Urethane) and a Ny-Lok nut that won't vibrate loose, even under severe off-road conditions. Easily installed, and ready for the toughest demands on your off-roader or strictly-street machine. Won't rust, rot, or fall off -- this bump stop does the job, and will last for years. I have used these bump-stops on my personal vehicles, including 2 Land Cruisers, 1 Crown Vic, and 1 Grand Marquis -- with never a failure. I have also installed these on customers' vehicles, with never a return or complaint of any kind. It's a low-cost, last-forever, easily installed problem solver. Get a pair !!

Excellent cover for the Galaxy S5 -- all ports exposed for easy access, but the camera lenses are still protected from scratches. The case seems sturdy, and it improves phone grip while preventing damage to the phone's edges, ports, and lenses. .The gold color is a bit off, but the case doesn't look cheap or flimsy. I think it's a good value at $9.99 -- would buy another one if/when this one wears out. My order arrived promptly and undamaged.

These solid copper, 16-ounce mugs are beautiful to behold, and a real pleasure to drink from!!For best results, hand wash and keep them in the freezer @ zero degrees.For the PERFECT Moscow Mule to share with a Spouse or Special Friend: Stolichnaya recommends 2 ounces of Ginger Beer to each 1 ounce of Vodka: Our Favorite Mule Recipe2 - Mugs @ zero degrees F.2 - 8-ounce cans of STOLI Ginger Beer.2 - Juice from 1/4th Lime.1/2 Cup Crushed Ice.8 - Ounces of Stolichnaya (Russian) Vodka Pour 1 can of Ginger Beer into each frozen Mug.Squeeze 1/4th lime into each Mug. Add 1/4th cup ice to each Mug. Add 4 Ounces of Stolichnaya Vodka to each Mug. Add squeezed 1/4th Lime to each Mug. Stir to blend flavors. Relax and enjoy the kick of a genuine Stoli Moscow Mule !!

The prefect nostalgia gift for the Veteran in your life !! Every Veteran remembers the P-38 and the P-51, and I got a set to have Silver-Plated and wear around my neck. I think this is the jewelery bargain of the century, and I plan to buy more for my Veteran friends. My order arrived promptly and in perfect condition.

Common sense would tell me that Epsom Salts are all the same -- HOWEVER, common sense is not so common these days. My wife of 34 years has had problems with aching feet and ankles for over 40 years, and soaks them regularly and religiously in Epsom Salts to relieve the achiness. Tried every brand we could find, with the same results, regardless of brand or dosage. Then, we stumbled on the "Epsoak" brand, in the convenient 5-lb. re-sealable plastic pouch.  BINGO!!, we have a winner !! Using the same 1-cup-per-gallon-of-water, the results were(and are) wonderful !! Quicker, longer-lasting relief every soak, and she sleeps so much better -- it's a blessing for both of us !! Highly recommended !!

The Goodyear Comfortred Touring tire is an excellent choice for drivers who demand  premium comfort  and maximum control on all types of road surfaces. Trips through and around the mountains and valleys of the desert Southwest and the Rocky Mountains in heavy rains or desert heat have given our family both comfort and safety for thousands of miles. Load rating = 98. Speed Rating = T =118mph. Wide tread gives excellent grip. Deep tread resists aquaplaning. Thousands of sipes provide traction on wet/slippery roads. Computer tread design gives quiet ride. Perfect for large sedans. These features combine for the best Touring Tire that I've ever owned. Highly recommended !!
Just right for my needs -- the convenient 4-Pack is great. 3M quality at Amazon prices -- tough to beat !!

Stoli Ginger Beer -- Got it !!Stolichnaya Vodka -- Got it !!1-Half Lime -- Got it !! Ice @ 0 degrees -- Got it !! 2 Solid Copper Mugs @ 0 degrees -- Got 'em !! Watch Carefully. Add Ice to mugs. Squeeze 1/4th of Lime into each mug. Pour 1-half can (4 ounces) of Ginger Beer into each mug. Add 2 ounces of Stolichnaya Vodka into each mug. Stir and garnish with 1/4th Lime. Relax together, and enjoy the kick of the  Perfect Moscow Mule.

If you have a broken or missing rear end link, this item will do as a replacement -- providing that you just drive the car to the grocery store that's less than 2 miles away. This item is of little quality, which is reflected by the cheap price and cheap materials The rubber end link bushings are neither strong nor durable. Do yourself a favor and get a set of Energy Suspension Urethane end link kits.
Another Dorman product that gets the job done at a low cost. Recommended.

Just the ticket to keep an old PC in perfect running order. Good enough for e-mail and shopping, and lets the rest of the family use the GOOD computer for other things. The PC100 stick drops right in, and revives that old PC in just a few minutes. PNY products have served me well in the past. Recommended.

The Samsung 16GB Micro SDHC is the perfect card for the Garvin 66LMT -- it can and will handle any and all updates to the software for years to come. The 66LMT can handle a 32GB card, but , according to Garmin Support, that would be an expensive over-kill. This Samsung EVO Class 10 card is big enough and fast enough to get the job done well -- and at a minumum of expense. It's water-proof, shock-proof, X-ray-proof, magnet-proof, and probably idiot-proof, too !! If you have a Garvin 66LMT, this is the card you  need !! My order arrived promptly, and in perfect condition.

This excellent KENSUN product arrived promptly and in perfect condition. The shipping box contained: 1 Tire inflator with attached 100 psi gauge, 10-foot cord with cigar-lighter adapter, 3-foot flexible nylon hose with quick-release connector, 3 pump nozzle-adapters, 1 valve remover/thread die combination, 1 set of battery clamps-to-power adapter, 1 fuse, and 1 pair of white cotton gloves -- all contained neatly in a sturdy black locking case. The handy Pump/Inflator can pump up basketballs and pool toys in a few seconds, while the bigger jobs -- auto tires, etc. will take longer. I balanced my car's tire pressures (including the spare) in just a few minutes. The little pump packs easily in the car's trunk -- perfect as a safety feature when traveling to or in remote areas. My experience with KENSUN products has been positive in the past, and I expect that the new Pump/Inflator will serve me well in the future.

I ordered and received the 709-02 Kit that comes in a clear-fronted plastic storage case. The case is sturdy, with a latch on the front and 2 hinges on the back. Inside are 4 small compartments that hold sanding bands and discs -- with 4 larger compartments that hold mandrels, polishing felts, and various stones and polishing compound. Pieces stay neatly organized -- saves time and hassle. Case measures 8 1/4 inches high, 7 1/2 inches wide, and 1 3/4 inches deep -- with a hook hole at the top so you can hang it on the wall to save space.

Found this Cordless Dremel tool as a replacement for a 25-year-old corded model, and the new 8100-N/21 fits my needs and my budget perfectly.Comes with a black plastic case, one (1) Lithium-ion battery, a quick charger, and a bag of assorted sanding/grinding/polishing accessories. First charge took only 35 minutes, and the tool ran for 80 minutes at about 1/2 -power before it started to slow down. I use the Dremel for grinding, de-burring, sanding, and polishing of small auto and truck parts and household appliances. Wife tried it on the dog's nails, and was impressed with the ease of use and the excellent results. Doggie never flinched or wimpered, which is great news, since she always balked at "nail time" ! We plan to use the new Dremel often, so I ordered the 110-piece Dremel Accessories Kit so we can do whatever, whenever. Got the whole deal - Dremel tool and accessory kit for for less than 100 clams, right here at Amazon. My order arrived promptly, and in perfect conditon.

These tough, inexpensive black plastic wire separators are the perfect choice for keeping your ignition wires separated and neatly in place.They snap on easily, and help to keep your wires looking neat and away from hot manifolds and moving linkage. High-voltage ignition wires need to be kept separated to avoid power-robbing cross-fire, and these looms do the job cheaply and effectively. The separators fit and hold 7mm and 8mm wires firmly in place while they tidy up the engine compartment. I bought 2 sets for our Mercury V-8 -- engine compartment looks sharp when wires are neatly organized, and the wires won't rub together and damage the insulation. A cheap fix, and well worth the money !!

This is an accurate, well-made tool with a lot of good, usable features. I especially like the large, easy-to-read digital indicator -- big enough to read easily, but not TOO big and/or bulky. Has ON/OFF button. Comes in a gray, padded, plastic case -- with an extra CR2032 Battery. Includes Operating Instructions & Parts Manual. There's room in the case for small Silica Gel Packs (not included) to help protect against moisture damage. An excellent value at under 30 dollars.

The Kitchen Goddess could not buy this marvelous item locally -- and it became my job to find some. Amazon to the rescue !! My order arrived promptly, and the container was un-damaged. No spills, no mess. Kitchen Goddess swears by Spic & Span -- she says there's nothing better for floors, walls, woodwork, tile, and for spot-cleaning the laundry, too !! I use it to clean up spills on the garage floor, where it does a great job. A 50-50 mix with water sprayed on grass-stains keeps the boys' jeans looking good, and the girls use it to brighten their tennis shoes. Kitchen Goddess knows what's best for her family, and we ALL prefer the pleasant smell of the Yellow Spic & Span -- instead of that Pine-y, stinky  stuff.

These stainless-steel hose clamps are just the right size for repairing fuel hoses, air hoses, garden sprayers, etc. -- and for clamping things together until the glue dries !!They're  'Made in the USA', too !I keep  some handy in the shop all the time -- just in case !!

The Force Performance Chip (All Models) has the following Pros and Cons: Pros:1. It's cheap.2. It's easy to install.3. It doesn't take up much room.4. You'll be proud of yourself for installing it properly.5. When you've determined that it is useless, they'll refund your money. Cons:1. There is no "chip" inside.2. There's a cheap resistor inside.3. It does nothing but confuse the ECM.4. The perceived benefits are imaginary.5. You'll be sorry that you fell for the hype.

I've been using the Ford-recommended 5-W-30 oil in my Mercury 4.6 Liter V-8 for several years -- but after trying the Mobil 1 5-W-20 Extended Performance Synthetic for several thousand miles, I've noticed a more quiet engine and less oil consumption. I prefer an oil that's available almost everywhere, from Alabama to Wyoming, from city to country -- wherever I live or travel.  Mobil 1 5-W-20 Extended Performance Synthetic delivers outstanding performance by helping to keep my engine cleaner, quieter, and cooler-running -- and at an afFORDable price !! Meets ILSAC GF-5, Chrysler, Ford, and GM specs -- plus some Japanese and European specs. too. Due to the oil's ability to remain stable at very high and low temperatures, I wouild recommend this oil for all gasoline engines -- including turbocharged and supercharged, domestic or foreign -- regardless of climate.Update: 12 December, 2014 -- My 4.6 Liter V-8 has recorded an overall fuel mileage increase of 0.31 miles-per-gallon since switching to Mobil1 5-W-20 EP from Mobil1 5-W-30 back on September 1st, 2014. -- about 3,000 miles ago.

Still learning about my Garmin 66LMT, but it looks really good, so far !! I programed a 30-mile trip into it, and it got me there quickly and with no fuss or muss -- or any voices yelling out "recalculating", as so many others have complained about. The 6-inch (diagonal) screen is easy to read, with real-time elevation, posted speed limits, current vehicle speed, over-speed warning, up-ahead direction indicator, distance before turns, and a legible map were just a few of the features that make for easy navigation -- and without all the usual "Oh, s**t, we missed the off-ramp!" exclamations along the way !! Example: Samantha says "Three-quarters of a mile ahead, turn right onto 75th Avenue." -- which gives me a plenty of time to get in the proper lane. Wife and I both liked the clear, well-enunciated voice (Samantha) -- and the timely, easy-to-follow instructions that she gave. What we liked most about our new gizmo was the "HOME" button -- the machine knows where we live, and it took us there quickly and by a very convenient route. It has a "qwerty" keyboard and a numbers pad, so entering info while on the road is quick and easy -- but PLEASE don't attempt it while driving !! Anyways, we love our Garmin 66LMT, and look forward to some long, out-of-state trips. We got a great "50 Dollars Off" deal at Amazon, too !!

It's a bit pricey, but well worth the cost -- I spent the extra bucks to do a complete (drained transmission AND torque converter) fluid change when changing the transmission filter and installing a B&M Shift Improver Kit.  I stuck with the Mobil 1 synthetic, and I'm glad I did. The transmission shifts beautifully -- crisp, firm up-shifts and down-shifts -- with no lag or hesitation. Here in the desert climate, the extra protection against heat build-up will help my transmission run cooler and last longer -- and when I go to the cold country, the synthetic fluid will flow properly at extremely cold temps, too. Amazon's price was lower than the local parts/speed shops -- it's a no-brainer!!

This cord is clearly shown in the product description to be rated at just 10 Amps, that it is only 18 guage wire, which is NOT suitable for a device with high-amp current draw -- but does a fine job on computers and other low-amp devices !! Devices such as vacuum cleaners and projectors require 14-guage wire to carry high amperage safely.Comparing this power cord to the original one that came with the DELL computer, this one gets a better rating than the OEM cord. Less resistance, heavier insulation, and better fittings than the OEM cord combine to make this the perfect choice to replace your lost, stolen, or damaged computer power cord. The cord measures exactly 6 feet in length.

I read a ton of reviews regarding the compatability of the  GN097-USB mount with various models of the Garmin gps, and considered many pros and cons before deciding on a course of action when mounting a Garmin 66 LMT in my Mercury Grand Marquis. The GN097-USB is listed by Garmin as "incompatible" with models that employ the "LMT" features, (= Lifetime Maps/Traffic) because the USB doesn't deliver enough power to meet the requirements of the "LMT" features -- the power cord that comes with the Garmin unit DOES deliver adequte power, so here's what I did: I bought the USB mount, and cut off the USB cord flush with the stalk. When fully extended (straight), the mount measures 8 1/4 inches overall, but the plugged-in length is 6 1/2 inches. The mount plugs directly into the cigar lighter, and stands straight up out of the ash tray/cupholder, so there is no wiggling, jiggling, or flopping around. The charger that comes with the Garmin 66LMT plugs into an under-dash power supply (cigar lighter type) and feeds the Garmin plenty of power to supply the Updates/Maps/Traffic information that the USB cord can't cope with. The modified USB mount is less bulky than the regular GN097, which has the plug-in socket on the side of the stalk, where it is clumsy and cumbersome -- Cutting off the USB cord makes the whole installation neater and cleaner-looking from all angles, and it allows full access to the heater/AC controls. I modified the Arkon Mount even further, by removing the adjustment screw and knob that connects the upper and lower parts of the mount. An 8 1/2 inch length of 3/4 inch Schedule 40 PVC pipe was added between the upper and lower sections, which made the Garmin stand up higher where it could be more visible and easier to read. Two wraps of 3M electrician's tape around each section made for a snug fit when pressed into the PVC pipe. 2 coats of black paint for the PVC pipe, and the modified Arkon Mount gives me the height and stability that I need -- with no flimsy wires, no suction cups, no blocking of air vents, no flopping around, no bulkiness, and all the power I'll ever need to quickly charge the Garmin's battery and drive those LMT options !!Note: The LMT features take up most of the internal memory, so an additional Micro-card is recommended. Garmin Support suggests a 16MB Micro-card as the largest size that is practical, and that a 32MB card is the MAXIMUM size that the unit will accept. I opted for the recommended 16GB Micro-card, which should cover all info and updates for several years. A shake-down cruise with the Garmin 66LMT and the modified GN-097 USB mount was a great success -- The mount was sturdy and steady, with no shaking or flopping around. Wire from 66LMT to under-dash power supply left the area neat and uncluttered. The whole deal is easy to remove and stash neatly in the glove box. I searched high and low for a mount that would fit my needs exactly, and the Arkon GN097 USB was as close as I could get. A bit of tinkering, and I got exactly what I wanted. Give it a try, and see for yourself !!

The Dorman Striker Bolt fits perfectly and makes the car door close firmly and quietly -- and for A LOT less money than the Dealer Part. The Cadmium-plated bolt has a black guard that prevents clothes from snagging on the bolt when getting in and/or out. Includes spring washer and thermoplastic bushing. You'll need a T47 Torx driver to remove and install the bolts. Thread size is M10x1.5mm. Fits various Ford, Mercury, and Lincoln - 1980-2006

These Energy Suspension urethane bump stops are stronger, last longer, and resist oil, salt, and chemicals better than any rubber type of stops. The Cadmium-plated mounting bolt and Ny-Lock nut keep them where you put them -- and they'll stay put for years !! They have many uses on both on-and-off-road vehicles, and on the farm, as well.

The B&M Shift Improver Kit #40264 fits the following applications:FORD CROWN VICTORIA BASE 1992-1995FORD CROWN VICTORIA LX 1992-1995FORD CROWN VICTORIA POLICE INTERCEPTOR 1993-1995FORD CROWN VICTORIA S 1992-1995FORD CROWN VICTORIA TOURING SEDAN 1992FORD E-150 ECONOLINE BASE 1995FORD E-150 ECONOLINE XL 1995FORD E-150 ECONOLINE CLUB WAGON CHATEAU 1995FORD E-150 ECONOLINE CLUB WAGON CUSTOM 1995FORD E-150 ECONOLINE CLUB WAGON XLT 1995FORD F-150 PICKUP EDDIE BAUER 1995FORD F-150 PICKUP SPECIAL 1995FORD F-150 PICKUP XL 1995FORD F-150 PICKUP XLT 1995FORD MUSTANG GT 1994-1995FORD MUSTANG GTS 1995FORD MUSTANG LX 1993FORD THUNDERBIRD LX 1994-1995FORD THUNDERBIRD SUPER COUPE 1994-1995LINCOLN MARK VIII BASE 1993-1995LINCOLN MARK VIII LSC 1995LINCOLN TOWN CAR BASE 1992-1995LINCOLN TOWN CAR CARTIER 1992-1995LINCOLN TOWN CAR CYPRESS 1992-1995LINCOLN TOWN CAR EXECUTIVE 1992-1995LINCOLN TOWN CAR JACK NICKLAUS 1993LINCOLN TOWN CAR SIGNATURE 1992-1995LINCOLN TOWN CAR TOURING EDITION 1992-1995LINCOLN TOWN CAR TOURNAMENT EDITION 1994MERCURY COUGAR XR-7 1994-1995MERCURY GRAND MARQUIS GS 1992-1995MERCURY GRAND MARQUIS LS1992-1995Kit comes with all parts necessary to do a transmission upgrade to quicker, more positive shifts, less heat build-up, and a longer transmission life. You will need a hydraulic jack and a clean, flat surface and 4 jack stands to support the vehicle. You'll need a 1/4-inch electric drill-- and a small jar of Vaseline (to hold small parts in place). I use a Craftsman "clicker" torque wrench (inch/pound type) to be sure of proper torque on all bolts. Over-tightening of the bolts can warp the valve body and ruin the tranny and all your work. B&M suggests that you have 10 quarts of the proper type of trans fluid on hand. I drained the torque converter, too -- so it took 12.5 quarts to bring the level back to "Full". Put the 10 quarts in first, and add the rest after the trans is fully warmed up. Check the fluid level with engine fully warmed up (driven for 10 miles), and DO NOT OVER-FILL !! I spent the extra dough to get Mobil 1 Synthetic Trans Fluid -- Amazon's price was better than the local shops. These transmissions are electronically controlled by the ECM (computer) -- To avoid electrical problems with computer-controlled devices, disconnect the NEGATIVE battery cable before work begins! Review the included instructions CAREFULLY before beginning -- the list of required tools is short, but be SURE to have the proper snap-ring pliers on hand !! ALL of the necessary drill bits are included in the kit, but you'll only need the 5/64ths drill bit for the "RV-Heavy Duty" option. Handle ALL parts carefully, being careful to avoid any source of dirt/debris. This entire job CAN be completed in one day -- but I allow an extra few hours to take extra care and avoid being rushed. I had already installed a B&M Drain Plug Kit, so the job of changing the fluid and filter wouldn't be messy. Be careful to SAVE the original (RE-USEABLE) pan gasket -- clean it carefully with WD-40 before re-installing. Some brands of Trans Filters come with a cork gasket, but these things are a nasty mess to install, and even worse to remove at your next filter change!! I recommend using the Motorcraft FT100 Automatic Transmission Filter - it's of premium quality, Made in the USA, and available at Amazon. Re-use the original gasket for best results !! Use diesel fuel to clean all parts -- it's cheap and non-explosive !! I have installed the same and similar B&M Kits in the Ford C-6 and the 4R70W automatic transmissions with excellent results. The Kit comes with complete instructions, but you can print a copy of the instructions (downloaded the PDF from JEGS.com) to study while you're waiting for your kit to arrive -- it'll help you line up the job and to have the necessary stuff on hand before you start work.Good Luck !! Update: Using the "RV-Heavy Duty" option, a Shake-Down cruise on city streets, freeways, and some mountain driving showed impressive improvements over the stock transmission -- shifting was firm and positive, on both the up-shift and the down-shift. The most noticable improvement was in the feel of the trans during mountain driving -- a better feeling of being "connected" to the road. Didn't do "before & after" timing runs, but the car felt a bit quicker under acceleration. Will need to run several tanks of gas through it before checking for mileage improvements.

This is an excellent pre-filter ahead of a granular carbon filter in a dual-filter, under-sink unit, such as the Omni Deluxe. This filter cartridge installs in the inlet side of the dual unit, with a granular carbon filter in the outlet end -- for an odorless, tasteless sediment-free water that is great for drinking, cooking, and watering delicate plants. When connected in series with a granular carbon filter, the dual cartridges last from 6 months to a year without changing the water's taste. We've saved a BUNDLE with an under-sink filter, and these cartridges keep our water pure and the bottled-water nightmare is gone !!

These replacement generic electric toothbrush heads fit the following models of Oral B/Braun electric toothbrushes: 3D Excel Advance Power Professional Care Professional Care Smart Series Pro Health Triumph TriZone Vitality Dual Clean Vitality Precision Clean They are NOT compatible with: CrossAction Power Pulsonic Sonic Complete Vitality Sonic  Package is marked "Soft Bristles". Rounded-end bristle material is of DuPont "TYNEX". No  country of origin is specified. The dual-action brush heads fit perfectly to our Oral B 3D Excel and Triumph models, and the bristles are softer and gentler on the gums than the original Oral B brand. Our dentist and orthodontist both recommend the softer bristles, and that the brush heads be changed every 3 months. The brush heads fit perfectly and work smoothly and quietly. The 16-Pack is an excellent value. Highly recommended !

For the price, these earbuds have surprisingly rich sound. Vocals are clear, highs are crisp. Bass is adequate, but not thundering. If you're a hip hop fan, you might want just a little bit more.The overall quality is very good (as has been the case for all Mengo products I've tested). I have an ear where I'm missing much of the tragus (the little flap that's closest to your cheeks), so many earbuds don't stay put in my ear - the iPhone buds are the worst and slip off immediately. Thankfully, the Mengos stay put very well thanks to several earbud options of different sizes and shapes.The wires also seem to be reinforced and give it a nice high-quality feel. There is an inline button and a mic. The button does not control volume. One tap pauses a song. Two taps skips forward one track. Holding it button engages the voice command on my LG G3 phone. The sound quality during a call is very good. Unfortunately, there is no clip on the mic, so you really need to hold it up to your mouth for the other party to hear you clearly.Overall, this is a great pair of everyday earbuds! I've owned may earphones that cost under $20, and this one has some of the best sound in that category.I received a highly discounted sample in return for an honest review.

I regularly take Arginine and Citrulline to help with workouts and other things that depend on increased blood flow. So I was excited to try the Cellucor NO Pump Amplifier. Unfortunately, this product only has very weak effects on me. I get much better performance boost from using the cheap Arginine/Citrulline complex from Source Naturals. This stuff is pricier and weaker.

I'm not sure how much real scientific research has been done on the compounds in this. But I didn't notice any changes in my cognitive powers.The main effect I felt was less anxiety. Life can be pretty stressful right now for me, but I honestly find that taking this relaxes me quite a bit. It's a mental relaxation. I don't really feel much effect physically, like I would if I took Xanax or something similar. It's calming, and I like that.

I was surprised by how thick this paste is. It was dense and rubbery. I could put it down with a finger without my finger going through it. Hence, this product goes and pretty thick and leaves behind a sticky texture on the hair. It's great if you really need a lot of sculpting that will hold, but not if you want your hair to be more free and flowing. You definitely want to use this on damp hair and it will be difficult to spread thoroughly on dry hair.The smell is like generic men products, which I'm not a fan of. Wish it was unscented.

This is a pretty small bag of kale chips. Kale is costlier than potatoes, so it's not a fair comparison to say that this is an expensive product. If you're used to buying "superfoods" that are organic, the cost is par for these products.I tested the Kool Ranch flavor. Don't expect it to taste like Doritos. The ranch flavor is subtle, but the overall flavor is more complex than I was expecting. I liked the flavor, but I like kale, and the other ingredients these chips contain: kale, sunflower seeds, tahini, carrot, cane sugar, apple cider vinegar, onion, seal salt, lemon juice, dill weed, garlic, white pepper. I wish they had left out the sugar since this product doesn't need it. The garlic and onion taste like the powder forms, and could have been used more judiciously to let the kale flavor be more prominent.The texture of these chips is thick and hearty and I did enjoy it, along with the crunch. It's not the lightweight homemade version of kale chips. Unfortunately, these chips are also a bit fragile, and my bag had too many crushed up small pieces.

I've been testing this out during a camping road trip on the West Coast. In 4 days, I've encountered campsites that have been swarming with hundreds of mosquitoes, and I haven't been bit once yet! Neither have my trip friends, except when they didn't put this stuff on. The mosquitoes do come up very close and hang around uncomfortably close, but worry not, they don't seem to land on exposed skin and don't bite. Having used repellants with high amounts of DEET in the past, Odomos is more effective in my experience.

This is a good quality wiper and has been working perfectly during this very rainy year in central Texas. The design is classic and the wipers make good contact with the glass for clean wipes without streaks. It's also stable at highway speeds and doesn't rattle.The open design does have some drawbacks however. I have a tree that has been dropping a ton of flowers and leaves next to my driveway. The debris is constantly getting stuck in the open spaces and hinges of the wipers. And if you live in northern states, snow and ice will accumulate in those gaps, making it troublesome during winter.

I've been using palm sugar (aka coconut sugar, jaggery, etc.) for many years. I love its rich complex flavor and subtler sweetness compared to table sugar. But a lot of palm sugar comes in hard chunks that have to be shaved or hacked off to be used. And it doesn't dissolve readily either.This palm syrup tastes every bit as good as the solid stuff, but is much easier to use. If you've never had palm sugar, it tastes similar to brown sugar but more complex. I like to use it in cocktails based on rum or whiskey, instead of a simple syrup. It gives the drink more depth. It also has a lower glycemix index than table sugar - but that doesn't necessarily make it healthy.

While our little one, Gomez, is too small for such complicated assembly sets, we decided to give our twin nephews, Marcus and Brad, the KForce Build and Blast and let them have at it! With nearly 400 pieces and six different ways to assemble the thing - including two guns, which of course the nine-year-old boys immediately wanted to build - we suggest you make sure you keep the long instructions AND the box for the final pictures.And given our Texas locale, the boys were right at home tearing through the streets with their newly built guns, and proud of what they built. But it wasn't easy and it didn't happen fast.If you're looking for the assembly challenge of Legos, the engineering and movement of erectors and, you know, the blast 'em in the face of Nerfs, well the KForce might be for you.But it took a long time, and some slightly frazzled kids (not to mention adults) to figure it out. And the set doesn't have its own containment case, so once it starts getting pulled apart - and heaven help you if the pieces get mixed in with the Legos - well, it's time to throw up your hands and just try to build a truck or something out of the remaining parts. Still, my understanding is that this set is easier to put together then some other K'Nex sets, like the Ferris wheel.By the way, two things to add so you're not surprised. The cross bow is not actually a functioning cross bow, it just looks like one. And be warned, the KForce shoots 75 feet! That's a lot of power, even for a soft dart. At one of two feet, that thing hurts. We know this by experience as the first person my nephew shot was me. Ouch!In the end, even for the steep price, the newest K'Nex kit delivers!

For a battery powered chainsaw, this is pretty good. It's lightweight and great for small jobs. I've cut logs up to 6" thick with it without issues. It's nice to have a battery powered chainsaw for its portability, but you do trade power for it. It includes a battery and a charger, though the battery can be charged on the saw itself.The construction of the saw is not the best. The plastic feels thin and bends while using. It has stayed together but I'm doubtful about the longevity of this unit. The chain blades also aren't that sharp, though they were adequate for my needs. Still, I would prefer a sharper blade and might consider sharpening these.There are other cordless chainsaw choices out there. Scotts isn't really known for power tools. And with cordless tools, the battery is usually quite valuable and it makes sense to stick to one brand's line of cordless tools to take advantage of battery interchangeability. Since Scotts doesn't have that many power tools available, I would consider a chainsaw from Black & Decker instead of this one (they have a 10" saw for about the same price as this). B&D has many more cordless tools in their inventory that you could use their battery with.

I got this to make high extraction flour from whole wheat that I mill myself. I had tried a Winco 22-mesh sieve before and it was letting too much bran through. This 50-mesh sieve is perfect for keeping the bran out and results in a very fine high extraction flour. I had debated between a 50 and 70 mesh and am happy with the 50-mesh for my needs. I feel like with a 70-mesh, it would be very difficult and time-consuming to sift the flour through.The overall quality is good and the size is perfect for me (I do large batch sizes). It's about as big a seive as I would want because anything bigger would be difficult to use. Remember, you will still need a large container to sift the flour into. The larger the better.

Things I liked:- Good thickness- Felt like it had a solid foam core - could tell there were multiple layers of foam used- Good length, could be used for someone taller- Well cushioned. My hands and feet really sunk into it, kind of like with a memory foam mattress- The underside was pretty grippy, which was better than the top side with the logo on it.Things I didn't like:- Very slippery and shiny. Odd since they bill this as a "non-slip" mat.- Intense new mat smell. Hope this dissipates over the next few weeks- Wasn't much different overall from the starter cheapy mat I bought at a yoga studio - same materials, just a little thicker and a little more slippery on the top sideIn regards to grip, I would give my Jade Harmony yoga mat a 9 out of 10, and a regular Gaiam mat a 6 out of 10.  The back of this one I would give a 7 or an 8 out of ten, but the top side I would give a 5 or 6 out of 10. Again,  I'm sure the slipperiness will fade over the course of a month or so, but again, I was surprised how slippery it was.I received this mat at a discounted rate in return for an honest and unbiased review.

I've only tried this and another, headset but that one had to be connected to the phone with a wire. So right away I liked that there were no wires to deal with thanks to the Bluetooth connection. I quickly glanced at the manual, turned it on and started using it - it was very easy to pair and use. As for the quality, it's decent. It took me a little while to get used to the fact that you have ear buds on and this means that you don't hear everything that goes on around you like the sound of traffic and other exterior noises. I just make a mental note to be a bit more aware when I have the headset on. The earbuds were a little snug on my ears and hurt a bit, but I have small ears so that might not be a problem for others. As for sound quality, it's decent. It is not as clear as when I am talking in the phone directly, but it's clear enough to have a conversation while driving on the highway. Family members at the other end did note that I sounded like I was on speakerphone. One issue I ran into was how to store the device without breaking it. After trying a few spots in the car I have resorted to hanging it on my rear view mirror. Overall a decent headset.

I love the smell of this soap. The lavender is pronounced, but the sage doesn't smell like Thanksgiving stuffing...it's more spicy smelling. A half push will be plenty of soap for washing hands. It's a thin yellow liquid that doesn't foam, and the smell is quite strong while washing but it dissipates quickly. There is no lavender/sage scent left behind. It's an ephemeral scent treat. My hand is left feeling slightly moistened, but not overly so. I used it on my face too, but it leaves the skin a bit tight and benefits from a moisturizer.The bottle is plastic - glass would have been nice considering the price. You do get quite a bit of soap though, especially if you only use a half pump for cleaning.

I was surprised at how big this oven is, because I thought it would be closer to a normal toaster oven size. But it holds a real 12" pizza, which is great. The selling point of this oven is that it can get to 600F, which is great for cooking up fresh dough pizzas, but not as much for thicker frozen pizzas. The high heat setting on a thick pizza will burn the outside before the inside is cooked. But that setting works adequately for thin crust frozen pizzas, as long as you watch the pie and turn it once or more to get the right amount of crispiness without burning. The rear of the oven runs hotter than the front, probably because there is additional reflected heat from the rear wall - pretty common in all ovens without convection.  Speaking of which, a convection setting would have made this oven perfect and able to cook pizzas even faster.I think the strength of this oven is in cooking fresh homemade New York style pizzas (a thinner crust that might have a little bit of sugar and oil in it to help with browning). The high heat and low profile chamber gives it a nice rise and bits of browning on the cheese, better than in an unmodified full size oven. The oven does not get hot enough for Neapolitan-style pizza.Ultimately, this is a dedicated machine for mostly pizzas. It's not as versatile as a pizza oven. maybe you can make cookies with the lower setting. It's big and gets pretty hot on the outside and requires quite a bit of dedicated space.

This lube goes on wet, like WD40, but dries pretty fast. It's thin so it penetrates well. It stopped my door hinges from squeaking instantly. It doesn't stink like WD40, but has a faint lube smell if you put your nose to it.I wish the included spray straw had a finer tip to really get into tight spaces without having to spray excess lube. But the force of the spray and the thin viscosity ensures that the lube still works it way in, even if you have to deal with some drips.I like that the straw snaps onto the cap for storage.

I had a pretty bad rodent infestation in my outdoor shed. I cleaned it pretty thoroughly and setup some traps, poison and this scent-away. Apparently, peppermint scent is supposed to keep the rodents away. The shed is pretty small and the scent from this bag is overpowering to me, so I had high hopes.I checked the shed a week after placing this bag in it, and I still saw signs of rodents being present. The poison bars were half eaten, and there were droppings throughout. No sign of a dead rodent in the traps though. Clearly, this scent-away did not keep the rodents away. Oh well.

This shower curtain looks and feels nice. It's not really waffle texture, and has shiny raised squares, rather than a grid of recessed squares. I don't mind that it doesn't look like a waffle. The fabric has a good amount of weight to it and also has weights on the bottom hem.I recommend using it with a separate liner. It's polyester, and does soak up water when it gets wet. maybe it dries quickly under normal conditions, but it's been rainy and humid most of this year in central Texas, and things tend to stay damp and get moldy. While this is washable, I'd rather not have mold grow on it in the first place. So yeah, use a liner if you're in a humid environment.The overall quality is very good and I'm happy to have this in my bathroom.

Well known in the recording industry, Tascam delivers a multi-purpose home recording cardioid condenser for the budget-minded.Utilizing an 18mm diaphragm, larger than the majority of the Tascam microphone line, frequency response is stated being very wide at 20hz-20khz. This combined with the circuit design produces an equalization profile relatively even up to mids around 1khz, with boosts starting at 6.5khz to 10khz, rolling off noticeably upward. Lack of a pad is somewhat made up forby a stated SPL of 136dB, which adds to the options one can record.Sources such as cymbals came through well with upper register accents, and string instruments produce a defined body. Mid and high response can compliment higher range voices, although a low cut switch would be a great addition to clean up excess low end frequencies. The aluminium body construction is solid, but out-of-studio use would not be recommended. Overall the microphone makes a good complement to other mics due to the upper mid/high emphasis.Considering that accessories include a shock mount, mini desk stand, and short XLR cable, the TM-80 would make a great addition to a home studio looking for versatility with affordability.Pros:  Great mid and high response. Full body from the low mids. Solid build quality.Cons: Lack of Pad/Low Cut switch. Mid vocal frequency lacks emphasis. Rolloff above 10k can lead to “radio” sound

The Vector 180 is a great drive that is compatible with many laptops and desktops due to its 7mm 2.5" form factor. It also looks sleek, but you won't really see much of it once it's installed. Vector touts this series of drives for their reliability as well as the hassle-free ShieldPlus warranty process, which is one of the best in its class (they'll send a replacement with a prepaid label to ship back the defective drive. No receipts required, just the serial #).Performance-wise, I find the drive to be pretty speedy for my needs, especially compared to non-SSD drives that I've recently used. If you look at benchmark tests, this drive performs in the middle of the pack compared to similar drives from Samsung (best) and Crucial (worst).A drawback of this drive is that it consumes more power than other drives in its class. Even compared to the Vector 150 series, power consumption is 15-50% higher as reported by some hardware sites. This is not an issue for me since I use this in a desktop, but I'd consider other options if you're looking for a laptop drive.

While this (rather pricey) toothgel might actually be good for your teeth and gums, I don't really like using it. It just does not leave my mouth feeling clean. I don't mind that the flavor is very subtle (of mint and aloe vera); most toothpastes from the big corporations taste way too artificial and sweet anyway. However, I do mind that my teeth still feel like they have gunk on them even after using my fancy electric toothbrush for the recommended 2 minutes. I actually had to use my regular toothpaste right after I used TheraBreath.As for the ingredients that make this product unique, there is some scientific basis to it. There is some evidence that CoEnzyme Q10 and aloe vera help with dental issues. As for their proprietary OXY-D, we don't really know what it is except some derivative of sodium chlorite that also contains stabilized oxygen. The idea is that the oxygen is released while brushing and kills anaerobic bacteria that cause bad breath. There seems to be limited research on this topic, but it makes sense that chlorine and oxygen might kill anaerobic bacteria. The product also contains xylitol, which unfortunately will also kill or slow down the good bacteria (probiotics) in your mouth.You can search PubMed and find these research articles (the quoted texts are from the abstracts and not the manuscript titles):"ClO2 mouthwash used over a 7-day period appeared effective in reducing plaque, tongue coating accumulation and the counts of Fusobacterium nucleatum in saliva. Future research is needed to examine long-term effects, as well as effects on periodontal diseases and plaque accumulation in a well-defined sample of halitosis patients and broader population samples." (Shinada 2010)"Topical application of CoQ10 improves adult periodontitis." (Hanioka 1994)"Ubiquinol (reduced form coenzyme Q10) serves as an endogenous antioxidant which increases the concentration of CoQ10 in the diseased gingiva and effectively suppresses advanced periodontal inflammation." (Prakash 2010)"Aloe vera has various medicinal properties like anti-inflammatory, antibacterial, antiviral, and antitumor which accelerates wound healing and helps in treating various lesions in oral cavity." (Sajjad 2014)"it was concluded that aloe vera had a significant anti-inflammatory property. Thus, it can be used as an adjunct to mechanical therapy for treating plaque-induced gingivitis." (Ajmera 2013)

PROS- It's cast iron, which has great thermal mass. You can sear meats well.- It's enamel coated, which means no worrying about seasoning the pan to keep it from rusting.- It's very good quality and large.- Flat lid top which allows for it to be used inverted on a burner, like a grill pan.- Good seal between the lid and pot, preventing moisture loss during long cooking times.CONS- It's cast iron, which means it actually heats very unevenly.- It might be too heavy for those with weak hands.- The grill marks on the lid pan limits its usefulness as a general pan.- The price is on the higher end of enameled cast irons, close to what the French imports cost.- The black interior makes it difficult to judge development of browning of fond, roux, etc.I have a lot of experience using cast iron cookware, but this is my first enameled cast iron pot (aka a French oven. The enamel coating makes it French vs. a Dutch oven which is naked cast iron). The main advantage of this pot over a bare cast iron Dutch oven, is that it does not need to be seasoned and requires less maintenance overall. I own many Dutch ovens, and although I spend the effort to season them thoroughly, the seasoning always becomes vulnerable when a long braise is performed. All the cooking in liquid, especially if it is acidic, takes its toll on the seasoned surface. So for braising, I really prefer an enameled pot such as this one.This Kitchen Aid pot is very nice indeed. I can't really tell the difference between it and a Le Creuset. And honestly, a Lodge brand enameled pot probably performs just as well as these higher priced ones, for less than half the cost. But still, this is a nice pot and I'm happy to have received one to review.It has the main advantage of cast iron, which is high heat capacity and thermal mass. It's great for putting a nice sear on meat to develop flavor before it's braised. But it does stick more than a well-seasoned Dutch oven because the enameled coating isn't as nonstick. But as Jeff Smith, The Frougal Gourmet, used to say, "Hot pan, cold oil. Foods won't stick." And if the chunks of meat you're browning are still stuck, it probably means that you need to leave them alone for a bit longer. They will release themselves when they're ready.Contrary to popular belief, cast iron does not heat evenly. If you want even heating, you need copper or aluminum, which conduct heat much faster, thus evenly. Cast iron heats up very very slowly, hence there is a pretty big gradient of temperatures on the cooking surface. Go ahead and dust the pan's bottom evenly with flour and then place it on a burner. You'll see the area directly above the fire turn brown and black much sooner than the rest of the pot. But this is generally okay for a Dutch/French oven, specially if you're going to put it into an oven to braise for several hours.A note about the lid: I really like that KitchenAid elected to go with a handle-less lid that allows to be used on a burner. Much like the Lodge Double Dutch Oven (one of my favorite pots), it allows you to sear the meat on both the big pot and the lid simultaneously, saving a bit of cooking time. Unfortunately, KitchenAid decided to put grill marks on the lid, which really really limits its usefulness. In my opinion, grill pans are a marketing gimmick. They give you much less surface area for your food to come into contact with the pan when compared to flat pans. They will not brown all over as well, limiting how much flavor is developed. And good luck trying to make pancakes on a grill pan. Some say the ridges help distribute condensation evenly as it drips back down onto the food. I don't think that really matters.The other negative of this pot is the black interior. Sorry, a black coating does not resist staining better than a white one - you just don't see the staining. A black interior makes it more difficult to judge how the cooking is progressing. let's say you're making a Louisiana-style roux, which is cooked to a very deep brown. It becomes difficult to see how brown the roux is before you risk burning it. I prefer a light interior because I can see how all the fond (the tasty stuck on bits) are developing and can stop the cooking before they get burnt. Yes, you have the same problem with an uncoated cast iron pot, but if I'm paying extra for enamel, make it light, please!

With spring right around the corner in our little corner of paradise here in Austin, and baby Gomez still sharing the bedroom with us, we were looking for a small unit that could fit into our city apartment. The AeraMax Baby Air Purifier is perfect for our bedroom that we share with our baby. Although Gomez doesn'thaven't any allergens, we just wanted to purify the air a bit. The  unexpected benefit we discovered was that the smell from the diaper genie is minimized! It also acts as a sort of white noise which helps with warm weather noise of all those hipster scooters. Also, my partner has very bad allergies and has just resorted to taking nasal spray. This seems to help a bit with the allergens, but it's still a little early to see if it's really the machine or the fact that we cut down a few trees outside this past winter. Either way, so far it's worth the money.

I've tried several different headlight restorers in the past, but none of them have really worked. So I was pretty skeptical about Meguiar's 2000 as well. But I have a 2002 Honda Civic that has very oxidized headlights, so I gave it a shot.First, you apply a cleaner by buffing it in with an included sponge. Wipe it off thoroughly (I used a microfiber cloth), and then apply the protector.The cleaner really diminished the yellowing on the lens. It didn't get rid of all the scratches and erosion, but I still think it significantly improved the look of the lens and how much light passes through. Well enough that I don't think I need to get a new headlight assembly for the time being!

In The New Mediterranean Table, Sameh Wadi takes the essential flavors and simplicity of Mediterranean cuisine and weaves them into a beautiful cookbook. It's a cookbook for those jaded by run-of-the-mill Mediterranean cuisine.There are plenty of recipes with a small number of ingredients for the sake of ease and simplicity (e.g. charred fresh chickpeas with oil, lemon juice and salt. That's it.). But then, there are also recipes that demand preserved tuna, rose petals, preserved lemons, and coriander seeds pickled in champagne vinegar. The Paella Croquettes with saffron Aioli will force you to write a checklist of 24 ingredients. The Chicken Bastela might give you an anxiety attack, but then you can calm yourself down with the Roasted Lemonade with Mint and Arak.The recipes are vibrant, fresh and exciting. They're unique enough to keep the experienced cooks interested. They include portions in metric units (thank you!!)

These trays make nice and big ice cubes that look great in fancy cocktails. The ice melts slower, diluting your drink less, while keeping it cold.These are not perfect cubes, however. The bottom of each well isn't a right angle; there is a slope instead, like a trapezoid. I guess this is to make it easier to take the cubes out, or give the tray more stability? While you don't get perfect cubes, they still look nice in the drink. The trays have little lips that help to carry it to the freezer when full of water.

According to the ingredients list, this product contains menadione sodium bisulfite complex. Menadione is a synthetic precursor (ahem, not the "natural choice") for Vitamin K and has notably been reported to have toxic effects. The use of menadione over the natural sources of vitamin K (such as leafy greens, kelp, etc.) is only justified for cost-saving reasons. It is disingenuous of The Naturo Company to claim this to be a natural cat food when menadione is not a naturally occuring chemical.Menadione is banned by the Food & Drug Administration in over-the-counter supplements due to its potential for organ toxicity. It's also banned in Europe for human consumption.A study in rats showed that exposure to menadione "produced lesions in the kidney, heart, liver and lung." Chiou et al. Toxicology 1997. Some may argue that since this was a toxicology study, the doses are unnaturally high. Perhaps, but that's the de facto methodology in the field to determine if something is potentially toxic before doing a drawn out longitudinal chronic-exposure study. Menadione's toxicity seems to be due to its ability to induce oxidative stress in cells. In fact, menadione is a tool frequently used in the toxicology field to induce oxidative stress and organ damage.I don't know about you, but I'd prefer not to feed my pets something that's actually used to cause cell and tissue damage. Especially from a company that's blatantly lying about its product being natural.

While I was excited to receive this item for free, in return for an honest review, I was utterly disappointed once I turned it on. It has very little power, even on the high mode. Thinking my batteries might be weak, I tried a freshly charged pair, but it was still underpowered to do anything. The brushes feel fine on the face, and I guess they'd work for applying lotion. But forget about using the pumice stone to get any dead skin cells off.

This is an okay basic charger, but for the money, there are chargers with more functionality and a solid reputation out there. Check out ones by LaCrosse, Ansmann, etc.GOOD- Can charge a wide array of batteries (though not 9V).- BacklightBAD- Super annoying beeps when batteries are fully charged. Sucks when 6 loud beeps go off at 3am, and that happens 4 times. The person who though of this should have to sleep with this charger going off every night! But see another review's note about how to disable this by disassembling the unit.- Only 2 charging currents: 0.5 and 1A. Better chargers have a range from 200mA to 2A- Only 2 modes: charge and capacity testing. Better chargers have modes to allow for rejuvenating old batteries (through repeated discharging/charging).- Large size not great for use while travelling light.I received a free unit in return for an honest review.

I have  a 2012 Honda Fit. The Texas sun has bleached out some of the black plastic and vinyl on the exterior. I used this stuff on 5 different spots made of different materials. It totally restored 3 of the spots back to a nice deep black. But it didn't do anything to the other 2 spots, leaving them still looking bleached gray.Unlike some other restoring products I've used (some made by this same company), this stuff goes on more like a spray paint rather than a cream you rub on. Using too much can leave a visible layer of coating. It leaves a semi-gloss finish, which is attractive unless you use too much.Since this is a spray can, there is a lot of waste when trying to apply to small areas or thin trims. It will get on the windows, which seemed to removed a layer of something when I tried to wipe it off. And then you end up breathing this stuff in, which is probably not good for your lungs. I wish I had worn a mask. The advantage of a spray is that it's easy to get even coverage on non-flat surfaces, like the front grill.
The Otterbox Commuter cases are my favorite and this one is no exception.  It provides great protection for the Motorola X.  For even better protection, get the Otterbox Defender.
This is an 8-port switch.  It is used to join 8 ethernet devices together on a local network.  It works great and I have no complaints.

This is a genuine Cabin Air Filter used in a variety of Toyota vehicles.  Toyota recommend changing the filters about once a year, but I change mine every six months, or whenever it starts to smell.  Definitely cheaper to buy from Amazon than the local Toyota dealer.

Coveroo takes cases that are made by a variety of companies and adds their own decoration to them.  In the case of this product, they took a black Otterbox Commuter case for the iPhone 4S and added white polka dots.  It came in the original Otterbox case and looks good.
This USB drive is tiny.  The nub barely sticks out of the computer when it is plugged in.  If you're looking for a low profile USB Drive, this is the one.

I purchased a bunch of these to use to control XBMC and Windows Media Center computers, so that I can use them to watch on a regular TV.  These remote controls work great.  The IR Receiver plugs into the computer using USB, and can be placed almost anywhere.  I highly recommend this.  If you want a universal remote control, I recommend using this in conjunction with the URC RF-20, which amazon sells for about $55.00.

I use Windows Media Center to record Live TV, and XBMC to watch it throughout my home.This device provides a critical missing piece:  The TV Tuner.  Connect this device to a TV Antenna and to your network, and install the drivers onto your computer running Windows Media Center, and now you can record and watch TV off two channels at the same time.  If you buy a second one of these, you can record 4 channels at once.It works great, and I highly recommend it.

I have a lot of cables in my entertainment center and on my PCs.  If you don't organize them, they tend to get tangled, which makes it very difficult when you make changes.  I use these to bundle the cables together and it makes everything look neat and configuration changes much easier.
I purchased this for use with an Intel Next Unit of Computing (which does not come with a power cord), and it works great.

I purchased this to add Qi Wireless Charging to my Samsung Galaxy S3.It works great, and installation was simple.  Just pop the battery door off, stick this to the back of the battery, and put the door back on.I use it to charge my phone in my new Toyota (which comes with Qi charging) and at home with this:http://www.amazon.com/UPGRADED-Wireless-Charging-Blackberry-Qi-Enabled/dp/B00C40OG22/ref=pd_bxgy_cps_img_y

If you routinely fly the Blade MQX, you'll eventually crash.  This is the first part to become damaged.  The damage is usually not evident at first, but these things will lose their torsional rigidity and the heli will have difficulty flying in wind.  Eventually, they'll break completely, but its a good idea to replace them well before that.You should always keep a few of these on hand.

If you routinely fly the Blade MQX, you'll eventually crash.  After enough crashes, the motor mounts will start to become deformed, either where the thruster boom meets with them, or in a curved spot where the shaft meets the guard.  You can see the deformity because the parts will turn white as the plastic stretches.  You should always keep a few of these on hand.

I purchased these to replace the stock black blades that come with my Blade MQX helicopter.  Because these are bright orange, they make it much easier to see the heli while it is flying.  I highly recommend them.

This is a 48-volt Power of Ethernet Injector.  It allows you to power a device that supports POE using a single ethernet cable, instead of having to send power on a separate pair of wires.  48-Volts is the typical voltage used by POE devices.  I purchased this to use with a Polycom VOIP phone, and it works just fine.

I decided to investigate Qi Wireless Charging after I purchased a new Toyota that came with the feature built in.I started by purchasing a DigiYes Wireless Charger Charging Receiver Module for Samsung Galaxy S3 from Amazon, which is a very thin device that I inserted between the battery and the battery cover on my Samsung Galaxy S3 to enable wireless charging.Then I bought this device to wirelessly charge my phone when I'm in my house.  The device consists of a square plastic pad that measures about 3" x 3".  It has a small blue light in the front and a USB plug in the back.  You have to supply your own USB power supply, and the USB charger that came with my phone worked fine.I was surprised at how well this works and how convenient it is to use.  I've previously avoided wireless charging because I felt that it was a gimmick.  After all, it's pretty easy to just plug in your phone to a charger, right?After using this, I can say that I'm pretty impressed.  It's even easier to just place your phone on the charging pad and watch the blue light come on.  While I haven't used a timer to measure the speed at which my phone charges, the charging time is not noticeably slower than it was when I used to plug the phone in, and since it's so easy, I find myself using the charging pad everytime I get home, and have had fewer low-battery events as a result.Overall, I'm very happy with Qi charging and with this particular charging pad, and I highly recommend it.

The Resolve SE6 is a "studio reference monitor."  Essentially, it is a medium sized 100-watt speaker that contains it's own power amplifier.  It plugs into 120 volt AC power (a wall outlet) and allows you to connect an RCA audio source and/or a separate microphone.  Generally, people buy two of these in order to get stereo sound, but I received this one for free through Amazon's Vine Program, and they only sent me one.There's really not much more to say about it.  It looks good.  It sounds great.  I wish I had two.  :)

This is a very fun South Park themed Role Playing Game.  It has a fun story, great graphics, and looks and sounds exactly like South Park.  If you're a fan of the show and you like RPGs, you'll love this game.

This is a a great sunshade.  It attached to your chair or any other pole-like surface, and will keep the sun off of you.  It is very sturdy and has many adjustment points.  The umbrella is lined on the inside with a material that completely blocks out the sun.  It's probably not large enough to keep the rain off of you, but it works great to block the sun from a single person sitting in a chair.I own several of the much larger Sport-Brella products that are designed for use by several people at once, and find this a better solution, more portable, and more economical solution for providing portable shade.

I bought this device several years back and was using it with great results for several years.  Recently, I updated to the latest firmware (dated in 2014), and began having serious video quality problems, including video dropping out completely every 30 seconds on one channel.  I found a thread on SiliconDust's forums where customers have been complaining about the problem since 2013, without any response from SD personnel.I managed to find the 20120405 Firmware and downgrade and all of my problems were resolved.  Unfortunately, SiliconDust no longer makes it easy to find the older firmware.  If you contact support, they may give you a link, and there are links posted to the 20120405 bin file (not the whole software) which you can use to downgrade the firmware using the latest software and the 20120405 bin file.However, if you run the Windows software again, it will automatically upgrade your firmware to the 2014 version again. You can stop that from happening by deleting the .bin files from:C:\Program Files\Silicondust\HDHomeRun\Note:  After I went through all that trouble, I found out that the disk inside the box contained the 20120405 firmware.  I wish I'd known that sooner!

This is a stand-up case for the Samsung Galaxy Tab 3.It functions as intended, but I have one gripe.  There's no way to access the charging port when the case is closed.  To charge the Galaxy Tab, you have to leave the case open so that the screen is exposed and could be damaged.Before I got this case for free through Amazon's Vine Program, I purchased a MoKo Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 10.1 Case - Slim Folding Case for Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 10.1 Inch Android Tablet, BLACK (with Smart Cover Auto Wake / Sleep), which I like considerably more.The Moko product is heavier duty, lighter, also will stand up, includes a magnet to keep it closed, and has an opening for the charging port so that you can charge the Tab without leaving the case open.

I received this product through Amazon's Vine Program.  That means that I received it for free in exchange for my agreement to write a review.When I received the router, I originally did not like it because I reviewed it for its intended purposes, i.e. as a travel router.  As a travel router, it is a poor device because it is not self-contained and appeared to require the use of a set-up disk.  It turned out that a set-up disk is not required, but you must understand that to configure the device, you must first connect to it using Wifi using the credentials listed in very small print on the router.  You cannot initially connect via the wired ethernet port.Once I did that, I was quickly able to convert it from a travel router to a wireless client.  I've been using it to connect my VOIP phone to my Wifi network ever since, and it has been very reliable for that purpose.  It is also very small, and so it is easy to conceal under the phone.  Overall, I think that this is a great device for giving wifi access to devices that lack Wifi.As a travel router, however, I still prefer something that has a built in power supply.

I received this product through Amazon's Vine Program, which means that I received it for free in exchange for my agreement to write this review.I have owned several of Schlage's keypad products, including my favorite, the Schlage BE365VPLY505 Plymouth Keypad Deadbolt, Bright Brass, and so I was anxious to compare the two.  Ultimately, I decided that I liked the older Plymouth Keypad Deadbolt better.  Here's why:Style:  The Plymouth Keypad Deadbolt looks more like a traditional deadbolt, and thus matches my existing handles and decor better.
