This product has a much more futuristic design, which would be fine if that were the style of the rest of my house.Size:  The interior components of this deadbolt are much larger than the Plymouth Keypad Deadbolt.Price:  The Plymouth Keypad Deadbolt is considerably cheaper ($100 vs. $200).Durability:  The Plymouth Keypad Deadbolt does not use a motor to drive the deadbolt.  Instead, it simply engages a latch that you can turn yourself.  Fewer moving parts generally means greater durability.  In contrast, this product uses a motor to drive the deadbolt.This product is supposed to support Nexia and Z-wave, however many of the other reviews indicate that it doesn't work with Z-Wave.  I don't use either, as I am opposed to using server based services when the nature of the technology doesn't require a server based system, because (1) they'll stop working if the company that provides the server decides to discontinue the server and (2) they generally require monthly payments.  While I certainly understand Schlage's desire to get a monthly income stream from this type of product, there's nothing inherent in the nature of the product that requires a server or that requires a consumer to make a monthly payment in order to get the same functionality.

I received this item through Amazon's Vine Program, which means that I received it for free in exchange for my agreement to write this review.Because of it's size, the chair will be delivered by a freight company, and not by FedEx or UPS.  They will call you in advance to schedule the delivery.  It comes in a very large cardboard box which contains another cardboard box inside.  Inside that box is the chair itself and the back and bottom cushion (which are connected together).  It was well-packaged to prevent damage and was fully assembled out of the box.  The only thing that I had to do to begin using it was to remove the protective cardboard and styrofoam from the legs, remove the plastic cover from the cushions, and then place the cushions onto the frame.HINT:  Open the plastic cover for the cushions at the top so that you can re-use the cover as a protective cover for the cushions during the off seasons!The chair itself is a black/brown color and the cushions could be described as light-brown or off-white.  The chair back is adjustable in five separate positions, and can be laid flat as well.  It is very lightweight given its size, presumably because it is made from aluminum.  It is fairly large, and is more than suitable for my six-foot tall frame.  The cushions are firm, but comfortable.I also own the Strathwood Basics Hardwood Chaise Lounge, which is considerably cheaper, but is made of wood and requires that cushions be purchased separately.  This chair is far more durable, far more comfortable, lighter, and presumably justifies the far higher price.

The Blade MQX is a flying remote controlled toy that is commonly referred to as "quadcopter."  It is insanely fun to fly, but requires some experience before you can fly without crashing.The MQX is available in two versions.  The "RTF" (Ready to Fly) version includes a very basic remote control.The "BNF" (Bind-N-Fly) version comes without a remote control, and is intended for people who already own a Spektrum remote control.  Spektrum makes a wide variety of remote controls that can be used with a wide variety of Blade brand helicopters and E-flite brand remote controlled airplanes.  I use the Spektrum DX6i, which you can buy from Amazon.com for $139.99.  It can remember ten different planes/helis at once, has a very nice display, and includes a timer, which is helpful to prevent crashes due to dead batteries.  If you buy two of the DX6i, you can even connect them together and put them in training mode, which allows you to give and take control from another controller when you're teaching someone else how to fly.Both the BNF and RTF versions include the MQX Quadcopter, a single battery, a single battery charger, and a user manual with a diagram that shows how all the parts go together and (more importantly) what each part is called.  Each battery yields about ten minutes of flight time.The MQX is a quad-copter because it has four independent motors that operate four independent blades.  It flies by adjusting the speed of the blades to allow it to pitch forward and back, roll left and right, and to yaw (turn) left and right.The MQX includes a stabilization system that Blade uses on its mid-level helicopters.  It flies very well in no to light wind.  In moderate winds, it can still generally maintain stability, but it tends to wobble a little, and the wobble becomes more pronounced as you increase the throttle or the wind speed increases.Unless you have a lot experience, do not fly this inside your house.  This toy is for use in large open spaces, i.e. parks.  While beginner helicopters will auto level when you release the right control stick, the MQX does not.  In addition, it can fly very fast.If you push the right stick forward, the unit will start leaning forward (and flying forward) and will continue leaning farther forward until you release the stick.  When you release the stick, the MQX will continue leaning forward and flying forward at the angle it was at when you released the stick until you counter the forward lean by pulling the stick towards you.  As you hold the stick towards you, the MQX will slow down, and eventually stop.  If you continue pulling the stick towards you, the MQX will begin flying backwards.  The same principles apply when you move the right stick to the left or the right.If you turn the MQX around using the left stick while it is flying forward, the forward momentum will be translated into sideways momentum, which you'll need to counteract with the right stick.So, for example, if you are flying forward and push the left stick to the right to make a 180 degree right hand turn, when the unit comes out of the right hand turn, it will begin sliding to its left (your right).  You'll need to counteract that by pushing the right the stick to the right.  It usually will stop as well, so you'll need forward input on the right stick to get it going again.  The opposite is true if you make a left hand turn:  You'll need to give it right stick input to the left at the conclusion of the turn as well.You should also note that when you turn the MQX around and face it towards you, all of the controls become reversed.  When the MQX gets far away from you, the easiest way to tell which side is "forward" is to look for the white blades.  As sold, the white blades are in the front and the black blades are in the rear.  Blade also makes a set of high contrast Orange blades, which I used to replace the black blades (in the rear) on mine.If you buy this product, you should consider also buying some additional parts right away.  As you're reading the rest of my review, it might help you to refer to the MQX user manual (which you can also download from Blade's web-site), because it includes a parts diagram that shows the name of each part and where it goes on the MQX.1.  Buy several packages of replacement Thruster Boom with Wiring (2): mQXs.  You will need them.The Thruster Booms are made from carbon fiber.  Every time you crash, the carbon fiber will weaken, and eventually it will break.  Even before it breaks, it loses rigidity, which can increase the wobble in light winds and on heavy throttle.  Replacing them is incredibly easy.  They come pre-wired.  No tools are required.  You just unplug the old ones and plug the new ones in.Start by pulling the decorative cover off the center of the MQX.  Then, unplug the wire from the old Thruster Boom that goes onto the main board.  Then pull the motor mount cover off the motor mount (jiggle it while pulling it towards the center of the unit).  Unplug the motor from the wiring on the Thruster Boom.  Now pull the Thruster Boom out of the center of the unit and out of the motor mount.  Reverse the process with the new one.  Make sure that you line up the sides of the wire plugs that are painted green.2.  You should also buy several packs of replacement blades.  When you crash, there is a 30% chance that a rotor blade will become bent.  If the bend is minor, you can sometimes bend it back.  If the bend is major, you will experience significant wobble and an unusual noise as well.When buying blades, do note that each of the four blades has a specific color and direction.  A full set of blades includes a black clockwise blade, a black counter-clockwise blade, a white clockwise blade, and a white counter-clockwise blade.  Blade also makes a set of high contrast, easy to see Orange blades, which I recommend using in place of the black blades.When installing replacement blades, grab the blade and pull it upwards.  The blade will pull the propeller shaft out of the motor mount and the white gear will fall out of the bottom of the MQX.Remove the screw that holds the propeller in place and then replace the blade.  Tighten the screw only until you feel the very slightest of resistant.  If you keep tightening, you'll strip the propeller shaft and have to turn it around and use the backup screw hole or replace the propeller shaft.Push the propeller shaft back into the motor mount housing, and slide the white gear ring onto the bottom.  Be sure to line up the flat spot on the white gear ring with the flat spot on the propeller shaft.3.  You should buy several additional batteries (Model EFLB5001S25).  Do not buy aftermarket batteries.  They may be slightly cheaper, but the connectors don't fit quite right.  They're a pain to plug in and unplug and may even damage the unit when you have to pull the wires so hard that you rip the connector off the circuit board.4.  If you purchase the Bind-N-Fly (BNF) version, you should also buy a DX6i Remote Control.5.  If you're going to fly at night, Horizon Hobby sells a light kit (Ram190) for about $15.00.  It is very easy to install (I used scotch tape to install mine) and makes night flying easier than daytime flying.If you are buying multiple parts at the same time, it is usually cheaper to pick a seller (like HopMeUp) that charges for shipping separately.  Several Amazon sellers will charge $8.00 per battery with $3.00 for shipping, while others will charge $11.00 per battery with free shipping.  If you're only buying one battery, the price is the same.  But, if you buy five batteries, the shipping for all five will only be slightly higher than $3.00, and you'll save a ton of money on the $8.00 batteries.  The same is true of other parts.The only other common maintenance item on these involves the motors.  The motor mount covers have a small lip that keeps the motor in place.  When you crash, the motor sometimes jumps over the lip.  When that happens, the motor will no longer connect with the gear.  It's easy to fix:  Just push the motor back down into the housing, and then push the motor mount back into place.I've been pretty aggressive with mine.  I've flown up and down a large park hundreds of times, and done quite a few rolls as well.  As a result, I've had to replace at least fifteen booms, four motor mounts, and several blades as well.

I own four Logitech Harmony One remote controls and love them.  What makes the Harmony One such a great remote is its combination of hard keys and touchscreen keys.  Frequently used keys were available as physical buttons.  Your fingers can find them and push them without having to take your eyes off of the TV.  Less frequently used buttons can be moved to a touch screen.  All of the related hard keys were located within easy reach of one another.  The touchscreen was not within easy reach, but that didn't matter because you had to take your eyes off of the TV screen to see and push them anyway.Unfortunately, Logitech took all the great design features of the Harmony One and eliminated them when creating this remote.  This remote is a HUGE step backwards.  Here's why:1.  Bad Software:  With the Harmony One, Logitech used software that you downloaded from their web-site and ran on your computer.  It was very well designed and easy to use.  Now, they use a web-based application that relies on Microsoft Silverlight.  It is quite buggy and slow.2.  Inconvenient Keys:  The transport keys are located above the touch screen, while all the other keys are located below the touch screen.  This is very inconvenient because it means that you have to look down at the remote and physically move it in your hand in order to reach the fast foward, rewind, pause, stop, and record buttons, and then move it back when you want to use the up, down, left, right, guide, PVR, Info, and OK buttons.On the Harmony One, the transport keys were just below the navigation keys.  Having related keys near one another makes the remote much more convenient to use.  Separating them makes the remote far more difficult to use.3.  Missing Keys:  The skip forward and skip backward buttons are gone.  Completely gone. You can remap the fast forward and rewind keys, but then you have to use the touchscreen for those (or remap the colored keys, which are located as far away from the transport keys as they could possibly be).4.  No motion sensor:  Older Harmony Remotes had a motion sensor and would activate the touch screen when you picked up the remote.  You could turn the feature off if you didn't want it.  This remote doesn't have the feature at all.5.  More Missing Keys:  The Help and Activities button have been replaced with touch-sensitive keys that have icons.  The Activities button now looks like a Home icon.  Just to make things more confusing, the word "Home" also appears on the screen when you are on the Home screen, but pressing on the word home does nothing.  The Help button is now a question mark icon that's way too easy to push by accident.6.  Swipe now required:  Previously, you'd see 3 activity choices on the touch screen at a time.  Now, you only see one.  To get to the others, you have to swipe to the left or the right.  I'm fine with swiping to get to more choices, but there's no reason why they made only one option per screen.7.  Bigger screen, fewer options:  The screen is larger, but you have fewer options on each screen.You can no longer get to the devices from within an activity.  Now, if you want to change a setting on a device that isn't included in the activity, you have to go back to the home screen.Also, Logitech changed the size of soft buttons from a finger sized square to a longer, thinner rectangle, making it even easier to hit the wrong button.8.  Poorly designed charger:  The charging plug for this unit comes with a british AC adaptor and then a U.S. converter.  As a result, it sticks out of the wall by about 3 inches.  Dumb!9.  Battery not removable:  Prior Harmony remotes had removeable batteries, so if the battery died, you could replace it.  This one is permanently installed.  You have to break it open to remove it (only at the end of the product's life).  So, I pay more, and get less!  Thanks Logitech!This remote is a redesign that sacrifices function for form.  It is a huge step backwards with no corresponding benefits.In my view, the best remotes don't use a touch screen at all.  Having a screen that is accompanied by hard buttons is best.  The screen allows the hard buttons to have different labels, and a more button to scroll.I used to recommend the Harmony One even though it had a touch screen, because setup was so easy and there were enough hard buttons that the touch screen only needed to be used infrequently.Today, I recommend either URC MasterControl RF20 Universal Learning Remote with RF Capability or the URC R40 "My Favorite Remote" Advanced Universal Remote Control for up to 18 A/V Components.  Both are even better than the Harmony One because they have all hard, physical buttons.  The buttons at the top are adjacent to a screen, which allows those buttons to be used for more than one function.  The transport buttons are conveniently located near the navigation buttons.  The only downside of these remotes is that they are programmed by hand, and not using a computer.  They're preprogrammed with many common remotes, and can learn directly from an existing remote, but the process is a bit more complicated than the Logitech software and more time consuming.

This is a very poorly made copy of the Blade MSR.The only positive thing that I can say is that the controller feels well built and is a faithful reproduction of the Blade controller.However, everything about the helicopter is AWFUL.  The gyro does not function correctly, and so the helicopter always turns as you increase or decrease the throttle.  It also was not adjusted properly and so it drifted from the factory.  The drift can be repaired by making adjustments, but there's no way to fix a poorly designed electronic gyro.  I bought two of these and both are going back.If you're looking for an inexpensive entry level outdoor helicopter, I recommend the WL Toys V911 or V912.  If you want top qualify, the Blade 120 SR is an excellent choice.  This is not worth the $30.00 that I paid.

The WL Toys V911 is a 4 channel fixed pitch helicopter with flybar that uses a 2.4 Ghz remote control. It comes with the helicopter, two batteries, a charger, and the 2.4 Ghz Remote.  It is a great choice for people who are starting out with helicopters and want an inexpensive starter helicopter to use outdoors.Because the helicopter is a fixed pitch helicopter with a flybar, it is moderately stable but can fly very quickly. Because it uses 2.4 Ghz, it has a good range and will not suffer from interference from lights (like some IR controlled helis will). Because it has replaceable battery, when the battery dies, you can simply replace it with a charged one. Because it is 4 channels, you can fly forward and backwards, go up and down, spin left and right, and can slide to the left and right.Be sure to buy extra blades and a screw kit. The blades tend to get damaged when they hit things. While the flybar won't get damaged, the screw that holds the flybar in place can become bent, and when that happens, the helicopter will lose some stability and may experience what is known as the toilet bowl effect. If you experience vibration, the screw that holds the flybar in place might be too loose. If you experience a toilet bowl effect, try loosening the screw that holds the flybar in place.Quality control is an issue for this helicopter. The first one that I received had a bad gyro, and so it would turn to the right.  Even the "good" ones have a slight tendency to rotate to the right, and it gets worse as the battery level drops.The second and third one did not have the swashplate adjusted, and so the helicopter would tend to drift.  If your helicopter drifts instead of hovering, determine which direction it is drifting (forward, back, left and/or right).  Then while the helicopter is sitting on a table, move the remove control in the direction oppose of the drift.  Watch which levers move in which directions.  Then adjust the black plastic/silver control arms to move the swashplate in that direction by popping the black plastic control arms off of the black swashplate ball joint and then screwing or unscrewing the black part of the arm against the silver part of the arm to lengthen it or shorten it.WL Toys offers no U.S. based support, but you can find parts if you want to try to repair the helicopter yourself.It is not a toy and because the blades can cause serious eye injury, you should not fly the helicopter near anyone and should not allow children to operate it.The helicopter is fun to fly, but as you lift off, be sure to move the right stick about half way to the right.  These helicopters have a natural lean to the left to counter the force of the tail rotor and you need to counteract it at lift-off or the heli will veer off to the left and crash.If you don't mind spending a bit more, you should consider these helicopters:Blade MCX2- Coaxial helicopter, 4-channel, replaceable battery, 2.4 Ghz controller. Great for indoor use, but can be used outdoors if there is no wind. Still slow. U.S. based support and good quality. Around $120.00 with the controller (less if you already have a compatible controller).Blade CX2/CX4- Similar to MCX2, but considerably larger and so it can be flown in very light wind outdoors. Around $150 to $200. U.S. based support and good quality.Blade SR 120- Fixed pitch, 4-channel, replaceable battery, 2.4 Ghz controller. Too large for indoor use. Great as a park flyer even with some wind. Very fast. Around $160.00 with the controller and $130 if you already own a Blade compatible controller. U.S. based support and good quality.----Here's a summary of the different technology choices when it comes to RC helicopters.Blade SystemsCoaxial- A coaxial helicopter has two sets of blades, one on top of the other. Coaxial helicopters are generally very stable and move fairly slowly. They are great for beginners and for flying indoors.Fixed Pitch- A single set of blades. Not as stable as a coaxial helicopter, and can move much more quickly than a coaxial helicopter. A "FP" helicopter cannot fly upside down. Fixed Pitch helicopters are generally for intermediate flyers and are used outdoors.Collective Pitch- A single set of blades whose pitch changes to raise or lower the helicopter. A "CP" helicopter can fly upside down. For advanced and expert flyers.Stabilization SystemsGyro- An electronic system inside the helicopter that prevents the helicopter from rotating in the direction opposite the blades. All modern helicopters have electronic gyros.Flybar- Two weights that are connected together using plastic or metal and which spin around along with the helicopter blades. Fixed Pitch Helicopters that have a flybar will level off when you release the stick. Helicopters that do not have a flybar (and Collective Pitch Helicopters) will not level off when you release the control stick. Collective Pitch and helicopters without flybars are not suitable for beginners.Control SystemsInfrared- Use infrared light to control the helicopter. Bright lights, sunlight, and TV remote controls will interfere with the operation of the helicopter. Not suitable for use outside during the daytime.Radio (27 Mhz/2.4 Ghz)- uses radio waves to control the helicopter. Suitable for use indoors or outdoors.Battery Systems-Internal- a helicopter with an internal battery that cannot easily be removed. When the battery dies, the fun is over until you recharge it. Most helicopter batteries take about 30-50 minutes to charge and allow for about 5 minutes of run-time.Replaceable- a helicopter with a battery that can easily be removed and recharged. When one battery dies, you just pull it out and put a fresh one in and continue flying.

All modern helicopters have electronic gyros.Flybar- Two weights that are connected together using plastic or metal and which spin around along with the helicopter blades. Bright lights, sunlight, and TV remote controls will interfere with the operation of the helicopter. Not suitable for use outside during the daytime.Radio (27 Mhz/2.4 Ghz)- uses radio waves to control the helicopter. Suitable for use indoors or outdoors.Battery Systems-Internal- a helicopter with an internal battery that cannot easily be removed. When the battery dies, the fun is over until you recharge it. Most helicopter batteries take about 30-50 minutes to charge and allow for about 5 minutes of run-time.Replaceable- a helicopter with a battery that can easily be removed and recharged. When one battery dies, you just pull it out and put a fresh one in and continue flying.

The Syma S107G is a 3.5 channel coaxial helicopter with an infrared remote control and an internal battery.  It is a great choice for people who are starting out with helicopters and want an inexpensive starter helicopter to use indoors.Because the helicopter is a coaxial helicopter (with two stacked blades), it is very stable.  Because it uses infrared controls, sunlight, bright lights, and TV remotes can interfere with its operation.  Because it has an internal battery, when the battery dies, you have to stop flying it and recharge (which takes about 30 minutes).  Because it is 3.5 channels, you can fly forward and backwards, go up and down, and spin left and right, but cannot slide to the left and right.Be sure to buy extra blades and an extra flybar.  The blades tend to get damaged when they hit things.  While the flybar won't get damaged, the pin that holds the flybar in place can become bent, and when that happens, the helicopter will lose some stability and may experience what is known as the toilet bowl effect.Quality control is an issue for this helicopter.  I've had quite a few that had motors freeze up and have to be returned within 30 days of purchase.  Syma offers no U.S. based support, but you can find parts if you want to try to repair the helicopter yourself.It is not a toy and because the blades can cause serious eye injury, you should not fly the helicopter near anyone and should not allow children to operate it.If you don't mind spending a bit more, you should consider these helicopters:WL Toys V911- a fixed pitch, 4-channel (can slide left and right), replaceable battery, 2.4 Ghz helicopter. Around $120.00 with the controller (less if you already have a compatible controller).Blade CX2/CX4- Similar to MCX2, but considerably larger and so it can be flown in very light wind outdoors. Great as a park flyer even with some wind.  Very fast.  Around $160.00 with the controller and $130 if you already own a Blade compatible controller.  U.S. based support and good quality.----Here's a summary of the different technology choices when it comes to RC helicopters.Blade SystemsCoaxial- A coaxial helicopter has two sets of blades, one on top of the other.  Coaxial helicopters are generally very stable and move fairly slowly.  They are great for beginners and for flying indoors.Fixed Pitch- A single set of blades. The speed at which the blades rotate are normally not changed.  A "CP" helicopter can fly upside down.  For advanced and expert flyers.Stabilization SystemsGyro- An electronic system inside the helicopter that prevents the helicopter from rotating in the direction opposite the blades. My house is wired with a home distribution system that allows for changes to the routing of video, audio, and ethernet.  Unfortunately, every time that I need to make a change, I had to call a technician who had the proper tools.  I got tired of paying $100 every time I wanted to change something and I so I started looking at what tools I needed and how to use them.I found a number of useful websites online and Youtube videos explaining what each tool did and how to use it.  Amazon doesn't allow me to post links here, but if you Google "swhowto" (or just type those letters and add .com to the end), you'll find a number of resources that explains the tools you need and how they work.I found that there are a number of companies that make tools for this purpose.  Since I don't do this for a living and I knew that the tools wouldn't get used all that much, I focused more on value.  Paladin makes a number of different reasonably priced kits, and after exhaustive research, I settled on this one.  Fluke Networks also makes tools, but they appear to of significantly higher quality (and also more expensive).This kit includes:1.  A wire cutter- to cut wires2.  A coax stripper- used to make the ends of TV/Coax cable suitable for adding a connector.3.  A network cable stripper- used to make the ends of phone/network cable suitable for adding a phone or network plug.4.  A universal crimper- used to squeeze a coax screw connector and/or a phone/network plug so that it will stay on the end of a coax or ethernet cable.5.  Die Sets- these are installed into the crimper so that it can be used on coax or ethernet.6.  Punchdown tool- used to punch wires onto a wire block or onto the back of a a wall jack.  Although it has the ability to impact, I find that its easier to just push on the cable until it seats.  If you actually punch it down, it will often damage the modern blocks, which are somewhat fragile.7.  110 Blade & 66 blade- these are blades that are installed into the Punchdown tool to match the size of the holes on the block.  They are different sizes, and it is important that you have a blade to match the size used on your block.  110 and 66 are the most common, but there is also another version8. Coax/Network Cable Tester- used to test network cable or coax cable to make sure that it is wired properly and not damaged.9.  A Tone generator and banana probe- used to locate/identify which wire goes where.10.  Various connectors and adapters for #8 and #9.11.  A RG45 Adaptor that will allow you to plug-in a network cable and then access each of the eight individual wires for testing without cutting off the end of a cable.11.  A very nice tool bag and box.The only thing that this kit doesn't have that I recommend is the Paladin Tools 4599 SurePunch Pro Detachable Light and Batteries.  It costs about $15.00 and allows you to add a tiny flashlight to the punch down tool, which is often very helpful because all this equipment tends to be installed into a dark closet

I bought this device to allow me to monitor the temperature and humidity in my garage, in my car, and in my house.  It works great for that purpose.The product includes four devices:  A main base unit with a display and three remote sensors that connect wirelessly.Each device runs on AAA batteries.  I use Eneloop rechargeable batteries and the LaCrosse BC-900 to recharge them.I have only one complaint:  The humidity sensor will not register humidity under 20%.  So, if the humidity goes under 20%, the unit continues to show 20%.Other than that, it works great.

The idea behind these devices is a sensible one:  Make a cheap GSM phone that can operate on a disposable AA battery and keep it for emergencies.  Here's the problem:  The days of the GSM network in the U.S. are numbered.  When the GSM networks go offline, these phones will be useless.  Also, these devices aren't cheap.AT&T and T-mobile have already begun taking their GSM networks offline in some areas, and AT&T has indicated that it will turn off the GSM network everywhere in the U.S. by 2017.There is an easy fix:  The maker of this phone just needs to make the phones support the new 3G standard which currently works on all AT&T and T-Mobile towers in the U.S.  Even better, they could make the phones support the next generation for mobile voice, LTE.  I realize that this would add to the cost, but at $50, this phone is already overpriced.This phone includes no screen, no flip mechanism, no battery, and no 3G, and so it should be cheaper than the comparable Samsung.  With no screen, there's no way to determine if you've dialed a wrong number until you hit send and see who answers.  To make matters worse, the tones that are generated when you push a button are wrong.  For example, when you push 9, it sounds like you are pressing 0.  All the digits are off in the same manner.  So, even if you could recognize the tones by the sound they make, you won't be able to use that skill on this phone to verify that you dialed the correct number.  Finally, with no screen, you can't send a text message.  In a disaster where mobile networks are overloaded, text messages are much more likely to get through - yet you won't be able to send them with this.Right now, you can buy an un-subsidized Samsung flip phone that will work on AT&T or T-Mobile for about $20.00.  Those phones support 3G (not merely GSM), and include a rechargeable lithium ion battery, a color screen, and web browser.  If you want to be able to power it using AA batteries, you can buy the Energizer Instant Charger for Micro USB Mobile Phones.At $50.00, this product is way overpriced, and is already useless in some places and will be useless everywhere in less than 5 years.

I bought several of these, but they did not fit.  I failed to notice the word "Aftermarket" in title, which apparently means that they are not really FAPF01/FAPF02 3M filters, but instead a filter made by someone else.  They did not fit in my filters, and do not contain the same quality of filter materials as the original 3M Filters.

This is an electronic timer switch that plugs into a 3-prong U.S. electric outlet.  The unit plugs into the wall, and the prongs are located on the back of the unit.  You can then plug any 2 or 3-pronged electrical device (such as a lamp) into the bottom.The timer allows you to set up to 100 different on/off periods, which you can program on a particular day of the week, during the weekend, during the workweek, or everyday.  You can program the timer to start or end a time period based upon the time of day or based upon the sunset or sunrise time in a particular location, and can even program it to offset from that time, i.e. 30 minutes before sunset.The timer includes a wired remote control which you can press to turn the switch on and off.  If you press the remote and release it promptly, it will toggle the load on or off and then continue with whatever timers you set.  If you hold the remote button, it will toggle the load and override the timers until you push the button again.Another review on Amazon indicates that the wired remote is not useful unless you can see the display, but I have not found that to be correct.  Nothing on the display gives any useful information relating to the use of the remote.  You simply push the button and the attached light turns on and push it again to turn the light off.  It is possible that an older firmware version of this remote operated differently, but the version that I bought in December of 2012 works with no need to see the display.Another Amazon review indicates that the unit has problems with a low battery condition.  I find this surprising.  The battery is only used when the unit is not plugged into power.  The backup battery is used to allow you to program the unit without having it plugged into the wall and presumably also keeps the time correct during a power outage.  The unit contains no "low battery indicator."  Rather, the unit has an indicator that indicates when the unit is running on battery power.  Unfortunately, the icon that indicates that the unit is on battery power looks suspiciously like a low battery indicator.  I suspect that the reviewer who was concerned about low battery may have been confused.

I received this product through Amazon.com's Vine Program, which means that I received it for free in exchange for my agreement to write this review.The idea behind the Tap2Pass receiver is that you connect it to your garage door opener and then you can connect to it using your smartphone and then open your garage door.  This solves the problem of having to carry a garage door remote control around in your car, when you only have room to carry your smartphone.Unfortunately, there are three issues with this solution:1. The range is incredibly short.  This is the nature of Bluetooth.  It is supposed to be a very short range service, i.e. a few feet.  Since this device is intended to be inside your garage and you are going to be outside your garage, adding a garage door and car between you makes the range way too short.2.  Bluetooth is too slow.  Bluetooth pairing isn't fast enough to make this useful.  It takes several seconds after you get into range before your smartphone and this device will pair.3.  Most cars have room for a garage door remote control.These three issues, combined with the cost to purchase and install it, make me wonder why anyone would prefer this option over the option of simply purchasing an extra garage door remote (which should cost between $10 and $30).Having said all of that, if they made this device an 802.11 wifi device, and you set it up to connect to your home Wifi, the first two of these problems could easily be overcome.  Wifi networks can easily be configured to have significant coverage outside of someone's home and today's smartphones can connect to a Wifi network in less than a second.Even if the device operated on Wifi, I'm still not sure that a case could be made for buying it rather than getting another garage door remote.All in all, I'd say that this device is a solution in search of a problem.  The trouble is that the problem doesn't exist.

I received the Otterbox Prefix case for the Samsung Galaxy S3 through Amazon.com's Vine Program, which means that I got it for free in exchange for agreeing to write this review.I have been a long-time fan of Otterbox.  I was first introduced to Otterbox case after my daughter dropped and broke her iPod touch.  Since then, we've always protected all of our electronics with Otterbox cases.  In fact, I will not buy a mobile device unless Otterbox makes a case for it.Having said that, this case is not worth the price I paid, i.e. "Free."  Instead, I would recommend that anyone considering a case for their Galaxy S3 get the higher-quality Otterbox Commuter series case instead.Here's why:1.  This case (Otterbox Prefix) is a piece of junk.Because it is a one-piece design, it is relatively difficult to put on, and requires quite a bit of stretching and contorting both the case and your device.  Once installed, the case does not fit my device snugly, but is instead bowed out towards the middle.  When you use the device, the case squeaks as it rubs against the device in certain spots.  It is also considerably more bulky than the Commuter series case.The Prefix includes no protection whatsoever for the charging and 3.5 mm headphone ports.The outside color is a very drab gray.Currently, it is more expensive than the Commuter:  Amazon charges $24.95 for this case today.2.  The Otterbox Commuter case is fantastic.It has a two piece design, including a soft inner shell and a harder outer shell.  It is very easy to install without having to contort the case or the phone.  It is less bulky than the Prefix case and fits like a glove.The Commuter DOES include protection for the charging and 3.5 mm headphone ports.The Commuter case is available in a variety of colors, including my favorite:  Black.The Commuter series case is supposed to be a higher quality case, and has a higher MSRP than the Prefix.  However, currently, you can buy it for between $16 and $20, depending upon the color.  I have read complaints that the it is difficult to press the power button on the Commuter case, and I've found that to be true.  However, it is not **that** difficult, and making it a little difficult will prevent inadvertent button pushes and save battery life.So, in sum, skip this one and get the Commuter series case instead.

I received the product through Amazon.com's Vine Program, which means that I received it for free in exchange for my agreement to write this review.This is a backup battery for devices that use a micro-USB plug, i.e. most mobile telephones.  It includes a small black box (2" x 1.5" x .75") and a short standard USB to micro-USB cable.The sealed black box includes a small, rechargeable battery, a standard USB port, a micro-USB port, a button, and a 4-bar LED battery gauge.If you connect the USB cable to the micro-USB port and connect the USB connector to a laptop, PC, or a USB power source, the unit will charge.  If you reverse the connector, you can then use the micro-USB connector to charge your cellular phone or any other device that accepts micro-USB power.The short USB cable includes magnets on either end, and those magnets will allow you to wrap the cable around the black box and hold it in place.Overall, a great, portable backup battery for micro-USB devices.

I received this product through Amazon's Vine Program, which means that I received it for free in exchange for my agreement to write this review.Over the last few years, a number of products have come out promising to allow you to extend the reach of an ethernet (computer) network using other types of wiring.  The first to arrive was the Ethernet Over Power devices (not to be confused with POE, which sends power over ethernet), which allowed you to send computer networking signals using the power wires inside the walls of your house.  The first models were very slow and unreliable.  The latest powerline models are much more reliable, but they still don't deliver anywhere near the performance and reliability of true ethernet.Similar products that deliver ethernet over coax have been promised for years, but this is one of the first products that I've actually seen available.  I'm not sure why, though, because almost every house in America is wired with Coax.  In any case, this one works well and is much more reliable than the powerline models that I've tested.This is one of the first reasonably priced commercially available Ethernet over Coax products available in the U.S.  It uses the MoCA networking standard.  Although the box says that it is "Not for Use in Satellite TV Homes," the unit will work just fine as long as you don't attempt to use the Coax that connects your Satellite Dish to your Satellite Receiver.The box that I received includes (1) two black adapter boxes, (2) two coax patch cords, (3) two ethernet patch cables, (4) two power supplies, and (5) one coax splitter.Each adaptor box has two coax jacks, an ethernet jack, a power jack (for the AC adaptor), a reset button and a switch that reads "config/run".Installation was simple:  Hook up the ethernet jack to whatever you want (your router, switch, computer, etc) and then plug in your coaxial cable and AC adaptor.  There is an additional jack to hook up a TV or Set Top Box output if you want to use the coaxial cable for sending video in addition to sending data, but using that connector is optional. Then repeat this process at the other end.The speed and reliability was very good, and certainly comparable to 10/100 ethernet.  It claims to support up to 16 devices, although I only tested two of them.The documentation consists of a single, double-sided sheet of paper that does nothing more than tell you how to plug everything in.  There is no explanation of what the reset button does, when you should push it, or how to use it (momentary press or hold for 10 seconds?).  Likewise, no explanation as to the purpose of the "config/run" switch.  I was unable to find any additional documentation on Actiontec's web-site.Overall a good product.  I just wonder why it took so long for these to show up in the store?

I received this product through Amazon's Vine Program, which means that I received it for free in exchange for my agreement to write a review. I've had it for about two months, and so this should be my final review.The product came in a single box, that included (1) the outdoor speaker unit, (2) an indoor transmitter, and (3) a power supply for each.(1).  The outdoor speaker unit is stylized to look like a spanish lantern, but it emits no light.  It has six faces.It appears to contain two speaker drivers (a small one and a larger one).  Both are on a single face of the unit and so the unit emits sound in only one direction.  You can apparently purchase another speaker unit and use it with the same transmitter if you want stereo sound.  The outdoor unit can run on batteries or using the supplied AC adaptor.The outdoor unit is apparently weather resistant when run using batteries, but surely is not when using the AC adaptor.  Further, the unit's design will only resist rain and other water that is falling down, and will not protect the unit from rising waters, floods, or immersion.The outdoor unit has five buttons, all on one of the faces of the unit.  The buttons include (1) Bass Boost, (2) On/Off, (3) Auto Scan (used to scan through the 3 channels), Volume +, and Volume -.The sound quality is very good, and includes ample bass and treble.  Depending upon your source, however, I found the overall volume low.  You won't be using this at any large parties, but if you want to enjoy music for a small group on the patio, you should be very happy.(2).  The indoor transmitter is a bit larger than a bar of soap, and is definitely NOT weatherproof.  It runs only on AC power, and has no option to use batteries.  It supports stereo audio input via RCA style jacks (Red for Right, White for Left), and comes with an adaptor cord that will plug into a standard headphone jack like one you would find on an iPod or Android device.You can choose from three transmit channels.  It transmits on 900 Mhz, which means that it won't interfere with 802.11 Wifi Networks (which use 2.4 Ghz).Overall, I was very happy with this product, but I believe that in order to really enjoy it, you should purchase two of them so that you can stereo sound.

This mini dehumidifier is based upon a great concept, but it has a few design flaws.1.  The air intake has no filter.  This is a problem because dust will eventually coat the cooling unit.  There's no easy way to clean it without taking the unit apart.2.  The air exhaust is covered by a grill mechanism that significantly restricts the airflow. The grill mechanism almost looks like it would act as a filter, were it on the air intake.  It probably also serves to keep dust from settling in the machine when the fan is off.  However, because it comes after the cooling mechanism, the only purpose that it serves is to restrict airflow and make the unit work less efficiently.  Fortunately, it snaps right off, and when you take it off, the airflow almost doubles, making the unit work much more efficiently.

This new entry from IFC Midnight is a Horror/thriller about a group of 12 year old girls who are having a sleepover at a  luxurious house set in the snowy woods.The snow  makes for both a beautiful and creepy setting.The house itself is the star of the film with it's huge glass windows everywhere and lot's of modern, pop art, throughout.I was obsessed with the Marilyn Monroe piece that had a sliced boiled egg in loo of her face.This film was said to be based on a true story.It's mainly about bullying ,cyber and real time as well.It isn't very gory but there are a couple of kills that are somewhat bloody.The cast was amazing. Chloe Svengny,Timothy Hutton and Taryn Manning.The  young girls did a believable job at being vicious,cruel spoiled brats as well.They kept showing a series of graphics that had the look of Twitter ,Candy crush and Tinder.As the masked killer stalks them the images are being submitted online and rack up a bunch of likes.It seems the more violent the more likes they receive.The film had somewhat of an arthouse feel to it with scenes such as the girls putting on artistic yet creepy masks  and dancing.There is a lot of catty dialogue about who's fat,who's gay.Who might not be a virgin or who lives in the "poorer section of town". Basically anything that they can use as ammunition.I was entertained and might even watch it again.The wintery shots combined with the art and the movie itself are enough to make it quite memerable.

My nephew said this was the best headset he had ever used. The design is sleek and looks cool especially the blue on the side that lights up.They give amazing sound and are very comfortable as well. Because he will play for hours on end and if the ear gear isn't comfortable, it's a problem.The fact that it has the adjustable band across the top is very helpful when both kids and adults use them.I also tried them out ,although I'm not a big gamer could feel the great fit and hear the intricate sound.These are winners and you can't beat the price for comfort and quality.They're a winner.Set up is so easy  and they seem very sturdy.I highly recommend them as does my 10 year old nephew. He's the real critic where there items are concerned concerned.(In fairness I was given these for a fair and impartial review). That's another reason I let my nephew test them out.Kids don't mince words and give it to you straight!

I expected something different. I assumed each photo would have a little description or information next to it.Instead each photo took up the entire page sometimes two pages for one photo.Which gives the viewer a chance to see  details one might not see had they been smaller.  It did however have thumbnails of the photos in the back of the book that told you from which club they were taken.Some were obvious as to location if you're an avid disco enthusiast or were a NYC nightlife staple yourself.It makes for a nice Coffee table book as it's nicely bound and large.There are some interesting pictures where I found myself  wondering " I wish I  knew what he,she or they were thinking" .I believe everyone who views the photos will find there own favorite moment ,situation or Fantasy!  If your expecting celebrites this is more devoted to the other half.The so-called "freaks" and people who were there for the celebrity's to be entertained by.My favorite shots were from (GG's Barnum Room) a bar for Trans women and their admirers.

All I can say is this film is pretty amazing! The story well thought out. The acting was amazing as was the cinematography. But the star of this film are the awesome creature effects .I don't want to give too much away but I can tell you this is the best creature feature I've seen in a very long time, that has a right to play it completely straight.Which is refreshing as we've had many schlocky,Horror Comedies this year.Don't misunderstand, I love those films too but this filled a void this year. You become easily invested in the main characters which makes the film more endearing and enjoyable.There's no unessacery filler.All is relevant and entertaining. The last 45 minutes is insane! There's not much gore but there's a lot of violence ,and  many hold your breath moments.

This was a pretty good home invasion flick.Granted it wasn't the best but it did have great acting.Two relationship misfortunes thrown in the mix and a twist.It was somewhat like You're Next in that when the home invasion occurred the son's girlfriend (Kara Scodelario) had sneaked in and so no one knew she was there but the boyfriend and the mother.She hid and  when opportunities presented themselves she kind of went ninja girl on the bad guys.There wasn't any gore but there was some brutal violence.Stand outs were Dougray Scott and Kara Scodelario but all were effective.It's not going to satisfy a hardcore Horror fan but it will serve as entertainment for lovers of One location thrillers.

This is a back to basics Slasher .With good practical effects.It starts with a tale about the legend of a young deformed Charlie and his cannibal family.Of course some not so smart people think it would be a good idea to visit the farm,investigate and camp.All except  Tara Reid,who weighs all of 80 pounds! Charlie himself was quite menacing and huge at 7 feet tall and 350 pounds. His creature makeup was done nicely too.So when Reid and Charlie meet it isn't actually a fair match up! The odds are much better when Charlie takes on Kane Hodder's character.As I said before it's back to basics ,but I like formulaic Slashers.They're what I grew up loving and still do! There were quite a few brutal kills with a good amount of gore and the lighting was sort of dark during these scenes because they were usually done either at night or in a dark barn. So it made them look all the more real.There were a couple of kills in the daylight and one was a (WTF) I have to rewind this about 5 times moment!I can't say that I really cared that much about the characters as to be disturbed if they got offed. It's not that they weren't likeable, they just really didn't resonate with me.I enjoyed it and definatley recommend it to other Slasher lovers.

A group of people camping in some Turkish ruins play a game called (Murder In The Dark) Then they start turning up dead for real .Not just dead but also missing internal organs.The scenery and camera work is beautiful and the acting is very good as well.This film was  experimental in that none of the actors knew who among them the killer was until they got to that part of the film .Plus there was a lot of ad lib acting.I personally thought the story was somewhat stagnant and the characters one dimensional. I didn't guess the killer but then again I wasn't very inspired. For a film about organ transplant research the film was virtually bloodless.The only way they could have redeemed this would be if there was some good gore to go with the organ transplant theme.No such luck! Sorry but this was a big miss for me.I realize it was an experimental film.But remember your core audience is watching this because (8 Films To Die For) is usually known for over the top horror which includes gore or atleast disturbing visuals!

This anthology had some  wickedly fun and creepy tales.There were a couple that ended too abruptly.There was good build up then little payoff.But as a whole I really enjoyed it and recommend it to lovers of Horror with humor.It did a great job of getting you into the Halloween spirit as they went all out with the Holiday theme including costumes and decortations. There was some pretty good gore and some Campy splatter as well.It was a fun viewing experience and is sure to become a Halloween staple.I loved seeing all the different actors that we have come to recognize from Horror films past.The list is quite impressive and these scream kings and queens add to the overall personality of the film.My personal favorite tales were Sweet Tooth,Friday The 31st ,The Ransom Of Rusty Rex and Bad Seed!Although everyone will have there own favorites. I won't go into each story and sonopsize them as that will spoil the fun and flow of the entire viewing experience.

This could have been a really good film had they not dragged everything out .Otherwise,the acting was good.The locations and scenery were beautiful and it had good production value.It was just too little too late because the only real action or anything really interesting happened in the last 25 minutes.It was supposed to be a creature feature but it was very lite on the creature .It was about a mutated polar bear terrorizing a group of people in Alaska.But we never really get a good look at it.I understand if you show a creature too much we as an audience can become desensitized to it.But in order for us to fear it we must be able to be properly introduced to it on film.James Remar is always good and this role is no exception.There were a few scenes of violence but nothing that took it to a level of real Horror.

This was pure camp and cheese! It's fun for the horror\ comedy Lover.Although I love a good horror comedy this one was particularly silly.The Lumberjack man's flapjack recipe was stolen years ago and ever since he roams the woods pulling his  giant flapjacks in a homemade wagon looking for victims. As he only uses blood as syrup.Some of the dialogue was funny ,some not so much but it was still a fun film to watch.There was lots of gore, mostly done with CGI but it was still very entertaining.(Michael Madsen) as Dr Peter Shirtcliff was  awesome as always.So was (Jarrett King) as Reggie the chef.I'm certain lovers of films like (Dale &Tucker Vs Evil) will get a kick out of this as well.Even though it's a church group on a weekend getaway in the woods.We still have all the usual characters.There are alot of topless girls for people to ogle ,so guys you won't be disappointed.

Suspension is filmed beautifully using different color schemes such as using monochromatic grays but then during a kill using vivid blood red so it really makes a statement.The story itself is about a girl Emily (Ellen MacNevin) and her little brother who are home alone ,frightened that there psycho dad will come calling. Emily is bullied at school so she escapes by drawing pictures of a bloody murders which seem to be coming to fruition in real life!The acting is well done and the characters are fine enough.There is quite a lot of bloody violence but nothing extremely gory.There's a lot of stabbings and killings of that nature. I enjoyed it except there was a twist which I saw coming quite clearly.I liked the killers mask and thought he was creepy enough to scare someone who has the luxury of still being frightened by these types of films.There was also a little bit of black comedy thrown in to round it out.I would recommend this to lovers of teen Slashers.

A newly married couple that just happen to be serial killers pick up another couple that are hitchiking.They go to a bed & breakfast together (the same Hotel used in the 2007 After Dark Horror Fest Film "Lake Dead") Unexpected friendships and bonds are formed.But who can or cannot be trusted?There is also a suicidal,gay,genderly confused cop on the premises and most importantly a murderer running around in a babydoll mask.This film is very raw and brutal. There's quite a bit of gore paired with disturbing scenes and situations.Tlhe film keeps moving at a nice pace with one OMG moment after the other.The acting was in most cases honest and believable.This is a film for the hard core indie Horror Lover! The gore effects are hit and miss but they're good enough that it doesn't take away from the film.I would have liked some more back story on some of the characters but I saw that there is a sequel in the works. Maybe they'll answer some of the questions I have.Bottom line-I was intrigued with the story and the film!

I've had many make up bags ,totes etc,but this is perfect! It's roomy enough so all your makeup  fits in it and small enough that it can be carried in a large tote bag.I love that it has separate zipped compartments. It also has a section with slots for your essential make up brushes.That is nice because they stay separate from the makeup and keeps them clean.there is also a netted zippered compartment for things like mascara and eye pencils.It's adorable as well because the print that is reminiscent of zebra is highlighted by pink accents such as stripes across the top and outside zipper areas and the bottom. I love it so much I bought my mom and my sister one as well.

I had heard such bad things about this entry in the franchise but decided to watch for myself.I thought it delivered the goods.Jennifer Hils the survivor from the first film has assumed a new identity as a woman named Angela .Angela go's to a rape suviviors group on a regular basis and starts taking out the scum that are preying on or have preyed on the other members. There were a couple of really awesome and disturbing kill scenes and some good gore effects.I also liked it because I didn't have to see the rapes as there were none shown except for brief flashbacks.The film keeps cutting to Jennifer\Angela sitting in the office of a counselor but we never fully understand the complete reasoning until the end of the film.Some of the film can be somewhat subjective at times or ambiguous leaving one to form his or her own opinion.Everything seems very dark ,even when inside. Especially in Jennifer \Angela's apartment.It makes for a good revenge Horror flick and is much better than it's been rumored to be.Beware of the Almighty Pipe!

This has to be the best genre piece I've seen in years.Everything works!When I heard it was going too be PG-13 I was disappointed.But it did not hinder the enjoyment of the film for me at all.I'll admit I'm a gore hound and gore would have been a cherry on top. They managed to get in quite a few very cleverly toned down kills,and it was enough to satisfy me.The production was amazing.The sets are perfection as was the acting and hilarious dialogue. It had a sweet side to it as well seeing as it deals with the relationship between a daughter and her deceased mother.This is as of now my top Horror film of the year even though it's a straight up Horror\Comedy.The casting was also pitch perfect. (Taissa Farmiga) of AHS Coven fame was perfect as Max and in my opinion the stand outs were (Alia Shawkat) as Gertie and (Adam DeVine) as Kurt. Both are hilarious and have the best executed lines. This is a must buy,because I can see myself watching this many times over.The end was great and please keep watching during the credits for bloopers, shown on demand as well.
These boots are right on trend with the fringe and they're so comfy and cute.I ordered my regular size and they are a bit big.But I would rather them be a little big than too snug.

I just got this bear and it's so well made and soft. Her fur trimmed sweater is made out out of the finest knit and faux fur.It's also beautifully sewn.This bear is perfect for the collector or would make a great companion for a boy or girl with a gentle touch. She's also jointed and has that antique look.

This was another Halloween anthology, a sequel to All Hallows Eve .It starts out with a woman finding a strange VHS tape on her doorstep, then she pops it in the VCR and starts watching.! There are about 6 or 7 short films but there were really only 3 that were memorable and the rest were average to underwhelming at best!There wasn't much gore and few effects.The last short had a very creepy feel to it and the makeup was well done.It was in Spanish with English subtitles. The overall offering isn't bad but not good either. It had promise but fell short.They skimped on the gore and effects.There was oppurtunity for some good splatter and  other gore but they went the easy route.The first story dealing with pumpkin seeds was the best and had the only really decent gore effect.That could have definatley brought the movie up a couple of stars.If the stories had been better executed and been more suspensful,they might have been able to get away with it. I did however enjoy the musical score and found it creepy and fitting.The pumpkin face man that delivers the tape and lurks outside the main characters house is sort of creepy in a couple of shots but once you see him full on in a more lighted setting he's not at all disturbing. I liked what there intentions were but I would really only recommend it for a Redbox rental or if you had no other Halloween films to choose from.

This Holiday Horror anthology had something for most Horror lovers! Zombie elves,creepy kids,some good creature effects and a nice amount of well done gore plus some supernatural elements thrown in for good measure.The Stories intertwined very nicely with each other,denoting good editing .There are some pretty creepy scenes and one that has to do with a mother and her young son,that was truly chilling and cringe worthy.I enjoyed the entire film even though there were actually four different storys going on.None  were duds.They all served up some different flavor to make this a well rounded film.It even has a twist that I never saw coming but thought was clever and made for a great ending.(William Shatner) is a hoot as a sarcastic,tipsy radio DJ broadcasting on Christmas eve, giving us some always appreciated comic relief. This is a perfect  Horror flick to get you into the the Holiday spirit and I highly recommend it.Best Christmas based genre piece since 2010's (Rare Exports).It also has thoughtful and effective productive value!

I was pleasantly surprised by this Slasher flick! It has a well peiced together storyline and doesn't at all seem like some of these thrown together messes we have seen alot of lately.Even though it has some camp appeal.There are some genuinely disturbing and creepy scenes.The story starts out as a flashback and builds wonderfully from there.Of course these are critics that will say "the characters made stupid decisions"  .But if they didn't,the film wouldn't be as fun!The acting was good and we get large doses of Horror icons (Bill Moseley) and (Kane Hodder) who play psychotic brothers with some distasteful habits.This isn't the first time we've seen an ambulance used for purposes of carnage in a slasher film,in 2008 we saw it in the After Dark Horror Fest film Autopsy.This film isn't without some twists and turns along the way and the ride is fun! There are some well done practical gore effects and some splatter,I believe I saw one CGI kill but that's all.I would give it a 6/7 on the 1 to10 gore meter.I was never bored, not even in the beginning when they took quite awhile to introduce and develop the characters.I think most slasher fans will find it quite entertaining and satisfying.

(Awaken) is a movie about organ harvesters who own two islands. One for the actual procedures to take place and another where their  soon to be victims wake up on shore having no clue how they got there. The harvesters  make sure the captives eat fruit and clean thier systems out before they hunt them for the operations!There's a really good ensemble cast of you might say "has beens" like( Daryl Hannah) (David Keith)(Jason London) etc. There's also (Michael Copon) and the awesome (Natalie Burn).It's pretty good,some of it believable some of it not so much.Burn as Billie steals the show as an butt kickng ,tough but hot new captive girl.The story is interesting enough to pull you in and keep you watching because you want to see how the characters fare because the character development for the main characters is good .There are a couple of not so surprising twists that add a little spice.There is violence but nothing really gory save one scene of a cadaver who's organs have been taken..The fight choreography was good and fun to watch especially when Billie was kicking butt! There are also alot of gun fights.  Over all it's definitely worth a watch especially if you like the fight or die or trapped on an island type genres. (3-1\2 Stars)

(Stung) is a fun creature feature about mutated wasps crashing a boring garden party .But it's OK they really liven things up(Matt O'Leary) and (Jessica Cook) play Paul and Julia, 2 party caterers that just happen to be at the wrong place at the wrong time. There's some sexual tension between the two but mainly on Paul's part.It also stars the great (Clifton Collins Jr) and horror veteran (Lance Henriksen).Collins as  the nerdy son of the woman throwing the party "quite a departure for Collins" and Henriksen as a guest.At first the wasps are large but when they bite someone they burrow into them and Become huge mutations.There is plenty of action and gore and other gross stuff. Turns out Paul is not the loser Julia thought he was as he  takes on the dreaded creatures with hero like finnesse.This movie is fun,entertaining .It has romance betrayal and is the best creature feature I've seen in a long time. Horror and SyFy lovers will Enjoy!

(Clown) was a movie I have been wanting to see since I heard about it! I'm a huge Eli Roth fan and he didn't disappoint with this .I found the story to be quite original and unique.The main character Kent played by (Andy Powers) finds an old clown suit "that unbeknownst to him has an evil and terrifying history" he puts it on for his son's birthday party to play (Dummo The Clown)  and it actually starts taking root on and in his body.He finds out the suit is cursed and is turning him into a demon that eats children.The transformation effects are really good especially when he is completely transformed,he is terrifying and looks freaky and so cool.There's was a nice amount of gore but not as much as I expected, and it was all done extremely well.They don't shy away from showing children getting eaten or killed either.The story got a little bogged down in a couple of places but that's such a small thing to complain about. There was a found Footage scene that was quite chilling as well.The fact that they took the movie seriously said alot about the confidence they had in the story because it could have gone really wrong fast but it worked perfectly. All in all I think it's one of the best horror films I've seen in quite awhile.

Abby Daniels (Alicia M Clark) Answers an ad for an in home caretaker for an elderly woman, Granny/Mildred (Donna Sweden) who just happens to be the kind of sweet old lady that makes masks out of dead people's faces.Sleeps in the same bed with her decomposed husband, feeds the local preacher a severed penis for breakfast and has a zero tolerance for fornication!With the help of her equally psychotic grandson Jace (TJ Pack) they find ways to keep their freezer full of meat so they can make all kinds of cullinary treats.This was actually a fun and gory little indie slasher flick. Some of the puns and dialogue had me laughing out loud. Yes, it borrowed from films such as TCM but nothing will ever take it's place.The acting was passable and some of the gore effects were reminiscent of those from the 80s slashers and fun to watch. There's a hot and heavy sex scene and nudity. At only about 70 minutes they didn't waste time with unnecessary filler.While not without it's obvious flaws.I think indie slasher lovers will get a kick out of "Kill Granny Kill" !(3 1/2 Stars)

(Bound To Vengeance) which has a running time of  only about 1 hour and 15 minutes wastes no time in getting straight to the meat.Even though it doesn't build much character development in the beginning we come to know the two main characters as the movie proceeds.Eve (Tina Ivlev) who reminds me of a young (Evan Rachel Wood)) wakes up in a dark dank room,chained ,beaten,raped and filthy.Her captor Phil (Richard Tyson) attempts to feed her but she over powers him by beating him in the head with a brick then fastens a neck snare with a very long handle and takes control of his gun! ( no spoiler,it happens in the first 5 minutes) She finds several polaroids of other girls with names and numbers on them.Should Eve do the easy thing and run or try and rescue the other girls? Well,she's a pretty bad a** chick so she decides to go on a rescue mission.From here the movie becomes a fast paced adrenaline, revenge and blood  filled adventure. The acting is superb.The situations are white knuckle inducing.Sometimes hard to watch ,sometimes satisfying ! There is bloody violence and some quick glimpses of gore but not enough to call it a slasher flick.It is one heck of a good revenge thriller though. (Tina Ivlev) as Eve is believable and so good you can't take your eyes off of her.There really are no twists but more like a couple of revelations. It does have a very short running time, but not a moment was wasted on anything frivolous.I really liked the song near the end of the movie and am glad they sang it in Spanish otherwise it would have seemed a bit cliché.

This was a much anticipated movie for me, I was excited after I read about it and saw the trailer.Think "Open Water" but switch it up with The woods and a Bear.I won't go into much because of spoilers.This movie had me glued to the screen from the first frame mostly due to it's beautiful lush scenery,the amazing acting and realism.The two main characters"Alex" and "Jenn" played flawlessly by Jeff Roop and Missy Peregrym are the only people focused on except an encounter with a Mysterious drifter type "Brad" Eric Balfour.This makes the movie all the more endearing because it makes us as viewers feel, up close and personal to them.The gore and brutality was at slasher status and so uncomfortable to watch. The music was perfect and helped build the intensity of each moment.A must See!

This is nothing but an exploitation movie about transsexuals narrated by a "specialist in the field" (Dr Leo Wollman) with a large portion of dialoge coming from a very passable and pretty transsexual named  (Leslie). Most of the other people under going (sex change therapy) "as it was called back then" are unconvincing as the opposite sex save a couple.It's almost a porno film ,even porn star (Harry Reems) of Deep Throat fame is in it ,as they reinact how a trans woman has sex too soon and he leaves her in a small pool of blood after intercourse. They actually show a full sex change surgery blow by blow. Then show the results weeks after with her spread eagle! I must say they have certainly come along way in the surgery department! Now with the new technology the vagina is  aesthetically pleasing and one would never know it was created and not genetic.But this film is just for shock value although most of the information as to the mindset of transgender individuals is accurate. Not for the squeamish or closed minded.

Eddy (Jason Tobin) is an introverted Asian man who denies his Asian descent,to the point of telling Asian jokes to one of his male coworkers and perpetuates Asian stereotypes.He is obsessed with serial killers,his favorite being Ted Bundy!Laughed at and ostrasized by some girls at work Eddy starts his murder spree by offing one of them.After that kill he gets bolder, as he does with every other kill. Eddy becomes romantically involved with the boss' mistress and that is the basis for most of the story.The story was interesting enough although stagnet at times.The acting was good especially by (Jason Tobin) but the kills were lackluster and unsatisfying! There was some blood but no gore! The first kill was the closest thing to being slasher worthy and it was just a stabbing through clothes with some blood splattered on the killers face.Bottom line ...This is an OK film that has a much used plotline.The production value is better than one would expect.There is violence but nothing a hardcore horror lover would find interesting .

I have been using this product for a week now and have seen a noticeable difference in my skin.It's smoother and more youthful looking.This Stem Cell Gold Flake Cream is nicely packaged ,has a pump for easy application and goes on like silk!I use other Perfjohn products and love them but this is my favorite and I feel the most beneficial to.my completion.I received a free sample of this product for an honest and unbiased review!

I'm sorry to disagree with these glowing reviews. Most of which have no more than three total reviews or less! But,I do.This movie while somewhat entertaining, fails when it comes to casting and the fight scenes were so bad at times I was like "hurry up and kill him already".While Dean Cain's acting was good,I found it very hard buying into him being an army of one after being placed in the same prison as the man  (Victor Abbott) played by 7 foot tall Wrestler Paul Wright who killed his pregnant wife.The story was cliché but that would be OK if it gave us something juicy to latch onto. This didn't. Yes, there was some bloody violence as we would expect from The Soska Sisters but it certainly wasn't gory as some have written.There was a bright spot and that was (Michael Eklund) as Warden Snyder.Eklund is always great as the wormish bad guy and plays it so well everytime he makes me want to choke him.Nothing different or special here,it's a do a crime so you can do the time ,get into prison to get revenge on an inmate film.Of course it's usually you against the rest of the prison but there becomes a bit of a different spin on that.I'm not saying it's horrible or unwatchable just that if I don't believe the main actor in his role ,it makes it hard to invest emotionally!
These clogs are great with jeans and a T shirt .Very comfortable and sturdy. A nice break from pumps and other uncomfortable footwear! The 3 inch heel is a perfect height as I'm a tall woman.

Cake was far from a feel good movie but it does give the viewer hope that life, even under the most tragic of situations is still worth fighting for.The ensemble cast was perfect .Yes (Jennifer Aniston) as Claire Bennett was great but so was the often overlooked (Adriana Barraza) as Silvana and (Sam Worthington) husband to the late Nina Collins (Anna Kendrick) who killed herself by jumping off a busy overpass.As much tragedy as the film boasts Jennifer Aniston's comedic timing and dry wit are perfectly utilized and while lighten the mood do not make light of the situations. Claire is heartbreaking to watch. You can see she's in agonizing pain physically and mentally.She also punishes herself by allowing men to use her body as if she has left it spiritually which is further emphasized when we see her having conversations with the deceased Nina.Kudos to Aniston for allowing herself to be filmed in such an unattractive light. It just wouldn't have worked if she looked beautiful.I personally found this to be one of the best films of the year. It made me feel so many real emotions and that is great film making.

This is nothing I would wear out as I like to dress a bit more modestly,but it sure put a smile on my man's face when I wore it for him. It's sexy and the fabric is very comfy and hugs all your curves just right!It "could" be worn to a club with a blazer over it and a great pair of pumps!

This was part documentary part fiction. Kim Filth is a weed smoking, pill snorting loser who lives with his father. He writes poetry and quotes it thoughout the film. I found his poetry to be depressing but prolific.If and when Kim was acting I couldn't tell. Either most of it was real or he's that good!Some might find this rather boring or mundane but I was mesmerized by Kim Filth/Shadow Zombie "his alter ego" and the strange unfortunate people that we're introduced to. There is some disturbing imagery that somehow ties into the story but there was never enough explanation to know exactly what the full extent of the images were.One of the images was explained at the end of the film, the one dealing with Kim not the bloody images that Cookie/Brandi was seeing. Brandi is a very disturbed girl who dresses up as a clown named Cookie .Shadow Zombie and Cookie have a brief stint as boyfriend /girlfriend until she loses it. He also has a love interest who is an amputee and lets him suck on her stump!I guess I liked it so much because Kim is a real person.One with rotten teeth, a very thin frame,he's highly disfuctional and really has nothing to look forward to but more tragedy ,yet he keeps on keepin on. This isn't for everyone but if you're into realism and character studies I think you will be intrigued.

Abby Daniels (Alicia M Clark) Answers an ad for an in home caretaker for an elderly woman, Granny/Mildred (Donna Sweden) who just happens to be the kind of sweet old lady that makes masks out of dead people's faces.Sleeps in the same bed with her decomposed husband, feeds the local preacher a severed penis for breakfast and has a zero tolerance for fornication!With the help of her equally psychotic grandson Jace (TJ Pack) they find ways to keep their freezer full of meat so they can make all kinds of cullinary treats.This was actually a fun and gory little indie slasher flick. Some of the puns and dialogue had me laughing out loud. Yes, it borrowed from films such as TCM but nothing will ever take it's place.The acting was passable and some of the gore effects were reminiscent of those from the 80s slashers and fun to watch. There's a hot and heavy sex scene and nudity. At only about 70 minutes they didn't waste time with unnecessary filler.While not without it's obvious flaws.I think indie slasher lovers will get a kick out of "Kill Granny Kill" !(3 1/2 Stars)

I received these headphones  and am thrilled with them. They're so light weight and comfortable. I'm using them with my tablet,they were so easy to connect to my bluetooth and I'm mechanically challenged.It comes with everything in the photos in a nice little box that shuts magnetically. This way everything you need including the headphones will fit nice and neatly and it will help you stay organized.They're so light weight I almost forgot I had them on. They have such a crisp, clear sound my music sounds amazing.
