This review was written by me and of my own opinion after testing the batteries in an X4. The batteries being offered for free did NOT sway me in any way.

Got this for my 21-month old son, and yes I realize it says "Not for children under 3 yrs." due to small parts. He's good about not eating the tiny pieces. He has a Fisher-Price Doodle Pro Trip, Aqua that he uses extensively, and figured this would be a nice change.The moment I took it out of the package I knew this was not going to last long. It feels cheap, looks cheap, and bends really easily (even in toddler hands.) And my son has managed to sort of break it in a few days—the sliding erasure doesn't go all the way across anymore.The pen is on a cheap thin string, and has a metal tip that is about the thickness of a wire coat hanger. I say this because he has managed to dent the surface with this tip, and come very close to poking a hole in it. The tip is needlessly pointy/sharp. And placing the pen back in the tray is difficult even for an adult since you can only do it pointing one way (downward) and it has to be rotated a certain way to fit onto the pegs.Once the two shapes came out of their cups they don't go back in. I've pushed them in and they just fall out. Weird. They do work well on the surface though, and my son enjoys using them more than the pen.The sliding erasure thing is a real pain to slide across, even for an adult. My son can hardly do it, and he has the Doodle Pro mentioned above so he knows how to do it just fine. Now it stops an inch or so from the edge and won't go all the way unless I turn it over and fiddle with it.the screen actually works quite well with easy to see contrasting colors. I was deeply surprised by this given the quality of the rest of the device.Overall its just okay, The Doodle Pro mentioned above is a better deal, and WAY more durable.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased and honest review. This review was written by me and of my own opinion after testing the drawing board. The drawing board being offered for free did NOT sway me in any way.

This review is based on a pair of medium gloves worn by a 6" 5" male.While the medium size fits just right for finger length, the elastic wrist hits me at the base of my palm. For a 6' 5" male that normally wears gloves in size large, I would recommend getting a large in these too. For these types of gloves, you do not want them too big or loose.If you have cracked or chapped hands, the inner material is pretty annoying in that it feels like velcro to your hands. It's almost like a microfiber insert. It's certainly warm and breathable, but I found that when take the gloves off/on a lot it gets annoying to have my cracked/chapped hands stick to the inner material.Outer shell is pretty unassuming and not over-designed. I like that since I am not looking to make a statement with my gloves, just keep warm.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased and honest review. This review was written by me and of my own opinion after testing the gloves. The gloves being offered free did NOT sway me in any way.

I got these and had them shipped to the office to share with others. They only lasted about an hour before they were gone!At first I wasn't all that interested in the raw walnuts thinking they would be an odd combo to this mix of roasted, salted and flavorful nuts. But they ended up being a good compliment to the mix.The candied pecans are also a nice touch without being too sweet. And the hickory smoked almonds are not too salty or to smokey, they're just right.The box it came in and the bow around the nuts container make this a great option for gifts (office, business, holiday). It's not some cheap box either, but a rather nice one with packing material inside and a product card.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This ring is amazing! The weight of it is noticeable: not too heavy, but feels dense, quite solid. When you put it on you instantly notice the silky smooth interior of the ring. It's so smooth and really does feel wonderful.The outside of the ring is a noticeably rough, brushed metal. I say rough, but not in an uncomfortable way. The smooth inside and rough outside make for a nice juxtaposition of textures that work quite well together. It's something only you will notice, but a nice touch.The 'gold' color of the inside material is just barely visible on the edges of the ring and sometimes catches the light just right. If you wear your ring tight, then you may not see it.Really well-made ring that I HIGHLY recommend.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This ring is amazing! The weight of it is noticeable: not too heavy, but feels dense, quite solid. When you put it on you instantly notice the silky smooth interior of the ring. It's so smooth and really does feel wonderful.The outside of the ring is a noticeably rough, brushed metal. I say rough, but not in an uncomfortable way. The smooth inside and rough outside make for a nice juxtaposition of textures that work quite well together. It's something only you will notice, but a nice touch.The black color of the inside material is just barely visible on the edges of the ring and sometimes catches the light just right. If you wear your ring tight, then you may not see it.Really well-made ring that I HIGHLY recommend.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

I wanted to love this keyboard since my Apple keyboard keeps eating up (rechargeable) batteries weekly, and this is a smaller form factor.Problem is that I paired it with my 6-month old MacBook Pro running El Capitan and it was really laggy. I'd type a few keys and look up to see it still typing away slowly. I disconnected it and now whenever I turn on the keyboard I have this dialog box pop up on my screen for a split second and go away. I found out it is the numerical pin you have to type into the keyboard. Problem is it disappears before you can read it so I can't type it on to get it connected again. Tried everything, but the keyboard no longer works with the MacBook.So, I tried to connect it to my iPad running iOS8. It works, and the dialog box on the McBook went away. By the way, when the dialog box was popping up there was no way to disconnect it form the Bluetooth control panel.I thought I would like the smaller form factor, but it is really only good for shot usage when traveling or having to type on an iPad. Great for keyboard replacement on touch screens, just not a better keyboard than what comes with my Macbook and iMac.Also, the keyboard's battery saving policy is aggressive. It keeps turning off (or sleeping) much sooner than I think necessary. Would be nice to be able to reset this or override it.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This is my second solar-powered battery backup, and I think my new favorite.First thing I noticed was that it is about the same size as an iPhone 6 (in a case), just a bit thicker. The rubberize grips on the side help keep it from slipping out of your hand (not that you'll be holding it much.) It looks and feels a lot like some external harddrives.I also noticed that there is fair amount of flex to the device when I go to try and bend it lengthwise. The outer case does not appear to add a lot of support to the device so much as protection.As with many battery backups on the market, this one also has the 4 blue LED indicators to show you how much charge is left (1 for 25%, 2 for 50%, 3 for 75%, and 4 for full.) They are not as bright as others, but can be seen on the sunlight quite easily.When the unit is enough sunlight to start charging itself, a single green LED illuminates. There is also a MicroUSB port to charge the unit using the supplied USB to MicroUSB cable.The instructions are, in one case, ironic:— "Solar charging only for emergency..." Hmm, thought this was its main m.o., no?Other solar chargers only charge the unit to 75% capacity under the sun (for some safety reason.) I didn't see that mentioned in the instructions, and I noticed that I got a full charge under the sun with this one!I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

The quality of the lenses are somewhere in the mid-range. I noticed the the edges of the viewable area are darker (vignette) and a bit out of focus. The images get a bit darker as well. My camera seems to refocus periodically when the lenses are on.You also have to take the case off your phone in order to use this. I have a thin case, but still need to take it off otherwise the lens doesn't sit properly and the viewable area becomes very small and dark.Great for:— playing around— kids— taking close up (macro) shots of objects.The macro lens works best out of all of them. I was more interested in the fisheye, but it's not very good.I received a sample of this product at a discount to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

We have had a lot of Bluetooth speakers in the past year, many of them sounded horrible. When I connected this one and played some music my wife was impressed with the sound quality. I have to admit that it is not the best Bluetooth speaker I have heard, BUT for a dual-speaker system it does have decent sound and gets loud enough for outdoor use.When you turn on the flashlight you can look into the side audio port and see one speaker. the other speaker is inside the belt loop area and looks to be oval shaped.Having a battery backup, speaker and flashlight all on a bike/bar mount is pretty cool. This all-in-one unit can make it pretty handy for:— camping— hiking— RVs— biking— kids— garage— strollersThere are 3 mounting options: carabiner, belt/strap, and bike/bar mount (included.) The bike/bar mount is fairly large, and comes with rubber and foam shims to make it work for smaller bars. This fit on the round handle of a Joovy Caboose stroller just fine.The audible prompts are nice. It says "connected" and "low power" instead of relying on forgettable blinking light patterns.The front of the unit (in orange) has a bit of an under-designed funky kind of vibe going on. Almost doesn't match the rest of the unit.The speaker sounds good when the back rubber panel is closed and fully seated. But, when you open it, the speaker sounds tinny and weird. Seems like the sound design relies on it being closed, and when it is playing you can really feel the bass in the rubber panel.The outer rubber cover can be lifted up around the sound ports on the sides and bottom—it's not glued to the unit.The ports on the bottom allow for a belt/string/strap to go through to hang it by. Doesn't seem to interfere with the sound, so long as the belt or strap isn't too thick an blocks the speaker that is in this area.The flashlight is not super bright, but would work for biking or stroller use at night.The instructions are in SUPER tiny print, and the English version is badly written. Most people should be able to get a basic understanding of what they are trying to say.I received a sample of this product at a discount to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This light claims 1200 lumens (the brightness of light measurement). So, I compared it to my 970 lumens LED flashlight and found that it was very similar, if not the same. Either it is hard to see the difference of 200 or so lumens, or one of the specified ratings is a bit off.This light also casts a bit of a yellowish color, whereas my other one was brilliant white, almost blue. Again both are using a very similar square LED style bulb.The light end of the flashlight is a LOT bigger (wider) than I expected. It's about the diameter of a U.S. half dollar coin at 1 and 3.4 inches across. The convex lens on it is huge, and sits close to the edge when standing verticlaly on a flat surface. Meaning, the lens is a bit more exposed than other flashlights of this type.I also noticed that my flashlight lens has some scratched and gouges on it. Nothing serious, but they are present. Thought they were dust at first but you can feel the etching of the scratches.Battery is easy to replace, no tools required, and no plastic sleeve needed around the battery.The button works well, and comes with a simple half-press function to change to flashing/strobe, high and low intensities. The unit is all-black, even the button.The charger is super basic and built to charge one battery. Has a somewhat short cord (which is nice that you don't have a ton of cord to coil up or get in the way).I also did not get any packaging or instructions with this flashlight. Everything is super basic, but even some simple instructions covering what is stated in the details page on Amazon would be nice for those of use giving this to someone else.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This is a great guide with MANY links to current and relevant apps/products to help you stay productive. But, as the author said, this is not an exhaustive list but a 'best of', the cream of the crop.In a sense, this book is the ebook version of a website he founded to collect and find the best products for things like Browsers, email clients, exercise and a lot more.I noticed pretty quick that there are a ton of quotes from Amazon's Jeff Bezos in this book. I think quotes can help, but I would have liked to see a more broad range of sources that just one person.Well-written and with suggestions that I actually find current and useful. I hope it gets updated regularly.Also, unlike some other ebooks, I found the formatting to actually be pretty good and readable. Nice blue underlined links make it easy to find your way to the app/product mentioned.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

I was pleasantly surprised how soft and comfortable this pillow is. Most neck pillows I have used are stiff and not very moldable. This pillow allows you to pile it up where you want and thin it out where you don't want it.The design of the strap and buckle is really smart too. The way of putting it under your arm and up around your shoulder is genius! It really works well.I found the cover to be softer than any sheet or blanket I have at home. It did not irritate my face and was a real pleasure to lay on.I also found that it makes a great hammock companion. Just wrap it around the top of the hammock and get in. With a little adjustment the pillow sits in the right place (for me.)The washable cover is really convenient too. Would be nice if there were other cover color/pattern options, but overall the gray color works well.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

I really like the design how the bottom contact slides down to fit different battery lengths, and works as a spring loaded clamp to hold the battery in place. Makes charging different sized batteries simultaneously a lot easier.One of the first things I noticed from using it and reading the instructions was that the unit automatically detects the battery type and best charge for it. I found it detected Ni-MH, Li-ion and Li-FePO automatically. I was a little confused on the selected charge since it didn't match what was stated on the batteries. Battery states 1.2v and the charger showed it was charging at 1.4v. Not sure how that works out.I did notice that compared to my other charger, this one gets a little warm, and so does the batteries. Again, my other wall charger does not.I like chargers that plug directly into the wall. I can see how some people prefer the cord so they are confined to hogging up an outlet. The box plug is nice in that they thought about the other plug and made it sideways so as to not obstruct the other outlet or work in a bar-type multi-outlet extension cord.The instructions are brutal to understand and read. Super tiny print that made me get out a lighted magnifying glass! The way they describe the settings is tough to follow. I have been using the auto detection just fine, but some of you may want to override it. At least the display is easy to read, which is great.I would have liked it more if this had battery conditioning and a better explanation of the settings.Great for those that have a bunch of different sized rechargeable Ni-MH, Li-ion and Li-FePO batteries.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

I was surprised by how sturdy this stand actually is. I wouldn't go leaning my whole body weight on it, but it most certainly holds my large laptop well.At first, I doubted the two legs would be able to hold it from folding over side to side. But, we put laptops on it and typed on it and pushed it around and it really held up! It does wiggle side to side if you push it, but when you are typing it barely moves at all.The mouse try is kind of useless for a traditional mouse since it is small and the mouse falls off—the tray is at an angle. We did find that an Apple Wireless Magic Trackpad works well since you don't have to move it.The fans are USB powered. If you only have one USB slot, or no free ones, this can be an issue. In that case, I recommend you use a USB wall charger to power it (you'll just have to find a USB extension or be close to an outlet.Adjusting the legs takes some work. We found ourselves making numerous adjustments until we got it at the right height and in such a way as to not tip forward/backward. It's a balancing act. Also know that you cannot adjust the legs when your laptop is still on the tray. The downward pressure makes pushing in the buttons on the legs not possible.Works great for:— standing desk— couch/chair desk— music stand— cookbook holderI received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

Keep in mind this is a "thin thermal", and that you can see through it when held up to even low light. Like tiny little mesh holes throughout it. It makes it exceptionally breathable, and a good layer to be used under/over other clothes.Upon inspection we did notice quite a few threads hanging of of the seams. Some attached, some not.Zipper is good. On the black version the zipper is all black, which is nice.Size wise the large felt a touch too small. Being that it is thin stretchy material, it works well as a running jacket since it sits close to the body.The front pockets are really shallow. They are about 2" deep, so know that things may fall out of them easily when you bend over or sit.// CARE - WASHThe label states "Machine wash cold, gentle cycle, do not bleach, tumble dry low.""MADE IN CHINA"I received this at a discount to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This is a fun little camera for those times when you want to give out 2"x3" prints right away (well, 10-15 seconds later.)The prints come out very slowly, but are ready to hold and completely processed once they do. No more waiting! Some print stock comes with a peel and stick back to turn them into stickers.Instructions are lacking, big time! The entirety of the instruction manual that come sin the box is a small card with just illustrations on it. NO words. They are meant for those that have some experience with film and Polaroid cameras before. If this is your first real print camera (non-phone camera), then you may be at a loss for a little bit. I HIGHLY recommend you do a search for "Polaroid snap user manual", or download the manual from the product detail page for this camera on Amazon, which is far better than what is supplied here.The viewfinder is just a toy, and really just the power button for the camera. It isn't really calibrated to be used accurately. When I did, the shot come out way too close and not what I saw in the viewfinder.The viewfinder is also way too easy to flip open which turns on the camera. You barely bump it and it's open and on. Found it open numerous times when in my bag. Camera turns off after a bit, but still, too easy to bump on.The lens cap is magnetic, which makes removal and replacement very easy and interesting. No more clips to hold it in place. Also, no hole for a lanyard.Overall it works well and is fun to use, even for my toddler. Just be sure to buy Polaroid 2x3 paper with this!I received this at a discount to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

I have been using a jojoba oil with vitamin E every day for years now. This oil is a pleasant change to that daily regimen in that it has the same moisturizing qualities, but with a very pleasant almost woodsy scent. And I mean woodsy in that outdoorsy kind of way, not smelling like actual cedar or pine.Also pretty stoked that the fragrance is subtle and not overwhelming. When I use it I notice the smell during application but it tends to go away over time and I am not left with it all day. Again, it's pleasant but subtle.The pour spout on this is just okay. You have to be gentle when pouring—like you are pouring out an insanely spicy hot sauce. Reason is that it tends to go everywhere, and then drip down the side of the bottle. It has one of those plastic caps with a small hole in the middle. Unscrew the metal cap and gently tip it into your hand. Don't shake it! Just give the plastic bottle a tiny squeeze, then roll the plastic cap along your hand to wipe off the excess that likes to drip down the side. Again: the cap could be better.I could not find anywhere that stated where the oil contents were actually made. The company is listed as "S El Monte, CA", but that does not expressly mean they manufacture the oil there. Would be nice if the company mentioned this somewhere.I received a free 4.09oz sample of this oil to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

I'm one of those people that is kind of stoked on the fact that they thought to put a pump on this bottle to make it really convenient in a shower caddy.Also pretty stoked that the fragrance is subtle and not overwhelming. When rinsed from my hair, I do not have to go the entire day smelling the shampoo. Again, it's pleasant but subtle.Works great! Don't know what else to say about it except that it left my hair feeling clean and manageable.I could not find anywhere that stated where the shampoo and conditioner contents were actually made. The company is listed as "S El Monte, CA", but that does not expressly mean they manufacture the shampoo and conditioner there. Would be nice if the company mentioned this somewhere.I received a free 16.9oz sample of shampoo and conditioner to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

I'm one of those people that is kind of stoked on the fact that they thought to put a pump on this bottle to make it really convenient in a shower caddy.Also pretty stoked that the fragrance is subtle and not overwhelming. When rinsed from my hair, I do not have to go the entire day smelling the shampoo. Again, it's pleasant but subtle.Works great! Don't know what else to say about it except that it left my hair feeling clean and manageable.I could not find anywhere that stated where the shampoo and conditioner contents were actually made. The company is listed as "S El Monte, CA", but that does not expressly mean they manufacture the shampoo and conditioner there. Would be nice if the company mentioned this somewhere.I received a free 16.9oz sample of shampoo and conditioner to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

I like it. This is a great lens for those that have an iPhone 5/6/6+. There is a a clamp option for other phones, but I have to admit that using the large lens on the clamp is not advised: it falls off easily and is really hard to align correctly. The fisheye lens works great with the clamp, though!The quality of the materials is pretty good. Mostly metal, minimal plastic, and the lens appear to be real glass. The view through the lens is crisp and clear. Serious camera fanatics may notice some quality issues in the lenses per se, but most other people won't.I found the idea great, but the execution of swapping out lenses a bit tedious. I really like the fisheye on the clamp setup the best, since it is fast and easy. Having to take my phone out of my case to use the supplied case with the long lens is a bit tedious. If that was the sole purpose of the day, then it's fine. But, if I just want to take one or two shots, it's a bit of work to set up.You have to turn off your camera flash since the supplied case covers up the flash and it just ends up shooting across the case and lens thus making some interesting, albeit useless, images. (See the image I uploaded.)I found the tripod to work ok. My phone did not sit straight (like in the product photos) and kept turning clockwise (downward) from the weigh of it. This meant I had to hold the phone level while taking the picture. The tripod is fairly stable though with a nice wide stance.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This 65', 1/8-inch wide, 7 core rope is a highly functional part of our camping kit. The flash orange color makes it highly visible, and the thickness makes it versatile for use with numerous applications, without being too thin.The spool it is on is reusable, but the cardboard ends make it a short-term solution, not a long-term one.Claims it holds 550 pounds, but I have yet to put it that much weight on it, or a need to. This makes a great sunshade using Gecko Active Beach Blanket / Picnic Blanket - 100% Parachute Nylon. Lightweight, Quick-drying, With Anchor Pockets. Perfect For a SAND-FREE Day at the Beach! Extra Large - 6 x 7 Feet.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This is by far the nicest and fanciest USB to Lightening cable I have ever owned! I really like that it is white and has a smooth surface that is not the tacky/rubbery feel of the original cable (they tangle too easily.) These do not tangle up very easily at all!The connectors fit great, and the look and feel of them is really nice. If you are person who hates plastic, these metal jacks are going to be a pleasure to you.My iPhone 6 connects to it just fine without the dreaded 'not compatible' warning that some other non-compliant cables produce.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

I like it. It's a tiny robot the size of a quarter and is pretty easy to program and reprogram to do what you want.The contents were surprisingly abundant!— 2 robots with internal rechargeable batteries— 2 USB charging cables— holding tray to protect them— GREAT, well-written instructions with calibration circle— 4 covers that go on the robots, plus 2 carry caes— stickers!— and race trackPlus you get free access to the Blockly website to reprogram your robots (no sign up/in required).I found the act of reprogramming the robots to be educationally challenging in that it takes the user a bit to move the blocks around on the screen in a cohesive order to make the robot do what they want it to do. There are also pre-written programs, should you just want to jump into it.If you have a curious and patient child no younger than 7 or 8, I would highly recommend this. You need to have access to a computer with a USB drive (for charging) in order to program the robots. Without a computer, they simply go off of their preprogrammed functions and work on the race track. So, they work right out of the box (should they still have a charge.)Programming a robot is very easy, and works like a linear Lego chain. Do this first, do this second, and so on.I received this at a discount to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This review is for a genuine Hubsan X4, NOT a clone or knockoff. **Be careful some people are getting clone/knockoffs. Request a refund from Amazon if you do NOT get the genuine Hubsan X4.This is my first drone, and I was told by another drone pilot to get a Hubsan because they are the best for beginners to learn on. After flying an X4 for a few weeks, I have to agree: this has been a great teaching tool and helped me feel like I can get a more expensive drone.// TWO MODESI like that the X4 has two modes, one for newbies that helps keep them from flipping it and crashing as easily, and another for experts that gives them free range to do what they want.I did NOT feel like the newbie mode was a bummer to fly at all. If you have never flown one before, this is the mode for you. If you have, then you may feel it to be a bit restrictive because it is keeping you from flipping it. Think of it more like a governor.// REPLACEABLE PARTSMine came with an additional set of propellers, which was good since mine got bested up after a dozen or so crashes. They are simple to replace: just push them onto the motor spindle with your hands, no tools required. I did notice that the ones that came preinstalled fell off more easily in crashes than the second set that I installed. Not sure why, same style crashes hitting the same things.Mine did NOT come with the prop guard. Wish I had one at first, but now feel I did not need it.// INSTRUCTIONSThe instructions are not the best. Took me a couple read-thrus to get it. And even then it was a lot easier to learn how to properly calibrate the drone and controls from another drone pilot or YouTube videos. I highly recommend watching some videos on calibration tips for the X4. So much easier than the instructions that come with it.I HIGHLY recommend this for those new to flying drones. If you have remote controlled vehicle experience, you should be able to pick it up really quickly. Others may take a handful of flights to start to get the hang of it.

This is my sixth small form bluetooth speaker, and my third single speaker type. I say that because it is important to note that a single speaker will rarely sound as good as a dual or multi-speaker system.// SOUNDIn the single-speaker category, this sounds pretty good. A bit monaural, but the quality is fairly clean and crisp. The bass is only really noticeable when the speaker is pointed directly at you since it comes out the top, not the bottom or sides.You may want to play with the EQ on your phone/laptop to help improve the sound a bit.// WEIGHTThe weight of it is impressive. When you pick it up you will notice that it has some heft to it— a bit less than the weight of a full cup of coffee/tea. It also feels very solid and dense, not flimsy or cheap at all.The unit alone (no cables) weight 272 grams, or 9.6 oz.// BATTERYThere is some discrepancy in the description on Amazon and the instruction manual. Amazon detail page says "Unrivalled [sic] 8 to 12-hour playtime", but the instructions state "about 6H". Depending on how loud you play the music, how much bass there is to it, the battery life may vary a lot. I'm not one to let the battery go all the way to empty—and I usually only listen for about 30 min intervals—so I don't know how long it lasts yet.// PACKAGINGI would consider the packaging to be gift quality. It's NOT your typical low-quality designed packaging. I would definitely consider this a good gift for someone that needs it for the following...Great for:—camping and RVs— office, desk, conference rooms— background music for small rooms— kidsI received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

These are some well-built flashlights! All metal construction that looks like they are CNC machined, not poured (don't quote me on that process though).They are really bright, but I would not say that they are the brightest I have seen. While I would not want this shown into my eyes, I would say they are right up there with some Maglites' I have had in the past. Again, satisfied, but if you are looking for the type of light that stuns and looks like this product, this is not a stun light.The smaller light is not as bright as the bigger light. It is more like the bigger light's medium power. It only takes an AA battery, not the supplied 18650 battery.The larger light takes one 18650 battery (2 are supplied, plus wall charger) or 3 AAA batteries using the converter sleeve.The button works well, and the flash orange color stands out in low light situations. The small light does NOT Have a multi-function button. The large light does have a handful of settings that you can access by turning on the light and half-pressing the button to cycle through them (high, med, low, pulse, and SOS). When you turn it off, the setting does NOT remain selected—it goes back to full strength.Great for:— camping and RVs— kids in scouts/troops— daily use— in the car— emergenciesI received a sample of this product at a discount to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This case is very similar to other battery backup cases in form and function.// FEELThe case itself does not have any sharp edges, and is very smooth in your hand. Large corners and a velvety smooth finish with a subtle amount of grip to it. Just enough to keep it from slipping out of your hands, but not too much that it is a pain to get out of your pocket.// CHARGINGThe case does not come with a cable since you use your Lightening cable to charge the case, and the case charges the iPhone. This is awesome! One less cable to own and manage.Charging the phone (when unplugged) simply takes you pressing the silver button on the back of the unit. Press it and release to turn on and charge phone. Press and hold for a couple seconds to turn off battery backup. If not phone is installed, the battery backup will turn off automatically after about 10 seconds. You can see if it is on by the 4 blue LEDs on the back of the unit.I think it charges the phone at a good rate of speed. Not as fast as another battery case I have, but also not slow either.I feel like the statement in the details from the Seller "Swap your low battery for a fully charged one to get your phone to a 100% charge immediately" is not completely accurate. If your phone is dead, you can place it in this case and turn the case on so you can use your phone. The case does not instantly bring your phone to a 100% charge (that's not possible), but it does offer a full charge on standby. So, a dead iPhone and a full case will equal one full charged iPhone.// BUTTONSThe buttons are not awesome. I had trouble using the volume buttons to take pictures since they are hard to get to. Ended up taking the top of the case off to use them with obstruction.Power button is gnarly to press and operate. Has a ribbed feel to it that can get annoying if you are one to turn your phone on/off numerous times throughout the day.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

It took longer to download a cardboard VR game for this than it did to set up. No tools required—just unfold and fold according to instructions, takes about 5 seconds.Works great with the iPhone 6 (not Plus). The space for the phone is made to be a little forgiving, but I recommend you take your phone out of your case (unless it is ultra thin).// TRIGGERThe "trigger" is the pad on the top right, and it is made of some conductive material to transfer your finger to be a tap on the screen. You barely need to tap it and it works. At first I was pulling it like a trigger and getting poor performance. When I treated it like a remote screen and only tapped it, it worked better.// LIGHTINGWorks great in all sorts of lighting conditions. But, you must be sitting or standing for it to work. If you are laying down (on your back) it will think you are looking directly upward. So, you do need some room and mobility for most games.// GAMESThis device does NOT come with games. It is meant to work with existing 'cardboard VR' games in the app store (iPhone and Android). Simply do a search for "cardboard VR app" or cardboard VR games" to find some you are interested in.I downloaded VR Flappy and Vanguard VR from the Apple App Store. Both are great intros to the world of cardboard VR games, and playable by kids too.// NO QR CODESome other cardboard VR devices have a QR code that you scan when using a game. This doe snot, so you simply press 'skip' on that step of the apps/games.// CONSTRUCTIONIt's thick, durable cardboard. So, know that it will wear out if not handled properly. It's meant to be a lightweight recyclable device. The cardboard VR device is really a statement saying that you can have virtual reality in the form of something made from paper and use your phone.It's durable, the trigger works well, and they even thought about the tape on the area where your forehead goes so it doesn't get gross.There is a noticeable glue smell when you first open it and place it on your face. Kind of a bummer being that it is right up against your nose and no way to get around it.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

The plastic chemical smell is REALLY strong when I first opened the package. We had to put these outside to air out because the smell was too overwhelming for the car. It's not that we are sensitive to it— it has a REALLY strong plastic smell.They are still airing out, so I will update this review after I install them.

This is my second LED filament type bulb. I love the style of the 'filaments', and I find that they burn much cooler than CFLs and especially incandescents.The light it emits is very warm and nice. I have this in a Chardonnay bottle with the bottom cut off, and the light is very warm and pleasant. As a bare bulb it's a great light for any room. If you are used to glaring white, almost blue type lighting, then this will be a huge difference for you. I think for the better, but that's up to you.The screw in base is a standard, common size—you shouldn't need any adapters. I like that the glass bulb part is a bit smaller than regular incandescents, helping it hit in more places.I received a sample of this product at a huge discount to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

These really are as soft as they describe them to be. Soft right out of the box, and they really did get a bit softer after the wash. Would be nice it they had the washing instructions on the label. Once the box is gone you have to guess how to wash them. I no longer have the box, and don't remember what it said, if anything at all.They are also a great size: not too big, just a bit larger than a large adult hand.I did notice that one of the threads pulled out in the middle of the cloth, and it created a long line of missing pile, kind of looks like a deep gash. I had to cut it and tie it off to keep it from just forever unravelling. Be careful not to snag it on sharp things, and if you do, cut it and tie the ends.The material is a nice brilliant white, not dingy at all.Great for more than just washing:— use and handkerchief instead of tissues— drool rag— food cleanup while feeding— breast feeding clothI received a free 6-pack sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

First thing is: if you are one of those people that HATE those metal edged sunshades for your car that you can never understand how to get folded up correctly, then you are are going to struggle with this even worse. I can get the sunshade things folded up easily, but this thing is something else. I read the instructions printed on the bag, followed it to a T, but could not get it folded to go back in the bag—and YES, you need the bag to hold it together to move store or move around.Second, it would have been nice to have the sandbag corners you see on some other products like this. It's where the corners have pockets that you can fill with sand or rocks or weights to hold it down. This brand gives you these cheap straight metal pegs that are completely useless on the beach. And "beach" is in the title of this product!So, once you have it set up on the beach, the wind easily blows it away because there really isn't anything to hold it down. I recommend making/buying some small sandbags to tie to the corners.Quality seems to be great, just not much foresight into making a product that can actually be used in places where the wind blows.

The size 4 fit my 36-pound, 21-month old son just right—not too tight, not too saggy, and the waist band seems to sit in the right place.The quality of these is awesome. Great material, solid stitching, and feel like they are made to last. When I washed them in hot water and dried them on high heat, they barely shrunk at all and really held their shape.The white is brilliant white (not dingy), just like what you see in the pictures.Comes in a gift quality box, 3 pairs rolled up. It's minimal packaging, so you won't be pulling out those little plastic ties or any clips. Just open the box and unroll.I received a free 3 pair sample to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

Great material, solid stitching, and feel like they are made to last. When I washed them in hot water and dried them on high heat, they barely shrunk at all and really held their shape.The colors are great too, and look just like what you see in the pictures.Comes in a gift quality box, 3 pairs rolled up. It's minimal packaging, so you won't be pulling out those little plastic ties or any clips. Just open the box and unroll.I received a free 3 pair sample to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

At first I was surprised that it came in two 10oz jars—guess I should read the description closer.First thing we noticed was that the expiration date is 3 months from now—normal? or is this batch old? Eating 20oz of this stuff in 3 months is probably not going to happen for us, so we are sharing the second jar with family. Guess it coming in two jars really paid off.My wife is not a fan of the 'fudginess' of Nutella. This is thinner than that, and does not have that pasty, fudge-like consistency. It's really smooth, a bit thin, spreads very easily and even works great as a dip. She likes this over the Nutella.I like that it is all natural, non-GMO, and has the appropriate fair trade certificates and notices on it (for palm oil).The paper seal was a bit of a hassle to get off. It split in two so I had to remove two seals, the second being papery and hard to get off in one go. Now there is paper glued to the rim of the jar, not awesome, but functional.Great for:— ice cream—dipping fruit— toast— drizzle on oatmeal— straight— chocolate milk (takes a minute to get mixed)I received two 10oz jars for free to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

These lids really are thin and very flexible. They are also VERY sticky, in a way that helps them stay in place. This also means they tend to stick to one another and are not something you can just slide out from one another.We have a large stainless steel bowl that measures 10-inches across and we found it is about an inch too big to work for the largest lid here. I'd say a 9-inch across bowl would work fine. Those small one cup pyrex glass bowls work great for the smallest lid.Getting the lids to stretch around a bowl can sometimes be a bit tricky. The material sticks so well to the bowl that it does NOT slide over it. You have to stretch it out beyond the bowl and bring it down over the side without dragging it across the bowl. It's that sticky! Which is great for staying in place, just makes it kind of a pain to put on some bowls/containers.There is no way I am placing these in the dishwasher! First, should one fall below the racks you are in for a big expensive problem with it sitting on the heating elements. Two, they are so easy to wash by hand, and keeping them out of the dishwasher heat should make them last longer.Great for:— kids snack cups— letting bread rise (maybe not all types of breads)— RVs— times when you need to cover something but also see through the coverI received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This jar is huge! Going to last me a long time.Upon opening it I noticed a rich, slightly sweet scent of coconut. I spread a small amount on my hands and the warmth really brought out the notes of fresh coconut. The texture is very smooth and silky, just like you would expect.There are no flakes or other deposits in this oil—it's pure and clean.Great for:— baby's skin— hair— baking and cookingI received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

They work! For those that are worried they won't work from reading other reviews, know that they do work, and are in fact some of the longest lasting temp tattoos my son has ever worn!// PRO TIPYou have to make sure:1) that your child's skin is clean and free from sunscreen BEFORE you apply the tattoo2) you must use a VERY wet washcloth/rag/towel and some good amount of pressure to work well.3) hold the wet cloth on the tattoo for a good 2-3 mins.The above steps have worked for us on over a dozen of these M&D tattoos. When we try and put it on an arm that already has sunscreen on it, they fail. When we only do a short session with the wet cloth, they fail.// SUNSCREEN REMOVES THE TATTOOSWhen you place the tattoos on a sunscreened skin, they will come off. If you apply sunscreen over the tattoo, they will get stick/tacky and start to disintegrate MUCH faster. Sunscreen is a great way to remove the tattoos too!// LAST FOR DAYS!My son has been wearing his latest two tattoos for well over a week, almost 2 weeks! Some last shorter, but that depends on the number of applications of sunscreen (have I hammered this home enough?) and baths he takes.// DESIGNSThe designs are cheesy, okay, and awesome. Seems kind of like 2-3 designers worked on it, or someone modified them after delivery, because some are really fun and cool while others are really cheesy—even for kids. My son couldn't care less, he just likes having them on his arms so he can point to them and exclaim "tay-toooz!"

It's hard to tell from the photos, but the lens are actually a mirrored chrome-like finish with lots of orange in them, a hint of yellow (the photos make it look more like brown lenses.) I'll try and post my own photos here.// FRAMEThe brown part of the frame is a nice smooth, polished finish, and feel durable, not fragile or brittle. They have a small amount of flex to them.// ARMSThe arms are a really smooth bamboo, with a thin sateen finish to them. This is my first pair of glasses that use bamboo (second pair by 8Wake), and I have to say that I like the feel of the material. Compared to my all plastic sunglasses, the bamboo slides more easily over your face and hair whereas the plastic tends to stick slightly to your face.The arms are also slightly more straight than my other glasses. The part that goes over the ear does not turn inward as much as other glasses, and I feel it's the middle of the arm that is hugging my head, not the end or hook of the arm.With my other pair of 8Wake sunglasses, the bamboo arms start to dark up a bit wear the oils have rubbed onto it—these have a nice finish to them that seems to be keeping the oils from penetrating.// HINGESI like the spring hinges that are forgiving of over expanding the arms. They also gently snap the arms into place: close and open. They also are forgiving in the alignment of the arms. You can twist them slightly to adjust the comfort and alignment to your head.// LENSESThe lens are crisp and clear. The polarization creates a faint blue tint to everything, yet still bright. They are not super dark lenses, but more of a light to medium tint.One small problem with my OTHER pair of 8Wakes (the Rush Black Bamboo) arose from the level of tinting in that the sunlight shines through with just enough intensity that it sometimes is reflected back from my face onto the inside of the lenses creating a reflection. It almost appears as a smudge in my vision. This is MUCH LESS of a problem with this pair, to the point where I barely notice it.I also noticed that the lenses completely block out the red display of my Kia car stereo. The screen appears blank, even when it is on full intensity/contrast. I believe this is due to the polarization, but am not sure. I rarely ever drive the car, so it's not a deal breaker.// SUMMARYI like the overall weight, and the feel of the bamboo arms. The hinges are a nice touch for me, make it feel a bit higher quality than just swing hinges.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

I've tried a bunch of bluetooth speakers that were this size, and NONE of them sound this good, and are as easy to pair with my phone.// SOUND & BASSThe bass ports out the bottom, and at first I thought that it would just get muffled from sitting on the counter/desk. But it doesn't! I put on some really heavy rock and—again, seriously: for the size and price—this thing pretty amazing! The sound isn't all lopsided or tinny, it's fairly balanced and actually sounds pretty good.// CONTROLSThere is an on/off switch on the back, and four buttons along the top. Like most bluetooth speakers do, they have some buttons doing double-duty. The volume up/down is also the track next/prev. You have to press and hold for the volume to work. Strange since the printed icon on the button is the volume up/down, you would think that it would be the thing that is a single press, not a press and hold.I mainly use my phone's controls, so it's no big deal to me.// CONSTRUCTIONThe case is fairly solid, though I wouldn't want to drop it on concrete. I actually like the slightly rubbery feel to the case—keeps it form slipping out of my hands.The feet are REALLY sticky. Once you set it down on a countertop (especially a smooth one) there is no sliding/pushing it around. You have to pick it up and move it.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

It's hard to tell from the photos, but the lens are actually a mirrored chrome-like finish with a hint of orange in them. The photos make it look more like yellow safety/shooter lenses. I'll try and post my own photos here.// FRAMEThe black part of the frame is a nice matte finish, and  feel durable, not fragile or brittle. They have just the right amount of flex to them.// ARMSThe arms are a really smooth bamboo. This is my first pair of glasses that use bamboo, and I have to say that I like the feel of the material. Compared to my all plastic sunglasses, the bamboo slides more easily over your face and hair whereas the plastic tends to stick slightly to your face.The arms are also slightly more straight than my other glasses. The part that goes over the ear does not turn inward as much as other glasses, and I feel it's the middle of the arm that is hugging my head, not the end or hook of the arm.Also, as you handle the arms and wear them, the bamboo may start to dark up a bit wear the oils have rubbed onto it. Mine are looking nice from the handling and wear.// HINGESI like the spring hinges that are forgiving of over expanding the arms. They also gently snap the arms into place: close and open. They also are forgiving in the alignment of the arms. You can twist them slightly to adjust the comfort and alignment to your head.// LENSESThe lens are crisp and clear. The polarization creates a faint blue tint to everything, yet still bright. They are not super dark lenses, but more of a light to medium tint.One small problem arises out of the level of tinting in that the sunlight shines through with just enough intensity that it sometimes is reflected back from my face onto the inside of the lenses creating a reflection. It almost appears as a smudge in my vision. This is not a problem when in the shade or driving, only in direct, strong sunlight. This also may not be a problem for those of you with darker skin tones and less oily skin to keep the light from being reflected.I also noticed that the lenses completely block out the red display of my Kia car stereo. The screen appears blank, even when it is on full intensity/contrast. I believe this is due to the polarization, but am not sure.// SUMMARYI like the overall weight, and the feel of the bamboo arms. The hinges are a nice touch for me, make it feel a bit higher quality than just swing hinges. The reflection on the inside of the lens can sometimes bug me when I am walking outside, but you may not notice. If you are wearing a hat, it certainly cuts down on this.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This takes a little getting used to. Straight from the bag they are like a raisin with a crumbly texture. They are sweet to the same level of a good quality raisin.These are great for adding to:— hot tea (I recommend this)— hot cereal— trail mix— homemade powerbarsKeep in mind a serving is a tenth of the bag. I would say a normal serving for the above mentioned items is about half of that amount.I received a free 10oz bag of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This is my second brand of coconut sugar, and my favorite so far. The texture and taste is great—can be eaten straight from the bag. Not as syrupy sweet as sugar, but similar level of sweetness (if that makes sense). Packs similar to brown sugar, though a bit more crumbly.Great for use in baking (use 1:1 to sugar), and especially in coffee. Can also be sprinkled on top of cupcakes, cookies, cakes for a nice flavor that is not too sweet. UPDATE: We just made a pumpkin pie with it (again, using a 1:1 ratio when substituting the regular sugar) and it turned out great!The bag is kind of useless. It is a lined paper bag, and the contents are 4lbs, so the bottom doesn't really hold up well. What I mean is the design of the bag has this sort of base to hold it upright, but after a couple uses the paper base just crumbles under the weight and the bag doesn't really stand up straight anymore. No big deal for me since we put it in a jar anyway.It also has a zip-loc style closure which is a nice touch.I received a free 4lbs bag of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

Takes a minute to get used to drinking out of this spout design. There is no air hole, so you can't suck on it like other bottles, you have to leave a bit of room for the air to go while drinking. Technically, you pour it into your mouth.It doesn't take a rocket scientist to figure out how to disassemble the bottle, BUT the instructions to do so are on the inside of the paper sleeve that is inside the bottle. Would at least recommend putting the first line of the instructions on the outside to read so some people can easily disassemble it without guessing if you unscrew the bottom or top or just pull it off.I like the lid lock feature. Great for keeping my toddler out of it.Note that the lid screws onto the outer plastic shell, not the glass bottle. So, you can remove the glass bottle and use the plastic shell as a snack container (very small snacks since the spout is very small) for kids. Cheerios work, and the small spout slows 'em down a bit.Only holds 16oz of water, so it does not last me very long and find that I have refill it often. But, the size and form makes it work in more places than other bottles.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This bulb is really made for a light fixture that exposes the bulb. If you are planning on placing this in a closed glass container where you can't see the bulb, you are wasting your time and money.Having this in an exposed fixture is the whole point: the see the amber glow and the hand woven filaments. I think the speckled design is interesting, but not sure of it yet. Thinking it will grow on me over time. Definitely a nod to the 50s era—think speckled formica counter tops.The bulb gets every bit as hot as ordinary incandescent bulbs.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

I was really surprised that the two smaller ones fit great in our toaster oven. We also have a large commercial grade baking sheet for the main oven, and the three of them together provide great coverage.The surface of these are sort of tacky, or sticky to the touch. If you throw on at your cupboard door, it will stick for a second. This seems to pick up lint and dust from the cupboard, so be sure to rinse them before use.I thought the black logo might be a decal or screen printed on, but it appears to be impregnated into the silicone itself, nice.I also like that when I first opened them they did not have a strong plastic-y smell at all.It comes with a letter-sized instruction paper that is actually a sticker. They recommend you place it on your fridge, but it doesn't stick very well. In a day it started to curl and come off. Great for measurements and converting measurements, but just use some magnets if you want it accessible.The surface works great, and is a superior alliterative to using parchment or even tinfoil in the toaster oven. Just don't get it above 450-degrees, as per instructions.I received this product at a discount to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

After 8 tries and back and forth with support, I finally got it to work. Once. Then no more.First, the instructions that come in the box are virtually useless, riddled with typos and missing a LOT of pertinent and critical information to being able to get this device working. The company sent a PDF of some "updated" instructions that look very similar. While they have fewer typos, they are even more useless since they have connectivity information for an entirely different device that doesn't work on this one.Second, there is no explanation of what the button and indicators do on the device, or how use and read them. Sometimes the lights are on, but mostly they are not. When it did finally connect (once!) the lights were all on. Never got it to do that again.Troubleshooting is minimal and did not help me connect.The instructions state that you use 192.168.10.1 in your address bar of your browser to log into the admin panel for the device. This is normal for most routers, but they failed to mention what the username and password was. Had to email them to find out. Now I know it is admin / admin. They even referred me to another reviewer's post to get this information! One would think that they would print this in the instructions.The instructions state that the key in "on the product box", but it is not. There are plenty of other numbers to confuse you into thinking it is, though. The key is 12345678, again, had to email them to find out.Here's the kicker: when I unplug the repeater to move it to another location, it is never able to reconnect. I tried everything, but the repeater simply will not show up in my available networks. To make things worse, once I set up my wifi SSD and password in the device's admin panel, I cannot use 192.168.10.1 to access it anymore, it simply says "gateway timeout". So, the only way to access it is to reset the device by holding down the reset button on the side and start all over from scratch.I REALLY wanted this thing to work. I could seriously use it in some dead spots around work and the house. But, after my experience with it I simply cannot recommend it at all.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

I was surprised by how much these batteries weigh. Very solid and can withstand being dropped and abused a bit.The ends are also well made: the flat end is solid metal so that you have a wide surface area for contact, while the nipple end has a nice fat tip to ensure contact.The outer shell/wrap is plastic, not paper like some others.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

These straps work great for more than just keeping things closed and children out of drawers and fridges. Our son likes to push over a lightweight pine Ikea table, so we used these to strap the table to a heavier box that it sits next to. The buckle system allows me to quickly disconnect the table when I want to move it, but keeps him from tipping it over. Now he's just bored with it.At first I thought the closure system was a bit difficult to open, but I have gotten used to it.Would be nice to have them come with a couple extra sticky pads for the case where one comes off or I need to move one.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

I was super excited to get the bike for the weekend, but also expecting to spend an hour or more putting it together. I was wrong! It only took about 20-30 mins to put it all together enough for my son to ride it. Another 5-15 mins spent getting the brakes tuned (one side dragged, at first), the reflector on and the seat adjusted just right.// ASSEMBLYThe vast majority of the bike comes pre-assembled. Out of the box it is all protected with foam wrapping and looks a bit daunting. Once you get the strings untied and the wrapping off, you find that you simply just need to put the front wheel on and the handle bars in the frame. Everything else is already preassembled (though may need some tightening.)Keep in mind that you may need to adjust the brakes—ours were off-center and a bit loose.// TOOLSWhile an open-ended wrench and two Allen wrenches come with the bike, you DO NEED a Philip's head screw driver to install the reflector, and tighten the bell and brake handle.// TIRESThe tires are not fully inflated, but I found them to road-ready anyway. They are supporting my 30-pound son just fine, but plan on inflating them soon.// SEAT HEIGHTOur son is 34" tall (unsure on the inseam at the moment, though he does wear 2T/3T pants), and we have the seat all the way down with the seat front pointing down a bit. He fits it just right. An inch higher on the seat and he might not be able to touch the ground all that well.The bike comes with a second longer seat post, which is awesome! He will be able to ride this bike for years to come.// WEIGHTI was surprised to find the bike feels solid, yet not that heavy. I wouldn't want to carry it up a mountain for 3 hours, but if I had to walk a couple miles with it I would be ok. We are looking to make some carry straps or get the PUKY one.// CONSTRUCTIONThis bike feels very solid. Once everything was tightened up and the way we wanted it, it feels solid and doesn't make a sound when moved or placed (dropped) on the ground. Some bikes rattle or sound janky, this one DOES NOT. Really impressed with the build on this bike. I'm confident that it would even support a fully grown adult (try at your own risk).I HIGHLY recommend this balance bike for anyone with children that are 34" or taller (or wearing at least 3T pants).

Great organizer to help keep the items I need most often—especially the small ones—out of the bottom of the stroller.The insulated drink pockets are large! I assumed they would be can size. They're larger and able to fit most sippy cups, adult water bottles and even a 40 oz beer.Pockets are well-thought out and easy to access when the bag is in place. The only problem was that with our UPPAbaby Vista stroller the bag sits pretty low and close to the basket. It's ok since it keep the center of gravity closer to the middle and not tipping the stroller backward, but also not really that easy to access while walking. We don't hold heavy items in it, and wanted something more accessible while walking and not have to stop. We wrapped the straps around the handle bar and that seems to keep it up higher and easily accessible while walking.Zippers and velcro all seem to work well, too. That's nice, since that is not often the case with baby products lately.The velcro'd straps are flexible enough to work in numerous places, such as:— bike handlebars— seat backs— around backpacksI received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This tea has an amazing fragrance to it—fruity, hints of vanilla, and rich aroma. Definitely one of the best smelling teas I have ever had.The ingredients appear to be of high quality. And the tea itself is loose leaf, but more of a fine grind/chop. So, be sure to use a mesh filter and not one of those strainers that has holes in it.The bag is great for storage and has a self-closing seal at the top. No need to transfer the tea to another container.As per instructions, I take this tea at night before I go to bed, or after dinner. I definitely notice the effects in the morning, and after I go to the bathroom I feel great. It's nice to know it works when you feel great after getting rid of the toxins! I have not had any adverse affects from using this tea.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

Keep in mind that this requires some assembly. No tools needed, just press in the legs to the bottom.// LEG BROKEAnd that's where the trouble happened. One of the clips on a leg snapped off. Believe me when I say that we didn't abuse or force it, it just snapped trying to put on the leg. Now the leg sort of wobbles and comes out fairly easily. It's still useable, but I had to tape it in place from the inside.// THE LIDThe lid to the potty is kind of useless, to me. First, my son likes to step/stand on it, and the lid always caves into the potty or flips over. He sees it as something to stand on, but it is far from able to support a toddler standing on it. So, I just removed it. It's not like I am going to store any waste in there for an extended period of time.// SIZEIt's a nice size. My son is very tall, but I feel this is accommodating for most toddlers. Some very small/short kids may have trouble getting over the from raised area until they learn to swing their leg over.Great for potty training, but I would not call the legs 'durable' or 'high-quality.' The leg's tab definitely broke too easily.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

When I saw these I thought of my son. He's at the toddler age where he is starting notice his food, and I thought these would be a fun way to introduce food. You know, make it fun.// CONSTRUCTIONThe construction is okay. I would recommend being careful with them. It's simply rolled/stamped metal that is crimped together with a seam. During washing I noticed the largest one's seam is not 100% secure and will likely be the first to come apart. I recommend you do NOT keep these in a drawer with other larger, heavier objects— they could be smashed, and again, the seam may not take the force. Keep them in a small plastic container to themselves.// CUTTINGThe metal itself is not very sharp, which is a good thing for those of us that handwash. But, it still cut the veggies and potatoes quite easily. If you are using the red cover to push the tool down, you will need to push out the veggies every 3 or 4 cuts since the cut shapes stay inside the metal tool. If you don't use the red caps, the cut shapes can come out the top and you can just keep on stamping.// WASHINGHandwashing these is tedious. If you have a dishwasher, I recommend putting these in a basket and not just over the pegs, for they could come off and end up in the bottom.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

It's a bit smaller than I expected, but the light is more than bright enough to make up for its size.// BATTERIESThis requires 3 AAA batteries. Problem is that when I went to insert the batteries the battery compartment opening was very tight and I had ram the batteries into the compartment. Once in, they worked fine, but getting them out means I have to bang the light against my hand—they don't just slide out.// NO ON/OFF SWITCHI know that the unit is motion activated, but it would be nice to be able to turn it off as an override for times when I may not want it on. To turn it off, you have to open the battery compartment door on the side, which is fairly easy to do, but not as easy a s switch.// GOES OFF IN 5 SECONDSInstructions said it goes off in about 15 seconds, but I found mine goes off in about 5 seconds, which is nice for me.// ADHESIVE MAGNETIC STRIPI was looking forward to mounting this using the magnetic strip. In my situation, all the surfaces that could mount it too (drywall, door, shelf) are too rough for the adhesive to stick to. So, I used a Velcro tape to loop around it and mount it to a handle in the closet and it works well.// GREAT FORThis is great for:— closets— RVs— car glovebox— kids toybox— bathroom nightlight (though it is bright!)— office desk drawerI received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

First thing I noticed was that the coffee grinder I pulled out of the box is a reddish-pink, not black. See picture. There is also a Jumbl logo printed on the 2 jars. I don't really care about the color so much since it doesn't affect the way it performs, but mention it because I didn't see anywhere on the detail page where I could choose a different color, and the box doesn't mention any other color options either. May have been a mixup at the factory?// SETUPPutting the coffee grinder together is easy, and only takes about a minute. The instructions included showing you how to put the handle on and explain how to adjust the grind are very well written and illustrated.// THE GRINDYes, this is a manual grinder. It takes a minute or three to grind the coffee. The point is that the grind is much better, more even than an electric grinder. And, it allows you to take it camping, on picnics, hikes, and elsewhere that you can make hot water but not have electricity.How hard it is to turn the handle depends on the beans. Some brands' beans are very hard to grind while others are like butter. Try a couple different roaster before you give up.// COMPARE TO OTHER MAJOR BRANDI also have a very similar coffee grinder made by a major Japanese brand. It's designed and works very similarly. In the other one I notice that the handle screw comes loose very easily. I've had two of them and this happened on both. With the Jumbl one, the screw stays tight and I don't have to retighten it multiple times during grinding. Nice!With Jumbl you also get an extra storage jar and brush, and the jars are thick and durable. This is not something you usually get with other brands.// CLEANINGThe included brush makes it easy to clean the burr grinder, which really only ever needs to be brushed off. The jar jars can be hand-washed or put in the dishwasher. As for other parts, I would recommend hand washing as needed (but not the actual burr grinder.)// CapacityThe top cup will hold about a cup of beans, max. I recommend you not put more than a half cup in at a time since they can spill over the edge while grinding—the unit can move around as you turn the handle. This is normal for a hand grinder.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This review is for the solid copper version, but think it applies to all of themFirst, if you are looking to take this off/on every day, I would advise against it. It requires you to bend the bracelet to get it on/off, and after a while that may wear it down to the point of breaking.It is soft and pliable, so getting it to fit right doesn't take long. After it warms up to your body it is a little more pliable.In my case, I found it limits the motion of my hand at the wrist. When I put my hand to the floor while playing with my son, I find myself constantly having to move it up my wrist first or else it sits right between my hand and wrist and is uncomfortable. It's very comfortable during normal wear, but when moving my hand to pick up boxes or let's say do a push-up, it's uncomfortable.The magnets are surprisingly powerful for their size. And I found the quality of the metal and finish to be nicer than expected. It's solid and doesn't feel cheap at all. I would go so far as to call it gift quality.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

I did read the description, and nowhere does it overtly say that a microSD card is NOT included. I didn't realize this until I received it and had to buy one. Two suggestions for Polaroid, either:— include a basic microSD card with the unit, OR— be upfront with the fact that it will not work unless you have a microSD card// VIDEO QUALITYThe 1080p picture quality is great for such a small camera. You won't be making any feature films with this, but it is more than good enough for video for the web. In virtually all cases, when you post to Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and other platforms, they compress/degrade the quality anyway. This shoots well above what they compress down to.The size of the 1080p video is 1920 x 1080px, and the 720p is 1280 x 720px. The quality of the 720p is okay to good. In lower light situations you can really start to see the pixelation. Again, it is definitely good enough for posting to facebook and other web platforms.// AUDIO QUALITYAudio is recorded through the tiny hole/port on the front under the lens. The quality is barely okay for quiet situations, and does pick up louder conversations quite easily. I would say the range of the mic depends on the volume of the noise, but is not really all that far. After about 10 feet it degrades noticeably.The enclosure seems to be really quiet. I tossed the Cube up in the air and caught it a few times, and it didn't pick up the noise of it hitting my hand hardly at all. Where my hand came close to the mic I got some scuffling noise, but that was about it.// ENCLOSUREDetails say it is weather/water resistant, but I have to say that after reading some reviews I don't trust that claim at all. I highly recommend a waterproof case for it if you are going to be in the rain.// CAPABILITIES & LIMITATIONS— You cannot record while the USB cord is plugged into a computer or charging the Cube. All you can do is turn it off/on.— On Macs, plugging it in and turning it on will automatically open the Photos app (when using Yosemtite OSX). You can use that app or the Image Capture app on earlier OSX's to download the videos.— You can copy and delete the videos on the microSD using the two apps listed above (on Macs).— There is no live streaming— No wifi connectivity— No bluetooth connectivity— There is no way to start/stop recording without the beeps. These do not get recorded on the video.— You have to way for the three green light beeps to end before you can start recording. This means form off state to recording tales about 5 seconds. From on state to recording takes about 2-3 seconds.— there is no menu. It's a simple on/off and record/stop type device.— things about 4-5 inches away from the lens start to get pretty blurry. About a foot away is best for close shots.— It takes a surprisingly wide shot. Seems like it is wider than my iPhone 6 camera, for comparison.// MAGNET MOUNTThe magnet dimple mount is fairly strong. I'm not totally sold on that it can stay in place on some handle bars of a mountain bike. I'd recommend a better aftermarket mount that wraps around it and clamps it securely in place.It doesn't stick to flat/straight metal surfaces as well as it does to one that fills the dimple. So, it doesn't stick to metal bike handle bars as well as the corner of a metal toolbox. Make sense?// RECORDINGAs stated in the beginning of this review, you MUST supply your own microSD card. I bought a Samsung 32GB EVO Class 10 Micro SDHC on Amazon and it works very well, no problems. I feel Polaroid should at least supply a basic small capacity microSD with the unit. Or be more clear about that it in the product description.I received a sample of this product at a huge discount to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

// CRYSTAL CLEARThe magnification is very clear and sharp. Everything from edge to edge is in super sharp detail. NO fading or warping of the magnification near the edges of the lens.// LIGHTThe light is very bright and helpful. Great for bright rooms as well as dark situations. If you are thinking of using this to read, know that the light is a wee bit bright for lengthy use. It's a great brightness for inspecting something for 5-10 mins, but after that it tends to wear on your eyes, especially for hours of reading on bright-white pages.// BATTERYThe battery compartment is easy to access without tools, and appears to be a standard sized flat button battery. The LED lights should help it last a long time. Also, be sure to use the on/off switch to help keep the light from turning on accidentally.// OPERATIONIt's a simple push down on the lens ring to turn it on/off. You don't have to touch the lens at all, but it sounds like other reviewers have trouble with that. I feel there is plenty of metal ring around the lens to prevent you form having to touch the lens to turn it on/off.As I said above, be sure to use the on/off switch to help keep the light from turning on accidentally during storage/travel.// CONSTRUCTIONI was deeply impressed by the all-metal body of the magnifying glass. And the glass seems to be real glass! Nice. I also really like the grooves that go around the bezel and body. Another nice touch that make using it feel nice in your hand/fingers. Great quality all around.Note that the battery compartment and switch is plastic.// GREAT FOR— kids— education / classrooms— people losing the sharpness of their vision— finding and pulling out splinters— hobbies and crafts— electronicsI received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

This is my fourth brand of fish oil soft gels that I have tried. This also the first brand to use the "Enteric coating" claiming they reduce the 'fish burbs'. I haven't had a problem with that using other soft gels, but figured I would give these a try. And they're great!The soft gels look like they have been sandblasted: they have a smooth textured surface, not the smooth almost clear surface other brands have. I think this is the "Enteric coating", but seems to also keep them form sticking together in the bottle.Opening the container you do NOT smell any fishiness. To the most sensitive nose you may smell something similar to the flakes used for fish food, but it's subtle. I have not experienced any 'fish burbs' or unsettled stomach as some other claim with other brands.With the amount of Omega-3s in this you can take one gel in the morning and another at night to spread it out and get more than your daily dose in.I received a free sample of this product to evaluate and provide an unbiased review.

The material is very soft and lightweight. When folded up and in its pouch, the whole thing weights about as much as your smartphone.// VERSATILEThis blanket can be made into a sun shade using the corner straps, or connected together to another Gecko blanket to form a larger blanket/sunshade.// CONSTRUCTIONThe material feels soft, yet durable. While they say it is "parasheet" material, know that it does NOT have ripstop woven into it. This is the cross fibers that keep the material from ripping beyond a 1/4-inch or so. To be clear, mine has not ripped.The stitching is all double-stitched and very solid.// BREATHABILITY (CHILD SAFETY)To test it, I tightly wrapped my head in this sheet and tried to breath. While I felt I could still breath a little bit, I would not call this a breathable kid safe blanket to the extent that you could use it in a crib. Not that you would, but trying to explain how breathable the fabric is should a infant/ child get tangled in it. I would recommend you NOT allow infants or very young children to play on it unsupervised for this reason.// WATERPROOF?I would not call this waterproof, or even a moisture barrier between you and wet grass. The material does get wet and you will eventually feel it.// WASHABLE?Yes! Cool thing is there are no metal parts to rust. Highly recommend line drying this, or on low temp.
