He was always working and didn’t seem to support Sawyer (or so it seemed). This set the stage for me to be completely team Caleb. Caleb was absolutely perfect. He was handsome, talented, sweet, caring and always there when Sawyer needed him.I would recommend this book to anyone who loves a romance story with a modern twist. The ending was perfect and tied up all the loose ends but it did leave me feeling a little guilty for judging Liam so harshly.  I adored this book and I’m so hoping that we get Liam’s story next.

I was pleasantly surprised with this book. Seeing it was about a politician I thought it would be about a slime ball man whore changed by love but I was WRONG!!!Drake Prescott is not your typical politician he is strong, smart, caring and honest. Drake is also completely devoted to his family and his country. He is just the perfect man!!Lucy Washburn is a quite, sweet school teacher and her best friend Mason is the only family she has. But Lucy has a secret in her past that she is ashamed of and no one can know it! Being involved with a man that is constantly in the spotlight is not something she wants to deal with. It could be bad for both of them if the secret comes out.I just totally fell in love with this couple!! It warmed my heart to see a man with such patience and gentlemanly ways. His family welcomed her as their own immediately. When push comes to shove and secrets are revealed they rally around her and show her a love she has never known!I am excited to see this is the start of a series a few of the Prescott siblings have me curious and I definitely want to know more.

4.25This was my first Rebecca Brooke book so I had nothing to compare it to. The synopsis sounded like the book could be slightly dark and could quite possibly be about a subject that some people would find hard to read about.From the synopsis I went in to the book slightly angry because I was thinking who in there right mind would ever trade up their wife, regardless of problems they have in the marriage of outside of the marriage. You just don't trade a person, so it did make me quite angry but I wanted to read the book to find out the reasoning behind everything and not make initial judgements based on the synopsis alone.Elena's character just made me want to reach in and save her, but tell her how inspirational she is and so strong. Her character was outstanding after what she went through.She was abused verbally and mentally for so long. Elena felt useless, ugly, nothing she did was good enough all because of her husband.It was almost like being traded because of her husband and meeting her captor would be worse than being with her husband, but sometimes God has other plans for great people and Elena was getting her bit of good she deserved finally, although it took time to happen.The author handled really hard subjects very well. She wrote them sensitively and with care, plus researched about the topic so she had all her information correct.I cant praise her enough for writing so carefully about a difficult subject.The story was full of dreams, hope and wishes. Elena never gave up. She was pushed further down each day, but she never lost her true self through dreaming, hoping and wishing and everything came true for her. It was very inspiring and heartbreaking, but beautiful.I really enjoyed the journey Elena went on through the book and that's what kept me glued to the pages.I'll defiantly read more of Rebecca's books now I've read Traded as her writing was captivating.

I seriously could not put this book down! I got so wrapped up in the rock n roll world of Ruby Riot.I loved watching Jax and Tegans romance. They fought it! She didn't want to be with a rockstar! He was warned by her big brother to keep his HANDS OFF! Their attraction was too strong they couldn't resist.I was rooting for this couple. I wanted them together! They struggled through a lot of BS, misunderstandings and meddling. Gosh they are both so stubborn!!! I got frustrated wanted to throw my Kindle. I honestly wasn't sure they were going to stay together, wasn't sure they could overcome some of the obstacles thrown in the way. I still sit here and question it? They definitely love each other but is that always enough?I was very excited to see this was a spinoff from another series and will definitely be checking those out while I not so patiently wait for the next in the Ruby Riot series!!!

If I could give this book more than 5 stars, I totally would!!! Finn and Harlow's story was witty, smart, SEXY, sweet, loving, SEXY, need I go on!!After Harlow surprised Finn by showing up at his home in Canada with nothing on but a trench coat and then rocking each other's worlds, she hasn't heard from him. Not a text, call, email....nothing. So she is very surprised when she tries a new Starbucks and sees him in line there. Now to ignore or engage....well..Harlow being the strong willed, determined woman that she is..engages. But after they both decide that it's just a fun fling while Finn is in town and to get their minds off of what's wrong in their life, Harlow is starting to realize that maybe, just maybe Finn is more than a fling.Finn came to San Diego in hopes to save his family fishing business but he was also hoping to run into Harlow, not that he would tell anyone else that!! Running into her at a Starbucks was too easy and they fell into a hook up only relationship, but now Finn is starting to think more about Harlow and how he can see her more and not what he actually came to San Diego to do.When misunderstandings start to ruin what they have, one runs but will the other follow?LOVE LOVE LOVE!!! Finn was sooooooo DIRTY!!! I loved his dirty talk in bed! Definitely has some GREAT bedside manner that I wouldn't mind having in my life!! I also loved reading about Mia and Ansel and a glimpse into Oliver and Lola..I'm pretty excited to read their story as well!! I don't want this series to end!!

4.5 StarsWalking Among the Cherry Trees was the first book I had read by this author and I was blown away at how well written it was. I love second chance love stories and add in that this was a second chance with her first love; I was hooked from the blurb.I fell in love with the characters. Morgan was a great heroine and her story tugged at my heart strings. She was a strong, independant woman; her one weakness was Taylor. She fell in love with him as a teenager; everything with him was perfect until he fell out of love with her and ripped her heart out. From that point on she put all her energy into her career. When her grandmother dies and she has to go back to Cherryville, running into Taylor is inevitable. Will she be able to handle all the emotions and survive the secrets?Even the secondary characters were well written and easy to connect with. For me they added to the feel of the story and added extra charm. I loved the differences between the small town of Cherryville and New York; Morgan was completely different in Cherryville. I think that it was because she felt at home there. New York was more about her work than her personal life.This book was full of emotions; I felt like I went through everything the characters did and at times this story had me crying and had my heart aching. Taylor’s secrets kept my interest from the beginning to the end. I was on pins and needles waiting to find out how their story would end. I cannot wait to read the next book in this series.

I loved this book!I am a big baseball fan and this book was written for and by a true fan. I loved the game refrences, the team refrences and especially the part about All Star game being in Cincinnati. I live in Cincinnati and saw the excitement of this game first hand. This is a baseball book but there is a sweet romance story building through the sport theme.The love story between Ethan and Daisy was a slow building attraction that we watch develop into love.The game brought them together she a fan and he a player. Like in any relationship they stumble and get back up but there is a big secret she holds that could end them for good.I have loved all of Heidi's books but I do think this might be favorite! A simple sweet story that made me smile, a bit of angst, some steamy scenes, and some emotional moments that brought tears. I fell in love with the story and the characters and could not put it down!

Reviewer: ChelseaRating: 4 stars!!I liked Toni! She was my kind of girl, knew who she was and what she wanted. After taking a job as Isadora Lang's assistant to make money to finish her degree she meets Ash, her new bosses big brother. Ash is a sexy but very brusk billionaire. Ash and Toni get off to a great start, but when both their lives get spin in their end, they react in a way that changes everything between them. Will Ash see how bad he messed up? Will Toni be able to move past the things that happened? What will happen to Isadora?!I was on the end of my seat through all five of these books! I was dying to get the next one as soon as I finished one! Parker and Wild sure do know how to keep my heart racing ... In more ways than one!!If you love suspense, hot alpha males and a good romance one click these novellas!!!

Hard Beat is very different from the other books in the series. There’s more story behind it and a deeper meaning. We get to explore a type of life we would not usually get to discover. The amount of research into the topic is very evident. K Bromberg brought us into the life of an oversees investigative reporter, show us what they experience, how they are always in danger searching for the hard beat, and makes the reader feel an extreme amount of emotion.I really did love Tanner and Beaux together. They shared a connection that most never experience. Their relationship happened with rocket speed because of the situation they were in. However there are doubts, pasts issues, and secrets that stand between the two. I fell in love right along with them and felt every emotion that the characters did. Their relationship didn’t happen in the conventional way but I thing that’s what made it so strong and special.This review was hard for me to write. It took me awhile to really get into the book and connect fully with the characters. There are huge secrets happening and it makes it to where you don’t totally get to know and experience the characters. BUT there is a huge turning point in the book that drew me and wouldn’t let me out. The second half of the book was easily a five star read for me. I went through a roller coaster of emotions right along with the characters. I was yelling at my Kindle and was trying to figure out what piece of the puzzle I was missing. All is revealed in the end and helps to put all the pieces together. It’s the type were you want to re-read and see if you can discover the hints and foreshadowing of what was to come.

4.5 StarsThis book surprised me. I was pulled into the story and couldn't put it down. I absolutely loved it. I have not read the first book in the series and did not feel lost at all. We do get a little bit of the couple from book one and it left me one clicking their book immediately. This book had highly emotional parts that will have you hurting and breaking right along with the the characters. There are twists, turns, and secrets that you aren't expecting, that you so involved in the story.The characters are written so you can easily connect to them and fall In love with them. I loved both Rogan and Katie's characters. Both have had difficult pasts, that seem to bring them together and help them understand each other more. Katie, ahh she's been through A LOT and has become a shell of herself, not fully living. Rogan has been living but wants more and that more is Katie. The connection between the two was off the charts. I loved Rogans's persistence. I had a huge a smile on my face every time he had a surprise for Katie. However the past has a way of coming back and haunting you and it does in a big way for Rogan and Katie.This book left me wanting more. I wanted more Rogan and Katie because they were such amazing characters. There were a few parts of the book that I felt skipped over situations and I wished that we had a little more. However this book is easily one of my favorites of 2015 and I can't wait for more.

ith Every Breath is the first book in the River Bend Series. Jaden left River Bend six years ago and vowed to never return but when her best friend, Mia, sounds like she is having a break down Jaden returns to check on her. Jaden had a crush on Mia’s older brother but when they started to get close Cole’s ex-girlfriend shows up and she’s pregnant. So he does the right thing for their child and marries her.  When Jaden returns to town her car breaks down and Mia sends Cole to rescue her. Will they be given a second chance at love or will or will history repeat itself?I fell in love with Cole from the beginning; he is handsome, witty, and an all around good guy. Jaden seems to have everything in place in her life with her career but she still hasn’t made her apartment hers by adding personal touches. I felt like maybe it was because she didn’t really consider it home yet and maybe she was longing for her hometown and friends of River Bend. I know how she felt about wanting to leave her small hometown, I think everyone from a small town feels the same way but no matter what that small town will also be home. I loved this cast of characters from the main characters to the supporting characters. They are all well written and add so much to the story.This is a group of people that I can imagine myself being friends with.  I loved the banter between them and I look forward to reading more about them in the next installment of this series.With Every Breath was another home run for Ms Roy. It is a great second chance at love story and an awesome start to her new series. I would recommend this book to anyone who likes a sweet love story with great characters. I cannot wait for the next book in this series to release.

I was so sad this series ended!! I enjoyed the ride! This story was one I was intrigued by from the first inklings we got in the previous book, I loved Ivy!!!Ivy was the perfect badass heroine!! Ivy doesn't stay in be place too long and is always in the move. Sebastian is in town on business... Seems innocent enough, but their paths were made to cross in more ways than one.The twist of this book was so shocking!! I didn't see it coming!! I loved the ending of this story, it was perfect for the couple. I will miss the characters in this series!!! While I really liked Ivy an Sebastian's story I will always love Burying Water the most. Check out this great series!!!

Congrats to this new author and her first book!!!This book was raw, gritty, and a page turner!!  I found myself reading late into the night!  Zack was the epitome of an MC Prez and was such a hot alpha!!!  I can't wait to read the next book!!

Since I've started reading CA Harm's books I've learned a few things. One, she loves making me cry :) and two, I always finish her books with a big dopey grin on my face.I loved this book. I finished it in one sitting because I just didn't want to put it down.  Jackson is your typical sweet alpha man who suffers such a sad tragedy at the beginning of the story, but when Bailey needed him (even though she didn't know it, he was there)I loved Bailey and after learning her back story my heart hurt for her and even though it had happened so long ago it still effected her. She was such a strong character because even with the past she was dealing with it didn't stop her from living.I don't want to give a lot of the plot away, but you could feel the chemistry these two characters had from the get go and how they both were there for each other when they both needed it most. There, as always, are great supporting characters and I just have two words.... NOAH's BOOK!!!!!!!I messaged CA after I finished and said I needed to know about Noah, but not really *:) happy I want to be surprised.YOU MUST READ THIS BOOK!!!

Another great Mafia book by Rachel.When starting to read this book, I wasn’t really sure what the book was going to be about or what genre it was based on as the synopsis didn’t give much away, so when starting this book I was going in completely blind.Wow what a great surprise read it was.I was sucked in to the story and characters within the first few pages and then just couldn’t put it down.As always with a book from this author it had great detail, suspense, love, great character development, twists and turns and unpredictability.I absolutely loved Nikolai and he made the story for me.He’s rich, good looking, bossy, mysterious and completely smoking hot! You can’t help but failed for his dark, dangerous, murderous personality, he just had something about him that made you forget his bad ways and fall in love with him.I love Rachel’s Mafia books. You can’t find a better author to write about this genre in my opinion. This is another to add to her great list.A must read.

Blue Horizons isn’t just a story about music and love, it is so much more. It was an emotional read for me; which I love. The emotions that Ms Andrews made me experience only heightened my connection to these amazing characters. Will is a successful musician but he is learning that fame and success come with a price and he isn’t willing to give up his integrity in the process. When he started it was all about the music but now he isn’t feeling it any more. So he escapes to the Blue Ridge Mountains to regroup. Ava is also a musician and has had a very troubled past. Even though the physical scars have healed she is left with huge emotional scars that keep her closed off to people. When they meet they both hide their true identities from the other but the more they are around each other the more they start to reveal about who they are and their pasts. These two really are perfect for each other even if they don’t see it right away, especially Ava.This book has plenty of angst and emotions that literally took my breath away and left me a sobbing mess. I was reduced to tears on several occasions while reading about Ava and her trying to come to terms with her insecurities and pain from her past. Will is absolutely perfect for Ava and I loved how he tried so hard to win the girl he had fallen in love with. He seemed to find his passion for life again when he met Ava. I also loved the humor that was added by Clay, Will’s foster brother and also a member of his band. I would love to read more about Clay.Once again Ms Andrews has hit a homerun with Blue Horizons. It has everything I have come to love about her novels and she is quickly becoming one of my favorite new to me authors. I look forward to reading more from her. I highly recommend this book to anyone who likes musicians and love stories filled with emotion and angst.

I have loved this whole series! This group of friends are just awesome.Guilt is a horrible thing! Nina is carrying it around like a badge of honor and refuses to let anyone to close.Jake is having an awful streak of horrible dates and can't seem to meet a girl that he can be with.They met under some funny circumstances! I loved Jakes persistence, he was going to get the girl, no matter how many times she turned him away. I love reading a book and watching someone break through and bring their walls down. This book had me almost in tears and at one point I had a mini panic attack. Gotta love when the angst gets to you!!

This was a wonderful story. I loved it from the beginning. I loved the storyline and all of the characters. Echo and Malachi were amazingly written characters.I really liked the alternating POV. I love getting to see the story from both sides. I don’t read a lot of paranormal, but I really loved this book and it’s unique storyline.The relationship between Echo and Malachi is wonderful. The author did a wonderful job developing the relationship between the main characters. And all the characters are very well done and they really draw you into the story. I couldn’t put this book down from the beginning.After reading this I will definitely be trying more paranormal stories, especially ghost stories!!I can’t wait for more in this series. And I will definitely be reading more from DelSheree Gladden. This book is a must read, even if paranormal is not one of your normal go to genres. It might just make you change your mind about paranormal books!!

This story really shocked me as it is set in 1957. I never thought I'd like reading a book based in that ere so I'm glad I never knew beforehand.The story being set back in that time made for a real difference though and stood out from other books.The author must of done a lot of research as she had set the story in 1957 and the Korean war. The lives of how people lived in that era played a big impact in the story and so did The weather and the hot summer's day t gat changed everything.This book does have a love story, but I did feel so many real, honest and true emotions from all 3 characters.I did enjoy the story as a whole but I did find it hard to read as I'm not someone who has ever read a book like this before or based so far in the past.The writing and descriptions of the characters, story and past were very good but unfortunately due to the age differences between myself and when the story was told, I found it hard. I found parts interesting it not like I normally find the authors books.

This book hooked me on the first page!Karlie is a girl you can't help feel sorry for, she had a sad childhood in foster care and immediately fell into an abusive relationship. She didn't know what true love was or what it felt like. No one ever showed her!Enter Lucas definitely her knight in shining armor to save the day and probably save her life. He rescues her from her abusive boyfriend and shows her what a real man is.Karlie is so damaged, she doesn't think she is good enough or deserves everything Lucas is offering. He slowly breaks down her wallls and she learns to love herself, life, and him.This couple has to tackle some big obstacles but together I feel they can do it!This is the first I have read by this author and will definitely be looking for more of this series.

Always is the debut novel for Randa Lynn but you would never know it. This story is well written and captivating. I was pulled in from the beginning and this story never let go of my attention until the end. I simply couldn’t put it down; I kept telling myself just one more chapter.The characters were well written and very realistic. Lenni was a broken women because of all she endured in her relationship with Ryan. Wes was a single father, who was charming and handsome. He was an amazing father to Elli. Elli was adorable and stole every scene she was in. This was a great love story between these three characters. This story is not just about love but also about learning to appreciate what you have.The secondary characters were fun to read about also. Lenni and Wes had an amazing group of friends. I felt like they added so much to the story and I couldn’t wait to learn more about them. This is definitely a group of people I could see myself being friends with.Always is an exceptionally well written book. I love a second chance love story and this one is one of the best I’ve ever read. This is one of those stories that will ALWAYS stay with you. I cannot wait to read more from Randa Lynn.

Have your tissues ready for this book as you are going to need a box or 2 of them when you read this book. It is pull at your heartstrings sad.I honestly never knew what to expect when I started reading this book. I’d not read a book by the author before, but I had heard great things about her previous books and what a great writer she is, so I had every confidence that the book would be wrote very well and the rest I’d find out when reading the book.The biggest shock I had when reading this book was that it had some difficult subjects that were hard to read. I wasn’t expecting that at all.Aiden is a Hollywood playboy who is very cocky and arrogant. He has everything and everything he could ever want. However he is just playing a character to everyone all the time. No one really knows who the real Aiden is.Haley is a great girl. She is sweet and charitable. She loves to be in the country and rescue and re home horses. Her life is good until tragedy strikes and leaves Haley so hurt and in a dark place.Aidan had some very serious demons and this really effected his personality and didn’t make things easy with Haley either, especially as Haley is also dealing with her own demons. Sometimes I wasn’t sure if I liked Aiden as he could be very nasty and rude. I needed to keep reminding myself that Aiden acted like that though through hurt and he doesn’t no how to act any other way, until he finally lets Haley in and she can help him.Both of the characters were very lovable despite their faults and both characters were easy to relate. Both of the characters are very complex and have a lot of different sides to them. Learning about all the sides of both their personalities and their individual stories was interesting and it kept me very interested in the story.This was a story about loss and sadness, but also getting the strength and pulling yourself up and out of the darkness and living again. Aiden and Haley needed each other and they saved each other and made each other stronger.

I was clamoring for this book as soon as I finished book 2!!! I was looking forward to getting seeing how this couple ended up! The trials Shae and Jasper went through were insane and I just wanted to throw my e-reader sometimes!I really wish we would have gotten Jasper's POV because I wanted to get into his head. I liked that even though the story was a suspense it still had the MS Parker expectation! I LOVE MS Parker's writing and her steamy scenes are more like FIRE!!The story pick ups right where book 2 left off and the chaos started immediately! I love when there is no time jumping in a story!!!I would definitely recommend this series to readers!!! I love MS Parker's writing!

Reviewer: NicoleRating: 4.5 StarsI have been waiting for this book and was not disappointed!! I loved it! It starts off right where Naughty King left off with Margo and Alex waking up married. Alcohol plus sexual chemistry plus a friend like Yamada can only lead to trouble, in the form of an unplanned spouse. It’s crazy how short these installments are yet we get so much story.Of course there is a lot of bickering and fighting between Margo and Alex but we also get to see them start discover other sides of each other. Then there is the sexual connection the two have its off the charts and HOT. We get a lot of shocks towards the end and are left with wanting more….more Alex and Margo…more Yamada….and more of Diem and her possible love interest!!! I’m hooked and can’t wait to see what happens next.Reviewer: TammiRating: 4.5 Groupie StarsPerfect follow up to Naughty King!Totally loved this book! It has sexy times, funny times, and even some touching moments. It is the whole package!We got to see their feelings this time!!! And more Yamada that strange little man still cracks me up!!Can this marriage become more than the farce it is starting as? Can the Naughty King be tamed? Can the Fiesty Princess be calmed?Michelle gave me everything I wanted and left me dying for more!!!!

This story was perfectly written. I finished this book in one day!! It grabs your attention from the beginning and doesn't let go. I loved Kelsey and Ethan. And the supporting characters were great, too.Ethan and Kelsey shared a moment a long time ago, but neither have forgotten. When Ethan comes back into the picture, they both feel an attraction. Unfortunately, there are circumstances that might stand in the way.This story has lies and deceit, and it also has romance and steam.  This book will keep you reading to see what will happen.  Ethan is a hot book boyfriend that is struggling between what he wants and what he thinks he needs to do.  Kelsey is a strong girl who has been wronged and just wants to stick to her plan.I loved everything about this story. I liked that there was some drama and lies mixed in with the romance and attraction.  The supporting characters really brought a lot to the story. The writing had you connecting to the characters and it drew you into the story.I would definitely recommend this book.

Only You is a standalone novel in the Second Chances Series. Only You is a great second chance love story. This is the second book in this series that I have read and I loved them both. I am a huge fan of second chance love stories and this series defiantly doesn't disappoint.Only You had me on an emotional roller coaster from the beginning. I knew from the prologue that this book would wreck me and it did at times, but it was also inspiring. It dealt with real issues that everyone might face at one time or another. In the end, I felt like my heart was put back together from all the heartache I endured reading this story.I loved the characters. Like I said before everything about this book was so real, including the characters. I connected with them immediately. I felt every emotion and pain that they endured.  Evan was pretty near perfect. He was strong, loyal,loving, kind and handsome. Paige always had a knack of picking the wrong guys. She was pretty, smart, and a great friend. I loved that all of the characters were connected. The supporting characters were also amazing and I loved the glimpses into their lives.I would recommend this book to anyone who likes a second chance love story full of emotions and an HEA ending. I cannot wait to read more from this author.

Aleatha has done it again! When I read her books I get lost in them, they don't read like a typical romance I feel like I am reading a piece of classical literature.Betrayal definitely kept me guessing and wanting to know more about the intriguing Alexandria/ Alex/ Charli. I loved how she "reinvented" herself trying to find her true self. I feel she won't be happy until she mixes the three but I fear she may lose them all in the end. She has always had follow the family "rules" but now she is cutting the cord. She thought she was finally taking control of her life, making all her own decisions and no longer answering to anyone but the step she took may have one man from the past controlling everything.I was left with so many questions. What will the future bring her? I really want to know her past! What is behind the smoke and mirrors? Loved this book and cannot wait for the next one.

Slaying the Dragon is book two in the Deception Duet. I have read every book by T.K. Leigh and this was another perfectly written book by her. She does such an amazing job pulling you into the story and making you invested in the characters. I have been anxiously awaiting this story ever since I finished Chasing the Dragon. This is an incredibly done story full of suspense, drama, twists and turns, and of course lots of hot and steamy scenes.Tyler is still a hot, dominating, take charge guy. And of course Mackenzie is still a hardheaded, and hurting woman. They both need each other. But will they be able to figure out what the truth is behind all the lies and deception so that they can make sure their future is safe?This book will keep you drawn in from the very first page. This was a definite 5 star read. If I could give it 10 stars I would!!! Absolutely love Tyler. He is a drool-worthy book boyfriend. T.K. Leigh writes the best characters I really loved everyone in this story. I felt like I was right there with them and I was just hoping for everything to work out for Tyler and Mackenzie.This book is a 5-star, must read book. If you like hot dominating, protective book boyfriends and stories with suspense and drama, you will love this story. I can’t wait to read more from T.K. Leigh. I am anxiously awaiting her next book!

Sarah O'Rourke is FAST becoming a favorite of mine!!! Definitely a one-clicker!!!Patience McKinnon has had enough drama in her life to have a tv show but it's not like she can stop it from happening..I mean she has 3 sisters!! It's bound to happen!! Patience is the sister with the mouth. The one that will take down anyone with it and makes most grown men cry. Except for one, Abel Turner, the one man that won't back down, no matter what she says! He just doesn't seem to get that what happened three years ago WILL NEVER happen again. This is HER life and she will NEVER let a man close to her again. He had his chance and he ruined it worse than a burnt cake on your birthday and all the bakeries are closed! But her life is never easy and obstacles are always showing up to change all of her plans!Abel has been trying hard for the last three years to prove to Patience that he is sorry for what happened and wants a do over, even if she did tell the whole town how bad he "performs." He can't get her out of his head and he knows that there is more than just sex involved after he finally wears her down one night but convincing her of that it is a WHOLE different story! Not mention that someone is leaving them threatening notes and God decided to open a can of whoop ass on Abel by giving something to Patience that will take nine months to "get rid of." What's a man to do?This book was beyond hilarious!! I laughed out loud soooo many times with the things that would come out of Patience and her sisters' mouths! I would have to say though that the dialogue could get kind of lengthy at times. Sometimes I just wanted to tape Patience's mouth closed and tell her stop talking but I think Abel handled it well! There was definitely some drama and tears in this book and I was soooo nervous towards the end!! I think I bit off all of my nails at least twice!! I'm pretty excited about the next book, but have to love Abel and Patience for awhile first!!

4.5 Stars!!!! I was granted the opportunity to read this BEFORE the masses got a hold of it and....phew!!! Everyone is in for a treat!!! I can still here that hot english accent in my head!!Elizabeth had something precious stolen from her in the worst possible way but still seems to think that it was partly her fault. Now two years later at college, she gets around great with men. Her motto: find the least likely player, but decent enough looking, for a one night stand at HER place and never see/call them again. It has worked so far and her heart never has to get involved. Dragged to Frat party one night, she is on the prowl for her next conquest when meets Dax and then is equally hot brother Declan. TOTALLY not what she usually goes for but there is something about Declan that she just can't stay away from.Declan has a future plan and has every intention of opening a gym and getting into UFC. Elizabeth is definitely not his type but there is just something about her. When Declan finally tells Elizabeth how he feels, she runs. Can he prove to her that he isn't her past, but her future?I have to say that is the first book I have ever read by this author, but it definitely will NOT be my last!! British accent-check....hot guy with muscles..check...man who follows his heart...check..need I say more?!! There were some pretty hilarious moments in the book and I will never think of Ninja Turles the same!! OH and the ending..holy cow the last 25% had me in heart failure!!!

I love books that deal with anything out of the box and this book didn't disappoint!!Lucy has a wonderful life up until she almost died 4 years ago. Now she lives in the shadows and barely exists. But she likes it that way, it's safe, comfortable, and she doesn't have to worry about having "episodes" and freaking people out. But when she Ellis out on the beach that she will never step foot on again, her heart starts beating a little harder and it isn't from anxiety. Can he be the one to pull her from her darkness and bring her floating to the top?Ellis is enjoying his last summer before he has to get a "real" job after college. He decides to stay at his parent's place on the beach with his two friends and party the summer away before obligations start and he as to be an adult. The moment he saw Lucy on her deck, he knew it was over for him. He had met the one. Now if he could just get her name..after some searching(slight stalking) he finally meets her and is even more blown away by her. He knows that she fights an inner demon but wants to be her knight in shining armor to slay the dragon for her. One problem, her ex...why can't that guy just give it up already?!This was a great heartwarming story. Ellis really was the man that could take all of Lucy's insecurities away and help her becoming stronger in herself. He didn't want her to become needy of him, he wanted her to overcome her demon's with his help and come out the strong, independent woman she once was. Great story and one I couldn't put down. Can't wait to see what happens next in this series!!

Jake Part One was a short, sexy read. This book has some of the hottest sex scenes I’ve ever read. The writing is flawless. This strut flows so fast that I read it in one sitting.Jake is sexy, talented tattoo artist and a man whore. He never seems to run out of women who want him. He had one simple rule…it’s just sex, nothing more. He never takes women to his home and they never stay after the sex is over. His twin brother Jax is back in town and had opened a bar. Jax’s business partner is Addi. From the first time Jake sees her he is taken back. There is something about her that gets to him. But will she risk a chance with her business partner's brother? Hopefully volume two will answer this question. I can’t wait to read the next installment.

Easily one of my top 10 books of 2015. I loved everything about this book. I’ve read a majority of Meghan Quinn’s books and each series is so different from the others and unique to itself. Yes Repentance is part of the Jett Girl Series but it is so different from Jett and Goldie’s books. I could not put it down and I needed to know what was going to happen next and if Kace was going to find forgiveness and forgive himself.Repentance is a highly emotional book that will break your heart, as you experience the pain and regret that Kace is going through. You feel his emotions and experience his lows right along with him. We really get to know and understand Kace in this book. You can’t help but fall in love with him despite his past sins and his outlook to his future.Kace and Lyla are amazing together, when Kace actually lets her in. The sexual chemistry between them is HOT!!! Lyla seems to bring out the best in Kace. She helps to lessen the pain and to have him live a little. Things are not easy for the two, both have difficult pasts and lives that were drastically changed by one event in their life. Lyla is a strong and confident woman who when she sets her eyes on someone she fights for them and isn’t easily pushed away and she’s in for one heck of a fight when it comes to Kace.This is a must read book and can easily be read without read the other Jett Girls books. There are chapters that flashback to the past (which I usually don’t like but they it was done in a way that benefitted the story) so you are not lost. WE also get more Jett, Goldie, and the rest of the gang. Goldie is of course Goldie spouting hilarious nonsense. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this book….GO ONE CLICK IMMEDIATELY!!

Great second book in the series!In the first book we saw Kyle as a teenager discovering her passion for music.In this book Kyle has joined a band and going on tour. She is living her dream! The tour is everything you expect Sex, Drugs and Rock n Roll. Through it all Kyle keeps a smart head she takes part in the lifestyle but knows her limits. Her band mates are not all as smart. We see her as a rising star but at some point she has to come down to earth and deal with real life. The old saying 'All that glitters is not gold' definitely holds true.Kyle continues her friendship with CJ, wanting more, getting more and still wanting even more. But CJ is living his own Rock n Roll dream! How do they make it together when they are always apart?I can't wait for the next in the series. I can't to see where Kyle's love of music takes her now that she has had a rise and fall taste of fame.

There is no denying it I have a weakness when it comes to men with what I like to call "alpha syndrome"  and Draven is no exception !!!Jasmine and her sister  Zandra were orphaned as children and Jasmine is basically reared by her older sister who is rather controlling and protective. Jasmine craves freedom and her first taste thereof very nearly killed her ...Draven finds Jasmine and immediately his protective instincts kick in and I'm convinced he'll give his last breath trying to protect her . I lost my heart to Draven very early ♥ I'm weak I know #don't judge#Draven's occupation scares Jasmine and she has some major trust issues. However she can't resist Draven , like a moth to a flame really , hell who can blame her ?!Draven has innocence and perfection in Jasmine and she's eager to learn and he's the best teacher there is . These 2 are like hot molten larva #snailtrailalert#A word to the wise ....have extra knickers on hand Jasmine and Draven keep melting them !There is a new name in DOMtown ladies he goes by the name Draven ♥

Dark reads have hit a new high with this book. Clarissa Wild is by far the best writer of dark reads I've ever read. Her books have always been twisted and read between your fingers scary. However with Twenty One everything became more intense, captivating and just so wrong that you can't out it down.I was drawn instantly in to the book. The secrets, lies and betrayal were ruthless and emotional. You was taken on a roller coaster of a million emotions and never knew if you was up or down or where you was. So much was going on I just couldn't stop reading until the end.You need to read the story to understand its brilliance. There wasn't just the intense journey, it was a love story too.Sky was fierce and hard character. I couldn't help but feel sorry for her though. She goes through so much hell not knowing if she's going to live or die. Her character was inspiring. She went through so much with the kidnapping and torture she was put through.Angel is someone you should really hate and not want to like because he's so dark and twisted, but I couldn't help but like him. He fought internally about what was right and writing through the whole book,Both characters had a intense connection that shouldn't ever be but ends up feeling right. I could understand there inner struggles and was really immersed in to the story.Clarissa Wild yet again has wrote a mind blowing book that with leave you reeling long after you've finished it.

I don't know where to start. This book was amazing, to say I loved it doesn't begin to describe it. There are so many things that made me devour this book. I was honestly hooked on the first page.First off it has all my favorite romance storylines friends to lovers, second chance at love but it is second chance at first love which is just perfection for me.Second it is a military story and they always just break my heart. The whole ultimate sacrifice gets me everytime. Reading and knowing a soldier took part in writing made it very real, we got to actually look at what happens in war. We are in the soldiers head, just amazing.And last but not least it was an emotional read. I laughed because Katie was a funny little smart as# at times. I cried quite a few times. I even held my breath through a few scenes.Just a wonderful, beautiful story. Thank you both for sharing it with us!!

I have been waiting for this book since Until July!! I couldn't wait to read Jax's love story!! It was worth the wait!Ellie was such a good heroine! She was the perfect balance for Jax! Jax s like all his uncles in the fact that he is such an alpha male! I loved that we got to see the cousins more and the couples we first fell in love with, we even get to see a little bit of Jules, though I won't give anything away in regards to her part in this story but I was shocked!I only wish we got a little bit more of Jax and Cash's relationship, though Jax and Lilly's bond was showcased. Now on to wait for the next story, I can't wait to get more of this amazing family!!Bring it on Aurora!!

She Part 2 is the perfect follow up to She. Logan and Gemima are vacationing on the French Riviera. It’s the perfect combination of sightseeing, relaxing and sex. The only problem seems to be Gemima having to meet Logan’s parents and his brother.I fell in love with Logan and Gemima in She and that love has grown deeper in She Part 2. These characters are so well written, I couldn’t help but to fall in love with them. Logan is handsome, kind, rich, and all around perfect guy. Gemima is beautiful, full of life and has a tendency to speak her mind. Logan’s brother on the other hand is a bit of a jerk. The chemistry and passion between Logan and Gemima is off the charts. This leads to some pretty hot sex scenes. Their love knows no bounds and is a dream of a relationship. I loved reading more about their relationship and watching it grow.She Part 2 is an amazing read and the perfect ending to She. This story is a great love story and I truly believe that Logan and Gemima are soulmates. Logan waited for two years to get his girl. It is absolutely beautifully written. I felt like I was there with them and was wishing Logan was mine. Ms Fanning is quickly becoming a favorite author of mine. Her writing is flawless and near perfection. I would recommend She Part 2 to anyone who read She Part 1 and likes a epic love story with lots of hot sex scenes. I cannot wait to read more from this author.

So Blaine and Libby with a baby on the way pick up where they left off in A Paper Trail. ...Preggie hormones are raging and even the most angelic of woman can become frightening beings lol and Libby is no exception , Blaine will need to have hair on his teeth...Blaine always seemed to be the committed one in the relationship but this time round he had me rather worried on more than one  occasion.  Thankfully he comes back to us .There were glimpses of the old Libby here and there but she is totally committed to Blaine ♥Magan stays true to her style,  the series and the characters .Watching Libby and Blaine grow has been a beautiful adventure with moments of frustration , tenderness  and heartbreak but isn't that life ?Looking forward to more from Magan Vernon.

Terrible product. If I went into detail, it would be a novel. The firmware has far too many bugs in it. The worst is if you set the NVR to record over the oldest video when the drive becomes full, the system goes bonkers when there's still hundreds of gigs left, and puts messages on the screen saying the hard drive is full. It beeps like crazy, stops recording, and won't work again until you format the hard drive. Almost 6 months since this thing came out. I reported like 45 bugs to them. They haven't release a firmware update still, even though I was told 5 months ago that it would be "soon".Once their support department realized how serious I was, they all stopped responding. I had to throw this thing in the trash because I was way past the return policy because I tried so hard to work with Amcrest.

I love Apple mobile products, but this device is just a bigger iPad, and nothing more. There really isn't anything special here. Sure, you can do split screen apps, and a bit of multitasking, but that's about where the advantages stop, aside from the screen being bigger.I've had an iPad since the first one was released. I've had the iPad 1, 3, 4, and Air 1. I greatly enjoy my iPad air, and actually prefer it over my Windows 10 laptop with a touch screen I love it so much I decided to buy an iPad pro because I wanted the bigger screen. Why did I want a bigger screen? Not because I'm 700 years old, or because my eyesight is 8799324/20, and I need my text to be bigger, but because I want more resolution space. I want text to appear on the iPad Pro as the same size, or even smaller, than it appears on my iPad Air, giving me more space to see more stuff all on one screen. What did I get? an iPad that displays stuff on the screen EXACTLY THE SAME WAY as on EVERY OTHER IPAD IN EXISTENCE. Instead of text being the same size as on the Air, it's bigger. It takes up the same amount of space, therefore making the bigger screen not worth it for me. Text settings are set all the way to smallest, on both of my iPads. It's a super disappointment, and therefore I am returning the THOUSAND DOLLAR giant iPad Air.Now, let's get into the issues I had within the first 24 hours of ownership. TouchID is SLOW SLOW SLOW. Sometimes I'd put my finger on the home button, the lock screen would start to unlock, and 20 seconds later the iPad would actually unlock. This would differ, depending on how long the iPad had been sitting idle. If I woke it up over and over again, it would take the typical 1-2 seconds for touchID to work. On my iPhone 6s, it takes only milliseconds of my finger being in the home button, for it to unlock.The device completely died when it reached 100% charge, 7 out of the 8 times I got it charged to 100%. Every time I would have to hold the power/home buttons for 10 seconds, forcing a reset. I'd drain it a few percent, plug it back in and when I'd come back, it would be dead. It's being reported in many other places, and Apple is zero help. This issue is being reported on many forums all over the place. Apple is aware, but has no idea how to solve the issue.The hardware is beautiful. It's a great weight. It's nice to hold. The screen looks as good as the rest of the iPads I've had. It's really fast, and gaming is amazing on the A9X processor. But iOS 9 is awful, which essentially ruins this iPad.Save your cash, and wait until Apple gets their crap together with iOS 9.
Absolute junk. There is no built-in jacket stripper. There are crimpers at half the price that have more capability.
Love it so much, I bought another one. I love that even if you pull out some of the yellow tubs, they stay in place.

I put this on my new quad, and wow... Far brighter than the HIDs on my truck, though not quite as nice a spread as projected light. The truck lights provide a better view, while the LED bar provides more brightness. Measured against the stock headlights of the quad, this bar produces about 4 times as much light (measured in lux), using 72% of the wattage. I love it.
Absolutely not worth the $10 price tag. I expected something closer to purple, but got nothing but hot pink.
Worked exactly how I expected it to on the first try. SD card reader worked and ethernet worked. What more could I ask for?

This thing is awesome. I haven't used it much, but it does almost exactly what I need it to do so far. My only gripe is that it doesn't work as a wired keyboard when plugged in via USB. The USB cable is only used for power/charging. However, the cable it came with allows connection of the included dongle for connection to PC. Would be nice to not have to use the dongle. Aside from that, pretty freaking sweet. I think I want another one. I have no idea what for, but I want it anyway.

The picture makes this look like an actual knife blade. It's not. It's too thick to be a hot knife. If you've ever tried cutting thick plastic with a hot knife, you'll know how messy it becomes when the blade is thick. I had to grind this down to a super thin blade. Only then was it worth anything.

We use this twice per day, every day. Had it for 3 years. Literally over 2000 cups of milk. Makes milk hot but not too hot that it will burn your mouth. Add 2 shots of 190 degree espresso and it's the perfect temperature. My only complaint is the Teflon finish has worn down in one spot. That's it.

Essentially worthless. Huge variances from one sensor to another, none of them being accurate. Only measures in 1 degree C increments, meaning farenheit readings are always weird numbers, and vary by 1.5 degrees or more. This is only after testing for about 15 minutes. Junk junk junk. I need something more accurate.

I thought to myself, "No way will mine break like the others". Well, I was wrong. Worked the first 50 or so times I used it, then one day, half the plastic is gone from the plug. Still works, but the plastic is as thin as a piece of paper. This thing sucks, even though it works great.

Just got a brand new quad that came with this box, and wow is it awesome. Except one thing... The strap latches are made entirely of rubber, and have the ability to put a padlock on them. First, a padlock is a terrible idea because they will just jiggle around everywhere, and someone with a sharp utility knife could take one swipe at each strap and get past those locks in less than 10 seconds. The straps really need to be rubber coated metal. If they were, it would make this box perfect! Might get one for our other quad, because it really does provide some great storage.

Not really sure why this gets such rave reviews. It only puts out 110 lumens, which is 14% of that of a 60W incandescent bulb (average 800 lumens) Go buy a cheap-o work bulb holder, and a $5 LED 60W equivalent light bulb, and for $10 you have a work light that is 7 times brighter. The light is also WAY too focused, making it look as if it's brighter than it actually is.
These are great. Well made, and haven't had any problems with the couple I've ordered. Connectors are compact enough to fit through small conduit in commercial settings.

I'm impressed with this scanner. It's so tiny, but works like the big boys. I do wish it had slightly larger input/output trays, but other than that it's awesome.The software is a tad buggy. The CaptureOnTouch software has a bug where you choose job #1 on the scanner and hit start, and it doesn't choose job #1, and therefore job #1 in the software us useless unless you specifically choose job #1 in the software. #2-9 work exactly how they're supposed to. I've also had it crash on me like 15 different times at all stages. After the scan, during a scan, etc. It's frustrating that it crashes, which means you have to start the scan job over completely.One small wish I have for the software is for it to read barcodes off of ONLY the first page in the batch, in order to determine how to name the file. This would save us a ton of time, as we scan hundreds upon hundreds of pieces of paper every day. The problem is, almost every single piece of paper we scan, also has a barcode on it. We would like the cover sheet of each batch to be able to name the file, for true one-touch scanning and saving.

Love eTrack, but I specifically bought the black painted stuff to match my brand new trailer. The eTrack wasn't outside for even 24 hours before the gloss of the paint was lost, and the black turned into more of a dark gray. Cheap paint is used, and chips off easily.

Wow... Nice case. I'm glad it seems to fit everything, and has more space to spare. $250 seemed a bit steep, but it seems to be worth that price.Only complaint is that I put everything in, closed it up, rolled it around the office a little bit, then when I opened it back up, black foam dust everywhere. All over the copter and everything else. Looks like it's going to need a little work with the air compressor when I get home, to get the dust off EVERYTHING.

I thought this thing was great until I started actually using it. I finally realized that it's near impossible to get standard SD cards out of the sleeve, and microSD cards fall right out, making it too easy to lose them. Works well enough though.

Meh... Not terrible, but not great.Battery connectors are way too tight. Output is not as great as oem battery. Play time has been getting shorter. Charger power plug is a tad loose. Charger will not charge more than 2 batteries on a 1A power adapter. Needs 2.1-2.4A.Do yourself a favor and buy something else.

I'll try to get to the point.-Excellent video. Straight up awesome, except in low light.-Absolutely terrible still photos that are outshined by the camera on an iPhone 4-Poor hardware design:---Battery cover is near impossible to remove---Port cover is difficult to remove, and has no retention device.---Lens cover is flat, which causes water to be more likely to stick in places, causing blurred video when coming out of water.---Camera case is more difficult to open than my old GoPro 960. There has got to be a better way-Excellent battery life, compared to my old GoPro

Software crashes on every computer I've tried with Windows Server 2008. Sucks when you're trying to keep track of the temperature in a server room and there is no other computer running a different OS.

While these are great cameras, if anything goes wrong with them in the warranty period, expect to either buy a new one, or hire an attorney to go after Grandstream. I've been trying for months to get them to replace a couple of phones that are under warranty, and they flat out refuse to do so. I've been very happy with Grandstream products, but their inability to honor their warranty has caused us to no longer purchase their products. Just be aware of their terrible policy. Go in with low expectations, and then you won't be disappointed.Here is a response I received from Grandstream: "This product was purchased from amazon, so from legal point of view you have to contact amazon first not going after the manufacturer. If you buy an Apple product from Bestbuy and Bestbuy return policy doesn't allow you to return the item are you going after Apple? "

As others pointed out, it's not plastic, it's metal. This was my first disappointment. However, since this is not an object which moves or vibrates, it will not cause any cable issues. There's plenty of space in the slots, contrary to another review. Although, I got the 25 slot version, so I'm not sure if the others are different. Another person said the cover doesn't stay, but that's not my experience. It is just as stable as all the Panduit cable managers I have in the same rack. I don't have a lot of cables in this, as it separates a couple of networking devices which are not switches, so it works perfectly for our needs.

Keep in mind that Grandstream DOES NOT offer a manufacturer's warranty. Warranty is processed through the reseller, meaning you probably will have no idea how long the warranty is on your device.These are really nice phones, especially for the price.Compares to the GXP2160, there's one flaw in the LCD. If the phone is to your left, the screen must be pointed directly at your face. If the screen is rotated clockwise when at your left, it's hard to see what's on the screen. However, when the phone is at your right, you can rotate it and it's got a great viewing angle. The GXP2160 doesn't have this issue.

I don't like this as much as I thought I would. It's a great idea, but the #1 problem is that it's too easy to get a key off. This leads to keys coming half way off in your pocket. I still like it, and will continue to use it. It's also a bit bigger than I thought it would be.

I'm disappointed. Overall, this looks like a good lock, and has the beginnings of being a good product. I bought a brand new trailer with a Bulldog hitch on it. This is the lock suggested by bulldog for securing their specific style of hitch. Unfortunately, it's almost 2" longer than it needs to be. This allows a person to cut this, VERY easily. Why bulldog left almost 2" of space is beyond me, unless space for a cut off grinding wheel is a "feature". A person could cut this with a pair of bolt cutters, making it completely worthless. I'll be returning it.

Bought two of these. One for my son's quad (90cc Polaris), and another for my dirt bike (WR450). In the quad it's in the upright position, and in the bike it's laying on its side. It took me a good 10 minutes to get the screws on in my bike, and I had to put it up on a stand, and I had to use a screwdriver to push the nut into the right position for the screw. On the quad, it was WAY easier. Regardless of the PITA install, both batteries came with a 12.7v charge in them, which is definitely a little low. However after a trickle charge, both were up to a bit over 13v. The Yuasa battery in my bike was almost 3 years old, and sat in a crate as new for 2+ years before I bought the bike. It absolutely will not show voltage over 12.6v, even after being on a float charger for the entire winter. It was either spent $80 for each battery, or spend $24 for these guys, and take a gamble. I took the gamble, and I believe it's already paid off. We'll see how they fair over this summer, into the next.

These are excellent scanners, and we have many of them. Some of them are 8+ years odl, and still going strong. They just need a good cleaning every once in awhile. The ONLY reason I take off one star is for Magtek's absolutely terrible configuration software. It works, but is in no way intuitive, the localization within the program is terrible, and it's buggy buggy buggy. It needs serious improvement.

Less than two months old, and the system has died. It will start up, it refuses to connect to any cameras, it stays booted for about a minute, then shuts down and reboots. I've disconnected all hard drives, and tested the power supply. This thing is a steaming pile of junk. DO NOT BUY IT. Even worse is that I know when I contact Grandstream about it, they will refuse to replace it, since they don't honor any kind of warranty.I contacted Grandstream, and as usual, they told me to contact my reseller. I contacted Amazon, even though it was sold by the VOIPMart. Amazon instantly refunded my money, and told me to throw the product away. Apparently they are already aware of a high number of issues with this product. I don't like being the guinnea pig, but hopefully I save some people some time.Grandstream products DO NOT HAVE A WARRANTY! Thankfully, Amazon refunded my money for this purchase.-----------------------------------------------------------HARDWAREI was a bit shocked by the size of this thing. Seems like they could have made it a tad more compact, especially considering that the main board is absolutely tiny, and doesn't take up the whole space in the back. If the board were redesigned, the box could lose a good 3-4" in depth. It's rack mountable and the hard drives go up front, putting the weight in the proper position for mounting on a 2-post rack, as in my case. However, what I find strange is how unbelievably difficult it is to get into this box. From the factory there's 8 screws which must be removed in order to open it up. 4 on the back, then 2 on each side towards the front. However, add the rack mounts, and suddenly you've added another 6 screws that must be removed. If you add the rear mounts for some 4-post racks, that's another 6 screws. If you have to replace a hard drive, you're looking at 20 screws to be removed just to access the hard drives, and it doesn't include the 4 screws to remove the hard drive. Aside from that, the chassis is so unbelievably simple. It's easy to mount hard drives, and the cost is kept down through the use of all those screws.The dumbest thing is that this only has two USB ports. The manual suggests connecting keyboard and mouse to the rear one. You can connect a keyboard OR mouse to this, but not both. I connected a small 4 port USB hub, and that allowed me to have both connected, which is good. Really though, it should just have 2 USB ports in back, and 2 up front for storage.Audio input and output are RCA plugs, and not standard 3.5mm headphone jacks. This means it's compatible with almost nothing, since nothing utilizes RCA jacks these days. You must purchase adapters in order to connect the system to regular computer speakers or anything similar.There is ONE little TINY 1.5" fan in the back of this unit. Nowhere near proper cooling for 4 hard drives. I'm worried about thermal issues once the system has 4 hard drives in it.No batteries were included with the remote control (requires 2 AAA)SOFTWAREThis is where this product starts to go downhill. I really love Grandstream products, but the #1 problem with their stuff is that it's written by someone who doesn't speak English, and is never double-checked by someone who does. Instructions are worded in odd ways, and tool tips for options always have weird wording that often doesn't make sense.  Tips don't actually match the option in some cases. As an example, on the SMTP config page, the option is "Receiver 1", but the help hint says "Set the email address of sender 1".When you choose DHCP (default) the screen does not show what the IP configuration is. For me to figure out what its IP address was, I had to go to my DHCP server and compare the MAC address. It looks as if it doesn't pull DNS addresses from DHCP, because the option to specify DNS servers is NOT grayed out when DHCP is selected. Once you go to the status screen and view network info, you can see that it did correctly grab DNS, but the system shows that my primary DNS server shows the default DNS suffix, and the secondary DNS server shows the address of the primary DNS server. Buggy buggy buggy.The configuration of this device was really easy. The interface is relatively intuitive. But it's when you start getting into more finite settings that it gets worse.You can't configure a no authentication SMTP setup. Your SMTP server must allow authentication, because the GVR requires that you provide the username and password. In my case, we don't need that info, but I'm able to supply it. I don't like doing so. It only allows up to 3 email addresses to send to, rather than an endless list of them. When I ran a test to send an email, it said it sent successfully but there was nothing on the SMTP server showing that the GVR had tried in any way. I have been unable to get email notifications to work.Setting up recording is weird. You have 3 options. Closed, All Day, or Schedule. I chose all day for the 2 cameras I added, but then it literally records all day, 24/7. When choosing to disable (closed) recording, it makes you think that nothing will get recorded. I only want to record when there's an alarm, like from motion or something external. You can manage "Camera events", but on the camera event page, you have to know what camera number you want to configure, because Grandstream provided no way to name a camera. You can't call camera 1 "Lobby" and camera 2 "Front Door", so that you can reference that name everywhere else in the software. So you're forced to remember which camera number you're wanting to use. Sometimes this requires going back to the config page to figure that out. Once you figure out which camera, it's easy enough to set up recording for an alarm. What's awesome is that when you get motion on one camera, you can force any other camera to record as well. In my case I have a camera pointing at our front door from outside, and from inside. When motion is sensed from outside, I can record on both cameras and get every bit of the action before it even starts on the inside.Now we'll get to the absolute worst part of this device, and that's the playback. It's absolutely terrible, and uncontrollable. I'm unsure how to even begin to list all the problems with playback. There is no scrubbing, so you can't go back and forth. You can only change the forward speed, and only when ONE camera is being shown. Going in reverse is almost impossible to watch. It skips backwards in 2-3 second increments. Moving the slider to try to get to a specific point in time, is not worth it, because it's impossible. It doesn't matter if you're using the web player or are on the server itself. You can't increase playback speed while viewing more than one camera at a time, which is dumb. Even two pictures can't be displayed at 2x speeds.I've had constant issues getting the browser plugin to work on one of my computers with Chrome. Works great on my home computer and with my laptop, but does not work on my work machine. Same with a colleague of mine. Reinstalled, rebooted, tried it all. Does not work in Chrome, but works great in Firefox.Bringing up the Live View page to view the cameras, comes up with a completely blank screen. You are then forced to double click each camera you want to show. If you show 24 cameras at a time, you will click 48 times to load all those cameras into a view. Then, OOPS, I forgot to change that one setting on that one camera, so you go and change that setting, only to come back to the live view and realize that you have 48 more clicks to load all your cameras. The Live View page needs to save the last view, or something.There's no browser or other type of instant alert for motion. At this time we're constantly monitoring our lobby camera in our new office, as we don't have a receptionist there yet. Since we moved in, I've been using iSpy which causes an instant balloon popup in the taskbar to notify you which camera has movement. It would be a nice feature to get those instant alerts, and not have them be sound based (at the server) or email based. I don't need an email every time an employee walks out the front door.The Live view page utilizes the secondary stream of the camera. In the case of our grandstream cameras, the resolution was 320x240, and made the preview very grainy until you went full screen, at which point it starts using the primary camera stream. I'm having a difficult time fully determining when it's using which stream, and how it's analyzing the stream in order to determine motion.So far, it's really not bad, especially considering the price. I am thinking about ordering one for home, but I wish it were physically smaller.-----UPDATE: 6/15/2015-----Endless issues with this thing. We stopped buying Grandstream products, because Grandstream warranty and support are worthless, so I started buying several cameras to test out. After 4 different cameras, here are my results:-First camera would log me out when I added it. Talked to support, they blame the camera, end of story. Works perfectly within the ONVIF device manager software from sourceforge.-Second camera simply does not work. It sees the camera, adds the camera, but then doesn't connect to the streams. Works perfectly within ONVIF device manager.-Third and fourth cameras are relatively similar, and they work great, except that the NVR refuses to detect motion from anything from grandstream cameras. Also, when I do a full-time record of either camera, the bottom 15% of the image gets blurred on playback. I am unable to see motion within the playback screen on either camera.In addition to that, today the hard drive had completely lost its configuration. When I tried to recreate the volume, it said it failed. When I went back to try it again, there was the successfully created volume. 2 months worth of recordings lost. System says HDD is in good condition with no SMART errors. It was a brand new HD, so who knows where the problem lies.After all that, I'm playing with cameras, and trying to get it to record, but it won't unless the camera is made by grandstream. I would love to contact support, but they really are horrible. So, I'm adding and removing cameras, and suddenly am logged out. Then I try to log back in and it says that the user "admin" doesn't exist. WTF? I was literally just logged in. I try another browser, and same thing. I use the DNS name rather than the IP, and it lets me in. So I play around for a few minutes, and it logs me out AGAIN, and says the admin user doesn't exist. WTFFFFFF? I try the other user I created, and it also doesn't exist. What a pile of junk.I'm glad We only spent $200 on this thing, because it's probably going to either go in the trash, or to my house to record video from a single camera. It's not AT ALL high enough quality for business use. I should not have been so naive.

I own several other pairs of Life Khaki pants, but this is the first corduroy I've bought. I was excited to try them on, until I saw that they are not button waist pants. Instead, they utilize a slip hook system. For me, that simply does not work. Back to Amazon they go.

It fit how I need it to fit, but I think it's a tiny bit small for a large. Usually mediums fit me right, but are not long enough and barely make it past my belt. So I usually order large. This actually seems to fit better than most larges.The material is WAY thinner than I expected! I think it will be nice on a 90-100 degree day, or when I'm actively working. Many other days I will probably wear an under shirt. When I put it on, it felt and looked almost like workout material, because it's 100% polyester. Once I looked at myself in a mirror, I realized that it looks very sharp, and not at all weird.

It works well, except that I had to modify it to work with the B155. There were a couple completely unnecessary pieces of plastic which made it not fit in the B155. Aside from that, exactly what we needed. I still think it would have been better to modify the original reservoir with a float valve, and a TON cheaper, but this works.

Because it comes straight out of the plug, and it's the first thing to hit the wall, people are constantly pushing the machine to the wall, and kinking the hose, causing the Keurig to run out of water. I also generally have to pull the hose, cut it, and put it back in to get rid of the kink in the line. Then, repeat. This should BE a 90 degree connector. Buying an additional 90 degree adapter adds to the depth of the keurig machine, which is stupid. This works, but it's high maintenance. Kind of like Italian women.

First, download the Aquatec ERP1000 instructions.They contain the diagram for removing the shut-off switch, which makes a huge difference.The reason this works so well is that it uses the drain water to turn a pump which pushes more pressure into the storage tank. It's also pulling from the membrane so it's generating more water, more quickly. The tank pressure will be closer to water inlet pressure. It's pretty much the hydraulics version of a turbocharger in a car.In my case, I installed a system in our new office building. The fridge and coffee machine are on the opposite side of the room. 52PSI from the city inlet, which is awful. The fridge barely had a trickle of water. It was making tiny ice cubes. I had no outlet under the sink for a demand pump. I took videos of before, during, and after, of the speed of filling a cup. ~40 seconds before, and ~20 seconds after. That's a huge improvement. It also makes properly sized ice cubes now. Not quite as good as the demand pump I have on the same RO system at home, but I'm considering adding the permeate pump simply because it increases the capacity of the storage tank via higher pressures. This is why the shut-off valve must be removed. The Watts manual did not include this.I didn't use any of the included parts, except for the tubing. Plenty of stuff in there if you need it.

Since Grandstream refuses to honor their warranty for many of the products we have purchased from them, I have changed by rating of all of their products to 1 star. When Grandstream decides to honor their warranty, I'll restore my 4 star rating. Here is a response I received from Grandstream: "This product was purchased from amazon, so from legal point of view you have to contact amazon first not going after the manufacturer. If you buy an Apple product from Bestbuy and Bestbuy return policy doesn't allow you to return the item are you going after Apple?First, as was pointed out by another reviewer, this camera is not black. It's white. For me that was ok, but some might want what's in the picture.I absolutely love this camera so far, but it's missing a couple important items compared to other grandstream cameras. Most notably is its inability to adjust time based on daylight savings. Our GXV3611 has settings for when DST starts and ends, but this camera does not. So, when you set time/date via NTP, it sets it an hour behind as of right now. The only other option is to change the time manually. I expect any device that has NTP capabilities to have DST settings in this day and age.It's only been installed for a few hours, but I really like the quality and adjustability of the housing, and that it's all metal.

Started with the HM1300, and liked the headset so much that I decided to grab this HM1900 for the noise cancelling, A2DP bluetooth profile capabilities, and being able to have 2 devices connected at the same time. There are a few issues with this headset:1. Battery life is not as good as the HM13002. Volume level and sound quality of the earpiece is not as good as the HM13003. While this cancels out the background noise, my voice doesn't sound as good to the caller on the other end, as it did on the HM1300. It's a toss-up whether or not this trade-off is worth it. Callers can still hear me clickety-clacketing away at my keyboard, and every mouse click.4. Charging port cover is next to impossible to remove without having long fingernails. I have to use a pen to open it up every night for charging.5. While it connects to my computer and my desk phone without issue, occasionally it will completely lose itself. Sometimes my desk phone ends a call, and the headset doesn't recognize it, and refuses to switch back to the computer. Sometimes the headset will not connect to my computer, even though it was just playing sound several seconds earlier. This requires me turning the headset off and back on for it to reconnect.I got 2 of these. One for myself, and one for our receptionist. While our receptionist only connects it to her phone, she has many of the same issues I do with the phone randomly all of a sudden not recognizing that the headset is connected. Easily solved by turning the headset off and back on. A pain, but a great deal for only $20.

I love this thing, but there's a couple things wrong with it. First, it's stupid as a zipper pull. I cut the strap off it and put it on a key ring. Much better that way. Second, it's nearly impossible to open, and even worse because I have hardly any fingernails. I hate fingernail open knives. But, that was solved by adding a drop of lube to the center, and I bent back the friction arm which keep the blade open. It not only made it easier to close, but way easier to open.Perfect tiny little knife for little jobs. Won't quite cut a large zip tie, but it's perfect for opening boxes and cutting ropes and other stuff.

Steer far clear of Fortivoice products. Their software is feature-lacking, and their QA is non-existent. Being a customer is like being a member of a QA team, without the ability to report bugs to the development team. The dev team refuses to look at bug reports and support has no direct connection to anyone to get these issues solved. If you have a huge issue, it might get solved, and it might not. We used their products for years, and made the terrible decision to upgrade to these later model systems. We ended up returning it because the software was awful. I submitted a large list of bugs, and asked when they would be fixed. Kept being told that it would be "in a few days", or "by next week" or "guaranteed by end of November". None of those things were ever met. The sales team wasn't kept up to date by the engineering team. There was miscommunication everywhere. Sales person tells me I can get latest build, to contact support. Contact support and they say they can't give that out, because they don't have it.We returned the system, went with Asterisk, and have never looked back.
