It is mainly only shifters but Heather was raised with a family of leopards and feels more comfortable with them then she does her parents. She wasn’t looking for a man and didn’t want one after what happened to her in college. She was enjoying herself when her friend Dana brings in her date Ben.Ben is just wanting a little fun with Dana and goes to the BBQ with her. He never expected to find his mate when he walked in. He is told that Heather will think that she is trying to take over Dana’s man. He knows he has to have her and there are no options of him leaving her alone. No one knew that his tiger would be so obsessive. When she tries to get away from Ben his tiger see’s red. What happens is really bad and she never wants to see Ben again.At first you wonder if you will like Ben. He wants sex and that is all. He says that a shifter knows what they are doing and it’s just about sex. He changes his mind when he scents Heather. I knew that Ben would be into a hard time getting Heather to trust him when he does what he does to her. As the story went you see each character change for the better. There’s so much of a connection with them and just because she’s a human doesn’t mean anything.By the time I got to the end of the book I was really into the story. I hated to know that I was almost done. I do know that there is another book after this one and after reading the end of this book I really want the other book. I have read several books by this author and when you open the books and start to read you are in for a real treat. Every book is different and you know there will be an alpha that will want to control the female. Good thing that the females can take them and can take care of themselves.

Reviewed by Amy W.Book provided by the publisher for reviewReview originally posted at Romancing the BookIf you are expecting this to be a typical story of a poor girl who gets swept away by a handsome rich man, be prepared to be completely overwhelmed. 30 Days of Syn is a true diamond in the rough featuring complex characters who experience the gamut of human emotion.Just when I thought it was safe to predict what would happen next, author Charlotte Boyett-Compo provided yet another twist and turn to the storyline. The incorporation of New Zealand slang added an interesting element that gave me a real taste of the characters.If there were a contest for broken characters, Synjyn McGregor would be among the nominees. He is a dynamic character who makes me want to smack him one minute and then hug him tightly the next. I was pleased to see that Melina retained a feisty attitude throughout the story without turning into a doormat. The cast of supporting characters is also well developed.From an emotional standpoint, this is a story that fully engages all senses for the reader. There is plenty of laughter and tears to go around. By the time I finished the book, I felt a strong connection to these characters. The heat level is carried out throughout each encounter, moving the intensity meter well beyond the spicy mark.Whether it is the smooth writing style or the way the author chose to spin the storyline, this is one of those unforgettable stories that will have a lasting place on my keeper shelf.

Reviewed by Amy W.Book provided by Edelweiss for reviewReview originally posted at Romancing the BookIn her gripping new release, author Wendy Corsi Staub delivers yet another thriller that will make readers think twice about the faceless people they deal with online. The Perfect Stranger follows a group of breast cancer bloggers, including sections from their blogs at the beginning of each chapter.On one hand, it is a testimony to those who battle cancer. On the other, it is an eye-opening tale of what can happen when you share too much information with the wrong person. It is a storyline full of a see-saw of emotions. Just when you think you have everything figured out, a new twist or turn is introduced. It’s a disturbing story when you consider that it is completely possible that it could actually happen in real life.The story focuses on five main characters, richly detailing their lives. From the start to the finish, this is one storyline that grabs the reader and maintains your attention. Fortunately, the author wraps up all the loose ends in a very unexpected conclusion. If I had to point out anything that distracted from the story, it would be the fact that the switching of characters is abrupt. In spite of this, I found the book to be exceptionally well written and engaging.

Reviewed by EffyBook provided by the author for reviewReview originally posted at Romancing the BookWind and Shadow by Tori L. Ridgewood was a book that took me pleasantly by surprise. I was a bit hesitant going in, but I’m really glad I took the chance. This is such a wonderfully well-rounded book; I really don’t know how the author managed to pull it all off. No one area really suffered, or lacked. The entire cast of characters are fully fleshed, obviously some more than others, but even the characters you only see once or twice are described wonderfully.Rayvin escaped her hometown years ago, following a super-secret Big Bad Thing that happened. The entire town shunned her, and she decided to hightail it out of there. It was pretty annoying at how long it took for that to be revealed. You knew Rayvin was strong, so you could only guess that it was something really bad, but then you start wondering if maybe she just wasn’t strong enough to handle it. You know she’s a witch, so is it something she couldn’t solve with magic, or is it a moral thing? So many questions.Our heroine Rayvin was kick ass. She was amazing, strong in a way that most other heroines pretend to be, and innocent and vulnerable in ways most other heroines pretend to be, as well. We got more pieces and clues into her character as the story went on. Maybe I’m impatient, but it sort of pissed me off at how slow in coming the “big reveal” was, the reason why she left home so many years ago.As soon as she returns home, the crap hits the fan. Technically I’m not even sure if she technically made it in to her home town, she was on the outskirts of it. This goes to show you just how bad things get. But it was a delicious journey. Then you’re introduced to our hero, Grant. He’s pretty amazing, all male, all strong and brooding, yet seriously sensitive and understanding. Although it takes a bit for that to come to light. The more you get to know him, the more you like him. But at the same time, once you know him you start getting pissed off by some of his more annoying attributes. But again, that’s another one of those crazily appealing things about this book, these people have zero of those normal book character qualities. They’re actually real. Well, except for the magic.The way the author handled the magic, the witchiness, the vampires, (yes, I said vampires,) was just astounding. None of the trite things I’ve come to expect from novels containing vampires. And as the book progresses, it just becomes more involved, more powers are developed and shown, more people are turned. The villain in this piece was seriously despicable. He was just gross, creepy, delusional and plain evil. He really had some plans. You’re always kept guessing, and you’re rooting; you’re annoyed and excited, happy and sad. The prose and descriptive properties in this novel were amazing. The cliffhanger was just… wow. NOT what I was expecting at all. At the end of it, you’re dying to find out more. As soon as I read the last word, I opened up my internet tab and checked to see if the sequel was already available. It was. I’d recommend this to anyone that likes paranormal romance, and likes real characters, magic, betrayals, cheering and crying, and seriously hating the bad guy.

Reviewed by CrystalBook provided by the publisher for reviewReview originally posted at Romancing the BookI really wanted to read this book because I loved the title and the blurb.Terri meet Beorn last year at the Renaissance Faire where she works every year. He always said he would be back but he never comes. She remembers him but she puts him to the back of her mind. Everything changes when his house hob Brokk comes and tells her that Beorn wants to see her. She goes with him and he all of a sudden brings out a glowing wand and she notices that the forest changes but doesn’t say anything. When she see’s Beorn again she knows something is different because he keeps saying that he wants to make her happy. She wants to to leave and he tells her that she can after she stays the weekend.The book started and I liked it but as I read a little more it started to lose my attention. I wanted more out of the book then I was getting and that feeling that you get when you are reading a great book, well I wasn’t getting that feeling. I love shifter books and were bears has really started growing on me. Terri never really got why she couldn’t leave the forest and always ended back at Beorn’s house until the ending of the book. I understand keeping secrets about who you are but to keep it away until the end wasn’t what I would do.Now this is just my thoughts and view. It doesn’t mean that you shouldn’t read it. There were some things in the book that I liked but there were some things I didn’t like. I have read several books by this author and this is the only one that I didn’t like all that much. Now the book did have a great ending. So if this looks like a book you would like to read then give it a try.

Reviewed by HeatherProduct provided by the manufacturer for reviewReview originally posted at Romancing the BookI am very surprised at the quality and durability of the DBPower Portable Bluetooth Speaker. This speaker is absolutely amazing for the price.First of all, the packaging was amazing. I felt like I had received a top of the line product when I opened the package to find a very nice white box. Everything was very well placed as to not cause any damage during shipping. It came with almost everything I needed, minus the wall plug for the charger. It had the charging cable but not the plug itself. I was a little disappointed by this.The main reason I wanted to review this product is because I love to listen to music throughout the day and I always use my smartphone to do this. The DBPower Portable Bluetooth Speaker was perfect for this. I can listen to music that is stored in my phone, Pandora, and even music from a USB drive. I carry it from room to room as I’m cleaning or working on projects. I love it because I can control the volume and change songs from my phone or the speaker. I also use it when I am bike riding. I keep it in my child’s bike trailer that is pulled behind my bike and the sound is perfect.We live in the country and do not pick up many radio stations on the radio that we bought for our son recently. I was very pleased to find that this product could pick up many more stations than his radio, even when they are sitting side by side.It has fell our hard kitchen floor many times. I also have two very energetic children that like to run around the house with it. I’ve had the speaker for a few weeks now and I am happy to report that it is still in perfect condition despite the abuse it has seen. I have only charged the speaker one time, the day I received it. I use it at least 3-4 times a week for about an hour or so at a time. The battery life is very impressive.I honestly feel like this is a really great product for the price despite the missing wall plug. We had plenty of them laying around the house so it wasn’t a big deal to us. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone who is in the marker for a portable bluetooth speaker. I am very happy with it.

Reviewed by JenProduct provided by the manufacturer for reviewReview originally posted at Romancing the BookMy kitchen has multiple cutting boards.  I have the old school big plastic cutting board.  I have a couple of those smaller flexible plastic ones.  But I’ve always wanted a wood board.  I was excited when I saw this set of three bamboo boards as I could really use the different size boards.The boards were well wrapped and included a set of care instructions.  There weren’t any defects in the boards and so after a quick wash, I put them to work.  I set out making dinner and chopping up chicken and potatoes and all that I needed for my meal.  I put them through the paces and they came through with flying colors.  Outside of a little sliding around on my counter top (and that’s quite normal with that horrid Formica top), I was quite pleased with the cutting boards.After my meal, cleaning the boards was quite easy.  I was excited to see that bamboo is more germ and bacteria resistant and even Googled that to ensure the manufacturer’s claims.  Who wouldn’t like a product that would help in cleanliness and food safety?All in all, I was happy with these boards and can totally see myself getting an even larger one (the largest of the three was a little bigger than a sheet of paper) when I have more room in my kitchen.  If you’re looking for cutting boards, give these a try.

Reviewed by VictoriaBook provided by the publisherOriginally posted at Romancing the BookFully Exposed by Tara Tennyson is not part of a series but I do hope we get to see these characters again in the future. I chose this book because after reading the summary I wondered how this was going to turn out.Jade Hamilton is the owner of an event planner business. When several waitresses call in sick, Jade jumps in to help. Jade is hard working and not looking someone. However when Caspar wants to take her picture she is intrigued. But Jade seems to want to protect herself from those around her.Caspar Jones is an erotic art photographer who has his sights set on Jade. Caspar is portrayed as a typical artist who is oblivious to those around him. I do wish we got a better picture of Caspar because I get the feeling that he has a big heart.The chemistry between the characters and the sex scenes were blistering. I can see Caspar and Jade being a good match for each other. I found this book well written with interesting and engaging characters. I liked that while this book started off fairly typical it turned out anything but. Overall, this was a good story.

Reviewed by Amy WBook provided by the publisherOriginally posted at Romancing the BookAuthor Jocelyn Dex brings a fresh paranormal story line to readers in Araya’s Addiction.The story features Araya, who is part human and part Sempire. She has special needs that threaten her life if they remain unfulfilled. Kean just happens to be in the right place at the wrong time and is forced to help her. Kean has his own secrets, but he finds himself strangely drawn to Araya.What follows is an entertaining tale featuring demons and shapeshifters. While clearly paranormal in nature, the story line contains elements to appeal to a variety of readers. These are not your typical paranormal characters.Although it is a quick read, there is plenty of entertainment and humor in the dialog. The heat factor is substantial and provides good support for the story line. As the first in the series, this sexy read sets the bar high for future installments.

Reviewed by Crystal NBook provided by the publisherOriginally posted at Romancing the BookThis book has a great spin. Werewolves are not allowed to take a mate until they are 21. There is just something about that number and it seems to work out for everyone.Well that is a whole new thing when you talk about Elle. She has tried her best to stay out of the alpha’s way and do her job. She thinks about moving to the city and get away from everything if only her friend would come with her. She even skipped the 21 birthday party that the pack has for everyone. She was just at work one day when she is jerked out of the kitchen to go and see the Alpha. Imagine her surprise when he moves so fast, says that she is his and bites her.Brandon doesn’t think he will ever see his mate and have the love that other couples in the pack has. He has a woman that wants to marry him but he only wants her for one thing and she doesn’t make his life easy. Brandon can’t believe that when he is just in the same restaurant that he suddenly scents his mate and it turns out to be Elle. Seems he had felt something when she was 16, when she first came to town.I love and enjoy every book that this author writes. I will have to say that she is one of my favorite authors. When she writes there is just some magic that she puts in her writing that makes me want to read everything by her and then start all over. This story just seemed so real to me and I didn’t want it to end. I can’t wait to read the rest of the series.If you love books about Alpha males that thinks they know how to handle everything and then find out that they are wrong and admit it then this is the book for you. The love between these two was slow but it needed to be. Neither really knew their true feelings or what the other thought. I will say that there are some vampires and witches in this story.

Reviewed by JulieBook provided by the publisherOriginally posted at Romancing the BookThis book is an absolute classic! Native American interracial/ cultural historical romance that dares touch upon openly voiced and acted upon bigotry and prejudice. Before the days of political correctness, historical romance novelist dared to cross the lines and face up to the facts as they were in this period of time. The message is the same then as it is now. When you open your mind and your heart you can look past the color of someone’s skin and see the person inside, and isn’t that all that really matters?For Caitlyn it is hard to forgive “Indians” because they were responsible for the death of her brothers.  However, she is not about to allow a man to be hanged for a crime he didn’t commit just because of his heritage.Stalking Wolf has had to leave the Cherokee tribe he was raised in because of the machinations of a woman. Because he is part Irish, he deals with the moniker of being a “half-breed”. He vows never to trust a woman again. But, then he finds himself being held for a crime he didn’t commit and is healing on the ranch where Caitlyn and her father live. Almost from the the time Caitlyn lays eyes on Stalking Wolf she is physically attracted to him, but she continually reminds herself that he is an Indian and she hates all Indians.Caitlyn will learn the most valuable of lessons in learning not to judge all people by their looks or heritage. Stalking Wolf was an easy character to like and I could imagine how gorgeous he was. Caitlyn’s character was a little bit more complicated. Naturally, she worried about the reactions of others and what people would think of her. I think that was just a human flaw and even today people can be that way. It takes her awhile to come around, but she eventually matures and lets herself falls in love with Stalking Wolf.  I thought the author did a good job of showing the real fears many would have if they found themselves attracted to and falling in love with someone who is considered her enemy.This was western/ Indian Historical Romance at it’s peak and I for one wish we could see these books come back in style. These books have really stood the test of time and since Ellora’s Cave has re-released these in digital format I hope they will find a new audience.Madeline Baker has written a slew of Native American Historical Romances and for a time it was like a niche for her. I think she is in her best element when writing these historical novels. Many of you may know her as a very popular paranormal romance novelist who writes under a different name and also made a niche for herself in that genre as well. So, you know this is a good writer.Try these titles out through online bookstores – especially if you like western romances. These stories are just as good now as they were then and I think you will enjoy them.

Reviewed by Amy WBook provided by NetGalleyOriginally posted at Romancing the BookWhen you put a career woman determined to fulfill the needs of her biological clock in the same orbit with a man renowned for taking risks and committed to an adventurous lifestyle, there’s bound to be an explosion.All Samantha Evans can focus on is finding the perfect man to father her child. She hasn’t worked out all the details about how she will handle the challenges of motherhood, but as a career woman, she is certain that satisfying her “cheeping” eggs is the right thing to do.Nick Hawke knows better than to get involved with a woman seeking a permanent commitment. He tries his best to help Sam in her search, setting her up with guys based on her listed requirements. He soon finds himself realizing that matchmaking can be risky business.Author Amy Andrews delivers a quirky romance packed with a solid story line and enough one-liners to keep the laughter rolling in Risky Business. The supporting characters, including Sam’s sister and the bookstore customers, add to the overall flavor.You will find yourself cheering for Sam as she navigates through the challenges of walking away from her job, dealing with some downright painful blind dates and then finally coming to the realization that maybe there are some things in life that simply can’t be scripted.These two characters mesh well together, providing plenty of chemistry and some pretty crazy conversations. The off-the-wall dialog adds to the storyline’s impact, creating a sense that the reader has a seat in the bookstore while everything is happening. It’s a fun story that not only captured my interest, but reaffirmed my belief in happy endings.

Reviewed by Amy WBook provided by the author for reviewOriginally posted at Romancing the BookWith plenty of sizzling action, author Diane Leyne delivers a contemporary story of two strangers thrown together by accident. Jack O’Dell unwittingly slips into the role of Nelly O’Malley’s boyfriend during a family visit. As they get to know each other, the sparks continue to fly.In this quick read, there is a ribbon of suspense woven into the story line. An investigation into Nelly’s accident reveals that it was no accident, which forces her to consider Jack as a possible suspect. The only question is whether their budding relationship can withstand the pressure caused by the uncertainty.The characters are well developed, especially Jack. He has had his share of heartache in the past, which drew me to him. By the end of the story, the author had me rooting for the couple, hoping they would have a shot at a happily-ever-after.

Reviewed by Melissa DBook provided by the publisherOriginally posted at Romancing the BookThe Outlaw Stakes His Claim is the fifth book in The Grizzly MC series by Jenika Snow. This book is part of a series but it can be read and enjoyed as a standalone novel. I love reading Ms. Snow’s book and have not found one that I don’t like.Hope Richards has made it through school and has managed to get a job in her chosen field. This has caused her to move to a new town to start her life. On her first night, she meets a man who should scare her, but only seems to fascinate her. Hope has self-image issues but it seems to come toward the end of the story like that author put it in as more of an afterthought.Dallas is a member of The Grizzly motorcycle club. He lost his wife and son in a car accident and is having a hard time moving forward. When he meets Hope, he is attracted to her in a way he does not expect and fights with himself on pursuing her.The sex scenes between Dallas and Hope are scorching. The chemistry between Hope and Dallas is intense. They make a great pair if they can move past the stereotyping they both do to each other.While I enjoyed this book a lot, I wished this book was a bit longer and more detailed. This book seems to gloss over some details (like Dallas’s fighting). The main characters and the secondary characters are appealing and very lifelike. Overall, this was a good book. I have read several book in this series and each book is better than the last.

Reviewed by Amy WBook provided by the publisherOriginally posted at Romancing the BookThis is one of those rare books highlighting a Domme in a relationship as opposed to the male taking charge.In Collar Me in Paris, author Sidney Bristol writes about the adventures of a married couple who get caught up in a family challenge to find envelopes hidden throughout the city.With the Parisian landscape as a backdrop, the couple battles against family members to see which couple will come out on top. Meanwhile, Bianca and Clay, who have an established relationship where Bianca is the Dominant, find themselves exploring the boundaries of their relationship.The author has put quite a bit of effort into bringing Paris and its beloved landmarks to life. Unfortunately, the Domme story line didn’t quite work for me, especially since there were numerous times throughout the book where Clay had to take the lead outside the bedroom.There is a strong emphasis on pain and its connection to pleasure, as well as some less publicized aspects of the BDSM lifestyle. The heat level is high with plenty of kink.

Reviewed by LoriBook provided by the publisherReview originally posted at Romancing the BookThis was a fun read, it really was. What I mean when I say this is that the characters really entertained me, kept me on my toes, and I had a couple of good laughs while reading this.I know I usually talk about the main protagonists first but I think I’ll save them for last as they are just delicious.First, I want to talk about Carey’s best friends. They form a band that plays at different venues and have known each other forever. These group of shifters are loyal to Carey and depend on him to help direct them in their day to day lives. He’s their alpha. These dudes tease Carey mercilessly about Broden and it’s just too funny. They want Carey to be happy and love him like a brother. Each of these guys have their own back story and I wonder if more books will be written. I hope so. I want to know more.We also get a glimpse into Carey’s family life and get to meet his father. This guy is military and is all about protecting the things and people he loves and has instilled these morals into his son. Even though his presence is very brief in this book, he really made an impression on me and I feel that he provides a glimpse into Carey and how his personality works.Now I’ll get to the protagonists. Carey was an unusual character. He was a human alpha in a group of shifters. I loved that idea. I never read about that before and it made me happy to see. Most alpha males are some kind of shifter and here we see a human being in charge of a bunch of shifters.  He was unassuming in his nature and the way he carried himself. He wasn’t massive in strength and size. He wasn’t the kind to throw his weight around and talk about how great and fabulous we was. He didn’t need to do that. All one has to do is look at him, at the kindness that he shows other people, the love and kindness he shows his friends in his pack, the work that he does for his job, to see that he’s so much more then meets the eye. He’s been trained as if he’s been in the military and knows all about defending himself. He’s also sexy as sin so that doesn’t hurt either.Broden was such a great character to read about. He was a cat shifter and an alpha to boot and he has some very definite opinions about humans and their fragility and not being able to defend themselves against shifters. He lacks tact, he’s arrogant, and he’s clueless. He’s also an honorable man, he’s loving, and he’s generous. He’s trying to overcome what he thinks he knows about humans but he’s not quick enough. He has unusual strength and stamina and is used to people obeying his every command. He has a lot to work through and deal with. I really liked this guy despite his shortcomings. How could I not? Carey likes him too and that’s good enough for me.

Reviewed by MarissaBook provided by NetGalley for reviewReview originally posted at Romancing the BookThis is a nice departure from the TAG books, taking us readers out of college and back into the small rural Pacific Northwest town. Tenino has a way of infusing her characters with that certain something, that it that makes them jump off the page and straight into my heart.I loved that Lucas got lost in his own world quite often. As that’s something I tend to do, I can see that it’s not self-centered (as most people might tend to think) – it’s that his thought process takes precedent over anything else going on at the moment. Given that he’s artistic, he gets away with it. (I’m not so I don’t.)Gabe is a sort of shy, quiet type, but not really. He’s more of a thinker than the loud, gregarious type although he is friendly and personable. He works hard at making his lumber farm a success and is a talented horse trainer.The one thing I wasn’t sure I liked was that both Lucas and Gabe had crushes on each other going back to high school and hadn’t stopped thinking about each other since. I supposed it could happen but how likely is it? On the other hand, it is kind of sweet, two people pining over each other for so long.While this is the seventh Bluewater Bay book of the series, each is a stand-alone novel written by a different author. This is the first I’ve read and I’m hooked. I want to go back and see what other charming couples are out there – and I’m hoping Seth gets his happy ending.

'Going Home', Book 1 of the 'Where We Left Off' series is a great quick read! It's really fast-paced and the characters are really well developed so we quickly get to know them so that we can find joy in their happiness and stress at their trials.Khloe is real, she's lovable and she's fun. I love how relatable she is. She's been through some stuff - more than most - and she's ready to kind of put it behind her and move on. As we watch her pick up the pieces and put a life together, Paul steps in... a hottie who's got a special place in her heart.They've both got great family dynamics and I'm absolutely in love with the small-town in which this is set. It seems predictable off the bat but then there are some little twists. The book does end on  - not exactly a cliffhanger  but it completely left me needing more and I eagerly await the release of Book 2!A really fun way to spend a couple hours. I still miss these characters and cannot wait for more.Nice touch, making this avail in the KOLL - a great way to use my monthly library / Prime loan! Thank you.

I love this case! It's adorable!It's a perfect stocking stuffer for a loved one because of the cute expression.Or anyone who loves elephants because the elephant is adorable.It is perfect for lady products to keep in a purse or backpack, etc. so you can be more conspicous.It also is perfect for its intended purpose - a pencil case. I was skeptical but i got a complete 72-pencil set in here and I can comfortable zipper it shut, with room to spare.Love the little pockets that are sewn into the top - they're perfect for erasers, sharpeners, etc.Hoping my budget allows for me to purchase more of these. Adorable.I'm not sure why it's labeled "funny" as there isn't anything funny about this - just adorable !!Zipper works great, smooth. Case is well made.Love.5 stars for being better than I expected.*I received this pencil case for free in exchange for my honest review.

These are - overall, I'd say "okay" - hence the rating of 3 stars for "it's okay".It took 2 pairs of these to get them all tried out.The first pair absolutely would not pair at all, with any devices. I tried it with 2 iPhones, 3 iPads, a Kindle Fire HD, 2 Macbooks and an Android tablet.I contacted the seller and they overnighted a replacement to me - it was nice to see them back up their product.The second pair, charged up just like the first - within an hour.They paired right away with my iPhone 6.. I tried some of the other previously mentioned devices and they paired with them all.Obviously the first pair was just defective.What I like about these:*The flat cord that doesn't tangle easily.*The magnets!*Came with replacement tips and elastics.What I dislike:They are a little bit bigger than necessary & if I'm gonna wear earbuds, I want them tiny.I could take or leave the Bluetooth feature, depending on what I'm using them for.Most importantly:The sound!The sound isn't spectacular.It isn't terrible.It's just okay.*I received these earbuds for free in exchange for my honest review.

I've been through a lot of kitchen timers in the last few years and this is my favorite - I think this might be 'the one'.Here's how it works:It's really simple, with just 3 buttons like many timers. M for minutes, S for seconds and your ST/SP for start / stop.Just hit the minute button repeatedly until it lands where you want it. Can repeat with seconds. Hit ST/SP to start and then again to shut it up when it goes off.Major Pro:There's actually a power switch on the side of this. So when not in use, it doesn't need to drain the battery.Also this will eliminate my randomly turning it on and not knowing til it later goes off and startles me! (I've done this with my other timers many times.)Other Pros:Easy to use.Accurate.Very low battery usage.Has a collapsible stand - stand it up or lie it flat.Built in magnet - can just live on the fridge, etc.Cons:It's really really hard to get to the battery. It DID come with the necessary battery which is awesome - but I had to get in there and remove the plastic to activate it. The door to the battery panel doesn't easily slide or snap or fold. I really hurt myself getting to it - still failed, had to get someone to help me and they didn't have it any easier. Once you get past this, you should be set for a long time though since this won't use a lot of battery power.I love that this is a 2-pack. It's handy because I'm always looking for another one. Sometimes I'm multi-tasking in the kitchen and need more than one timer.This last part, is a Con for me, but probably a Pro for many - very subjective:It's REALLY LOUD. Ear-piercing. I can see how that would be good, if you're moving between rooms, etc, you dont want to not hear it / neglect whatever you're cooking/baking and ruin it. For me though, it's a little painful. :)*I received this 2pack of kitchen timers for free in exchange for my honest review.

SUPER comfortable!!!So - I got these for my husband but I'm actually keeping them. The cuffs do run a bit small and they cut off his circulation a bit.They're fine for me and I actually love them.Three pairs came in this set, they're all solid black. They are really soft, feel really nice. No scratchy-ness like some have.No tags.They are thin - I expected to have to layer them but my feet have actually been really toasty in these.It's good to have solid black socks for work, etc.I'm using these when lounging around the house to keep warm and also - they're really comfortable with my sneakers when I set out on foot to run my errands.*I received these socks for free in exchange for my honest review!

I'm really enjoying this cooling pad!!Plugs right into my USB port - I really like that it reaches the side I need it to.I mostly use my Macbook which has USB ports only on its right.. other cooling pads I've actually had to use upside down because they couldn't reach.This one reaches my Macbook's right side great - without being upside down!Love the blue light up - looks cool.Another thing I love about this one is that it's quiet.  Most cooling pads I try are loud, I can't stand to use them and then my computer overheats.This one actually solved that problem! YAY!Handy that it tilts - but isn't perma-tilted. I can keep it flat or tilted. I often use my computer on my lap and I move around a lot - also in bed. So I love that this one has some flexibility to it. I can customize it to however I want to sit.Super handy, practical and it seems they've thought of everything. I'm very fond of this cooler and cannot find any cons.*I received this cooling pad for free in exchange for my honest review.

SO PRETTY!!!This case is beautiful - what I like about this one is the glitter is iridescent so it picks up from the light or whatever the color is of whatever you set it down on and looks even prettier and bolder.This one has not just glitter, but hearts! Tiny hearts-  I've gotten a ton of compliments on it.Pros:Pretty.Goes on easily - snaps right in.Non-bulky.Cons:Not super protective. (I just pair mine with a tempered glass screen protector).Really hard to get off the phone without breaking it.Not super protective - sides and back only and mostly against superficial stuff only.Overall - 4 stars as it's beautiful and good for a slim case, but there are a couple minor things I'd change about it.*I received this case for free in exchange for my honest review.

Not only do I have no complaints  // nothing I'd change about this ring, but it has an added bonus if the cute, mesh, drawstring bag!Hubby and I like silicone rings because they are more conducive to some work that is done with hands - guitar playing, photography, soldering, etc because it doesn't add any noticeable weight to the hand like 'real' rings (metals, gems, etc.)He also likes that it's quiet and I've got no giant stone that "claws" // "attacks" him. (My diamond has torn him up good.)This ring is a pretty color - navy blue.It fits as expected and is extremely comfortable.Stays in place - another advantage to the rubber over the silicone.Overall - better than describe so, 5 stars.

This taffy is definitely some of the most fun I've ever had with a product test.For the most part it's great taffy and if Shriver's offers custom orders where you can pick your flavors, I'd consider ordering more.Some little things vary from flavor to flavor ... I'm going to share everything I've noticed/ found here in the hope that it helps someone who's considering this as one of the possibilities for a taffy purchase...First of all -I counted 15 different flavors included in this one pound box.. pretty cool.Secondly -The are ALL soft, chewy and pull apart easily.They are less sticky than any other salt water taffy I've had - so i'd like to think this makes eating it easier on my teeth.You know how when you eat some things - you just feel like it's trying to rip your fillings out? Sticky, rough ? This taffy isn't like that.(I'm sure that it could, it just doesn't seem as imminent.)The flavor inconsistency:Some flavors are really bold! Others are really bland. It's almost like multiple people are involved in making this and someone is stingy with the flavoring while someone is generous. I haven't found a happy medium in this regard. Obviously though, some flavors are more potent than others but that isn't the case here - at least in my opinion and I've made candy before.Flavors!I took pics of many of them & wrote in the flavors of the ones I did.Green:Lime.Really strong, fairly tart and, in my opinion, delicious. Tastes of that candy-flavor-lime, not the fresh fruit.Yellow (solid):Lemon.Much like the lime. Really potent flavor, fairly tart. Tastes like that fake/ candied lemon flavor - not fresh lemons. Really yummy- reminded me of lemonheads off the bat - the smell of it.Purple (solid):Grape.This one is pretty potent, fairly tart. I'm not a huge fan of grape-flavored things. Ate one for evaluation, gave the rest to Hubby who loves grape flavored things and he loves them. He also agrees with my findings of this taffy being way less sticky than others.Black (solid):Licorice.Not a fan of licorice. Hubby who is, loves the licorice flavored taffy that came in this box though!White (solid):Vanilla.This one  was a big of a disappointment but also delicious at the same time if that makes any sense. I loooove vanilla. If I could get a pound of this in all vanilla - and if I could afford it- I would. And I would eat it all day. That said, it's a very mild vanilla flavor. I could stand it a bit less bland if it were up to me :).Pink (solid):StrawberryI put the question mark because  - it's really, really bland. I think it's supposed to be strawberry but it almost just tastes more plain than anything. Yummy, regardless - like the vanilla.White (with red stripe)Peppermint.This one tastes like a chewy candy cane. It's pretty intense. Not like Dentene Ice intense but ... def not mild.White (with green stripe) :Spearmint.I'm a huge fan of spearmint! This one is mild but it works! I like when I can enjoy me some spearmint but not necessarily be left with minty breath.Yellow (with red stripe):Banana (I think).I fully expected this one to be strawberry-banana because of the red stripe but I tasted only 100% banana. Not overly potent like most banana things are so in this case, if you like banana, this company's being stingy with the flavor add-in works! (However if it's trying to be anything other than banana, maybe it doesn't?)Brown (darker, chocolate-colored):Chocolate!I usually hate chocolate flavored things but this is lovely. Seriously - it tastes like chocolate ice cream. I'm a fan. Flavor was well balanced. I only got ONE of this flavor in the box, so that kinda sucks but - delicious.Brown (lighter color):Coffee or mocha?Immediately upon opening this, I smelled coffee. I absolutely hate coffee and the smell nauseated me so I didn't put any of this color in my mouth.Of all the people around me for the past week or so - no one has been willing to try it. There is some debate as to weather it smells like just coffee or mocha... or something else like cappuccino - so it's something coffee-related, is all I can share about this one.  Sadly there were many of this flavor included in my mix! Figures.Coral (solid):Grapefruit?Initially it was unanimous that it smelled like nothing.As soon as I twisted -it wow! The smell was AMAZING. Reminded me of lemon-lime, initially. Taste is a bit tart, citrus-y - I think, (based on the color and the non-specific citrus flavor) that it's supposed to be grapefruit. It's pleasant. Wish I got more than just the one in this box!White (with red & green stripes):Freshmint?My first impression was "this tastes like toothpaste."  It's very minty - not wintergreen or spearmint or peppermint. Reminds me of that "freshmint" that some institutions do now. Not a fan.Tan (with brown stripe):Rootbeer!!!Pleasant! Reminds me of those rootbeer dumdumbs. Rootbeer flavored taffy- I'd probably not have thought of it but I'm glad someone did.Tan (with green stripe):Mint- chocolateNot a fan of this one at all - it's like a chewy Andes mint. Doesn't work for me. Flavor-wise, it's well flavored. Strong mint, strong flavor of chocolate as well, maybe a dark chocolate flavor.There ya have it. :)I hope this was helpful. Or you can always do the 'sample at your own risk' deal.Good candy  and probably a flavor for everyone in here.Overall - 4 stars.Some of the flavors could be more intense. Others could be less intense.*I received this box of taffy at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review.

I've fast become a huge fan of this bracelet!It first caught my eye because I love the colors - I've got the deep blue with tones of tan, etc that in the light, often look golden and remind me of a celestial scene.When I first put it on, it was icy cold! Cold burned my wrist. These beads are interesting - the way they quickly adapt to temperature.I pulled the bracelet off and place it against my skin for just a minute and then it almost felt hot ! This made it much more comfortable on my wrist and it's stayed comfortable - or my wrist is adjusted to it . :)It feels lightweight- doesn't flare up my arthritis or my tendinitis - which is awesome because I love looking down and seeing it.I'm thinking it might be pretty stacked with a couple of others, depending on the colors, etc. I've got a few ordered so I'll soon find out.Gifting:Now- as a gift- this would totally work. It's stunning in person. But if you're considering it as a gift, you'll need to ship it to yourself and wrap it up first. I'd pick up some tissue paper and a box or gift bag - it just came in a thick plastic zipper bag with a barcode sticker on it.Some items I'd recommend shipped directly to the recipient as is - (based on presentation) this isn't one. (in case you're wondering).Overall - really pretty bracelet. Love it. 5 stars.*I received this bracelet at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest review.
